sentence: As of the start of the 115th Congress, Arizona's representatives in the United States House of Representatives are Tom O'Halleran (D-1), Ann Kirkpatrick (D-2), Raul Grijalva (D-3), Paul Gosar (R-4), Andy Biggs (R-5), David Schweikert (R-6), Ruben Gallego (D-7), Debbie Lesko (R-8), and Greg Stanton (D-9).

name: arizona
sentence: Arizona gained a ninth seat in the House of Representatives due to redistricting based on Census 2010.

name: arizona
sentence: From statehood through the late 1940s, Arizona was primarily dominated by the Democratic Party.

name: arizona
sentence: During this time, the Democratic candidate for the presidency carried the state each election, the only exceptions being the elections of 1920, 1924 and 1928—all three were national Republican landslides.

name: arizona
sentence: In 1924, Congress had passed a law granting citizenship and suffrage to all Native Americans, some of whom had previously been excluded as members of tribes on reservations.

name: arizona
sentence: Legal interpretations of Arizona's constitution prohibited Native Americans living on reservations from voting, classifying them as being under "guardianship".

name: arizona
sentence: This interpretation was overturned as being incorrect and unconstitutional in 1948 by the Arizona Supreme Court, following a suit by World War II Indian veterans Frank Harrison and Harry Austin, both of the Fort McDowell Yavapai Nation.

name: arizona
sentence: The landmark case is Harrison and Austin v. Laveen.

name: arizona
sentence: After the men were refused the opportunity to register in Maricopa County, they filed suit against the registrar.

name: arizona
sentence: The National Congress of American Indians, the Department of Justice, the Department of the Interior, and the American Civil Liberties Union all filed amicus curiae (friends of the court) briefs in the case.

name: arizona
sentence: The State Supreme Court established the rights of Native Americans to vote in the state; at the time, they comprised about 11% of the population.

name: arizona
sentence: That year, a similar provision was overturned in New Mexico when challenged by another Indian veteran in court.

name: arizona
sentence: These were the only two states that had continued to prohibit Native Americans from voting.

name: arizona
sentence: From the election of Dwight D. Eisenhower in 1952 until 2020, the majority of state voters favored Republicans in presidential elections.

name: arizona
sentence: Arizona voted Republican in every presidential election from 1952 to 1992, with Richard Nixon and Ronald Reagan winning the state by particularly large margins.

name: arizona
sentence: During this forty-year span, it was the only state not to be carried by a Democrat at least once.

name: arizona
sentence: Democrat Lyndon Johnson, in 1964, lost the state by less than 5,000 votes to Arizona Senatortor and native Barry Goldwater.

name: arizona
sentence: (This was the most closely contested state in what was otherwise a landslide victory for Johnson that year.)

name: arizona
sentence: Democrat Bill Clinton ended this streak in 1996, when he won Arizona by a little over two percentage points (Clinton had previously come within less than two percent of winning Arizona's electoral votes in 1992).

name: arizona
sentence: From 2000 until 2016, the majority of the state continued to support Republican presidential candidates by solid margins.

name: arizona
sentence: In the 2020 United States presidential election, Joe Biden again broke the streak by becoming the first Democratic presidential candidate to win Arizona since 1996.

name: arizona
sentence: Since the late 20th century, the Republican Party has also dominated Arizona politics in general.

name: arizona
sentence: The fast-growing Phoenix and Tucson suburbs became increasingly friendly to Republicans from the 1950s onward.

name: arizona
sentence: During this time, many "Pinto Democrats", or conservative Democrats from rural areas, became increasingly willing to support Republicans at the state and national level.

name: arizona
sentence: While the state normally supports Republicans at the federal level, Democrats are often competitive in statewide elections.

name: arizona
sentence: Two of the last six governors have been Democrats.

name: arizona
sentence: On March 4, 2008, Senatortor John McCain effectively clinched the Republican nomination for 2008, becoming the first presidential nominee from the state since Barry Goldwater in 1964.

name: arizona
sentence: Arizona politics are dominated by a longstanding rivalry between its two largest counties, Maricopa and Pima—home to Phoenix and Tucson, respectively.

name: arizona
sentence: The two counties have almost 75 percent of the state's population and cast almost 80 percent of the state's vote.

name: arizona
sentence: They also elect a substantial majority of the state legislature.

name: arizona
sentence: Maricopa County is home to almost 60 percent of the state's population, and most of the state's elected officials live there.

name: arizona
sentence: Before Joe Biden won Maricopa County in 2020, it had voted Republican in every presidential election since 1948.

name: arizona
sentence: This includes the 1964 run of native son Barry Goldwater; he would not have carried his home state without his 20,000-vote margin in Maricopa County.

name: arizona
sentence: Similarly, while McCain won Arizona by eight percentage points in 2008, aided by his 130,000-vote margin in Maricopa County.

name: arizona
sentence: In contrast, Pima County, home to Tucson, and most of southern Arizona have historically voted more Democratic.

name: arizona
sentence: While Tucson's suburbs lean Republican, they hold to a somewhat more moderate brand of Republicanism than is common in the Phoenix area.

name: arizona
sentence: Arizona rejected a same-sex marriage ban in a referendum as part of the 2006 elections.

name: arizona
sentence: Arizona was the first state in the nation to do so.

name: arizona
sentence: Same-sex marriage was not recognized in Arizona, but this amendment would have denied any legal or financial benefits to unmarried homosexual or heterosexual couples.

name: arizona
sentence: In 2008, Arizona voters passed Proposition 102, an amendment to the state constitution to define marriage as a union of one man and one woman.

name: arizona
sentence: It passed by a more narrow majority than similar votes in a number of other states.

name: arizona
sentence: In 2010, Arizona passed SB 1070, called the toughest illegal immigration legislation in the nation.

name: arizona
sentence: A fierce debate erupted between supporters and detractors of the law.

name: arizona
sentence: The United States Supreme Court heard arguments March 18, 2013, regarding the validity of the Arizona law, which requires individuals to show documents proving US citizenship in order to register to vote in national elections.

name: arizona
sentence: The West Virginia teachers' strike in 2018 inspired teachers in other states, including Arizona, to take similar action.

name: arizona
sentence: In 2006, Arizona became the first state in the United States to reject a proposition, Prop 107, that would have banned same-sex marriage and civil unions.

name: arizona
sentence: However, in 2008, Arizona voters approved of Prop 102, a constitutional amendment that prohibited same-sex marriage but not other unions.

name: arizona
sentence: Prior to same-sex marriage being legal, the City of Bisbee became the first jurisdiction in Arizona to approve of civil unions.

name: arizona
sentence: The state's Attorney General at the time, Tom Horne, threatened to sue, but rescinded the threat once Bisbee amended the ordinance; Bisbee approved of civil unions in 2013.

name: arizona
sentence: The municipalities of Clarkdale, Cottonwood, Jerome, Sedona, and Tucson also passed civil unions.

name: arizona
sentence: A November 2011 Public Policy Polling survey found 44% of Arizona voters supported the legalization of same-sex marriage, while 45% opposed it and 12% were not sure.

name: arizona
sentence: A separate question on the same survey found 72% of respondents supported legal recognition of same-sex couples, with 40% supporting same-sex marriage, 32% supporting civil unions, 27% opposing all legal recognition and 1% not sure.

name: arizona
sentence: Arizona Proposition 102, known by its supporters as the Marriage Protection Amendment, appeared as a legislatively referred constitutional amendment on the November 4, 2008 ballot in Arizona, where it was approved: 56.2%–43%.

name: arizona
sentence: It amended the Arizona Constitution to define marriage as between one man and one woman.

name: arizona
sentence: On October 17, 2014, Arizona Attorney General Tom Horne announced his office would no longer object to same-sex marriage, in response to a US District Court Ruling on Arizona Proposition 102.

name: arizona
sentence: On that day, each county's Clerk of the Superior Court began to issue same-sex marriage licenses, and Arizona became the 31st state to legalize same-sex marriage.

name: arizona
sentence: Public schools in Arizona are separated into about 220 local school districts which operate independently, but are governed in most cases by elected county school superintendents; these are in turn overseen by the Arizona State Board of Education and the Arizona Department of Education.

name: arizona
sentence: A state Superintendent of Public Instruction (elected in partisan elections every even-numbered year when there is not a presidential election, for a four-year term).

name: arizona
sentence: In 2005, a School District Redistricting Commission was established with the goal of combining and consolidating many of these districts.

name: arizona
sentence: Arizona is served by three public universities: The University of Arizona, Arizona State University, and Northern Arizona University.

name: arizona
sentence: These schools are governed by the Arizona Board of Regents.

name: arizona
sentence: Private higher education in Arizona is dominated by a large number of for-profit and "chain" (multi-site) universities.

name: arizona
sentence: Embry–Riddle Aeronautical University, Prescott and Prescott College are Arizona's only non-profit four-year private colleges.

name: arizona
sentence: Arizona has a wide network of two-year vocational schools and community colleges.

name: arizona
sentence: These colleges were governed historically by a separate statewide board of directors but, in 2002, the state legislature transferred almost all oversight authority to individual community college districts.

name: arizona
sentence: The Maricopa County Community College District includes 11 community colleges throughout Maricopa County and is one of the largest in the nation.

name: arizona
sentence: Phoenix Art Museum, on the historic Central Avenue Corridor in Phoenix, is the Southwest's largest collection of visual art from across the world.

name: arizona
sentence: The museum displays international exhibitions alongside the museum's collection of more than 18,000 works of American, Asian, European, Latin American, Western American, modern and contemporary art, and fashion design.

name: arizona
sentence: With a community education mandate since 1951, Phoenix Art Museum holds a year-round program of festivals, live performances, independent art films and educational programs.

name: arizona
sentence: The museum also has PhxArtKids, an interactive space for children; photography exhibitions through the museum's partnership with the Center for Creative Photography; the landscaped Sculpture Garden and dining at Arcadia Farms.

name: arizona
sentence: Arizona is a recognized center of Native American art, with a number of galleries showcasing historical and contemporary works.

name: arizona
sentence: The Heard Museum, also in Phoenix, is a major repository of Native American art.

name: arizona
sentence: Some of the signature exhibits include a full Navajo hogan, the Mareen Allen Nichols Collection containing 260 pieces of contemporary jewelry, the Barry Goldwater Collection of 437 historic Hopi kachina dolls, and an exhibit on the 19th century boarding school experiences of Native Americans.

name: arizona
sentence: The Heard Museum has about 250,000 visitors a year.

name: arizona
sentence: Sedona, Jerome, and Tubac are known as a budding artist colonies, and small arts scenes exist in the larger cities and near the state universities.

name: arizona
sentence: Several major Hollywood films, such as Billy Jack, U Turn, Waiting to Exhale, Just One of the Guys, Can't Buy Me Love, Bill & Ted's Excellent Adventure, The Scorpion King, The Banger Sisters, Used Cars, and Raising Arizona have been made there (as have many Westerns).

name: arizona
sentence: The 1993 science fiction movie Fire in the Sky, based on a reported alien abduction in the town of Snowflake, was set in Snowflake.

name: arizona
sentence: It was filmed in the Oregon towns of Oakland, Roseburg, and Sutherlin.

name: arizona
sentence: The 1974 film Alice Doesn't Live Here Anymore, for which Ellen Burstyn won the Academy Award for Best Actress, and also starring Kris Kristofferson, was set in Tucson.

name: arizona
sentence: The climax of the 1977 Clint Eastwood film The Gauntlet takes place in downtown Phoenix.

name: arizona
sentence: The final segments of the 1984 film Starman take place at Meteor Crater outside Winslow.

name: arizona
sentence: The Jeff Foxworthy comedy documentary movie Blue Collar Comedy Tour was filmed almost entirely at the Dodge Theatre.

name: arizona
sentence: Some of Alfred Hitchcock's classic film Psycho was shot in Phoenix, the ostensible home town of the main character.

name: arizona
sentence: Some of the television shows filmed or set in Arizona include The New Dick Van Dyke Show, Medium, Alice, The First 48, Insomniac with Dave Attell, Cops, and America's Most Wanted.

name: arizona
sentence: The TV sitcom Alice, which was based on the movie was set in Phoenix.

name: arizona
sentence: Twilight had passages set in Phoenix at the beginning and the end of the film.

name: arizona
sentence: Arizona is prominently featured in the lyrics of many Country and Western songs, such as Jamie O'Neal's hit ballad "There Is No Arizona".

name: arizona
sentence: George Strait's "Oceanfront Property" uses "ocean front property in Arizona" as a metaphor for a sucker proposition.

name: arizona
sentence: The line "see you down in Arizona Bay" is used in a Tool song in reference to the possibility (expressed as a hope by comedian Bill Hicks) that Southern California will one day fall into the ocean.

name: arizona
sentence: Glen Campbell, a notable resident, popularized the song "By The Time I Get To Phoenix".

name: arizona
sentence: "Arizona" was the title of a popular song recorded by Mark Lindsay.

name: arizona
sentence: Arizona is mentioned by the hit song "Take It Easy", written by Jackson Browne and Glenn Frey and performed by the Eagles.

name: arizona
sentence: Arizona is also mentioned in the Beatles' song "Get Back", credited to John Lennon and Paul McCartney; McCartney sings: "JoJo left his home in Tucson, Arizona, for some California grass."

name: arizona
sentence: "Carefree Highway", released in 1974 by Gordon Lightfoot, takes its name from Arizona State Route 74 north of Phoenix.

name: arizona
sentence: Arizona's budding music scene is helped by emerging bands, as well as some well-known artists.

name: arizona
sentence: The Gin Blossoms, Chronic Future, Roger Clyne and the Peacemakers, Jimmy Eat World, Caroline's Spine, and others began their careers in Arizona.

name: arizona
sentence: Also, a number of punk and rock bands got their start in Arizona, including JFA, The Feederz, Sun City Girls, The Meat Puppets, The Maine, The Summer Set, and more recently Authority Zero and Digital Summer.

name: arizona
sentence: Arizona also has many singers and other musicians.

name: arizona
sentence: Singer, songwriter and guitarist Michelle Branch is from Sedona.

name: arizona
sentence: Chester Bennington, the former lead vocalist of Linkin Park, and mash-up artist DJ Z-Trip are both from Phoenix.

name: arizona
sentence: One of Arizona's better known musicians is shock rocker Alice Cooper, who helped define the genre.

name: arizona
sentence: Maynard James Keenan, the lead singer of the bands Tool, A Perfect Circle, and Puscifer, calls the town of Cornville home.

name: arizona
sentence: Other notable singers include country singers Dierks Bentley and Marty Robbins, folk singer Katie Lee, Fleetwood Mac's Stevie Nicks, CeCe Peniston, Rex Allen, 2007 American Idol winner Jordin Sparks, and Linda Ronstadt.

name: arizona
sentence: Arizona is also known for its heavy metal scene, which is centered in and around Phoenix.

name: arizona
sentence: In the early to mid-1990s, it included bands such as Job for a Cowboy, Knights of the Abyss, Greeley Estates, Eyes Set To Kill, blessthefall, The Word Alive, The Dead Rabbitts, and Abigail Williams.

name: arizona
sentence: The band Soulfly calls Phoenix home and Megadeth lived in Phoenix for about a decade.

name: arizona
sentence: Beginning in and around 2009, Phoenix began to host a burgeoningdesert rock and sludge metal underground, (ala' Kyuss in 1990s California) led by bands like Wolves of Winter, Asimov, and Dead Canyon.

name: arizona
sentence: American composer Elliott Carter composed his first String Quartet (1950–51) while on sabbatical (from New York) in Arizona.

name: arizona
sentence: The quartet won a Pulitzer Prize and other awards and is now a staple of the string quartet repertoire.

name: arizona
sentence: State Farm Stadium hosted Super Bowl XLII on February 3, 2008, and Super Bowl XLIX on February 1, 2015.

name: arizona
sentence: The stadium is also scheduled to host Super Bowl LVII tentatively scheduled for February 5, 2023.

name: arizona
sentence: Due to its numerous golf courses, Arizona is home to several stops on the PGA Tour, most notably the Phoenix Open, held at the TPC of Scottsdale, and the WGC-Accenture Match Play Championship at the Ritz-Carlton Golf Club in Marana.

name: arizona
sentence: Auto racing is another sport known in the state.

name: arizona
sentence: Phoenix Raceway in Avondale is home to NASCAR race weekends twice a year.

name: arizona
sentence: Firebird International Raceway near Chandler is home to drag racing and other motorsport events.

name: arizona
sentence: College sports are also prevalent in Arizona.

name: arizona
sentence: The Arizona State Sun Devils and the Arizona Wildcats belong to the Pac-12 Conference while the Northern Arizona Lumberjacks compete in the Big Sky Conference and the Grand Canyon Antelopes compete in the Western Athletic Conference.

name: arizona
sentence: The rivalry between Arizona State Sun Devils and the Arizona Wildcats predates Arizona's statehood, and is the oldest rivalry in the NCAA.

name: arizona
sentence: The Territorial Cup, first awarded in 1889 and certified as the oldest trophy in college football, is awarded to the winner of the annual football game between the two schools.

name: arizona
sentence: Arizona also hosts several college football bowl games.

name: arizona
sentence: The Fiesta Bowl, originally held at Sun Devil Stadium, is now held at State Farm Stadium in Glendale.

name: arizona
sentence: The Fiesta Bowl is part of the new College Football Playoff (CFP).

name: arizona
sentence: University of Phoenix Stadium was also home to the 2007 and 2011 BCS National Championship Games.

name: arizona
sentence: State Farm Stadium hosted the Final Four of the NCAA Division I Men's Basketball Tournament in 2017 and is scheduled to host it again in 2024.

name: arizona
sentence: Arizona is a popular location for Major League Baseball spring training, as it is the site of the Cactus League.

name: arizona
sentence: Spring training was first started in Arizona in 1947, when Brewers owner Veeck sold them in 1945 but went onto purchase the Cleveland Indians in 1946.

name: arizona
sentence: He decided to train the Cleveland Indians in Tucson and convinced the New York Giants to give Phoenix a try.

name: arizona
sentence: Thus the Cactus League was born.

name: arizona
sentence: On March 9, 1995, Arizona was awarded a franchise to begin to play for the 1998 season.

name: arizona
sentence: A $130 million franchise fee was paid to Major League Baseball and on January 16, 1997, the Diamondbacks were officially voted into the National League.

name: arizona
sentence: Since their debut, the Diamondbacks have won five National League West titles, one National League Championship pennant, and the 2001 World Series.

name: arkansas
sentence: Arkansas () is a state in the south central United States, home to more than three million people as of 2018.

name: arkansas
sentence: Its name is from the Osage language, of Siouan derivation; it denoted their related kin, the Quapaw people.

name: arkansas
sentence: The state's diverse geography ranges from the mountainous regions of the Ozark and Ouachita Mountains, which make up the US

name: arkansas
sentence: Interior Highlands, to the densely forested land in the south known as the Arkansas Timberlands, to the eastern lowlands along the Mississippi River and the Arkansas Delta.

name: arkansas
sentence: Arkansas is the 29th largest by area and the 33rd most populous US state.

name: arkansas
sentence: The capital and most populous city is Little Rock, in the central part of the state, a hub for transportation, business, culture, and government.

name: arkansas
sentence: The northwestern corner of the state, including the Fayetteville–Springdale–Rogers Metropolitan Area and Fort Smith metropolitan area, is a population, education, and economic center.

name: arkansas
sentence: The largest city in the state's eastern part is Jonesboro.

name: arkansas
sentence: The largest city in the state's southeastern part is Pine Bluff.

name: arkansas
sentence: The Territory of Arkansas was admitted to the Union as the 25th state on June 15, 1836.

name: arkansas
sentence: Much of the Delta had been developed for cotton plantations, and landowners there largely depended on enslaved African Americans' labor.

name: arkansas
sentence: In 1861, Arkansas seceded from the United States and joined the Confederate States of America during the Civil War.

name: arkansas
sentence: On returning to the Union in 1868, Arkansas continued to suffer due to its reliance on the large-scale plantation economy.

name: arkansas
sentence: Cotton remained the leading commodity crop, although the cotton market declined.

name: arkansas
sentence: Because farmers and businessmen did not diversify and there was little industrial investment, the state fell behind in economic opportunity.

name: arkansas
sentence: White rural interests dominated the Arkansas's politics by disenfranchisement of African Americans and refusal to reapportion the legislature.

name: arkansas
sentence: Only after the civil rights movement and federal intervention were more African Americans able to vote.

name: arkansas
sentence: The Supreme Court overturned rural domination in the South and other states that had refused to reapportion their state legislatures, or retained rules based on geographic districts.

name: arkansas
sentence: In the landmark ruling of one man, one vote, it held that states had to organize their legislatures by districts that held approximately equal populations, and that these had to be redefined as necessary after each decade's census.

name: arkansas
sentence: After World War II, Arkansas began to diversify its economy.

name: arkansas
sentence: In the 21st century, its economy is based on service industries, aircraft, poultry, steel, and tourism, along with important commodity crops of cotton, soybeans and rice.

name: arkansas
sentence: Arkansas's culture is observable in museums, theaters, novels, television shows, restaurants, and athletic venues across the state.

name: arkansas
sentence: Notable people from the state include politician and educational advocate William Fulbright; former president Bill Clinton, who also served as the 40th and 42nd governor of Arkansas; general Wesley Clark, former NATO Supreme Allied Commander; Walmart founder and magnate Sam Walton; singer-songwriters Johnny Cash, Charlie Rich, Jimmy Driftwood, and Glen Campbell; actor-filmmaker Billy Bob Thornton; poet C. D. Wright; and physicist William L. McMillan, a pioneer in superconductor research.

name: arkansas
sentence: The name Arkansas initially applied to the Arkansas River.

name: arkansas
sentence: It derives from a French term, Arcansas, their plural term for their transliteration of akansa, an Algonquian term for the Quapaw people.

name: arkansas
sentence: These were a Dhegiha Siouan-speaking people who settled in Arkansas around the 13th century.

name: arkansas
sentence: Akansa is likely also the root term for Kansas.

name: arkansas
sentence: The name has been pronounced and spelled in a variety of ways.

name: arkansas
sentence: In 1881, the state legislature defined the official pronunciation of Arkansas as having the final "s" be silent (as it would be in French).

name: arkansas
sentence: A dispute had arisen between the state's two senators over the pronunciation issue.

name: arkansas
sentence: One favored (AR-kən-saw), the other (ar-KAN-zəs).

name: arkansas
sentence: In 2007, the state legislature passed a non-binding resolution declaring that the possessive form of the state's name is Arkansas's, which the state government has increasingly followed.

name: arkansas
sentence: Arkansas borders Louisiana to the south, Texas to the southwest, Oklahoma to the west, Missouri to the north, and Tennessee and Mississippi to the east.

name: arkansas
sentence: The United States Census Bureau classifies Arkansas as a southern state, sub-categorized among the West South Central States.

name: arkansas
sentence: The Mississippi River forms most of its eastern border, except in Clay and Greene counties, where the St. Francis River forms the western boundary of the Missouri Bootheel, and in many places where the channel of the Mississippi has meandered (or been straightened by man) from its original 1836 course.

name: arkansas
sentence: Arkansas can generally be split into two halves, the highlands in the northwest and the lowlands of the southeast.

name: arkansas
sentence: The highlands are part of the Southern Interior Highlands, including The Ozarks and the Ouachita Mountains.

name: arkansas
sentence: The southern lowlands include the Gulf Coastal Plain and the Arkansas Delta.

name: arkansas
sentence: This split can yield to a regional division into northwest, southwest, northeast, southeast, and central Arkansas.

name: arkansas
sentence: These regions are broad and not defined along county lines.

name: arkansas
sentence: Arkansas has seven distinct natural regions: the Ozark Mountains, Ouachita Mountains, Arkansas River Valley, Gulf Coastal Plain, Crowley's Ridge, and the Arkansas Delta, with Central Arkansas sometimes included as a blend of multiple regions.

name: arkansas
sentence: The southeastern part of Arkansas along the Mississippi Alluvial Plain is sometimes called the Arkansas Delta.

name: arkansas
sentence: This region is a flat landscape of rich alluvial soils formed by repeated flooding of the adjacent Mississippi.

name: arkansas
sentence: Farther from the river, in the southeastern part of the state, the Grand Prairie has a more undulating landscape.

name: arkansas
sentence: Both are fertile agricultural areas.

name: arkansas
sentence: The Delta region is bisected by a geological formation known as Crowley's Ridge.

name: arkansas
sentence: A narrow band of rolling hills, Crowley's Ridge rises 250 to 500 feet (76 to 152 m) above the surrounding alluvial plain and underlies many of eastern Arkansas's major towns.

name: arkansas
sentence: Northwest Arkansas is part of the Ozark Plateau including the Ozark Mountains, to the south are the Ouachita Mountains, and these regions are divided by the Arkansas River; the southern and eastern parts of Arkansas are called the Lowlands.

name: arkansas
sentence: These mountain ranges are part of the US

name: arkansas
sentence: Interior Highlands region, the only major mountainous region between the Rocky Mountains and the Appalachian Mountains.

name: arkansas
sentence: The state's highest point is Mount Magazine in the Ouachita Mountains, which is 2,753 feet (839 m) above sea level.

name: arkansas
sentence: Arkansas is home to many caves, such as Blanchard Springs Caverns.

name: arkansas
sentence: The State Archeologist has catalogued more than 43,000 Native American living, hunting and tool-making sites, many of them Pre-Columbian burial mounds and rock shelters.

name: arkansas
sentence: Crater of Diamonds State Park near Murfreesboro is the world's only diamond-bearing site accessible to the public for digging.

name: arkansas
sentence: Arkansas is home to a dozen Wilderness Areas totaling 158,444 acres (641.20 km2).

name: arkansas
sentence: These areas are set aside for outdoor recreation and are open to hunting, fishing, hiking, and primitive camping.

name: arkansas
sentence: No mechanized vehicles nor developed campgrounds are allowed in these areas.

name: arkansas
sentence: Arkansas has many rivers, lakes, and reservoirs within or along its borders.

name: arkansas
sentence: Major tributaries to the Mississippi River include the Arkansas River, the White River, and the St. Francis River.

name: arkansas
sentence: The Arkansas is fed by the Mulberry and Fourche LaFave Rivers in the Arkansas River Valley, which is also home to Lake Dardanelle.

name: arkansas
sentence: The Buffalo, Little Red, Black and Cache Rivers are all tributaries to the White River, which also empties into the Mississippi.

name: arkansas
sentence: Bayou Bartholomew and the Saline, Little Missouri, and Caddo Rivers are all tributaries to the Ouachita River in south Arkansas, which empties into the Mississippi in Louisiana.

name: arkansas
sentence: The Red River briefly forms the state's boundary with Texas.

name: arkansas
sentence: Arkansas has few natural lakes and many reservoirs, such as Bull Shoals Lake, Lake Ouachita, Greers Ferry Lake, Millwood Lake, Beaver Lake, Norfork Lake, DeGray Lake, and Lake Conway.

name: arkansas
sentence: Arkansas's temperate deciduous forest is divided into three broad ecoregions; the Ozark, Ouachita-Appalachian Forests, the Mississippi Alluvial and Southeast USA Coastal Plains, and the Southeastern USA Plains.

name: arkansas
sentence: The state is further divided into seven subregions: the Arkansas Valley, Boston Mountains, Mississippi Alluvial Plain, Mississippi Valley Loess Plain, Ozark Highlands, Ouachita Mountains, and the South Central Plains.

name: arkansas
sentence: A 2010 United States Forest Service survey determined 18,720,000 acres (7,580,000 ha) of Arkansas's land is forestland, or 56% of the state's total area.

name: arkansas
sentence: Dominant species in Arkansas's forests include Quercus (oak), Carya (hickory), Pinus echinata (shortleaf pine) and Pinus taeda (loblolly pine).

name: arkansas
sentence: Arkansas's plant life varies with its climate and elevation.

name: arkansas
sentence: The pine belt stretching from the Arkansas delta to Texas consists of dense oak-hickory-pine growth.

name: arkansas
sentence: Lumbering and paper milling activity is active throughout the region.

name: arkansas
sentence: In eastern Arkansas, one can find Taxodium (cypress), Quercus nigra (water oaks), and hickories with their roots submerged in the Mississippi Valley bayous indicative of the deep south.

name: arkansas
sentence: Nearby Crowley's Ridge is the only home of the tulip tree in the state, and generally hosts more northeastern plant life such as the beech tree.

name: arkansas
sentence: The northwestern highlands are covered in an oak-hickory mixture, with Ozark white cedars, cornus (dogwoods), and Cercis canadensis (redbuds) also present.

name: arkansas
sentence: The higher peaks in the Arkansas River Valley play host to scores of ferns, including the Woodsia scopulina and Adiantum (maidenhair fern) on Mount Magazine.

name: arkansas
sentence: Arkansas generally has a humid subtropical climate.

name: arkansas
sentence: While not bordering the Gulf of Mexico, Arkansas, is still close enough to this warm, large body of water for it to influence the weather in the state.

name: arkansas
sentence: Generally, Arkansas, has hot, humid summers and slightly drier, mild to cool winters.

name: arkansas
sentence: In Little Rock, the daily high temperatures average around 93 °F (34 °C) with lows around 73 °F (23 °C) in July.

name: arkansas
sentence: In January highs average around 51 °F (11 °C) and lows around 32 °F (0 °C).

name: arkansas
sentence: In Siloam Springs in the northwest part of the state, the average high and low temperatures in July are 89 and 67 °F (32 and 19 °C) and in January the average high and low are 44 and 23 °F (7 and −5 °C).

name: arkansas
sentence: Annual precipitation throughout the state averages between about 40 and 60 inches (1,000 and 1,500 mm); somewhat wetter in the south and drier in the northern part of the state.

name: arkansas
sentence: Snowfall is infrequent but most common in the northern half of the state.

name: arkansas
sentence: The half of the state south of Little Rock is more apt to see ice storms.

name: arkansas
sentence: Arkansas's all-time record high is 120 °F (49 °C) at Ozark on August 10, 1936; the all-time record low is −29 °F (−34 °C) at Gravette, on February 13, 1905.

name: arkansas
sentence: Arkansas is known for extreme weather and frequent storms.

name: arkansas
sentence: A typical year brings thunderstorms, tornadoes, hail, snow and ice storms.

name: arkansas
sentence: Between both the Great Plains and the Gulf States, Arkansas, receives around 60 days of thunderstorms.

name: arkansas
sentence: Arkansas is located in Tornado Alley, and as a result, a few of the most destructive tornadoes in US history have struck the state.

name: arkansas
sentence: While sufficiently far from the coast to avoid a direct hit from a hurricane, Arkansas can often get the remnants of a tropical system, which dumps tremendous amounts of rain in a short time and often spawns smaller tornadoes.

name: arkansas
sentence: Before European settlement of North America, Arkansas, was inhabited by indigenous peoples for thousands of years.

name: arkansas
sentence: The Caddo, Osage, and Quapaw peoples encountered European explorers.

name: arkansas
sentence: The first of these Europeans was Spanish explorer Hernando de Soto in 1541, who crossed the Mississippi and marched across central Arkansas and the Ozark Mountains.

name: arkansas
sentence: After finding nothing he considered of value and encountering native resistance the entire way, he and his men returned to the Mississippi River where de Soto fell ill. From his deathbed he ordered his men to massacre all the men of the nearby village of Anilco, who he feared had been plotting with a powerful polity down the Mississippi River, Quigualtam.

name: arkansas
sentence: His men obeyed and did not stop with the men, but were said to have massacred women and children as well.

name: arkansas
sentence: He died the following day in what is believed to be the vicinity of modern-day McArthur, Arkansas, in May 1542.

name: arkansas
sentence: His body was weighted down with sand and he was consigned to a watery grave in the Mississippi River under cover of darkness by his men.

name: arkansas
sentence: De Soto had attempted to deceive the native population into thinking he was an immortal deity, sun of the sun, in order to forestall attack by outraged Native Americans on his by then weakened and bedraggled army.

name: arkansas
sentence: In order to keep the ruse up, his men informed the locals that de Soto had ascended into the sky.

name: arkansas
sentence: His will at the time of his death listed "four Indian slaves, three horses and 700 hogs" which were auctioned off.

name: arkansas
sentence: The starving men, who had been living off maize stolen from natives, immediately started butchering the hogs and later, commanded by former aide-de-camp Moscoso, attempted an overland return to Mexico.

name: arkansas
sentence: They made it as far as Texas before running into territory too dry for maize farming and too thinly populated to sustain themselves by stealing food from the locals.

name: arkansas
sentence: The expedition promptly backtracked to Arkansas.

name: arkansas
sentence: After building a small fleet of boats they then headed down the Mississippi River and eventually on to Mexico by water.

name: arkansas
sentence: Later explorers included the French Jacques Marquette and Louis Jolliet in 1673, and Frenchmen Robert La Salle and Henri de Tonti in 1681.

name: arkansas
sentence: Tonti established Arkansas Post at a Quapaw village in 1686, making it the first European settlement in the territory.

name: arkansas
sentence: The early Spanish or French explorers of the state gave it its name, which is probably a phonetic spelling of the Illinois tribe's name for the Quapaw people, who lived downriver from them.

name: arkansas
sentence: The name Arkansas has been pronounced and spelled in a variety of fashions.

name: arkansas
sentence: The region was organized as the Territory of Arkansaw on July 4, 1819, with the territory admitted to the United States as the state of Arkansas on June 15, 1836.

name: arkansas
sentence: The name was historically , , and several other variants.

name: arkansas
sentence: Historically and modernly, the people of Arkansas call themselves either "Arkansans" or "Arkansawyers".

name: arkansas
sentence: In 1881, the Arkansas General Assembly passed Arkansas Code 1-4-105 (official text):

name: arkansas
sentence: Citizens of the state of Kansas often pronounce the Arkansas River as , in a manner similar to the common pronunciation of the name of their state.

name: arkansas
sentence: Settlers, such as fur trappers, moved to Arkansas in the early 18th century.

name: arkansas
sentence: These people used Arkansas Post as a home base and entrepôt.

name: arkansas
sentence: During the colonial period, Arkansas changed hands between France and Spain following the Seven Years' War, although neither showed interest in the remote settlement of Arkansas Post.

name: arkansas
sentence: In April 1783, Arkansas saw its only battle of the American Revolutionary War, a brief siege of the post by British Captain James Colbert with the assistance of the Choctaw and Chickasaw.

name: arkansas
sentence: Napoleon Bonaparte sold French Louisiana to the United States in 1803, including all of Arkansas, in a transaction known today as the Louisiana Purchase.

name: arkansas
sentence: French soldiers remained as a garrison at Arkansas Post.

name: arkansas
sentence: Following the purchase, the balanced give-and-take relationship between settlers and Native Americans began to change all along the frontier, including in Arkansas.

name: arkansas
sentence: Following a controversy over allowing slavery in the territory, the Territory of Arkansas was organized on July 4, 1819.

name: arkansas
sentence: Gradual emancipation in Arkansas was struck down by one vote, the Speaker of the House Henry Clay, allowing Arkansas to organize as a slave territory.

name: arkansas
sentence: Slavery became a wedge issue in Arkansas, forming a geographic divide that remained for decades.

name: arkansas
sentence: Owners and operators of the cotton plantation economy in southeast Arkansas firmly supported slavery, as they perceived slave labor as the best or "only" economically viable method of harvesting their commodity crops.

name: arkansas
sentence: The "hill country" of northwest Arkansas was unable to grow cotton and relied on a cash-scarce, subsistence farming economy.

name: arkansas
sentence: As European Americans settled throughout the East Coast and into the Midwest, in the 1830s the United States government forced the removal of many Native American tribes to Arkansas and Indian Territory west of the Mississippi River.

name: arkansas
sentence: Additional Native American removals began in earnest during the territorial period, with final Quapaw removal complete by 1833 as they were pushed into Indian Territory.

name: arkansas
sentence: The capital was relocated from Arkansas Post to Little Rock in 1821, during the territorial period.

name: arkansas
sentence: When Arkansas applied for statehood, the slavery issue was again raised in Washington, D.C.. Congress eventually approved the Arkansas Constitution after a 25-hour session, admitting Arkansas on June 15, 1836, as the 25th state and the 13th slave state, having a population of about 60,000.

name: arkansas
sentence: Arkansas struggled with taxation to support its new state government, a problem made worse by a state banking scandal and worse yet by the Panic of 1837.

name: arkansas
sentence: In early antebellum Arkansas, the southeast Arkansas slave-based economy developed rapidly.

name: arkansas
sentence: On the eve of the Civil War in 1860, enslaved African Americans numbered 111,115 people, just over 25% of the state's population.

name: arkansas
sentence: Plantation agriculture set the state and region behind the nation for decades.

name: arkansas
sentence: The wealth developed among planters of southeast Arkansas caused a political rift to form between the northwest and southeast.

name: arkansas
sentence: Many politicians were elected to office from the Family, the Southern rights political force in antebellum Arkansas.

name: arkansas
sentence: Residents generally wanted to avoid a civil war.

name: arkansas
sentence: When the Gulf states seceded in early 1861, Arkansas voted to remain in the Union.

name: arkansas
sentence: Arkansas did not secede until Abraham Lincoln demanded Arkansas troops be sent to Fort Sumter to quell the rebellion there.

name: arkansas
sentence: On May 6, a state convention voted to terminate Arkansas's membership in the Union and join the Confederate States of America.

name: arkansas
sentence: Arkansas held a very important position for the Rebels, maintaining control of the Mississippi River and surrounding Southern states.

name: arkansas
sentence: The bloody Battle of Wilson's Creek just across the border in Missouri shocked many Arkansans who thought the war would be a quick and decisive Southern victory.

name: arkansas
sentence: Battles early in the war took place in northwest Arkansas, including the Battle of Cane Hill, Battle of Pea Ridge, and Battle of Prairie Grove.

name: arkansas
sentence: Union general Samuel Curtis swept across the state to Helena in the Delta in 1862.

name: arkansas
sentence: Little Rock was captured the following year.

name: arkansas
sentence: The government shifted the state Confederate capital to Hot Springs, and then again to Washington from 1863 to 1865, for the remainder of the war.

name: arkansas
sentence: Throughout the state, guerrilla warfare ravaged the countryside and destroyed cities.

name: arkansas
sentence: Passion for the Confederate cause waned after implementation of programs such as the draft, high taxes, and martial law.

name: arkansas
sentence: Under the Military Reconstruction Act, Congress declared Arkansas restored to the Union in June 1868, after the Legislature accepted the 14th Amendment.

name: arkansas
sentence: The Republican-controlled reconstruction legislature established universal male suffrage (though temporarily disfranchising former Confederate Army officers, who were all Democrats), a public education system for blacks and whites, and passed general issues to improve the state and help more of the population.

name: arkansas
sentence: The State soon came under control of the Radical Republicans and Unionists, and led by Governor Powell Clayton, they presided over a time of great upheaval as Confederate sympathizers and the Ku Klux Klan fought the new developments, particularly voting rights for African Americans.

name: arkansas
sentence: In 1874, the Brooks-Baxter War, a political struggle between factions of the Republican Party shook Little Rock and the state governorship.

name: arkansas
sentence: It was settled only when President Ulysses S. Grant ordered Joseph Brooks to disperse his militant supporters.

name: arkansas
sentence: Following the Brooks-Baxter War, a new state constitution was ratified, re-enfranchising former Confederates.

name: arkansas
sentence: In 1881, the Arkansas state legislature enacted a bill that adopted an official pronunciation of the state's name, to combat a controversy then simmering.

name: arkansas
sentence: (See Law and Government below.)

name: arkansas
sentence: After Reconstruction, the state began to receive more immigrants and migrants.

name: arkansas
sentence: Chinese, Italian, and Syrian men were recruited for farm labor in the developing Delta region.

name: arkansas
sentence: None of these nationalities stayed long at farm labor

name: arkansas
sentence: Many Chinese became such successful merchants in small towns that they were able to educate their children at college.

name: arkansas
sentence: Some early 20th-century immigration included people from eastern Europe.

name: arkansas
sentence: Together, these immigrants made the Delta more diverse than the rest of the state.

name: arkansas
sentence: In the same years, some black migrants moved into the area because of opportunities to develop the bottomlands and own their own property.

name: arkansas
sentence: Construction of railroads enabled more farmers to get their products to market.

name: arkansas
sentence: It also brought new development into different parts of the state, including the Ozarks, where some areas were developed as resorts.

name: arkansas
sentence: In a few years at the end of the 19th century, for instance, Eureka Springs in Carroll County grew to 10,000 people, rapidly becoming a tourist destination and the fourth-largest city of the state.

name: arkansas
sentence: It featured newly constructed, elegant resort hotels and spas planned around its natural springs, considered to have healthful properties.

name: arkansas
sentence: The town's attractions included horse racing and other entertainment.

name: arkansas
sentence: It appealed to a wide variety of classes, becoming almost as popular as Hot Springs.

name: arkansas
sentence: In the late 1880s, the worsening agricultural depression catalyzed Populist and third party movements, leading to interracial coalitions.

name: arkansas
sentence: Struggling to stay in power, in the 1890s the Democrats in Arkansas followed other Southern states in passing legislation and constitutional amendments that disfranchised blacks and poor whites.

name: arkansas
sentence: In 1891 state legislators passed a requirement for a literacy test, knowing it would exclude many blacks and whites.

name: arkansas
sentence: At the time, more than 25% of the population could neither read nor write.

name: arkansas
sentence: In 1892, they amended the state constitution to require a poll tax and more complex residency requirements, both of which adversely affected poor people and sharecroppers, forcing most blacks and many poor whites from voter rolls.

name: arkansas
sentence: By 1900 the Democratic Party expanded use of the white primary in county and state elections, further denying blacks a part in the political process.

name: arkansas
sentence: Only in the primary was there any competition among candidates, as Democrats held all the power.

name: arkansas
sentence: The state was a Democratic one-party state for decades, until after passage of the federal Civil Rights Act of 1964 and Voting Rights Act of 1965 to enforce constitutional rights.

name: arkansas
sentence: Between 1905 and 1911, Arkansas began to receive a small immigration of German, Slovak, and Scots-Irish from Europe.

name: arkansas
sentence: The German and Slovak peoples settled in the eastern part of the state known as the Prairie, and the Irish founded small communities in the southeast part of the state.

name: arkansas
sentence: The Germans were mostly Lutheran and the Slovaks were primarily Catholic.

name: arkansas
sentence: The Irish were mostly Protestant from Ulster, of Scots and Northern Borders descent.

name: arkansas
sentence: Black sharecroppers began to try to organize a farmers' union after World War I.

name: arkansas
sentence: They were seeking better conditions of payment and accounting from white landowners of the area cotton plantations.

name: arkansas
sentence: Whites resisted any change and often tried to break up their meetings.

name: arkansas
sentence: On September 30, 1919, two white men, including a local deputy, tried to break up a meeting of black sharecroppers who were trying to organize a farmers' union.

name: arkansas
sentence: After a white deputy was killed in a confrontation with guards at the meeting, word spread to town and around the area.

name: arkansas
sentence: Hundreds of whites from Phillips and neighboring areas rushed to suppress the blacks, and started attacking blacks at large.

name: arkansas
sentence: Governor Charles Hillman Brough requested federal troops to stop what was called the Elaine massacre.

name: arkansas
sentence: White mobs spread throughout the county, killing an estimated 237 blacks before most of the violence was suppressed after October 1.

name: arkansas
sentence: Five whites also died in the incident.

name: arkansas
sentence: The governor accompanied the troops to the scene

name: arkansas
sentence: Based on the order of President Franklin D. Roosevelt given shortly after Imperial Japan's attack on Pearl Harbor, nearly 16,000 Japanese Americans were forcibly removed from the West Coast of the United States and incarcerated in two internment camps in the Arkansas Delta.

name: arkansas
sentence: The Rohwer Camp in Desha County operated from September 1942 to November 1945 and at its peak interned 8,475 prisoners.

name: arkansas
sentence: The Jerome War Relocation Center in Drew County operated from October 1942 to June 1944 and held about 8,000.

name: arkansas
sentence: After the Supreme Court ruled segregation in public schools unconstitutional in Brown v. Board of Education of Topeka, Kansas (1954), some students worked to integrate schools in the state.

name: arkansas
sentence: The Little Rock Nine brought Arkansas to national attention in 1957 when the federal government had to intervene to protect African-American students trying to integrate a high school in the capital.

name: arkansas
sentence: Governor Orval Faubus had ordered the Arkansas National Guard to help segregationists prevent nine African-American students from enrolling at Little Rock's Central High School.

name: arkansas
sentence: After attempting three times to contact Faubus, President Dwight D. Eisenhower sent 1,000 troops from the active-duty 101st Airborne Division to escort and protect the African-American students as they entered school on September 25, 1957.

name: arkansas
sentence: In defiance of federal court orders to integrate, the governor and city of Little Rock decided to close the high schools for the remainder of the school year.

name: arkansas
sentence: By the fall of 1959, the Little Rock high schools were completely integrated.

name: arkansas
sentence: Bill Clinton, the 42nd president of the United States, was born in Hope.

name: arkansas
sentence: Before his presidency, Clinton served as the 40th and 42nd governor of Arkansas, a total of nearly 12 years.

name: arkansas
sentence: Little Rock has been Arkansas's capital city since 1821 when it replaced Arkansas Post as the capital of the Territory of Arkansas.

name: arkansas
sentence: The state capitol was moved to Hot Springs and later Washington during the Civil War when the Union armies threatened the city in 1862, and state government did not return to Little Rock until after the war ended.

name: arkansas
sentence: Today, the Little Rock–North Little Rock–Conway metropolitan area is the largest in the state, with a population of 724,385 in 2013.

name: arkansas
sentence: The Fayetteville–Springdale–Rogers Metropolitan Area is the second-largest metropolitan area in Arkansas, growing at the fastest rate due to the influx of businesses and the growth of the University of Arkansas and Walmart.

name: arkansas
sentence: The state has eight cities with populations above 50,000 (based on 2010 census).

name: arkansas
sentence: In descending order of size, they are Little Rock, Fort Smith, Fayetteville, Springdale, Jonesboro, North Little Rock, Conway, and Rogers.

name: arkansas
sentence: Of these, only Fort Smith and Jonesboro are outside the two largest metropolitan areas.

name: arkansas
sentence: Other cities in Arkansas include Pine Bluff, Crossett, Bryant, Lake Village, Hot Springs, Bentonville, Texarkana, Sherwood, Jacksonville, Russellville, Bella Vista, West Memphis, Paragould, Cabot, Searcy, Van Buren, El Dorado, Blytheville, Harrison, Dumas, Rison, Warren, and Mountain Home.

name: arkansas
sentence: The United States Census Bureau estimates that the population of Arkansas was 3,017,804 on July 1, 2019, a 3.49% increase since the 2010 United States Census.

name: arkansas
sentence: As of 2019, Arkansas has an estimated population of 3,017,804.

name: arkansas
sentence: From fewer than 15,000 in 1820, Arkansas's population grew to 52,240 during a special census in 1835, far exceeding the 40,000 required to apply for statehood.

name: arkansas
sentence: Following statehood in 1836, the population doubled each decade until the 1870 Census conducted following the Civil War.

name: arkansas
sentence: The state recorded growth in each successive decade, although it gradually slowed in the 20th century.

name: arkansas
sentence: It recorded population losses in the 1950 and 1960 Censuses.

name: arkansas
sentence: This outmigration was a result of multiple factors, including farm mechanization, decreasing labor demand, and young educated people leaving the state due to a lack of non-farming industry in the state.

name: arkansas
sentence: Arkansas again began to grow, recording positive growth rates ever since and exceeding two million by the 1980 Census.

name: arkansas
sentence: Arkansas's rate of change, age distributions, and gender distributions mirror national averages.

name: arkansas
sentence: Minority group data also approximates national averages.

name: arkansas
sentence: There are fewer people in Arkansas of Hispanic or Latino origin than the national average.

name: arkansas
sentence: The center of population of Arkansas for 2000 was located in Perry County, near Nogal.

name: arkansas
sentence: In terms of race and ethnicity, the state was 80.1% white (74.2% non-Hispanic white), 15.6% black or African American, 0.9% American Indian and Alaska Native, 1.3% Asian, and 1.8% from two or more races.

name: arkansas
sentence: Hispanics or Latinos of any race made up 6.6% of the population.

name: arkansas
sentence: As of 2011, 39.0% of Arkansas's population younger than age 1 were minorities.

name: arkansas
sentence: European Americans have a strong presence in the northwestern Ozarks and the central part of the state.

name: arkansas
sentence: African Americans live mainly in the southern and eastern parts of the state.

name: arkansas
sentence: Arkansans of Irish, English and German ancestry are mostly found in the far northwestern Ozarks near the Missouri border.

name: arkansas
sentence: Ancestors of the Irish in the Ozarks were chiefly Scots-Irish, Protestants from Northern Ireland, the Scottish lowlands and northern England part of the largest group of immigrants from Great Britain and Ireland before the American Revolution.

name: arkansas
sentence: English and Scots-Irish immigrants settled throughout the backcountry of the South and in the more mountainous areas.

name: arkansas
sentence: Americans of English stock are found throughout the state.

name: arkansas
sentence: A 2010 survey of the principal ancestries of Arkansas's residents revealed the following:

name: arkansas
sentence: Most of the people identifying as American are of English descent and/or Scots-Irish descent.

name: arkansas
sentence: Their families have been in the state so long, in many cases since before statehood, that they choose to identify simply as having American ancestry or do not in fact know their own ancestry.

name: arkansas
sentence: Their ancestry primarily goes back to the original 13 colonies and for this reason many of them today simply claim American ancestry.

name: arkansas
sentence: Many people who identify themselves as Irish descent are in fact of Scots-Irish descent.

name: arkansas
sentence: According to the 2006–2008 American Community Survey, 93.8% of Arkansas's population (over the age of five) spoke only English at home.

name: arkansas
sentence: About 4.5% of the state's population spoke Spanish at home.

name: arkansas
sentence: About 0.7% of the state's population spoke any other Indo-European languages.

name: arkansas
sentence: About 0.8% of the state's population spoke an Asian language, and 0.2% spoke other languages.

name: arkansas
sentence: Arkansas, like most other Southern states, is part of the Bible Belt and is predominantly Protestant.

name: arkansas
sentence: The largest denominations by number of adherents in 2010 were the Southern Baptist Convention with 661,382; the United Methodist Church with 158,574; non-denominational Evangelical Protestants with 129,638; the Catholic Church with 122,662; and The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints with 31,254.

name: arkansas
sentence: There are some residents of the state who live by other religions such as Islam, Judaism, Wicca, Paganism, Hinduism, Buddhism or who claim no religious affiliation.

name: arkansas
sentence: Once a state with a cashless society in the uplands and plantation agriculture in the lowlands, Arkansas's economy has evolved and diversified.

name: arkansas
sentence: The state's gross domestic product (GDP) was $119 billion in 2015.

name: arkansas
sentence: Six Fortune 500 companies are based in Arkansas, including the world's #1 retailer, Walmart; Tyson Foods, J.B. Hunt, Dillard's, Murphy USA, and Windstream are also headquartered in the state.

name: arkansas
sentence: The per capita personal income in 2015 was $39,107, ranking forty-fifth in the nation.

name: arkansas
sentence: The median household income from 2011 to 2015 was $41,371, ranking forty-ninth in the nation.

name: arkansas
sentence: The state's agriculture outputs are poultry and eggs, soybeans, sorghum, cattle, cotton, rice, hogs, and milk.

name: arkansas
sentence: Its industrial outputs are food processing, electric equipment, fabricated metal products, machinery, and paper products.

name: arkansas
sentence: Mines in Arkansas produce natural gas, oil, crushed stone, bromine, and vanadium.

name: arkansas
sentence: According to CNBC, Arkansas ranks as the 20th best state for business, with the 2nd-lowest cost of doing business, 5th-lowest cost of living, 11th best workforce, 20th-best economic climate, 28th-best educated workforce, 31st-best infrastructure and the 32nd-friendliest regulatory environment.

name: arkansas
sentence: Arkansas gained 12 spots in the best state for business rankings since 2011.

name: arkansas
sentence: As of 2014, Arkansas was the most affordable US state to live in.

name: arkansas
sentence: As of October 2019, the state's unemployment rate is 3.5%.

name: arkansas
sentence: Arkansas's earliest industries were fur trading and agriculture, with development of cotton plantations in the areas near the Mississippi River.

name: arkansas
sentence: They were dependent on slave labor through the American Civil War.

name: arkansas
sentence: Today only about three percent of the population are employed in the agricultural sector, it remains a major part of the state's economy, ranking 13th in the nation in the value of products sold.

name: arkansas
sentence: Arkansas is the nation's largest producer of rice, broilers, and turkeys, and ranks in the top three for cotton, pullets, and aquaculture (catfish).

name: arkansas
sentence: Forestry remains strong in the Arkansas Timberlands, and the state ranks fourth nationally and first in the South in softwood lumber production.

name: arkansas
sentence: Automobile parts manufacturers have opened factories in eastern Arkansas to support auto plants in other states.

name: arkansas
sentence: Bauxite was formerly a large part of the state's economy, mined mostly around Saline County.

name: arkansas
sentence: Tourism is also very important to the Arkansas economy; the official state nickname "The Natural State" was created for state tourism advertising in the 1970s, and is still used to this day.

name: arkansas
sentence: The state maintains 52 state parks and the National Park Service maintains seven properties in Arkansas.

name: arkansas
sentence: The completion of the William Jefferson Clinton Presidential Library in Little Rock has drawn many visitors to the city and revitalized the nearby River Market District.

name: arkansas
sentence: Many cities also hold festivals, which draw tourists to Arkansas culture, such as The Bradley County Pink Tomato Festival in Warren, King Biscuit Blues Festival, Ozark Folk Festival, Toad Suck Daze, and Tontitown Grape Festival.

name: arkansas
sentence: As of 2010 many Arkansas local newspapers are owned by WEHCO Media, Alabama-based Lancaster Management, Kentucky-based Paxton Media Group, Missouri-based Rust Communications, Nevada-based Stephens Media, and New York-based GateHouse Media.

name: arkansas
sentence: The culture of Arkansas includes distinct cuisine, dialect, and traditional festivals.

name: arkansas
sentence: Sports are also very important to the culture of Arkansas, ranging from football, baseball, and basketball to hunting and fishing.

name: arkansas
sentence: Perhaps the best-known piece of Arkansas's culture is the stereotype of its citizens as shiftless hillbillies.

name: arkansas
sentence: The reputation began when the state was characterized by early explorers as a savage wilderness full of outlaws and thieves.

name: arkansas
sentence: The most enduring icon of Arkansas's hillbilly reputation is The Arkansas Traveller, a painted depiction of a folk tale from the 1840s.

name: arkansas
sentence: Although intended to represent the divide between rich southeastern plantation Arkansas planters and the poor northwestern hill country, the meaning was twisted to represent a Northerner lost in the Ozarks on a white horse asking a backwoods Arkansan for directions.

name: arkansas
sentence: The state also suffers from the racial stigma common to former Confederate states, with historical events such as the Little Rock Nine adding to Arkansas's enduring image.

name: arkansas
sentence: Art and history museums display pieces of cultural value for Arkansans and tourists to enjoy.

name: arkansas
sentence: Crystal Bridges Museum of American Art in Bentonville was visited by 604,000 people in 2012, its first year.

name: arkansas
sentence: The museum includes walking trails and educational opportunities in addition to displaying over 450 works covering five centuries of American art.

name: arkansas
sentence: Several historic town sites have been restored as Arkansas state parks, including Historic Washington State Park, Powhatan Historic State Park, and Davidsonville Historic State Park.

name: arkansas
sentence: Arkansas features a variety of native music across the state, ranging from the blues heritage of West Memphis, Pine Bluff, Helena–West Helena to rockabilly, bluegrass, and folk music from the Ozarks.

name: arkansas
sentence: Festivals such as the King Biscuit Blues Festival and Bikes, Blues, and BBQ pay homage to the history of blues in the state.

name: arkansas
sentence: The Ozark Folk Festival in Mountain View is a celebration of Ozark culture and often features folk and bluegrass musicians.

name: arkansas
sentence: Literature set in Arkansas such as I Know Why the Caged Bird Sings by Maya Angelou and A Painted House by John Grisham describe the culture at various time periods.

name: arkansas
sentence: Sports have become an integral part of the culture of Arkansas, and her residents enjoy participating in and spectating various events throughout the year.

name: arkansas
sentence: Team sports and especially collegiate football are important to Arkansans.

name: arkansas
sentence: College football in Arkansas began from humble beginnings, when the University of Arkansas first fielded a team in 1894.

name: arkansas
sentence: Over the years, many Arkansans have looked to Arkansas Razorbacks football as the public image of the state.

name: arkansas
sentence: Although the University of Arkansas is based in Fayetteville, the Razorbacks have always played at least one game per season at War Memorial Stadium in Little Rock in an effort to keep fan support in central and south Arkansas.

name: arkansas
sentence: Arkansas State University became the second NCAA Division I Football Bowl Subdivision (FBS) (then known as Division I-A) team in the state in 1992 after playing in lower divisions for nearly two decades.

name: arkansas
sentence: The two schools have never played each other, due to the University of Arkansas's policy of not playing intrastate games.

name: arkansas
sentence: Two other campuses of the University of Arkansas System are Division I members.

name: arkansas
sentence: The University of Arkansas at Pine Bluff is a member of the Southwestern Athletic Conference, a league whose members all play football in the second-level Football Championship Subdivision (FCS).

name: arkansas
sentence: The University of Arkansas at Little Rock is a member of the FBS Sun Belt Conference, but is one of two conference schools that have no football program.

name: arkansas
sentence: The state's other Division I member is the University of Central Arkansas, which is a full member (including football) of the FCS Southland Conference.

name: arkansas
sentence: Seven of Arkansas's smaller colleges play in NCAA Division II, with six in the Great American Conference and one in the Lone Star Conference.

name: arkansas
sentence: Two other small Arkansas colleges compete in NCAA Division III, in which athletic scholarships are prohibited.

name: arkansas
sentence: High school football also began to grow in Arkansas in the early 20th century.

name: arkansas
sentence: Baseball runs deep in Arkansas and has been popular before the state hosted Major League Baseball (MLB) spring training in Hot Springs from 1886 to the 1920s.

name: arkansas
sentence: Two minor league teams are based in the state.

name: arkansas
sentence: The Arkansas Travelers play at Dickey–Stephens Park in North Little Rock, and the Northwest Arkansas Naturals play in Arvest Ballpark in Springdale.

name: arkansas
sentence: Both teams compete in the Texas League.

name: arkansas
sentence: Related to the state's frontier past, hunting continues in the state.

name: arkansas
sentence: The state created the Arkansas Game and Fish Commission in 1915 to regulate hunting and enforce those regulations.

name: arkansas
sentence: Today a significant portion of Arkansas's population participates in hunting duck in the Mississippi flyway and deer across the state.

name: arkansas
sentence: Millions of acres of public land are available for both bow and modern gun hunters.

name: arkansas
sentence: Fishing has always been popular in Arkansas, and the sport and the state have benefited from the creation of reservoirs across the state.

name: arkansas
sentence: Following the completion of Norfork Dam, the Norfork Tailwater and the White River have become a destination for trout fishers.

name: arkansas
sentence: Several smaller retirement communities such as Bull Shoals, Hot Springs Village, and Fairfield Bay have flourished due to their position on a fishing lake.

name: arkansas
sentence: The National Park Service has preserved the Buffalo National River in its natural state and fly fishers visit it annually.

name: arkansas
sentence: As of 2012, Arkansas, as with many Southern states, has a high incidence of premature death, infant mortality, cardiovascular deaths, and occupational fatalities compared to the rest of the United States.

name: arkansas
sentence: The state is tied for 43rd with New York in percentage of adults who regularly exercise.

name: arkansas
sentence: Arkansas is usually ranked as one of the least healthy states due to high obesity, smoking, and sedentary lifestyle rates, but according to a Gallup poll, Arkansas made the most immediate progress in reducing its number of uninsured residents after the Affordable Care Act passed.

name: arkansas
sentence: The percentage of uninsured in Arkansas dropped from 22.5 in 2013 to 12.4 in August 2014.

name: arkansas
sentence: The Arkansas Clean Indoor Air Act, a statewide smoking ban excluding bars and some restaurants, went into effect in 2006.

name: arkansas
sentence: Healthcare in Arkansas is provided by a network of hospitals as members of the Arkansas Hospital Association.

name: arkansas
sentence: Major institutions with multiple branches include Baptist Health, Community Health Systems, and HealthSouth.

name: arkansas
sentence: The University of Arkansas for Medical Sciences (UAMS) in Little Rock operates the UAMS Medical Center, a teaching hospital ranked as high performing nationally in cancer and nephrology.

name: arkansas
sentence: The pediatric division of UAMS Medical Center is known as Arkansas Children's Hospital, nationally ranked in pediatric cardiology and heart surgery.

name: arkansas
sentence: Together, these two institutions are the state's only Level I trauma centers.

name: arkansas
sentence: Arkansas has 1,064 state-funded kindergartens, elementary, junior and senior high schools.

name: arkansas
sentence: The state supports a network of public universities and colleges, including two major university systems: Arkansas State University System and University of Arkansas System.

name: arkansas
sentence: The University of Arkansas, flagship campus of the University of Arkansas System in Fayetteville was ranked #63 among public schools in the nation by US News & World Report.

name: arkansas
sentence: Other public institutions include University of Arkansas at Pine Bluff, Arkansas Tech University, Henderson State University, Southern Arkansas University, and University of Central Arkansas across the state.

name: arkansas
sentence: It is also home to 11 private colleges and universities including Hendrix College, one of the nation's top 100 liberal arts colleges, according to US News & World Report.

name: arkansas
sentence: In the 1920s the state required all children to attend public schools.

name: arkansas
sentence: The school year was set at 131 days, although some areas were unable to meet that requirement.

name: arkansas
sentence: Generally prohibited in the West at large, school corporal punishment is not unusual in Arkansas, with 20,083 public school students paddled at least one time, according to government data for the 2011–12 school year.

name: arkansas
sentence: The rate of corporal punishment in public schools is higher only in Mississippi.

name: arkansas
sentence: Arkansas is one of the least educated US states.

name: arkansas
sentence: It ranks near the bottom in terms of percentage of the population with a high school or college degree.

name: arkansas
sentence: The state's educational system has a history of underfunding, low teachers' salaries and political meddling in the curriculum.

name: arkansas
sentence: Educational statistics during the early days are fragmentary and unreliable.

name: arkansas
sentence: Many counties did not submit full reports to the secretary of state, who did double duty as commissioner of common schools.

name: arkansas
sentence: But the percentage of whites over 20 years old who were illiterate was given as:

name: arkansas
sentence: In 2010 Arkansas students earned an average score of 20.3 on the ACT exam, just below the national average of 21.

name: arkansas
sentence: These results were expected due to the large increase in the number of students taking the exam since the establishment of the Academic Challenge Scholarship.

name: arkansas
sentence: Top high schools receiving recognition from the US News & World Report are spread across the state, including Haas Hall Academy in Fayetteville, KIPP Delta Collegiate in Helena-West Helena, Bentonville, Rogers, Rogers Heritage, Valley Springs, Searcy, and McCrory.

name: arkansas
sentence: A total of 81 Arkansas high schools were ranked by the US News & World Report in 2012.

name: arkansas
sentence: Arkansas ranks as the 32nd smartest state on the Morgan Quitno Smartest State Award, 44th in percentage of residents with at least a high school diploma, and 48th in percentage of bachelor's degree attainment.

name: arkansas
sentence: Arkansas has been making strides in education reform.

name: arkansas
sentence: Education Week has praised the state, ranking Arkansas in the top 10 of their Quality Counts Education Rankings every year since 2009 while scoring it in the top 5 during 2012 and 2013.

name: arkansas
sentence: Arkansas specifically received an A in Transition and Policy Making for progress in this area consisting of early-childhood education, college readiness, and career readiness.

name: arkansas
sentence: Governor Mike Beebe has made improving education a major issue through his attempts to spend more on education.

name: arkansas
sentence: Through reforms, the state is a leader in requiring curricula designed to prepare students for postsecondary education, rewarding teachers for student achievement, and providing incentives for principals who work in lower-tier schools.

name: arkansas
sentence: As an organized territory, and later in the early days of statehood, education was funded by the sales of federally controlled public lands.

name: arkansas
sentence: This system was inadequate and prone to local graft.

name: arkansas
sentence: In an 1854 message to the legislature, Governor Elias N. Conway said, "We have a common-school law intended as a system to establish common schools in all part of the state; but for the want of adequate means there are very few in operation under this law."

name: arkansas
sentence: At the time, only about a quarter of children were enrolled in school.

name: arkansas
sentence: By the beginning of the American Civil War, the state had only twenty-five publicly funded common schools.

name: arkansas
sentence: In 1867, the state legislature was still controlled by ex-Confederates.

name: arkansas
sentence: It passed a Common Schools Law that allowed public funded but limited schools to white children.

name: arkansas
sentence: The 1868 legislature banned former Confederates and passed a more wide-ranging law detailing funding and administrative issues and allowing black children to attend school.

name: arkansas
sentence: In furtherance of this, the postwar 1868 state constitution was the first to permit a personal-property tax to fund the lands and buildings for public schools.

name: arkansas
sentence: With the 1868 elections, the first county school commissioners took office.

name: arkansas
sentence: In 2014, the state spent $9,616 per student, compared with a national average of about $11,000 putting Arkansas in nineteenth place.

name: arkansas
sentence: Transportation in Arkansas is overseen by the Arkansas Department of Transportation (ArDOT), headquartered in Little Rock.

name: arkansas
sentence: Several main corridors pass through Little Rock, including Interstate 30 (I-30) and I-40 (the nation's 3rd-busiest trucking corridor).

name: arkansas
sentence: Arkansas first designated a state highway system in 1924, and first numbered its roads in 1926.

name: arkansas
sentence: Arkansas had one of the first paved roads, the Dollarway Road, and one of the first members of the Interstate Highway System.

name: arkansas
sentence: The state maintains a large system of state highways today, in addition to eight Interstates and 20 US

name: arkansas
sentence: Routes.

name: arkansas
sentence: In northeast Arkansas, I-55 travels north from Memphis to Missouri, with a new spur to Jonesboro (I-555).

name: arkansas
sentence: Northwest Arkansas is served by the segment of I-49 from Fort Smith to the beginning of the Bella Vista Bypass.

name: arkansas
sentence: This segment of I-49 currently follows mostly the same route as the former section of I-540 that extended north of I-40.

name: arkansas
sentence: The state also has the 13th largest state highway system in the nation.

name: arkansas
sentence: Arkansas is served by 2,750 miles (4,430 km) of railroad track divided among twenty-six railroad companies including three Class I railroads.

name: arkansas
sentence: Freight railroads are concentrated in southeast Arkansas to serve the industries in the region.

name: arkansas
sentence: The Texas Eagle, an Amtrak passenger train, serves five stations in the state Walnut Ridge, Little Rock, Malvern, Arkadelphia, and Texarkana.

name: arkansas
sentence: Arkansas also benefits from the use of its rivers for commerce.

name: arkansas
sentence: The Mississippi River and Arkansas River are both major rivers.

name: arkansas
sentence: The United States Army Corps of Engineers maintains the McClellan-Kerr Arkansas River Navigation System, allowing barge traffic up the Arkansas River to the Port of Catoosa in Tulsa, Oklahoma.

name: arkansas
sentence: There are four airports with commercial service: Clinton National Airport (formerly Little Rock National Airport or Adams Field), Northwest Arkansas Regional Airport, Fort Smith Regional Airport, and Texarkana Regional Airport, with dozens of smaller airports in the state.

name: arkansas
sentence: Public transit and community transport services for the elderly or those with developmental disabilities are provided by agencies such as the Central Arkansas Transit Authority and the Ozark Regional Transit, organizations that are part of the Arkansas Transit Association.

name: arkansas
sentence: As with the federal government of the United States, political power in Arkansas is divided into three branches: executive, legislative, and judicial.

name: arkansas
sentence: Each officer's term is four years long.

name: arkansas
sentence: Office holders are term-limited to two full terms plus any partial terms before the first full term.

name: arkansas
sentence: The governor of Arkansas is Asa Hutchinson, a Republican, who was inaugurated on January 13, 2015.

name: arkansas
sentence: The six other elected executive positions in Arkansas are lieutenant governor, secretary of state, attorney general, treasurer, auditor, and land commissioner.

name: arkansas
sentence: The governor also appoints the leaders of various state boards, committees, and departments.

name: arkansas
sentence: Arkansas governors served two-year terms until a referendum lengthened the term to four years, effective with the 1986 election.

name: arkansas
sentence: In Arkansas, the lieutenant governor is elected separately from the governor and thus can be from a different political party.

name: arkansas
