sentence: The Arkansas General Assembly is the state's bicameral bodies of legislators, composed of the Senatorte and House of Representatives.

name: arkansas
sentence: The Senatorte contains 35 members from districts of approximately equal population.

name: arkansas
sentence: These districts are redrawn decennially with each US census, and in election years ending in "2", the entire body is put up for reelection.

name: arkansas
sentence: Following the election, half of the seats are designated as two-year seats and are up for reelection again in two years, these "half-terms" do not count against a legislator's term limits.

name: arkansas
sentence: The remaining half serve a full four-year term.

name: arkansas
sentence: This staggers elections such that half the body is up for reelection every two years and allows for complete body turnover following redistricting.

name: arkansas
sentence: Arkansas voters elected a 21–14 Republican majority in the Senatorte in 2012.

name: arkansas
sentence: Arkansas House members can serve a maximum of three two-year terms.

name: arkansas
sentence: House districts are redistricted by the Arkansas Board of Apportionment.

name: arkansas
sentence: In the 2012 elections, Republicans gained a 51–49 majority in the House of Representatives.

name: arkansas
sentence: The Republican Party majority status in the Arkansas State House of Representatives after the 2012 elections is the party's first since 1874.

name: arkansas
sentence: Arkansas was the last state of the old Confederacy to never have Republicans control either chamber of its house since the Civil War.

name: arkansas
sentence: Following the term limits changes, studies have shown that lobbyists have become less influential in state politics.

name: arkansas
sentence: Legislative staff, not subject to term limits, have acquired additional power and influence due to the high rate of elected official turnover.

name: arkansas
sentence: Arkansas's judicial branch has five court systems: Arkansas Supreme Court, Arkansas Court of Appeals, Circuit Courts, District Courts and City Courts.

name: arkansas
sentence: Most cases begin in district court, which is subdivided into state district court and local district court.

name: arkansas
sentence: State district courts exercise district-wide jurisdiction over the districts created by the General Assembly, and local district courts are presided over by part-time judges who may privately practice law.

name: arkansas
sentence: 25 state district court judges preside over 15 districts, with more districts created in 2013 and 2017.

name: arkansas
sentence: There are 28 judicial circuits of Circuit Court, with each contains five subdivisions: criminal, civil, probate, domestic relations, and juvenile court.

name: arkansas
sentence: The jurisdiction of the Arkansas Court of Appeals is determined by the Arkansas Supreme Court, and there is no right of appeal from the Court of Appeals to the high court.

name: arkansas
sentence: The Arkansas Supreme Court can review Court of Appeals cases upon application by either a party to the litigation, upon request by the Court of Appeals, or if the Arkansas Supreme Court feels the case should have been initially assigned to it.

name: arkansas
sentence: The twelve judges of the Arkansas Court of Appeals are elected from judicial districts to renewable six-year terms.

name: arkansas
sentence: The Arkansas Supreme Court is the court of last resort in the state, composed of seven justices elected to eight-year terms.

name: arkansas
sentence: Established by the Arkansas Constitution in 1836, the court's decisions can be appealed to only the Supreme Court of the United States.

name: arkansas
sentence: Both Arkansas's US senators, John Boozman and Tom Cotton, are Republicans.

name: arkansas
sentence: The state has four seats in US House of Representatives.

name: arkansas
sentence: All four seats are held by Republicans: Rick Crawford (1st district), French Hill (2nd district), Steve Womack (3rd district), and Bruce Westerman (4th district).

name: arkansas
sentence: Arkansas governor Bill Clinton brought national attention to the state with a long speech at the 1988 Democratic National Convention endorsing Michael Dukakis.

name: arkansas
sentence: Some journalists suggested the speech was a threat to his ambitions; Clinton defined it "a comedy of error, just one of those fluky things".

name: arkansas
sentence: He won the Democratic nomination for president in 1992.

name: arkansas
sentence: Presenting himself as a "New Democrat" and using incumbent George H W Bush's broken promise against him, Clinton won the 1992 presidential election with 43.0% of the vote to Bush's 37.4% and independent billionaire Ross Perot's 18.9%.

name: arkansas
sentence: Most Republican strength traditionally lay mainly in the northwestern part of the state, particularly Fort Smith and Bentonville, as well as North Central Arkansas around the Mountain Home area.

name: arkansas
sentence: In the latter area, Republicans have been known to get 90% or more of the vote, while the rest of the state was more Democratic.

name: arkansas
sentence: After 2010, Republican strength expanded further to the Northeast and Southwest and into the Little Rock suburbs.

name: arkansas
sentence: The Democrats are mostly concentrated to central Little Rock, the Mississippi Delta, the Pine Bluff area, and the areas around the southern border with Louisiana.

name: arkansas
sentence: Arkansas has elected only three Republicans to the US Senatorte since Reconstruction: Tim Hutchinson, who was defeated after one term by Mark Pryor; John Boozman, who defeated incumbent Blanche Lincoln; and Tom Cotton, who defeated Pryor in 2014.

name: arkansas
sentence: Before 2013, the General Assembly had not been controlled by the Republican Party since Reconstruction, with the GOP holding a 51-seat majority in the state House and a 21-seat (of 35) in the state Senatorte following victories in 2012.

name: arkansas
sentence: Arkansas was one of just three states among the states of the former Confederacy that sent two Democrats to the US Senatorte (the others being Florida and Virginia) for any period during the first decade of the 21st century.

name: arkansas
sentence: In 2010, Republicans captured three of the state's four seats in the US House of Representatives.

name: arkansas
sentence: In 2012, they won election to all four House seats.

name: arkansas
sentence: Arkansas held the distinction of having a US House delegation composed entirely of military veterans (Rick Crawford, Army; Tim Griffin, Army Reserve; Steve Womack, Army National Guard; Tom Cotton, Army).

name: arkansas
sentence: When Pryor was defeated in 2014, the entire congressional delegation was in GOP hands for the first time since Reconstruction.

name: arkansas
sentence: Reflecting the state's large evangelical population, the state has a strong social conservative bent.

name: arkansas
sentence: Under the Arkansas Constitution Arkansas is a right to work state, its voters passed a ban on same-sex marriage with 75% voting yes, and the state is one of a handful with legislation on its books banning abortion in the event Roe v. Wade is ever overturned.

name: arkansas
sentence: Arkansas is one of only four states (along with Georgia, South Carolina, and Wyoming) not to have any legal protection against hate crimes.

name: arkansas
sentence: An anti-hate crimes measure passed the state Senatorte in 2001 but failed before a House panel

name: arkansas
sentence: The forests of Arkansas and the Ozark mountain region have provided cover for clandestine hate groups.

name: arkansas
sentence: White nationalist groups such as The Covenant, The Sword, and the Arm of the Lord had a compound in the Ozarks in the 1980s, later raided by authorities.

name: arkansas
sentence: The Knights of the KKK and the Kingdom Identity Ministries (a Christian identity organization) have also established headquarters in that area, specifically in Harrison.

name: arkansas
sentence: A series of riots in Harrison in the early 1900s forced most of its African-American population out of the area.

name: arkansas
sentence: In February 2018, prosecutors in Little Rock unsealed indictments against 54 members of the New Aryan Empire (a white supremacist group that began as a prison gang).

name: arkansas
sentence: Most of the NEE members indicted in 2019 are from Russellville.

name: arkansas
sentence: Its leader briefly escaped from a Pine Bluff jail in August of that year.

name: arkansas
sentence: In May, another group of white supremacists protesters carrying the flag of Nazi Germany also disrupted a Holocaust remembrance event in Russellville.

name: arkansas
sentence: Billboards have appeared in the state displaying white supremacist slogans (e.g.

name: arkansas
sentence: "anti-racist is a code word for anti-white") or promoting white pride websites.

name: arkansas
sentence: In 2018, the Southern Poverty Law Center (an organization which tracks hate groups) identified 14 distinct hate groups in the state.

name: arkansas
sentence: In 2019, Republican Governor Asa Hutchinson (who as federal prosecutor in the 1980s was involved in negotiations with the CSA) and Democratic Senatortor Joyce Elliott have called on lawmakers in the state to approve harsher penalties for hate crimes.

name: arkansas
sentence: The Strategic Air Command facility of Little Rock Air Force Base was one of eighteen silos in the command of the 308th Strategic Missile Wing (308th SMW), specifically one of the nine silos within its 374th Strategic Missile Squadron (374th SMS).

name: arkansas
sentence: The squadron was responsible for Launch Complex 374–7, site of the 1980 explosion of a Titan II Intercontinental Ballistic Missile (ICBM) in Damascus, Arkansas.

name: arkansas
sentence: Taxes are collected by the Arkansas Department of Finance and Administration.

name: arkansas
sentence: Arkansas is home to many areas protected by the National Park System.

name: arkansas
sentence: These include:

name: california
sentence: California is a state in the Pacific Region of the United States.

name: california
sentence: With over 39.3 million residents across a total area of approximately 163,696 square miles (423,970 km2), it is the most populous US state and the third-largest by area, as well as the world's thirty-fourth-most-populous subnational entity.

name: california
sentence: California is also the most populated subnational entity in North America, and has its state capital in Sacramento.

name: california
sentence: The Greater Los Angeles area and the San Francisco Bay Area are the nation's second- and fifth-most-populous urban regions, with more than 18.7 million and 9.6 million residents respectively.

name: california
sentence: Los Angeles is California's most populous city, and the country's second-most-populous, after New York City.

name: california
sentence: California also has the nation's most populous county, Los Angeles County, and its largest county by area, San Bernardino County.

name: california
sentence: The City and County of San Francisco is both the country's second most densely populated major city after New York City and the fifth-most-densely populated county, behind only four of the five New York City boroughs.

name: california
sentence: California's economy, with a gross state product of $3.2 trillion as of 2019, is the largest sub-national economy in the world.

name: california
sentence: If it were a country, California would be the fifth-largest economy in the world, and the 37th-most populous as of 2020.

name: california
sentence: The Greater Los Angeles area and the San Francisco Bay Area are the nation's second- and third-largest urban economies ($1.3 trillion and $1.0 trillion respectively as of 2020), after the New York metropolitan area ($2.0 trillion).

name: california
sentence: The San Francisco Bay Area Combined Statistical Area had the nation's highest gross domestic product per capita in 2018 ($106,757) among large primary statistical areas, and is home to four of the world's ten largest companies by market capitalization and four of the world's ten richest people.

name: california
sentence: California is considered a global trendsetter in popular culture, communication, information, innovation, environmentalism, economics, politics, and entertainment.

name: california
sentence: As a result of the state's diversity and migration, California integrates foods, languages, and traditions from other areas across the country and around the globe.

name: california
sentence: It is considered the origin of the hippie counterculture, beach and car culture, the Internet, and the personal computer, among others.

name: california
sentence: The San Francisco Bay Area and the Greater Los Angeles Area are widely seen as centers of the global technology and entertainment industries, respectively.

name: california
sentence: California's economy is very diverse: 58% of it is based on finance, government, real estate services, technology, and professional, scientific, and technical business services.

name: california
sentence: Although it accounts for only 1.5% of the state's economy, California's agriculture industry has the highest output of any US state.

name: california
sentence: California shares a border with Oregon to the north, Nevada and Arizona to the east, and the Mexican state of Baja California to the south.

name: california
sentence: The state's diverse geography ranges from the Pacific Coast in the west to the Sierra Nevada mountain range in the east, and from the redwood and Douglas fir forests in the northwest to the Mojave Desert in the southeast.

name: california
sentence: The Central Valley, a major agricultural area, dominates the state's center.

name: california
sentence: Although California is well-known for its warm Mediterranean climate and monsoon seasonal weather, the large size of the state results in climates that vary from moist temperate rainforest in the north to arid desert in the interior, as well as snowy alpine in the mountains.

name: california
sentence: All these factors lead to an enormous demand for water; in total numbers, California is the largest consumer of water in North America.

name: california
sentence: Over time, drought and wildfires have become more frequent; further straining California's water security.

name: california
sentence: What is now California was first settled by various Native Californian tribes before being explored by a number of Europeans during the 16th and 17th centuries.

name: california
sentence: The Spanish Empire then claimed and colonized it.

name: california
sentence: In 1804 it was included in Alta California province, within the Viceroyalty of New Spain.

name: california
sentence: The area became a part of Mexico in 1821 following its successful war for independence but was ceded to the United States in 1848 after the Mexican–American War.

name: california
sentence: The western portion of Alta California was then organized and admitted as the 31st state on September 9, 1850.

name: california
sentence: The California Gold Rush starting in 1848 led to dramatic social and demographic changes, with large-scale emigration from the east and abroad with an accompanying economic boom.

name: california
sentence: The Spaniards gave the name Las Californias to the peninsula of Baja California and to Alta California, the region that became the present-day state of California.

name: california
sentence: The name likely derived from the mythical island of California in the fictional story of Queen Calafia, as recorded in a 1510 work The Adventures of Esplandián by Garci Rodríguez de Montalvo.

name: california
sentence: This work was the fifth in a popular Spanish chivalric romance series that began with Amadis de Gaula.

name: california
sentence: Queen Calafia's kingdom was said to be a remote land rich in gold and pearls, inhabited by beautiful black women who wore gold armor and lived like Amazons, as well as griffins and other strange beasts.

name: california
sentence: In the fictional paradise, the ruler Queen Calafia fought alongside Muslims and her name may have been chosen to echo the title of a Muslim leader, the Caliph.

name: california
sentence: It is possible the name California was meant to imply the island was a Caliphate.

name: california
sentence: Shortened forms of the state's name include CA, Cal, Cali, Calif, Califas, and US-CA.

name: california
sentence: Settled by successive waves of arrivals during at least the last 13,000 years, California was one of the most culturally and linguistically diverse areas in pre-Columbian North America.

name: california
sentence: Various estimates of the native population range from 100,000 to 300,000.

name: california
sentence: The indigenous peoples of California included more than 70 distinct ethnic groups of Native Americans, ranging from large, settled populations living on the coast to groups in the interior.

name: california
sentence: California groups also were diverse in their political organization with bands, tribes, villages, and on the resource-rich coasts, large chiefdoms, such as the Chumash, Pomo and Salinan.

name: california
sentence: Trade, intermarriage and military alliances fostered many social and economic relationships among the diverse groups.

name: california
sentence: The first Europeans to explore the California coast were the members of a Spanish sailing expedition led by Portuguese captain Juan Rodríguez Cabrillo; they entered San Diego Bay on September 28, 1542, and reached at least as far north as San Miguel Island.

name: california
sentence: Privateer and explorer Francis Drake explored and claimed an undefined portion of the California coast in 1579, landing north of the future city of San Francisco.

name: california
sentence: The first Asians to set foot on what would be the United States occurred in 1587, when Filipino sailors arrived in Spanish ships at Morro Bay.

name: california
sentence: Sebastián Vizcaíno explored and mapped the coast of California in 1602 for New Spain, sailing as far north as Cape Mendocino.

name: california
sentence: Despite the on-the-ground explorations of California in the 16th century, Rodríguez's idea of California as an island persisted.

name: california
sentence: Such depictions appeared on many European maps well into the 18th century.

name: california
sentence: After the Portolà expedition of 1769–70, Spanish missionaries led by Junipero Serra began setting up 21 California Missions on or near the coast of Alta (Upper) California, beginning in San Diego.

name: california
sentence: During the same period, Spanish military forces built several forts (presidios) and three small towns (pueblos).

name: california
sentence: The San Francisco Mission grew into the city of San Francisco, and two of the pueblos grew into the cities of Los Angeles and San Jose.

name: california
sentence: Several other smaller cities and towns also sprang up surrounding the various Spanish missions and pueblos, which remain to this day.

name: california
sentence: The Spanish colonization began decimating the natives through epidemics of various diseases for which the indigenous peoples had no natural immunity, such as measles and diphtheria.

name: california
sentence: The establishment of the Spanish systems of government and social structure, which the Spanish settlers had brought with them, also technologically and culturally overwhelmed the societies of the earlier indigenous peoples.

name: california
sentence: During this same period, Russian ships also explored along the California coast and in 1812 established a trading post at Fort Ross.

name: california
sentence: Russia's early 19th-century coastal settlements in California were positioned just north of the northernmost edge of the area of Spanish settlement in San Francisco Bay, and were the southernmost Russian settlements in North America.

name: california
sentence: The Russian settlements associated with Fort Ross were spread from Point Arena to Tomales Bay.

name: california
sentence: In 1821, the Mexican War of Independence gave Mexico (including California) independence from Spain.

name: california
sentence: For the next 25 years, Alta California remained as a remote, sparsely populated, northwestern administrative district of the newly independent country of Mexico.The missions, which controlled most of the best land in the state, were secularized by 1834 and became the property of the Mexican government.

name: california
sentence: The governor granted many square leagues of land to others with political influence.

name: california
sentence: These huge ranchos or cattle ranches emerged as the dominant institutions of Mexican California.

name: california
sentence: The ranchos developed under ownership by Californios (Hispanics native of California) who traded cowhides and tallow with Boston merchants.

name: california
sentence: Beef did not become a commodity until the 1849 California Gold Rush.

name: california
sentence: From the 1820s, trappers and settlers from the United States and the future Canada arrived in Northern California.

name: california
sentence: These new arrivals used the Siskiyou Trail, California Trail, Oregon Trail and Old Spanish Trail to cross the rugged mountains and harsh deserts in and surrounding California.

name: california
sentence: The early government of the newly independent Mexico was highly unstable, and in a reflection of this, from 1831 onwards, California also experienced a series of armed disputes, both internal and with the central Mexican government.

name: california
sentence: During this tumultuous political period Juan Bautista Alvarado was able to secure the governorship during 1836–1842.

name: california
sentence: The military action which first brought Alvarado to power had momentarily declared California to be an independent state, and had been aided by Anglo-American residents of California, including Isaac Graham.

name: california
sentence: In 1840, one hundred of those residents who did not have passports were arrested, leading to the Graham Affair, which was resolved in part with the intercession of Royal Navy officials.

name: california
sentence: One of the largest ranchers in California was John Marsh.

name: california
sentence: After failing to obtain justice against squatters on his land from the Mexican courts, he determined that California should become part of the United States.

name: california
sentence: Marsh conducted a letter-writing campaign espousing the California climate, the soil, and other reasons to settle there, as well as the best route to follow, which became known as "Marsh's route".

name: california
sentence: His letters were read, reread, passed around, and printed in newspapers throughout the country, and started the first wagon trains rolling to California.

name: california
sentence: He invited immigrants to stay on his ranch until they could get settled, and assisted in their obtaining passports.

name: california
sentence: After ushering in the period of organized emigration to California, Marsh became involved in a military battle between the much-hated Mexican general, Manuel Micheltorena and the California governor he had replaced, Juan Bautista Alvarado.

name: california
sentence: The armies of each met at the Battle of Providencia near Los Angeles.

name: california
sentence: Marsh had been forced against his will to join Micheltorena's army.

name: california
sentence: Ignoring his superiors, during the battle, he signaled the other side for a parlay.

name: california
sentence: There were many settlers from the United States fighting on both sides.

name: california
sentence: He convinced these men that they had no reason to be fighting each other.

name: california
sentence: As a result of Marsh's actions, they abandoned the fight, Micheltorena was defeated, and California-born Pio Pico was returned to the governorship.

name: california
sentence: This paved the way to California's ultimate acquisition by the United States.

name: california
sentence: In 1846, a group of American settlers in and around Sonoma rebelled against Mexican rule during the Bear Flag Revolt.

name: california
sentence: Afterwards, rebels raised the Bear Flag (featuring a bear, a star, a red stripe and the words "California Republic") at Sonoma.

name: california
sentence: The Republic's only president was William B. Ide, who played a pivotal role during the Bear Flag Revolt.

name: california
sentence: This revolt by American settlers served as a prelude to the later American military invasion of California and was closely coordinated with nearby American military commanders.

name: california
sentence: The California Republic was short lived

name: california
sentence: When Commodore John D. Sloat of the United States Navy sailed into Monterey Bay and began the military occupation of California by the United States, Northern California capitulated in less than a month to the United States forces.

name: california
sentence: After a series of defensive battles in Southern California, the Treaty of Cahuenga was signed by the Californios on January 13, 1847, securing American control in California.

name: california
sentence: Following the Treaty of Guadalupe Hidalgo (February 2, 1848) that ended the war, the westernmost portion of the annexed Mexican territory of Alta California soon became the American state of California, and the remainder of the old territory was then subdivided into the new American Territories of Arizona, Nevada, Colorado and Utah.

name: california
sentence: The even more lightly populated and arid lower region of old Baja California remained as a part of Mexico.

name: california
sentence: In 1846, the total settler population of the western part of the old Alta California had been estimated to be no more than 8,000, plus about 100,000 Native Americans, down from about 300,000 before Hispanic settlement in 1769.

name: california
sentence: In 1848, only one week before the official American annexation of the area, gold was discovered in California, this being an event which was to forever alter both the state's demographics and its finances.

name: california
sentence: Soon afterward, a massive influx of immigration into the area resulted, as prospectors and miners arrived by the thousands.

name: california
sentence: The population burgeoned with United States citizens, Europeans, Chinese and other immigrants during the great California Gold Rush.

name: california
sentence: By the time of California's application for statehood in 1850, the settler population of California had multiplied to 100,000.

name: california
sentence: By 1854, more than 300,000 settlers had come.

name: california
sentence: Between 1847 and 1870, the population of San Francisco increased from 500 to 150,000.

name: california
sentence: California was suddenly no longer a sparsely populated backwater, but seemingly overnight it had grown into a major population center.

name: california
sentence: The seat of government for California under Spanish and later Mexican rule had been located in Monterey from 1777 until 1845.

name: california
sentence: Pio Pico, the last Mexican governor of Alta California, had briefly moved the capital to Los Angeles in 1845.

name: california
sentence: The United States consulate had also been located in Monterey, under consul Thomas O. Larkin.

name: california
sentence: In 1849, a state Constitutional Convention was first held in Monterey.

name: california
sentence: Among the first tasks of the Convention was a decision on a location for the new state capital.

name: california
sentence: The first full legislative sessions were held in San Jose (1850–1851).

name: california
sentence: Subsequent locations included Vallejo (1852–1853), and nearby Benicia (1853–1854); these locations eventually proved to be inadequate as well.

name: california
sentence: The capital has been located in Sacramento since 1854 with only a short break in 1862 when legislative sessions were held in San Francisco due to flooding in Sacramento.Once the state's Constitutional Convention had finalized its state constitution, it applied to the US Congress for admission to statehood.

name: california
sentence: On September 9, 1850, as part of the Compromise of 1850, California became a free state and September 9 a state holiday.

name: california
sentence: During the American Civil War (1861–1865), California sent gold shipments eastwards to Washington in support of the Union.

name: california
sentence: However, due to the existence of a large contingent of pro-South sympathizers within the state, the state was not able to muster any full military regiments to send eastwards to officially serve in the Union war effort.

name: california
sentence: Still, several smaller military units within the Union army were unofficially associated with the state of California, such as the "California 100 Company", due to a majority of their members being from California.

name: california
sentence: At the time of California's admission into the Union, travel between California and the rest of the continental United States had been a time-consuming and dangerous feat.

name: california
sentence: Nineteen years afterwards, in 1869, shortly after the conclusion of the Civil War, a more direct connection was developed with the completion of the First Transcontinental Railroad in 1869.

name: california
sentence: California was then easy to reach.

name: california
sentence: Much of the state was extremely well suited to fruit cultivation and agriculture in general.

name: california
sentence: Vast expanses of wheat, other cereal crops, vegetable crops, cotton, and nut and fruit trees were grown (including oranges in Southern California), and the foundation was laid for the state's prodigious agricultural production in the Central Valley and elsewhere.

name: california
sentence: Under earlier Spanish and Mexican rule, California's original native population had precipitously declined, above all, from Eurasian diseases to which the indigenous people of California had not yet developed a natural immunity.

name: california
sentence: Under its new American administration, California's harsh governmental policies towards its own indigenous people did not improve.

name: california
sentence: As in other American states, many of the native inhabitants were soon forcibly removed from their lands by incoming American settlers such as miners, ranchers, and farmers.

name: california
sentence: Although California had entered the American union as a free state, the "loitering or orphaned Indians" were de facto enslaved by their new Anglo-American masters under the 1853 Act for the Government and Protection of Indians.

name: california
sentence: There were also massacres in which hundreds of indigenous people were killed.

name: california
sentence: Between 1850 and 1860, the California state government paid around 1.5 million dollars (some 250,000 of which was reimbursed by the federal government) to hire militias whose purpose was to protect settlers from the indigenous populations.

name: california
sentence: In later decades, the native population was placed in reservations and rancherias, which were often small and isolated and without enough natural resources or funding from the government to sustain the populations living on them.

name: california
sentence: As a result, the rise of California was a calamity for the native inhabitants.

name: california
sentence: Several scholars and Native American activists, including Benjamin Madley and Ed Castillo, have described the actions of the California government as a genocide.

name: california
sentence: Migration to California accelerated during the early 20th century with the completion of major transcontinental highways like the Lincoln Highway and Route 66.

name: california
sentence: In the period from 1900 to 1965, the population grew from fewer than one million to the greatest in the Union.

name: california
sentence: In 1940, the Census Bureau reported California's population as 6.0% Hispanic, 2.4% Asian, and 89.5% non-Hispanic white.

name: california
sentence: To meet the population's needs, major engineering feats like the California and Los Angeles Aqueducts; the Oroville and Shasta Dams; and the Bay and Golden Gate Bridges were built across the state.

name: california
sentence: The state government also adopted the California Master Plan for Higher Education in 1960 to develop a highly efficient system of public education.

name: california
sentence: Meanwhile, attracted to the mild Mediterranean climate, cheap land, and the state's wide variety of geography, filmmakers established the studio system in Hollywood in the 1920s.

name: california
sentence: California manufactured 8.7 percent of total United States military armaments produced during World War II, ranking third (behind New York and Michigan) among the 48 states.

name: california
sentence: California however easily ranked first in production of military ships during the war (transport, cargo, [merchant ships] such as Liberty ships, Victory ships, and warships) at drydock facilities in San Diego, Los Angeles, and the San Francisco Bay Area.

name: california
sentence: After World War II, California's economy greatly expanded due to strong aerospace and defense industries, whose size decreased following the end of the Cold War.

name: california
sentence: Stanford University and its Dean of Engineering Frederick Terman began encouraging faculty and graduates to stay in California instead of leaving the state, and develop a high-tech region in the area now known as Silicon Valley.

name: california
sentence: As a result of these efforts, California is regarded as a world center of the entertainment and music industries, of technology, engineering, and the aerospace industry, and as the United States center of agricultural production.

name: california
sentence: Just before the Dot Com Bust, California had the fifth-largest economy in the world among nations.

name: california
sentence: Yet since 1991, and starting in the late 1980s in Southern California, California has seen a net loss of domestic migrants in most years.

name: california
sentence: This is often referred to by the media as the California exodus.

name: california
sentence: During the 20th century, two great disasters happened in California.

name: california
sentence: The 1906 San Francisco earthquake and 1928 St. Francis Dam flood remain the deadliest in UShistory.

name: california
sentence: Although air pollution problems have been reduced, health problems associated with pollution have continued.

name: california
sentence: The brown haze known as "smog" has been substantially abated after the passage of federal and state restrictions on automobile exhaust.

name: california
sentence: An energy crisis in 2001 led to rolling blackouts, soaring power rates, and the importation of electricity from neighboring states.

name: california
sentence: Southern California Edison and Pacific Gas and Electric Company came under heavy criticism.

name: california
sentence: Housing prices in urban areas continued to increase; a modest home which in the 1960s cost $25,000 would cost half a million dollars or more in urban areas by 2005.

name: california
sentence: More people commuted longer hours to afford a home in more rural areas while earning larger salaries in the urban areas.

name: california
sentence: Speculators bought houses they never intended to live in, expecting to make a huge profit in a matter of months, then rolling it over by buying more properties.

name: california
sentence: Mortgage companies were compliant, as everyone assumed the prices would keep rising.

name: california
sentence: The bubble burst in 2007-8 as housing prices began to crash and the boom years ended.

name: california
sentence: Hundreds of billions in property values vanished and foreclosures soared as many financial institutions and investors were badly hurt.

name: california
sentence: California is the third-largest state in the United States in area, after Alaska and Texas.

name: california
sentence: California is often geographically bisected into two regions, Southern California, comprising the 10 southernmost counties, and Northern California, comprising the 48 northernmost counties.

name: california
sentence: It is bordered by Oregon to the north, Nevada to the east and northeast, Arizona to the southeast, the Pacific Ocean to the west and it shares an international border with the Mexican state of Baja California to the south (with which it makes up part of The Californias region of North America, alongside Baja California Sur).

name: california
sentence: In the middle of the state lies the California Central Valley, bounded by the Sierra Nevada in the east, the coastal mountain ranges in the west, the Cascade Range to the north and by the Tehachapi Mountains in the south.

name: california
sentence: The Central Valley is California's productive agricultural heartland.

name: california
sentence: Divided in two by the Sacramento-San Joaquin River Delta, the northern portion, the Sacramento Valley serves as the watershed of the Sacramento River, while the southern portion, the San Joaquin Valley is the watershed for the San Joaquin River.

name: california
sentence: Both valleys derive their names from the rivers that flow through them.

name: california
sentence: With dredging, the Sacramento and the San Joaquin Rivers have remained deep enough for several inland cities to be seaports.

name: california
sentence: The Sacramento-San Joaquin River Delta is a critical water supply hub for the state.

name: california
sentence: Water is diverted from the delta and through an extensive network of pumps and canals that traverse nearly the length of the state, to the Central Valley and the State Water Projects and other needs.

name: california
sentence: Water from the Delta provides drinking water for nearly 23 million people, almost two-thirds of the state's population as well as water for farmers on the west side of the San Joaquin Valley.

name: california
sentence: Suisun Bay lies at the confluence of the Sacramento and San Joaquin Rivers.

name: california
sentence: The water is drained by the Carquinez Strait, which flows into San Pablo Bay, a northern extension of San Francisco Bay, which then connects to the Pacific Ocean via the Golden Gate strait.

name: california
sentence: The Channel Islands are located off the Southern coast, while the Farallon Islands lie west of San Francisco.

name: california
sentence: The Sierra Nevada (Spanish for "snowy range") includes the highest peak in the contiguous 48 states, Mount Whitney, at 14,505 feet (4,421 m).

name: california
sentence: The range embraces Yosemite Valley, famous for its glacially carved domes, and Sequoia National Park, home to the giant sequoia trees, the largest living organisms on Earth, and the deep freshwater lake, Lake Tahoe, the largest lake in the state by volume.

name: california
sentence: To the east of the Sierra Nevada are Owens Valley and Mono Lake, an essential migratory bird habitat.

name: california
sentence: In the western part of the state is Clear Lake, the largest freshwater lake by area entirely in California.

name: california
sentence: Although Lake Tahoe is larger, it is divided by the California/Nevada border.

name: california
sentence: The Sierra Nevada falls to Arctic temperatures in winter and has several dozen small glaciers, including Palisade Glacier, the southernmost glacier in the United States.

name: california
sentence: The Tulare Lake was the largest freshwater lake west of the Mississippi River.

name: california
sentence: A remnant of Pleistocene-era Lake Corcoran, Tulare Lake dried up by the early 20th century after its tributary rivers were diverted for agricultural irrigation and municipal water uses.

name: california
sentence: About 45 percent of the state's total surface area is covered by forests, and California's diversity of pine species is unmatched by any other state.

name: california
sentence: California contains more forestland than any other state except Alaska.

name: california
sentence: Many of the trees in the California White Mountains are the oldest in the world; an individual bristlecone pine is over 5,000 years old.

name: california
sentence: In the south is a large inland salt lake, the Salton Sea.

name: california
sentence: The south-central desert is called the Mojave; to the northeast of the Mojave lies Death Valley, which contains the lowest and hottest place in North America, the Badwater Basin at −279 feet (−85 m).

name: california
sentence: The horizontal distance from the bottom of Death Valley to the top of Mount Whitney is less than 90 miles (140 km).

name: california
sentence: Indeed, almost all of southeastern California is arid, hot desert, with routine extreme high temperatures during the summer.

name: california
sentence: The southeastern border of California with Arizona is entirely formed by the Colorado River, from which the southern part of the state gets about half of its water.

name: california
sentence: A majority of California's cities are located in either the San Francisco Bay Area or the Sacramento metropolitan area in Northern California; or the Los Angeles area, the Riverside-San Bernardino-Inland Empire, or the San Diego metropolitan area in Southern California.

name: california
sentence: The Los Angeles Area, the Bay Area, and the San Diego metropolitan area are among several major metropolitan areas along the California coast.

name: california
sentence: As part of the Ring of Fire, California is subject to tsunamis, floods, droughts, Santa Ana winds, wildfires, landslides on steep terrain, and has several volcanoes.

name: california
sentence: It has many earthquakes due to several faults running through the state, the largest being the San Andreas Fault.

name: california
sentence: About 37,000 earthquakes are recorded each year, but most are too small to be felt.

name: california
sentence: Although most of the state has a Mediterranean climate, due to the state's large size the climate ranges from polar to subtropical.

name: california
sentence: The cool California Current offshore often creates summer fog near the coast.

name: california
sentence: Farther inland, there are colder winters and hotter summers.

name: california
sentence: The maritime moderation results in the shoreline summertime temperatures of Los Angeles and San Francisco being the coolest of all major metropolitan areas of the United States and uniquely cool compared to areas on the same latitude in the interior and on the east coast of the North American continent.

name: california
sentence: Even the San Diego shoreline bordering Mexico is cooler in summer than most areas in the contiguous United States.

name: california
sentence: Just a few miles inland, summer temperature extremes are significantly higher, with downtown Los Angeles being several degrees warmer than at the coast.

name: california
sentence: The same microclimate phenomenon is seen in the climate of the Bay Area, where areas sheltered from the sea experience significantly hotter summers than nearby areas closer to the ocean.

name: california
sentence: Northern parts of the state have more rain than the south.

name: california
sentence: California's mountain ranges also influence the climate: some of the rainiest parts of the state are west-facing mountain slopes.

name: california
sentence: Northwestern California has a temperate climate, and the Central Valley has a Mediterranean climate but with greater temperature extremes than the coast.

name: california
sentence: The high mountains, including the Sierra Nevada, have an alpine climate with snow in winter and mild to moderate heat in summer.

name: california
sentence: California's mountains produce rain shadows on the eastern side, creating extensive deserts.

name: california
sentence: The higher elevation deserts of eastern California have hot summers and cold winters, while the low deserts east of the Southern California mountains have hot summers and nearly frostless mild winters.

name: california
sentence: Death Valley, a desert with large expanses below sea level, is considered the hottest location in the world; the highest temperature in the world, 134 °F (56.7 °C), was recorded there on July 10, 1913.

name: california
sentence: The lowest temperature in California was −45 °F (−43 °C) on January 20, 1937 in Boca.

name: california
sentence: The table below lists average temperatures for January and August in a selection of places throughout the state

name: california
sentence: This includes the relatively cool summers of the Humboldt Bay region around Eureka, the extreme heat of Death Valley, and the mountain climate of Mammoth in the Sierra Nevada.

name: california
sentence: California is one of the richest and most diverse parts of the world, and includes some of the most endangered ecological communities.

name: california
sentence: California is part of the Nearctic realm and spans a number of terrestrial ecoregions.

name: california
sentence: California's large number of endemic species includes relict species, which have died out elsewhere, such as the Catalina ironwood (Lyonothamnus floribundus).

name: california
sentence: Many other endemics originated through differentiation or adaptive radiation, whereby multiple species develop from a common ancestor to take advantage of diverse ecological conditions such as the California lilac (Ceanothus).

name: california
sentence: Many California endemics have become endangered, as urbanization, logging, overgrazing, and the introduction of exotic species have encroached on their habitat.

name: california
sentence: California boasts several superlatives in its collection of flora: the largest trees, the tallest trees, and the oldest trees.

name: california
sentence: California's native grasses are perennial plants.

name: california
sentence: After European contact, these were generally replaced by invasive species of European annual grasses; and, in modern times, California's hills turn a characteristic golden-brown in summer.

name: california
sentence: Because California has the greatest diversity of climate and terrain, the state has six life zones which are the lower Sonoran Desert; upper Sonoran (foothill regions and some coastal lands), transition (coastal areas and moist northeastern counties); and the Canadian, Hudsonian, and Arctic Zones, comprising the state's highest elevations.

name: california
sentence: Plant life in the dry climate of the lower Sonoran zone contains a diversity of native cactus, mesquite, and paloverde.

name: california
sentence: The Joshua tree is found in the Mojave Desert.

name: california
sentence: Flowering plants include the dwarf desert poppy and a variety of asters.

name: california
sentence: Fremont cottonwood and valley oak thrive in the Central Valley.

name: california
sentence: The upper Sonoran zone includes the chaparral belt, characterized by forests of small shrubs, stunted trees, and herbaceous plants.

name: california
sentence: Nemophila, mint, Phacelia, Viola, and the California poppy (Eschscholzia californica, the state flower) also flourish in this zone, along with the lupine, more species of which occur here than anywhere else in the world.

name: california
sentence: The transition zone includes most of California's forests with the redwood (Sequoia sempervirens) and the "big tree" or giant sequoia (Sequoiadendron giganteum), among the oldest living things on earth (some are said to have lived at least 4,000 years).

name: california
sentence: Tanbark oak, California laurel, sugar pine, madrona, broad-leaved maple, and Douglas-fir also grow here.

name: california
sentence: Forest floors are covered with swordfern, alumnroot, barrenwort, and trillium, and there are thickets of huckleberry, azalea, elder, and wild currant.

name: california
sentence: Characteristic wild flowers include varieties of mariposa, tulip, and tiger and leopard lilies.

name: california
sentence: The high elevations of the Canadian zone allow the Jeffrey pine, red fir, and lodgepole pine to thrive.

name: california
sentence: Brushy areas are abundant with dwarf manzanita and ceanothus

name: california
sentence: Right below the timberline, in the Hudsonian zone, the whitebark, foxtail, and silver pines grow.

name: california
sentence: At about 10,500 feet (3,200 m), begins the Arctic zone, a treeless region whose flora include a number of wildflowers, including Sierra primrose, yellow columbine, alpine buttercup, and alpine shooting star.

name: california
sentence: Common plants that have been introduced to the state include the eucalyptus, acacia, pepper tree, geranium, and Scotch broom.

name: california
sentence: The species that are federally classified as endangered are the Contra Costa wallflower, Antioch Dunes evening primrose, Solano grass, San Clemente Island larkspur, salt marsh bird's beak, McDonald's rock-cress, and Santa Barbara Island liveforever.

name: california
sentence: As of December 1997, 85 plant species were listed as threatened or endangered.

name: california
sentence: In the deserts of the lower Sonoran zone, the mammals include the jackrabbit, kangaroo rat, squirrel, and opossum.

name: california
sentence: Common birds include the owl, roadrunner, cactus wren, and various species of hawk.

name: california
sentence: The area's reptilian life include the sidewinder viper, desert tortoise, and horned toad.

name: california
sentence: The upper Sonoran zone boasts mammals such as the antelope, brown-footed woodrat, and ring-tailed cat.

name: california
sentence: Birds unique to this zone are the California thrasher, bushtit, and California condor.

name: california
sentence: In the transition zone, there are Colombian black-tailed deer, black bears, gray foxes, cougars, bobcats, and Roosevelt elk.

name: california
sentence: Reptiles such as the garter snakes and rattlesnakes inhabit the zone.

name: california
sentence: In addition, amphibians such as the water puppy and redwood salamander are common too.

name: california
sentence: Birds such as the kingfisher, chickadee, towhee, and hummingbird thrive here as well.

name: california
sentence: The Canadian zone mammals include the mountain weasel, snowshoe hare, and several species of chipmunks.

name: california
sentence: Conspicuous birds include the blue-fronted jay, Sierra chickadee, Sierra hermit thrush, water ouzel, and Townsend's solitaire.

name: california
sentence: As one ascends into the Hudsonian zone, birds become scarcer.

name: california
sentence: While the Sierra rosy finch is the only bird native to the high Arctic region, other bird species such as the hummingbird and Clark's nutcracker.

name: california
sentence: Principal mammals found in this region include the Sierra coney, white-tailed jackrabbit, and the bighorn sheep.

name: california
sentence: As of April 2003, the bighorn sheep was listed as endangered by the US

name: california
sentence: Fish and Wildlife Service.

name: california
sentence: The fauna found throughout several zones are the mule deer, coyote, mountain lion, northern flicker, and several species of hawk and sparrow.

name: california
sentence: Aquatic life in California thrives, from the state's mountain lakes and streams to the rocky Pacific coastline.

name: california
sentence: Numerous trout species are found, among them rainbow, golden, and cutthroat.

name: california
sentence: Migratory species of salmon are common as well.

name: california
sentence: Deep-sea life forms include sea bass, yellowfin tuna, barracuda, and several types of whale.

name: california
sentence: Native to the cliffs of northern California are seals, sea lions, and many types of shorebirds, including migratory species.

name: california
sentence: As of April 2003, 118 California animals were on the federal endangered list; 181 plants were listed as endangered or threatened.

name: california
sentence: Endangered animals include the San Joaquin kitfox, Point Arena mountain beaver, Pacific pocket mouse, salt marsh harvest mouse, Morro Bay kangaroo rat (and five other species of kangaroo rat), Amargosa vole, California least tern, California condor, loggerhead shrike, San Clemente sage sparrow, San Francisco garter snake, five species of salamander, three species of chub, and two species of pupfish.

name: california
sentence: Eleven butterflies are also endangered and two that are threatened are on the federal list.

name: california
sentence: Among threatened animals are the coastal California gnatcatcher, Paiute cutthroat trout, southern sea otter, and northern spotted owl.

name: california
sentence: California has a total of 290,821 acres (1,176.91 km2) of National Wildlife Refuges.

name: california
sentence: As of September 2010, 123 California animals were listed as either endangered or threatened on the federal list.

name: california
sentence: Also, as of the same year, 178 species of California plants were listed either as endangered or threatened on this federal list.

name: california
sentence: The most prominent river system within California is formed by the Sacramento River and San Joaquin River, which are fed mostly by snowmelt from the west slope of the Sierra Nevada, and respectively drain the north and south halves of the Central Valley.

name: california
sentence: The two rivers join in the Sacramento–San Joaquin River Delta, flowing into the Pacific Ocean through San Francisco Bay.

name: california
sentence: Many major tributaries feed into the Sacramento–San Joaquin system, including the Pit River, Feather River and Tuolumne River.

name: california
sentence: The Klamath and Trinity Rivers drain a large area in far northwestern California.

name: california
sentence: The Eel River and Salinas River each drain portions of the California coast, north and south of San Francisco Bay, respectively.

name: california
sentence: The Mojave River is the primary watercourse in the Mojave Desert, and the Santa Ana River drains much of the Transverse Ranges as it bisects Southern California.

name: california
sentence: The Colorado River forms the state's southeast border with Arizona.

name: california
sentence: Most of California's major rivers are dammed as part of two massive water projects: the Central Valley Project, providing water for agriculture in the Central Valley, and the California State Water Project diverting water from northern to southern California.

name: california
sentence: The state's coasts, rivers, and other bodies of water are regulated by the California Coastal Commission.

name: california
sentence: The United States Census Bureau estimates that the population of California was 39,368,078 on July 1, 2020, a 5.67% increase since the 2010 United States Census.

name: california
sentence: The population is projected to reach forty million by 2020 and fifty million by 2060.

name: california
sentence: Between 2000 and 2009, there was a natural increase of 3,090,016 (5,058,440 births minus 2,179,958 deaths).

name: california
sentence: During this time period, international migration produced a net increase of 1,816,633 people while domestic migration produced a net decrease of 1,509,708, resulting in a net in-migration of 306,925 people.

name: california
sentence: The state of California's own statistics show a population of 38,292,687 for January 1, 2009.

name: california
sentence: However, according to the Manhattan Institute for Policy Research, since 1990 almost 3.4 million Californians have moved to other states, with most leaving to Texas, Nevada, and Arizona.

name: california
sentence: Within the Western hemisphere California is the second most populous sub-national administrative entity (behind the state of São Paulo in Brazil) and third most populous sub-national entity of any kind outside Asia (in which wider category it also ranks behind England in the United Kingdom, which has no administrative functions).

name: california
sentence: California's population is greater than that of all but 34 countries of the world.

name: california
sentence: The Greater Los Angeles Area is the 2nd-largest metropolitan area in the United States, after the New York metropolitan area, while Los Angeles, with nearly half the population of New York City, is the second-largest city in the United States.

name: california
sentence: Conversely, San Francisco, with nearly one-quarter the population density of Manhattan, is the most densely populated city in California and one of the most densely populated cities in the United States.

name: california
sentence: Also, Los Angeles County has held the title of most populous United States county for decades, and it alone is more populous than 42 United States states.

name: california
sentence: Including Los Angeles, four of the top 15 most populous cities in the US are in California: Los Angeles (2nd), San Diego (8th), San Jose (10th), and San Francisco (13th).

name: california
sentence: The center of population of California is located in the town of Buttonwillow, Kern County.

name: california
sentence: The state has 482 incorporated cities and towns, of which 460 are cities and 22 are towns.

name: california
sentence: Under California law, the terms "city" and "town" are explicitly interchangeable; the name of an incorporated municipality in the state can either be "City of (Name)" or "Town of (Name)".

name: california
sentence: Sacramento became California's first incorporated city on February 27, 1850.

name: california
sentence: San Jose, San Diego, and Benicia tied for California's second incorporated city, each receiving incorporation on March 27, 1850.

name: california
sentence: Jurupa Valley became the state's most recent and 482nd incorporated municipality on July 1, 2011.

name: california
sentence: The majority of these cities and towns are within one of five metropolitan areas: the Los Angeles Metropolitan Area, the San Francisco Bay Area, the Riverside-San Bernardino Area, the San Diego metropolitan area, or the Sacramento metropolitan area.

name: california
sentence: Starting in the year 2010, for the first time since the California Gold Rush, California-born residents make up the majority of the state's population.

name: california
sentence: Along with the rest of the United States, California's immigration pattern has also shifted over the course of the late 2000s to early 2010s.

name: california
sentence: Immigration from Latin American countries has dropped significantly with most immigrants now coming from Asia.

name: california
sentence: In total for 2011, there were 277,304 immigrants.

name: california
sentence: Fifty-seven percent came from Asian countries versus 22% from Latin American countries.

name: california
sentence: Net immigration from Mexico, previously the most common country of origin for new immigrants, has dropped to zero / less than zero since more Mexican nationals are departing for their home country than immigrating.

name: california
sentence: As a result, it is projected that Hispanic citizens will constitute 49% of the population by 2060, instead of the previously projected 2050, due primarily to domestic births.

name: california
sentence: The state's population of undocumented immigrants has been shrinking in recent years, due to increased enforcement and decreased job opportunities for lower-skilled workers.

name: california
sentence: The number of migrants arrested attempting to cross the Mexican border in the Southwest decreased from a high of 1.1 million in 2005 to 367,000 in 2011.

name: california
sentence: Despite these recent trends, illegal aliens constituted an estimated 7.3 percent of the state's population, the third highest percentage of any state in the country, totaling nearly 2.6 million.

name: california
sentence: In particular, illegal immigrants tended to be concentrated in Los Angeles, Monterey, San Benito, Imperial, and Napa Counties—the latter four of which have significant agricultural industries that depend on manual labor.

name: california
sentence: More than half of illegal immigrants originate from Mexico.

name: california
sentence: The state of California and some California cities, including Los Angeles, Oakland and San Francisco, have adopted sanctuary policies.

name: california
sentence: According to the United States Census Bureau in 2018 the population self-identifies as (alone or in combination):

name: california
sentence: By ethnicity, in 2018 the population was 60.7% non-Hispanic (of any race) and 39.3% Hispanic or Latino (of any race).

name: california
sentence: Hispanics are the largest single ethnic group in California.

name: california
sentence: Non-Hispanic whites constituted 36.8% of the state's population.

name: california
sentence: Californios are the Hispanic residents native to California, who make up the Spanish-speaking community that has existed in California since 1542, of varying Mexican American/Chicano, Criollo Spaniard, and Mestizo origin.

name: california
sentence: As of 2011, 75.1% of California's population younger than age 1 were minorities, meaning they had at least one parent who was not non-Hispanic white (white Hispanics are counted as minorities).

name: california
sentence: In terms of total numbers, California has the largest population of White Americans in the United States, an estimated 22,200,000 residents.

name: california
sentence: The state has the 5th largest population of African Americans in the United States, an estimated 2,250,000 residents.

name: california
sentence: California's Asian American population is estimated at 4.4 million, constituting a third of the nation's total.

name: california
sentence: California's Native American population of 285,000 is the most of any state.

name: california
sentence: According to estimates from 2011, California has the largest minority population in the United States by numbers, making up 60% of the state population.

name: california
sentence: Over the past 25 years, the population of non-Hispanic whites has declined, while Hispanic and Asian populations have grown.

name: california
sentence: Between 1970 and 2011, non-Hispanic whites declined from 80% of the state's population to 40%, while Hispanics grew from 32% in 2000 to 38% in 2011.

name: california
sentence: It is currently projected that Hispanics will rise to 49% of the population by 2060, primarily due to domestic births rather than immigration.

name: california
sentence: With the decline of immigration from Latin America, Asian Americans now constitute the fastest growing racial/ethnic group in California; this growth is primarily driven by immigration from China, India and the Philippines, respectively.

name: california
sentence: English serves as California's de jure and de facto official language.

name: california
sentence: In 2010, the Modern Language Association of America estimated that 57.02% (19,429,309) of California residents age 5 and older spoke only English at home, while 42.98% spoke another language at home.

name: california
sentence: According to the 2007 American Community Survey, 73% of people who speak a language other than English at home are able to speak English "well" or "very well," while 9.8% of them could not speak English at all.

name: california
sentence: Like most US states (32 out of 50), California law enshrines English as its official language, and has done so since the passage of Proposition 63 by California voters.

name: california
sentence: Various government agencies do, and are often required to, furnish documents in the various languages needed to reach their intended audiences.

name: california
sentence: In total, 16 languages other than English were spoken as primary languages at home by more than 100,000 persons, more than any other state in the nation.

name: california
sentence: New York State, in second place, had nine languages other than English spoken by more than 100,000 persons.

name: california
sentence: The most common language spoken besides English was Spanish, spoken by 28.46% (9,696,638) of the population.

name: california
sentence: With Asia contributing most of California's new immigrants, California had the highest concentration nationwide of Vietnamese and Chinese speakers, the second highest concentration of Korean, and the third highest concentration of Tagalog speakers.

name: california
sentence: California has historically been one of the most linguistically diverse areas in the world, with more than 70 indigenous languages derived from 64 root languages in six language families.

name: california
sentence: A survey conducted between 2007 and 2009 identified 23 different indigenous languages among California farmworkers.

name: california
sentence: All of California's indigenous languages are endangered, although there are now efforts toward language revitalization.

name: california
sentence: As a result of the state's increasing diversity and migration from other areas across the country and around the globe, linguists began noticing a noteworthy set of emerging characteristics of spoken American English in California since the late 20th century.

name: california
sentence: This variety, known as California English, has a vowel shift and several other phonological processes that are different from varieties of AmericanEnglish used in other regions of the United States.

name: california
sentence: The culture of California is a Western culture and most clearly has its modern roots in the culture of the United States, but also, historically, many Hispanic Californio and Mexican influences.

name: california
sentence: As a border and coastal state, Californian culture has been greatly influenced by several large immigrant populations, especially those from Latin America and Asia.

name: california
sentence: California has long been a subject of interest in the public mind and has often been promoted by its boosters as a kind of paradise.

name: california
sentence: In the early 20th century, fueled by the efforts of state and local boosters, many Americans saw the Golden State as an ideal resort destination, sunny and dry all year round with easy access to the ocean and mountains.

name: california
sentence: In the 1960s, popular music groups such as The Beach Boys promoted the image of Californians as laid-back, tanned beach-goers.

name: california
sentence: The California Gold Rush of the 1850s is still seen as a symbol of California's economic style, which tends to generate technology, social, entertainment, and economic fads and booms and related busts.

name: california
sentence: Hollywood and the rest of the Los Angeles area is a major global center for entertainment, with the US film industry's "Big Five" major film studios (Columbia, Disney, Paramount, Universal, and Warner Bros.) being based in or around the area.

name: california
sentence: The four major American television broadcast networks (ABC, CBS, Fox and NBC) all have production facilities and offices in the state.

name: california
sentence: All four, plus the two major Spanish-language networks (Telemundo and Univision) each have at least two owned-and-operated TV stations in California, one in Los Angeles and one in the San Francisco Bay Area.

name: california
sentence: The San Francisco Bay Area is home to several prominent internet media and social media companies, including three of the "Big Five" technology companies (Apple, Facebook, and Google) as well as other services such as Netflix, Pandora Radio, Twitter, Yahoo!, and YouTube.

name: california
sentence: One of the oldest radio stations in the United States still in existence, KCBS (AM) in the Bay Area, was founded in 1909.

name: california
sentence: Universal Music Group, one of the "Big Four" record labels, is based in Santa Monica.

name: california
sentence: California is also the birthplace of several international music genres, including the Bakersfield sound, Bay Area thrash metal, g-funk, nu metal, stoner rock, surf music, West Coast hip hop, and West Coast jazz.

name: california
sentence: The largest religious denominations by number of adherents as a percentage of California's population in 2014 were the Catholic Church with 28 percent, Evangelical Protestants with 20 percent, and Mainline Protestants with 10 percent.

name: california
sentence: Together, all kinds of Protestants accounted for 32 percent.

name: california
sentence: Those unaffiliated with any religion represented 27 percent of the population.

name: california
sentence: The breakdown of other religions is 1% Muslim, 2% Hindu and 2% Buddhist.

name: california
sentence: This is a change from 2008, when the population identified their religion with the Catholic Church with 31 percent; Evangelical Protestants with 18 percent; and Mainline Protestants with 14 percent.

name: california
sentence: In 2008, those unaffiliated with any religion represented 21 percent of the population.

name: california
sentence: The breakdown of other religions in 2008 was 0.5% Muslim, 1% Hindu and 2% Buddhist.

name: california
sentence: The American Jewish Year Book placed the total Jewish population of California at about 1,194,190 in 2006.

name: california
sentence: According to the Association of Religion Data Archives (ARDA) the largest denominations by adherents in 2010 were the Roman Catholic Church with 10,233,334; The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints with 763,818; and the Southern Baptist Convention with 489,953.

name: california
sentence: The first priests to come to California were Roman Catholic missionaries from Spain.

name: california
sentence: Roman Catholics founded 21 missions along the California coast, as well as the cities of Los Angeles and San Francisco.

name: california
sentence: California continues to have a large Roman Catholic population due to the large numbers of Mexicans and Central Americans living within its borders.

name: california
sentence: California has twelve dioceses and two archdioceses, the Archdiocese of Los Angeles and the Archdiocese of San Francisco, the former being the largest archdiocese in the United States.

name: california
sentence: A Pew Research Center survey revealed that California is somewhat less religious than the rest of the states: 62 percent of Californians say they are "absolutely certain" of their belief in God, while in the nation 71 percent say so.

name: california
sentence: The survey also revealed 48 percent of Californians say religion is "very important", compared to 56 percent nationally.

name: california
sentence: California has nineteen major professional sports league franchises, far more than any other state.

name: california
sentence: The San Francisco Bay Area has six major league teams spread in its three major cities: San Francisco, San Jose, and Oakland, while the Greater Los Angeles Area is home to ten major league franchises.

name: california
sentence: San Diego and Sacramento each have one major league team.

name: california
sentence: The NFL Super Bowl has been hosted in California 11 times at four different stadiums: Los Angeles Memorial Coliseum, the Rose Bowl, Stanford Stadium, and San Diego's Qualcomm Stadium.

name: california
sentence: A twelfth, Super Bowl 50, was held at Levi's Stadium in Santa Clara on February 7, 2016.

name: california
sentence: California has long had many respected collegiate sports programs.

name: california
sentence: California is home to the oldest college bowl game, the annual Rose Bowl, among others.

name: california
sentence: California is the only US state to have hosted both the Summer and Winter Olympics.

name: california
sentence: The 1932 and 1984 summer games were held in Los Angeles.

name: california
sentence: Squaw Valley Ski Resort in the Lake Tahoe region hosted the 1960 Winter Olympics.

name: california
sentence: Los Angeles will host the 2028 Summer Olympics, marking the fourth time that California will have hosted the Olympic Games.

name: california
sentence: Multiple games during the 1994 FIFA World Cup took place in California, with the Rose Bowl hosting eight matches (including the final), while Stanford Stadium hosted six matches.

name: california
sentence: Public secondary education consists of high schools that teach elective courses in trades, languages, and liberal arts with tracks for gifted, college-bound and industrial arts students.

name: california
sentence: California's public educational system is supported by a unique constitutional amendment that requires a minimum annual funding level for grades K–12 and community colleges that grow with the economy and student enrollment figures.

name: california
sentence: In 2016, California's K–12 public school per-pupil spending was ranked 22nd in the nation ($11,500 per student vs. $11,800 for the US average).

name: california
sentence: For 2012, California's K–12 public schools ranked 48th in the number of employees per student, at 0.102 (the US average was 0.137), while paying the 7th most per employee, $49,000 (the US average was $39,000).

name: california
sentence: A 2007 study concluded that California's public school system was "broken" in that it suffered from over-regulation.

name: california
sentence: California's public postsecondary education offers three separate systems:

name: california
sentence: California is also home to such notable private universities as Stanford University, the University of Southern California, the California Institute of Technology, and the Claremont Colleges.

name: california
sentence: California has hundreds of other private colleges and universities, including many religious and special-purpose institutions.

name: california
sentence: California has twinning arrangements with the region of Catalonia in Spainand with the Province of Alberta in Canada.

name: california
sentence: California's economy ranks among the largest in the world.

name: california
sentence: As of 2019, the gross state product (GSP) was $3.2 trillion ($80,600 per capita), the largest in the United States.

name: california
sentence: California is responsible for one seventh of the nation's gross domestic product (GDP).

name: california
sentence: As of 2018, California's nominal GDP is larger than all but four countries (the United States, China, Japan, and Germany).

name: california
sentence: In terms of Purchasing power parity (PPP), it is larger than all but eight countries (the United States, China, India, Japan, Germany, Russia, Brazil and Indonesia).

name: california
sentence: California's economy is larger than Africa and Australia and is almost as large as South America.

name: california
sentence: The five largest sectors of employment in California are trade, transportation, and utilities; government; professional and business services; education and health services; and leisure and hospitality.

name: california
sentence: In output, the five largest sectors are financial services, followed by trade, transportation, and utilities; education and health services; government; and manufacturing.

name: california
sentence: As of May 2020, California has an unemployment rate of 16.3%.

name: california
sentence: California's economy is dependent on trade and international related commerce accounts for about one-quarter of the state's economy.

name: california
sentence: In 2008, California exported $144 billion worth of goods, up from $134 billion in 2007 and $127 billion in 2006.Computers and electronic products are California's top export, accounting for 42 percent of all the state's exports in 2008.

name: california
sentence: Agriculture is an important sector in California's economy.

name: california
sentence: Farming-related sales more than quadrupled over the past three decades, from $7.3 billion in 1974 to nearly $31 billion in 2004.

name: california
sentence: This increase has occurred despite a 15 percent decline in acreage devoted to farming during the period, and water supply suffering from chronic instability.

name: california
sentence: Factors contributing to the growth in sales-per-acre include more intensive use of active farmlands and technological improvements in crop production.

name: california
sentence: In 2008, California's 81,500 farms and ranches generated $36.2 billion products revenue.

name: california
sentence: In 2011, that number grew to $43.5 billion products revenue.

name: california
sentence: The Agriculture sector accounts for two percent of the state's GDP and employs around three percent of its total workforce.

name: california
sentence: According to the USDA in 2011, the three largest California agricultural products by value were milk and cream, shelled almonds, and grapes.

name: california
sentence: Per capita GDP in 2007 was $38,956, ranking eleventh in the nation.

name: california
sentence: Per capita income varies widely by geographic region and profession.

name: california
sentence: The Central Valley is the most impoverished, with migrant farm workers making less than minimum wage.

name: california
sentence: According to a 2005 report by the Congressional Research Service, the San Joaquin Valley was characterized as one of the most economically depressed regions in the United States, on par with the region of Appalachia.

name: california
sentence: Using the supplemental poverty measure, California has a poverty rate of 23.5%, the highest of any state in the country.

name: california
sentence: However, using the official measure the poverty rate was only 13.3% as of 2017.

name: california
sentence: Many coastal cities include some of the wealthiest per-capita areas in the United States.

name: california
sentence: The high-technology sectors in Northern California, specifically Silicon Valley, in Santa Clara and San Mateo counties, have emerged from the economic downturn caused by the dot-com bust.

name: california
sentence: In 2019, there were 1,042,027 millionaire households in the state, more than any other state in the nation.

name: california
sentence: In 2010, California residents were ranked first among the states with the best average credit score of 754.

name: california
sentence: State spending increased from $56 billion in 1998 to $127 billion in 2011.

name: california
sentence: California, with 12% of the United States population, has one-third of the nation's welfare recipients.

name: california
sentence: California has the third highest per capita spending on welfare among the states, as well as the highest spending on welfare at $6.67 billion.

name: california
sentence: In January 2011, California's total debt was at least $265 billion.

name: california
sentence: On June 27, 2013, Governor Jerry Brown signed a balanced budget (no deficit) for the state, its first in decades; however the state's debt remains at $132 billion.

name: california
