sentence: With the passage of Proposition 30 in 2012 and Proposition 55 in 2016, California now levies a 13.3% maximum marginal income tax rate with ten tax brackets, ranging from 1% at the bottom tax bracket of $0 annual individual income to 13.3% for annual individual income over $1,000,000 (though the top brackets are only temporary until Proposition 55 expires at the end of 2030).

name: california
sentence: While Proposition 30 also enacted a minimum state sales tax of 7.5%, this sales tax increase was not extended by Proposition 55 and reverted to a previous minimum state sales tax rate of 7.25% in 2017.

name: california
sentence: Local governments can and do levy additional sales taxes in addition to this minimum rate.

name: california
sentence: All real property is taxable annually

name: california
sentence: Property tax increases are capped at 2% annually or the rate of inflation (whichever is lower), per Proposition 13.

name: california
sentence: Because it is the most populous state in the United States, California is one of the country's largest users of energy.

name: california
sentence: However because of its high energy rates, conservation mandates, mild weather in the largest population centers and strong environmental movement, its per capita energy use is one of the smallest of any state in the United States.

name: california
sentence: Due to the high electricity demand, California imports more electricity than any other state, primarily hydroelectric power from states in the Pacific Northwest (via Path 15 and Path 66) and coal- and natural gas-fired production from the desert Southwest via Path 46.

name: california
sentence: As a result of the state's strong environmental movement, California has some of the most aggressive renewable energy goals in the United States, with a target for California to obtain a third of its electricity from renewables by 2020.

name: california
sentence: Currently, several solar power plants such as the Solar Energy Generating Systems facility are located in the Mojave Desert.

name: california
sentence: California's wind farms include Altamont Pass, San Gorgonio Pass, and Tehachapi Pass.

name: california
sentence: The Tehachapi area is also where the Tehachapi Energy Storage Project is located.

name: california
sentence: Several dams across the state provide hydro-electric power.

name: california
sentence: It would be possible to convert the total supply to 100% renewable energy, including heating, cooling and mobility, by 2050.

name: california
sentence: The state's crude oil and natural gas deposits are located in the Central Valley and along the coast, including the large Midway-Sunset Oil Field.

name: california
sentence: Natural gas-fired power plants typically account for more than one-half of state electricity generation.

name: california
sentence: California is also home to two major nuclear power plants: Diablo Canyon and San Onofre, the latter having been shut down in 2013.

name: california
sentence: More than 1,700 tons of radioactive waste are stored at San Onofre, which sits in an area where there is a record of past tsunamis.

name: california
sentence: Voters banned the approval of new nuclear power plants since the late 1970s because of concerns over radioactive waste disposal.

name: california
sentence: In addition, several cities such as Oakland, Berkeley and Davis have declared themselves as nuclear-free zones.

name: california
sentence: California's vast terrain is connected by an extensive system of controlled-access highways ('freeways'), limited-access roads ('expressways'), and highways.

name: california
sentence: California is known for its car culture, giving California's cities a reputation for severe traffic congestion.

name: california
sentence: Construction and maintenance of state roads and statewide transportation planning are primarily the responsibility of the California Department of Transportation, nicknamed "Caltrans".

name: california
sentence: The rapidly growing population of the state is straining all of its transportation networks, and California has some of the worst roads in the United States.

name: california
sentence: The Reason Foundation's 19th Annual Report on the Performance of State Highway Systems ranked California's highways the third-worst of any state, with Alaska second, and Rhode Island first.

name: california
sentence: The state has been a pioneer in road construction.

name: california
sentence: One of the state's more visible landmarks, the Golden Gate Bridge, was the longest suspension bridge main span in the world at 4,200 feet (1,300 m) between 1937 (when it opened) and 1964.

name: california
sentence: With its orange paint and panoramic views of the bay, this highway bridge is a popular tourist attraction and also accommodates pedestrians and bicyclists.

name: california
sentence: The San Francisco–Oakland Bay Bridge (often abbreviated the "Bay Bridge"), completed in 1936, transports about 280,000 vehicles per day on two-decks.

name: california
sentence: Its two sections meet at Yerba Buena Island through the world's largest diameter transportation bore tunnel, at 76 feet (23 m) wide by 58 feet (18 m) high.

name: california
sentence: The Arroyo Seco Parkway, connecting Los Angeles and Pasadena, opened in 1940 as the first freeway in the Western United States.

name: california
sentence: It was later extended south to the Four Level Interchange in downtown Los Angeles, regarded as the first stack interchange ever built.

name: california
sentence: Los Angeles International Airport (LAX), the 4th busiest airport in the world in 2018, and San Francisco International Airport (SFO), the 25th busiest airport in the world in 2018, are major hubs for trans-Pacific and transcontinental traffic.

name: california
sentence: There are about a dozen important commercial airports and many more general aviation airports throughout the state.

name: california
sentence: California also has several important seaports.

name: california
sentence: The giant seaport complex formed by the Port of Los Angeles and the Port of Long Beach in Southern California is the largest in the country and responsible for handling about a fourth of all container cargo traffic in the United States.

name: california
sentence: The Port of Oakland, fourth largest in the nation, also handles trade entering from the Pacific Rim to the rest of the country.

name: california
sentence: The Port of Stockton is the farthest inland port on the west coast of the United States.

name: california
sentence: The California Highway Patrol is the largest statewide police agency in the United States in employment with more than 10,000 employees.

name: california
sentence: They are responsible for providing any police-sanctioned service to anyone on California's state-maintained highways and on state property.

name: california
sentence: The California Department of Motor Vehicles is by far the largest in North America.

name: california
sentence: By the end of 2009, the California DMV had 26,555,006 driver's licenses and ID cards on file.

name: california
sentence: In 2010, there were 1.17 million new vehicle registrations in force.

name: california
sentence: Inter-city rail travel is provided by Amtrak California; the three routes, the Capitol Corridor, Pacific Surfliner, and San Joaquin, are funded by Caltrans.

name: california
sentence: These services are the busiest intercity rail lines in the United States outside the Northeast Corridor and ridership is continuing to set records.

name: california
sentence: The routes are becoming increasingly popular over flying, especially on the LAX-SFO route.

name: california
sentence: Integrated subway and light rail networks are found in Los Angeles (Metro Rail) and San Francisco (MUNI Metro).

name: california
sentence: Light rail systems are also found in San Jose (VTA), San Diego (San Diego Trolley), Sacramento (RT Light Rail), and Northern San Diego County (Sprinter).

name: california
sentence: Furthermore, commuter rail networks serve the San Francisco Bay Area (ACE, BART, Caltrain, SMART), Greater Los Angeles (Metrolink), and San Diego County (Coaster).

name: california
sentence: The California High-Speed Rail Authority was created in 1996 by the state to implement an extensive 800-mile (1,300 km) rail system.

name: california
sentence: Construction was approved by the voters during the November 2008 general election, with the first phase of construction estimated to cost $64.2 billion.

name: california
sentence: Nearly all counties operate bus lines, and many cities operate their own city bus lines as well.

name: california
sentence: Intercity bus travel is provided by Greyhound, Megabus, and Amtrak Thruway Motorcoach.

name: california
sentence: California's interconnected water system is the world's largest, managing over 40,000,000 acre feet (49 km3) of water per year, centered on six main systems of aqueducts and infrastructure projects.

name: california
sentence: Water use and conservation in California is a politically divisive issue, as the state experiences periodic droughts and has to balance the demands of its large agricultural and urban sectors, especially in the arid southern portion of the state.

name: california
sentence: The state's widespread redistribution of water also invites the frequent scorn of environmentalists.

name: california
sentence: The California Water Wars, a conflict between Los Angeles and the Owens Valley over water rights, is one of the most well-known examples of the struggle to secure adequate water supplies.

name: california
sentence: Former California Governor Arnold Schwarzenegger said: "We've been in crisis for quite some time because we're now 38 million people and not anymore 18 million people like we were in the late 60s.

name: california
sentence: So it developed into a battle between environmentalists and farmers and between the south and the north and between rural and urban.

name: california
sentence: And everyone has been fighting for the last four decades about water."

name: california
sentence: The capital of California is located within Sacramento.The state is organized into three branches of government—the executive branch consisting of the governor and the other independently elected constitutional officers

name: california
sentence: The state also allows ballot propositions: direct participation of the electorate by initiative, referendum, recall, and ratification.

name: california
sentence: Before the passage of California Proposition 14 (2010), California allowed each political party to choose whether to have a closed primary or a primary where only party members and independents vote.

name: california
sentence: After June 8, 2010, when Proposition 14 was approved, excepting only the United States president and county central committee offices, all candidates in the primary elections are listed on the ballot with their preferred party affiliation, but they are not the official nominee of that party.

name: california
sentence: At the primary election, the two candidates with the top votes will advance to the general election regardless of party affiliation.

name: california
sentence: If at a special primary election, one candidate receives more than 50% of all the votes cast, they are elected to fill the vacancy and no special general election will be held.

name: california
sentence: The California executive branch consists of the governor and seven other elected constitutional officers: lieutenant governor, attorney general, secretary of state, state controller, state treasurer, insurance commissioner, and state superintendent of public instruction.

name: california
sentence: They serve four-year terms and may be re-elected only once.

name: california
sentence: The California State Legislature consists of a 40-member Senatorte and 80-member Assembly.

name: california
sentence: Senatortors serve four-year terms and Assembly members two.

name: california
sentence: Members of the Assembly are subject to term limits of three terms, and members of the Senatorte are subject to term limits of two terms.

name: california
sentence: California's legal system is explicitly based upon English common law (as is the case with all other states except Louisiana) but carries a few features from Spanish civil law, such as community property.

name: california
sentence: California's prison population grew from 25,000 in 1980 to over 170,000 in 2007.

name: california
sentence: Capital punishment is a legal form of punishment and the state has the largest "Death Row" population in the country (though Oklahoma and Texas are far more active in carrying out executions).

name: california
sentence: California's judiciary system is the largest in the United States with a total of 1,600 judges (the federal system has only about 840).

name: california
sentence: At the apex is the seven-member Supreme Court of California, while the California Courts of Appeal serve as the primary appellate courts and the California Superior Courts serve as the primary trial courts.

name: california
sentence: Justices of the Supreme Court and Courts of Appeal are appointed by the governor, but are subject to retention by the electorate every 12 years.

name: california
sentence: The administration of the state's court system is controlled by the Judicial Council, composed of the chief justice of the California Supreme Court, 14 judicial officers, four representatives from the State Bar of California, and one member from each house of the state legislature.

name: california
sentence: California is divided into 58 counties.

name: california
sentence: Per Article 11, Section 1, of the Constitution of California, they are the legal subdivisions of the state.

name: california
sentence: The county government provides countywide services such as law enforcement, jails, elections and voter registration, vital records, property assessment and records, tax collection, public health, health care, social services, libraries, flood control, fire protection, animal control, agricultural regulations, building inspections, ambulance services, and education departments in charge of maintaining statewide standards.

name: california
sentence: In addition, the county serves as the local government for all unincorporated areas.

name: california
sentence: Each county is governed by an elected board of supervisors.

name: california
sentence: Incorporated cities and towns in California are either charter or general-law municipalities.

name: california
sentence: General-law municipalities owe their existence to state law and are consequently governed by it

name: california
sentence: Municipalities incorporated in the 19th century tend to be charter municipalities.

name: california
sentence: All ten of the state's most populous cities are charter cities.

name: california
sentence: Most small cities have a council–manager form of government, where the elected city council appoints a city manager to supervise the operations of the city.

name: california
sentence: Some larger cities have a directly-elected mayor who oversees the city government.

name: california
sentence: In many council-manager cities, the city council selects one of its members as a mayor, sometimes rotating through the council membership—but this type of mayoral position is primarily ceremonial.

name: california
sentence: The Government of San Francisco is the only consolidated city-county in California, where both the city and county governments have been merged into one unified jurisdiction.

name: california
sentence: About 1,102 school districts, independent of cities and counties, handle California's public education.

name: california
sentence: California school districts may be organized as elementary districts, high school districts, unified school districts combining elementary and high school grades, or community college districts.

name: california
sentence: There are about 3,400 special districts in California.

name: california
sentence: A special district, defined by California Government Code § 16271(d) as "any agency of the state for the local performance of governmental or proprietary functions within limited boundaries", provides a limited range of services within a defined geographic area.

name: california
sentence: The geographic area of a special district can spread across multiple cities or counties, or could consist of only a portion of one.

name: california
sentence: Most of California's special districts are single-purpose districts, and provide one service.

name: california
sentence: The state of California sends 53 members to the House of Representatives, the nation's largest congressional state delegation.

name: california
sentence: Consequently California also has the largest number of electoral votes in national presidential elections, with 55.

name: california
sentence: The current speaker of the House of Representatives is the representative of California's 12th district, Nancy Pelosi; Kevin McCarthy, representing the state's 23rd district, is the House Minority Leader.

name: california
sentence: California is represented by US senators Dianne Feinstein, a native and former mayor of San Francisco, and Alex Padilla, a native and former secretary of state of California.

name: california
sentence: Former US senator Kamala Harris, a native, former district attorney from San Francisco, former attorney general of California, resigned on January 18, 2021 to assume her role as the current Vice President-elect of the United States.

name: california
sentence: In the 1992 US Senatorte election, California became the first state to elect a Senatorte delegation entirely composed of women, due to the victories of Feinstein and Barbara Boxer.

name: california
sentence: Set to follow the Vice President-Elect, Gov.

name: california
sentence: Newsom appointed Secretary of State Alex Padilla to finish the rest of Harris's term which ends in 2022, Padilla has vowed to run for the full term in that election cycle.

name: california
sentence: Padilla was sworn-in on January 20, 2021, the same day as the Inauguration of President-Elect Joe Biden as well as Harris.

name: california
sentence: In California, as of 2009, the US Department of Defense had a total of 117,806 active duty servicemembers of which 88,370 were Sailors or Marines, 18,339 were Airmen, and 11,097 were Soldiers, with 61,365 Department of Defense civilian employees.

name: california
sentence: Additionally, there were a total of 57,792 Reservists and Guardsman in California.

name: california
sentence: In 2010, Los Angeles County was the largest origin of military recruits in the United States by county, with 1,437 individuals enlisting in the military.

name: california
sentence: However, as of 2002, Californians were relatively under-represented in the military as a proportion to its population.

name: california
sentence: In 2000, California, had 2,569,340 veterans of United States military service: 504,010 served in World War II, 301,034 in the Korean War, 754,682 during the Vietnam War, and 278,003 during 1990–2000 (including the Persian Gulf War).

name: california
sentence: As of 2010, there were 1,942,775 veterans living in California, of which 1,457,875 served during a period of armed conflict, and just over four thousand served before World War II (the largest population of this group of any state).

name: california
sentence: California's military forces consist of the Army and Air National Guard, the naval and state military reserve (militia), and the California Cadet Corps.

name: california
sentence: On August 5, 1950, a nuclear-capable United States Air Force Boeing B-29 Superfortress bomber carrying a nuclear bomb crashed shortly after takeoff from Fairfield-Suisun Air Force Base.

name: california
sentence: Brigadier General Robert F. Travis, command pilot of the bomber, was among the dead.

name: california
sentence: California has an idiosyncratic political culture compared to the rest of the country, and is sometimes regarded as a trendsetter.

name: california
sentence: In socio-cultural mores and national politics, Californians are perceived as more liberal than other Americans, especially those who live in the inland states.

name: california
sentence: As of the 2016 presidential election, California was the second most Democratic state behind Hawaii.

name: california
sentence: According to the Cook Political Report, California contains five of the 15 most Democratic congressional districts in the United States.

name: california
sentence: Among the political idiosyncrasies and trendsetting, California was the second state to recall their state governor, the second state to legalize abortion, and the only state to ban marriage for gay couples twice by vote (including Proposition 8 in 2008).

name: california
sentence: Voters also passed Proposition 71 in 2004 to fund stem cell research, and Proposition 14 in 2010 to completely change the state's primary election process.

name: california
sentence: California has also experienced disputes over water rights; and a tax revolt, culminating with the passage of Proposition 13 in 1978, limiting state property taxes.

name: california
sentence: The state's trend towards the Democratic Party and away from the Republican Party can be seen in state elections.

name: california
sentence: From 1899 to 1939, California had Republican governors.

name: california
sentence: Since 1990, California has generally elected Democratic candidates to federal, state and local offices, including current Governor Gavin Newsom; however, the state has elected Republican Governors, though many of its Republican Governors, such as Arnold Schwarzenegger, tend to be considered moderate Republicans and more centrist than the national party.

name: california
sentence: Several political movements have advocated for Californian independence.

name: california
sentence: The California National Party and the California Freedom Coalition both advocate for Californian independence along the lines of progressivism and civic nationalism.

name: california
sentence: The Yes California movement attempted to organize an independence referendum via ballot initiative for 2019, which was then postponed.

name: california
sentence: The Democrats also now hold a supermajority in both houses of the state legislature.

name: california
sentence: There are 60 Democrats and 20 Republicans in the Assembly

name: california
sentence: The trend towards the Democratic Party is most obvious in presidential elections.

name: california
sentence: From 1952 through 1988, California was a Republican leaning state, with the party carrying the state's electoral votes in nine of ten elections, with 1964 as the exception.

name: california
sentence: Southern California Republicans Richard Nixon and Ronald Reagan were both elected twice as the 37th and 40th US Presidents, respectively.

name: california
sentence: However, Democrats have won all of California's electoral votes for the last eight elections, starting in 1992.

name: california
sentence: In the United States House, the Democrats held a 34–19 edge in the CA delegation of the 110th United States Congress in 2007.

name: california
sentence: As the result of gerrymandering, the districts in California were usually dominated by one or the other party, and few districts were considered competitive.

name: california
sentence: In 2008, Californians passed Proposition 20 to empower a 14-member independent citizen commission to redraw districts for both local politicians and Congress.

name: california
sentence: After the 2012 elections, when the new system took effect, Democrats gained four seats and held a 38–15 majority in the delegation.

name: california
sentence: Following the 2018 midterm House elections, Democrats won 46 out of 53 congressional house seats in California, leaving Republicans with seven.

name: california
sentence: In general, Democratic strength is centered in the populous coastal regions of the Los Angeles metropolitan area and the San Francisco Bay Area.

name: california
sentence: Republican strength is still greatest in eastern parts of the state.

name: california
sentence: Orange County had remained largely Republican until the 2016 and 2018 elections, in which a majority of the county's votes were cast for Democratic candidates.

name: california
sentence: One study ranked Berkeley, Oakland, Inglewood and San Francisco in the top 20 most liberal American cities; and Bakersfield, Orange, Escondido, Garden Grove, and Simi Valley in the top 20 most conservative cities.

name: california
sentence: In October 2012, out of the 23,802,577 people eligible to vote, 18,245,970 people were registered to vote.

name: california
sentence: Of the people registered, the three largest registered groups were Democrats (7,966,422), Republicans (5,356,608), and Decline to State (3,820,545).

name: california
sentence: Los Angeles County had the largest number of registered Democrats (2,430,612) and Republicans (1,037,031) of any county in the state.

name: colorado
sentence: Colorado ( (listen), other variants) is a state in the western United States encompassing most of the southern Rocky Mountains as well as the northeastern portion of the Colorado Plateau and the western edge of the Great Plains.

name: colorado
sentence: It is the 8th most extensive and 21st most populous US state.

name: colorado
sentence: The estimated population of Colorado is 5,758,736 as of 2019, an increase of 14.5% since the 2010 United States Census.

name: colorado
sentence: The region has been inhabited by Native Americans for more than 13,000 years, with the Lindenmeier Site containing artifacts dating from approximately 9200 BCE to 1000 BCE; the eastern edge of the Rocky Mountains was a major migration route for early peoples who spread throughout the Americas.

name: colorado
sentence: The state was named for the Colorado River, which early Spanish explorers named the Río Colorado ("Red River") for the ruddy silt the river carried from the mountains.

name: colorado
sentence: The Territory of Colorado was organized on February 28, 1861, and on August 1, 1876, US President Ulysses S. Grant signed Proclamation 230 admitting Colorado to the Union as the 38th state.

name: colorado
sentence: Colorado is nicknamed the "Centennial State" because it became a state one century after the signing of the United States Declaration of Independence.

name: colorado
sentence: Colorado is bordered by Wyoming to the north, Nebraska to the northeast, Kansas to the east, Oklahoma to the southeast, New Mexico to the south, Utah to the west, and touches Arizona to the southwest at the Four Corners.

name: colorado
sentence: Colorado is noted for its vivid landscape of mountains, forests, high plains, mesas, canyons, plateaus, rivers and desert lands.

name: colorado
sentence: Colorado is one of the Mountain States and is a part of the western and southwestern United States.

name: colorado
sentence: Denver is the capital and most populous city in Colorado.

name: colorado
sentence: Residents of the state are known as Coloradans, although the antiquated term "Coloradoan" is occasionally used.

name: colorado
sentence: Colorado is a comparatively wealthy state, ranking 8th in household income in 2016, and 11th in per capita income in 2010.

name: colorado
sentence: Major parts of the economy include government and defense, mining, agriculture, tourism, and increasingly other kinds of manufacturing.

name: colorado
sentence: With increasing temperatures and decreasing water availability, Colorado's agriculture, forestry and tourism economies are expected to be heavily affected by climate change.

name: colorado
sentence: Colorado is notable for its diverse geography, which includes alpine mountains, high plains, deserts with huge sand dunes, and deep canyons.

name: colorado
sentence: In 1861, the United States Congress defined the boundaries of the new Territory of Colorado exclusively by lines of latitude and longitude, stretching from 37°N to 41°N latitude, and from 102°02′48″W to 109°02′48″W longitude (25°W to 32°W from the Washington Meridian).

name: colorado
sentence: After 159 years of government surveys, the borders of Colorado are now officially defined by 697 boundary markers and 697 straight boundary lines.

name: colorado
sentence: Colorado, Wyoming, and Utah are the only states that have their borders defined solely by straight boundary lines with no natural features.

name: colorado
sentence: The southwest corner of Colorado is the Four Corners Monument at 36°59′56″N, 109°2′43″W.

name: colorado
sentence: The Four Corners Monument, located at the place where Colorado, New Mexico, Arizona, and Utah meet, is the only place in the United States where four states meet.

name: colorado
sentence: To the west of the Great Plains of Colorado rises the eastern slope of the Rocky Mountains.

name: colorado
sentence: Notable peaks of the Rocky Mountains include Longs Peak, Mount Evans, Pikes Peak, and the Spanish Peaks near Walsenburg, in southern Colorado.

name: colorado
sentence: This area drains to the east and the southeast, ultimately either via the Mississippi River or the Rio Grande into the Gulf of Mexico.

name: colorado
sentence: The Rocky Mountains within Colorado contain 53 true peaks with a total of 58 that are 14,000 feet (4,267 m) or higher in elevation above sea level, known as fourteeners.

name: colorado
sentence: These mountains are largely covered with trees such as conifers and aspens up to the tree line, at an elevation of about 12,000 feet (3,658 m) in southern Colorado to about 10,500 feet (3,200 m) in northern Colorado.

name: colorado
sentence: Above this tree line only alpine vegetation grows.

name: colorado
sentence: Only small parts of the Colorado Rockies are snow-covered year-round.

name: colorado
sentence: Much of the alpine snow melts by mid-August with the exception of a few snow-capped peaks and a few small glaciers.

name: colorado
sentence: The Colorado Mineral Belt, stretching from the San Juan Mountains in the southwest to Boulder and Central City on the front range, contains most of the historic gold- and silver-mining districts of Colorado.

name: colorado
sentence: Mount Elbert is the highest summit of the Rocky Mountains.

name: colorado
sentence: The 30 highest major summits of the Rocky Mountains of North America all lie within the state.

name: colorado
sentence: The summit of Mount Elbert at 14,440 feet (4,401.2 m) elevation in Lake County is the highest point in Colorado and the Rocky Mountains of North America.

name: colorado
sentence: Colorado is the only US state that lies entirely above 1,000 meters elevation.

name: colorado
sentence: The point where the Arikaree River flows out of Yuma County, Colorado, and into Cheyenne County, Kansas, is the lowest point in Colorado at 3,317 feet (1,011 m) elevation.

name: colorado
sentence: This point, which is the highest low elevation point of any state, is higher than the high elevation points of 18 states and the District of Columbia.

name: colorado
sentence: A little less than half of Colorado is flat and rolling land.

name: colorado
sentence: East of the Rocky Mountains are the Colorado Eastern Plains of the High Plains, the section of the Great Plains within Nebraska at elevations ranging from roughly 3,350 to 7,500 feet (1,020 to 2,290 m).

name: colorado
sentence: The Colorado plains are mostly prairies but also include deciduous forests, buttes, and canyons.

name: colorado
sentence: Precipitation averages 15 to 25 inches (380 to 640 mm) annually.

name: colorado
sentence: Eastern Colorado is presently mainly farmland and rangeland, along with small farming villages and towns.

name: colorado
sentence: Corn, wheat, hay, soybeans, and oats are all typical crops.

name: colorado
sentence: Most villages and towns in this region boast both a water tower and a grain elevator.

name: colorado
sentence: Irrigation water is available from both surface and subterranean sources.

name: colorado
sentence: Surface water sources include the South Platte, the Arkansas River, and a few other streams.

name: colorado
sentence: Subterranean water is generally accessed through artesian wells.

name: colorado
sentence: Heavy usage of these wells for irrigation purposes caused underground water reserves to decline in the region.

name: colorado
sentence: Eastern Colorado also hosts a considerable amount and range of livestock, such as cattle ranches and hog farms.

name: colorado
sentence: Roughly 70% of Colorado's population resides along the eastern edge of the Rocky Mountains in the Front Range Urban Corridor between Cheyenne, Wyoming, and Pueblo, Colorado.

name: colorado
sentence: This region is partially protected from prevailing storms that blow in from the Pacific Ocean region by the high Rockies in the middle of Colorado.

name: colorado
sentence: The "Front Range" includes Denver, Boulder, Fort Collins, Loveland, Castle Rock, Colorado Springs, Pueblo, Greeley, and other townships and municipalities in between.

name: colorado
sentence: On the other side of the Rockies, the significant population centers in Western Colorado (which is not considered the "Front Range") are the cities of Grand Junction, Durango, and Montrose.

name: colorado
sentence: The Continental Divide of the Americas extends along the crest of the Rocky Mountains.

name: colorado
sentence: The area of Colorado to the west of the Continental Divide is called the Western Slope of Colorado.

name: colorado
sentence: West of the Continental Divide, water flows to the southwest via the Colorado River and the Green River into the Gulf of California.

name: colorado
sentence: Within the interior of the Rocky Mountains are several large parks which are high broad basins.

name: colorado
sentence: In the north, on the east side of the Continental Divide is the North Park of Colorado.

name: colorado
sentence: The North Park is drained by the North Platte River, which flows north into Wyoming and Nebraska.

name: colorado
sentence: Just to the south of North Park, but on the western side of the Continental Divide, is the Middle Park of Colorado, which is drained by the Colorado River.

name: colorado
sentence: The South Park of Colorado is the region of the headwaters of the South Platte River.

name: colorado
sentence: In southmost Colorado is the large San Luis Valley, where the headwaters of the Rio Grande are located.

name: colorado
sentence: The valley sits between the Sangre De Cristo Mountains and San Juan Mountains, and consists of large desert lands that eventually run into the mountains.

name: colorado
sentence: The Rio Grande drains due south into New Mexico, Mexico, and Texas.

name: colorado
sentence: Across the Sangre de Cristo Range to the east of the San Luis Valley lies the Wet Mountain Valley.

name: colorado
sentence: These basins, particularly the San Luis Valley, lie along the Rio Grande Rift, a major geological formation of the Rocky Mountains, and its branches.

name: colorado
sentence: The Western Slope area of Colorado includes the western face of the Rocky Mountains and all of the state to the western border.

name: colorado
sentence: This area includes several terrains and climates from alpine mountains to arid deserts.

name: colorado
sentence: The Western Slope includes many ski resort towns in the Rocky Mountains and towns west of the mountains.

name: colorado
sentence: It is less populous than the Front Range but includes a large number of national parks and monuments.

name: colorado
sentence: From west to east, the land of Colorado consists of desert lands, desert plateaus, alpine mountains, National Forests, relatively flat grasslands, scattered forests, buttes, and canyons in the western edge of the Great Plains.

name: colorado
sentence: The famous Pikes Peak is located just west of Colorado Springs.

name: colorado
sentence: Its isolated peak is visible from nearly the Kansas border on clear days, and also far to the north and the south.

name: colorado
sentence: The northwestern corner of Colorado is a sparsely populated region, and it contains part of the noted Dinosaur National Monument, which not only is a paleontological area, but is also a scenic area of rocky hills, canyons, arid desert, and streambeds.

name: colorado
sentence: Here, the Green River briefly crosses over into Colorado.

name: colorado
sentence: Desert lands in Colorado are located in and around areas such as the Pueblo, Canon City, Florence, Great Sand Dunes National Park and Preserve, San Luis Valley, Cortez, Canyon of the Ancients National Monument, Hovenweep National Monument, Ute Mountain, Delta, Grand Junction, Colorado National Monument, and other areas surrounding the Uncompahgre Plateau and Uncompahgre National Forest.

name: colorado
sentence: The Western Slope of Colorado is drained by the Colorado River and its tributaries (primarily the Gunnison River, Green River, and the San Juan River), or by evaporation in its arid areas.

name: colorado
sentence: The Colorado River flows through Glenwood Canyon, and then through an arid valley made up of desert from Rifle to Parachute, through the desert canyon of De Beque Canyon, and into the arid desert of Grand Valley, where the city of Grand Junction is located.

name: colorado
sentence: Also prominent in or near the southern portion of the Western Slope are the Grand Mesa, which lies to the southeast of Grand Junction; the high San Juan Mountains, a rugged mountain range; and to the west of the San Juan Mountains, the Colorado Plateau, a high arid region that borders Southern Utah.

name: colorado
sentence: Grand Junction, Colorado is the largest city on the Western Slope.

name: colorado
sentence: Grand Junction and Durango are the only major centers of television broadcasting west of the Continental Divide in Colorado, though most mountain resort communities publish daily newspapers.

name: colorado
sentence: Grand Junction is located along Interstate 70, the only major highway in Western Colorado.

name: colorado
sentence: Grand Junction is also along the major railroad of the Western Slope, the Union Pacific.

name: colorado
sentence: This railroad also provides the tracks for Amtrak's California Zephyr passenger train, which crosses the Rocky Mountains between Denver and Grand Junction via a route on which there are no continuous highways.

name: colorado
sentence: The Western Slope includes multiple notable destinations in the Colorado Rocky Mountains, including Glenwood Springs, with its resort hot springs, and the ski resorts of Aspen, Breckenridge, Vail, Crested Butte, Steamboat Springs, and Telluride.

name: colorado
sentence: Higher education in and near the Western Slope can be found at Colorado Mesa University in Grand Junction, Western Colorado University in Gunnison, Fort Lewis College in Durango, and Colorado Mountain College in Glenwood Springs and Steamboat Springs.

name: colorado
sentence: The Four Corners Monument in the southwest corner of Colorado marks the common boundary of Colorado, New Mexico, Arizona, and Utah; the only such place in the United States.

name: colorado
sentence: The climate of Colorado is more complex than states outside of the Mountain States region.

name: colorado
sentence: Unlike most other states, southern Colorado is not always warmer than northern Colorado.

name: colorado
sentence: Most of Colorado is made up of mountains, foothills, high plains, and desert lands.

name: colorado
sentence: Mountains and surrounding valleys greatly affect local climate.

name: colorado
sentence: As a general rule, with an increase in elevation comes a decrease in temperature and an increase in precipitation.

name: colorado
sentence: Northeast, east, and southeast Colorado are mostly the high plains, while Northern Colorado is a mix of high plains, foothills, and mountains.

name: colorado
sentence: Northwest and west Colorado are predominantly mountainous, with some desert lands mixed in.

name: colorado
sentence: Southwest and southern Colorado are a complex mixture of desert and mountain areas.

name: colorado
sentence: The climate of the Eastern Plains is semiarid (Köppen climate classification: BSk) with low humidity and moderate precipitation, usually from 15 to 25 inches (380 to 640 millimeters) annually.

name: colorado
sentence: The area is known for its abundant sunshine and cool, clear nights, which give this area a great average diurnal temperature range.

name: colorado
sentence: The difference between the highs of the days and the lows of the nights can be considerable as warmth dissipates to space during clear nights, the heat radiation not being trapped by clouds.

name: colorado
sentence: The Front Range urban corridor, where most of the population of Colorado resides, lies in a pronounced precipitation shadow as a result of being on the lee side of the Rocky Mountains.

name: colorado
sentence: In summer, this area can have many days above 95 °F (35 °C) and often 100 °F (38 °C).

name: colorado
sentence: On the plains, the winter lows usually range from 25 to −10 °F (−4 to −23 °C).

name: colorado
sentence: About 75% of the precipitation falls within the growing season, from April to September, but this area is very prone to droughts.

name: colorado
sentence: Most of the precipitation comes from thunderstorms, which can be severe, and from major snowstorms that occur in the winter and early spring.

name: colorado
sentence: Otherwise, winters tend to be mostly dry and cold.

name: colorado
sentence: In much of the region, March is the snowiest month.

name: colorado
sentence: April and May are normally the rainiest months, while April is the wettest month overall.

name: colorado
sentence: The Front Range cities closer to the mountains tend to be warmer in the winter due to Chinook winds which warm the area, sometimes bringing temperatures of 70 °F (21 °C) or higher in the winter.

name: colorado
sentence: The average July temperature is 55 °F (13 °C) in the morning and 90 °F (32 °C) in the afternoon.

name: colorado
sentence: The average January temperature is 18 °F (−8 °C) in the morning and 48 °F (9 °C) in the afternoon, although variation between consecutive days can be 40 °F (20 °C).

name: colorado
sentence: Just west of the plains and into the foothills, there are a wide variety of climate types.

name: colorado
sentence: Locations merely a few miles apart can experience entirely different weather depending on the topography.

name: colorado
sentence: Most valleys have a semi-arid climate not unlike the eastern plains, which transitions to an alpine climate at the highest elevations.

name: colorado
sentence: Microclimates also exist in local areas that run nearly the entire spectrum of climates, including subtropical highland (Cfb/Cwb), humid subtropical (Cfa), humid continental (Dfa/Dfb), Mediterranean (Csa/Csb) and subarctic (Dfc).

name: colorado
sentence: Extreme weather changes are common in Colorado, although a significant portion of the extreme weather occurs in the least populated areas of the state.

name: colorado
sentence: Thunderstorms are common east of the Continental Divide in the spring and summer, yet are usually brief.

name: colorado
sentence: Hail is a common sight in the mountains east of the Divide and across the eastern Plains, especially the northeast part of the state.

name: colorado
sentence: Hail is the most commonly reported warm-season severe weather hazard, and occasionally causes human injuries, as well as significant property damage.

name: colorado
sentence: The eastern Plains are subject to some of the biggest hail storms in North America.

name: colorado
sentence: Notable examples are the severe hailstorms that hit Denver on July 11, 1990 and May 8, 2017, the latter being the costliest ever in the state.

name: colorado
sentence: The Eastern Plains are part of the extreme western portion of Tornado Alley; some damaging tornadoes in the Eastern Plains include the 1990 Limon F3 tornado and the 2008 Windsor EF3 tornado, which devastated the small town.

name: colorado
sentence: Portions of the eastern Plains see especially frequent tornadoes, both those spawned from mesocyclones in supercell thunderstorms and from less intense landspouts, such as within the Denver convergence vorticity zone (DCVZ).

name: colorado
sentence: The Plains are also susceptible to occasional floods and particularly severe flash floods, which are caused both by thunderstorms and by the rapid melting of snow in the mountains during warm weather.

name: colorado
sentence: Notable examples include the 1965 Denver Flood, the Big Thompson River flooding of 1976 and the 2013 Colorado floods.

name: colorado
sentence: Hot weather is common during summers in Denver.

name: colorado
sentence: The city's record in 1901 for the number of consecutive days above 90 °F (32 °C) was broken during the summer of 2008.

name: colorado
sentence: The new record of 24 consecutive days surpassed the previous record by almost a week.

name: colorado
sentence: Much of Colorado is very dry, with the state averaging only 17 inches (430 millimeters) of precipitation per year statewide.

name: colorado
sentence: The state rarely experiences a time when some portion is not in some degree of drought.

name: colorado
sentence: The lack of precipitation contributes to the severity of wildfires in the state, such as the Hayman Fire of 2002.

name: colorado
sentence: Other notable fires include the Fourmile Canyon Fire of 2010, the Waldo Canyon Fire and High Park Fire of June 2012, and the Black Forest Fire of June 2013.

name: colorado
sentence: Even these fires were exceeded in severity by the Pine Gulch Fire, Cameron Peak Fire and East Troublesome Fire in 2020, all being the three largest fires in Colorado history (see 2020 Colorado wildfires).

name: colorado
sentence: However, some of the mountainous regions of Colorado receive a huge amount of moisture from winter snowfalls.

name: colorado
sentence: The spring melts of these snows often cause great waterflows in the Yampa River, the Colorado River, the Rio Grande, the Arkansas River, the North Platte River, and the South Platte River.

name: colorado
sentence: Water flowing out of the Colorado Rocky Mountains is a very significant source of water for the farms, towns, and cities of the southwest states of New Mexico, Arizona, Utah, and Nevada, as well as the Midwest, such as Nebraska and Kansas, and the southern states of Oklahoma and Texas.

name: colorado
sentence: A significant amount of water is also diverted for use in California; occasionally (formerly naturally and consistently), the flow of water reaches northern Mexico.

name: colorado
sentence: The highest official ambient air temperature ever recorded in Colorado was 115 °F (46.1 °C) on July 20, 2019, at John Martin Dam.

name: colorado
sentence: The lowest official air temperature was −61 °F (−51.7 °C) on February 1, 1985, at Maybell.

name: colorado
sentence: Despite its mountainous terrain, Colorado is relatively quiet seismically.

name: colorado
sentence: The US National Earthquake Information Center is located in Golden.

name: colorado
sentence: On August 22, 2011, a 5.3 magnitude earthquake occurred 9 miles (14 km) west-southwest of the city of Trinidad.

name: colorado
sentence: There were no casualties and only a small amount of damage was reported.

name: colorado
sentence: It was the second-largest earthquake in Colorado's history.

name: colorado
sentence: A magnitude 5.7 earthquake was recorded in 1973.

name: colorado
sentence: In early morning hours of August 24, 2018, four minor earthquakes rattled the state of Colorado ranging from magnitude 2.9 to 4.3.

name: colorado
sentence: Colorado has recorded 525 earthquakes since 1973, a majority of which range 2 to 3.5 on the Richter scale.

name: colorado
sentence: The region that is today the state of Colorado has been inhabited by Native Americans for more than 13,000 years.

name: colorado
sentence: The Lindenmeier Site in Larimer County contains artifacts dating from approximately 11200 BC to 3000 BC.

name: colorado
sentence: The eastern edge of the Rocky Mountains was a major migration route that was important to the spread of early peoples throughout the Americas.

name: colorado
sentence: The Ancient Pueblo peoples lived in the valleys and mesas of the Colorado Plateau.

name: colorado
sentence: The Ute Nation inhabited the mountain valleys of the Southern Rocky Mountains and the Western Rocky Mountains, even as far east as the Front Range of present day.

name: colorado
sentence: The Apache and the Comanche also inhabited Eastern and Southeastern parts of the state.

name: colorado
sentence: At times, the Arapaho Nation and the Cheyenne Nation moved west to hunt across the High Plains.

name: colorado
sentence: The Spanish Empire claimed Colorado as part of its New Mexico province prior to US involvement in the region.

name: colorado
sentence: The US acquired a territorial claim to the eastern Rocky Mountains with the Louisiana Purchase from France in 1803.

name: colorado
sentence: This US claim conflicted with the claim by Spain to the upper Arkansas River Basin as the exclusive trading zone of its colony of Santa Fé de Nuevo México.

name: colorado
sentence: In 1806, Zebulon Pike led a US Army reconnaissance expedition into the disputed region.

name: colorado
sentence: Colonel Pike and his men were arrested by Spanish cavalrymen in the San Luis Valley the following February, taken to Chihuahua, and expelled from Mexico the following July.

name: colorado
sentence: The US relinquished its claim to all land south and west of the Arkansas River and south of 42nd parallel north and west of the 100th meridian west as part of its purchase of Florida from Spain with the Adams-Onís Treaty of 1819.

name: colorado
sentence: The treaty took effect February 22, 1821.

name: colorado
sentence: Having settled its border with Spain, the US admitted the southeastern portion of the Territory of Missouri to the Union as the state of Missouri on August 10, 1821.

name: colorado
sentence: The remainder of Missouri Territory, including what would become northeastern Colorado, became unorganized territory, and remained so for 33 years over the question of slavery.

name: colorado
sentence: After 11 years of war, Spain finally recognized the independence of Mexico with the Treaty of Córdoba signed on August 24, 1821.

name: colorado
sentence: Mexico eventually ratified the Adams-Onís Treaty in 1831.

name: colorado
sentence: The Texian Revolt of 1835–36 fomented a dispute between the US and Mexico which eventually erupted into the Mexican–American War in 1846.

name: colorado
sentence: Mexico surrendered its northern territory to the US with the Treaty of Guadalupe Hidalgo at the conclusion of the war in 1848.

name: colorado
sentence: Most American settlers traveling overland west to the Oregon Country, the new goldfields of California, or the new Mormon settlements of the State of Deseret in the Salt Lake Valley, avoided the rugged Southern Rocky Mountains, and instead followed the North Platte River and Sweetwater River to South Pass (Wyoming), the lowest crossing of the Continental Divide between the Southern Rocky Mountains and the Central Rocky Mountains.

name: colorado
sentence: In 1849, the Mormons of the Salt Lake Valley organized the extralegal State of Deseret, claiming the entire Great Basin and all lands drained by the rivers Green, Grand, and Colorado.

name: colorado
sentence: The federal government of the US flatly refused to recognize the new Mormon government, because it was theocratic and sanctioned plural marriage.

name: colorado
sentence: Instead, the Compromise of 1850 divided the Mexican Cession and the northwestern claims of Texas into a new state and two new territories, the state of California, the Territory of New Mexico, and the Territory of Utah.

name: colorado
sentence: On April 9, 1851, Mexican American settlers from the area of Taos settled the village of San Luis, then in the New Mexico Territory, later to become Colorado's first permanent Euro-American settlement.

name: colorado
sentence: In 1854, Senatortor Stephen A. Douglas persuaded the US Congress to divide the unorganized territory east of the Continental Divide into two new organized territories, the Territory of Kansas and the Territory of Nebraska, and an unorganized southern region known as the Indian territory.

name: colorado
sentence: Each new territory was to decide the fate of slavery within its boundaries, but this compromise merely served to fuel animosity between free soil and pro-slavery factions.

name: colorado
sentence: The gold seekers organized the Provisional Government of the Territory of Jefferson on August 24, 1859, but this new territory failed to secure approval from the Congress of the United States embroiled in the debate over slavery.

name: colorado
sentence: The election of Abraham Lincoln for the President of the United States on November 6, 1860, led to the secession of nine southern slave states and the threat of civil war among the states.

name: colorado
sentence: Seeking to augment the political power of the Union states, the Republican Party-dominated Congress quickly admitted the eastern portion of the Territory of Kansas into the Union as the free State of Kansas on January 29, 1861, leaving the western portion of the Kansas Territory, and its gold-mining areas, as unorganized territory.

name: colorado
sentence: Thirty days later on February 28, 1861, outgoing US President James Buchanan signed an Act of Congress organizing the free Territory of Colorado.

name: colorado
sentence: The original boundaries of Colorado remain unchanged except for government survey amendments.

name: colorado
sentence: The name Colorado was chosen because it was commonly believed that the Colorado River originated in the territory.

name: colorado
sentence: In 1776, Spanish priest Silvestre Vélez de Escalante recorded that Native Americans in the area knew the river as el Rio Colorado for the red-brown silt that the river carried from the mountains.

name: colorado
sentence: In 1859, a US Army topographic expedition led by Captain John Macomb located the confluence of the Green River with the Grand River in what is now Canyonlands National Park in Utah.

name: colorado
sentence: The Macomb party designated the confluence as the source of the Colorado River.

name: colorado
sentence: On April 12, 1861, South Carolina artillery opened fire on Fort Sumter to start the American Civil War.

name: colorado
sentence: While many gold seekers held sympathies for the Confederacy, the vast majority remained fiercely loyal to the Union cause.

name: colorado
sentence: In 1862, a force of Texas cavalry invaded the Territory of New Mexico and captured Santa Fe on March 10.

name: colorado
sentence: The object of this Western Campaign was to seize or disrupt the gold fields of Colorado and California and to seize ports on the Pacific Ocean for the Confederacy.

name: colorado
sentence: A hastily organized force of Colorado volunteers force-marched from Denver City, Colorado Territory, to Glorieta Pass, New Mexico Territory, in an attempt to block the Texans.

name: colorado
sentence: On March 28, the Coloradans and local New Mexico volunteers stopped the Texans at the Battle of Glorieta Pass, destroyed their cannon and supply wagons, and dispersed 500 of their horses and mules.

name: colorado
sentence: The Texans were forced to retreat to Santa Fe.

name: colorado
sentence: Having lost the supplies for their campaign and finding little support in New Mexico, the Texans abandoned Santa Fe and returned to San Antonio in defeat.

name: colorado
sentence: The Confederacy made no further attempts to seize the Southwestern United States.

name: colorado
sentence: In 1864, Territorial Governor John Evans appointed the Reverend John Chivington as Colonel of the Colorado Volunteers with orders to protect white settlers from Cheyenne and Arapaho warriors who were accused of stealing cattle.

name: colorado
sentence: Colonel Chivington ordered his men to attack a band of Cheyenne and Arapaho encamped along Sand Creek.

name: colorado
sentence: Chivington reported that his troops killed more than 500 warriors.

name: colorado
sentence: The militia returned to Denver City in triumph, but several officers reported that the so-called battle was a blatant massacre of Indians at peace, that most of the dead were women and children, and that bodies of the dead had been hideously mutilated and desecrated.

name: colorado
sentence: Three US Army inquiries condemned the action, and incoming President Andrew Johnson asked Governor Evans for his resignation, but none of the perpetrators was ever punished.

name: colorado
sentence: This event is now known as the Sand Creek massacre.

name: colorado
sentence: In the midst and aftermath of Civil War, many discouraged prospectors returned to their homes, but a few stayed and developed mines, mills, farms, ranches, roads, and towns in Colorado Territory.

name: colorado
sentence: On September 14, 1864, James Huff discovered silver near Argentine Pass, the first of many silver strikes.

name: colorado
sentence: In 1867, the Union Pacific Railroad laid its tracks west to Weir, now Julesburg, in the northeast corner of the Territory.

name: colorado
sentence: The Union Pacific linked up with the Central Pacific Railroad at Promontory Summit, Utah, on May 10, 1869, to form the First Transcontinental Railroad.

name: colorado
sentence: The Denver Pacific Railway reached Denver in June the following year, and the Kansas Pacific arrived two months later to forge the second line across the continent.

name: colorado
sentence: In 1872, rich veins of silver were discovered in the San Juan Mountains on the Ute Indian reservation in southwestern Colorado.

name: colorado
sentence: The Ute people were removed from the San Juans the following year.

name: colorado
sentence: The United States Congress passed an enabling act on March 3, 1875, specifying the requirements for the Territory of Colorado to become a state.

name: colorado
sentence: On August 1, 1876 (four weeks after the Centennial of the United States), US President Ulysses S. Grant signed a proclamation admitting Colorado to the Union as the 38th state and earning it the moniker "Centennial State".

name: colorado
sentence: The discovery of a major silver lode near Leadville in 1878 triggered the Colorado Silver Boom.

name: colorado
sentence: The Sherman Silver Purchase Act of 1890 invigorated silver mining, and Colorado's last, but greatest, gold strike at Cripple Creek a few months later lured a new generation of gold seekers.

name: colorado
sentence: Colorado women were granted the right to vote on November 7, 1893, making Colorado the second state to grant universal suffrage and the first one by a popular vote (of Colorado men).

name: colorado
sentence: The repeal of the Sherman Silver Purchase Act in 1893 led to a staggering collapse of the mining and agricultural economy of Colorado, but the state slowly and steadily recovered.

name: colorado
sentence: Between the 1880s and 1930s, Denver's floriculture industry developed into a major industry in Colorado.

name: colorado
sentence: This period became known locally as the Carnation Gold Rush.

name: colorado
sentence: Poor labor conditions and discontent among miners resulted in several major clashes between strikers and the Colorado National Guard, including the 1903-1904 Western Federation of Miners Strike and Colorado Coalfield War, the latter of which included the Ludlow massacre that killed a dozen women and children.

name: colorado
sentence: Both the 1913-1914 Coalfield War and the Denver streetcar strike of 1920 resulted in federal troops intervening to end the violence.

name: colorado
sentence: In 1927, the Columbine Mine massacre resulted in six dead strikers following a confrontation with Colorado Rangers.

name: colorado
sentence: More than 5,000 Colorado miners—many immigrants—are estimated to have died in accidents since records began to be formally collected following an accident in Crested Butte that killed 59 in 1884.

name: colorado
sentence: Colorado became the first western state to host a major political convention when the Democratic Party met in Denver in 1908.

name: colorado
sentence: By the US Census in 1930, the population of Colorado first exceeded one million residents.

name: colorado
sentence: Colorado suffered greatly through the Great Depression and the Dust Bowl of the 1930s, but a major wave of immigration following World War II boosted Colorado's fortune.

name: colorado
sentence: Tourism became a mainstay of the state economy, and high technology became an important economic engine.

name: colorado
sentence: The United States Census Bureau estimated that the population of Colorado exceeded five million in 2009.

name: colorado
sentence: Three warships of the US Navy have been named the USColorado.

name: colorado
sentence: The first USColorado was named for the Colorado River and served in the Civil War and later the Asiatic Squadron, where it was attacked during the 1871 Korean Expedition.

name: colorado
sentence: The later two ships were named in honor of the state, including the battleship USColorado which served in World War II in the Pacific beginning in 1941.

name: colorado
sentence: At the time of the attack on Pearl Harbor, this USColorado was located at the naval base in San Diego, Calif. and hence went unscathed.

name: colorado
sentence: On September 11, 1957, a plutonium fire occurred at the Rocky Flats Plant, which resulted in the significant plutonium contamination of surrounding populated areas.

name: colorado
sentence: Since extirpation by trapping and poisoning of the gray wolf (Canis lupus) from Colorado in the 1930s, a wolf pack recolonized Moffat County, Colorado in northwestern Colorado in 2019.

name: colorado
sentence: The United States Census Bureau estimates that the population of Colorado was 5,758,736 as of 2019, a 14.51% increase since the 2010 United States Census.

name: colorado
sentence: Colorado's most populous city and capital, is Denver.

name: colorado
sentence: The Greater Denver Metropolitan Area, with an estimated 2017 population of 3,515,374, is considered the largest metropolitan area within the state and is found within the larger Front Range Urban Corridor, home to about five million.

name: colorado
sentence: The largest increases are expected in the Front Range Urban Corridor, especially in the Denver metropolitan area.

name: colorado
sentence: The state's fastest-growing counties are Douglas and Weld.

name: colorado
sentence: The center of population of Colorado is located just north of the village of Critchell in Jefferson County.

name: colorado
sentence: According to the 2010 United States Census, Colorado had a population of 5,029,196.

name: colorado
sentence: Racial composition of the state's population was:

name: colorado
sentence: People of Hispanic and Latino American (of any race made) heritage made up 20.7% of the population.

name: colorado
sentence: According to the 2000 Census, the largest ancestry groups in Colorado are German (22%) including of Swiss and Austrian nationalities, Mexican (18%), Irish (12%), and English (12%).

name: colorado
sentence: Persons reporting German ancestry are especially numerous in the Front Range, the Rockies (west-central counties), and Eastern parts/High Plains.

name: colorado
sentence: Colorado has a high proportion of Hispanic, mostly Mexican-American, citizens in Metropolitan Denver, Colorado Springs, as well as the smaller cities of Greeley and Pueblo, and elsewhere.

name: colorado
sentence: Southern, Southwestern, and Southeastern Colorado has a large number of Hispanos, the descendants of the early settlers of colonial Spanish origin.

name: colorado
sentence: In 1940, the Census Bureau reported Colorado's population as 8.2% Hispanic and 90.3% non-Hispanic white.

name: colorado
sentence: The Hispanic population of Colorado has continued to grow quickly over the past decades.

name: colorado
sentence: By 2019, Hispanics made up 22% of Colorado's population, and Non-Hispanic Whites made up 70%.

name: colorado
sentence: Spoken English in Colorado has many Spanish idioms.

name: colorado
sentence: Colorado also has some large African-American communities located in Denver, in the neighborhoods of Montbello, Five Points, Whittier, and many other East Denver areas.

name: colorado
sentence: The state has sizable numbers of Asian-Americans of Mongolian, Chinese, Filipino, Korean, Southeast Asian, and Japanese descent.

name: colorado
sentence: The highest population of Asian Americans can be found on the south and southeast side of Denver, as well as some on Denver's southwest side.

name: colorado
sentence: The Denver metropolitan area is considered more liberal and diverse than much of the state when it comes to political issues and environmental concerns.

name: colorado
sentence: There were a total of 70,331 births in Colorado in 2006.

name: colorado
sentence: (Birth rate of 14.6 per thousand.)

name: colorado
sentence: In 2007, non-Hispanic whites were involved in 59.1% of all the births.

name: colorado
sentence: Some 14.06% of those births involved a non-Hispanic white person and someone of a different race, most often with a couple including one Hispanic.

name: colorado
sentence: A birth where at least one Hispanic person was involved counted for 43% of the births in Colorado.

name: colorado
sentence: As of the 2010 Census, Colorado has the seventh highest percentage of Hispanics (20.7%) in the US behind New Mexico (46.3%), California (37.6%), Texas (37.6%), Arizona (29.6%), Nevada (26.5%), and Florida (22.5%).

name: colorado
sentence: Per the 2000 census, the Hispanic population is estimated to be 918,899 or approximately 20% of the state total population.

name: colorado
sentence: Colorado has the 5th-largest population of Mexican-Americans, behind California, Texas, Arizona, and Illinois.

name: colorado
sentence: In percentages, Colorado has the 6th-highest percentage of Mexican-Americans, behind New Mexico, California, Texas, Arizona, and Nevada.

name: colorado
sentence: In 2011, 46% of Colorado's population younger than the age of one were minorities, meaning that they had at least one parent who was not non-Hispanic white.

name: colorado
sentence: Note: Births in table don't add up, because Hispanics are counted both by their ethnicity and by their race, giving a higher overall number.

name: colorado
sentence: In 2017, Colorado recorded the second-lowest fertility rate in the United States outside of New England, after Oregon, at 1.63 children per woman.

name: colorado
sentence: Significant, contributing factors to the decline in pregnancies were the Title X Family Planning Program and an Intrauterine device grant from Warren Buffett's family.

name: colorado
sentence: Spanish is the second-most spoken language in Colorado, after English.

name: colorado
sentence: There is one Native Coloradan language still spoken in Colorado, Colorado River Numic (Ute).

name: colorado
sentence: Major religious affiliations of the people of Colorado are 64% Christian, of whom there are 44% Protestant, 16% Roman Catholic, 3% Mormon, and 1% Eastern Orthodox.

name: colorado
sentence: Other religious breakdowns are 1% Jewish, 1% Muslim, 1% Buddhist and 4% other.

name: colorado
sentence: The religiously unaffiliated make up 29% of the population.

name: colorado
sentence: The largest denominations by number of adherents in 2010 were the Catholic Church with 811,630; non-denominational Evangelical Protestants with 229,981; and The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints with 151,433.

name: colorado
sentence: According to several studies, Coloradans have the lowest rates of obesity of any state in the US.

name: colorado
sentence: As of 2018, 24% of the population was considered medically obese, and while the lowest in the nation, the percentage had increased from 17% in 2004.

name: colorado
sentence: According to a report in the Journal of the American Medical Association, residents of Colorado had a 2014 life expectancy of 80.21 years, the longest of any US state.

name: colorado
sentence: A number of film productions have shot on location in Colorado, especially prominent Westerns like True Grit, The Searchers, and Butch Cassidy and the Sundance Kid.

name: colorado
sentence: A number of historic military forts, railways with trains still operating, mining ghost towns have been utilized and transformed for historical accuracy in well known films.

name: colorado
sentence: There are also a number of scenic highways and mountain passes that helped to feature the open road in films such as Vanishing Point, Bingo and Starman.

name: colorado
sentence: Some Colorado landmarks have been featured in films, such as The Stanley Hotel in Dumb and Dumber and The Shining and the Sculptured House in Sleeper.

name: colorado
sentence: In 2015, Furious 7 was to film driving sequences on Pikes Peak Highway in Colorado.

name: colorado
sentence: The TV series Good Luck Charlie was being filmed in Denver, Colorado.

name: colorado
sentence: The Colorado Office of Film and Television has noted that more than 400 films have been shot in Colorado.

name: colorado
sentence: There are also a number of established film festivals in Colorado, including Aspen Shortsfest, Boulder International Film Festival, Castle Rock Film Festival, Denver Film Festival, Festivus Film Festival (ended in 2013), Mile High Horror Film Festival, Moondance International Film Festival, Mountainfilm in Telluride, Rocky Mountain Women's Film Festival, and Telluride Film Festival.

name: colorado
sentence: Colorado is known for its Southwest and Rocky Mountain cuisine.

name: colorado
sentence: Mexican restaurants are prominent throughout the state.

name: colorado
sentence: Boulder, Colorado was named America's Foodiest Town 2010 by Bon Appétit.

name: colorado
sentence: Boulder, and Colorado in general, is home to a number of national food and beverage companies, top-tier restaurants and farmers' markets.

name: colorado
sentence: Boulder, Colorado also has more Master Sommeliers per capita than any other city, including San Francisco and New York.

name: colorado
sentence: The Food & Wine Classic is held annually each June in Aspen, Colorado.

name: colorado
sentence: Aspen also has a reputation as the culinary capital of the Rocky Mountain region.

name: colorado
sentence: Denver is known for steak, but now has a diverse culinary scene with many restaurants.

name: colorado
sentence: Colorado wines include award-winning varietals that have attracted favorable notice from outside the state.

name: colorado
sentence: With wines made from traditional Vitis vinifera grapes along with wines made from cherries, peaches, plums and honey, Colorado wines have won top national and international awards for their quality.

name: colorado
sentence: Colorado's grape growing regions contain the highest elevation vineyards in the United States, with most viticulture in the state practiced between 4,000 and 7,000 feet (1,219 and 2,134 m) above sea level.

name: colorado
sentence: The mountain climate ensures warm summer days and cool nights.

name: colorado
sentence: Colorado is home to two designated American Viticultural Areas of the Grand Valley AVA and the West Elks AVA, where most of the vineyards in the state are located.

name: colorado
sentence: However, an increasing number of wineries are located along the Front Range.

name: colorado
sentence: In 2018, Wine Enthusiast Magazine named Colorado's Grand Valley AVA in Mesa County, Colorado, as one of the Top Ten wine travel destinations in the world.

name: colorado
sentence: Colorado is home to many nationally praised microbreweries, including New Belgium Brewing Company, Odell Brewing Company, Great Divide Brewing Company, and Bristol Brewing Company.

name: colorado
sentence: The area of northern Colorado near and between the cities of Denver, Boulder, and Fort Collins is known as the "Napa Valley of Beer" due to its high density of craft breweries.

name: colorado
sentence: Colorado is open to cannabis (marijuana) tourism.

name: colorado
sentence: With the adoption of their 64th state amendment in 2013, Colorado became the first state in the union to legalize the medicinal (2000), industrial (2013), and recreational (2014) use of marijuana.

name: colorado
sentence: Colorado's marijuana industry sold $1.31 billion worth of marijuana in 2016 and $1.26 billion in the first three-quarters of 2017.

name: colorado
sentence: The state generated tax, fee, and license revenue of $194 million in 2016 on legal marijuana sales.

name: colorado
sentence: Colorado regulates hemp as any part of the plant with less than 0.3% THC.

name: colorado
sentence: Amendment 64, adopted by the voters in the 2012 general election, forces the Colorado state legislature to enact legislation governing the cultivation, processing and sale of recreational marijuana and industrial hemp.

name: colorado
sentence: On April 4, 2014, Senatorte Bill 14–184 addressing oversight of Colorado's industrial hemp program was first introduced, ultimately being signed into law by Governor John Hickenlooper on May 31, 2014.

name: colorado
sentence: On November 7, 2000, 54% of Colorado voters passed Amendment 20, which amends the Colorado State constitution to allow the medical use of marijuana.

name: colorado
sentence: A patient's medical use of marijuana, within the following limits, is lawful:

name: colorado
sentence: Currently Colorado has listed "eight medical conditions for which patients can use marijuana—cancer, glaucoma, HIV/AIDS, muscle spasms, seizures, severe pain, severe nausea and cachexia, or dramatic weight loss and muscle atrophy".

name: colorado
sentence: While governor, John Hickenlooper allocated about half of the state's $13 million "Medical Marijuana Program Cash Fund" to medical research in the 2014 budget.

name: colorado
sentence: By 2018, the Medical Marijuana Program Cash Fund was the "largest pool of pot money in the state" and was used to fund programs including research into pediatric applications for controlling autism symptoms.

name: colorado
sentence: On November 6, 2012, voters amended the state constitution to protect "personal use" of marijuana for adults, establishing a framework to regulate marijuana in a manner similar to alcohol.

name: colorado
sentence: The first recreational marijuana shops in Colorado, and by extension the United States, opened their doors on January 1, 2014.

name: colorado
sentence: Colorado has five major professional sports leagues, all based in the Denver metropolitan area.

name: colorado
sentence: Colorado is the least populous state with a franchise in each of the major professional sports leagues.

name: colorado
sentence: The Pikes Peak International Hill Climb is a major hillclimbing motor race held at the Pikes Peak Highway.

name: colorado
sentence: The Cherry Hills Country Club has hosted several professional golf tournaments, including the US Open, US Senatoror Open, US Women's Open, PGA Championship and BMW Championship.

name: colorado
sentence: The following universities and colleges participate in the National Collegiate Athletic Association Division I.

name: colorado
sentence: The most popular college sports program is the University of Colorado Buffaloes, who used to play in the Big-12 but now play in the Pac-12.

name: colorado
sentence: They have won the 1957 and 1991 Orange Bowl, 1995 Fiesta Bowl, and 1996 Cotton Bowl Classic.

name: colorado
sentence: CNBC's list of "Top States for Business for 2010" has recognized Colorado as the third-best state in the nation, falling short only to Texas and Virginia.

name: colorado
sentence: The total state product in 2015 was $318.6 billion.

name: colorado
sentence: Median Annual Household Income in 2016 was $70,666, 8th in the nation.

name: colorado
sentence: Per capita personal income in 2010 was $51,940, ranking Colorado 11th in the nation.

name: colorado
sentence: The state's economy broadened from its mid-19th-century roots in mining when irrigated agriculture developed, and by the late 19th century, raising livestock had become important.

name: colorado
sentence: Early industry was based on the extraction and processing of minerals and agricultural products.

name: colorado
sentence: Current agricultural products are cattle, wheat, dairy products, corn, and hay.

name: colorado
sentence: The federal government is also a major economic force in the state with many important federal facilities including NORAD (North American Aerospace Defense Command), United States Air Force Academy, Schriever Air Force Base located approximately 10 miles (16 kilometers) east of Peterson Air Force Base, and Fort Carson, both located in Colorado Springs within El Paso County; NOAA, the National Renewable Energy Laboratory (NREL) in Golden, and the National Institute of Standards and Technology in Boulder; US Geological Survey and other government agencies at the Denver Federal Center near Lakewood; the Denver Mint, Buckley Air Force Base, the Tenth Circuit Court of Appeals, and the Byron G. Rogers Federal Building and United States Courthouse in Denver; and a federal Supermax Prison and other federal prisons near Cañon City.

name: colorado
sentence: In addition to these and other federal agencies, Colorado has abundant National Forest land and four National Parks that contribute to federal ownership of 24,615,788 acres (99,617 km2) of land in Colorado, or 37% of the total area of the state.In the second half of the 20th century, the industrial and service sectors have expanded greatly.

name: colorado
sentence: The state's economy is diversified, and is notable for its concentration of scientific research and high-technology industries.

name: colorado
sentence: Other industries include food processing, transportation equipment, machinery, chemical products, the extraction of metals such as gold (see Gold mining in Colorado), silver, and molybdenum.

name: colorado
sentence: Colorado now also has the largest annual production of beer of any state.

name: colorado
sentence: Denver is an important financial center.

name: colorado
sentence: The state's diverse geography and majestic mountains attract millions of tourists every year, including 85.2 million in 2018.

name: colorado
sentence: Tourism contributes greatly to Colorado's economy, with tourists generating $22.3 billion in 2018.

name: colorado
sentence: A number of nationally known brand names have originated in Colorado factories and laboratories.

name: colorado
sentence: From Denver came the forerunner of telecommunications giant Qwest in 1879, Samsonite luggage in 1910, Gates belts and hoses in 1911, and Russell Stover Candies in 1923.

name: colorado
sentence: Kuner canned vegetables began in Brighton in 1864.

name: colorado
sentence: From Golden came Coors beer in 1873, CoorsTek industrial ceramics in 1920, and Jolly Rancher candy in 1949.

name: colorado
sentence: CF&I railroad rails, wire, nails, and pipe debuted in Pueblo in 1892.

name: colorado
