sentence: Holly Sugar was first milled from beets in Holly in 1905, and later moved its headquarters to Colorado Springs.

name: colorado
sentence: The present-day Swift packed meat of Greeley evolved from Monfort of Colorado, Inc., established in 1930.

name: colorado
sentence: Estes model rockets were launched in Penrose in 1958.

name: colorado
sentence: Fort Collins has been the home of Woodward Governor Company's motor controllers (governors) since 1870, and Waterpik dental water jets and showerheads since 1962.

name: colorado
sentence: Celestial Seasonings herbal teas have been made in Boulder since 1969.

name: colorado
sentence: Rocky Mountain Chocolate Factory made its first candy in Durango in 1981.

name: colorado
sentence: Colorado has a flat 4.63% income tax, regardless of income level.

name: colorado
sentence: On Nov. 3, 2020 voters authorized an initiative to lower that income tax rate to 4.55 percent.

name: colorado
sentence: Unlike most states, which calculate taxes based on federal adjusted gross income, Colorado taxes are based on taxable income—income after federal exemptions and federal itemized (or standard) deductions.

name: colorado
sentence: Colorado's state sales tax is 2.9% on retail sales.

name: colorado
sentence: When state revenues exceed state constitutional limits, according to Colorado's Taxpayer Bill of Rights legislation, full-year Colorado residents can claim a sales tax refund on their individual state income tax return.

name: colorado
sentence: Many counties and cities charge their own rates, in addition to the base state rate.

name: colorado
sentence: There are also certain county and special district taxes that may apply.

name: colorado
sentence: Real estate and personal business property are taxable in Colorado.

name: colorado
sentence: The state's senior property tax exemption was temporarily suspended by the Colorado Legislature in 2003.

name: colorado
sentence: The tax break was scheduled to return for assessment year 2006, payable in 2007.

name: colorado
sentence: As of December 2018, the state's unemployment rate was 4.2%.

name: colorado
sentence: The West Virginia teachers' strike in 2018 inspired teachers in other states, including Colorado, to take similar action.

name: colorado
sentence: Colorado has significant hydrocarbon resources.

name: colorado
sentence: According to the Energy Information Administration, Colorado hosts seven of the Nation's hundred largest natural gas fields, and two of its hundred largest oil fields.

name: colorado
sentence: Conventional and unconventional natural gas output from several Colorado basins typically account for more than five percent of annual US natural gas production.

name: colorado
sentence: Colorado's oil shale deposits hold an estimated 1 trillion barrels (160 km3) of oil—nearly as much oil as the entire world's proven oil reserves; the economic viability of the oil shale, however, has not been demonstrated.

name: colorado
sentence: Substantial deposits of bituminous, subbituminous, and lignite coal are found in the state.

name: colorado
sentence: Uranium mining in Colorado goes back to 1872, when pitchblende ore was taken from gold mines near Central City, Colorado.

name: colorado
sentence: The Colorado uranium industry has seen booms and busts, but continues to this day.

name: colorado
sentence: Not counting byproduct uranium from phosphate, Colorado is considered to have the third-largest uranium reserves of any US state, behind Wyoming and New Mexico.

name: colorado
sentence: Uranium price increases from 2001 to 2007 prompted a number of companies to revive uranium mining in Colorado.

name: colorado
sentence: Price drops and financing problems in late 2008 forced these companies to cancel or scale back uranium-mining project.

name: colorado
sentence: Currently, there are no uranium producing mines in Colorado.

name: colorado
sentence: Colorado's high Rocky Mountain ridges and eastern plains offer wind power potential, and geologic activity in the mountain areas provides potential for geothermal power development.

name: colorado
sentence: Much of the state is sunny, and could produce solar power.

name: colorado
sentence: Major rivers flowing from the Rocky Mountains offer hydroelectric power resources.

name: colorado
sentence: Corn grown in the flat eastern part of the state offers potential resources for ethanol production.

name: colorado
sentence: Colorado's primary mode of transportation (in terms of passengers) is its highway system.

name: colorado
sentence: Interstate 25 (I-25) is the primary north–south highway in the state, connecting Pueblo, Colorado Springs, Denver, and Fort Collins, and extending north to Wyoming and south to New Mexico.

name: colorado
sentence: I-70 is the primary east–west corridor.

name: colorado
sentence: It connects Grand Junction and the mountain communities with Denver, and enters Utah and Kansas.

name: colorado
sentence: The state is home to a network of US and Colorado highways that provide access to all principal areas of the state.

name: colorado
sentence: Many smaller communities are connected to this network only via county roads.

name: colorado
sentence: Denver International Airport (DIA) is the fifth-busiest domestic US airport and twentieth busiest airport in the world by passenger traffic.

name: colorado
sentence: DIA handles by far the largest volume of commercial air traffic in Colorado, and is the busiest US hub airport between Chicago and the Pacific coast, making Denver the most important airport for connecting passenger traffic in the western United States.

name: colorado
sentence: Extensive public transportation bus services are offered both intra-city and inter-city—including the Denver metro area's extensive RTD services.

name: colorado
sentence: The Regional Transportation District (RTD) operates the popular RTD Bus & Rail transit system in the Denver Metropolitan Area.

name: colorado
sentence: As of January 2013 the RTD rail system had 170 light-rail vehicles, serving 47 miles (76 km) of track.

name: colorado
sentence: Amtrak operates two passenger rail lines in Colorado, the California Zephyr and Southwest Chief.

name: colorado
sentence: Colorado's contribution to world railroad history was forged principally by the Denver and Rio Grande Western Railroad which began in 1870 and wrote the book on mountain railroading.

name: colorado
sentence: In 1988 the "Rio Grande" acquired, but was merged into, the Southern Pacific Railroad by their joint owner Philip Anschutz.

name: colorado
sentence: On September 11, 1996, Anschutz sold the combined company to the Union Pacific Railroad, creating the largest railroad network in the United States.

name: colorado
sentence: The Anschutz sale was partly in response to the earlier merger of Burlington Northern and Santa Fe which formed the large Burlington Northern and Santa Fe Railway (BNSF), Union Pacific's principal competitor in western US railroading.

name: colorado
sentence: Both Union Pacific and BNSF have extensive freight operations in Colorado.

name: colorado
sentence: Colorado's freight railroad network consists of 2,688 miles of Class I trackage.

name: colorado
sentence: It is integral to the US economy, being a critical artery for the movement of energy, agriculture, mining, and industrial commodities as well as general freight and manufactured products between the East and Midwest and the Pacific coast states.

name: colorado
sentence: In August 2014, Colorado began to issue driver licenses to aliens not lawfully in the United States who lived in Colorado.

name: colorado
sentence: In September 2014, KCNC reported that 524 non-citizens were issued Colorado driver licenses that are normally issued to US citizens living in Colorado.

name: colorado
sentence: Like the federal government and all other US states, Colorado's state constitution provides for three branches of government: the legislative, the executive, and the judicial branches.

name: colorado
sentence: The Governor of Colorado heads the state's executive branch.

name: colorado
sentence: The current governor is Jared Polis, a Democrat.

name: colorado
sentence: Colorado's other statewide elected executive officers are the Lieutenant Governor of Colorado (elected on a ticket with the Governor), Secretary of State of Colorado, Colorado State Treasurer, and Attorney General of Colorado, all of whom serve four-year terms.

name: colorado
sentence: The seven-member Colorado Supreme Court is the state's highest court, with seven justices.

name: colorado
sentence: The Colorado Court of Appeals, with 22 judges, sits in divisions of three judges each.

name: colorado
sentence: Colorado is divided into 22 judicial districts, each of which has a district court and a county court with limited jurisdiction.

name: colorado
sentence: The state also has a water court, which sits in seven distinct divisions around the state and which decides matters relating to water rights and the use and administration of water.

name: colorado
sentence: The state legislative body is the Colorado General Assembly, which is made up of two houses - the House of Representatives and the Senatorte.

name: colorado
sentence: The House has 65 members and the Senatorte has 35.

name: colorado
sentence: As of 2018, the Democratic Party holds a 19 to 16 majority in the Senatorte and a 41 to 24 majority in the House.

name: colorado
sentence: Most Coloradans are native to other states (nearly 60% according to the 2000 census), and this is illustrated by the fact that the state did not have a native-born governor from 1975 (when John David Vanderhoof left office) until 2007, when Bill Ritter took office; his election the previous year marked the first electoral victory for a native-born Coloradan in a gubernatorial race since 1958 (Vanderhoof had ascended from the Lieutenant Governorship when John Arthur Love was given a position in Richard Nixon's administration in 1973).

name: colorado
sentence: In the 2016 election, the Democratic party won the Colorado electoral college votes.

name: colorado
sentence: Tax is collected by the Colorado Department of Revenue.

name: colorado
sentence: The State of Colorado is divided into 64 counties.

name: colorado
sentence: Counties are important units of government in Colorado since the state has no secondary civil subdivisions such as townships.

name: colorado
sentence: Two of these counties, the City and County of Denver and the City and County of Broomfield, have consolidated city and county governments.

name: colorado
sentence: Nine Colorado counties have a population in excess of 250,000 each, while eight Colorado counties have a population of less than 2,500 each.

name: colorado
sentence: The ten most populous Colorado counties are all located in the Front Range Urban Corridor.

name: colorado
sentence: The United States Office of Management and Budget (OMB) has defined one combined statistical area (CSA), seven Metropolitan Statistical Areas (MSAs), and seven Micropolitan Statistical Areas (μSAs) in the state of Colorado.

name: colorado
sentence: The most populous of the 14 Core Based Statistical Areas in Colorado is the Denver-Aurora-Broomfield, CO Metropolitan Statistical Area.

name: colorado
sentence: This area had an estimated population of 2,888,227 on July 1, 2017, an increase of +13.55% since the 2010 United States Census.

name: colorado
sentence: The more extensive Denver-Aurora-Boulder, CO Combined Statistical Area had an estimated population of 3,515,374 on July 1, 2017, an increase of +13.73% since the 2010 United States Census.

name: colorado
sentence: The most populous extended metropolitan region in Rocky Mountain Region is the Front Range Urban Corridor along the northeast face of the Southern Rocky Mountains.

name: colorado
sentence: This region with Denver at its center had an estimated population of 4,495,181 on July 1, 2012, an increase of +3.73% since the 2010 United States Census.

name: colorado
sentence: The state of Colorado currently has 271 active incorporated municipalities, including 196 towns, 73 cities, and two consolidated city and county governments.

name: colorado
sentence: Colorado municipalities operate under one of five types of municipal governing authority.

name: colorado
sentence: Colorado has one town with a territorial charter, 160 statutory towns, 12 statutory cities, 96 home rule municipalities (61 cities and 35 towns), and two consolidated city and county governments.

name: colorado
sentence: In addition to its 271 municipalities, Colorado has 187 unincorporated Census Designated Places and many other small communities.

name: colorado
sentence: The state of Colorado has more than 3,000 districts with taxing authority.

name: colorado
sentence: These districts may provide schools, law enforcement, fire protection, water, sewage, drainage, irrigation, transportation, recreation, infrastructure, cultural facilities, business support, redevelopment, or other services.

name: colorado
sentence: Some of these districts have authority to levy sales tax and well as property tax and use fees.

name: colorado
sentence: This has led to a hodgepodge of sales tax and property tax rates in Colorado.

name: colorado
sentence: There are some street intersections in Colorado with a different sales tax rate on each corner, sometimes substantially different.

name: colorado
sentence: Some of the more notable Colorado districts are:

name: colorado
sentence: Colorado is considered a swing state or (more recently) a blue state in both state and federal elections.

name: colorado
sentence: In presidential elections, it had not been won until 2020 by double digits since 1984, and has backed the winning candidate in 9 of the last 11 elections.

name: colorado
sentence: Coloradans have elected 17 Democrats and 12 Republicans to the governorship in the last 100 years.

name: colorado
sentence: In presidential politics, Colorado was considered a reliably Republican state during the post-World War II era, voting for the Democratic candidate only in 1948, 1964, and 1992.

name: colorado
sentence: However, it became a competitive swing state in the 1990s.

name: colorado
sentence: Since the mid-2000s, it has swung heavily to the Democrats, voting for Barack Obama in 2008 and 2012, Hillary Clinton in 2016 and Joe Biden in 2020.

name: colorado
sentence: Colorado politics has the contrast of conservative cities such as Colorado Springs and Grand Junction and liberal cities such as Boulder and Denver.

name: colorado
sentence: Democrats are strongest in metropolitan Denver, the college towns of Fort Collins and Boulder, southern Colorado (including Pueblo), and a number of western ski resort counties.

name: colorado
sentence: The Republicans are strongest in the Eastern Plains, Colorado Springs, Greeley, and far Western Colorado near Grand Junction.

name: colorado
sentence: Colorado is represented by two United States Senatortors:

name: colorado
sentence: Colorado is represented by seven Representatives to the United States House of Representatives:

name: colorado
sentence: In 1881 Colorado voters approved a referendum that selected Denver as the state capital.

name: colorado
sentence: Colorado was the first state in the union to enact, by voter referendum, a law extending suffrage to women.

name: colorado
sentence: That initiative was approved by the state's voters on Nov. 7, 1893.

name: colorado
sentence: On the November 8, 1932 ballot, Colorado approved the repeal of alcohol prohibition more than a year before the Twenty-first Amendment to the United States Constitution was ratified.

name: colorado
sentence: Colorado has banned, via C.R.S.

name: colorado
sentence: section 12-6-302, the sale of motor vehicles on Sunday since at least 1953.

name: colorado
sentence: In 1972 Colorado voters rejected a referendum proposal to fund the 1976 Winter Olympics, which had been scheduled to be held in the state.

name: colorado
sentence: Denver had been chosen by the International Olympic Committee as host city on May 12, 1970.

name: colorado
sentence: In 2006 voters passed Amendment 43, which purported to ban gay marriage in Colorado.

name: colorado
sentence: That initiative was nullified by the US Supreme Court's 2015 decision in Obergefell v. Hodges.

name: colorado
sentence: In 2012, voters amended the state constitution protecting "personal use" of marijuana for adults, establishing a framework to regulate cannabis in a manner similar to alcohol.

name: colorado
sentence: The first recreational marijuana shops in Colorado, and by extension the United States, opened their doors on January 1, 2014.

name: colorado
sentence: On May 29, 2019, Governor Jared Polis signed House Bill 1124 immediately prohibiting law enforcement officials in Colorado from holding undocumented immigrants solely on the basis of a request from US Immigration and Customs Enforcement.

name: colorado
sentence: Former Military installations and outposts include:

name: colorado
sentence: Colorado is home to 4 national parks, 8 national monuments, 2 national recreation areas, 2 national historic sites, 3 national historic trails, a national scenic trail, 11 national forests, 2 national grasslands, 42 national wilderness areas, 2 national conservation areas, 8 national wildlife refuges, 44 state parks, 307 state wildlife areas, and numerous other scenic, historic, and recreational areas.

name: colorado
sentence: Units of the National Park System in Colorado:

name: connecticut
sentence: Connecticut ( (listen)) is the southernmost state in the New England region of the Northeastern United States.

name: connecticut
sentence: As of the 2010 Census, it has the highest per-capita income, Human Development Index (0.962), and median household income in the United States.

name: connecticut
sentence: It is bordered by Rhode Island to the east, Massachusetts to the north, New York to the west, and the Long Island Sound to the south.

name: connecticut
sentence: Its capital is Hartford and its most populous city is Bridgeport.

name: connecticut
sentence: Geographically the state is part of New England, and although its cultural history stems from the region, in the modern age large sections of it are increasingly connected to and associated with the tri-state area with New York and New Jersey.

name: connecticut
sentence: The state is named for the Connecticut River which approximately bisects the state.

name: connecticut
sentence: The word "Connecticut" is derived from various anglicized spellings of “Quononoquett (Conanicut),” a Mohegan-Pequot word for "long tidal river".

name: connecticut
sentence: Connecticut's first European settlers were Dutchmen who established a small, short-lived settlement called Fort Hoop in Hartford at the confluence of the Park and Connecticut Rivers.

name: connecticut
sentence: Half of Connecticut was initially part of the Dutch colony New Netherland, which included much of the land between the Connecticut and Delaware Rivers, although the first major settlements were established in the 1630s by the English.

name: connecticut
sentence: Thomas Hooker led a band of followers from the Massachusetts Bay Colony and founded the Connecticut Colony

name: connecticut
sentence: The Connecticut and New Haven colonies established documents of Fundamental Orders, considered the first constitutions in America.

name: connecticut
sentence: In 1662, the three colonies were merged under a royal charter, making Connecticut a crown colony.

name: connecticut
sentence: This was one of the Thirteen Colonies which rejected British rule in the American Revolution.

name: connecticut
sentence: Connecticut is the third smallest state by area, the 29th most populous, and the fourth most densely populated of the fifty states.

name: connecticut
sentence: It is known as the "Constitution State", the "Nutmeg State", the "Provisions State", and the "Land of Steady Habits".

name: connecticut
sentence: It was influential in the development of the federal government of the United States (see Connecticut Compromise).

name: connecticut
sentence: The Connecticut River, Thames River, and ports along Long Island Sound have given Connecticut a strong maritime tradition which continues today.

name: connecticut
sentence: The state also has a long history of hosting the financial services industry, including insurance companies in Hartford and hedge funds in Fairfield County.

name: connecticut
sentence: Connecticut is bordered on the south by Long Island Sound, on the west by New York, on the north by Massachusetts, and on the east by Rhode Island.

name: connecticut
sentence: The state capital and fourth largest city is Hartford, and other major cities and towns (by population) include Bridgeport, New Haven, Stamford, Waterbury, Norwalk, Danbury, New Britain, Greenwich, and Bristol.

name: connecticut
sentence: Connecticut is slightly larger than the country of Montenegro.

name: connecticut
sentence: There are 169 incorporated towns in Connecticut.

name: connecticut
sentence: The highest peak in Connecticut is Bear Mountain in Salisbury in the northwest corner of the state.

name: connecticut
sentence: The highest point is just east of where Connecticut, Massachusetts, and New York meet (42°3′ N, 73°29′ W), on the southern slope of Mount Frissell, whose peak lies nearby in Massachusetts.

name: connecticut
sentence: At the opposite extreme, many of the coastal towns have areas that are less than 20 feet (6 m) above sea level.

name: connecticut
sentence: Connecticut has a long maritime history and a reputation based on that history—yet the state has no direct oceanfront (technically speaking).

name: connecticut
sentence: The coast of Connecticut sits on Long Island Sound, which is an estuary.

name: connecticut
sentence: The state's access to the open Atlantic Ocean is both to the west (toward New York City) and to the east (toward the "race" near Rhode Island).

name: connecticut
sentence: This situation provides many safe harbors from ocean storms, and many transatlantic ships seek anchor inside Long Island Sound when tropical cyclones pass off the upper East Coast.

name: connecticut
sentence: The Connecticut River cuts through the center of the state, flowing into Long Island Sound.

name: connecticut
sentence: The most populous metropolitan region centered within the state lies in the Connecticut River Valley.

name: connecticut
sentence: Despite Connecticut's relatively small size, it features wide regional variations in its landscape; for example, in the northwestern Litchfield Hills, it features rolling mountains and horse farms, whereas in areas to the east of New Haven along the coast, the landscape features coastal marshes, beaches, and large scale maritime activities.

name: connecticut
sentence: Connecticut's rural areas and small towns in the northeast and northwest corners of the state contrast sharply with its industrial cities such as Stamford, Bridgeport, and New Haven, located along the coastal highways from the New York border to New London, then northward up the Connecticut River to Hartford.

name: connecticut
sentence: Many towns in northeastern and northwestern Connecticut center around a green.

name: connecticut
sentence: Near the green typically stand historical visual symbols of New England towns, such as a white church, a colonial meeting house, a colonial tavern or inn, several colonial houses, and so on, establishing a scenic historical appearance maintained for both historic preservation and tourism.

name: connecticut
sentence: Many of the areas in southern and coastal Connecticut have been built up and rebuilt over the years, and look less visually like traditional New England.

name: connecticut
sentence: The northern boundary of the state with Massachusetts is marked by the Southwick Jog or Granby Notch, an approximately 2.5 miles (4.0 km) square detour into Connecticut.

name: connecticut
sentence: The origin of this anomaly is clearly established in a long line of disputes and temporary agreements which were finally concluded in 1804, when southern Southwick's residents sought to leave Massachusetts, and the town was split in half.

name: connecticut
sentence: The southwestern border of Connecticut where it abuts New York State is marked by a panhandle in Fairfield County, containing the towns of Greenwich, Stamford, New Canaan, Darien, and parts of Norwalk and Wilton.

name: connecticut
sentence: This irregularity in the boundary is the result of territorial disputes in the late 17th century, culminating with New York giving up its claim to the area, whose residents considered themselves part of Connecticut, in exchange for an equivalent area extending northwards from Ridgefield to the Massachusetts border, as well as undisputed claim to Rye, New York.

name: connecticut
sentence: Areas maintained by the National Park Service include Appalachian National Scenic Trail, Quinebaug and Shetucket Rivers Valley National Heritage Corridor, and Weir Farm National Historic Site.

name: connecticut
sentence: Connecticut lies at the rough transition zone between the southern end of the humid continental climate, and the northern portion of the humid subtropical climate.

name: connecticut
sentence: Northern Connecticut generally experiences a climate with cold winters with moderate snowfall and hot, humid summers.

name: connecticut
sentence: Far southern and coastal Connecticut has a climate with cool winters with a mix of rain and infrequent snow, and the long hot and humid summers typical of the middle and lower East Coast.

name: connecticut
sentence: Connecticut sees a fairly even precipitation pattern with rainfall/snowfall spread throughout the 12 months.

name: connecticut
sentence: Connecticut averages 56% of possible sunshine (higher than the US national average), averaging 2,400 hours of sunshine annually.

name: connecticut
sentence: Early spring (April) can range from slightly cool (40s to low 50s F) to warm (65 to 70 F), while mid and late spring (late April/May) is warm.

name: connecticut
sentence: By late May, the building Bermuda High creates a southerly flow of warm and humid tropical air, bringing hot weather conditions throughout the state, with average highs in New London of 81 °F (27 °C) and 85 °F (29 °C) in Windsor Locks at the peak of summer in late July.

name: connecticut
sentence: On occasion, heat waves with highs from 90 to 100 °F (38 °C) occur across Connecticut.

name: connecticut
sentence: Although summers are sunny in Connecticut, quick moving summer thunderstorms can bring brief downpours with thunder and lightning.

name: connecticut
sentence: Occasionally these thunderstorms can be severe, and the state usually averages one tornado per year.

name: connecticut
sentence: During hurricane season, the remains of tropical cyclones occasionally affect the region, though a direct hit is rare.

name: connecticut
sentence: Weather commonly associated with the fall season typically begins in October and lasts to the first days of December.

name: connecticut
sentence: Daily high temperatures in October and November range from the 50s to 60s (Fahrenheit) with nights in the 40s and upper 30s.

name: connecticut
sentence: Colorful foliage begins across northern parts of the state in early October and moves south and east reaching southeast Connecticut by early November.

name: connecticut
sentence: Far southern and coastal areas, however, have more oak and hickory trees (and fewer maples) and are often less colorful than areas to the north.

name: connecticut
sentence: By December daytime highs are in the 40s °F for much of the state, and average overnight lows are below freezing.

name: connecticut
sentence: Winters (December through mid-March) are generally cold from south to north in Connecticut.

name: connecticut
sentence: The coldest month (January) has average high temperatures ranging from 38 °F (3 °C) in the coastal lowlands to 33 °F (1 °C) in the inland and northern portions on the state.

name: connecticut
sentence: The average yearly snowfall ranges from about 60 inches (1,500 mm) in the higher elevations of the northern portion of the state to only 20–25 inches (510–640 mm) along the southeast coast of Connecticut (Branford to Groton).

name: connecticut
sentence: Generally, any locale north or west of Interstate 84 receives the most snow, during a storm, and throughout the season.

name: connecticut
sentence: Most of Connecticut has less than 60 days of snow cover.

name: connecticut
sentence: Snow usually falls from late November to late March in the northern part of the state, and from early December to mid-March in the southern and coastal parts of the state.

name: connecticut
sentence: Connecticut's record high temperature is 106 °F (41 °C) which occurred in Danbury on July 15, 1995; the record low is −32 °F (−36 °C) which occurred in the Northwest Hills Falls Village on February 16, 1943, and Coventry on January 22, 1961.

name: connecticut
sentence: Forests consist of a mix of Northeastern coastal forests of Oak in southern areas of the state, to the upland New England-Acadian forests in the northwestern parts of the state.

name: connecticut
sentence: Mountain Laurel (Kalmia latifolia) is the state flower and is native to low ridges in several parts of Connecticut.

name: connecticut
sentence: Rosebay Rhododendron (Rhododendron maximum) is also native to eastern uplands of Connecticut and Pachaug State Forest is home to the Rhododendron Sanctuary Trail.

name: connecticut
sentence: Atlantic white cedar (Chamaecyparis thyoides), is found in wetlands in the southern parts of the state.

name: connecticut
sentence: Connecticut has one native cactus (Opuntia humifusa), found in sandy coastal areas and low hillsides.

name: connecticut
sentence: Several types of beach grasses and wildflowers are also native to Connecticut.

name: connecticut
sentence: Connecticut spans USDA Plant Hardiness Zones 5b to 7a.

name: connecticut
sentence: Coastal Connecticut is the broad transition zone where more southern and subtropical plants are cultivated.

name: connecticut
sentence: In some coastal communities, Magnolia grandiflora (southern magnolia), Crape Myrtles, scrub palms (Sabal minor), Needle Palms (Rhapidophyllum hystrix), and other broadleaved evergreens are cultivated in small numbers.

name: connecticut
sentence: The name Connecticut is derived from the Mohegan-Pequot word that has been translated as "long tidal river" and "upon the long river", referring to the Connecticut River.

name: connecticut
sentence: Evidence of human presence in the Connecticut region dates to as much as 10,000 years ago.

name: connecticut
sentence: Stone tools were used for hunting, fishing, and woodworking.

name: connecticut
sentence: Semi-nomadic in lifestyle, these peoples moved seasonally to take advantage of various resources in the area.

name: connecticut
sentence: They shared languages based on Algonquian.

name: connecticut
sentence: The Connecticut region was inhabited by multiple Native American tribes which can be grouped into the Nipmuc, the Sequin or "River Indians" (which included the Tunxis, Schaghticoke, Podunk, Wangunk, Hammonasset, and Quinnipiac), the Mattabesec or "Wappinger Confederacy" and the Pequot-Mohegan.

name: connecticut
sentence: Some of these groups continue to abide in Connecticut, including the Mohegans, the Pequots, and the Paugusetts.

name: connecticut
sentence: The first European explorer in Connecticut was Dutchman Adriaen Block, who explored the region in 1614.

name: connecticut
sentence: Dutch fur traders then sailed up the Connecticut River, which they called Versche Rivier ("Fresh River"), and built a fort at Dutch Point in Hartford that they named "House of Hope" (Dutch: Huis van Hoop).

name: connecticut
sentence: The Connecticut Colony was originally a number of separate, smaller settlements at Windsor, Wethersfield, Saybrook, Hartford, and New Haven.

name: connecticut
sentence: The first English settlers came in 1633 and settled at Windsor, and then at Wethersfield the following year.

name: connecticut
sentence: John Winthrop the Younger of Massachusetts received a commission to create Saybrook Colony at the mouth of the Connecticut River in 1635.

name: connecticut
sentence: The main body of settlers came in one large group in 1636.

name: connecticut
sentence: They were Puritans from Massachusetts Bay Colony led by Thomas Hooker, who established the Connecticut Colony at Hartford.

name: connecticut
sentence: The Quinnipiack Colony was established by John Davenport, Theophilus Eaton, and others at New Haven in March 1638.

name: connecticut
sentence: The New Haven Colony had its own constitution called "The Fundamental Agreement of the New Haven Colony", signed on June 4, 1639.

name: connecticut
sentence: The settlements were established without official sanction of the English Crown, and each was an independent political entity.

name: connecticut
sentence: In 1662, Winthrop traveled to England and obtained a charter from Charles II which united the settlements of Connecticut.

name: connecticut
sentence: Historically important colonial settlements included Windsor (1633), Wethersfield (1634), Saybrook (1635), Hartford (1636), New Haven (1638), Fairfield (1639), Guilford (1639), Milford (1639), Stratford (1639), Farmington (1640), Stamford (1641), and New London (1646).

name: connecticut
sentence: The Pequot War marked the first major clash between colonists and Native Americans in New England.

name: connecticut
sentence: The Pequots reacted with increasing aggression to Colonial settlements in their territory—while simultaneously taking lands from the Narragansett and Mohegan tribes.

name: connecticut
sentence: Settlers responded to a murder in 1636 with a raid on a Pequot village on Block Island; the Pequots laid siege to Saybrook Colony's garrison that autumn, then raided Wethersfield in the spring of 1637.

name: connecticut
sentence: Colonists declared war on the Pequots, organized a band of militia and allies from the Mohegan and Narragansett tribes, and attacked a Pequot village on the Mystic River, with death toll estimates ranging between 300 and 700 Pequots.

name: connecticut
sentence: After suffering another major loss at a battle in Fairfield, the Pequots asked for a truce and peace terms.

name: connecticut
sentence: The western boundaries of Connecticut have been subject to change over time.

name: connecticut
sentence: The Hartford Treaty with the Dutch was signed on September 19, 1650, but it was never ratified by the British.

name: connecticut
sentence: According to it, the western boundary of Connecticut ran north from Greenwich Bay for a distance of 20 miles (32 km), "provided the said line come not within 10 miles of Hudson River".

name: connecticut
sentence: This agreement was observed by both sides until war erupted between England and The Netherlands in 1652.

name: connecticut
sentence: Conflict continued concerning colonial limits until the Duke of York captured New Netherland in 1664.

name: connecticut
sentence: On the other hand, Connecticut's original Charter in 1662 granted it all the land to the "South Sea"—that is, to the Pacific Ocean.

name: connecticut
sentence: Most Colonial royal grants were for long east–west strips.

name: connecticut
sentence: Connecticut took its grant seriously and established a ninth county between the Susquehanna River and Delaware River named Westmoreland County.

name: connecticut
sentence: This resulted in the brief Pennamite Wars with Pennsylvania.

name: connecticut
sentence: Yale College was established in 1701, providing Connecticut with an important institution to educate clergy and civil leaders.

name: connecticut
sentence: The Congregational church dominated religious life in the colony and, by extension, town affairs in many parts.

name: connecticut
sentence: With more than 600 miles of coastline including along its navigable rivers, during the colonial years Connecticut developed the antecedents of a maritime tradition that would later produce booms in shipbuilding, marine transport, naval support, seafood production, and leisure boating.

name: connecticut
sentence: Historical records list the Tryall as the first vessel built in Connecticut Colony, in 1649 at a site on the Connecticut River in present-day Wethersfield.

name: connecticut
sentence: In the two decades leading up to 1776 and the American Revolution, Connecticut boatyards launched about 100 sloops, schooners and brigs according to a database of US customs records maintained online by the Mystic Seaport Museum, the largest being the 180-ton Patient Mary launched in New Haven in 1763.

name: connecticut
sentence: Connecticut's first lighthouse was constructed in 1760 at the mouth of the Thames River with the New London Harbor Lighthouse.

name: connecticut
sentence: Connecticut designated four delegates to the Second Continental Congress who signed the Declaration of Independence: Samuel Huntington, Roger Sherman, William Williams, and Oliver Wolcott.

name: connecticut
sentence: Connecticut's legislature authorized the outfitting of six new regiments in 1775, in the wake of the clashes between British regulars and Massachusetts militia at Lexington and Concord.

name: connecticut
sentence: There were some 1,200 Connecticut troops on hand at the Battle of Bunker Hill in June 1775.

name: connecticut
sentence: In 1775, David Bushnell invented the Turtle which the following year launched the first submarine attack in history, unsuccessfully against a British warship at anchor in New York Harbor.

name: connecticut
sentence: In 1777, the British got word of Continental Army supplies in Danbury, and they landed an expeditionary force of some 2,000 troops in Westport.

name: connecticut
sentence: This force then marched to Danbury and destroyed homes and much of the depot.

name: connecticut
sentence: Continental Army troops and militia led by General David Wooster and General Benedict Arnold engaged them on their return march at Ridgefield in 1777.

name: connecticut
sentence: For the winter of 1778–79, General George Washington decided to split the Continental Army into three divisions encircling New York City, where British General Sir Henry Clinton had taken up winter quarters.

name: connecticut
sentence: Major General Israel Putnam chose Redding as the winter encampment quarters for some 3,000 regulars and militia under his command.

name: connecticut
sentence: The Redding encampment allowed Putnam's soldiers to guard the replenished supply depot in Danbury and to support any operations along Long Island Sound and the Hudson River Valley.

name: connecticut
sentence: Some of the men were veterans of the winter encampment at Valley Forge, Pennsylvania the previous winter.

name: connecticut
sentence: Soldiers at the Redding camp endured supply shortages, cold temperatures, and significant snow, with some historians dubbing the encampment "Connecticut's Valley Forge".

name: connecticut
sentence: The state was also the launching site for a number of raids against Long Island orchestrated by Samuel Holden Parsons and Benjamin Tallmadge, and provided men and material for the war effort, especially to Washington's army outside New York City.

name: connecticut
sentence: General William Tryon raided the Connecticut coast in July 1779, focusing on New Haven, Norwalk, and Fairfield.

name: connecticut
sentence: New London and Groton Heights were raided in September 1781 by Benedict Arnold, who had turned traitor to the British.

name: connecticut
sentence: At the outset of the American Revolution, the Continental Congress assigned Nathaniel Shaw Jr. of New London as its naval agent in charge of recruiting privateers to seize British vessels as opportunities presented, with nearly 50 operating out of the Thames River which eventually drew the reprisal from the British force led by Arnold.

name: connecticut
sentence: Connecticut ratified the US Constitution on January 9, 1788, becoming the fifth state.

name: connecticut
sentence: The state prospered during the era following the American Revolution, as mills and textile factories were built and seaports flourished from trade and fisheries.

name: connecticut
sentence: After Congress established in 1790 the predecessor to the US Revenue Cutter Service that would evolve into the US Coast Guard, President Washington assigned Jonathan Maltbie as one of seven masters to enforce customs regulations, with Maltbie monitoring the southern New England coast with a 48-foot cutter sloop named Argus.

name: connecticut
sentence: In 1786, Connecticut ceded territory to the US government that became part of the Northwest Territory.

name: connecticut
sentence: The state retained land extending across the northern part of present-day Ohio called the Connecticut Western Reserve.

name: connecticut
sentence: The Western Reserve section was settled largely by people from Connecticut, and they brought Connecticut place names to Ohio.

name: connecticut
sentence: Connecticut made agreements with Pennsylvania and New York which extinguished the land claims within those states' boundaries and created the Connecticut Panhandle.

name: connecticut
sentence: The state then ceded the Western Reserve in 1800 to the federal government, which brought it to its present boundaries (other than minor adjustments with Massachusetts).

name: connecticut
sentence: For the first time in 1800, Connecticut shipwrights launched more than 100 vessels in a single year.

name: connecticut
sentence: Over the following decade to the doorstep of renewed hostilities with Britain that sparked the War of 1812, Connecticut boatyards constructed close to 1,000 vessels, the most productive stretch of any decade in the 19th century.

name: connecticut
sentence: During the war, the British launched raids in Stonington and Essex and blockaded vessels in the Thames River.

name: connecticut
sentence: Derby native Isaac Hull became Connecticut's best-known naval figure to win renown during the conflict, as captain of the USConstitution.

name: connecticut
sentence: The British blockade during the War of 1812 hurt exports and bolstered the influence of Federalists who opposed the war.

name: connecticut
sentence: The cessation of imports from Britain stimulated the construction of factories to manufacture textiles and machinery.

name: connecticut
sentence: Connecticut came to be recognized as a major center for manufacturing, due in part to the inventions of Eli Whitney and other early innovators of the Industrial Revolution.

name: connecticut
sentence: The war led to the development of fast clippers that helped extend the reach of New England merchants to the Pacific and Indian oceans.

name: connecticut
sentence: The first half of the 19th century saw as well a rapid rise in whaling, with New London emerging as one of the New England industry's three biggest home ports after Nantucket and New Bedford.

name: connecticut
sentence: The state was known for its political conservatism, typified by its Federalist party and the Yale College of Timothy Dwight.

name: connecticut
sentence: The foremost intellectuals were Dwight and Noah Webster, who compiled his great dictionary in New Haven.

name: connecticut
sentence: Religious tensions polarized the state, as the Congregational Church struggled to maintain traditional viewpoints, in alliance with the Federalists.

name: connecticut
sentence: The failure of the Hartford Convention in 1814 hurt the Federalist cause, with the Democratic-Republican Party gaining control in 1817.

name: connecticut
sentence: Connecticut had been governed under the "Fundamental Orders" since 1639, but the state adopted a new constitution in 1818.

name: connecticut
sentence: Connecticut manufacturers played a major role in supplying the Union forces with weapons and supplies during the Civil War.

name: connecticut
sentence: The state furnished 55,000 men, formed into thirty full regiments of infantry, including two in the US

name: connecticut
sentence: Colored Troops, with several Connecticut men becoming generals.

name: connecticut
sentence: The Navy attracted 250 officers and 2,100 men, and Glastonbury native Gideon Welles was Secretary of the Navy.

name: connecticut
sentence: James H. Ward of Hartford was the first US

name: connecticut
sentence: Naval Officer killed in the Civil War.

name: connecticut
sentence: Connecticut casualties included 2,088 killed in combat, 2,801 dying from disease, and 689 dying in Confederate prison camps.

name: connecticut
sentence: A surge of national unity in 1861 brought thousands flocking to the colors from every town and city.

name: connecticut
sentence: However, as the war became a crusade to end slavery, many Democrats (especially Irish Catholics) pulled back.

name: connecticut
sentence: The Democrats took a pro-slavery position and included many Copperheads willing to let the South secede.

name: connecticut
sentence: The intensely fought 1863 election for governor was narrowly won by the Republicans.

name: connecticut
sentence: Connecticut's extensive industry, dense population, flat terrain, and wealth encouraged the construction of railroads starting in 1839.

name: connecticut
sentence: By 1840, 102 miles (164 km) of line were in operation, growing to 402 miles (647 km) in 1850 and 601 miles (967 km) in 1860.

name: connecticut
sentence: The New York, New Haven and Hartford Railroad, called the New Haven or "The Consolidated", became the dominant Connecticut railroad company after 1872.

name: connecticut
sentence: J. P. Morgan began financing the major New England railroads in the 1890s, dividing territory so that they would not compete.

name: connecticut
sentence: The New Haven purchased 50 smaller companies, including steamship lines, and built a network of light rails (electrified trolleys) that provided inter-urban transportation for all of southern New England.

name: connecticut
sentence: By 1912, the New Haven operated over 2,000 miles (3,200 km) of track with 120,000 employees.

name: connecticut
sentence: As steam-powered passenger ships proliferated after the Civil War, Noank would produce the two largest built in Connecticut during the 19th century, with the 332-foot wooden steam paddle wheeler Rhode Island launched in 1882, and the 345-foot paddle wheeler Connecticut seven years later.

name: connecticut
sentence: Connecticut shipyards would launch more than 165 steam-powered vessels in the 19th century.

name: connecticut
sentence: In 1875, the first telephone exchange in the world was established in New Haven.

name: connecticut
sentence: When World War I broke out in 1914, Connecticut became a major supplier of weaponry to the US military; by 1918, 80% of the state's industries were producing goods for the war effort.

name: connecticut
sentence: Remington Arms in Bridgeport produced half the small-arms cartridges used by the US Army, with other major suppliers including Winchester in New Haven and Colt in Hartford.

name: connecticut
sentence: Connecticut was also an important US Navy supplier, with Electric Boat receiving orders for 85 submarines, Lake Torpedo Boat building more than 20 subs, and the Groton Iron Works building freighters.

name: connecticut
sentence: On June 21, 1916, the Navy made Groton the site for its East Coast submarine base and school.

name: connecticut
sentence: The state enthusiastically supported the American war effort in 1917 and 1918 with large purchases of war bonds, a further expansion of industry, and an emphasis on increasing food production on the farms.

name: connecticut
sentence: Thousands of state, local, and volunteer groups mobilized for the war effort and were coordinated by the Connecticut State Council of Defense.

name: connecticut
sentence: Manufacturers wrestled with manpower shortages; Waterbury's American Brass and Manufacturing Company was running at half capacity, so the federal government agreed to furlough soldiers to work there.

name: connecticut
sentence: In 1919, J. Henry Roraback started the Connecticut Light & Power Co. which became the state's dominant electric utility.

name: connecticut
sentence: In 1925, Frederick Rentschler spurred the creation of Pratt & Whitney in Hartford to develop engines for aircraft; the company became an important military supplier in World War II and one of the three major manufacturers of jet engines in the world.

name: connecticut
sentence: On September 21, 1938, the most destructive storm in New England history struck eastern Connecticut, killing hundreds of people.

name: connecticut
sentence: The eye of the "Long Island Express" passed just west of New Haven and devastated the Connecticut shoreline between Old Saybrook and Stonington from the full force of wind and waves, even though they had partial protection by Long Island.

name: connecticut
sentence: The hurricane caused extensive damage to infrastructure, homes, and businesses.

name: connecticut
sentence: In New London, a 500-foot (150 m) sailing ship was driven into a warehouse complex, causing a major fire.

name: connecticut
sentence: Heavy rainfall caused the Connecticut River to flood downtown Hartford and East Hartford.

name: connecticut
sentence: An estimated 50,000 trees fell onto roadways.

name: connecticut
sentence: The advent of lend-lease in support of Britain helped lift Connecticut from the Great Depression, with the state a major production center for weaponry and supplies used in World War II.

name: connecticut
sentence: Connecticut manufactured 4.1% of total US military armaments produced during the war, ranking ninth among the 48 states, with major factories including Colt for firearms, Pratt & Whitney for aircraft engines, Chance Vought for fighter planes, Hamilton Standard for propellers, and Electric Boat for submarines and PT boats.

name: connecticut
sentence: In Bridgeport, General Electric produced a significant new weapon to combat tanks: the bazooka.

name: connecticut
sentence: On May 13, 1940, Igor Sikorsky made an untethered flight of the first practical helicopter.

name: connecticut
sentence: The helicopter saw limited use in World War II, but future military production made Sikorsky Aircraft's Stratford plant Connecticut's largest single manufacturing site by the start of the 21st century.

name: connecticut
sentence: Connecticut lost some wartime factories following the end of hostilities, but the state shared in a general post-war expansion that included the construction of highways and resulting in middle-class growth in suburban areas.

name: connecticut
sentence: Prescott Bush represented Connecticut in the US Senatorte from 1952 to 1963

name: connecticut
sentence: Bush and grandson George W. Bush both became presidents of the United States.

name: connecticut
sentence: In 1965, Connecticut ratified its current constitution, replacing the document that had served since 1818.

name: connecticut
sentence: In 1968, commercial operation began for the Connecticut Yankee Nuclear Power Plant in East Haddam; in 1970, the Millstone Nuclear Power Station began operations in Waterford.

name: connecticut
sentence: In 1974, Connecticut elected Democratic Governor Ella T. Grasso, who became the first woman in any state to be elected governor without being the wife or widow of a previous governor.

name: connecticut
sentence: Connecticut's dependence on the defense industry posed an economic challenge at the end of the Cold War.

name: connecticut
sentence: The resulting budget crisis helped elect Lowell Weicker as governor on a third-party ticket in 1990.

name: connecticut
sentence: Weicker's remedy was a state income tax which proved effective in balancing the budget, but only for the short-term.

name: connecticut
sentence: He did not run for a second term, in part because of this politically unpopular move.

name: connecticut
sentence: In 1992, initial construction was completed on Foxwoods Casino at the Mashantucket Pequots reservation in eastern Connecticut, which became the largest casino in the Western Hemisphere.

name: connecticut
sentence: Mohegan Sun followed four years later.

name: connecticut
sentence: In 2000, presidential candidate Al Gore chose Senatortor Joe Lieberman as his running mate, marking the first time that a major party presidential ticket included someone of the Jewish faith.

name: connecticut
sentence: Gore and Lieberman fell five votes short of George W. Bush and Dick Cheney in the Electoral College.In the terrorist attacks of September 11, 2001, 65 state residents were killed, mostly Fairfield County residents who were working in the World Trade Center.In 2004, Republican Governor John G. Rowland resigned during a corruption investigation, later pleading guilty to federal charges.Connecticut was hit by three major storms in just over 14 months in 2011 and 2012, with all three causing extensive property damage and electric outages.

name: connecticut
sentence: Hurricane Irene struck Connecticut August 28, and damage totaled $235 million.

name: connecticut
sentence: Two months later, the "Halloween nor'easter" dropped extensive snow onto trees, resulting in snapped branches and trunks that damaged power lines; some areas were without electricity for 11 days.

name: connecticut
sentence: Hurricane Sandy had tropical storm-force winds when it reached Connecticut October 29, 2012.

name: connecticut
sentence: Sandy's winds drove storm surges into streets and cut power to 98% of homes and businesses, with more than $360 million in damage.

name: connecticut
sentence: On December 14, 2012, Adam Lanza shot and killed 26 people at Sandy Hook Elementary School in Newtown, and then killed himself.

name: connecticut
sentence: The massacre spurred renewed efforts by activists for tighter laws on gun ownership nationally.

name: connecticut
sentence: In the summer and fall of 2016, Connecticut experienced a drought in many parts of the state, causing some water-use bans.

name: connecticut
sentence: As of November 15, 2016 (2016-11-15), 45% of the state was listed at Severe Drought by the US Drought Monitor, including almost all of Hartford and Litchfield counties.

name: connecticut
sentence: All the rest of the state was in Moderate Drought or Severe Drought, including Middlesex, Fairfield, New London, New Haven, Windham, and Tolland counties.

name: connecticut
sentence: This affected the agricultural economy in the state.

name: connecticut
sentence: The United States Census Bureau estimates that the population of Connecticut was 3,565,287 on July 1, 2019, a 0.25% decrease since the 2010 United States Census.

name: connecticut
sentence: As of 2019, Connecticut had an estimated population of 3,565,287, which is a decrease of 7,378 (0.25%) from the prior year and a decrease of 8,810 (0.25%) since 2010.

name: connecticut
sentence: This includes a natural increase since the last census of 67,427 (222,222 births minus 154,795 deaths) and an increase due to net migration of 41,718 people into the state.

name: connecticut
sentence: Immigration from outside the United States resulted in a net increase of 75,991 people, and migration within the country produced a net loss of 34,273.

name: connecticut
sentence: Based on the 2005 estimates, Connecticut moved from 29th most populous state to 30th.

name: connecticut
sentence: 2018 estimates put Connecticut's population at 3,572,665.

name: connecticut
sentence: 6.6% of its population was reported as being under 5 years old, 24.7% under 18 years old, and 13.8% were 65 years of age or older.

name: connecticut
sentence: Females made up approximately 51.6% of the population, with 48.4% male.

name: connecticut
sentence: In 1790, 97% of the population in Connecticut was classified as "rural".

name: connecticut
sentence: The first census in which less than half the population was classified as rural was 1890.

name: connecticut
sentence: In the 2000 census, only 12.3% was considered rural.

name: connecticut
sentence: Most of western and southern Connecticut (particularly the Gold Coast) is strongly associated with New York City

name: connecticut
sentence: The center of population of Connecticut is located in the town of Cheshire.

name: connecticut
sentence: As of the 2010 United States Census, Connecticut's race and ethnic percentages were:

name: connecticut
sentence: Hispanics and Latinos of any race made up 13.4% of the population in the 2010 Census.

name: connecticut
sentence: The state's most populous ethnic group is Non-Hispanic White, but this has declined from 98% in 1940 to 71% in 2010.

name: connecticut
sentence: As of 2004, 11.4% of the population (400,000) was foreign-born.

name: connecticut
sentence: In 1870, native-born Americans had accounted for 75% of the state's population, but that had dropped to 35% by 1918.

name: connecticut
sentence: As of 2000, 81.69% of Connecticut residents age 5 and older spoke English at home and 8.42% spoke Spanish, followed by Italian at 1.59%, French at 1.31%, and Polish at 1.20%.

name: connecticut
sentence: The largest European ancestry groups are:

name: connecticut
sentence: As of 2011, 46.1% of Connecticut's population younger than age 1 were minorities.

name: connecticut
sentence: Note: Births in table do not add up, because Hispanics are counted both by their ethnicity and by their race, giving a higher overall number.

name: connecticut
sentence: The religious affiliations of the people of Connecticut as of 2014:

name: connecticut
sentence: A Pew survey of Connecticut residents' religious self-identification showed the following distribution of affiliations: Protestant 35%, Mormonism 1%, Jewish 3%, Roman Catholic 33%, Orthodox 1%, Non-religious 28%, Jehovah's Witness 1%, Hinduism 1%, Buddhism 1% and Islam 1%.

name: connecticut
sentence: Jewish congregations had 108,280 (3.2%) members in 2000.

name: connecticut
sentence: The Jewish population is concentrated in the towns near Long Island Sound between Greenwich and New Haven, in Greater New Haven and in Greater Hartford, especially the suburb of West Hartford.

name: connecticut
sentence: According to the Association of Religion Data Archives, the largest Christian denominations, by number of adherents, in 2010 were: the Catholic Church, with 1,252,936; the United Church of Christ, with 96,506; and non-denominational Evangelical Protestants, with 72,863.

name: connecticut
sentence: Recent immigration has brought other non-Christian religions to the state, but the numbers of adherents of other religions are still low.

name: connecticut
sentence: Connecticut is also home to New England's largest Protestant Church: The First Cathedral in Bloomfield, Connecticut located in Hartford County.

name: connecticut
sentence: Hartford is seat to the Roman Catholic Archdiocese of Hartford, which is sovereign over the Diocese of Bridgeport and the Diocese of Norwich.

name: connecticut
sentence: Connecticut's economic output in 2019 as measured by gross domestic product was $289 billion, up from $277.9 billion in 2018.

name: connecticut
sentence: Connecticut's per capita personal income in 2019 was estimated at $79,087, the highest of any state.

name: connecticut
sentence: There is, however, a great disparity in incomes throughout the state; after New York, Connecticut had the second largest gap nationwide between the average incomes of the top 1% and the average incomes of the bottom 99%.

name: connecticut
sentence: According to a 2018 study by Phoenix Marketing International, Connecticut had the third-largest number of millionaires per capita in the United States, with a ratio of 7.75%.

name: connecticut
sentence: New Canaan is the wealthiest town in Connecticut, with a per capita income of $85,459.

name: connecticut
sentence: Hartford is the poorest municipality in Connecticut, with a per capita income of $13,428 in 2000.

name: connecticut
sentence: As of December 2019, Connecticut's seasonally adjusted unemployment rate was 3.8%, with US unemployment at 3.5% that month.

name: connecticut
sentence: Dating back to 1982, Connecticut recorded its lowest unemployment in 2000 between August and October, at 2.2%.

name: connecticut
sentence: The highest unemployment rate during that period occurred in November and December 2010 at 9.3%, but economists expect record new levels of layoffs as a result of business closures in the spring of 2020 as the result of the coronavirus pandemic.

name: connecticut
sentence: Tax is collected by the Connecticut Department of Revenue Services and by local municipalities.

name: connecticut
sentence: As of 2012, Connecticut residents had the second highest rate in the nation of combined state and local taxes after New York, at 12.6% of income compared to the national average of 9.9% as reported by the Tax Foundation.

name: connecticut
sentence: Before 1991, Connecticut had an investment-only income tax system.

name: connecticut
sentence: Income from employment was untaxed, but income from investments was taxed at 13%, the highest rate in the US, with no deductions allowed for costs of producing the investment income, such as interest on borrowing.

name: connecticut
sentence: In 1991, under Governor Lowell P. Weicker Jr., an independent, the system was changed to one in which the taxes on employment income and investment income were equalized at a maximum rate of 4%.

name: connecticut
sentence: The new tax policy drew investment firms to Connecticut; as of 2019, Fairfield County was home to the headquarters for 16 of the 200 largest hedge funds in the world.

name: connecticut
sentence: As of 2019, the income tax rates on Connecticut individuals were divided into seven tax brackets of 3% (on income up to $10,000); 5% ($10,000-$50,000); 5.5% ($50,000-$100,000); 6% ($100,000-$200,000); 6.5% ($200,000-$250,000); 6.9% ($250,000-$500,000); and 6.99% above $500,000, with additional amounts owed depending on the bracket.

name: connecticut
sentence: All wages of Connecticut residents are subject to the state's income tax, even if earned outside the state.

name: connecticut
sentence: However, in those cases, Connecticut income tax must be withheld only to the extent the Connecticut tax exceeds the amount withheld by the other jurisdiction.

name: connecticut
sentence: Since New York has higher income tax rates than Connecticut, this effectively means that Connecticut residents who work in New York have no Connecticut income tax withheld.

name: connecticut
sentence: Connecticut permits a credit for taxes paid to other jurisdictions, but since residents who work in other states are still subject to Connecticut income taxation, they may owe taxes if the jurisdictional credit does not fully offset the Connecticut tax amount.

name: connecticut
sentence: Connecticut levies a 6.35% state sales tax on the retail sale, lease, or rental of most goods.

name: connecticut
sentence: Some items and services in general are not subject to sales and use taxes unless specifically enumerated as taxable by statute.

name: connecticut
sentence: A provision excluding clothing under $50 from sales tax was repealed as of July 1, 2011.

name: connecticut
sentence: There are no additional sales taxes imposed by local jurisdictions.

name: connecticut
sentence: In 2001, Connecticut instituted what became an annual sales tax "holiday" each August lasting one week, when retailers do not have to remit sales tax on certain items and quantities of clothing that has varied from year to year.

name: connecticut
sentence: State law authorizes municipalities to tax property, including real estate, vehicles and other personal property, with state statute providing varying exemptions, credits and abatements.

name: connecticut
sentence: All assessments are at 70% of fair market value.

name: connecticut
sentence: The maximum property tax credit is $200 per return and any excess may not be refunded or carried forward.

name: connecticut
sentence: According to the Tax Foundation, on a per capita basis in the 2017 fiscal year Connecticut residents paid the 3rd highest average property taxes in the nation after New Hampshire and New Jersey.

name: connecticut
sentence: As of January 1, 2020, gasoline taxes and fees in Connecticut were 40.13 cents per gallon, 11th highest in the United States which had a nationwide average of 36.13 cents a gallon excluding federal taxes.

name: connecticut
sentence: Diesel taxes and fees as of January 2020 in Connecticut were 46.50 cents per gallon, ninth highest nationally with the US average at 37.91 cents.

name: connecticut
sentence: In 2019, sales of single-family homes in Connecticut totaled 33,146 units, a 2.1 percent decline from the 2018 transaction total.

name: connecticut
sentence: The median home sold in 2019 recorded a transaction amount of $260,000, up 0.4 percent from 2018.

name: connecticut
sentence: Connecticut had the seventh highest rate of home foreclosure activity in the country in 2019 at 0.53 percent of the total housing stock.

name: connecticut
sentence: Finance, insurance and real estate was Connecticut's largest industry in 2018 as ranked by gross domestic product, generating $75.7 billion in GDP that year.

name: connecticut
sentence: Major financial industry employers include The Hartford, Travelers, Cigna, the Aetna subsidiary of CVS Health, Mass Mutual, People's United Financial, Bank of America, Realogy, Bridgewater Associates, GE Capital, William Raveis Real Estate, and Berkshire Hathaway through reinsurance and residential real estate subsidiaries.

name: connecticut
sentence: The combined educational, health and social services sector was the largest single industry as ranked by employment, with a combined workforce of 342,600 people at the end of 2019, ranking fourth the year before in GDP at $28.3 billion.

name: connecticut
sentence: The broad business and professional services sector had the second highest GDP total in Connecticut in 2018 at an estimated $33.7 billion.

name: connecticut
sentence: Manufacturing was the third biggest industry in 2018 with GDP of $30.8 billion, dominated by Raytheon Technologies formed in the March 2020 merger of Hartford-based United Technologies and Waltham, Mass.-based Raytheon Co. As of the merger, Raytheon Technologies employed about 19,000 people in Connecticut through subsidiaries Pratt & Whitney and Collins Aerospace.

name: connecticut
sentence: Lockheed Martin subsidiary Sikorsky Aircraft operates Connecticut's single largest manufacturing plant in Stratford, where it makes helicopters.

name: connecticut
sentence: Other major manufacturers include the Electric Boat division of General Dynamics, which makes submarines in Groton, Boehringer Ingelheim, a pharmaceuticals manufacturer with its US headquarters in Ridgefield, and ASML, which in Wilton makes precision lithography machines used to create circuitry on semiconductors and flat-screen displays.

name: connecticut
sentence: Connecticut historically was a center of gun manufacturing, and four gun-manufacturing firms continued to operate in the state as of December 2012, employing 2,000 people: Colt, Stag, Ruger, and Mossberg.

name: connecticut
sentence: Marlin, owned by Remington, closed in April 2011.

name: connecticut
sentence: Other large components of the Connecticut economy in 2018 included wholesale trade ($18.1 billion in GDP); information services ($13.8 billion); retail ($13.7 billion); arts, entertainment and food services ($9.1 billion); and construction ($8.3 billion).

name: connecticut
sentence: Tourists spent $9.3 billion in Connecticut in 2017 according to estimates as part of a series of studies commissioned by the state of Connecticut.

name: connecticut
sentence: Foxwoods Resort Casino and Mohegan Sun are the two biggest tourist draws and number among the state's largest employers

name: connecticut
sentence: Connecticut's agricultural production totaled $580 million in 2017, with just over half of that revenue the result of nursery stock production.

name: connecticut
sentence: Milk production totaled $81 million that year, with other major product categories including eggs, vegetables and fruit, tobacco and shellfish.

name: connecticut
sentence: The Interstate highways in the state are Interstate 95 (I-95) traveling southwest to northeast along the coast, I-84 traveling southwest to northeast in the center of the state, I-91 traveling north to south in the center of the state, and I-395 traveling north to south near the eastern border of the state.

name: connecticut
sentence: The other major highways in Connecticut are the Merritt Parkway and Wilbur Cross Parkway, which together form Connecticut Route 15 (Route 15), traveling from the Hutchinson River Parkway in New York parallel to I-95 before turning north of New Haven and traveling parallel to I-91, finally becoming a surface road in Berlin.

name: connecticut
sentence: I-95 and Route 15 were originally toll roads

name: connecticut
sentence: A series of major crashes at these plazas eventually contributed to the decision to remove the tolls in 1988.

name: connecticut
sentence: Other major arteries in the state include US Route 7 (US 7) in the west traveling parallel to the New York state line, Route 8 farther east near the industrial city of Waterbury and traveling north–south along the Naugatuck River Valley nearly parallel with US 7, and Route 9 in the east.

name: connecticut
sentence: Between New Haven and New York City, I-95 is one of the most congested highways in the United States.

name: connecticut
sentence: Although I-95 has been widened in several spots, some areas are only three lanes and this strains traffic capacity, resulting in frequent and lengthy rush hour delays.

name: connecticut
sentence: Frequently, the congestion spills over to clog the parallel Merritt Parkway and even US 1.

name: connecticut
sentence: The state has encouraged traffic reduction schemes, including rail use and ride-sharing.

name: connecticut
sentence: Connecticut also has a very active bicycling community, with one of the highest rates of bicycle ownership and use in the United States, particularly in New Haven.

name: connecticut
sentence: According to the US Census 2006 American Community Survey, New Haven has the highest percentage of commuters who bicycle to work of any major metropolitan center on the East Coast.

name: connecticut
sentence: Rail is a popular travel mode between New Haven and New York City's Grand Central Terminal.

name: connecticut
sentence: Southwestern Connecticut is served by the Metro-North Railroad's New Haven Line, operated by the Metropolitan Transportation Authority and providing commuter service to New York City and New Haven, with branches servicing New Canaan, Danbury, and Waterbury.

name: connecticut
sentence: Connecticut lies along Amtrak's Northeast Corridor which features frequent Northeast Regional and Acela Express service from New Haven south to New York City, Philadelphia, Baltimore, Washington, DC, and Norfolk, VA.

name: connecticut
sentence: Coastal cities and towns between New Haven and New London are also served by the Shore Line East commuter line.

name: connecticut
sentence: Several new stations were completed along the Connecticut shoreline recently, and a commuter rail service called the Hartford Line between New Haven and Springfield on Amtrak's New Haven-Springfield Line began operating in June 2018.A proposed commuter rail service, the Central Corridor Rail Line, will connect New London with Norwich, Willimantic, Storrs, and Stafford Springs, with service continuing into Massachusetts and Brattleboro.

name: connecticut
sentence: Amtrak also operates a shuttle service (CTRail) between New Haven and Springfield, Massachusetts, serving Wallingford, Meriden, Berlin, Hartford, Windsor Locks, and Springfield, MA and the Vermonter runs from Washington to St. Albans, Vermont via the same line.

name: connecticut
sentence: Statewide bus service is supplied by Connecticut Transit, owned by the Connecticut Department of Transportation, with smaller municipal authorities providing local service.

name: connecticut
sentence: Bus networks are an important part of the transportation system in Connecticut, especially in urban areas like Hartford, Stamford, Norwalk, Bridgeport and New Haven.

name: connecticut
sentence: Connecticut Transit also operates CTfastrak, a bus rapid transit service between New Britain and Hartford.

name: connecticut
sentence: The bus route opened to the public on March 28, 2015.

name: connecticut
sentence: Bradley International Airport, is located in Windsor Locks, 15 miles (24 km) north of Hartford.

name: connecticut
sentence: Many residents of central and southern Connecticut also make heavy use of JFK International Airport and Newark International Airports, especially for international travel.

name: connecticut
sentence: Smaller regional air service is provided at Tweed New Haven Regional Airport.

name: connecticut
sentence: Larger civil airports include Danbury Municipal Airport and Waterbury-Oxford Airport in western Connecticut, Hartford–Brainard Airport in central Connecticut, and Groton-New London Airport in eastern Connecticut.

name: connecticut
sentence: Sikorsky Memorial Airport is located in Stratford and mostly services cargo, helicopter and private aviation.

name: connecticut
sentence: The Bridgeport & Port Jefferson Ferry travels between Bridgeport, Connecticut and Port Jefferson, New York by crossing Long Island Sound.

name: connecticut
sentence: Ferry service also operates out of New London to Orient, New York; Fishers Island, New York; and Block Island, Rhode Island, which are popular tourist destinations.

name: connecticut
sentence: Small local services operate the Rocky Hill–Glastonbury Ferry and the Chester–Hadlyme Ferry which cross the Connecticut River.

name: connecticut
sentence: Hartford has been the sole capital of Connecticut since 1875.

name: connecticut
sentence: Before then, New Haven and Hartford alternated as capitals.

name: connecticut
sentence: Connecticut is known as the "Constitution State".

name: connecticut
sentence: The origin of this nickname is uncertain, but it likely comes from Connecticut's pivotal role in the federal constitutional convention of 1787, during which Roger Sherman and Oliver Ellsworth helped to orchestrate what became known as the Connecticut Compromise, or the Great Compromise.

name: connecticut
sentence: This plan combined the Virginia Plan and the New Jersey Plan to form a bicameral legislature, a form copied by almost every state constitution since the adoption of the federal constitution.

name: connecticut
sentence: Variations of the bicameral legislature had been proposed by Virginia and New Jersey, but Connecticut's plan was the one that was in effect until the early 20th century, when Senatortors ceased to be selected by their state legislatures and were instead directly elected.

name: connecticut
sentence: Otherwise, it is still the design of Congress.

name: connecticut
sentence: The nickname also might refer to the Fundamental Orders of 1638–39.

name: connecticut
sentence: These Fundamental Orders represent the framework for the first formal Connecticut state government written by a representative body in Connecticut.

name: connecticut
sentence: The State of Connecticut government has operated under the direction of four separate documents in the course of the state's constitutional history.

name: connecticut
sentence: After the Fundamental Orders, Connecticut was granted governmental authority by King Charles II of England through the Connecticut Charter of 1662.

name: connecticut
sentence: Separate branches of government did not exist during this period, and the General Assembly acted as the supreme authority.

name: connecticut
sentence: A constitution similar to the modern US Constitution was not adopted in Connecticut until 1818.

name: connecticut
sentence: Finally, the current state constitution was implemented in 1965.

name: connecticut
sentence: The 1965 constitution absorbed a majority of its 1818 predecessor, but incorporated a handful of important modifications.

name: connecticut
sentence: The governor heads the executive branch.

name: connecticut
sentence: As of 2020, Ned Lamont is the Governor and Susan Bysiewicz is the Lieutenant Governor; both are Democrats.

name: connecticut
sentence: From 1639 until the adoption of the 1818 constitution, the governor presided over the General Assembly.

name: connecticut
sentence: In 1974, Ella Grasso was elected as the governor of Connecticut.

name: connecticut
sentence: This was the first time in United States history when a woman was a governor without her husband being governor first.

name: connecticut
sentence: There are several executive departments: Administrative Services, Agriculture, Banking, Children and Families, Consumer Protection, Correction, Economic and Community Development, Developmental Services, Construction Services, Education, Emergency Management and Public Protection, Energy & Environmental Protection, Higher Education, Insurance, Labor, Mental Health and Addiction Services, Military, Motor Vehicles, Public Health, Public Utility Regulatory Authority, Public Works, Revenue Services, Social Services, Transportation, and Veterans Affairs.

name: connecticut
sentence: In addition to these departments, there are other independent bureaus, offices and commissions.

name: connecticut
sentence: In addition to the Governor and Lieutenant Governor, there are four other executive officers named in the state constitution that are elected directly by voters: Secretary of the State, Treasurer, Comptroller, and Attorney General.

name: connecticut
sentence: All executive officers are elected to four-year terms.

name: connecticut
sentence: The legislature is the General Assembly.

name: connecticut
sentence: The General Assembly is a bicameral body consisting of an upper body, the State Senatorte (36 senators); and a lower body, the House of Representatives (151 representatives).

name: connecticut
sentence: Bills must pass each house in order to become law.

name: connecticut
sentence: The governor can veto the bill, but this veto can be overridden by a two-thirds majority in each house.

name: connecticut
sentence: Per Article XV of the state constitution, Senatortors and Representatives must be at least 18 years of age and are elected to two-year terms in November on even-numbered years.

name: connecticut
sentence: There also must always be between 30 and 50 senators and 125 to 225 representatives.

name: connecticut
sentence: The Lieutenant Governor presides over the Senatorte, except when absent from the chamber, when the President pro tempore presides.

name: connecticut
sentence: The Speaker of the House presides over the House.

name: connecticut
sentence: As of 2020, Joe Aresimowicz is the Speaker of the House of Connecticut.

name: connecticut
sentence: As of 2019, Connecticut's United States Senatortors are Richard Blumenthal (Democrat) and Chris Murphy (Democrat).

name: connecticut
sentence: Connecticut has five representatives in the US House, all of whom are Democrats.

name: connecticut
sentence: Locally elected representatives also develop Local ordinances to govern cities and towns.

name: connecticut
sentence: The town ordinances often include noise control and zoning guidelines.

name: connecticut
