sentence: However, the State of Connecticut also provides statewide ordinances for noise control as well.

name: connecticut
sentence: The highest court of Connecticut's judicial branch is the Connecticut Supreme Court, headed by the Chief Justice of Connecticut.

name: connecticut
sentence: The Supreme Court is responsible for deciding on the constitutionality of the law or cases as they relate to the law.

name: connecticut
sentence: Its proceedings are similar to those of the United States Supreme Court, with no testimony given by witnesses, and the lawyers of the two sides each present oral arguments no longer than thirty minutes.

name: connecticut
sentence: Following a court proceeding, the court may take several months to arrive at a judgment.

name: connecticut
sentence: As of 2020 the Chief Justice is Richard A. Robinson.

name: connecticut
sentence: In 1818, the court became a separate entity, independent of the legislative and executive branches.

name: connecticut
sentence: The Appellate Court is a lesser statewide court and the Superior Courts are lower courts that resemble county courts of other states.

name: connecticut
sentence: The State of Connecticut also offers access to Arrest warrant enforcement statistics through the Office of Policy and Management.

name: connecticut
sentence: Connecticut does not have county government, unlike all other states except Rhode Island.

name: connecticut
sentence: Connecticut county governments were mostly eliminated in 1960, with the exception of sheriffs elected in each county.

name: connecticut
sentence: In 2000, the county sheriff was abolished and replaced with the state marshal system, which has districts that follow the old county territories.

name: connecticut
sentence: The judicial system is divided into judicial districts at the trial-court level which largely follow the old county lines.

name: connecticut
sentence: The eight counties are still widely used for purely geographical and statistical purposes, such as weather reports and census reporting.

name: connecticut
sentence: Connecticut shares with the rest of New England a governmental institution called the New England town.

name: connecticut
sentence: The state is divided into 169 towns which serve as the fundamental political jurisdictions.

name: connecticut
sentence: There are also 21 cities, most of which simply follow the boundaries of their namesake towns and have a merged city-town government.

name: connecticut
sentence: There are two exceptions: the City of Groton, which is a subsection of the Town of Groton, and the City of Winsted in the Town of Winchester.

name: connecticut
sentence: There are also nine incorporated boroughs which may provide additional services to a section of town.

name: connecticut
sentence: Naugatuck is a consolidated town and borough.

name: connecticut
sentence: The state is also divided into nine regional councils of government defined by the state Office of Planning and Management, which facilitate regional planning and coordination of services between member towns.

name: connecticut
sentence: The Intragovernmental Policy Division of this Office coordinates regional planning with the administrative bodies of these regions.

name: connecticut
sentence: Each region has an administrative body made up chief executive officers of the member towns.

name: connecticut
sentence: The regions are established for the purpose of planning "coordination of regional and state planning activities; redesignation of logical planning regions and promotion of the continuation of regional planning organizations within the state; and provision for technical aid and the administration of financial assistance to regional planning organizations".

name: connecticut
sentence: Connecticut residents who register to vote may declare an affiliation to a political party, may become unaffiliated at will, and may change affiliations subject to certain waiting periods.

name: connecticut
sentence: As of 2018 about 60% of registered voters are enrolled (just over 1% total in 28 third parties minor parties), and ratios among unaffiliated voters and the two major parties are about eight unaffiliated for every seven in the Democratic Party of Connecticut and for every four in the Connecticut Republican Party.

name: connecticut
sentence: (Among the minor parties, the Libertarian Party and Green Party appeared in the Presidential-electors column in 2016, and drew, respectively, 2.96% and 1.39% of the vote.)

name: connecticut
sentence: Many Connecticut towns and cities show a marked preference for moderate candidates of either party.

name: connecticut
sentence: In April 2012 both houses of the Connecticut state legislature passed a bill (20 to 16 and 86 to 62) that abolished the capital punishment for all future crimes, while 11 inmates who were waiting on the death row at the time could still be executed.

name: connecticut
sentence: In July 2009 the Connecticut legislature overrode a veto by Governor M. Jodi Rell to pass SustiNet, the first significant public-option health care reform legislation in the nation.

name: connecticut
sentence: Connecticut ranked third in the nation for educational performance, according to Education Week's Quality Counts 2018 report.

name: connecticut
sentence: It earned an overall score of 83.5 out of 100 points.

name: connecticut
sentence: On average, the country received a score of 75.2.Connecticut posted a B-plus in the Chance-for-Success category, ranking fourth on factors that contribute to a person's success both within and outside the K-12 education system.

name: connecticut
sentence: Connecticut received a mark of B-plus and finished fourth for School Finance.

name: connecticut
sentence: It ranked 12th with a grade of C on the K-12 Achievement Index.

name: connecticut
sentence: The Connecticut State Board of Education manages the public school system for children in grades K–12.

name: connecticut
sentence: Board of Education members are appointed by the Governor of Connecticut.

name: connecticut
sentence: Statistics for each school are made available to the public through an online database system called "CEDAR".

name: connecticut
sentence: The CEDAR database also provides statistics for "ACES" or "RESC" schools for children with behavioral disorders.

name: connecticut
sentence: Connecticut was home to the nation's first law school, Litchfield Law School, which operated from 1773 to 1833 in Litchfield.

name: connecticut
sentence: Hartford Public High School (1638) is the third-oldest secondary school in the nation after the Collegiate School (1628) in Manhattan and the Boston Latin School (1635).

name: connecticut
sentence: The state also has many noted private day schools, and its boarding schools draw students from around the world.

name: connecticut
sentence: There are two Connecticut teams in the American Hockey League.

name: connecticut
sentence: The Bridgeport Sound Tigers is a farm team for the New York Islanders which competes at the Webster Bank Arena in Bridgeport.

name: connecticut
sentence: The Hartford Wolf Pack is the affiliate of the New York Rangers

name: connecticut
sentence: The Hartford Yard Goats of the Eastern League are a AA affiliate of the Colorado Rockies.

name: connecticut
sentence: Also, the Norwich Sea Unicorns play in the New York-Penn League and are an A affiliate of the Detroit Tigers.

name: connecticut
sentence: The New Britain Bees play in the Atlantic League of Professional Baseball.

name: connecticut
sentence: The Connecticut Sun of the WNBA currently play at the Mohegan Sun Arena in Uncasville.

name: connecticut
sentence: In soccer, Hartford Athletic began play in the USL Championship in 2019, serving as the reserve team for the New England Revolution of Major League Soccer.

name: connecticut
sentence: The state hosts several major sporting events.

name: connecticut
sentence: Since 1952, a PGA Tour golf tournament has been played in the Hartford area.

name: connecticut
sentence: It was originally called the "Insurance City Open" and later the "Greater Hartford Open" and is now known as the Travelers Championship.

name: connecticut
sentence: The Connecticut Open tennis tournament is held annually in the Cullman-Heyman Tennis Center at Yale University in New Haven.

name: connecticut
sentence: Lime Rock Park in Salisbury is a 1.5-mile (2.4 km) road racing course, home to the International Motor Sports Association, SCCA, United States Auto Club, and K&N Pro Series East races.

name: connecticut
sentence: Thompson International Speedway, Stafford Motor Speedway, and Waterford Speedbowl are oval tracks holding weekly races for NASCAR Modifieds and other classes, including the NASCAR Whelen Modified Tour.

name: connecticut
sentence: The state also hosts several major mixed martial arts events for Bellator MMA and the Ultimate Fighting Championship.

name: connecticut
sentence: The Hartford Whalers of the National Hockey League played in Hartford from 1975 to 1997 at the Hartford Civic Center.

name: connecticut
sentence: They departed to Raleigh, North Carolina after disputes with the state over the construction of a new arena, and they are now known as the Carolina Hurricanes.

name: connecticut
sentence: In 1926, Hartford had a franchise in the National Football League known as the Hartford Blues.

name: connecticut
sentence: They joined the National League for one season in 1876, making them the state's only Major League baseball franchise before moving to Brooklyn, New York and then disbanding one season later.

name: connecticut
sentence: From 2000 until 2006 the city was home to the Hartford FoxForce of World TeamTennis.

name: connecticut
sentence: The Connecticut Huskies are the team of the University of Connecticut (UConn)

name: connecticut
sentence: Both the men's basketball and women's basketball teams have won multiple national championships.

name: connecticut
sentence: In 2004, UConn became the first school in NCAA Division I history to have its men's and women's basketball programs win the national title in the same year; they repeated the feat in 2014 and are still the only Division I school to win both titles in the same year.

name: connecticut
sentence: The UConn women's basketball team holds the record for the longest consecutive winning streak in NCAA college basketball at 111 games, a streak that ended in 2017.

name: connecticut
sentence: The UConn Huskies football team has played in the Football Bowl Subdivision since 2002, and has played in four bowl games.

name: connecticut
sentence: New Haven biennially hosts "The Game" between the Yale Bulldogs and the Harvard Crimson, the country's second-oldest college football rivalry.

name: connecticut
sentence: Yale alumnus Walter Camp is deemed the "Father of American Football", and he helped develop modern football while living in New Haven.

name: connecticut
sentence: Other Connecticut universities which feature Division I sports teams are Quinnipiac University, Fairfield University, Central Connecticut State University, Sacred Heart University, and the University of Hartford.

name: connecticut
sentence: The Constitution State Rivalry is an in-state college football rivalry between Sacred Heart University and Central Connecticut State University.

name: connecticut
sentence: Both teams compete at the NCAA Division 1 Football Championship Subdivision level in the Northeast Conference.

name: connecticut
sentence: Since 1998, the game has been played annually with the location of the matchup determined on a yearly basis.

name: connecticut
sentence: The name "Connecticut" originated with the Mohegan word quonehtacut, meaning "place of long tidal river".

name: connecticut
sentence: Connecticut's official nickname is "The Constitution State", adopted in 1959 and based on its colonial constitution of 1638–1639 which was the first in America and, arguably, the world.

name: connecticut
sentence: Connecticut is also unofficially known as "The Nutmeg State," whose origin is unknown.

name: connecticut
sentence: It may have come from its sailors returning from voyages with nutmeg, which was a very valuable spice in the 18th and 19th centuries.

name: connecticut
sentence: It may have originated in the early machined sheet tin nutmeg grinders sold by early Connecticut peddlers.

name: connecticut
sentence: It is also facetiously said to come from Yankee peddlers from Connecticut who would sell small carved nobs of wood shaped to look like nutmeg to unsuspecting customers.

name: connecticut
sentence: George Washington gave Connecticut the title of "The Provisions State" because of the material aid that the state rendered to the American Revolutionary War effort.

name: connecticut
sentence: Connecticut is also known as "The Land of Steady Habits".

name: connecticut
sentence: According to Webster's New International Dictionary (1993), a person who is a native or resident of Connecticut is a "Connecticuter".

name: connecticut
sentence: There are numerous other terms coined in print but not in use, such as "Connecticotian" (Cotton Mather in 1702) and "Connecticutensian" (Samuel Peters in 1781).

name: connecticut
sentence: Linguist Allen Walker Read suggests the more playful term "connecticutie".

name: connecticut
sentence: "Nutmegger" is sometimes used, as is "Yankee".

name: connecticut
sentence: The official state song is "Yankee Doodle".

name: connecticut
sentence: The traditional abbreviation of the state's name is "Conn".

name: connecticut
sentence: Commemorative stamps issued by the United States Postal Service with Connecticut themes include Nathan Hale, Eugene O'Neill, Josiah Willard Gibbs, Noah Webster, Eli Whitney, the whaling ship the Charles W. Morgan, which is docked at Mystic Seaport, and a decoy of a broadbill duck.

name: delaware
sentence: Delaware ( (listen) DEL-ə-wair) is a state in the Mid-Atlantic region of the United States, bordering Maryland to its south and west; Pennsylvania to its north; and New Jersey and the Atlantic Ocean to its east.

name: delaware
sentence: The state takes its name from the nearby Delaware River named after Thomas West, 3rd Baron De La Warr, an English nobleman and Virginia's first colonial governor.

name: delaware
sentence: Delaware occupies the northeastern portion of the Delmarva Peninsula and some islands and territory within the Delaware River.

name: delaware
sentence: It is the second-smallest and sixth-least populous state, but also the sixth-most densely populated.

name: delaware
sentence: Delaware's largest city is Wilmington, while the state capital is Dover, the second-largest city in the state.

name: delaware
sentence: The state is divided into three counties, having the lowest number of any state; from north to south, they are New Castle County, Kent County, and Sussex County.

name: delaware
sentence: While the southern two counties have historically been predominantly agricultural, New Castle is more urbanized.

name: delaware
sentence: In a similar vein to Maryland, Delaware's geography, culture, and history combine elements of the Mid-Atlantic, Northeastern, and Southern regions of the country.

name: delaware
sentence: Before its coastline was explored by Europeans in the 16th century, Delaware was inhabited by several groups of Native Americans, including the Lenape in the north and Nanticoke in the south.

name: delaware
sentence: It was initially colonized by Dutch traders at Zwaanendael, near the present town of Lewes, in 1631.

name: delaware
sentence: Delaware was one of the 13 colonies participating in the American Revolution.

name: delaware
sentence: On December 7, 1787, Delaware became the first state to ratify the Constitution of the United States, and has since been known as The First State.

name: delaware
sentence: Since the turn of the 20th century, Delaware is also a de facto onshore corporate haven, in which by virtue of its corporate laws, the state is the domicile of over 50% of all NYSE-listed business and 60% of the Fortune 500.

name: delaware
sentence: The state was named after the Delaware River, which in turn derived its name from Thomas West, 3rd Baron De La Warr (1577–1618) who was the ruling governor of the Colony of Virginia at the time Europeans first explored the river.

name: delaware
sentence: The Delaware people, a name used by Europeans for Lenape people indigenous to the Delaware Valley, also derive their name from the same source.

name: delaware
sentence: The surname de La Warr comes from Sussex and is of Anglo-Norman origin.

name: delaware
sentence: It came probably from a Norman lieu-dit La Guerre.

name: delaware
sentence: This toponymic could derive from Latin ager, from the Breton gwern or from the Late Latin varectum (fallow).

name: delaware
sentence: The toponyms Gara, Gare, Gaire (the sound [ä] often mutated in [æ]) also appear in old texts cited by Lucien Musset, where the word ga(i)ra means gore.

name: delaware
sentence: It could also be linked with a patronymic from the Old Norse verr.

name: delaware
sentence: Delaware is 96 miles (154 km) long and ranges from 9 miles (14 km) to 35 miles (56 km) across, totaling 1,954 square miles (5,060 km2), making it the second-smallest state in the United States after Rhode Island.

name: delaware
sentence: Delaware is bounded to the north by Pennsylvania; to the east by the Delaware River, Delaware Bay, New Jersey and the Atlantic Ocean; and to the west and south by Maryland.

name: delaware
sentence: Small portions of Delaware are also situated on the eastern side of the Delaware River sharing land boundaries with New Jersey.

name: delaware
sentence: The state of Delaware, together with the Eastern Shore counties of Maryland and two counties of Virginia, form the Delmarva Peninsula, which stretches down the Mid-Atlantic Coast.

name: delaware
sentence: The definition of the northern boundary of the state is unusual.

name: delaware
sentence: Most of the boundary between Delaware and Pennsylvania was originally defined by an arc extending 12 miles (19.3 km) from the cupola of the courthouse in the city of New Castle.

name: delaware
sentence: This boundary is often referred to as the Twelve-Mile Circle.

name: delaware
sentence: Although the Twelve-Mile Circle is often claimed to be the only territorial boundary in the US that is a true arc, the Mexican boundary with Texas includes several arcs, and many cities in the South (such as Plains, Georgia) also have circular boundaries.

name: delaware
sentence: This border extends all the way east to the low-tide mark on the New Jersey shore, then continues south along the shoreline until it again reaches the 12-mile (19 km) arc in the south; then the boundary continues in a more conventional way in the middle of the main channel (thalweg) of the Delaware River.

name: delaware
sentence: To the west, a portion of the arc extends past the easternmost edge of Maryland.

name: delaware
sentence: The remaining western border runs slightly east of due south from its intersection with the arc.

name: delaware
sentence: The Wedge of land between the northwest part of the arc and the Maryland border was claimed by both Delaware and Pennsylvania until 1921, when Delaware's claim was confirmed.

name: delaware
sentence: Delaware is on a level plain, with the lowest mean elevation of any state in the nation.

name: delaware
sentence: Its highest elevation, located at Ebright Azimuth, near Concord High School, is less than 450 feet (140 m) above sea level.

name: delaware
sentence: The northernmost part of the state is part of the Piedmont Plateau with hills and rolling surfaces.

name: delaware
sentence: The Atlantic Seaboard fall line approximately follows the Robert Kirkwood Highway between Newark and Wilmington; south of this road is the Atlantic Coastal Plain with flat, sandy, and, in some parts, swampy ground.

name: delaware
sentence: A ridge about 75 to 80 feet (23 to 24 m) high extends along the western boundary of the state and separates the watersheds that feed Delaware River and Bay to the east and the Chesapeake Bay to the west.

name: delaware
sentence: Since almost all of Delaware is a part of the Atlantic coastal plain, the effects of the ocean moderate its climate.

name: delaware
sentence: The state lies in the humid subtropical climate zone.

name: delaware
sentence: Despite its small size (roughly 100 miles (160 km) from its northernmost to southernmost points), there is significant variation in mean temperature and amount of snowfall between Sussex County and New Castle County.

name: delaware
sentence: Moderated by the Atlantic Ocean and Delaware Bay, the southern portion of the state has a milder climate and a longer growing season than the northern portion of the state.

name: delaware

sentence: Delaware does not assess a state-level tax on real or personal property.

name: delaware
sentence: Real estate is subject to county property taxes, school district property taxes, vocational school district taxes, and, if located within an incorporated area, municipal property taxes.

name: delaware
sentence: Gambling provides significant revenue to the state.

name: delaware
sentence: For instance, the casino at Delaware Park Racetrack provided more than $100 million to the state in 2010.

name: delaware
sentence: In June 2018, Delaware became the first US state to legalize sports betting following the Supreme Court ruling to repeal The Professional and Amateur Sports Protection Act (PASPA).

name: delaware
sentence: Wilmington is the state's most populous city (70,635) and its economic hub.

name: delaware
sentence: It is located within commuting distance of both Philadelphia and Baltimore.

name: delaware
sentence: Dover is the state capital and the second most populous city (38,079).

name: delaware
sentence: The table below lists the ten largest municipalities in the state based on the 2018 United States Census Estimate.

name: delaware
sentence: In the early 1920s, Pierre S. du Pont served as president of the state board of education.

name: delaware
sentence: At the time, state law prohibited money raised from white taxpayers from being used to support the state's schools for black children.

name: delaware
sentence: Appalled by the condition of the black schools, du Pont donated four million dollars to construct 86 new school buildings.

name: delaware
sentence: Delaware was the origin of Belton v. Gebhart (1952), one of the four cases which were combined into Brown v. Board of Education, the Supreme Court of the United States decision that led to the end of officially segregated public schools.

name: delaware
sentence: Significantly, Belton was the only case in which the state court found for the plaintiffs, thereby ruling that segregation is unconstitutional.

name: delaware
sentence: Unlike many states, Delaware's educational system is centralized in a state Superintendent of Education, with local school boards retaining control over taxation and some curriculum decisions.

name: delaware
sentence: This centralized system, combined with the small size of the state, likely contributed to Delaware becoming the first state, after completion of a three-year, $30 million program ending in 1999, to wire every K-12 classroom in the state to the Internet.

name: delaware
sentence: As of 2011, the Delaware Department of Education had authorized the founding of 25 charter schools in the state, one of them being all-girls.

name: delaware
sentence: All teachers in the State's public school districts are unionized.

name: delaware
sentence: As of January 2012, none of the State's charter schools are members of a teachers union.

name: delaware
sentence: One of the State's teachers' unions is Delaware State Education Association (DSEA), whose President as of January 2012 is Frederika Jenner.

name: delaware
sentence: Delaware's sister state in Japan is Miyagi Prefecture.

name: delaware
sentence: Two daily newspapers are based in Delaware, the Delaware State News, based in Dover and covering the two southern counties, and The News Journal covering Wilmington and northern Delaware.

name: delaware
sentence: The state is also served by several weekly, monthly and online publications.

name: delaware
sentence: No standalone television stations are based solely in Delaware.

name: delaware
sentence: The northern part of the state is served by network stations in Philadelphia and the southern part by network stations in Salisbury, Maryland.

name: delaware
sentence: Philadelphia's ABC affiliate, WPVI-TV, maintains a news bureau in downtown Wilmington.

name: delaware
sentence: Salisbury's CBS affiliate, WBOC-TV, maintains bureaus in Dover and Milton.

name: delaware
sentence: Three Philadelphia-market stations—PBS member WHYY-TV, Ion affiliate WPPX, and MeTV affiliate WDPN-TV—all have Wilmington as their city of license, but maintain transmitters at the market antenna farm in Roxborough and do not produce any Delaware-centric programming.

name: delaware
sentence: Delaware is home to First State National Historical Park, a National Park Service unit composed of historic sites across the state including the New Castle Court House, Green, and Sheriff's House, Dover Green, Beaver Valley, Fort Christina, Old Swedes' Church, John Dickinson Plantation, and the Ryves Holt House.

name: delaware
sentence: Delaware has several museums, wildlife refuges, parks, houses, lighthouses, and other historic places.

name: delaware
sentence: Rehoboth Beach, together with the towns of Lewes, Dewey Beach, Bethany Beach, South Bethany, and Fenwick Island, comprise Delaware's beach resorts.

name: delaware
sentence: Rehoboth Beach often bills itself as "The Nation's Summer Capital" because it is a frequent summer vacation destination for Washington, D.C., residents as well as visitors from Maryland, Virginia, and in lesser numbers, Pennsylvania.

name: delaware
sentence: Vacationers are drawn for many reasons, including the town's charm, artistic appeal, nightlife, and tax-free shopping.

name: delaware
sentence: According to SeaGrant Delaware, the Delaware beaches generate $6.9 billion annually and over $711 million in tax revenue.

name: delaware
sentence: Delaware is home to several festivals, fairs, and events.

name: delaware
sentence: Some of the more notable festivals are the Riverfest held in Seaford, the World Championship Punkin Chunkin formerly held at various locations throughout the state since 1986, the Rehoboth Beach Chocolate Festival, the Bethany Beach Jazz Funeral to mark the end of summer, the Apple Scrapple Festival held in Bridgeville, the Clifford Brown Jazz Festival in Wilmington, the Rehoboth Beach Jazz Festival, the Sea Witch Halloween Festival and Parade in Rehoboth Beach, the Rehoboth Beach Independent Film Festival, the Nanticoke Indian Pow Wow in Oak Orchard, Firefly Music Festival, and the Return Day Parade held after every election in Georgetown.

name: delaware
sentence: In 2015, tourism in Delaware generated $3.1 billion, which makes up five percent of the state's GDP.

name: delaware
sentence: Delaware saw 8.5 million visitors in 2015, with the tourism industry employing 41,730 people, making it the 4th largest private employer in the state.

name: delaware
sentence: Major origin markets for Delaware tourists include Philadelphia, Baltimore, New York City, Washington, D.C., and Harrisburg, with 97% of tourists arriving to the state by car and 75% of tourists coming from a distance of 200 miles (320 km) or less.

name: delaware
sentence: Delaware is also home to two large sporting venues.

name: delaware
sentence: Dover International Speedway is a race track in Dover, and Frawley Stadium in Wilmington is the home of the Wilmington Blue Rocks, a Minor League Baseball team.

name: delaware
sentence: As Delaware has no franchises in the major American professional sports leagues, many Delawareans follow either Philadelphia or Baltimore teams.

name: delaware
sentence: In the WNBA, the Washington Mystics enjoy a major following due to the presence of Wilmington native and University of Delaware product Elena Delle Donne.

name: delaware
sentence: The University of Delaware's football team has a large following throughout the state, with the Delaware State University and Wesley College teams also enjoying a smaller degree of support.

name: delaware
sentence: Delaware is home to Dover International Speedway and Dover Downs.

name: delaware
sentence: DIS, also known as the Monster Mile, is one of only 10 tracks in the nation to have hosted 100 or more NASCAR Cup Series races.

name: delaware
sentence: Dover Downs is a popular harness racing facility.

name: delaware
sentence: It is the only co-located horse- and car-racing facility in the nation, with the Dover Downs track located inside the DIS track.

name: delaware
sentence: Delaware is represented in rugby by the Delaware Black Foxes, a 2015 expansion club.

name: delaware
sentence: Delaware has been home to professional wrestling outfit Combat Zone Wrestling (CZW).

name: delaware
sentence: CZW has been affiliated with the annual Tournament of Death and ECWA with its annual Super 8 Tournament.

name: delaware
sentence: Delaware's official state sport is bicycling.

name: delaware
sentence: Delaware is also the name of a Native American group (called in their own language Lenni Lenape) which was influential in the colonial period of the United States and is today headquartered in Cheswold, Kent County, Delaware.

name: delaware
sentence: A band of the Nanticoke tribe of American Indians today resides in Sussex County and is headquartered in Millsboro, Sussex County, Delaware.

name: delaware
sentence: Several ships have been named USDelaware in honor of this state.

name: delaware
sentence: Prominent Delawareans include the du Pont family of politicians and businesspersons and the Biden family among whom Joe Biden is notable as the President of the United States.

name: florida
sentence: Florida ( (listen), Spanish pronunciation: [floˈɾiða]) is a state located in the southeastern region of the United States.

name: florida
sentence: With a population of over 21 million, Florida is the third-most populous and the 22nd-most extensive of the 50 United States.

name: florida
sentence: The state is bordered to the west by the Gulf of Mexico, to the northwest by Alabama, to the north by Georgia, to the east by the Atlantic Ocean, and to the south by the Straits of Florida.

name: florida
sentence: The state's capital is Tallahassee and its most populous municipality is Jacksonville.

name: florida
sentence: The Miami metropolitan area, with a population of almost 6.2 million, is the most populous urban area in Florida and the seventh-most populous in the United States.

name: florida
sentence: Other urban areas in the state with a population of more than one million are Tampa Bay, Orlando, and Jacksonville.

name: florida
sentence: Florida's $1.0 trillion economy is the fourth-largest of any US state, and if it were a country, Florida would be the 16th-largest economy in the world.

name: florida
sentence: The first European contact was made in 1513 by Spanish explorer Juan Ponce de León, who called it la Florida ([la floˈɾiða] "the land of flowers") upon landing there.

name: florida
sentence: At various points in its colonial history, Florida was administered by Spain and Great Britain.

name: florida
sentence: Florida was admitted as the 27th state on March 3, 1845.

name: florida
sentence: Florida was the principal location of the Seminole Wars (1816 – 1858), the longest and most extensive of Indian Wars in United States history.

name: florida
sentence: Florida declared its secession from the Union on January 10, 1861, and was one of the seven original Confederate States.

name: florida
sentence: After the Civil War, Florida was restored to the Union on June 25, 1868.

name: florida
sentence: Today, Florida is distinctive for its large Cuban expatriate community and high population growth, as well as for its increasing environmental issues.

name: florida
sentence: The state's economy relies mainly on tourism, agriculture, and transportation, which developed in the late 19th century.

name: florida
sentence: Florida is also renowned for amusement parks, orange crops, winter vegetables, the Kennedy Space Center, and as a popular destination for retirees.

name: florida
sentence: It is the flattest state in the United States, and Lake Okeechobee is its largest freshwater lake.

name: florida
sentence: The state's close proximity to the ocean influences many aspects of Florida culture and daily life.

name: florida
sentence: Florida is a reflection of influences and multiple inheritance; African, European, indigenous, Latino, and Asian heritages can be found in the architecture and cuisine.

name: florida
sentence: Florida has attracted many writers such as Marjorie Kinnan Rawlings, Ernest Hemingway and Tennessee Williams, and continues to attract celebrities and athletes.

name: florida
sentence: It is internationally known for golf, tennis, auto racing, and water sports.

name: florida
sentence: Several beaches in Florida have turquoise and emerald-colored coastal waters.

name: florida
sentence: About two-thirds of Florida occupies a peninsula between the Gulf of Mexico and the Atlantic Ocean.

name: florida
sentence: Florida has the longest coastline in the contiguous United States, approximately 1,350 miles (2,170 km), not including the contribution of the many barrier islands.

name: florida
sentence: Florida has a total of 4,510 islands that are ten acres (4 ha) or larger in area.

name: florida
sentence: This is the second-highest number of islands of any state

name: florida
sentence: It is the only state that borders both the Gulf of Mexico and the Atlantic Ocean.

name: florida
sentence: Much of the state is at or near sea level, and is characterized by sedimentary soil.

name: florida
sentence: Florida has the lowest high point of any US state.

name: florida
sentence: The American alligator, American crocodile, American flamingo, Roseate spoonbill, Florida panther, bottlenose dolphin, and manatee can be found in Everglades National Park in the southern part of the state.

name: florida
sentence: The climate varies from subtropical in the north to tropical in the south.

name: florida
sentence: Along with Hawaii, Florida is one of only two states that have a tropical climate, and is the only continental state that has both a tropical climate and a coral reef.

name: florida
sentence: The Florida Reef is the only living coral barrier reef in the continental United States, and the third-largest coral barrier reef system in the world (after the Great Barrier Reef and Belize Barrier Reef).

name: florida
sentence: By the 16th century, the earliest time for which there is a historical record, major Native American groups included the Apalachee of the Florida Panhandle, the Timucua of northern and central Florida, the Ais of the central Atlantic coast, the Tocobaga of the Tampa Bay area, the Calusa of southwest Florida and the Tequesta of the southeastern coast.

name: florida
sentence: Florida was the first region of the continental United States to be visited and settled by Europeans.

name: florida
sentence: The earliest known European explorers came with the Spanish conquistador Juan Ponce de León.

name: florida
sentence: Ponce de León spotted and landed on the peninsula on April 2, 1513.

name: florida
sentence: He named it La Florida in recognition of the verdant landscape and because it was the Easter season, which the Spaniards called Pascua Florida (Festival of Flowers).

name: florida
sentence: The following day they came ashore to seek information and take possession of this new land.

name: florida
sentence: The story that he was searching for the Fountain of Youth is mythical and appeared only long after his death.

name: florida
sentence: In May 1539, Conquistador Hernando de Soto skirted the coast of Florida, searching for a deep harbor to land.

name: florida
sentence: He described a thick wall of red mangroves spread mile after mile, some reaching as high as 70 feet (21 m), with intertwined and elevated roots making landing difficult.

name: florida
sentence: The Spanish introduced Christianity, cattle, horses, sheep, the Castilian language, and more to Florida.

name: florida
sentence: Spain established several settlements in Florida, with varying degrees of success.

name: florida
sentence: In 1559, Don Tristán de Luna y Arellano established a settlement at present-day Pensacola, making it the first attempted settlement in Florida, but it was mostly abandoned by 1561.

name: florida
sentence: In 1564-65 there was a French settlement at Fort Caroline, in present Duval County, which was destroyed by the Spanish.

name: florida
sentence: In 1565, the settlement of St. Augustine (San Agustín) was established under the leadership of admiral and governor Pedro Menéndez de Avilés, creating what would become one of the oldest, continuously-occupied European settlements in the continental US and establishing the first generation of Floridanos and the Government of Florida.

name: florida
sentence: Spain maintained strategic control over the region by converting the local tribes to Christianity.

name: florida
sentence: The marriage between Luisa de Abrego, a free black domestic servant from Seville, and Miguel Rodríguez, a white Segovian, occurred in 1565 in St. Augustine.

name: florida
sentence: It is the first recorded Christian marriage in the continental United States.

name: florida
sentence: Some Spanish married or had unions with Pensacola, Creek or African women, both slave and free, and their descendants created a mixed-race population of mestizos and mulattos.

name: florida
sentence: The Spanish encouraged slaves from the Thirteen Colonies to come to Florida as a refuge, promising freedom in exchange for conversion to Catholicism.

name: florida
sentence: King Charles II of Spain issued a royal proclamation freeing all slaves who fled to Spanish Florida and accepted conversion and baptism.

name: florida
sentence: Most went to the area around St. Augustine, but escaped slaves also reached Pensacola.

name: florida
sentence: St. Augustine had mustered an all-black militia unit defending Spanish Florida as early as 1683.

name: florida
sentence: The geographical area of Spanish claims in La Florida diminished with the establishment of English settlements to the north and French claims to the west.

name: florida
sentence: English colonists and buccaneers launched several attacks on St. Augustine in the 17th and 18th centuries, razing the city and its cathedral to the ground several times.

name: florida
sentence: Spain built the Castillo de San Marcos in 1672 and Fort Matanzas in 1742 to defend Florida's capital city from attacks, and to maintain its strategic position in the defense of the Captaincy General of Cuba and the Spanish West Indies.

name: florida
sentence: In 1738, the Spanish governor of Florida Manuel de Montiano established Fort Gracia Real de Santa Teresa de Mose near St. Augustine, a fortified town for escaped slaves to whom Montiano granted citizenship and freedom in return for their service in the Florida militia, and which became the first free black settlement legally sanctioned in North America.

name: florida
sentence: In 1763, Spain traded Florida to the Kingdom of Great Britain for control of Havana, Cuba, which had been captured by the British during the Seven Years' War.

name: florida
sentence: The trade was done as part of the 1763 Treaty of Paris which ended the Seven Year's War.

name: florida
sentence: Spain was granted Louisiana from France due to their loss of Florida.

name: florida
sentence: A large portion of the Florida population left, taking along large portions of the remaining indigenous population with them to Cuba.

name: florida
sentence: The British soon constructed the King's Road connecting St. Augustine to Georgia.

name: florida
sentence: The road crossed the St. Johns River at a narrow point called Wacca Pilatka, or the British name "Cow Ford", reflecting the fact that cattle were brought across the river there.

name: florida
sentence: The British divided and consolidated the Florida provinces (Las Floridas) into East Florida and West Florida, a division the Spanish government kept after the brief British period.

name: florida
sentence: The British government gave land grants to officers and soldiers who had fought in the French and Indian War in order to encourage settlement.

name: florida
sentence: In order to induce settlers to move to Florida, reports of its natural wealth were published in England.

name: florida
sentence: A number of British settlers who were described as being "energetic and of good character" moved to Florida, mostly coming from South Carolina, Georgia and England.

name: florida
sentence: There was also a group of settlers who came from the colony of Bermuda.

name: florida
sentence: This would be the first permanent English-speaking population in what is now Duval County, Baker County, St. Johns County and Nassau County.

name: florida
sentence: The British constructed high-quality public roads and introduced the cultivation of sugar cane, indigo and fruits as well as the export of lumber.

name: florida
sentence: The British governors were directed to call general assemblies as soon as possible in order to make laws for the Floridas, and in the meantime they were, with the advice of councils, to establish courts.

name: florida
sentence: This was the first introduction of the English-derived legal system which Florida still has today, including trial by jury, habeas corpus and county-based government.

name: florida
sentence: Neither East Florida nor West Florida sent any representatives to Philadelphia to draft the Declaration of Independence.

name: florida
sentence: Florida remained a Loyalist stronghold for the duration of the American Revolution.

name: florida
sentence: Spain regained both East and West Florida after Britain's defeat in the Revolutionary War and the subsequent Treaty of Versailles in 1783, and continued the provincial divisions until 1821.

name: florida
sentence: Defense of Florida's northern border with the United States was minor during the second Spanish period.

name: florida
sentence: The region became a haven for escaped slaves and a base for Indian attacks against US territories, and the US pressed Spain for reform.

name: florida
sentence: Americans of English descent and Americans of Scots-Irish descent began moving into northern Florida from the backwoods of Georgia and South Carolina.

name: florida
sentence: Though technically not allowed by the Spanish authorities and the Floridan government, they were never able to effectively police the border region and the backwoods settlers from the United States would continue to immigrate into Florida unchecked.

name: florida
sentence: These migrants, mixing with the already present British settlers who had remained in Florida since the British period, would be the progenitors of the population known as Florida Crackers.

name: florida
sentence: These American settlers established a permanent foothold in the area and ignored Spanish authorities.

name: florida
sentence: The British settlers who had remained also resented Spanish rule, leading to a rebellion in 1810 and the establishment for ninety days of the so-called Free and Independent Republic of West Florida on September 23.

name: florida
sentence: After meetings beginning in June, rebels overcame the garrison at Baton Rouge (now in Louisiana), and unfurled the flag of the new republic: a single white star on a blue field.

name: florida
sentence: This flag would later become known as the "Bonnie Blue Flag".

name: florida
sentence: In 1810, parts of West Florida were annexed by proclamation of President James Madison, who claimed the region as part of the Louisiana Purchase.

name: florida
sentence: These parts were incorporated into the newly formed Territory of Orleans.

name: florida
sentence: The US annexed the Mobile District of West Florida to the Mississippi Territory in 1812.

name: florida
sentence: Spain continued to dispute the area, though the United States gradually increased the area it occupied.

name: florida
sentence: In 1812, a group of settlers from Georgia, with de facto support from the US federal government, attempted to overthrow the Floridan government in the province of East Florida.

name: florida
sentence: The settlers hoped to convince Floridans to join their cause and proclaim independence from Spain, but the settlers lost their tenuous support from the federal government and abandoned their cause by 1813.

name: florida
sentence: Seminoles based in East Florida began raiding Georgia settlements, and offering havens for runaway slaves.

name: florida
sentence: The United States Army led increasingly frequent incursions into Spanish territory, including the 1817–1818 campaign against the Seminole Indians by Andrew Jackson that became known as the First Seminole War.

name: florida
sentence: The United States now effectively controlled East Florida.

name: florida
sentence: Control was necessary according to Secretary of State John Quincy Adams because Florida had become "a derelict open to the occupancy of every enemy, civilized or savage, of the United States, and serving no other earthly purpose than as a post of annoyance to them."

name: florida
sentence: Florida had become a burden to Spain, which could not afford to send settlers or troops due to the devastation caused by the Peninsular War.

name: florida
sentence: Madrid therefore decided to cede the territory to the United States through the Adams–Onís Treaty, which took effect in 1821.

name: florida
sentence: President James Monroe was authorized on March 3, 1821 to take possession of East Florida and West Florida for the United States and provide for initial governance.

name: florida
sentence: Andrew Jackson, on behalf of the US federal government, served as a military commissioner with the powers of governor of the newly acquired territory for a brief period.

name: florida
sentence: On March 30, 1822, the US Congress merged East Florida and part of West Florida into the Florida Territory.

name: florida
sentence: By the early 1800s, Indian removal was a significant issue throughout the southeastern US and also in Florida.

name: florida
sentence: In 1830, the US Congress passed the Indian Removal Act and as settlement increased, pressure grew on the US government to remove the Indians from Florida.

name: florida
sentence: Seminoles offered sanctuary to blacks, and these became known as the Black Seminoles, and clashes between whites and Indians grew with the influx of new settlers.

name: florida
sentence: In 1832, the Treaty of Payne's Landing promised to the Seminoles lands west of the Mississippi River if they agreed to leave Florida.

name: florida
sentence: Many Seminole left at this time.

name: florida
sentence: Some Seminoles remained, and the US Army arrived in Florida, leading to the Second Seminole War (1835–1842).

name: florida
sentence: Following the war, approximately 3,000 Seminole and 800 Black Seminole were removed to Indian Territory.

name: florida
sentence: A few hundred Seminole remained in Florida in the Everglades.

name: florida
sentence: On March 3, 1845, only one day before the end of President John Tyler's term in office, Florida became the 27th state, admitted as a slave state and no longer a sanctuary for runaway slaves.

name: florida
sentence: Initially its population grew slowly.

name: florida
sentence: As European settlers continued to encroach on Seminole lands, the United States intervened to move the remaining Seminoles to the West.

name: florida
sentence: The Third Seminole War (1855–58) resulted in the forced removal of most of the remaining Seminoles, although hundreds of Seminole Indians remained in the Everglades.

name: florida
sentence: American settlers began to establish cotton plantations in north Florida, which required numerous laborers, which they supplied by buying slaves in the domestic market.

name: florida
sentence: By 1860, Florida had only 140,424 people, of whom 44% were enslaved.

name: florida
sentence: There were fewer than 1,000 free African Americans before the American Civil War.

name: florida
sentence: On January 10, 1861, nearly all delegates in the Florida Legislature approved an ordinance of secession, declaring Florida to be "a sovereign and independent nation"—an apparent reassertion to the preamble in Florida's Constitution of 1838, in which Florida agreed with Congress to be a "Free and Independent State."

name: florida
sentence: The ordinance declared Florida's secession from the Union, allowing it to become one of the founding members of the Confederate States.

name: florida
sentence: The Confederacy received little help from Florida; the 15,000 men it offered were generally sent elsewhere.

name: florida
sentence: Instead of men and manufactured goods, Florida did provide salt and, more importantly, beef to feed the Confederate armies.

name: florida
sentence: This was particularly important after 1864, when the Confederacy lost control of the Mississippi River, thereby losing access to Texas beef.

name: florida
sentence: The largest engagements in the state were the Battle of Olustee, on February 20, 1864, and the Battle of Natural Bridge, on March 6, 1865.

name: florida
sentence: Both were Confederate victories.

name: florida
sentence: The war ended in 1865.

name: florida
sentence: Following the American Civil War, Florida's congressional representation was restored on June 25, 1868, albeit forcefully after Radical Reconstruction and the installation of unelected government officials under the final authority of federal military commanders.

name: florida
sentence: After the Reconstruction period ended in 1876, white Democrats regained power in the state legislature.

name: florida
sentence: In 1885, they created a new constitution, followed by statutes through 1889 that disfranchised most blacks and many poor whites.

name: florida
sentence: In the pre-automobile era, railroads played a key role in the state's development, particularly in coastal areas.

name: florida
sentence: In 1883, the Pensacola and Atlantic Railroad connected Pensacola and the rest of the Panhandle to the rest of the state.

name: florida
sentence: In 1884 the South Florida Railroad (later absorbed by Atlantic Coast Line Railroad) opened full service to Tampa.

name: florida
sentence: In 1894 the Florida East Coast Railway reached West Palm Beach

name: florida
sentence: Numerous other railroads were built all over the interior of the state.

name: florida
sentence: Until the mid-20th century, Florida was the least populous state in the southern United States.

name: florida
sentence: In 1900, its population was only 528,542, of whom nearly 44% were African American, the same proportion as before the Civil War.

name: florida
sentence: The boll weevil devastated cotton crops.

name: florida
sentence: Forty thousand blacks, roughly one-fifth of their 1900 population levels in Florida, left the state in the Great Migration.

name: florida
sentence: They left due to lynchings and racial violence, and for better opportunities in the North and the West.

name: florida
sentence: Disfranchisement for most African Americans in the state persisted until the Civil Rights Movement of the 1960s gained federal legislation in 1965 to enforce protection of their constitutional suffrage.

name: florida
sentence: Historically, Florida's economy has been based primarily upon agricultural products such as cattle, sugar cane, citrus fruits, tomatoes, and strawberries.

name: florida
sentence: In 1925, the Seaboard Air Line broke the FEC's southeast Florida monopoly and extended its freight and passenger service to West Palm Beach; two years later it extended passenger service to Miami.

name: florida
sentence: Economic prosperity in the 1920s stimulated tourism to Florida and related development of hotels and resort communities.

name: florida
sentence: Combined with its sudden elevation in profile was the Florida land boom of the 1920s, which brought a brief period of intense land development.

name: florida
sentence: Devastating hurricanes in 1926 and 1928, followed by the Great Depression, brought that period to a halt.Florida's economy did not fully recover until the military buildup for World War II.

name: florida
sentence: In 1939, Florida was described as "still very largely an empty State."

name: florida
sentence: Subsequently, the growing availability of air conditioning, the climate, and a low cost of living made the state a haven.

name: florida
sentence: Migration from the Rust Belt and the Northeast sharply increased Florida's population after 1945.

name: florida
sentence: In the 1960s, many refugees from Cuba fleeing Fidel Castro's communist regime arrived in Miami at the Freedom Tower, where the federal government used the facility to process, document and provide medical and dental services for the newcomers.

name: florida
sentence: As a result, the Freedom Tower was also called the "Ellis Island of the South."

name: florida
sentence: In recent decades, more migrants have come for the jobs in a developing economy.

name: florida
sentence: With a population of more than 18 million, according to the 2010 census, Florida is the most populous state in the southeastern United States and the third-most populous in the United States.

name: florida
sentence: The population of Florida has boomed in recent years with the state being the recipient of the largest number of out-of-state movers in the country as of 2019.

name: florida
sentence: Florida's growth has been widespread, as cities throughout the state have grown since 2010.

name: florida
sentence: After Hurricane Maria devastated Puerto Rico in September 2017, a large population of Puerto Ricans began moving to Florida to escape the widespread destruction.

name: florida
sentence: Hundreds of thousands of Puerto Ricans arrived in Florida after Maria dissipated, with nearly half of them arriving in Orlando and large populations also moving to Tampa, Fort Lauderdale, and West Palm Beach.

name: florida
sentence: Much of Florida is on a peninsula between the Gulf of Mexico, the Atlantic Ocean and the Straits of Florida.

name: florida
sentence: Spanning two time zones, it extends to the northwest into a panhandle, extending along the northern Gulf of Mexico.

name: florida
sentence: It is bordered on the north by Georgia and Alabama, and on the west, at the end of the panhandle, by Alabama.

name: florida
sentence: It is the only state that borders both the Atlantic Ocean and the Gulf of Mexico.

name: florida
sentence: Florida also is the southernmost of the 48 contiguous states, Hawaii being the only one of the fifty states reaching farther south.

name: florida
sentence: Florida is west of The Bahamas and 90 miles (140 km) north of Cuba.

name: florida
sentence: Florida is one of the largest states east of the Mississippi River, and only Alaska and Michigan are larger in water area.

name: florida
sentence: The water boundary is 3 nautical miles (3.5 mi

name: florida
sentence: At 345 feet (105 m) above mean sea level, Britton Hill is the highest point in Florida and the lowest highpoint of any US state.

name: florida
sentence: Much of the state south of Orlando lies at a lower elevation than northern Florida, and is fairly level.

name: florida
sentence: Much of the state is at or near sea level.

name: florida
sentence: However, some places such as Clearwater have promontories that rise 50 to 100 ft (15 to 30 m) above the water.

name: florida
sentence: Much of Central and North Florida, typically 25 mi (40 km) or more away from the coastline, have rolling hills with elevations ranging from 100 to 250 ft (30 to 76 m).

name: florida
sentence: The highest point in peninsular Florida (east and south of the Suwannee River), Sugarloaf Mountain, is a 312-foot (95 m) peak in Lake County.

name: florida
sentence: On average, Florida is the flattest state in the United States.

name: florida
sentence: The climate of Florida is tempered somewhat by the fact that no part of the state is distant from the ocean.

name: florida
sentence: North of Lake Okeechobee, the prevalent climate is humid subtropical (Köppen: Cfa), while areas south of the lake (including the Florida Keys) have a true tropical climate (Köppen: Aw, Am, and Af).

name: florida
sentence: Mean high temperatures for late July are primarily in the low 90s Fahrenheit (32–34 °C).

name: florida
sentence: Mean low temperatures for early to mid January range from the low 40s Fahrenheit (4–7 °C) in north Florida to above 60 °F (16 °C) from Miami on southward.

name: florida
sentence: With an average daily temperature of 70.7 °F (21.5 °C), it is the warmest state in the US

name: florida
sentence: In the summer, high temperatures in the state rarely exceed 100 °F (37.8 °C).

name: florida
sentence: Several record cold maxima have been in the 30s °F (−1 to 4 °C) and record lows have been in the 10s (−12 to −7 °C).

name: florida
sentence: These temperatures normally extend at most a few days at a time in the northern and central parts of Florida.

name: florida
sentence: South Florida, however, rarely encounters below freezing temperatures.

name: florida
sentence: The hottest temperature ever recorded in Florida was 109 °F (43 °C), which was set on June 29, 1931 in Monticello.

name: florida
sentence: The coldest temperature was −2 °F (−19 °C), on February 13, 1899, just 25 miles (40 km) away, in Tallahassee.

name: florida
sentence: Due to its subtropical and tropical climate, Florida rarely receives measurable snowfall.

name: florida
sentence: However, on rare occasions, a combination of cold moisture and freezing temperatures can result in snowfall in the farthest northern regions like Jacksonville, Gainesville or Pensacola.

name: florida
sentence: Frost, which is more common than snow, sometimes occurs in the panhandle.

name: florida
sentence: The USDA Plant hardiness zones for the state range from zone 8a (no colder than 10 °F or −12 °C) in the inland western panhandle to zone 11b (no colder than 45 °F or 7 °C) in the lower Florida Keys.

name: florida
sentence: Fog also occurs all over the state or climate of Florida.

name: florida
sentence: Florida's nickname is the "Sunshine State", but severe weather is a common occurrence in the state.

name: florida
sentence: Central Florida is known as the lightning capital of the United States, as it experiences more lightning strikes than anywhere else in the country.

name: florida
sentence: Florida has one of the highest average precipitation levels of any state, in large part because afternoon thunderstorms are common in much of the state from late spring until early autumn.

name: florida
sentence: A narrow eastern part of the state including Orlando and Jacksonville receives between 2,400 and 2,800 hours of sunshine annually.

name: florida
sentence: The rest of the state, including Miami, receives between 2,800 and 3,200 hours annually.

name: florida
sentence: Florida leads the United States in tornadoes per area (when including waterspouts), but they do not typically reach the intensity of those in the Midwest and Great Plains.

name: florida
sentence: Hail often accompanies the most severe thunderstorms.

name: florida
sentence: Hurricanes pose a severe threat each year from June 1 to November 30, particularly from August to October.

name: florida
sentence: Florida is the most hurricane-prone state, with subtropical or tropical water on a lengthy coastline.

name: florida
sentence: Of the category 4 or higher storms that have struck the United States, 83% have either hit Florida or Texas.

name: florida
sentence: From 1851 to 2006, Florida was struck by 114 hurricanes, 37 of them major—category 3 and above.

name: florida
sentence: It is rare for a hurricane season to pass without any impact in the state by at least a tropical storm.

name: florida
sentence: In 1992, Florida was the site of what was then the costliest weather disaster in US history, Hurricane Andrew, which caused more than $25 billion in damages when it struck during August; it held that distinction until 2005, when Hurricane Katrina surpassed it, and it has since been surpassed by six other hurricanes.

name: florida
sentence: Andrew is currently the second costliest hurricane in Florida's history.

name: florida
sentence: Florida is host to many types of wildlife including:

name: florida
sentence: Florida also has more than 500 nonnative animal species and 1,000 nonnative insects found throughout the state.

name: florida
sentence: Some exotic species living in Florida include the Burmese python, green iguana, veiled chameleon, Argentine black and white tegu, peacock bass, mayan cichlid, lionfish, White-nosed coati, rhesus macaque, vervet monkey, Cuban tree frog, cane toad, Indian peafowl, monk parakeet, tui parakeet, and many more.

name: florida
sentence: Some of these nonnative species do not pose a threat to any native species, but some do threaten the native species of Florida by living in the state and eating them.

name: florida
sentence: The state has more than 26,000 square miles (67,000 km2) of forests, covering about half of the state's land area.

name: florida
sentence: There are about 3,000 different types of wildflowers in Florida.

name: florida
sentence: This is the third-most diverse state in the union, behind California and Texas, both larger states.

name: florida
sentence: In Florida, wild populations of coconut palms extend up the East Coast from Key West to Jupiter Inlet, and up the West Coast from Marco Island to Sarasota.

name: florida
sentence: Many of the smallest coral islands in the Florida Keys are known to have abundant coconut palms sprouting from coconuts deposited by ocean currents.

name: florida
sentence: Coconut palms are cultivated north of south Florida to roughly Cocoa Beach on the East Coast and the Tampa Bay Area on the West Coast.

name: florida
sentence: On the east coast of the state, mangroves have normally dominated the coast from Cocoa Beach southward; salt marshes from St. Augustine northward.

name: florida
sentence: From St. Augustine south to Cocoa Beach, the coast fluctuates between the two, depending on the annual weather conditions.

name: florida
sentence: All three mangrove species flower in the spring and early summer.

name: florida
sentence: Propagules fall from late summer through early autumn.

name: florida
sentence: Florida mangrove plant communities covered an estimated 430,000 to 540,000 acres (1,700 to 2,200 km2) in Florida in 1981.

name: florida
sentence: Ninety percent of the Florida mangroves are in southern Florida, in Collier, Lee, Miami-Dade and Monroe Counties.

name: florida
sentence: The Florida Reef is the only living coral barrier reef in the continental United States.

name: florida
sentence: It is also the third largest coral barrier reef system in the world, after the Great Barrier Reef and the Belize Barrier Reef.

name: florida
sentence: The reef lies a little bit off of the coast of the Florida Keys.

name: florida
sentence: A lot of the reef lies within John Pennekamp Coral Reef State Park, which was the first underwater park in the United States.

name: florida
sentence: The park contains a lot of tropical vegetation, marine life, and seabirds.

name: florida
sentence: The Florida Reef extends into other parks and sanctuaries as well including Dry Tortugas National Park, Biscayne National Park, and the Florida Keys National Marine Sanctuary.

name: florida
sentence: Almost 1,400 species of marine plants and animals, including more than 40 species of stony corals and 500 species of fish, live on the Florida Reef.

name: florida
sentence: The Florida Reef, being a delicate ecosystem like other coral reefs, faces many threats including overfishing, plastics in the ocean, coral bleaching, rising sea levels, and changes in sea surface temperature.

name: florida
sentence: Florida is a low per capita energy user.

name: florida
sentence: It is estimated that approximately 4% of energy in the state is generated through renewable resources.

name: florida
sentence: Florida's energy production is 6% of the nation's total energy output, while total production of pollutants is lower, with figures of 6% for nitrogen oxide, 5% for carbon dioxide, and 4% for sulfur dioxide.

name: florida
sentence: Wildfires in Florida occur at all times of the year.

name: florida
sentence: All potable water resources have been controlled by the state government through five regional water authorities since 1972.

name: florida
sentence: Red tide has been an issue on the southwest coast of Florida, as well as other areas.

name: florida
sentence: While there has been a great deal of conjecture over the cause of the toxic algae bloom, there is no evidence that it is being caused by pollution or that there has been an increase in the duration or frequency of red tides.

name: florida
sentence: Red tide is now killing off wildlife or Tropical fish and coral reefs putting all in danger.

name: florida
sentence: The Florida panther is close to extinction.

name: florida
sentence: A record 23 were killed in 2009, mainly by automobile collisions, leaving about 100 individuals in the wild.

name: florida
sentence: The Center for Biological Diversity and others have therefore called for a special protected area for the panther to be established.

name: florida
sentence: Manatees are also dying at a rate higher than their reproduction.

name: florida
sentence: American flamingos are rare to see in Florida due to being hunted in the 1900s, where it was to a point considered completely extirpated.

name: florida
sentence: Now the flamingos are reproducing toward making a comeback to South Florida since it is adamantly considered native to the state and also are now being protected.

name: florida
sentence: Much of Florida has an elevation of less than 12 feet (3.7 m), including many populated areas.

name: florida
sentence: Therefore, it is susceptible to rising sea levels associated with global warming.

name: florida
sentence: The Atlantic beaches that are vital to the state's economy are being washed out to sea due to rising sea levels caused by climate change.

name: florida
sentence: The Miami beach area, close to the continental shelf, is running out of accessible offshore sand reserves.

name: florida
sentence: Elevated temperatures can damage coral reefs, causing coral bleaching.

name: florida
sentence: The first recorded bleaching incident on the Florida Reef was in 1973.

name: florida
sentence: Incidents of bleaching have become more frequent in recent decades, in correlation with a rise in sea surface temperatures.

name: florida
sentence: White band disease has also adversely affected corals on the Florida Reef.

name: florida
sentence: The Florida peninsula is a porous plateau of karst limestone sitting atop bedrock known as the Florida Platform.

name: florida
sentence: The largest deposits of potash in the United States are found in Florida.

name: florida
sentence: The largest deposits of rock phosphate in the country are found in Florida.

name: florida
sentence: Most of this is in Bone Valley.

name: florida
sentence: Extended systems of underwater caves, sinkholes and springs are found throughout the state and supply most of the water used by residents.

name: florida
sentence: The limestone is topped with sandy soils deposited as ancient beaches over millions of years as global sea levels rose and fell.

name: florida
sentence: During the last glacial period, lower sea levels and a drier climate revealed a much wider peninsula, largely savanna.

name: florida
sentence: While there are sinkholes in much of the state, modern sinkholes have tended to be in West-Central Florida.

name: florida
sentence: Everglades National Park covers 1,509,000 acres (6,110 km2), throughout Dade, Monroe, and Collier counties in Florida.

name: florida
sentence: The Everglades, an enormously wide, slow-flowing river encompasses the southern tip of the peninsula.

name: florida
sentence: Sinkhole damage claims on property in the state exceeded a total of $2 billion from 2006 through 2010.

name: florida
sentence: Winter Park Sinkhole, in central Florida, appeared May 8, 1981.

name: florida
sentence: It was approximately 350 feet (107 m) wide and 75 feet (23 m) deep.

name: florida
sentence: It was notable as one of the largest recent sinkholes to form in the United States.

name: florida
sentence: It is now known as Lake Rose.

name: florida
sentence: The Econlockhatchee River (Econ River for short) is an 87.7-kilometer-long (54.5 mi) north-flowing blackwater tributary of the St. Johns River, the longest river in the US state of Florida.

name: florida
sentence: The Econ River flows through Osceola, Orange, and Seminole counties in Central Florida, just east of the Orlando Metropolitan Area (east of State Road 417).

name: florida
sentence: It is a designated Outstanding Florida Waters.

name: florida
sentence: Earthquakes are rare because Florida is not located near any tectonic plate boundaries.

name: florida
sentence: The United States Census Bureau estimates that the population of Florida was 21,477,737 on July 1, 2019, a 14.24% increase since the 2010 United States Census.

name: florida
sentence: The population of Florida in the 2010 census was 18,801,310.

name: florida
sentence: Florida was the seventh fastest-growing state in the US in the 12-month period ending July 1, 2012.

name: florida
sentence: In 2010, the center of population of Florida was located between Fort Meade and Frostproof.

name: florida
sentence: The center of population has moved less than 5 miles (8 km) to the east and approximately 1 mile (1.6 km) to the north between 1980 and 2010 and has been located in Polk County since the 1960 census.The population exceeded 19.7 million by December 2014, surpassing the population of the state of New York for the first time, making Florida the third most populous state.

name: florida
sentence: The Florida population was 21,477,737 residents or people according to the US Census Bureau's 2019 Population Estimates Program.

name: florida
sentence: Florida contains the highest percentage of people over 65 (17%) in the US.

name: florida
sentence: There were 186,102 military retirees living in the state in 2008.About two-thirds of the population was born in another state, the second highest in the US

name: florida
sentence: In 2010, undocumented immigrants constituted an estimated 5.7% of the population.

name: florida
sentence: This was the sixth highest percentage of any US state.

name: florida
sentence: There were an estimated 675,000 illegal immigrants in the state in 2010.

name: florida
sentence: Florida has banned sanctuary cities.

name: florida
sentence: Hispanic and Latinos of any race made up 22.5% of the population in 2010.

name: florida
sentence: As of 2011, 57% of Florida's population younger than age 1 had at least one parent who was not non-Hispanic white.

name: florida
sentence: The largest metropolitan area in the state as well as the entire southeastern United States is the Miami metropolitan area, with about 6.06 million people.

name: florida
sentence: The Tampa Bay Area, with more than 3.02 million, is the second largest; the Orlando metropolitan area, with more than 2.44 million, is third; and the Jacksonville metropolitan area, with more than 1.47 million, is fourth.

name: florida
sentence: Florida has 22 Metropolitan Statistical Areas (MSAs) defined by the United States Office of Management and Budget (OMB).

name: florida
sentence: Forty-three of Florida's 67 counties are in a MSA.

name: florida
sentence: The legal name in Florida for a city, town or village is "municipality".

name: florida
sentence: In Florida there is no legal difference between towns, villages and cities.

name: florida
sentence: Florida is a highly urbanized state, with 89 percent of its population living in urban areas in 2000, compared to 79 percent nationally.

name: florida
sentence: In 2012, 75% of the population lived within 10 miles (16 km) of the coastline.

name: florida
sentence: In 2010, 6.9% of the population (1,269,765) considered themselves to be of only American ancestry (regardless of race or ethnicity).

name: florida
sentence: Many of these were of English or Scotch-Irish descent; however, their families have lived in the state for so long they choose to identify as having "American" ancestry or do not know their ancestry.

name: florida
sentence: In the 1980 United States census, the largest ancestry group reported in Florida was English with 2,232,514 Floridians claiming they were of English or mostly English American ancestry.

name: florida
sentence: Some of their ancestry went back to the original thirteen colonies.

name: florida
sentence: As of 2010, those of (non-Hispanic white) European ancestry accounted for 57.9% of Florida's population.

name: florida
sentence: Out of the 57.9%, the largest groups were 12.0% German (2,212,391), 10.7% Irish (1,979,058), 8.8% English (1,629,832), 6.6% Italian (1,215,242), 2.8% Polish (511,229), and 2.7% French (504,641).White Americans of all European backgrounds are present in all areas of the state.

name: florida
sentence: In 1970, non-Hispanic whites were nearly 80% of Florida's population.

name: florida
sentence: Those of English and Irish ancestry are present in large numbers in all the urban/suburban areas across the state.

name: florida
sentence: Some native white Floridians, especially those who have descended from long-time Florida families, may refer to themselves as "Florida crackers"; others see the term as a derogatory one.

name: florida
sentence: Like whites in most other states of the southern US, they descend mainly from English and Scots-Irish settlers, as well as some other British American settlers.

name: florida
sentence: As of 2010, those of Hispanic or Latino ancestry accounted for 22.5% (4,223,806) of Florida's population.

name: florida
sentence: Out of the 22.5%, the largest groups were 6.5% (1,213,438) Cuban, and 4.5% (847,550) Puerto Rican.

name: florida
sentence: Florida's Hispanic population includes large communities of Cuban Americans in Miami and Tampa, Puerto Ricans in Orlando and Tampa, and Mexican/Central American migrant workers.

name: florida
sentence: The Hispanic community continues to grow more affluent and mobile.

name: florida
sentence: Florida has a large and diverse Hispanic population, with Cubans and Puerto Ricans being the largest groups in the state.

name: florida
sentence: Nearly 80% of Cuban Americans live in Florida, especially South Florida where there is a long-standing and affluent Cuban community.

name: florida
sentence: Florida has the second largest Puerto Rican population after New York, as well as the fastest-growing in the nation.

name: florida
sentence: Puerto Ricans are more widespread throughout the state, though the heaviest concentrations are in the Orlando area of Central Florida.

name: florida
sentence: Florida has one of the largest and most diverse Hispanic/Latino populations in the country, especially in South Florida around Miami, and to a lesser degree Central Florida.

name: florida
sentence: Aside from the dominant Cuban and Puerto Rican populations, there are also large populations of Mexicans, Colombians, and Dominicans, among numerous other groups, as most Latino groups have sizable numbers in the state.

name: florida
sentence: As of 2010, those of African ancestry accounted for 16.0% of Florida's population, which includes African Americans.

name: florida
sentence: Out of the 16.0%, 4.0% (741,879) were West Indian or Afro-Caribbean American.

name: florida
sentence: During the early 1900s, black people made up nearly half of the state's population.

name: florida
sentence: In response to segregation, disfranchisement and agricultural depression, many African Americans migrated from Florida to northern cities in the Great Migration, in waves from 1910 to 1940, and again starting in the later 1940s.

name: florida
sentence: They moved for jobs, better education for their children and the chance to vote and participate in society.

name: florida
sentence: By 1960, the proportion of African Americans in the state had declined to 18%.

name: florida
sentence: Conversely, large numbers of northern whites moved to the state.

name: florida
sentence: Today, large concentrations of black residents can be found in northern and central Florida.

name: florida
sentence: Aside from blacks descended from African slaves brought to the southern US, there are also large numbers of blacks of West Indian, recent African, and Afro-Latino immigrant origins, especially in the Miami/South Florida area.

name: florida
sentence: Florida has the largest West Indian population of any state, originating from many Caribbean countries, with Haitian Americans being the most numerous.

name: florida
sentence: In 2016, Florida had the highest percentage of West Indians in the United States at 4.5%, with 2.3% (483,874) from Haitian ancestry, 1.5% (303,527) Jamaican, and 0.2% (31,966) Bahamian, with the other West Indian groups making up the rest.

name: florida
sentence: As of 2010, those of Asian ancestry accounted for 2.4% of Florida's population.

name: florida
sentence: In 1988, English was affirmed as the state's official language in the Florida Constitution.

name: florida
sentence: Spanish is also widely spoken, especially as immigration has continued from Latin America.

name: florida
sentence: Twenty percent of the population speak Spanish as their first language.

name: florida
sentence: Twenty-seven percent of Florida's population reports speaking a mother language other than English, and more than 200 first languages other than English are spoken at home in the state.

name: florida
