name: florida
sentence: Florida is mostly Christian, although there is a large irreligious and relatively significant Jewish community.

name: florida
sentence: Protestants account for almost half of the population, but the Catholic Church is the largest single denomination in the state mainly due to its large Hispanic population and other groups like Haitians.

name: florida
sentence: Protestants are very diverse, although Baptists, Methodists, Pentecostals and nondenominational Protestants are the largest groups.

name: florida
sentence: There is also a sizable Jewish community in South Florida.

name: florida
sentence: This is the largest Jewish population in the southern US and the third-largest in the US behind those of New York and California.

name: florida
sentence: In 2010, the three largest denominations in Florida were the Catholic Church, the Southern Baptist Convention, and the United Methodist Church.

name: florida
sentence: The Pew Research Center survey in 2014 gave the following religious makeup of Florida:

name: florida
sentence: The basic structure, duties, function, and operations of the government of the State of Florida are defined and established by the Florida Constitution, which establishes the basic law of the state and guarantees various rights and freedoms of the people.

name: florida
sentence: The state government consists of three separate branches: judicial, executive, and legislative.

name: florida
sentence: The legislature enacts bills, which, if signed by the governor, become law.

name: florida
sentence: The Florida Legislature comprises the Florida Senatorte, which has 40 members, and the Florida House of Representatives, which has 120 members.

name: florida
sentence: The current governor of Florida is Ron DeSantis.The Florida Supreme Court consists of a chief justice and six justices.

name: florida
sentence: Florida has 67 counties.

name: florida
sentence: Some reference materials may show only 66 because Duval County is consolidated with the City of Jacksonville.

name: florida
sentence: There are 379 cities in Florida (out of 411) that report regularly to the Florida Department of Revenue, but there are other incorporated municipalities that do not.

name: florida
sentence: The state government's primary revenue source is sales tax.

name: florida
sentence: Florida does not impose a personal income tax.

name: florida
sentence: The primary revenue source for cities and counties is property tax; unpaid taxes are subject to tax sales, which are held (at the county level) in May and (due to the extensive use of online bidding sites) are highly popular.

name: florida
sentence: There were 800 federal corruption convictions from 1988 to 2007, more than any other state.

name: florida
sentence: From 1952 to 1964, most voters were registered Democrats, but the state voted for the Republican presidential candidate in every election except for 1964.

name: florida
sentence: The following year, Congress passed and President Lyndon B. Johnson signed the Voting Rights Act of 1965, providing for oversight of state practices and enforcement of constitutional voting rights for African Americans and other minorities in order to prevent the discrimination and disenfranchisement which had excluded most of them for decades from the political process.

name: florida
sentence: From the 1930s through much of the 1960s, Florida was essentially a one-party state dominated by white conservative Democrats, who together with other Democrats of the "Solid South", exercised considerable control in Congress.

name: florida
sentence: They have gained slightly less federal money from national programs than they have paid in taxes.

name: florida
sentence: Since the 1970s, conservative white voters in the state have largely shifted from the Democratic to the Republican Party.

name: florida
sentence: Though the majority of registered voters in Florida are Democrats, it continued to support Republican presidential candidates through 2004, except in 1976 and 1996, when the Democratic nominee was from "the South".

name: florida
sentence: In the 2008 and 2012 presidential elections, Barack Obama carried the state as a northern Democrat, attracting high voter turnout, especially among the young, Independents, and minority voters, of whom Hispanics comprise an increasingly large proportion.

name: florida
sentence: 2008 marked the first time since 1944, when Franklin D. Roosevelt carried the state for the fourth time, that Florida was carried by a Northern Democrat for president.

name: florida
sentence: The first post-Reconstruction era Republican elected to Congress from Florida was William C. Cramer in 1954 from Pinellas County on the Gulf Coast, where demographic changes were underway.

name: florida
sentence: In this period, African Americans were still disenfranchised by the state's constitution and discriminatory practices; in the 19th century, they had made up most of the Republican Party.

name: florida
sentence: Cramer built a different Republican Party in Florida, attracting local white conservatives and transplants from northern and midwestern states.

name: florida
sentence: In 1966, Claude R. Kirk, Jr. was elected as the first post-Reconstruction Republican governor, in an upset election.

name: florida
sentence: In 1968, Edward J. Gurney, also a white conservative, was elected as the state's first post-reconstruction Republican US senator.

name: florida
sentence: In 1970, Democrats took the governorship and the open US Senatorte seat, and maintained dominance for years.

name: florida
sentence: Since the mid-20th century, Florida has been considered a bellwether, voting for 15 successful presidential candidates since 1952.

name: florida
sentence: During such period, it has voted for a losing candidate only twice.

name: florida
sentence: In 1998, Democratic voters dominated areas of the state with a high percentage of racial minorities and transplanted white liberals from the northeastern United States, known colloquially as "snowbirds".

name: florida
sentence: South Florida and the Miami metropolitan area are dominated by both racial minorities and white liberals.

name: florida
sentence: Because of this, the area has consistently voted as one of the most Democratic areas of the state.

name: florida
sentence: The Daytona Beach area is similar demographically and the city of Orlando has a large Hispanic population, which has often favored Democrats.

name: florida
sentence: Republicans, made up mostly of white conservatives, have dominated throughout much of the rest of Florida, particularly in the more rural and suburban areas.

name: florida
sentence: This is characteristic of its voter base throughout the Deep South.

name: florida
sentence: The fast-growing I-4 corridor area, which runs through Central Florida and connects the cities of Daytona Beach, Orlando, and Tampa/St.

name: florida
sentence: Petersburg, has had a fairly even breakdown of Republican and Democratic voters.

name: florida
sentence: The area is often seen as a merging point of the conservative northern portion of the state and the liberal southern portion, making it the biggest swing area in the state.

name: florida
sentence: Since the late 20th century, the voting results in this area, containing 40% of Florida voters, has often determined who will win the state in federal presidential elections.

name: florida
sentence: The Democratic Party has maintained an edge in voter registration, both statewide and in 40 of the 67 counties, including Miami-Dade, Broward, and Palm Beach counties, the state's three most populous.

name: florida
sentence: In 2000, George W. Bush won the US presidential election by a margin of 271–266 in the Electoral College.

name: florida
sentence: Of the 271 electoral votes for Bush, 25 were cast by electors from Florida.

name: florida
sentence: The Florida results were contested and a recount was ordered by the court, with the results settled in a Supreme Court decision, Bush v. Gore.

name: florida
sentence: Reapportionment following the 2010 United States Census gave the state two more seats in the House of Representatives.

name: florida
sentence: The legislature's redistricting, announced in 2012, was quickly challenged in court, on the grounds that it had unfairly benefited Republican interests.

name: florida
sentence: In 2015, the Florida Supreme Court ruled on appeal that the congressional districts had to be redrawn because of the legislature's violation of the Fair District Amendments to the state constitution passed in 2010; it accepted a new map in early December 2015.

name: florida
sentence: The political make-up of congressional and legislative districts has enabled Republicans to control the governorship and most statewide elective offices, and 17 of the state's 27 seats in the 2012 House of Representatives.

name: florida
sentence: Florida has been listed as a swing state in presidential elections since 1952, voting for the losing candidate only twice in that period of time.

name: florida
sentence: In the closely contested 2000 election, the state played a pivotal role.

name: florida
sentence: Out of more than 5.8 million votes for the two main contenders Bush and Al Gore, around 500 votes separated the two candidates for the all-decisive Florida electoral votes that landed Bush the election win.

name: florida
sentence: Florida's felony disenfranchisement law is more severe than most European nations or other American states.

name: florida
sentence: A 2002 study in the American Sociological Review concluded that "if the state's 827,000 disenfranchised felons had voted at the same rate as other Floridians, Democratic candidate Al Gore would have won Florida—and the presidency—by more than 80,000 votes."

name: florida
sentence: In 2008, delegates of both the Republican Florida primary election and Democratic Florida primary election were stripped of half of their votes when the conventions met in August due to violation of both parties' national rules.

name: florida
sentence: In the 2010 elections, Republicans solidified their dominance statewide, by winning the governor's mansion, and maintaining firm majorities in both houses of the state legislature.

name: florida
sentence: They won four previously Democratic-held seats to create a 19–6 Republican majority delegation representing Florida in the federal House of Representatives.

name: florida
sentence: In 2010, more than 63% of state voters approved the initiated Amendments 5 and 6 to the state constitution, to ensure more fairness in districting.

name: florida
sentence: These have become known as the Fair District Amendments.

name: florida
sentence: As a result of the 2010 United States Census, Florida gained two House of Representative seats in 2012.

name: florida
sentence: The legislature issued revised congressional districts in 2012, which were immediately challenged in court by supporters of the above amendments.

name: florida
sentence: The court ruled in 2014, after lengthy testimony, that at least two districts had to be redrawn because of gerrymandering.

name: florida
sentence: After this was appealed, in July 2015 the Florida Supreme Court ruled that lawmakers had followed an illegal and unconstitutional process overly influenced by party operatives, and ruled that at least eight districts had to be redrawn.

name: florida
sentence: On December 2, 2015, a 5–2 majority of the Court accepted a new map of congressional districts, some of which was drawn by challengers.

name: florida
sentence: Their ruling affirmed the map previously approved by Leon County Judge Terry Lewis, who had overseen the original trial.

name: florida
sentence: It particularly makes changes in South Florida.

name: florida
sentence: There are likely to be additional challenges to the map and districts.

name: florida
sentence: According to The Senatorencing Project, the effect of Florida's felony disenfranchisement law is such that in 2014, "[m]ore than one in ten Floridians—and nearly one in four African-American Floridians—are [were] shut out of the polls because of felony convictions", although they had completed sentences and parole/probation requirements.

name: florida
sentence: In the 2016 United States presidential and general elections, the state leaned Republican.

name: florida
sentence: The state's Democratic representation at the national level increased by one seat, but the overall state-wide composition was 16 Republicans to 11 Democrats.

name: florida
sentence: Floridians also voted 49.0% to 47.8% to elect Donald Trump over Hillary Clinton in the presidential election.

name: florida
sentence: With a 1.2% difference, this was the 5th closest presidential race that year, with only Wisconsin, Michigan, New Hampshire and Pennsylvania being closer.

name: florida
sentence: In the 2018 elections, the ratio of Republican to Democratic representation fell from 16:11 to 14:13.

name: florida
sentence: The US Senatorte election between Democratic incumbent senator Bill Nelson and former governor Rick Scott was close, with a 49.93% voting for the incumbent and 50.06% voting for the former governor.

name: florida
sentence: Republicans also held onto the governorship in a close race between Republican candidate Ron DeSantis and Democractic candidate Andrew Gillum, with 49.6% voting for the DeSantis and 49.3% voting for Gillum.

name: florida
sentence: In 1972, the state made personal injury protection auto insurance mandatory for drivers, becoming the second in the nation to enact a no-fault insurance law.

name: florida
sentence: The ease of receiving payments under this law is seen as precipitating a major increase in insurance fraud.

name: florida
sentence: Auto insurance fraud was the highest in the nation in 2011, estimated at close to $1 billion.

name: florida
sentence: Fraud is particularly centered in the Miami-Dade and Tampa areas.

name: florida
sentence: Capital punishment is applied in Florida.

name: florida
sentence: If a person committing a predicate felony directly contributed to the death of the victim then the person will be charged with murder in the first degree.

name: florida
sentence: The only two sentences available for that statute are life imprisonment and the death penalty.

name: florida
sentence: If a person commits a predicate felony, but was not the direct contributor to the death of the victim then the person will be charged with murder in the second degree.

name: florida
sentence: The maximum prison term is life.

name: florida
sentence: In 1995, the legislature modified Chapter 921 to provide that felons should serve at least 85% of their sentence.

name: florida
sentence: Florida approved its lottery by amending the constitution in 1984.

name: florida
sentence: It approved slot machines in Broward and Miami-Dade County in 2004.

name: florida
sentence: It has disapproved casinos (outside of sovereign Seminole and Miccosukee tribal areas) three times: 1978, 1986, and 1994.

name: florida
sentence: Tax is collected by the Florida Department of Revenue.

name: florida
sentence: Florida's economy ranks among the largest in the world.

name: florida
sentence: As of 2018, the gross state product (GSP) is about $1.0 trillion, the fourth largest economy in the United States.

name: florida
sentence: Florida is responsible for 5 percent of the United States' approximately $21 trillion gross domestic product (GDP).

name: florida
sentence: As of 2018, Florida's nominal GDP is larger than all but 15 countries.

name: florida
sentence: In terms of Purchasing Power Parity, it is larger than all but 24 countries.

name: florida
sentence: In the 20th century, tourism, industry, construction, international banking, biomedical and life sciences, healthcare research, simulation training, aerospace and defense, and commercial space travel have contributed to the state's economic development.

name: florida
sentence: The five largest sectors of employment in Florida are: trade, transportation, and utilities; government; professional and business services; education and health services; and leisure and hospitality.

name: florida
sentence: In output, the five largest sectors are: finance, insurance, real estate, rental, and leasing, followed by professional and business services; government and government enterprises; educational services, health care, and social assistance; and retail trade.

name: florida
sentence: In 2017, Florida became the United States' eighth largest exporter of trade goods.

name: florida
sentence: Florida's top countries for export are Brazil, Canada, Mexico, Germany, and Colombia.

name: florida
sentence: In 2017, Florida became the United States' tenth largest importer of trade goods.

name: florida
sentence: Florida imported US$75.4 billion worth of goods globally in 2017.

name: florida
sentence: The value of Florida's imports equals 3.2% of United States' overall imported products for 2017.

name: florida
sentence: Florida's top countries for imports are China, Mexico, Canada, Germany, and France.

name: florida
sentence: The Miami Metropolitan Area has the highest GDP of all the metro areas in Florida with $344.9 billion in 2017.

name: florida
sentence: This is more than twice the number of the next metro area, the Tampa Bay Area, which has a GDP of $145.3 billion.

name: florida
sentence: The economy of Florida is driven almost entirely by its nineteen metropolitan areas.

name: florida
sentence: In 2004, they had a combined total of 95.7% of the state's domestic product.

name: florida
sentence: Per capita GDP in 2017 was $39,842, ranking fortieth in the nation.

name: florida
sentence: Per capita income varies widely by geographic region and profession.

name: florida
sentence: North Florida and the rural counties of the Florida Panhandle are the most impoverished in the state.

name: florida
sentence: Florida has a poverty rate of 14.0%, the seventeenth lowest of any state in the country.

name: florida
sentence: Many coastal cities include some of the wealthiest per-capita areas in the United States.

name: florida
sentence: In 2018, there were more than 427,824 millionaires in the state, the fourth highest number in the nation.

name: florida
sentence: For 2018–19, the approved state budget is $88.7 billion, a 4.4% increase over the previous 2017–18 budget of $84.9 billion.

name: florida
sentence: Chief Executive Magazine named Florida the third "Best State for Business" in 2011.

name: florida
sentence: In 2017, Florida's per capita personal income was $47,684, ranking 26th in the nation.

name: florida
sentence: The state's unemployment rate in September 2018 was 3.5% and ranked as the 18th lowest in the United States.

name: florida
sentence: Florida is one of seven states that do not impose a personal income tax.

name: florida
sentence: In 2017, Florida had a personal income of $1,000,624,065(in thousands of dollars).

name: florida
sentence: This personal income ranked 4th in the United States.

name: florida
sentence: Florida's constitution establishes a state minimum wage, which is adjusted annually for inflation.

name: florida
sentence: As of January 1, 2017, Florida's minimum wage was $5.08 for tipped positions, and $8.10 for non-tipped positions, which was higher than the federal rate of $7.25.

name: florida
sentence: Florida has two cities in the top 25 cities in the US with the highest average credit card debt, Miami and Tampa.

name: florida
sentence: The poverty rate in Florida in 2018 was 14%, down from a peak of 17.1% in 2012.

name: florida
sentence: In the early 20th century, land speculators discovered Florida, and businessmen such as Henry Plant and Henry Flagler developed railroad systems, which led people to move in, drawn by the weather and local economies.

name: florida
sentence: From then on, tourism boomed, fueling a cycle of development that overwhelmed a great deal of farmland.

name: florida
sentence: At the end of the third quarter of 2008, Florida had the highest mortgage delinquency rate in the US, with 7.8% of mortgages delinquent at least 60 days.

name: florida
sentence: A 2009 list of national housing markets that were hard hit in the real estate crash included a disproportionate number in Florida.

name: florida
sentence: The early 21st-century building boom left Florida with 300,000 vacant homes in 2009, according to state figures.

name: florida
sentence: In 2009, the US Census Bureau estimated that Floridians spent an average 49.1% of personal income on housing-related costs, the third highest percentage in the US

name: florida
sentence: In the third quarter of 2009, there were 278,189 delinquent loans, 80,327 foreclosures.

name: florida
sentence: Sales of existing homes in February 2010 was 11,890, up 21% from the same month in 2009.

name: florida
sentence: Only two metropolitan areas showed a decrease in homes sold: Panama City and Brevard County.

name: florida
sentence: The average sales price for an existing house was $131,000, 7% decrease from the prior year.

name: florida
sentence: Tourism makes up one of the largest sectors of the state economy, with nearly 1.4 million people employed in the tourism industry in 2016 (a record for the state, surpassing the 1.2 million employment from 2015).

name: florida
sentence: In 2015, Florida broke the 100-million visitor mark for the first time in state history by hosting a record 105 million visitors.

name: florida
sentence: The state has set tourism records for eight consecutive years, most recently breaking the 120-million visitor mark for the first time in 2018 with 126.1 million visitors reported.

name: florida
sentence: Many beach towns are popular tourist destinations, particularly during winter and spring break.

name: florida
sentence: Twenty-three million tourists visited Florida beaches in 2000, spending $22 billion.

name: florida
sentence: The public has a right to beach access under the public trust doctrine, but some areas have access effectively blocked by private owners for a long distance.

name: florida
sentence: Amusement parks, especially in the Greater Orlando area, make up a significant portion of tourism.

name: florida
sentence: The Walt Disney World Resort is the most visited vacation resort in the world with more than 58 million visitors annually, consisting of four theme parks, 27 themed resort hotels, nine non-Disney hotels, two water parks, four golf courses and other recreational venues.

name: florida
sentence: Other major theme parks in the area include Universal Orlando Resort, SeaWorld Orlando and Busch Gardens Tampa.

name: florida
sentence: Florida's many state parks and protected areas receive a lot of visitors as well with 25.2 million visitors visiting Florida State Parks in 2013.

name: florida
sentence: Agriculture is the second largest industry in the state.

name: florida
sentence: Citrus fruit, especially oranges, are a major part of the economy, and Florida produces the majority of citrus fruit grown in the United States.

name: florida
sentence: In 2006, 67% of all citrus, 74% of oranges, 58% of tangerines, and 54% of grapefruit were grown in Florida.

name: florida
sentence: About 95% of commercial orange production in the state is destined for processing (mostly as orange juice, the official state beverage).

name: florida
sentence: Citrus canker continues to be an issue of concern.

name: florida
sentence: From 1997 to 2013, the growing of citrus trees has declined 25%, from 600,000 to 450,000 acres (240,000 to 180,000 ha).

name: florida
sentence: Citrus greening disease is incurable.

name: florida
sentence: A study states that it has caused the loss of $4.5 billion between 2006 and 2012.

name: florida
sentence: As of 2014, it was the major agricultural concern.

name: florida
sentence: The largest farm category by sales in Florida is the $2.3 billion ornamental industry, which includes nursery, greenhouse, flowers, and sod products.

name: florida
sentence: Other products include sugarcane, strawberries, tomatoes and celery.

name: florida
sentence: The state is the largest producer of sweet corn and green beans for the US

name: florida
sentence: The Everglades Agricultural Area is a major center for agriculture.

name: florida
sentence: The environmental impact of agriculture, especially water pollution, is a major issue in Florida today.

name: florida
sentence: In 2009, fishing was a $6 billion industry, employing 60,000 jobs for sports and commercial purposes.

name: florida
sentence: The state has a near monopoly on saw palmetto berries, an alternative medicine used to treat prostate and urinary disorders.

name: florida
sentence: Florida is the leading state for sales of powerboats.

name: florida
sentence: Boats sales totaled $1.96 billion in 2013.

name: florida
sentence: Phosphate mining, concentrated in the Bone Valley, is the state's third-largest industry.

name: florida
sentence: The state produces about 75% of the phosphate required by farmers in the United States and 25% of the world supply, with about 95% used for agriculture (90% for fertilizer and 5% for livestock feed supplements) and 5% used for other products.

name: florida
sentence: After the watershed events of Hurricane Andrew in 1992, Florida began investing in economic development through the Office of Trade, Tourism, and Economic Development.

name: florida
sentence: Governor Jeb Bush realized that watershed events such as Andrew negatively impacted Florida's backbone industry of tourism severely.

name: florida
sentence: The office was directed to target Medical/Bio-Sciences among others.

name: florida
sentence: Three years later, The Scripps Research Institute (TSRI) announced it had chosen Florida for its newest expansion.

name: florida
sentence: In 2003, TSRI announced plans to establish a major science center in Palm Beach, a 364,000 square feet (33,800 m2) facility on 100 acres (40 ha), which TSRI planned to occupy in 2006.

name: florida
sentence: Since the development of the federal NASA Merritt Island launch sites on Cape Canaveral (most notably Kennedy Space Center) in 1962, Florida has developed a sizable aerospace industry.

name: florida
sentence: Another major economic engine in Florida is the United States military.

name: florida
sentence: There are 24 military bases in the state, housing three Unified Combatant Commands; United States Central Command in Tampa, United States Southern Command in Doral, and United States Special Operations Command in Tampa.

name: florida
sentence: Some 109,390 US military personnel stationed in Florida, contributing, directly and indirectly, $52 billion a year to the state's economy.

name: florida
sentence: In 2009, there were 89,706 federal workers employed within the state.

name: florida
sentence: Tens of thousands more employees work for contractors who have federal contracts, including those with the military.

name: florida
sentence: In 2012, government of all levels was a top employer in all counties in the state, because this classification includes public school teachers and other school staff.

name: florida
sentence: School boards employ nearly one of every thirty workers in the state.

name: florida
sentence: The federal military was the top employer in three counties.

name: florida
sentence: Florida has many seaports that serve container ships, tank ships, and cruise lines.

name: florida
sentence: Major ports in Florida include Port Tampa Bay in Tampa, Port Everglades in Fort Lauderdale, Port of Jacksonville in Jacksonville, PortMiami in Miami, Port Canaveral in Brevard County, Port Manatee in Manatee County, and Port of Palm Beach in Riviera Beach.

name: florida
sentence: The world's top three busiest cruise ports are found in Florida with PortMiami as the busiest and Port Canaveral and Port Everglades as the second and third busiest.

name: florida
sentence: Port Tampa Bay meanwhile is the largest in the state, having the most tonnage.

name: florida
sentence: As of 2013, Port Tampa Bay ranks 16th in the United States by tonnage in domestic trade, 32nd in foreign trade, and 22nd in total trade.

name: florida
sentence: It is the largest, most diversified port in Florida, has an economic impact of more than $15.1 billion, and supports more than 80,000 jobs.

name: florida
sentence: There were 2.7 million Medicaid patients in Florida in 2009.

name: florida
sentence: The governor has proposed adding $2.6 billion to care for the expected 300,000 additional patients in 2011.

name: florida
sentence: The cost of caring for 2.3 million clients in 2010 was $18.8 billion.

name: florida
sentence: This is nearly 30% of Florida's budget.

name: florida
sentence: Medicaid paid for 60% of all births in Florida in 2009.

name: florida
sentence: The state has a program for those not covered by Medicaid.

name: florida
sentence: In 2013, Florida refused to participate in providing coverage for the uninsured under the Affordable Care Act, popularly called Obamacare.

name: florida
sentence: The Florida legislature also refused to accept additional Federal funding for Medicaid, although this would have helped its constituents at no cost to the state.

name: florida
sentence: As a result, Florida is second only to Texas in the percentage of its citizens without health insurance.

name: florida
sentence: Florida has the largest collection of Art Deco and Streamline Moderne buildings, both in the United States and in the entire world, most of which are located in the Miami metropolitan area, especially Miami Beach's Art Deco District, constructed as the city was becoming a resort destination.

name: florida
sentence: A unique architectural design found only in Florida is the post-World War II Miami Modern, which can be seen in areas such as Miami's MiMo Historic District.

name: florida
sentence: Being of early importance as a regional center of banking and finance, the architecture of Jacksonville displays a wide variety of styles and design principles.

name: florida
sentence: Many of the state's earliest skyscrapers were constructed in Jacksonville, dating as far back as 1902, and last holding a state height record from 1974 to 1981.

name: florida
sentence: The city is endowed with one of the largest collections of Prairie School buildings outside of the Midwest.

name: florida
sentence: Jacksonville is also noteworthy for its collection of Mid-Century modern architecture.

name: florida
sentence: Some sections of the state feature architectural styles including Spanish revival, Florida vernacular, and Mediterranean Revival.

name: florida
sentence: A notable collection of these styles can be found in St. Augustine, the oldest continuously occupied European-established settlement within the borders of the United States.

name: florida
sentence: Florida overall was ranked the 7th best state in America for educating students at all levels by US News & World Report in 2018.

name: florida
sentence: With an educational system made up of public school districts and independent private institutions, Florida had 2,833,115 students enrolled in 4,269 public primary, secondary, and vocational schools in Florida's 67 regular or seven special school districts as of 2018.

name: florida
sentence: Miami-Dade County is the largest of Florida's 67 regular districts with more than 350 thousand students and Jefferson is the smallest with less than one thousand students.

name: florida
sentence: Florida spent $8,920 for each student in 2016, and was 43rd in the nation in expenditures per student.

name: florida
sentence: Florida's primary and secondary school systems are administered by the Florida Department of Education.

name: florida
sentence: School districts are organized within county boundaries.

name: florida
sentence: Each school district has an elected Board of Education that sets policy, budget, goals, and approves expenditures.

name: florida
sentence: Management is the responsibility of a Superintendent of schools.

name: florida
sentence: The Florida Department of Education is required by law to train educators in teaching English for Speakers of Other Languages (ESOL).

name: florida
sentence: The State University System of Florida was founded in 1905, and is governed by the Florida Board of Governors.

name: florida
sentence: During the 2010 academic year, 312,216 students attended one of these twelve universities.

name: florida
sentence: The Florida College System comprises 28 public community and state colleges.

name: florida
sentence: In 2011–12, enrollment consisted of more than 875,000 students.

name: florida
sentence: As of 2017, the University of Central Florida, with more than 64,000 students, is the largest university by enrollment in the United States.Florida's first private university, Stetson University, was founded in 1883.

name: florida
sentence: The Independent Colleges and Universities of Florida is an association of 28 private, educational institutions in the state.

name: florida
sentence: This Association reported that their member institutions served more than 121,000 students in the fall of 2006.

name: florida
sentence: In 2016, Florida charged the second lowest tuition in the nation for four years, $26,000 for in-state students, to $86,000 for out-of-state students.

name: florida
sentence: This compares with an average of $34,800 nationally for in-state students.

name: florida
sentence: Florida's highway system contains 1,495 mi (2,406 km) of interstate highway, and 10,601 mi (17,061 km) of non-interstate highway, such as state highways and US

name: florida
sentence: Highways.

name: florida
sentence: Florida's interstates, state highways, and US

name: florida
sentence: Highways are maintained by the Florida Department of Transportation.

name: florida
sentence: In 2011, there were about 9,000 retail gas stations in the state.

name: florida
sentence: Floridians consumed 21 million gallons of gasoline daily in 2011, ranking it third in national use behind California and Texas.Motorists have the 45th lowest rate of car insurance in the US 24% are uninsured.

name: florida
sentence: Drivers between 15 and 19 years of age averaged 364 car crashes a year per ten thousand licensed Florida drivers in 2010.

name: florida
sentence: Drivers 70 and older averaged 95 per 10,000 during the same time frame.

name: florida
sentence: A spokesperson for the non-profit Insurance Institute said that "Older drivers are more of a threat to themselves."

name: florida
sentence: Intercity bus travel, which utilizes Florida's highway system, is provided by Greyhound, Megabus, and Amtrak Thruway Motorcoach.

name: florida
sentence: Before the construction of routes under the Federal Aid Highway Act of 1956, Florida began construction of a long cross-state toll road, Florida's Turnpike.

name: florida
sentence: The first section, from Fort Pierce south to the Golden Glades Interchange was completed in 1957.

name: florida
sentence: After a second section north through Orlando to Wildwood (near present-day The Villages), and a southward extension around Miami to Homestead, it was finished in 1974.

name: florida
sentence: Florida's primary interstate routes include:

name: florida
sentence: Florida has 131 public airports.

name: florida
sentence: Florida's seven large hub and medium hub airports, as classified by the FAA, are the following:

name: florida
sentence: Florida has three NFL teams, two MLB teams, two NBA teams, two NHL teams, and two MLS teams.

name: florida
sentence: Florida gained its first permanent major-league professional sports team in 1966 when the American Football League added the Miami Dolphins.

name: florida
sentence: Florida has given professional sports franchises some subsidies in the form of tax breaks since 1991.

name: florida
sentence: About half of all Major League Baseball teams conduct spring training in the state, with teams informally organized into the "Grapefruit League".

name: florida
sentence: Throughout MLB history, other teams have held spring training in Florida.

name: florida
sentence: NASCAR (headquartered in Daytona Beach) begins all three of its major auto racing series in Florida at Daytona International Speedway in February, featuring the Daytona 500, and ends all three Series in November at Homestead-Miami Speedway.

name: florida
sentence: Daytona also has the Coke Zero Sugar 400 NASCAR race weekend around Independence Day in July.

name: florida
sentence: The 24 Hours of Daytona is one of the world's most prestigious endurance auto races.

name: florida
sentence: The Grand Prix of St. Petersburg and Grand Prix of Miami have held IndyCar races as well.

name: florida
sentence: Florida is a major golf hub.

name: florida
sentence: The PGA of America is headquartered in Palm Beach Gardens, the PGA Tour is headquartered in Ponte Vedra Beach, and the LPGA is headquartered in Daytona Beach.

name: florida
sentence: The Players Championship, WGC-Cadillac Championship, Arnold Palmer Invitational, Honda Classic and Valspar Championship are PGA Tour rounds.

name: florida
sentence: Florida has teams in all five American major league sports.

name: florida
sentence: Florida's most recent major-league team, Inter Miami, began play in MLS in 2020.

name: florida
sentence: The Miami Masters is an ATP World Tour Masters 1000 and WTA Premier tennis event, whereas the Delray Beach International Tennis Championships is an ATP World Tour 250 event.

name: florida
sentence: Minor league baseball, football, basketball, ice hockey, soccer and indoor football teams are based in Florida.

name: florida
sentence: Ben Hill Griffin Stadium is the largest football stadium in Florida, the 12th largest stadium in American college football, and the 18th largest stadium in the world, as measured by its official seating capacity of 88,548—though, it has often held over 90,000 for Florida's home football games.

name: florida
sentence: Florida's universities have a number of collegiate sport programs.

name: florida
sentence: Major college football programs include the Florida State Seminoles and Miami Hurricanes of the Atlantic Coast Conference, and the Florida Gators of the Southeastern Conference.

name: florida
sentence: Since 1996, Florida has added four additional programs to the ranks of Division I FCS: UCF Knights, South Florida Bulls, Florida Atlantic Owls and FIU Panthers.

name: florida
sentence: The majority of the symbols were chosen after 1950; only the two oldest symbols—the state flower (chosen in 1909), and the state bird (chosen in 1927), and the state nickname (chosen in 1970)—are not listed in the 2010 Florida Statutes.

name: georgia
sentence: Georgia () is a state in the Deep South region of the Southern United States, bordered to the north by Tennessee and North Carolina; to the northeast by South Carolina; to the southeast by the Atlantic Ocean; to the south by Florida; and to the west by Alabama.

name: georgia
sentence: Georgia is the 24th-largest in area and 8th-most populous of the 50 United States.

name: georgia
sentence: Its 2019 estimated population was 10,617,423, according to the US Census Bureau.

name: georgia
sentence: Atlanta, a "beta(+)" global city, is both the state's capital and its largest city.

name: georgia
sentence: The Atlanta metropolitan area, with an estimated population of more than 6 million people in 2019, is the 9th most populous metropolitan area in the United States and contains about 57% of Georgia's entire population.

name: georgia
sentence: Founded in 1733 as a British colony, Georgia was the last and southernmost of the original Thirteen Colonies to be established.

name: georgia
sentence: Named after King George II of Great Britain, the Colony of Georgia covered the area from South Carolina south to Spanish Florida and west to French Louisiana at the Mississippi River.

name: georgia
sentence: On January 2, 1788, Georgia became the fourth state to ratify the United States Constitution.

name: georgia
sentence: From 1802 to 1804, western Georgia was split to form the Mississippi Territory, which later was admitted as the US states of Alabama and Mississippi.

name: georgia
sentence: Georgia declared its secession from the Union on January 19, 1861, and was one of the original seven Confederate States.

name: georgia
sentence: Following the Civil War, it was the last state to be restored to the Union, on July 15, 1870.

name: georgia
sentence: In the post-Reconstruction era, Georgia's economy was transformed as a group of prominent politicians, businessmen, and journalists, led by Henry W. Grady, espoused the "New South" philosophy of sectional reconciliation, industrialization, and white supremacy.

name: georgia
sentence: During the 20th century, several Georgians, most notably Martin Luther King Jr., were prominent leaders during the civil rights movement.

name: georgia
sentence: Since 1945, Georgia has seen substantial population growth as part of the broader Sun Belt phenomenon.

name: georgia
sentence: From 2007 to 2008, 14 of Georgia's counties ranked among the nation's 100 fastest-growing.

name: georgia
sentence: Georgia is defined by a diversity of landscapes, flora, and fauna.

name: georgia
sentence: The state's northernmost regions include the Blue Ridge Mountains, part of the larger Appalachian Mountain system.

name: georgia
sentence: The Piedmont plateau extends from the foothills of the Blue Ridge south to the Fall Line, an escarpment to the coastal plain defining the state's southern region.

name: georgia
sentence: Georgia's highest point is Brasstown Bald at 4,784 feet (1,458 m) above sea level; the lowest is the Atlantic Ocean.

name: georgia
sentence: With the exception of some high-altitude areas in the Blue Ridge, the entirety of the state has a humid subtropical climate.

name: georgia
sentence: Of the states entirely east of the Mississippi River, Georgia is the largest in land area.

name: georgia
sentence: Before settlement by Europeans, Georgia was inhabited by the mound building cultures.

name: georgia
sentence: The British colony of Georgia was founded by James Oglethorpe on February 12, 1733.

name: georgia
sentence: The colony was administered by the Trustees for the Establishment of the Colony of Georgia in America under a charter issued by (and named for) King George II.

name: georgia
sentence: The Trustees implemented an elaborate plan for the colony's settlement, known as the Oglethorpe Plan, which envisioned an agrarian society of yeoman farmers and prohibited slavery.

name: georgia
sentence: The colony was invaded by the Spanish in 1742, during the War of Jenkins' Ear.

name: georgia
sentence: In 1752, after the government failed to renew subsidies that had helped support the colony, the Trustees turned over control to the crown.

name: georgia
sentence: Georgia became a crown colony, with a governor appointed by the king.

name: georgia
sentence: The Province of Georgia was one of the Thirteen Colonies that revolted against British rule in the American Revolution by signing the 1776 Declaration of Independence.

name: georgia
sentence: The State of Georgia's first constitution was ratified in February 1777.

name: georgia
sentence: Georgia was the 10th state to ratify the Articles of Confederation on July 24, 1778, and was the 4th state to ratify the United States Constitution on January 2, 1788.

name: georgia
sentence: After the Creek War (1813–1814), General Andrew Jackson forced the Muscogee (Creek) tribes to surrender land to the state of Georgia, including in the Treaty of Fort Jackson (1814), surrendering 21 million acres in what is now southern Georgia and central Alabama, and the Treaty of Indian Springs (1825).

name: georgia
sentence: In 1829, gold was discovered in the North Georgia mountains leading to the Georgia Gold Rush and establishment of a federal mint in Dahlonega, which continued in operation until 1861.

name: georgia
sentence: The resulting influx of white settlers put pressure on the government to take land from the Cherokee Nation.

name: georgia
sentence: In 1830, President Andrew Jackson signed the Indian Removal Act, sending many eastern Native American nations to reservations in present-day Oklahoma, including all of Georgia's tribes.

name: georgia
sentence: Despite the Supreme Court's ruling in Worcester v. Georgia (1832) that US states were not permitted to redraw Indian boundaries, President Jackson and the state of Georgia ignored the ruling.

name: georgia
sentence: In 1838, his successor, Martin Van Buren, dispatched federal troops to gather the tribes and deport them west of the Mississippi.

name: georgia
sentence: This forced relocation, known as the Trail of Tears, led to the death of more than four thousand Cherokees.

name: georgia
sentence: In early 1861, Georgia joined the Confederacy (with secessionists having a slight majority of delegates) and became a major theater of the Civil War.

name: georgia
sentence: Major battles took place at Chickamauga, Kennesaw Mountain, and Atlanta.

name: georgia
sentence: In December 1864, a large swath of the state from Atlanta to Savannah was destroyed during General William Tecumseh Sherman's March to the Sea.

name: georgia
sentence: 18,253 Georgian soldiers died in service, roughly one of every five who served.

name: georgia
sentence: In 1870, following the Reconstruction Era, Georgia became the last Confederate state to be restored to the Union.

name: georgia
sentence: With white Democrats having regained power in the state legislature, they passed a poll tax in 1877, which disenfranchised many poor blacks and whites, preventing them from registering.

name: georgia
sentence: In 1908, the state established a white primary; with the only competitive contests within the Democratic Party, it was another way to exclude blacks from politics.

name: georgia
sentence: They constituted 46.7% of the state's population in 1900, but the proportion of Georgia's population that was African American dropped thereafter to 28%, primarily due to tens of thousands leaving the state during the Great Migration.

name: georgia
sentence: According to the Equal Justice Institute's 2015 report on lynching in the United States (1877–1950), Georgia had 531 deaths, the second-highest total of these extralegal executions of any state in the South.

name: georgia
sentence: The overwhelming number of victims were black and male.

name: georgia
sentence: Political disfranchisement persisted through the mid-1960s, until after Congress passed the Voting Rights Act of 1965.

name: georgia
sentence: An Atlanta-born Baptist minister who was part of the educated middle class that had developed in Atlanta's African-American community, Martin Luther King Jr., emerged as a national leader in the civil rights movement.

name: georgia
sentence: King joined with others to form the Southern Christian Leadership Conference (SCLC) in Atlanta in 1957 to provide political leadership for the Civil Rights Movement across the South.

name: georgia
sentence: On February 5, 1958, during a training mission flown by a B-47, a Mark 15 nuclear bomb, also known as the Tybee Bomb, was lost off the coast of Tybee Island near Savannah.

name: georgia
sentence: The bomb was thought by the Department of Energy to lie buried in silt at the bottom of Wassaw Sound.

name: georgia
sentence: By the 1960s, the proportion of African Americans in Georgia had declined to 28% of the state's population, after waves of migration to the North and some in-migration by whites.

name: georgia
sentence: With their voting power diminished, it took some years for African Americans to win a state-wide office.

name: georgia
sentence: Julian Bond, a noted civil rights leader, was elected to the state House in 1965, and served multiple terms there and in the state senate.

name: georgia
sentence: Atlanta Mayor Ivan Allen, Jr. testified before Congress in support of the Civil Rights Act, and Governor Carl Sanders worked with the Kennedy administration to ensure the state's compliance.

name: georgia
sentence: Ralph McGill, editor and syndicated columnist at the Atlanta Constitution, earned admiration by writing in support of the Civil Rights Movement.

name: georgia
sentence: In 1970, newly elected Governor Jimmy Carter declared in his inaugural address that the era of racial segregation had ended.

name: georgia
sentence: In 1972, Georgians elected Andrew Young to Congress as the first African American Congressman since the Reconstruction era.

name: georgia
sentence: In 1980, construction was completed on an expansion of what is now named Hartsfield–Jackson Atlanta International Airport (ATL).

name: georgia
sentence: The busiest and most efficient airport in the world, it accommodates more than a hundred million passengers annually.

name: georgia
sentence: Employing more than 60,000 people, the airport became a major engine for economic growth.

name: georgia
sentence: With the advantages of cheap real estate, low taxes, right-to-work laws and a regulatory environment limiting government interference, the Atlanta metropolitan area became a national center of finance, insurance, technology, manufacturing, real estate, logistics, and transportation companies, as well as the film, convention, and trade show businesses.

name: georgia
sentence: As a testament to the city's growing international profile, in 1990 the International Olympic Committee selected Atlanta as the site of the 1996 Summer Olympics.

name: georgia
sentence: Taking advantage of Atlanta's status as a transportation hub, in 1991 USestablished its headquarters in a suburb.

name: georgia

name: georgia
sentence: Beginning from the Atlantic Ocean, the state's eastern border with South Carolina runs up the Savannah River, northwest to its origin at the confluence of the Tugaloo and Senatorca Rivers.

name: georgia
sentence: It then continues up the Tugaloo (originally Tugalo) and into the Chattooga River, its most significant tributary.

name: georgia
sentence: These bounds were decided in the 1797 Treaty of Beaufort, and tested in the US Supreme Court in the two Georgia v. South Carolina cases in 1923 and 1989.

name: georgia
sentence: The border then takes a sharp turn around the tip of Rabun County, at latitude 35°N, though from this point it diverges slightly south (due to inaccuracies in the original survey).

name: georgia
sentence: This northern border was originally the Georgia and North Carolina border all the way to the Mississippi River, until Tennessee was divided from North Carolina, and the Yazoo companies induced the legislature of Georgia to pass an act, approved by the governor in 1795, to sell the greater part of Georgia's territory presently comprising Alabama and Mississippi.

name: georgia
sentence: The state's western border runs in a straight line south-southeastward from a point southwest of Chattanooga, to meet the Chattahoochee River near West Point.

name: georgia
sentence: It continues downriver to the point where it joins the Flint River (the confluence of the two forming Florida's Apalachicola River); the southern border goes almost due east and very slightly south, in a straight line to the St. Mary's River, which then forms the remainder of the boundary back to the ocean.

name: georgia
sentence: The water boundaries are still set to be the original thalweg of the rivers.

name: georgia
sentence: Since then, several have been inundated by lakes created by dams, including the Apalachicola/Chattahoochee/Flint point now under Lake Seminole.

name: georgia
sentence: Georgia state legislators have claimed that in an 1818 survey the state's border with Tennessee was erroneously placed one mile (1.6 km) farther south than intended, and they still dispute it.

name: georgia

name: georgia
sentence: Each region has its own distinctive characteristics.

name: georgia
sentence: For instance, the Ridge and Valley, which lies in the northwest corner of the state, includes limestone, sandstone, shale, and other sedimentary rocks, which have yielded construction-grade limestone, barite, ocher, and small amounts of coal.

name: georgia
sentence: The state of Georgia has approximately 250 tree species and 58 protected plants.

name: georgia
sentence: Georgia's native trees include red cedar, a variety of pines, oaks, hollies, cypress, sweetgum, scaly-bark and white hickories, and sabal palmetto.

name: georgia
sentence: East Georgia is in the subtropical coniferous forest biome and conifer species as other broadleaf evergreen flora make up the majority of the southern and coastal regions.

name: georgia
sentence: Yellow jasmine and mountain laurel make up just a few of the flowering shrubs in the state.

name: georgia
sentence: White-tailed (Virginia) deer are in nearly all counties.

name: georgia
sentence: The northern mockingbird and brown thrasher are among the 160 bird species that live in the state.

name: georgia
sentence: Reptiles include the eastern diamondback, copperhead, and cottonmouth snakes as well as alligators; amphibians include salamanders, frogs and toads.

name: georgia
sentence: There are about 79 species of reptile and 63 amphibians known to live in Georgia.

name: georgia
sentence: The most popular freshwater game fish are trout, bream, bass, and catfish, all but the last of which are produced in state hatcheries for restocking.

name: georgia
sentence: Popular saltwater game fish include red drum, spotted seatrout, flounder, and tarpon.

name: georgia
sentence: Porpoises, whales, shrimp, oysters, and blue crabs are found inshore and offshore of the Georgia coast.

name: georgia
sentence: The majority of the state is primarily a humid subtropical climate.

name: georgia
sentence: Hot and humid summers are typical, except at the highest elevations.

name: georgia
sentence: The entire state, including the North Georgia mountains, receives moderate to heavy precipitation, which varies from 45 inches (1143 mm) in central Georgia to approximately 75 inches (1905 mm) around the northeast part of the state.

name: georgia
sentence: The degree to which the weather of a certain region of Georgia is subtropical depends on the latitude, its proximity to the Atlantic Ocean or Gulf of Mexico, and the elevation.

name: georgia
sentence: The latter factor is felt chiefly in the mountainous areas of the northern part of the state, which are farther away from the ocean and can be 4500 feet (1350 m) above sea level.

name: georgia
sentence: The USDA plant hardiness zones for Georgia range from zone 6b (no colder than −5 °F (−21 °C) ) in the Blue Ridge Mountains to zone 8b (no colder than 15 °F (−9 °C) ) along the Atlantic coast and Florida border.

name: georgia
sentence: The highest temperature ever recorded is 112 °F (44.4 °C) in Louisville on July 24, 1952, while the lowest is −17 °F (−27.2 °C) in northern Floyd County on January 27, 1940.

name: georgia
sentence: Georgia is one of the leading states in frequency of tornadoes, though they are rarely stronger than EF1.

name: georgia
sentence: Although tornadoes striking the city are very rare, an EF2 tornado hit downtown Atlanta on March 14, 2008, causing moderate to severe damage to various buildings.

name: georgia
sentence: With a coastline on the Atlantic Ocean, Georgia is also vulnerable to hurricanes, although direct hurricane strikes were rare during the 20th century.

name: georgia
sentence: Georgia often is affected by hurricanes that strike the Florida Panhandle, weaken over land, and bring strong tropical storm winds and heavy rain to the interior, a recent example being Hurricane Michael, as well as hurricanes that come close to the Georgia coastline, brushing the coast on their way north without ever making landfall.

name: georgia
sentence: Hurricane Matthew of 2016 and Hurricane Dorian of 2019 did just that.

name: georgia
sentence: Due to anthropogenic Climate change the climate of Georgia is warming.

name: georgia
sentence: This is already causing major disruption, for example, from sea level rise (Georgia is more vulnerable to it than many other states because the its land is sinking) and further warming will increase it.

name: georgia
sentence: The United States Census Bureau estimates that in 2019 Georgia had a population of 10,617,423, which was an increase of 97,948 from the previous year, and an increase of 929,770 (9.60%) since 2010.

name: georgia
sentence: This includes a natural increase since the last census of 438,939 (849,414 births minus 410,475 deaths) and an increase from net migration of 606,673 people into the state.

name: georgia
sentence: Immigration resulted in a net increase of 228,415 people, and migration within the country produced a net increase of 378,258 people.

name: georgia
sentence: As of 2010, the number of illegal immigrants living in Georgia more than doubled to 480,000 from January 2000 to January 2009, according to a federal report.

name: georgia
sentence: That gave Georgia the greatest percentage increase among the 10 states with the biggest illegal immigrant populations during those years.

sentence: Georgia has banned sanctuary cities.
