name: georgia
sentence: According to the 2010 United States Census, Georgia had a population of 9,687,653.

name: georgia
sentence: In terms of race and ethnicity, the state was 59.7% White (55.9% Non-Hispanic White alone), 30.5% Black or African American, 0.3% American Indian or Alaska Native, 3.2% Asian, 0.1% Native Hawaiian or other Pacific Islander, 4.0% from some other race, and 2.1% from two or more races.

name: georgia
sentence: Hispanics and Latinos of any race made up 8.8% of the population.

name: georgia
sentence: As of 2011, 58.8% of Georgia's population younger than 1 were minorities (meaning they had at least one parent who was not non-Hispanic white) compared to other states like California with 75.1%, New York with 55.6%, and Texas with 69.8%.

name: georgia
sentence: The largest European ancestry groups are:

name: georgia
sentence: In the 1980 census 1,584,303 Georgians claimed English ancestry out of a total state population of 3,994,817, making them 40% of the state, and the largest ethnic group at the time.

name: georgia
sentence: Today, many of these same people claiming they are of "American" ancestry are actually of English descent, and some are of Scots-Irish descent; however, their families have lived in the state for so long, in many cases since the colonial period, that they choose to identify simply as having "American" ancestry or do not in fact know their own ancestry.

name: georgia
sentence: Their ancestry primarily goes back to the original thirteen colonies and for this reason many of them today simply claim "American" ancestry, though they are of predominantly English ancestry.

name: georgia
sentence: As of 2004, 7.7% of Georgia's population was reported as under 5 years of age, 26.4% under 18, and 9.6% were 65 or older.

name: georgia
sentence: Also, as of 2004, females made up approximately 50.6% of the population and African Americans made up approximately 29.6%.

name: georgia
sentence: Historically, about half of Georgia's population was composed of African Americans who, before the Civil War, were almost exclusively enslaved.

name: georgia
sentence: The Great Migration of hundreds of thousands of blacks from the rural South to the industrial North from 1914 to 1970 reduced the African American population.

name: georgia
sentence: Georgia had the second-fastest-growing Asian population growth in the US from 1990 to 2000, more than doubling in size during the ten-year period.

name: georgia
sentence: In addition, according to census estimates, Georgia ranks third among the states in terms of the percent of the total population that is African American (after Mississippi and Louisiana) and third in numeric Black population after New York and Florida.

name: georgia
sentence: Georgia is the state with the third-lowest percentage of older people (65 or older), at 12.8 percent (as of 2015).

name: georgia
sentence: The colonial settlement of large numbers of Scottish American, English American and Scotch-Irish Americans in the mountains and piedmont, and coastal settlement by some English Americans and African Americans, have strongly influenced the state's culture in food, language and music.

name: georgia
sentence: The concentration of Africans imported to coastal areas in the 18th century repeatedly from rice-growing regions of West Africa led to the development of Gullah-Geechee language and culture in the Low Country among African Americans.

name: georgia
sentence: They share a unique heritage in which African traditions of food, religion and culture were continued more than in some other areas.

name: georgia
sentence: In the creolization of Southern culture, their foodways became an integral part of all Southern cooking in the Low Country.

name: georgia
sentence: As of 2010, 87.35% (7,666,663) of Georgia residents age 5 and older spoke English at home as a primary language, while 7.42% (651,583) spoke Spanish, 0.51% (44,702) Korean, 0.44% (38,244) Vietnamese, 0.42% (36,679) French, 0.38% (33,009) Chinese (which includes Mandarin), and German, which was spoken as a main language by 0.29% (23,351) of the population over the age of 5.

name: georgia
sentence: In total, 12.65% (1,109,888) of Georgia's population age 5 and older spoke a mother language other than English.

name: georgia
sentence: Atlanta, located in north-central Georgia at the Eastern Continental Divide, has been Georgia's capital city since 1868.

name: georgia
sentence: It is the most populous city in Georgia, with an estimated 2019 population of just over 506,000.

name: georgia
sentence: The Atlanta metropolitan area is the cultural and economic center of the Southeast; its estimated population in 2019 was over 6 million, or 57% of Georgia's total.

name: georgia
sentence: Atlanta is the nation's ninth largest metropolitan area.

name: georgia
sentence: The state has seventeen cities with populations above 50,000, based on 2019 US Census estimates.

name: georgia
sentence: Along with the rest of the Southeast, Georgia's population continues to grow rapidly, with primary gains concentrated in urban areas.

name: georgia
sentence: The population of the Atlanta metropolitan area added 1.23 million people (24 percent) between 2000 and 2010, and Atlanta rose in rank from the eleventh-largest metropolitan area in the United States to the ninth-largest.

name: georgia
sentence: The composition of religious affiliation in Georgia is 70% Protestant, 9% Catholic, 1% Mormon, 1% Jewish, 0.5% Muslim, 0.5% Buddhist, and 0.5% Hindu.

name: georgia
sentence: Atheists, deists, agnostics, and other unaffiliated people make up 13% of the population.

name: georgia
sentence: The largest Christian denominations by number of adherents in 2010 were the Southern Baptist Convention with 1,759,317; the United Methodist Church with 619,394; and the Roman Catholic Church with 596,384.

name: georgia
sentence: Non-denominational Evangelical Protestant had 566,782 members, the Church of God (Cleveland, Tennessee) has 175,184 members, and the National Baptist Convention, USA, Inc. has 172,982 members.

name: georgia
sentence: The Presbyterian Church (USA) is the largest Presbyterian body in the state, with 300 congregations and 100,000 members.

name: georgia
sentence: The other large body, Presbyterian Church in America, had at its founding date 14 congregations and 2,800 members; in 2010 it counted 139 congregations and 32,000 members.

name: georgia
sentence: The Roman Catholic Church is noteworthy in Georgia's urban areas, and includes the Archdiocese of Atlanta and the Diocese of Savannah.

name: georgia
sentence: Georgia is home to the largest Hindu temple in the United States, the BAPS Shri Swaminarayan Mandir Atlanta, located in the suburb city of Lilburn.

name: georgia
sentence: Georgia is home to several historic synagogues including The Temple (Atlanta), Congregation Beth Jacob (Atlanta), and Congregation Mickve Israel (Savannah).

name: georgia
sentence: Chabad and the Rohr Jewish Learning Institute are also active in the state.

name: georgia
sentence: As with all other US states and the federal government, Georgia's government is based on the separation of legislative, executive, and judicial power.

name: georgia
sentence: Executive authority in the state rests with the governor, currently Brian Kemp (Republican).

name: georgia
sentence: Both the Governor of Georgia and lieutenant governor are elected on separate ballots to four-year terms of office.

name: georgia
sentence: Unlike the federal government, but like many other US States, most of the executive officials who comprise the governor's cabinet are elected by the citizens of Georgia rather than appointed by the governor.

name: georgia
sentence: Legislative authority resides in the General Assembly, composed of the Senatorte and House of Representatives.

name: georgia
sentence: The Lieutenant Governor presides over the Senatorte, while members of the House of Representatives select their own Speaker.

name: georgia
sentence: The Georgia Constitution mandates a maximum of 56 senators, elected from single-member districts, and a minimum of 180 representatives, apportioned among representative districts (which sometimes results in more than one representative per district); there are currently 56 senators and 180 representatives.

name: georgia
sentence: The term of office for senators and representatives is two years.

name: georgia
sentence: The laws enacted by the General Assembly are codified in the Official Code of Georgia Annotated.

name: georgia
sentence: State judicial authority rests with the state Supreme Court and Court of Appeals, which have statewide authority.

name: georgia
sentence: In addition, there are smaller courts which have more limited geographical jurisdiction, including Superior Courts, State Courts, Juvenile Courts, Magistrate Courts and Probate Courts.

name: georgia
sentence: Justices of the Supreme Court and judges of the Court of Appeals are elected statewide by the citizens in non-partisan elections to six-year terms.

name: georgia
sentence: Judges for the smaller courts are elected to four-year terms by the state's citizens who live within that court's jurisdiction.

name: georgia
sentence: Georgia consists of 159 counties, second only to Texas, with 254.

name: georgia
sentence: Georgia had 161 counties until the end of 1931, when Milton and Campbell were merged into the existing Fulton.

name: georgia
sentence: Some counties have been named for prominent figures in both American and Georgian history, and many bear names with Native American origin.

name: georgia
sentence: Counties in Georgia have their own elected legislative branch, usually called the Board of Commissioners, which usually also has executive authority in the county.

name: georgia
sentence: Several counties have a sole Commissioner form of government, with legislative and executive authority vested in a single person.

name: georgia
sentence: Georgia is the only state with current Sole Commissioner counties.

name: georgia
sentence: Georgia's Constitution provides all counties and cities with "home rule" authority.

name: georgia
sentence: The county commissions have considerable power to pass legislation within their county, as a municipality would.

name: georgia
sentence: Georgia recognizes all local units of government as cities, so every incorporated town is legally a city.

name: georgia
sentence: Georgia does not provide for townships or independent cities, though there have been bills proposed in the Legislature to provide for townships; it does allow consolidated city-county governments by local referendum.

name: georgia
sentence: All of Georgia's second-tier cities except Savannah have now formed consolidated city-county governments by referendum: Columbus (in 1970), Athens (1990), Augusta (1995), and Macon (2012).

name: georgia
sentence: (Augusta and Athens have excluded one or more small, incorporated towns within their consolidated boundaries; Columbus and Macon eventually absorbed all smaller incorporated entities within their consolidated boundaries.)

name: georgia
sentence: The small town of Cusseta adopted a consolidated city-county government after it merged with unincorporated Chattahoochee County in 2003.

name: georgia
sentence: Three years later, in 2006, the town of Georgetown consolidated with the rest of Quitman County.

name: georgia
sentence: There is no true metropolitan government in Georgia, though the Atlanta Regional Commission (ARC) and Georgia Regional Transportation Authority do provide some services, and the ARC must approve all major land development projects in the Atlanta metropolitan area.

name: georgia
sentence: Georgia had voted Republican in six consecutive presidential elections from 1996 to 2016, a streak that was broken when the state went for Democratic candidate Joe Biden in 2020.

name: georgia
sentence: Until 1964, Georgia's state government had the longest unbroken record of single-party dominance, by the Democratic Party, of any state in the Union.

name: georgia
sentence: This record was established largely due to the disenfranchisement of most blacks and many poor whites by the state in its constitution and laws in the early 20th century.

name: georgia
sentence: Some elements, such as requiring payment of poll taxes and passing literacy tests, prevented blacks from registering to vote; their exclusion from the political system lasted into the 1960s and reduced the Republican Party to a non-competitive status in the early 20th century.

name: georgia
sentence: White Democrats regained power after Reconstruction due in part to the efforts of some using intimidation and violence, but this method came into disrepute.

name: georgia
sentence: In 1900, shortly before Georgia adopted a disfranchising constitutional amendment in 1908, blacks comprised 47% of the state's population.

name: georgia
sentence: The whites dealt with this problem of potential political power by the 1908 amendment, which in practice disenfranchised blacks and poor whites, nearly half of the state population.

name: georgia
sentence: It required that any male at least 21 years of age wanting to register to vote must also: (a) be of good character and able to pass a test on citizenship, (b) be able to read and write provisions of the US and Georgia constitutions, or (c) own at least 40 acres of land or $500 in property.

name: georgia
sentence: Any Georgian who had fought in any war from the American Revolution through the Spanish–American War was exempted from these additional qualifications.

name: georgia
sentence: More importantly, any Georgian descended from a veteran of any of these wars also was exempted.

name: georgia
sentence: Because by 1908 many white Georgia males were grandsons of veterans and/or owned the required property, the exemption and the property requirement basically allowed only well-to-do whites to vote.

name: georgia
sentence: The qualifications of good character, citizenship knowledge, and literacy (all determined subjectively by white registrars), and property ownership were used to disqualify most blacks and poor whites, preventing them from registering to vote.

name: georgia
sentence: The voter rolls dropped dramatically.

name: georgia
sentence: In the early 20th century, Progressives promoted electoral reform and reducing the power of ward bosses to clean up politics.

name: georgia
sentence: Their additional rules, such as the eight-box law, continued to effectively close out people who were illiterate.

name: georgia
sentence: White one-party rule was solidified.

name: georgia
sentence: For more than 130 years, from 1872 to 2003, Georgians nominated and elected only white Democratic governors, and white Democrats held the majority of seats in the General Assembly.

name: georgia
sentence: Most of the Democrats elected throughout these years were Southern Democrats, who were fiscally and socially conservative by national standards.

name: georgia
sentence: This voting pattern continued after the segregationist period.

name: georgia
sentence: Legal segregation was ended by passage of federal legislation in the 1960s.

name: georgia
sentence: According to the 1960 census, the proportion of Georgia's population that was African American was 28%; hundreds of thousands of blacks had left the state in the Great Migration to the North and Midwest.

name: georgia
sentence: New white residents arrived through migration and immigration.

name: georgia
sentence: Following support from the national Democratic Party for the civil rights movement and especially civil rights legislation of 1964 and 1965, most African-American voters, as well as other minority voters, have largely supported the Democratic Party in Georgia.

name: georgia
sentence: In the decades since the late 20th century, the conservative white-majority voters have increasingly supported Republicans for national and state offices.

name: georgia
sentence: In 2002, incumbent moderate Democratic Governor Roy Barnes was defeated by Republican Sonny Perdue, a state legislator and former Democrat.

name: georgia
sentence: While Democrats retained control of the State House, they lost their majority in the Senatorte when four Democrats switched parties.

name: georgia
sentence: They lost the House in the 2004 election.

name: georgia
sentence: Republicans then controlled all three partisan elements of the state government.

name: georgia
sentence: Even before 2002, the state had become increasingly supportive of Republicans in Presidential elections.

name: georgia
sentence: It has supported a Democrat for president only three times since 1960.

name: georgia
sentence: In 1976 and 1980, native son Jimmy Carter carried the state; in 1992, the former Arkansas governor Bill Clinton narrowly won the state.

name: georgia
sentence: Generally, Republicans are strongest in the predominantly white suburban (especially the Atlanta suburbs) and rural portions of the state.

name: georgia
sentence: Many of these areas were represented by conservative Democrats in the state legislature well into the 21st century.

name: georgia
sentence: One of the most conservative of these was US

name: georgia
sentence: Congressman Larry McDonald, former head of the John Birch Society, who died when the Soviet Union shot down KAL 007 near Sakhalin Island.

name: georgia
sentence: Democratic candidates have tended to win a higher percentage of the vote in the areas where black voters are most numerous, as well as in the cities among liberal urban populations (especially Atlanta and Athens), and the central and southwestern portion of the state.

name: georgia
sentence: The ascendancy of the Republican Party in Georgia and in the South in general resulted in Georgia US House of Representatives member Newt Gingrich being elected as Speaker of the House following the election of a Republican majority in the House in 1994.

name: georgia
sentence: Gingrich served as Speaker until 1999, when he resigned in the aftermath of the loss of House seats held by members of the GOP.

name: georgia
sentence: Gingrich mounted an unsuccessful bid for president in the 2012 election, but withdrew after winning only the South Carolina and Georgia primaries.

name: georgia
sentence: In 2008, Democrat Jim Martin ran against incumbent Republican Senatortor Saxby Chambliss.

name: georgia
sentence: Chambliss failed to acquire the necessary 50 percent of votes due to a Libertarian Party candidate receiving the remainder of votes.

name: georgia
sentence: In the runoff election held on December 2, 2008, Chambliss became the second Georgia Republican to be reelected to the US Senatorte.

name: georgia
sentence: In the 2018 elections, the governor remained a Republican (by 54,723 votes against a democratic black female, Stacey Abrams), Republicans lost eight seats in the Georgia House of Representatives (winning 106), while Democrats gained ten (winning 74), Republicans lost two seats in the Georgia Senatorte (winning 35 seats), while Democrats gained two seats (winning 21), and five Democrat US

name: georgia
sentence: Representatives were elected with Republicans winning nine seats (one winning with just 419 votes over the Democratic challenger, and one seat being lost).

name: georgia
sentence: In the three presidential elections up to and including 2016, the Republican candidate has won Georgia by approximately five to eight points over the Democratic nominee, at least once for each election being narrower than margins recorded in some states that have flipped within that timeframe, such as Michigan, Ohio and Wisconsin.

name: georgia
sentence: This trend led to the state electing Democrat Joe Biden for president in 2020, and it coming to be regarded as a swing state.

name: georgia
sentence: During the 1960s and 1970s, Georgia made significant changes in civil rights and governance.

name: georgia
sentence: As in many other states, its legislature had not reapportioned congressional districts according to population from 1931 to after the 1960 census.

name: georgia
sentence: Problems of malapportionment in the state legislature, where rural districts had outsize power in relation to urban districts, such as Atlanta's, were corrected after the US Supreme Court ruling in Wesberry v. Sanders (1964).

name: georgia
sentence: The court ruled that congressional districts had to be reapportioned to have essentially equal populations.

name: georgia
sentence: A related case, Reynolds v. Sims (1964), required state legislatures to end their use of geographical districts or counties in favor of "one man, one vote"; that is, districts based upon approximately equal populations, to be reviewed and changed as necessary after each census.

name: georgia
sentence: These changes resulted in residents of Atlanta and other urban areas gaining political power in Georgia in proportion to their populations.

name: georgia
sentence: From the mid-1960s, the voting electorate increased after African Americans' rights to vote were enforced under civil rights law.

name: georgia
sentence: Economic growth through this period was dominated by Atlanta and its region.

name: georgia
sentence: It was a bedrock of the emerging "New South".

name: georgia
sentence: From the late 20th century, Atlanta attracted headquarters and relocated workers of national companies, becoming more diverse, liberal and cosmopolitan than many areas of the state.

name: georgia
sentence: In the 21st century, many conservative Democrats, including former US

name: georgia
sentence: Senatortor and governor Zell Miller, decided to support Republicans.

name: georgia
sentence: The state's socially conservative bent results in wide support for measures such as restrictions on abortion.

name: georgia
sentence: In 2004, a state constitutional amendment banning same-sex marriages was approved by 76% of voters.

name: georgia
sentence: However, after the United States Supreme Court issued its ruling in Obergefell v. Hodges, all Georgia counties came into full compliance, recognizing the rights of same-sex couples to marry in the state.

name: georgia
sentence: In presidential elections, Georgia voted solely Democratic in every election from 1900 to 1960.

name: georgia
sentence: In 1964, it was one of only a handful of states to vote for Republican Barry Goldwater over Democrat Lyndon B. Johnson.

name: georgia
sentence: In 1968, it did not vote for either of the two parties, but rather the American Independent Party and its nominee, Alabama Governor George Wallace.

name: georgia
sentence: In 1972, the state returned to Republicans as part of a landslide victory for Richard Nixon.

name: georgia
sentence: In 1976 and 1980, it voted for Democrat and former Georgia governor Jimmy Carter.

name: georgia
sentence: The state returned to Republicans in 1984 and 1988, before going Democratic once again in 1992.

name: georgia
sentence: For every election between that year and 2020, Georgia voted heavily Republican, in line with many of its neighbors in the Deep South.

name: georgia
sentence: In 2020, it voted Democratic for the first time in 28 years, aiding Joe Biden in his defeat of incumbent Republican Donald Trump.

name: georgia
sentence: Prior to 2020, Republicans in state, federal and congressional races had seen decreasing margins of victory, and many election forecasts had ranked Georgia as a "toss-up" state, or with Biden as a very narrow favorite.

name: georgia
sentence: Concurrent with the 2020 presidential election were two elections for both of Georgia's United States Senatorte seats (one of which being a special election due to the resignation of Senatortor Johnny Isakson, and the other being regularly scheduled).

name: georgia
sentence: After no candidate in either race received a majority of the vote, both went to January 5, 2021 run-offs, which Democrats Jon Ossoff and Raphael Warnock won.

name: georgia
sentence: Ossoff is the state's first Jewish senator, and Warnock is the state's first Black senator.

name: georgia
sentence: Biden's, Ossoff's, and Warnock's wins were attributed to increased turnout of younger African American voters, particularly around the suburbs of Atlanta and in Savannah, Georgia, due to the work of local organizers such as Stacey Abrams and LaTosha Brown.

name: georgia
sentence: Georgia's 2018 total gross state product was $602 billion.

name: georgia
sentence: For years Georgia as a state has had the highest credit rating by Standard & Poor's (AAA) and is one of only 15 states with a AAA rating.

name: georgia
sentence: If Georgia were a stand-alone country, it would be the 28th largest economy in the world, based on data from 2005.

name: georgia
sentence: There are 17 Fortune 500 companies and 26 Fortune 1000 companies with headquarters in Georgia, including Home Depot, US Coca-Cola, TSYS, Delta Air Lines, Aflac, Southern Company, Anthem Inc., and SunTrust Banks.

name: georgia
sentence: Atlanta boasts the world's busiest airport, as measured both by passenger traffic and by aircraft traffic.

name: georgia
sentence: Also, the Port of Savannah is the fourth largest seaport and fastest-growing container seaport in North America, importing and exporting a total of 2.3 million TEUs per year.

name: georgia
sentence: Atlanta has a large effect on the state of Georgia, the Southeastern United States, and beyond.

name: georgia
sentence: Atlanta has been the site of growth in finance, insurance, technology, manufacturing, real estate, service, logistics, transportation, film, communications, convention and trade show businesses and industries, while tourism is important to the economy.

name: georgia
sentence: Atlanta is a global city, also called world city or sometimes alpha city or world center, as a city generally considered to be an important node in the global economic system.

name: georgia
sentence: For the five years through November 2017, Georgia has been ranked the top state (number 1) in the nation to do business, and has been recognized as number 1 for business and labor climate in the nation, number 1 in business climate in the nation, number 1 in the nation in workforce training and as having a "Best in Class" state economic development agency.

name: georgia
sentence: In 2016, Georgia had median annual income per person of between $50,000 and $59,999, which is in inflation-adjusted dollars for 2016.

name: georgia
sentence: The US median annual income for the entire nation is $57,617.

name: georgia
sentence: This lies within the range of Georgia's median annual income.

name: georgia
sentence: Widespread farms produce peanuts, corn, and soybeans across middle and south Georgia.

name: georgia
sentence: The state is the number one producer of pecans in the world, with the region around Albany in southwest Georgia being the center of Georgia's pecan production.

name: georgia
sentence: Gainesville in northeast Georgia touts itself as the Poultry Capital of the World.

name: georgia
sentence: Georgia is in the top five blueberry producers in the United States.

name: georgia
sentence: Major products in the mineral industry include a variety of clays, stones, sands and the clay palygorskite, known as attapulgite.

name: georgia
sentence: While many textile jobs moved overseas, there is still a textile industry located around the cities of Rome, Columbus, Augusta, Macon and along the I-75 corridor between Atlanta and Chattanooga, Tennessee.

name: georgia
sentence: Historically it started along the fall line in the Piedmont, where factories were powered by waterfalls and rivers.

sentence: In November 2009, Kia started production in Georgia at the first US Kia Motors plant, Kia Motors Manufacturing Georgia in West Point.

name: georgia
sentence: Industrial products include textiles and apparel, transportation equipment, food processing, paper products, chemicals and products, and electric equipment.

name: georgia
sentence: Georgia was ranked the number 2 state for infrastructure and global access by Area Development magazine.

name: georgia
sentence: The Georgia Ports Authority owns and operates four ports in the state: Port of Savannah, Port of Brunswick, Port Bainbridge, and Port Columbus.

name: georgia

name: georgia
sentence: Several major companies including Target, IKEA, and Heineken operate distribution centers in close proximity to the Port of Savannah.

sentence: Hartsfield–Jackson Atlanta International Airport moves over 650,000 tons of cargo annually through three cargo complexes (two million square feet of floor space).

name: georgia

name: georgia
sentence: Georgia is a major railway hub, has the most extensive rail system in the Southeast, and has the service of two Class I railroads, CSX and Norfolk Southern, plus 24 short-line railroads.

name: georgia
sentence: Georgia is ranked the #3 state in the nation for rail accessibility.

name: georgia
sentence: Rail shipments include intermodal, bulk, automotive and every other type of shipment.

name: georgia
sentence: Georgia has an extensive interstate highway system including 1,200 miles of interstate highway and 20,000 miles of federal and state highways that facilitate the efficient movement of more than $620 billion of cargo by truck each year.

name: georgia
sentence: Georgia's six interstates connect to 80 percent of the US population within a two-day truck drive.

name: georgia
sentence: More than $14 billion in funding has been approved for new roadway infrastructure.

name: georgia
sentence: Southern Congressmen have attracted major investment by the US military in the state.

name: georgia
sentence: The several installations include Moody Air Force Base, Fort Stewart, Hunter Army Airfield, Naval Submarine Base Kings Bay, Fort Benning, Robins Air Force Base, Fort Gordon, Marine Corps Logistics Base Albany, Dobbins Air Reserve Base, Coast Guard Air Station Savannah and Coast Guard Station Brunswick.

name: georgia
sentence: These installations command numerous jobs and business for related contractors.

name: georgia
sentence: Georgia's electricity generation and consumption are among the highest in the United States, with natural gas being the primary electrical generation fuel, followed by coal.

name: georgia
sentence: The state also has two nuclear power facilities, Plant Hatch and Plant Vogtle, which contribute almost one fourth of Georgia's electricity generation, and an additional two nuclear power plants are under construction at Plant Vogtle.

name: georgia
sentence: In 2013, the generation mix was 39% gas, 35% coal, 23% nuclear, 3% hydro and other renewable sources.

name: georgia
sentence: The leading area of energy consumption is the industrial sector because Georgia "is a leader in the energy-intensive wood and paper products industry".

name: georgia
sentence: Solar generated energy is becoming more in use with solar energy generators currently installed ranking Georgia 15th in the country in installed solar capacity.

name: georgia
sentence: In 2013, $189 million was invested in Georgia to install solar for home, business and utility use representing a 795% increase over the previous year.

name: georgia
sentence: Georgia has a progressive income tax structure with six brackets of state income tax rates that range from 1% to 6%.

name: georgia
sentence: In 2009, Georgians paid 9% of their income in state and local taxes, compared to the US average of 9.8% of income.

name: georgia
sentence: This ranks Georgia 25th among the states for total state and local tax burden.

name: georgia
sentence: The state sales tax in Georgia is 4% with additional percentages added through local options (e.g.

name: georgia
sentence: special-purpose local-option sales tax or SPLOST), but there is no sales tax on prescription drugs, certain medical devices, or food items for home consumption.

name: georgia
sentence: The state legislature may allow municipalities to institute local sales taxes and special local taxes, such as the 2% SPLOST tax and the 1% sales tax for MARTA serviced counties.

name: georgia
sentence: Excise taxes are levied on alcohol, tobacco, and motor fuel.

name: georgia
sentence: Owners of real property in Georgia pay property tax to their county.

name: georgia
sentence: All taxes are collected by the Georgia Department of Revenue and then properly distributed according to any agreements that each county has with its cities.

sentence: The Georgia Film, Music and Digital Entertainment Office promotes filming in the state.

name: georgia
sentence: In the Atlanta area, World of Coke, Georgia Aquarium, Zoo Atlanta and Stone Mountain are important tourist attractions.

sentence: Authors have grappled with Georgia's complex history.

name: georgia
sentence: Sports in Georgia include professional teams in nearly all major sports, Olympic Games contenders and medalists, collegiate teams in major and small-school conferences and associations, and active amateur teams and individual sports.

sentence: There are 48 state parks, 15 historic sites, and numerous wildlife preserves under supervision of the Georgia Department of Natural Resources.

sentence: Outdoor recreational activities include hiking along the Appalachian Trail

name: georgia
sentence: Georgia county and city public school systems are administered by school boards with members elected at the local level.

name: georgia
sentence: As of 2013, all but 19 of 181 boards are elected from single-member districts.

name: georgia
sentence: Residents and activist groups in Fayette County, Georgia sued the board of commissioners and school board for maintaining an election system based on at-large voting, which tended to increase the power of the majority and effectively prevented minority participation on elected local boards for nearly 200 years.

name: georgia
sentence: A change to single-member districts has resulted in the African-American minority being able to elect representatives of its choice.

name: georgia
sentence: Georgia high schools (grades nine through twelve) are required to administer a standardized, multiple choice End of Course Test, or EOCT, in each of eight core subjects: algebra, geometry, US history, economics, biology, physical science, ninth grade literature and composition, and American literature.

name: georgia
sentence: The official purpose of the tests is to assess "specific content knowledge and skills".

name: georgia
sentence: Although a minimum test score is not required for the student to receive credit in the course, completion of the test is mandatory.

name: georgia
sentence: The EOCT score accounts for 15% of a student's grade in the course.

name: georgia
sentence: The Georgia Milestone evaluation is taken by public school students in the state.

name: georgia
sentence: In 2020, because of the ongoing COVID-19 pandemic, the Georgia State BOE agreed to state superintendent Richard Woods’ proposal to change the weight of the EOCT test to only count for 0.01% of the Student's course grade.

name: georgia
sentence: This change is currently only in effect for the 2020–21 school year.

name: georgia
sentence: Georgia has 85 public colleges, universities, and technical colleges in addition to more than 45 private institutes of higher learning.

name: georgia
sentence: Among Georgia's public universities is the flagship research university, the University of Georgia, founded in 1785 as the country's oldest state-chartered university and the birthplace of the American system of public higher education.

name: georgia
sentence: The University System of Georgia is the presiding body over public post-secondary education in the state.

name: georgia
sentence: The System includes 29 institutions of higher learning and is governed by the Georgia Board of Regents.

name: georgia
sentence: Georgia's workforce of more than 6.3 million is constantly refreshed by the growing number of people who move there along with the 90,000 graduates from the universities, colleges and technical colleges across the state, including the highly ranked University of Georgia, Georgia Institute of Technology, Georgia State University and Emory University.

name: georgia
sentence: The HOPE Scholarship, funded by the state lottery, is available to all Georgia residents who have graduated from high school or earned a General Educational Development certificate.

name: georgia
sentence: The student must maintain a 3.2 or higher grade point average and attend a public college or university in the state.

name: georgia
sentence: The Georgia Historical Society, an independent educational and research institution, has a research center located in Savannah.

name: georgia
sentence: The research center's library and archives hold the oldest collection of materials related to Georgia history in the nation.

name: georgia
sentence: The Atlanta metropolitan area is the ninth largest media market in the United States as ranked by Nielsen Media Research.

name: georgia
sentence: The state's other top markets are Savannah (95th largest), Augusta (115th largest), and Columbus (127th largest).

name: georgia
sentence: There are 48 television broadcast stations in Georgia including TBS, TNT, TCM, Cartoon Network, CNN and Headline News, all founded by notable Georgia resident Ted Turner.

name: georgia
sentence: The Weather Channel also has its headquarters in Atlanta.

name: georgia
sentence: By far, the largest daily newspaper in Georgia is the Atlanta Journal-Constitution with a daily readership of 195,592 and a Sunday readership of 397,925.

name: georgia
sentence: Other large dailies include The Augusta Chronicle, the Columbus Ledger-Enquirer, The Telegraph (formerly The Macon Telegraph) and the Savannah Morning News.

name: georgia
sentence: WSB-AM in Atlanta was the first licensed radio station in the southeastern United States, signing on in 1922.

name: georgia
sentence: Georgia Public Radio has been in service since 1984 and, with the exception of Atlanta, it broadcasts daily on several FM (and one AM) stations across the state.

sentence: Georgia Public Radio reaches nearly all of Georgia (with the exception of the Atlanta area, which is served by WABE).

name: georgia
sentence: WSB-TV in Atlanta is the state's oldest television station, having begun operations in 1948.

name: georgia
sentence: WSB was only the second such operation founded in the Southern US, trailing only WTVR in Richmond, Virginia.

name: georgia
sentence: Transportation in Georgia is overseen by the Georgia Department of Transportation, a part of the executive branch of the state government.

name: georgia
sentence: Georgia's major Interstate Highways are I-20, I-75, I-85, and I-95.

name: georgia
sentence: On March 18, 1998, the Georgia House of Representatives passed a resolution naming the portion of Interstate Highway 75, which runs from the Chattahoochee River northward to the Tennessee state line the Larry McDonald Memorial Highway.

name: georgia
sentence: Larry McDonald, a Democratic member of the House of Representatives, had been on Korean Air Lines Flight 007 when it was shot down by the Soviets on September 1, 1983.

name: georgia
sentence: Georgia's primary commercial airport is Hartsfield–Jackson Atlanta International Airport (ATL), the world's busiest airport.

name: georgia
sentence: In addition to Hartsfield–Jackson, there are eight other airports serving major commercial traffic in Georgia.

name: georgia
sentence: Savannah/Hilton Head International Airport is the second-busiest airport in the state as measured by passengers served, and is the only additional international airport.

name: georgia
sentence: Other commercial airports (ranked in order of passengers served) are located in Augusta, Columbus, Albany, Macon, Brunswick, Valdosta, and Athens.

name: georgia
sentence: The Georgia Ports Authority manages two deepwater seaports, at Savannah and Brunswick, and two river ports, at Bainbridge and Columbus.

name: georgia
sentence: The Port of Savannah is a major US seaport on the Atlantic coast.

name: georgia
sentence: The Metropolitan Atlanta Rapid Transit Authority (MARTA) is the principal rapid transit system in the Atlanta metropolitan area.

name: georgia
sentence: Formed in 1971 as strictly a bus system, MARTA operates a network of bus routes linked to a rapid transit system consisting of 48 miles (77 km) of rail track with 38 train stations.

name: georgia
sentence: MARTA operates almost exclusively in Fulton and DeKalb counties, with bus service to two destinations in Cobb county and the Cumberland Transfer Center next to the Cumberland Mall, and a single rail station in Clayton County at Hartsfield–Jackson Atlanta International Airport.

name: georgia
sentence: MARTA also operates a separate paratransit service for disabled customers.

name: georgia
sentence: As of 2009, the average total daily ridership for the system (bus and rail) was 482,500 passengers.

sentence: The state has 151 general hospitals, more than 15,000 doctors and almost 6,000 dentists.

name: georgia
sentence: The state is ranked forty-first in the percentage of residents who engage in regular exercise.

sentence: Jimmy Carter, from Plains, Georgia, was President of the United States from 1977 to 1981.

name: hawaii
sentence: Hawaii ( (listen) hə-WY-ee

name: hawaii
sentence: It is the only state outside North America, the only island state, and the only state in the tropics.

name: hawaii
sentence: Hawaii is also one of a handful of US states to have once been an independent nation.

name: hawaii
sentence: Hawaii encompasses nearly the entire Hawaiian archipelago, composed of 137 volcanic islands spanning 1,500 miles (2,400 km), which are physiographically and ethnologically part of the Polynesian subregion of Oceania.

name: hawaii
sentence: The state's ocean coastline is consequently the fourth longest in the US, at about 750 miles (1,210 km).

name: hawaii
sentence: The eight main islands, from northwest to southeast, are Niʻihau, Kauaʻi, Oʻahu, Molokaʻi, Lānaʻi, Kahoʻolawe, Maui, and Hawaiʻi, after which the state is named; it is often called the "Big Island" or "Hawaii Island" to avoid confusion with the state or archipelago.

name: hawaii
sentence: The uninhabited Northwestern Hawaiian Islands make up most of the Papahānaumokuākea Marine National Monument, the largest protected area in the US and the third largest in the world.

name: hawaii
sentence: Of the fifty US states, Hawaii is the eighth-smallest in area and the 11th-least populous, but with 1.4 million residents is the 13th-most densely populated.

name: hawaii
sentence: Two-thirds of the population lives on the island of O'ahu, home to the state's capital and largest city, Honolulu.

name: hawaii
sentence: Hawaii is among the most diverse states in the country, owing to its central location in the Pacific and over two centuries of migration; it has the nation's only Asian American majority, largest Buddhist community, and largest proportion of multiracial people.

name: hawaii
sentence: Consequently, the state is a unique melting pot of Southeast Asian, East Asian and North American cultures, in addition to its indigenous Hawaiian culture.

name: hawaii
sentence: Settled by Polynesians some time between 124 and 1120, Hawaii was home to numerous independent chiefdoms.

name: hawaii
sentence: British explorer James Cook was the first known non-Polynesian to discover the archipelago in 1778

name: hawaii
sentence: An influx of explorers, traders, and whalers arrived shortly thereafter, introducing diseases that decimated the once-isolated indigenous community.

name: hawaii
sentence: Hawaii became a unified, internationally recognized kingdom in 1810, remaining independent until Western businessmen overthrew the monarchy in 1893; this led to annexation by the US in 1898.

name: hawaii
sentence: As a strategically valuable US territory, Hawaii was attacked by Japan on December 7, 1941, which brought it global and historical significance, and contributed to America's decisive entry into World War II.

name: hawaii
sentence: Hawaii became the most recent state to join the union on August 21, 1959.

name: hawaii
sentence: In 1993, the US government formally apologized for its role in the overthrow of Hawaii's government, which spurred the Hawaiian sovereignty movement.

name: hawaii
sentence: Historically dominated by a plantation economy, Hawaii remains a major agricultural exporter due to its fertile soil and uniquely tropical climate in the US Its economy has gradually diversified since the mid 20th century, with tourism and military defense becoming the two largest sectors.

name: hawaii
sentence: The state attracts tourists, surfers, and scientists from around the world with its diverse natural scenery, warm tropical climate, abundance of public beaches, oceanic surroundings, active volcanoes, and clear skies on the Big Island.

name: hawaii
sentence: Hawaii hosts the US Pacific Fleet, the largest naval command in the world, as well as 75,000 employees of the Defense Department.

name: hawaii
sentence: Although its relative isolation results in one of the nation's highest costs of living, Hawaii ranks as the third wealthiest state in the US; Honolulu ranks high in several world livability rankings, ranking 22nd out of 140 cities worldwide in the 2019 Global Liveability Index, the highest of any American city.

name: hawaii
sentence: The state of Hawaii derives its name from the name of its largest island, Hawaiʻi.

name: hawaii
sentence: A common Hawaiian explanation of the name of Hawaiʻi is that it was named for Hawaiʻiloa, a legendary figure from Hawaiian myth.

name: hawaii
sentence: He is said to have discovered the islands when they were first settled.

name: hawaii
sentence: The Hawaiian language word Hawaiʻi is very similar to Proto-Polynesian Sawaiki, with the reconstructed meaning "homeland".

name: hawaii
sentence: Cognates of Hawaiʻi are found in other Polynesian languages, including Māori (Hawaiki), Rarotongan (ʻAvaiki) and Samoan (Savaiʻi).

name: hawaii
sentence: According to linguists Pukui and Elbert, "elsewhere in Polynesia, Hawaiʻi or a cognate is the name of the underworld or of the ancestral home, but in Hawaii, the name has no meaning".

name: hawaii
sentence: In 1978, Hawaiian was added to the Constitution of the State of Hawaii as an official state language alongside English.

name: hawaii
sentence: The title of the state constitution is The Constitution of the State of Hawaii.

name: hawaii
sentence: Article XV, Section 1 of the Constitution uses The State of Hawaii.

name: hawaii
sentence: Diacritics were not used because the document, drafted in 1949, predates the use of the ʻokina ⟨ʻ⟩ and the kahakō in modern Hawaiian orthography.

name: hawaii
sentence: The exact spelling of the state's name in the Hawaiian language is Hawaiʻi.

name: hawaii
sentence: In the Hawaii Admission Act that granted Hawaiian statehood, the federal government recognized Hawaii as the official state name.

name: hawaii
sentence: Official government publications, department and office titles, and the Seal of Hawaii use the traditional spelling with no symbols for glottal stops or vowel length.

name: hawaii
sentence: There are eight main Hawaiian islands, seven of which are permanently inhabited.

name: hawaii
sentence: The island of Niʻihau is privately managed by brothers Bruce and Keith Robinson

name: hawaii
sentence: Access to uninhabited Kahoʻolawe island is also restricted.

name: hawaii
sentence: The Hawaiian archipelago is located 2,000 mi (3,200 km) southwest of the contiguous United States.

name: hawaii
sentence: Hawaii is the southernmost US state and the second westernmost after Alaska.

name: hawaii
sentence: Hawaii, like Alaska, does not border any other US state.

name: hawaii
sentence: It is the only US state that is not geographically located in North America, the only state completely surrounded by water and that is entirely an archipelago, and the only state in which coffee is commercially cultivable.

name: hawaii
sentence: In addition to the eight main islands, the state has many smaller islands and islets.

name: hawaii
sentence: Kaʻula is a small island near Niʻihau.

name: hawaii
sentence: The Northwest Hawaiian Islands is a group of nine small, older islands to the northwest of Kauaʻi that extend from Nihoa to Kure Atoll; these are remnants of once much larger volcanic mountains.

name: hawaii
sentence: Across the archipelago are around 130 small rocks and islets, such as Molokini, which are either volcanic, marine sedimentary or erosional in origin.

name: hawaii
sentence: Hawaiʻi's tallest mountain Mauna Kea is 13,796 ft (4,205 m) above mean sea level; it is taller than Mount Everest if measured from the base of the mountain, which lies on the floor of the Pacific Ocean and rises about 33,500 feet (10,200 m).

name: hawaii
sentence: The Hawaiian islands were formed by volcanic activity initiated at an undersea magma source called the Hawaiʻi hotspot.

name: hawaii
sentence: The process is continuing to build islands; the tectonic plate beneath much of the Pacific Ocean continually moves northwest and the hot spot remains stationary, slowly creating new volcanoes.

name: hawaii
sentence: Because of the hotspot's location, all currently active land volcanoes are located on the southern half of Hawaiʻi Island.

name: hawaii
sentence: The newest volcano, Lōʻihi Seamount, is located south of the coast of Hawaiʻi Island.

name: hawaii
sentence: The last volcanic eruption outside Hawaiʻi Island occurred at Haleakalā on Maui before the late 18th century, possibly hundreds of years earlier.

name: hawaii
sentence: In 1790, Kīlauea exploded; it was the deadliest eruption known to have occurred in the modern era in what is now the United States.

name: hawaii
sentence: Up to 5,405 warriors and their families marching on Kīlauea were killed by the eruption.

name: hawaii
sentence: Volcanic activity and subsequent erosion have created impressive geological features.

name: hawaii
sentence: Hawaii Island has the second-highest point among the world's islands.

name: hawaii
sentence: On the flanks of the volcanoes, slope instability has generated damaging earthquakes and related tsunamis, particularly in 1868 and 1975.

name: hawaii
sentence: Steep cliffs have been created by catastrophic debris avalanches on the submerged flanks of ocean island volcanoes.

name: hawaii
sentence: The Kīlauea erupted in May 2018, opening 22 fissure vents on its East Rift Zone.

name: hawaii
sentence: The Leilani Estates and Lanipuna Gardens are situated within this territory.

name: hawaii
sentence: The destruction affected at least 36 buildings and this coupled with the lava flows and the sulfur dioxide fumes, necessitated the evacuation of more than 2,000 local inhabitants from the neighborhoods.

name: hawaii
sentence: Because the islands of Hawaiʻi are distant from other land habitats, life is thought to have arrived there by wind, waves (i.e.

name: hawaii
sentence: by ocean currents) and wings (i.e.

name: hawaii
sentence: birds, insects, and any seeds they may have carried on their feathers).

name: hawaii
sentence: This isolation, in combination with the diverse environment (including extreme altitudes, tropical climates, and arid shorelines), allowed for the evolution of new endemic flora and fauna.

name: hawaii
sentence: Hawaiʻi has more endangered species and has lost a higher percentage of its endemic species than any other US state.

name: hawaii
sentence: One endemic plant, Brighamia, now requires hand-pollination because its natural pollinator is presumed to be extinct.

name: hawaii
sentence: The two species of Brighamia—B.

name: hawaii
sentence: rockii and B. insignis—are represented in the wild by around 120 individual plants.

name: hawaii
sentence: To ensure these plants set seed, biologists rappel down 3,000-foot (910 m) cliffs to brush pollen onto their stigmas.

name: hawaii
sentence: The extant main islands of the archipelago have been above the surface of the ocean for fewer than 10 million years

name: hawaii
sentence: The islands are well known for the environmental diversity that occurs on high mountains within a trade winds field.

name: hawaii
sentence: On a single island, the climate around the coasts can range from dry tropical (less than 20 inches or 510 millimeters annual rainfall) to wet tropical; on the slopes, environments range from tropical rainforest (more than 200 inches or 5,100 millimeters per year), through a temperate climate, to alpine conditions with a cold, dry climate.

name: hawaii
sentence: The rainy climate impacts soil development, which largely determines ground permeability, affecting the distribution of streams and wetlands.

name: hawaii
sentence: Several areas in Hawaiʻi are under the protection of the National Park Service.

name: hawaii
sentence: Hawaii has two national parks: Haleakalā National Park located near Kula on the island of Maui, which features the dormant volcano Haleakalā that formed east Maui, and Hawaii Volcanoes National Park in the southeast region of the Hawaiʻi Island, which includes the active volcano Kīlauea and its rift zones.

name: hawaii
sentence: There are three national historical parks; Kalaupapa National Historical Park in Kalaupapa, Molokaʻi, the site of a former leper colony; Kaloko-Honokōhau National Historical Park in Kailua-Kona on Hawaiʻi Island; and Puʻuhonua o Hōnaunau National Historical Park, an ancient place of refuge on Hawaiʻi Island's west coast.

name: hawaii
sentence: Other areas under the control of the National Park Service include Ala Kahakai National Historic Trail on Hawaiʻi Island and the USArizona Memorial at Pearl Harbor on Oʻahu.

name: hawaii
sentence: The Papahānaumokuākea Marine National Monument was proclaimed by President George W. Bush on June 15, 2006.

name: hawaii
sentence: The monument covers roughly 140,000 square miles (360,000 km2) of reefs, atolls, and shallow and deep sea out to 50 miles (80 km) offshore in the Pacific Ocean—an area larger than all the national parks in the US combined.

name: hawaii
sentence: Hawaiʻi's climate is typical for the tropics, although temperatures and humidity tend to be less extreme because of near-constant trade winds from the east.

name: hawaii
sentence: Summer highs usually reach around 88 °F (31 °C) during the day, with the temperature reaching a low of 75 °F (24 °C) at night.

name: hawaii
sentence: Winter day temperatures are usually around 83 °F (28 °C)

name: hawaii
sentence: Snow, not usually associated with the tropics, falls at 13,800 feet (4,200 m) on Mauna Kea and Mauna Loa on Hawaii Island in some winter months.

name: hawaii
sentence: Snow rarely falls on Haleakalā.

name: hawaii
sentence: Mount Waiʻaleʻale on Kauaʻi has the second-highest average annual rainfall on Earth, about 460 inches (12,000 mm) per year.

name: hawaii
sentence: Most of Hawaii experiences only two seasons

name: hawaii
sentence: The warmest temperature recorded in the state, in Pahala on April 27, 1931, is 100 °F (38 °C), making it tied with Alaska as the lowest record high temperature observed in a US state.

name: hawaii
sentence: Hawaiʻi's record low temperature is 12 °F (−11 °C) observed in May 1979, on the summit of Mauna Kea.

name: hawaii
sentence: Hawaiʻi is the only state to have never recorded sub-zero Fahrenheit temperatures.

name: hawaii
sentence: Climates vary considerably on each island; they can be divided into windward and leeward (koʻolau and kona, respectively) areas based upon location relative to the higher mountains.

name: hawaii
sentence: Windward sides face cloud cover.

name: hawaii
sentence: Hawaiʻi is one of two states that were widely recognized independent nations prior to joining the United States.

name: hawaii
sentence: The Kingdom of Hawaiʻi was sovereign from 1810 until 1893 when the monarchy was overthrown by resident American and European capitalists and landholders.

name: hawaii
sentence: Hawaiʻi was an independent republic from 1894 until August 12, 1898, when it officially became a territory of the United States.

name: hawaii
sentence: Hawaiʻi was admitted as a US state on August 21, 1959.

name: hawaii
sentence: Based on archaeological evidence, the earliest habitation of the Hawaiian Islands dates to around AD 300, probably by Polynesian settlers from the Marquesas Islands.

name: hawaii
sentence: A second wave of migration from Raiatea and Bora Bora took place in the 11th century.

name: hawaii
sentence: The date of the human discovery and habitation of the Hawaiian Islands is the subject of academic debate.

name: hawaii
sentence: Some archaeologists and historians think it was a later wave of immigrants from Tahiti around AD 1000 who introduced a new line of high chiefs, the kapu system, the practice of human sacrifice, and the building of heiau.

name: hawaii
sentence: This later immigration is detailed in Hawaiian mythology (moʻolelo) about Paʻao.

name: hawaii
sentence: Other authors say there is no archaeological or linguistic evidence for a later influx of Tahitian settlers and that Paʻao must be regarded as a myth.

name: hawaii
sentence: The history of the islands is marked by a slow, steady growth in population and the size of the chiefdoms, which grew to encompass whole islands.

name: hawaii
sentence: Local chiefs, called aliʻi, ruled their settlements, and launched wars to extend their influence and defend their communities from predatory rivals.

name: hawaii
sentence: Ancient Hawaiʻi was a caste-based society, much like that of Hindus in India.

name: hawaii
sentence: The 1778 arrival of British explorer Captain James Cook marked the first documented contact by a European explorer with Hawaiʻi.

name: hawaii
sentence: Cook named the archipelago "the Sandwich Islands" in honor of his sponsor John Montagu, 4th Earl of Sandwich, publishing the islands' location and rendering the native name as Owyhee.

name: hawaii
sentence: The form 'Owyhee' or 'Owhyhee' is preserved in the names of certain locations in the American part of the Pacific Northwest, among them Owyhee County and Owyhee Mountains in Idaho, named after three native Hawaiian members of a trapping party who went missing in the area.

name: hawaii
sentence: It is very possible that Spanish explorers arrived in the Hawaiian Islands in the 16th century, two hundred years before Cook's first documented visit in 1778.

name: hawaii
sentence: Ruy López de Villalobos commanded a fleet of six ships that left Acapulco in 1542 bound for the Philippines, with a Spanish sailor named Juan Gaetano aboard as pilot.

name: hawaii
sentence: Depending on the interpretation, Gaetano's reports describe an encounter with either Hawaiʻi or the Marshall Islands.

name: hawaii
sentence: If de Villalobos' crew spotted Hawaiʻi, Gaetano would thus be considered the first European to see the islands.

name: hawaii
sentence: Some scholars have dismissed these claims due to a lack of credibility.

name: hawaii
sentence: Nonetheless, Spanish archives contain a chart that depicts islands at the same latitude as Hawaiʻi, but with a longitude ten degrees east of the islands.

name: hawaii
sentence: In this manuscript, the island of Maui is named La Desgraciada (The Unfortunate Island), and what appears to be Hawaiʻi Island is named La Mesa (The Table).

name: hawaii
sentence: Islands resembling Kahoʻolawe', Lānaʻi, and Molokaʻi are named Los Monjes (The Monks).

name: hawaii
sentence: For two-and-a-half centuries, Spanish galleons crossed the Pacific from Mexico along a route that passed south of Hawaiʻi on their way to Manila.

name: hawaii
sentence: The exact route was kept secret to protect the Spanish trade monopoly against competing powers.

name: hawaii
sentence: Hawaiʻi thus maintained independence, despite being situated on a sea route east–west between nations that were subjects of the Viceroyalty of New Spain, an empire that exercised jurisdiction over many subject civilizations and kingdoms on both sides of the Pacific.

name: hawaii
sentence: Despite such contested claims, Cook is generally credited as being the first European to land at Hawaiʻi, having visited the Hawaiian Islands twice.

name: hawaii
sentence: As he prepared for departure after his second visit in 1779, a quarrel ensued as Cook took temple idols and fencing as "firewood", and a minor chief and his men stole a boat from his ship.

name: hawaii
sentence: Cook abducted the King of Hawaiʻi Island, Kalaniʻōpuʻu, and held him for ransom aboard his ship in order to gain return of Cook's boat, as this tactic had previously worked in Tahiti and other islands.

name: hawaii
sentence: Instead, the supporters of Kalaniʻōpuʻu attacked, killing Cook and four sailors as Cook's party retreated along the beach to their ship.

name: hawaii
sentence: The ship departed without retrieving the stolen boat.

name: hawaii
sentence: After Cook's visit and the publication of several books relating his voyages, the Hawaiian Islands attracted many European visitors: explorers, traders, and eventually whalers, who found the islands to be a convenient harbor and source of supplies.

name: hawaii
sentence: Early British influence can be seen in the design of the flag of Hawaiʻi, which bears the Union Jack in the top-left corner.

name: hawaii
sentence: These visitors introduced diseases to the once-isolated islands, causing the Hawaiian population to drop precipitously.

name: hawaii
sentence: Native Hawaiians had no resistance to Eurasian diseases, such as influenza, smallpox and measles.

name: hawaii
sentence: By 1820, disease, famine and wars between the chiefs killed more than half of the Native Hawaiian population.

name: hawaii
sentence: During the 1850s, measles killed a fifth of Hawaiʻi's people.

name: hawaii
sentence: Historical records indicated the earliest Chinese immigrants to Hawaiʻi originated from Guangdong Province; a few sailors had arrived in 1778 with Captain Cook's journey, and more arrived in 1789 with an American trader who settled in Hawaiʻi in the late 18th century.

name: hawaii
sentence: It is said that leprosy was introduced by Chinese workers by 1830, and as with the other new infectious diseases, it proved damaging to the Hawaiians.

name: hawaii
sentence: During the 1780s, and 1790s, chiefs often fought for power.

name: hawaii
sentence: After a series of battles that ended in 1795, all inhabited islands were subjugated under a single ruler, who became known as King Kamehameha the Great.

name: hawaii
sentence: He established the House of Kamehameha, a dynasty that ruled the kingdom until 1872.

name: hawaii
sentence: After Kamehameha II inherited the throne in 1819, American Protestant missionaries to Hawaiʻi converted many Hawaiians to Christianity.

name: hawaii
sentence: They used their influence to end many traditional practices of the people.

name: hawaii
sentence: During the reign of King Kamehameha III, Hawaiʻi turned into a Christian monarchy with the signing of the 1840 Constitution.

name: hawaii
sentence: Hiram Bingham I, a prominent Protestant missionary, was a trusted adviser to the monarchy during this period.

name: hawaii
sentence: Other missionaries and their descendants became active in commercial and political affairs, leading to conflicts between the monarchy and its restive American subjects.

name: hawaii
sentence: Catholic and Mormon missionaries were also active in the kingdom, but they converted a minority of the Native Hawaiian population.

name: hawaii
sentence: Missionaries from each major group administered to the leper colony at Kalaupapa on Molokaʻi, which was established in 1866 and operated well into the 20th century.

name: hawaii
sentence: The best known were Father Damien and Mother Marianne Cope, both of whom were canonized in the early 21st century as Roman Catholic saints.

name: hawaii
sentence: The death of the bachelor King Kamehameha V—who did not name an heir—resulted in the popular election of Lunalilo over Kalākaua.

name: hawaii
sentence: Lunalilo died the next year, also without naming an heir.

name: hawaii
sentence: In 1874, the election was contested within the legislature between Kalākaua and Emma, Queen Consort of Kamehameha IV.

name: hawaii
sentence: After riots broke out, the United States and Britain landed troops on the islands to restore order.

name: hawaii
sentence: King Kalākaua was chosen as monarch by the Legislative Assembly by a vote of 39 to 6 on February 12, 1874.

name: hawaii
sentence: In 1887, Kalākaua was forced to sign the 1887 Constitution of the Kingdom of Hawaiʻi.

name: hawaii
sentence: Drafted by white businessmen and lawyers, the document stripped the king of much of his authority.

name: hawaii
sentence: It established a property qualification for voting that effectively disenfranchised most Hawaiians and immigrant laborers and favored the wealthier, white elite.

name: hawaii
sentence: Resident whites were allowed to vote but resident Asians were not.

name: hawaii
sentence: As the 1887 Constitution was signed under threat of violence, it is known as the Bayonet Constitution.

name: hawaii
sentence: King Kalākaua, reduced to a figurehead, reigned until his death in 1891.

name: hawaii
sentence: His sister, Queen Liliʻuokalani, succeeded him; she was the last monarch of Hawaiʻi.

name: hawaii
sentence: In 1893, Queen Liliʻuokalani announced plans for a new constitution to proclaim herself an absolute monarch.

name: hawaii
sentence: On January 14, 1893, a group of mostly Euro-American business leaders and residents formed the Committee of Safety to stage a coup d'état against the kingdom and seek annexation by the United States.

name: hawaii
sentence: United States Government Minister John L. Stevens, responding to a request from the Committee of Safety, summoned a company of US Marines.

name: hawaii
sentence: The Queen's soldiers did not resist.

name: hawaii
sentence: According to historian William Russ, the monarchy was unable to protect itself.

name: hawaii
sentence: On January 17, 1893, Queen Liliʻuokalani was overthrown and replaced by a provisional government composed of members of the Committee of Safety.

name: hawaii
sentence: The United States Minister to the Kingdom of Hawaii (John L. Stevens) conspired with US citizens to overthrow the monarchy.

name: hawaii
sentence: After the overthrow, Lawyer Sanford B. Dole, a citizen of Hawaii, became President of the Republic when the Provisional Government of Hawaiʻi ended on July 4, 1894.

name: hawaii
sentence: Controversy ensued in the following years as the Queen tried to regain her throne.

name: hawaii
sentence: The administration of President Grover Cleveland commissioned the Blount Report, which concluded that the removal of Liliʻuokalani had been illegal.

name: hawaii
sentence: The US government first demanded that Queen Liliʻuokalani be reinstated, but the Provisional Government refused.

name: hawaii
sentence: Congress conducted an independent investigation, and on February 26, 1894, submitted the Morgan Report, which found all parties, including Minister Stevens—with the exception of the Queen—"not guilty" and not responsible for the coup.

name: hawaii
sentence: Partisans on both sides of the debate questioned the accuracy and impartiality of both the Blount and Morgan reports over the events of 1893.

name: hawaii
sentence: In 1993, the US Congress passed a joint Apology Resolution regarding the overthrow; it was signed by President Bill Clinton.

name: hawaii
sentence: The resolution apologized and said that the overthrow was illegal in the following phrase: "The Congress—on the occasion of the 100th anniversary of the illegal overthrow of the Kingdom of Hawaiʻi on January 17, 1893, acknowledges the historical significance of this event which resulted in the suppression of the inherent sovereignty of the Native Hawaiian people."

name: hawaii
sentence: The Apology Resolution also "acknowledges that the overthrow of the Kingdom of Hawaiʻi occurred with the active participation of agents and citizens of the United States and further acknowledges that the Native Hawaiian people never directly relinquished to the United States their claims to their inherent sovereignty as a people over their national lands, either through the Kingdom of Hawaiʻi or through a plebiscite or referendum".

name: hawaii
sentence: After William McKinley won the 1896 US presidential election, advocates pressed to annex the Republic of Hawaiʻi.

name: hawaii
sentence: The previous president, Grover Cleveland, was a friend of Queen Liliʻuokalani.

name: hawaii
sentence: McKinley was open to persuasion by US expansionists and by annexationists from Hawaiʻi.

name: hawaii
sentence: He met with three non-native annexationists: Lorrin A. Thurston, Francis March Hatch and William Ansel Kinney.

name: hawaii
sentence: After negotiations in June 1897, Secretary of State John Sherman agreed to a treaty of annexation with these representatives of the Republic of Hawaiʻi.

name: hawaii
sentence: The US Senatorte never ratified the treaty.

name: hawaii
sentence: Despite the opposition of most native Hawaiians, the Newlands Resolution was used to annex the Republic to the US; it became the Territory of Hawaiʻi.

name: hawaii
sentence: The Newlands Resolution was passed by the House on June 15, 1898, by 209 votes in favor to 91 against, and by the Senatorte on July 6, 1898, by a vote of 42 to 21.

name: hawaii
sentence: In 1900, Hawaiʻi was granted self-governance and retained ʻIolani Palace as the territorial capitol building.

name: hawaii
sentence: Despite several attempts to become a state, Hawaii remained a territory for 60 years.

name: hawaii
sentence: Plantation owners and capitalists, who maintained control through financial institutions such as the Big Five, found territorial status convenient because they remained able to import cheap, foreign labor.

name: hawaii
sentence: Such immigration and labor practices were prohibited in many states.

name: hawaii
sentence: Puerto Rican immigration to Hawaiʻi began in 1899, when Puerto Rico's sugar industry was devastated by a hurricane, causing a worldwide shortage of sugar and a huge demand for sugar from Hawaiʻi.

name: hawaii
sentence: Hawaiian sugarcane plantation owners began to recruit experienced, unemployed laborers in Puerto Rico.

name: hawaii
sentence: Two waves of Korean immigration to Hawaiʻi occurred in the 20th century.

name: hawaii
sentence: The first wave arrived between 1903 and 1924; the second wave began in 1965 after President Lyndon B. Johnson signed the Immigration and Nationality Act of 1965, which removed racial and national barriers and resulted in significantly altering the demographic mix in the US

name: hawaii
sentence: Oʻahu was the target of a surprise attack on Pearl Harbor by Imperial Japan on December 7, 1941.

name: hawaii
sentence: The attack on Pearl Harbor and other military and naval installations, carried out by aircraft and by midget submarines, brought the United States into World War II.

name: hawaii
sentence: In the 1950s, the power of the plantation owners was broken by the descendants of immigrant laborers, who were born in Hawaiʻi and were US citizens.

name: hawaii
sentence: They voted against the Hawaiʻi Republican Party, strongly supported by plantation owners.

name: hawaii
sentence: The new majority voted for the Democratic Party of Hawaiʻi, which dominated territorial and state politics for more than 40 years.

name: hawaii
sentence: Eager to gain full representation in Congress and the Electoral College, residents actively campaigned for statehood.

name: hawaii
sentence: In Washington there was talk that Hawaiʻi would be a Republican Party stronghold so it was matched with the admission of Alaska, seen as a Democratic Party stronghold.

name: hawaii
sentence: These predictions turned out to be inaccurate; today, Hawaiʻi votes Democratic predominantly, while Alaska votes Republican.

name: hawaii
sentence: In March 1959, Congress passed the Hawaiʻi Admissions Act, which US President Dwight D. Eisenhower signed into law.

name: hawaii
sentence: The act excluded Palmyra Atoll from statehood

name: hawaii
sentence: On June 27, 1959, a referendum asked residents of Hawaiʻi to vote on the statehood bill; 94.3% voted in favor of statehood and 5.7% opposed it.

name: hawaii
sentence: The referendum asked voters to choose between accepting the Act and remaining a US territory.

name: hawaii
sentence: The United Nations' Special Committee on Decolonization later removed Hawaiʻi from its list of non-self-governing territories.

name: hawaii
sentence: After attaining statehood, Hawaiʻi quickly modernized through construction and a rapidly growing tourism economy.

name: hawaii
sentence: Later, state programs promoted Hawaiian culture.

name: hawaii
sentence: The Hawaiʻi State Constitutional Convention of 1978 created institutions such as the Office of Hawaiian Affairs to promote indigenous language and culture.

name: hawaii
sentence: Coincidentally, the Wiki knowledge revolution that transformed the Internet took its name from a Hawaiian word.

name: hawaii
sentence: After Europeans and mainland Americans first arrived during the Kingdom of Hawaii period, the overall population of Hawaii—which until that time composed solely of indigenous Hawaiians—fell dramatically.

name: hawaii
sentence: The indigenous Hawaiian population succumbed to foreign diseases, declining from 300,000 in the 1770s, to 60,000 in the 1850s, to 24,000 in 1920.

name: hawaii
sentence: In that year 43% of the population was of Japanese descent.

name: hawaii
sentence: The population of Hawaii began to finally increase after an influx of primarily Asian settlers that arrived as migrant laborers at the end of the 19th century.

name: hawaii
sentence: The unmixed indigenous Hawaiian population has still not restored itself to its 300,000 pre-contact level.

name: hawaii
sentence: As of 2010, only 156,000 persons declared themselves to be of Native Hawaiian-only ancestry, just over half the pre-contact level Native Hawaiian population, although an additional 371,000 persons declared themselves to possess Native Hawaiian ancestry in combination with one or more other races (including other Polynesian groups, but mostly Asian and/or Caucasian).

name: hawaii
sentence: The United States Census Bureau estimates the population of Hawaii was 1,420,491 on July 1, 2018; an increase of 4.42% since the 2010 United States Census.

name: hawaii
sentence: As of 2018, Hawaii had an estimated population of 1,420,491; a decrease of 7,047 from the previous year and an increase of 60,190 (4.42%) since 2010.

name: hawaii
sentence: This includes a natural increase of 48,111 (96,028 births minus 47,917 deaths) and an increase due to net migration of 16,956 people into the state.

name: hawaii
sentence: Immigration from outside the United States resulted in a net increase of 30,068; migration within the country produced a net loss of 13,112 people.

name: hawaii
sentence: The center of population of Hawaii is located on the island of O'ahu.

name: hawaii
sentence: Large numbers of Native Hawaiians have moved to Las Vegas, which has been called the "ninth island" of Hawaii.

name: hawaii
sentence: Hawaii has a de facto population of over 1.4 million, due in part to a large number of military personnel and tourist residents.

name: hawaii
sentence: O'ahu is the most populous island; it has the highest population density with a resident population of just under one million in 597 square miles (1,546 km2), approximately 1,650 people per square mile.

name: hawaii
sentence: Hawaii's 1.4 million residents, spread across 6,000 square miles (15,500 km2) of land, result in an average population density of 188.6 persons per square mile.

name: hawaii
sentence: The state has a lower population density than Ohio and Illinois.

name: hawaii
sentence: The average projected lifespan of people born in Hawaii in 2000 is 79.8 years; 77.1 years if male, 82.5 if female—longer than the average lifespan of any other US state.

name: hawaii
sentence: As of 2011 the US military reported it had 42,371 personnel on the islands.

name: hawaii
sentence: According to the 2010 United States Census, Hawaii had a population of 1,360,301.

name: hawaii
sentence: The state's population identified as 38.6% Asian

name: hawaii
sentence: Hawaii has the highest percentage of Asian Americans and multiracial Americans and the lowest percentage of White Americans of any state.

name: hawaii
sentence: It is the only state where people who identify as Asian Americans are the largest ethnic group.

name: hawaii
sentence: In 2012, 14.5% of the resident population under age 1 was non-Hispanic white.

name: hawaii
sentence: Hawaii's Asian population consists mainly of 198,000 (14.6%) Filipino Americans, 185,000 (13.6%) Japanese Americans, roughly 55,000 (4.0%) Chinese Americans, and 24,000 (1.8%) Korean Americans.

name: hawaii
sentence: There are more than 80,000 Indigenous Hawaiians—5.9% of the population.

name: hawaii
sentence: Including those with partial ancestry, Samoan Americans constitute 2.8% of Hawaii's population, and Tongan Americans constitute 0.6%.

name: hawaii
sentence: Over 120,000 (8.8%) Hispanic and Latino Americans live in Hawaii.

name: hawaii
sentence: Mexican Americans number over 35,000 (2.6%); Puerto Ricans exceed 44,000 (3.2%).

name: hawaii
sentence: Multiracial Americans constitute almost 25% of Hawaii's population, exceeding 320,000 people.

name: hawaii
sentence: Eurasian Americans are a prominent mixed-race group, numbering about 66,000 (4.9%).

name: hawaii
sentence: The non-Hispanic White population numbers around 310,000—just over 20% of the population.

name: hawaii
sentence: The multi-racial population outnumbers the non-Hispanic white population by about 10,000 people.

name: hawaii
sentence: In 1970, the Census Bureau reported Hawaii's population was 38.8% white and 57.7% Asian and Pacific Islander.

name: hawaii
sentence: The five largest European ancestries in Hawaii are German (7.4%), Irish (5.2%), English (4.6%), Portuguese (4.3%) and Italian (2.7%).

name: hawaii
sentence: About 82.2% of the state's residents were born in the United States.

name: hawaii
sentence: Roughly 75% of foreign-born residents originate in Asia.

name: hawaii
sentence: Hawaii is a majority-minority state.

name: hawaii
sentence: It was expected to be one of three states that will not have a non-Hispanic white plurality in 2014

name: hawaii
sentence: The third group of foreigners to arrive in Hawaii were from China.

name: hawaii
sentence: Chinese workers on Western trading ships settled in Hawaii starting in 1789.

name: hawaii
sentence: In 1820, the first American missionaries arrived to preach Christianity and teach the Hawaiians Western ways.

name: hawaii
sentence: As of 2015, a large proportion of Hawaii's population have Asian ancestry—especially Filipino, Japanese and Chinese.

name: hawaii
sentence: Many are descendants of immigrants brought to work on the sugarcane plantations in the mid-to-late 19th century.

name: hawaii
sentence: The first 153 Japanese immigrants arrived in Hawaii on June 19, 1868.

name: hawaii
sentence: They were not approved by the then-current Japanese government because the contract was between a broker and the Tokugawa shogunate—by then replaced by the Meiji Restoration.

name: hawaii
sentence: The first Japanese current-government-approved immigrants arrived on February 9, 1885, after Kalākaua's petition to Emperor Meiji when Kalākaua visited Japan in 1881.

name: hawaii
