sentence: Almost 13,000 Portuguese migrants had arrived by 1899; they also worked on the sugarcane plantations.

name: hawaii
sentence: By 1901, more than 5,000 Puerto Ricans were living in Hawaii.

name: hawaii
sentence: English and Hawaiian are listed as Hawaii's official languages in the state's 1978 constitution, in Article XV, Section 4.

name: hawaii
sentence: However, the use of Hawaiian is limited because the constitution specifies that "Hawaiian shall be required for public acts and transactions only as provided by law".

name: hawaii
sentence: Hawaiʻi Creole English, locally referred to as "Pidgin", is the native language of many native residents and is a second language for many others.

name: hawaii
sentence: As of the 2000 Census, 73.4% of Hawaii residents age 5 and older exclusively speak English at home.

name: hawaii
sentence: According to the 2008 American Community Survey, 74.6% of Hawaii's residents older than 5 speak only English at home.

name: hawaii
sentence: In their homes, 21.0% of state residents speak an additional Asian language, 2.6% speak Spanish, 1.6% speak other Indo-European languages and 0.2% speak another language.

name: hawaii
sentence: After English, other languages popularly spoken in the state are Tagalog, Japanese and Ilocano.

name: hawaii
sentence: Significant numbers of European immigrants and their descendants also speak their native languages; the most numerous are German, Portuguese, Italian and French.

name: hawaii
sentence: 5.4% of residents speak Tagalog—which includes non-native speakers of Filipino language, the national, co-official, Tagalog-based language; 5.0% speak Japanese and 4.0% speak Ilocano; 1.2% speak Chinese, 1.7% speak Hawaiian; 1.7% speak Spanish; 1.6% speak Korean; and 1.0% speak Samoan.

name: hawaii
sentence: The Hawaiian language has about 2,000 native speakers, about 0.15% of the total population.

name: hawaii
sentence: According to the United States Census, there were more than 24,000 total speakers of the language in Hawaii in 2006–2008.

name: hawaii
sentence: Hawaiian is a Polynesian member of the Austronesian language family.

name: hawaii
sentence: It is closely related to other Polynesian languages, such as Marquesan, Tahitian, Māori, Rapa Nui (the language of Easter Island), and less closely to Samoan and Tongan.

name: hawaii
sentence: According to Schütz, the Marquesans colonized the archipelago in roughly AD 300 and were later followed by waves of seafarers from the Society Islands, Samoa and Tonga.

name: hawaii
sentence: These Polynesians remained in the islands

name: hawaii
sentence: Kimura and Wilson say, "[l]inguists agree that Hawaiian is closely related to Eastern Polynesian, with a particularly strong link in the Southern Marquesas, and a secondary link in Tahiti, which may be explained by voyaging between the Hawaiian and Society Islands".

name: hawaii
sentence: Before the arrival of Captain James Cook, the Hawaiian language had no written form.

name: hawaii
sentence: That form was developed mainly by American Protestant missionaries between 1820 and 1826 who assigned to the Hawaiian phonemes letters from the Latin alphabet.

name: hawaii
sentence: Interest in Hawaiian increased significantly in the late 20th century.

name: hawaii
sentence: With the help of the Office of Hawaiian Affairs, specially designated immersion schools in which all subjects would be taught in Hawaiian were established.

name: hawaii
sentence: The University of Hawaii developed a Hawaiian language graduate studies program.

name: hawaii
sentence: Municipal codes were altered to favor Hawaiian place and street names for new civic developments.

name: hawaii
sentence: Hawaiian distinguishes between long and short vowel sounds.

name: hawaii
sentence: In modern practice, vowel length is indicated with a macron (kahakō).

name: hawaii
sentence: Hawaiian-language newspapers (nūpepa) published from 1834 to 1948 and traditional native speakers of Hawaiian generally omit the marks in their own writing.

name: hawaii
sentence: The ʻokina and kahakō are intended to help non-native speakers.

name: hawaii
sentence: The Hawaiian language uses the glottal stop (ʻokina) as a consonant.

name: hawaii
sentence: It is written as a symbol similar to the apostrophe or left-hanging (opening) single quotation mark.

name: hawaii
sentence: The keyboard layout used for Hawaiian is QWERTY.

name: hawaii
sentence: Some residents of Hawaii speak Hawaiʻi Creole English (HCE), endonymically called pidgin or pidgin English.

name: hawaii
sentence: The lexicon of HCE derives mainly from English but also uses words that have derived from Hawaiian, Chinese, Japanese, Portuguese, Ilocano and Tagalog.

name: hawaii
sentence: During the 19th century, the increase in immigration—mainly from China, Japan, Portugal—especially from the Azores and Madeira, and Spain—catalyzed the development of a hybrid variant of English known to its speakers as pidgin.

name: hawaii
sentence: By the early 20th century, pidgin speakers had children who acquired it as their first language.

name: hawaii
sentence: HCE speakers use some Hawaiian words without those words being considered archaic.

name: hawaii
sentence: Most place names are retained from Hawaiian, as are some names for plants and animals.

name: hawaii
sentence: For example, tuna fish is often called by its Hawaiian name, ahi.

name: hawaii
sentence: HCE speakers have modified the meanings of some English words.

name: hawaii
sentence: For example, "aunty" and "uncle" may either refer to any adult who is a friend or be used to show respect to an elder.

name: hawaii
sentence: Syntax and grammar follow distinctive rules different from those of General American English.

name: hawaii
sentence: For example, instead of "it is hot today, isn't it?

name: hawaii
sentence: ", an HCE speaker would say simply "stay hot, eh?"

name: hawaii
sentence: The term da kine is used as a filler

name: hawaii
sentence: During the surfing boom in Hawaii, HCE was influenced by surfer slang.

name: hawaii
sentence: Some HCE expressions, such as brah and da kine, have found their ways elsewhere through surfing communities.Sood, Suemedha (April 20, 2012).

name: hawaii
sentence: "Surfer lingo, explained".

name: hawaii
sentence: BBC.

name: hawaii
sentence: The British Broadcasting Corporation.

name: hawaii
sentence: Retrieved December 9, 2020.

name: hawaii
sentence: Hawaiʻi Sign Language, a sign language for the deaf based on the Hawaiian language, has been in use in the islands since the early 1800s.

name: hawaii
sentence: It is dwindling in numbers due to American Sign Language supplanting HSL through schooling and various other domains.

name: hawaii
sentence: Christianity is the most widespread religion in Hawaii, mainly represented by various Protestants groups, Roman Catholics and Mormons.

name: hawaii
sentence: The second largest religion is Buddhism, especially among the Japanese community.

name: hawaii
sentence: The uaffiliated account for one-quarter of the population, making Hawaii one of the most secular states in the US.

name: hawaii
sentence: The Cathedral Church of Saint Andrew in Honolulu was formally the seat of the Hawaiian Reformed Catholic Church.

name: hawaii
sentence: When the Hawaiian Reformed Catholic Church, a province of the Anglican Communion, was merged into the Episcopal Church in the 1890s following the overthrow of the Kingdom of Hawaii, it became the seat of the Episcopal Diocese of Hawaii.

name: hawaii
sentence: The Cathedral Basilica of Our Lady of Peace and the Co-Cathedral of Saint Theresa of the Child Jesus serve as seats of the Roman Catholic Diocese of Honolulu.

name: hawaii
sentence: The Eastern Orthodox community is centered around the Saints Constantine and Helen Greek Orthodox Cathedral of the Pacific.

name: hawaii
sentence: The largest denominations by number of adherents were the Roman Catholic Church with 249,619 adherents in 2010, the Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints with 68,128 adherents in 2009, the United Church of Christ with 115 congregations and 20,000 members, and the Southern Baptist Convention with 108 congregations and 18,000 members.

name: hawaii
sentence: All non-denominational churches have 128 congregations and 32,000 members.

name: hawaii
sentence: According to data provided by religious establishments, religion in Hawaii in 2000 was distributed as follows:

name: hawaii
sentence: A Pew poll found that the religious composition was as follows:

name: hawaii
sentence: Note: Births in this table do not add up, because Hispanics are counted both by their ethnicity and by their race, giving a higher overall number.

name: hawaii
sentence: Hawaii has had a long history of LGBT identities.

name: hawaii
sentence: Māhū ("in the middle") were a precolonization third gender with traditional spiritual and social roles; māhū were a respected group of people widely regarded as healers.

name: hawaii
sentence: The concept of aikāne referred to homosexual relationships, widely accepted as a normal part of ancient Hawaiian society.

name: hawaii
sentence: Among men, aikāne relationships often began as teens and continued throughout their adult lives, even if they also maintained heterosexual partners.

name: hawaii
sentence: While aikāne usually refers to male homosexuality, some stories also refer to women, implying that women may have been involved in aikāne relationships as well.

name: hawaii
sentence: Journals written by Captain Cook's crew record that many aliʻi (hereditary nobles) also engaged in aikāne relationships, and Kamehameha the Great, the founder and first ruler of the Kingdom of Hawaii, was also known to participate.

name: hawaii
sentence: Cook's second lieutenant and co-astronomer James King observed that "all the chiefs had them", and recounts that Cook was actually asked by one chief to leave King behind, considering the role a great honor.

name: hawaii
sentence: According to Hawaiian scholar Lilikalā Kameʻeleihiwa, "If you didn't sleep with a man, how could you trust him when you went into battle?

name: hawaii
sentence: How would you know if he was going to be the warrior that would protect you at all costs, if he wasn't your lover?"

name: hawaii
sentence: During the late 19th and early 20th century, the word aikāne was expurgated of its original sexual meaning by colonialism, and in print simply meant "friend".

name: hawaii
sentence: Nonetheless, in Hawaiian language publications its metaphorical meaning can still mean either "friend" or "lover" without stigmatization.

name: hawaii
sentence: A 2012 poll by Gallup found that Hawaii had the largest proportion of lesbian, gay, bisexual and transgender (LGBT) adults in the US, at 5.1%, comprising an estimated adult LGBT population of 53,966 individuals.

name: hawaii
sentence: The number of same-sex couple households in 2010 was 3,239; a 35.5% increase of figures from a decade earlier.

name: hawaii
sentence: In 2013, Hawaii became the fifteenth US state to legalize same-sex marriage; a University of Hawaii researcher reported at the time that the law may have been able to boost tourism by $217 million.

name: hawaii
sentence: The history of Hawaii's economy can be traced through a succession of dominant industries: sandalwood, whaling, sugarcane, pineapple, the military, tourism and education.

name: hawaii
sentence: Since statehood in 1959, tourism has been the largest industry, contributing 24.3% of the gross state product (GSP) in 1997, despite efforts to diversify.

name: hawaii
sentence: The state's gross output for 2003 was US$47 billion; per capita income for Hawaii residents in 2014 was US$54,516.

name: hawaii
sentence: Hawaiian exports include food and clothing.

name: hawaii
sentence: These industries play a small role in the Hawaiian economy, due to the shipping distance to viable markets, such as the West Coast of the contiguous US

name: hawaii
sentence: The state's food exports include coffee, macadamia nuts, pineapple, livestock, sugarcane and honey.

name: hawaii
sentence: By weight, honey bees may be the state's most valuable export.

name: hawaii
sentence: According to the Hawaii Agricultural Statistics Service, agricultural sales were US$370.9 million from diversified agriculture, US$100.6 million from pineapple, and US$64.3 million from sugarcane.

name: hawaii
sentence: Hawaii's relatively consistent climate has attracted the seed industry, which is able to test three generations of crops per year on the islands, compared with one or two on the mainland.

name: hawaii
sentence: Seeds yielded US$264 million in 2012, supporting 1,400 workers.

name: hawaii
sentence: As of December 2015, the state's unemployment rate was 3.2%.

name: hawaii
sentence: In 2009, the United States military spent US$12.2 billion in Hawaii, accounting for 18% of spending in the state for that year.

name: hawaii
sentence: 75,000 United States Department of Defense personnel live in Hawaii.

name: hawaii
sentence: According to a 2013 study by Phoenix Marketing International, Hawaii had the fourth-largest number of millionaires per capita in the United States, with a ratio of 7.2%.

name: hawaii
sentence: Tax is collected by the Hawaii Department of Taxation.

name: hawaii
sentence: Hawaii residents pay the most per person in state taxes in the United States.

name: hawaii
sentence: Millions of tourists pay general excise tax and hotel room tax.

name: hawaii
sentence: The Hawaii Tax Foundation considers the state's tax burden too high, which it says contributes to higher prices and the perception of an unfriendly business climate.

name: hawaii
sentence: State Senatortor Sam Slom says state taxes are comparatively higher than other states because the state government handles education, health care, and social services that are usually handled at a county or municipal level in most other states.

name: hawaii
sentence: The cost of living in Hawaii, specifically Honolulu, is high compared to that of most major US cities, although it is 6.7% lower than in New York City and 3.6% lower than in San Francisco.

name: hawaii
sentence: These numbers may not take into account some costs, such as increased travel costs for flights, additional shipping fees, and the loss of promotional participation opportunities for customers outside the contiguous US

name: hawaii
sentence: While some online stores offer free shipping on orders to Hawaii, many merchants exclude Hawaii, Alaska, Puerto Rico and certain other US territories.

name: hawaii
sentence: Hawaiian Electric Industries, a privately owned company, provides 95% of the state's population with electricity, mostly from fossil-fuel power stations.

name: hawaii
sentence: Average electricity prices in October 2014 (36.41 cents per kilowatt-hour) were nearly three times the national average (12.58 cents per kilowatt-hour) and 80% higher than the second-highest state, Connecticut.

name: hawaii
sentence: The median home value in Hawaii in the 2000 US Census was US$272,700, while the national median home value was US$119,600.

name: hawaii
sentence: Hawaii home values were the highest of all states, including California with a median home value of US$211,500.

name: hawaii
sentence: Research from the National Association of Realtors places the 2010 median sale price of a single family home in Honolulu, Hawaii, at US$607,600 and the US median sales price at US$173,200.

name: hawaii
sentence: The sale price of single family homes in Hawaii was the highest of any US city in 2010, just above that of the Silicon Valley area of California (US$602,000).

name: hawaii
sentence: Hawaii's very high cost of living is the result of several interwoven factors of the global economy in addition to domestic US government trade policy.

name: hawaii
sentence: Like other regions with desirable weather throughout the year, such as areas of California, Arizona and Florida, Hawaii's residents can be considered to be subject to a "sunshine tax".

name: hawaii
sentence: This situation is further exacerbated by the natural factors of geography and world distribution that lead to higher prices for goods due to increased shipping costs, a problem which many island states and territories suffer from as well.

name: hawaii
sentence: The higher costs to ship goods across an ocean may be further increased by the requirements of the Jones Act, which generally requires that goods be transported between places within the US, including between the mainland US west coast and Hawaii, using only US-owned, built, and crewed ships.

name: hawaii
sentence: Jones Act-compliant vessels are often more expensive to build and operate than foreign equivalents, which can drive up shipping costs.

name: hawaii
sentence: While the Jones Act does not affect transportation of goods to Hawaii directly from Asia, this type of trade is nonetheless not common; this is a result of other primarily economic reasons including additional costs associated with stopping over in Hawaii (e.g.

name: hawaii
sentence: pilot and port fees), the market size of Hawaii, and the economics of using ever-larger ships that cannot be handled in Hawaii for transoceanic voyages.

name: hawaii
sentence: Therefore, Hawaii relies on receiving most inbound goods on Jones Act-qualified vessels originating from the US west coast, which may contribute to the increased cost of some consumer goods and therefore the overall cost of living.

name: hawaii
sentence: Critics of the Jones Act contend that Hawaii consumers ultimately bear the expense of transporting goods imposed by the Jones Act.

name: hawaii
sentence: The aboriginal culture of Hawaii is Polynesian.

name: hawaii
sentence: Hawaii represents the northernmost extension of the vast Polynesian Triangle of the south and central Pacific Ocean.

name: hawaii
sentence: While traditional Hawaiian culture remains as vestiges in modern Hawaiian society, there are re-enactments of the ceremonies and traditions throughout the islands.

name: hawaii
sentence: Some of these cultural influences, including the popularity (in greatly modified form) of lūʻau and hula, are strong enough to affect the wider United States.

name: hawaii
sentence: The cuisine of Hawaii is a fusion of many foods brought by immigrants to the Hawaiian Islands, including the earliest Polynesians and Native Hawaiian cuisine, and American, Chinese, Filipino, Japanese, Korean, Polynesian, Puerto Rican, and Portuguese origins.

name: hawaii
sentence: Plant and animal food sources are imported from around the world for agricultural use in Hawaii.

name: hawaii
sentence: Poi, a starch made by pounding taro, is one of the traditional foods of the islands.

name: hawaii
sentence: Many local restaurants serve the ubiquitous plate lunch, which features two scoops of rice, a simplified version of American macaroni salad and a variety of toppings including hamburger patties, a fried egg, and gravy of a loco moco, Japanese style tonkatsu or the traditional lūʻau favorites, including kālua pork and laulau.

name: hawaii
sentence: Spam musubi is an example of the fusion of ethnic cuisine that developed on the islands among the mix of immigrant groups and military personnel.

name: hawaii
sentence: In the 1990s, a group of chefs developed Hawaii regional cuisine as a contemporary fusion cuisine.

name: hawaii
sentence: Some key customs and etiquette in Hawaii are as follows: when visiting a home, it is considered good manners to bring a small gift for one's host (for example, a dessert).

name: hawaii
sentence: Thus, parties are usually in the form of potlucks.

name: hawaii
sentence: Most locals take their shoes off before entering a home.

name: hawaii
sentence: It is customary for Hawaiian families, regardless of ethnicity, to hold a luau to celebrate a child's first birthday.

name: hawaii
sentence: It is also customary at Hawaiian weddings, especially at Filipino weddings, for the bride and groom to do a money dance (also called the pandanggo).

name: hawaii
sentence: Print media and local residents recommend that one refer to non-Hawaiians as "locals of Hawaii" or "people of Hawaii".

name: hawaii
sentence: Hawaiian mythology includes the legends, historical tales, and sayings of the ancient Hawaiian people.

name: hawaii
sentence: It is considered a variant of a more general Polynesian mythology that developed a unique character for several centuries before circa 1800.

name: hawaii
sentence: It is associated with the Hawaiian religion, which was officially suppressed in the 19th century but was kept alive by some practitioners to the modern day.

name: hawaii
sentence: Prominent figures and terms include Aumakua, the spirit of an ancestor or family god and Kāne, the highest of the four major Hawaiian deities.

name: hawaii
sentence: Polynesian mythology is the oral traditions of the people of Polynesia, a grouping of Central and South Pacific Ocean island archipelagos in the Polynesian triangle together with the scattered cultures known as the Polynesian outliers.

name: hawaii
sentence: Polynesians speak languages that descend from a language reconstructed as Proto-Polynesian that was probably spoken in the area around Tonga and Samoa in around 1000 BC.

name: hawaii
sentence: Prior to the 15th century, Polynesian people migrated east to the Cook Islands, and from there to other island groups such as Tahiti and the Marquesas.

name: hawaii
sentence: Their descendants later discovered the islands Tahiti, Rapa Nui and later the Hawaiian Islands and New Zealand.Wilmshurst, Janet (December 27, 2010).

name: hawaii
sentence: "High-precision radiocarbon dating shows recent and rapid initial human colonization of East Polynesia".

name: hawaii
sentence: Proceedings of the National Academy of Sciences of the United States of America.

name: hawaii
sentence: US National Library of Medicine.

name: hawaii
sentence: The Polynesian languages are part of the Austronesian language family.

name: hawaii
sentence: Many are close enough in terms of vocabulary and grammar to be mutually intelligible.

name: hawaii
sentence: There are also substantial cultural similarities between the various groups, especially in terms of social organization, childrearing, horticulture, building and textile technologies.

name: hawaii
sentence: Their mythologies in particular demonstrate local reworkings of commonly shared tales.

name: hawaii
sentence: The Polynesian cultures each have distinct but related oral traditions; legends or myths are traditionally considered to recount ancient history (the time of "pō") and the adventures of gods ("atua") and deified ancestors.

name: hawaii
sentence: There are many Hawaiian state parks.

name: hawaii
sentence: The literature of Hawaii is diverse and includes authors Kiana Davenport, Lois-Ann Yamanaka, and Kaui Hart Hemmings.

name: hawaii
sentence: Hawaiian magazines include Hana Hou!, Hawaii Business Magazine and Honolulu, among others.

name: hawaii
sentence: The music of Hawaii includes traditional and popular styles, ranging from native Hawaiian folk music to modern rock and hip hop.

name: hawaii
sentence: Hawaii's musical contributions to the music of the United States are out of proportion to the state's small size.

name: hawaii
sentence: Styles such as slack-key guitar are well known worldwide, while Hawaiian-tinged music is a frequent part of Hollywood soundtracks.

name: hawaii
sentence: Hawaii also made a major contribution to country music with the introduction of the steel guitar.

name: hawaii
sentence: Traditional Hawaiian folk music is a major part of the state's musical heritage.

name: hawaii
sentence: The Hawaiian people have inhabited the islands for centuries and have retained much of their traditional musical knowledge.

name: hawaii
sentence: Their music is largely religious in nature, and includes chanting and dance music.

name: hawaii
sentence: Hawaiian music has had an enormous impact on the music of other Polynesian islands; according to Peter Manuel, the influence of Hawaiian music a "unifying factor in the development of modern Pacific musics".

name: hawaii
sentence: Native Hawaiian musician and Hawaiian sovereignty activist Israel Kamakawiwoʻole, famous for his medley of "Somewhere Over the Rainbow/What a Wonderful World", was named "The Voice of Hawaii" by NPR in 2010 in its 50 great voices series.

name: hawaii
sentence: Surfing has been a central part of Polynesian culture for centuries.

name: hawaii
sentence: Since the late 19th century, Hawaii has become a major site for surfists from around the world.

name: hawaii
sentence: Notable competitions include the Triple Crown of Surfing and The Eddie.

name: hawaii
sentence: The only NCAA Division I team in Hawaii is the Hawaii Rainbow Warriors and Rainbow Wahine, which competes at the Big West Conference (major sports), Mountain West Conference (football) and Mountain Pacific Sports Federation (minor sports).

name: hawaii
sentence: There are three teams in NCAA Division II: Chaminade Silverswords, Hawaii Pacific Sharks and Hawaii-Hilo Vulcans, all of which compete at the Pacific West Conference.

name: hawaii
sentence: Notable college sports events in Hawaii include the Maui Invitational Tournament, Diamond Head Classic (basketball) and Hawaii Bowl (football).

name: hawaii
sentence: Notable professional teams include The Hawaiians, which played at the World Football League in 1974 and 1975; the Hawaii Islanders, a Triple-A minor league baseball team that played at the Pacific Coast League from 1961 to 1987; and Team Hawaii, a North American Soccer League team that played in 1977.

name: hawaii
sentence: Hawaii has hosted the Sony Open in Hawaii golf tournament since 1965, the Tournament of Champions golf tournament since 1999, the Lotte Championship golf tournament since 2012, the Honolulu Marathon since 1973, the Ironman World Championship triathlon race since 1978, the Ultraman triathlon since 1983, the National Football League's Pro Bowl from 1980 to 2016, the 2000 FINA World Open Water Swimming Championships, and the 2008 Pan-Pacific Championship and 2012 Hawaiian Islands Invitational soccer tournaments.

name: hawaii
sentence: Tourism is an important part of the Hawaiian economy.

name: hawaii
sentence: In 2003, according to state government data, there were more than 6.4 million visitors, with expenditures of over $10 billion, to the Hawaiian Islands.

name: hawaii
sentence: Due to the mild year-round weather, tourist travel is popular throughout the year.

name: hawaii
sentence: The major holidays are the most popular times for outsiders to visit, especially in the winter months.

name: hawaii
sentence: Substantial numbers of Japanese tourists still visit the islands but have now been surpassed by Chinese and Koreans due to the collapse of the value of the Yen and the weak Japanese economy.

name: hawaii
sentence: The average Japanese stays only five days, while other Asians stay over 9.5 days and spend 25% more.

name: hawaii
sentence: Hawaii hosts numerous cultural events.

name: hawaii
sentence: The annual Merrie Monarch Festival is an international Hula competition.

name: hawaii
sentence: The Hawaii International Film Festival is the premier film festival for Pacific rim cinema.

name: hawaii
sentence: Honolulu hosts the state's long-running LGBT film festival, the Rainbow Film Festival.

name: hawaii
sentence: As of 2009, Hawaii's health care system insures 92% of residents.

name: hawaii
sentence: Under the state's plan, businesses are required to provide insurance to employees who work more than twenty hours per week.

name: hawaii
sentence: Heavy regulation of insurance companies helps reduce the cost to employers.

name: hawaii
sentence: Due in part to heavy emphasis on preventive care, Hawaiians require hospital treatment less frequently than the rest of the United States, while total health care expenses measured as a percentage of state GDP are substantially lower.

name: hawaii
sentence: Proponents of universal health care elsewhere in the US sometimes use Hawaii as a model for proposed federal and state health care plans.

name: hawaii
sentence: Hawaii has the only school system within the US that is unified statewide.

name: hawaii
sentence: Policy decisions are made by the fourteen-member state Board of Education, which sets policy and hires the superintendent of schools, who oversees the state Department of Education.

name: hawaii
sentence: The Department of Education is divided into seven districts

name: hawaii
sentence: Public elementary, middle and high school test scores in Hawaii are below national averages on tests mandated under the No Child Left Behind Act.

name: hawaii
sentence: The Hawaii Board of Education requires all eligible students to take these tests and report all student test scores.

name: hawaii
sentence: This may have unbalanced the results that reported in August 2005 that of 282 schools across the state, 185 failed to reach federal minimum performance standards in mathematics and reading.

name: hawaii
sentence: The ACT college placement tests show that in 2005, seniors scored slightly above the national average (21.9 compared with 20.9), but in the widely accepted SAT examinations, Hawaii's college-bound seniors tend to score below the national average in all categories except mathematics.

name: hawaii
sentence: The first native controlled public charter school was the Kanu O Ka Aina New Century Charter School.

name: hawaii
sentence: Hawaii has the highest rates of private school attendance in the nation.

name: hawaii
sentence: During the 2011–2012 school year, Hawaii public and charter schools had an enrollment of 181,213, while private schools had 37,695.

name: hawaii
sentence: Private schools educated over 17% of students in Hawaii that school year, nearly three times the approximate national average of 6%.

name: hawaii
sentence: According to Alia Wong of Honolulu Civil Beat, this is due to private schools being relatively inexpensive compared to ones on the mainland as well as the overall reputations of private schools.

name: hawaii
sentence: It has four of the largest independent schools; ʻIolani School, Kamehameha Schools, Mid-Pacific Institute and Punahou School.

name: hawaii
sentence: Pacific Buddhist Academy, the second Buddhist high school in the US and first such school in Hawaii, was founded in 2003.

name: hawaii
sentence: Independent and charter schools can select their students, while the public schools are open to all students in their district.

name: hawaii
sentence: The Kamehameha Schools are the only schools in the US that openly grant admission to students based on ancestry; collectively, they are one of the wealthiest schools in the United States, if not the world, having over eleven billion US dollars in estate assets.

name: hawaii
sentence: In 2005, Kamehameha enrolled 5,398 students, 8.4% of the Native Hawaiian children in the state.

name: hawaii
sentence: The largest institution of higher learning in Hawaii is the University of Hawaii System, which consists of the research university at Mānoa, two comprehensive campuses at Hilo and West Oʻahu, and seven community colleges.

name: hawaii
sentence: Private universities include Brigham Young University–Hawaii, Chaminade University of Honolulu, Hawaii Pacific University, and Wayland Baptist University.

name: hawaii
sentence: Saint Stephen Diocesan Center is a seminary of the Roman Catholic Diocese of Honolulu.

name: hawaii
sentence: Kona hosts the University of the Nations, which is not an accredited university.

name: hawaii
sentence: A system of state highways encircles each main island.

name: hawaii
sentence: Only Oʻahu has federal highways, and is the only area outside the contiguous 48 states to have signed Interstate highways.

name: hawaii
sentence: Narrow, winding roads and congestion in populated places can slow traffic.

name: hawaii
sentence: Each major island has a public bus system.

name: hawaii
sentence: Honolulu International Airport (IATA: HNL), which shares runways with the adjacent Hickam Field (IATA: HIK), is the major commercial aviation hub of Hawaii.

name: hawaii
sentence: The commercial aviation airport offers intercontinental service to North America, Asia, Australia and Oceania.

name: hawaii
sentence: Hawaiian Airlines, Mokulele Airlines and go!

name: hawaii
sentence: use jets to provide services between the large airports in Honolulu, Līhuʻe, Kahului, Kona and Hilo.

name: hawaii
sentence: Island Air and Pacific Wings serve smaller airports.

name: hawaii
sentence: These airlines also provide air freight services between the islands.

name: hawaii
sentence: On May 30, 2017, the airport was officially renamed as the Daniel K. Inouye International Airport (HNL), after US

name: hawaii
sentence: Senatortor Daniel K. Inouye.

name: hawaii
sentence: Until air passenger services began in the 1920s, private boats were the sole means of traveling between the islands.

name: hawaii
sentence: Seaflite operated hydrofoils between the major islands in the mid-1970s.

name: hawaii
sentence: The Hawaii Superferry operated between Oʻahu and Maui between December 2007 and March 2009, with additional routes planned for other islands.

name: hawaii
sentence: Protests and legal problems over environmental impact statements ended the service, though the company operating Superferry has expressed a wish to recommence ferry services in the future.

name: hawaii
sentence: Currently there is a passenger ferry service in Maui County between Lanaʻi and Maui, which does not take vehicles; a passenger ferry to Molokai ended in 2016.

name: hawaii
sentence: Currently Norwegian Cruise Lines and Princess Cruises provide passenger cruise ship services between the larger islands.

name: hawaii
sentence: At one time Hawaii had a network of railroads on each of the larger islands that transported farm commodities and passengers.

name: hawaii
sentence: Most were 3 ft (914 mm) narrow gauge systems but there were some 2 ft 6 in (762 mm) gauge on some of the smaller islands.

name: hawaii
sentence: The standard gauge in the US is 4 ft 8 1⁄2 in (1,435 mm).

name: hawaii
sentence: By far the largest railroad was the Oahu Railway and Land Company (OR&L) that ran lines from Honolulu across the western and northern part of Oahu.

name: hawaii
sentence: The OR&L was important for moving troops and goods during World War II.

name: hawaii
sentence: Traffic on this line was busy enough for signals to be used to facilitate movement of trains and to require wigwag signals at some railroad crossings for the protection of motorists.

name: hawaii
sentence: The main line was officially abandoned in 1947, although part of it was bought by the US Navy and operated until 1970.

name: hawaii
sentence: Thirteen miles (21 km) of track remain

name: hawaii
sentence: The Honolulu High-Capacity Transit Corridor Project aims to add elevated passenger rail on Oahu to relieve highway congestion.

name: hawaii
sentence: The movement of the Hawaiian royal family from Hawaiʻi Island to Maui, and subsequently to Oʻahu, explains the modern-day distribution of population centers.

name: hawaii
sentence: Kamehameha III chose the largest city, Honolulu, as his capital because of its natural harbor—the present-day Honolulu Harbor.

name: hawaii
sentence: Now the state capital, Honolulu is located along the southeast coast of Oʻahu.

name: hawaii
sentence: The previous capital was Lahaina, Maui, and before that Kailua-Kona, Hawaiʻi.

name: hawaii
sentence: Some major towns are Hilo

name: hawaii
sentence: Kīhei

name: hawaii
sentence: Hawaii has five counties: the City and County of Honolulu, Hawaii County, Maui County, Kauai County, and Kalawao County.

name: hawaii
sentence: Hawaii has the fewest local governments among US states.

name: hawaii
sentence: Unique to this state is the lack of municipal governments.

name: hawaii
sentence: All local governments are generally administered at the county level.

name: hawaii
sentence: The only incorporated area in the state is Honolulu County, a consolidated city–county that governs the entire island of Oahu.

name: hawaii
sentence: County executives are referred to as mayors; these are the Mayor of Hawaii County, Mayor of Honolulu, Mayor of Kauaʻi, and the Mayor of Maui.

name: hawaii
sentence: The mayors are all elected in nonpartisan elections.

name: hawaii
sentence: Kalawao County has no elected government, and as mentioned above there are no local school districts and instead all local public education is administered at the state level by the Hawaii Department of Education.

name: hawaii
sentence: The remaining local governments are special districts.

name: hawaii
sentence: The state government of Hawaii is modeled after the federal government with adaptations originating from the kingdom era of Hawaiian history.

name: hawaii
sentence: As codified in the Constitution of Hawaii, there are three branches of government: executive, legislative and judicial.

name: hawaii
sentence: The executive branch is led by the Governor of Hawaii, who is assisted by the Lieutenant Governor of Hawaii, both of whom are elected on the same ticket.

name: hawaii
sentence: The governor is the only state public official elected statewide

name: hawaii
sentence: The lieutenant governor acts as the Secretary of State.

name: hawaii
sentence: The governor and lieutenant governor oversee twenty agencies and departments from offices in the State Capitol.

name: hawaii
sentence: The official residence of the governor is Washington Place.

name: hawaii
sentence: The legislative branch consists of the bicameral Hawaii State Legislature, which is composed of the 51-member Hawaii House of Representatives led by the Speaker of the House, and the 25-member Hawaii Senatorte led by the President of the Senatorte.

name: hawaii
sentence: The Legislature meets at the State Capitol.

name: hawaii
sentence: The unified judicial branch of Hawaii is the Hawaii State Judiciary.

name: hawaii
sentence: The state's highest court is the Supreme Court of Hawaii, which uses Aliʻiōlani Hale as its chambers.

name: hawaii
sentence: Hawaii is represented in the United States Congress by two senators and two representatives.

name: hawaii
sentence: As of 2021, all four seats are held by Democrats.

name: hawaii
sentence: Former representative Ed Case was elected in 2018 to the 1st congressional district.

name: hawaii
sentence: Kai Kahele represents the 2nd congressional district, representing the rest of the state, which is largely rural and semi-rural.

name: hawaii
sentence: Brian Schatz is the senior United States Senatortor from Hawaii.

name: hawaii
sentence: He was appointed to the office on December 26, 2012, by Governor Neil Abercrombie, following the death of former senator Daniel Inouye.

name: hawaii
sentence: The state's junior senator is Mazie Hirono, the former representative from the second congressional district.

name: hawaii
sentence: Hirono is the first female Asian American senator and the first Buddhist senator.

name: hawaii
sentence: Hawaii incurred the biggest seniority shift between the 112th and 113th Congresses.

name: hawaii
sentence: The state went from a delegation consisting of senators who were first and twenty-first in seniority to their respective replacements, relative newcomers Schatz and Hirono.

name: hawaii
sentence: Federal officials in Hawaii are based at the Prince Kūhiō Federal Building near the Aloha Tower and Honolulu Harbor.

name: hawaii
sentence: The Federal Bureau of Investigation, Internal Revenue Service and the Secret Service maintain their offices there; the building is also the site of the federal District Court for the District of Hawaii and the United States Attorney for the District of Hawaii.

name: hawaii
sentence: Since gaining statehood and participating in its first election in 1960, Hawaii has supported Democrats in all but two presidential elections; 1972 and 1984, both of which were landslide reelection victories for Republicans Richard Nixon and Ronald Reagan respectively.

name: hawaii
sentence: In Hawaii's statehood tenure, only Minnesota has supported Republican candidates fewer times in presidential elections.

name: hawaii
sentence: The 2016 Cook Partisan Voting Index ranks Hawaii as the most heavily Democratic state in the nation.

name: hawaii
sentence: Hawaii has not elected a Republican to represent the state in the US Senatorte since Hiram Fong in 1970; since 1977, both of the state's US

name: hawaii
sentence: Senatortors have been Democrats.

name: hawaii
sentence: In 2004, John Kerry won the state's four electoral votes by a margin of nine percentage points with 54% of the vote.

name: hawaii
sentence: Every county supported the Democratic candidate.

name: hawaii
sentence: In 1964, favorite son candidate senator Hiram Fong of Hawaii sought the Republican presidential nomination, while Patsy Mink ran in the Oregon primary in 1972.

name: hawaii
sentence: Honolulu-born Barack Obama, then serving as United States Senatortor from Illinois, was elected the 44th President of the United States on November 4, 2008 and was re-elected for a second term on November 6, 2012.

name: hawaii
sentence: Obama had won the Hawaii Democratic caucus on February 19, 2008, with 76% of the vote.

name: hawaii
sentence: He was the third Hawaii-born candidate to seek the nomination of a major party and the first presidential nominee from Hawaii.

name: hawaii
sentence: Hawaii is the only state in the United States that does not maintain a separate, state-wide police force.

name: hawaii
sentence: Instead, state law enforcement responsibilities are taken on by the municipal police agencies of the four main islands.

name: hawaii
sentence: Forensic services for all agencies in the state are provided by the Honolulu Police Department.

name: hawaii
sentence: While Hawaii is internationally recognized as a state of the United States while also being broadly accepted as such in mainstream understanding, the legality of this status has been questioned in US District Court, the U.N., and other international forums.

name: hawaii
sentence: Domestically, the debate is a topic covered in the Kamehameha Schools curriculum, and in classes at the University of Hawaiʻi at Mānoa.

name: hawaii
sentence: Political organizations seeking some form of sovereignty for Hawaii have been active since the late 19th century.

name: hawaii
sentence: Generally, their focus is on self-determination and self-governance, either for Hawaii as an independent nation (in many proposals, for "Hawaiian nationals" descended from subjects of the Hawaiian Kingdom or declaring themselves as such by choice), or for people of whole or part native Hawaiian ancestry in an indigenous "nation to nation" relationship akin to tribal sovereignty with US federal recognition of Native Hawaiians.

name: hawaii
sentence: The pro-federal recognition Akaka Bill drew substantial opposition among Hawaiian residents in the 2000s.

name: hawaii
sentence: Opponents to the tribal approach argue it is not a legitimate path to Hawaiian nationhood

name: hawaii
sentence: The Hawaiian sovereignty movement views the overthrow of the Kingdom of Hawaii in 1893 as illegal, and views the subsequent annexation of Hawaii by the United States as illegal; the movement seeks some form of greater autonomy for Hawaii, such as free association or independence from the United States.

name: hawaii
sentence: Some groups also advocate some form of redress from the United States for the 1893 overthrow of Queen Liliʻuokalani, and for what is described as a prolonged military occupation beginning with the 1898 annexation.

name: hawaii
sentence: The Apology Resolution passed by US Congress in 1993 is cited as a major impetus by the movement for Hawaiian sovereignty.

name: hawaii
sentence: The sovereignty movement considers Hawaii to be an illegally occupied nation.

name: idaho
sentence: Idaho ( (listen)) is a state in the Pacific Northwest region of the United States.

name: idaho
sentence: It borders the state of Montana to the east and northeast, Wyoming to the east, Nevada and Utah to the south, and Washington and Oregon to the west.

name: idaho
sentence: To the north, it shares a small portion of the Canadian border with the province of British Columbia.

name: idaho
sentence: With a population of approximately 1.7 million and an area of 83,570 square miles (216,400 km2), Idaho is the 14th largest, the 12th least populous and the 7th least densely populated of the 50 US states.

name: idaho
sentence: The state's capital and largest city is Boise.

name: idaho
sentence: For thousands of years Idaho has been inhabited by Native American peoples.

name: idaho
sentence: In the early 19th century, Idaho was considered part of the Oregon Country, an area disputed between the United States and the British Empire.

name: idaho
sentence: It officially became US territory with the signing of the Oregon Treaty of 1846, but a separate Idaho Territory was not organized until 1863, instead being included for periods in Oregon Territory and Washington Territory.

name: idaho
sentence: Idaho was eventually admitted to the Union on July 3, 1890, becoming the 43rd state.

name: idaho
sentence: Forming part of the Pacific Northwest (and the associated Cascadia bioregion), Idaho is divided into several distinct geographic and climatic regions.

name: idaho
sentence: The state's north, the relatively isolated Idaho Panhandle, is closely linked with Eastern Washington with which it shares the Pacific Time Zone—the rest of the state uses the Mountain Time Zone.

name: idaho
sentence: The state's south includes the Snake River Plain (which has most of the population and agricultural land).

name: idaho
sentence: The state's southeast incorporates part of the Great Basin.

name: idaho
sentence: Idaho is quite mountainous, and contains several stretches of the Rocky Mountains.

name: idaho
sentence: The United States Forest Service holds about 38% of Idaho's land, the highest proportion of any state.

name: idaho
sentence: Industries significant for the state economy include manufacturing, agriculture, mining, forestry, and tourism.

name: idaho
sentence: A number of science and technology firms are either headquartered in Idaho or have factories there, and the state also contains the Idaho National Laboratory, which is the country's largest Department of Energy facility.

name: idaho
sentence: Idaho's agricultural sector supplies many products, but the state is best known for its potato crop, which comprises around one-third of the nationwide yield.

name: idaho
sentence: The official state nickname is the "Gem State", which references Idaho's natural beauty.

name: idaho
sentence: The name's origin remains a mystery.

name: idaho
sentence: In the early 1860s, when the US Congress was considering organizing a new territory in the Rocky Mountains, the name "Idaho" was suggested by George M. Willing, a politician posing as an unrecognized delegate from the unofficial Jefferson Territory.

name: idaho
sentence: Willing claimed that the name was derived from a Shoshone term meaning "the sun comes from the mountains" or "gem of the mountains", but it was revealed later that there was no such term and Willing claimed that he had been inspired to coin the name when he met a little girl named "Ida".

name: idaho
sentence: Since the name appeared to be fabricated, the US Congress ultimately decided to name the area Colorado Territory instead when it was created in February 1861, but by the time this decision was made, the town of Idaho Springs, Colorado had already been named after Willing's proposal.

name: idaho
sentence: The same year Congress created Colorado Territory, a county called Idaho County was created in eastern Washington Territory.

name: idaho
sentence: The county was named after a steamship named Idaho, which was launched on the Columbia River in 1860.

name: idaho
sentence: It is unclear whether the steamship was named before or after Willing's claim was revealed.

name: idaho
sentence: Regardless, part of Washington Territory, including Idaho County, was used to create Idaho Territory in 1863.

name: idaho
sentence: Eventually, the name was given to the Idaho Territory, which would later become the US state.

name: idaho
sentence: Despite this lack of evidence for the origin of the name, many textbooks well into the 20th century repeated as fact Willing's account the name "Idaho" derived from the Shoshone term "ee-da-how".

name: idaho
sentence: A 1956 Idaho history textbook says:

name: idaho
sentence: An alternative etymology attributes the name to the Plains Apache word "ídaahę́" IPA: [í.taː.hɛ̃́] (enemy) that was used in reference to the Comanche.

name: idaho
sentence: Idaho borders six US states and one Canadian province.

name: idaho
sentence: The states of Washington and Oregon are to the west, Nevada and Utah are to the south, and Montana and Wyoming are to the east.

name: idaho
sentence: Idaho also shares a short border with the Canadian province of British Columbia to the north.

name: idaho
sentence: The landscape is rugged with some of the largest unspoiled natural areas in the United States.

name: idaho
sentence: For example, at 2.3 million acres (930,000 ha), the Frank Church-River of No Return Wilderness Area is the largest contiguous area of protected wilderness in the continental United States.

name: idaho
sentence: Idaho is a Rocky Mountain state with abundant natural resources and scenic areas.

name: idaho
sentence: The state has snow-capped mountain ranges, rapids, vast lakes and steep canyons.

name: idaho
sentence: The waters of the Snake River run through Hells Canyon, the deepest gorge in the United States.

name: idaho
sentence: Shoshone Falls falls down cliffs from a height greater than Niagara Falls.

name: idaho
sentence: By far, the most important river in Idaho is the Snake River, a major tributary of the Columbia River.

name: idaho
sentence: The Snake River flows out from Yellowstone in northwestern Wyoming through the Snake River Plain in southern Idaho before turning north, leaving the state at Lewiston before joining the Columbia in Kennewick.

name: idaho
sentence: Other major rivers are the Clark Fork/Pend Oreille River, the Spokane River, and major tributaries of the Snake river, including the Clearwater River, the Salmon River, the Boise River, and the Payette River.

name: idaho
sentence: The Salmon River empties into the Snake in Hells Canyon and forms the southern boundary of Nez Perce County on its north shore, of which Lewiston is the county seat.

name: idaho
sentence: The Port of Lewiston, at the confluence of the Clearwater and the Snake Rivers is the farthest inland seaport on the West Coast at 465 river miles from the Pacific at Astoria, Oregon.

name: idaho
sentence: The vast majority of Idaho's population lives in the Snake River Plain, a valley running from across the entirety of southern Idaho from east to west.

name: idaho
sentence: The valley contains the major cities of Boise, Meridian, Nampa, Caldwell, Twin Falls, Idaho Falls, and Pocatello.

name: idaho
sentence: The plain served as an easy pass through the Rocky Mountains for westward-bound settlers on the Oregon Trail, and many settlers chose to settle the area rather than risking the treacherous route through the Blue Mountains and the Cascade Range to the west.

name: idaho
sentence: The western region of the plain is known as the Treasure Valley, bound between the Owyhee Mountains to the southwest and the Boise Mountains to the northeast.

name: idaho
sentence: The central region of the Snake River Plain is known as the Magic Valley.

name: idaho
sentence: Idaho's highest point is Borah Peak, 12,662 ft (3,859 m), in the Lost River Range north of Mackay.

name: idaho
sentence: Idaho's lowest point, 710 ft (216 m), is in Lewiston, where the Clearwater River joins the Snake River and continues into Washington.

name: idaho
sentence: The Sawtooth Range is often considered Idaho's most famous mountain range.

name: idaho
sentence: Other mountain ranges in Idaho include the Bitterroot Range, the White Cloud Mountains, the Lost River Range, the Clearwater Mountains, and the Salmon River Mountains.

name: idaho
sentence: Idaho has two time zones, with the dividing line approximately midway between Canada and Nevada.

name: idaho
sentence: Southern Idaho, including the Boise metropolitan area, Idaho Falls, Pocatello, and Twin Falls, are in the Mountain Time Zone.

name: idaho
sentence: A legislative error (15 USC.

name: idaho
sentence: ch.

name: idaho
sentence: 6 §264) theoretically placed this region in the Central Time Zone, but this was corrected with a 2007 amendment.

name: idaho
sentence: Areas north of the Salmon River, including Coeur d'Alene, Moscow, Lewiston, and Sandpoint, are in the Pacific Time Zone, which contains less than a quarter of the state's population and land area.

name: idaho
sentence: Idaho's climate varies widely.

name: idaho
sentence: Although the state's western border is about 350 miles (560 km) from the Pacific Ocean, the maritime influence is still felt in Idaho, especially in the winter when cloud cover, humidity, and precipitation are at their maximum extent.

name: idaho
sentence: This influence has a moderating effect in the winter where temperatures are not as low as would otherwise be expected for a northern state with predominantly high elevations.

name: idaho
sentence: The maritime influence is least prominent in the state's eastern part where the precipitation patterns are often reversed, with wetter summers and drier winters, and seasonal temperature differences are more extreme, showing a more semi-arid continental climate.

name: idaho
sentence: Idaho can be hot, although extended periods over 98 °F (37 °C) are rare, except for the lowest point in elevation, Lewiston, which correspondingly sees little snow.

name: idaho
sentence: Hot summer days are tempered by the low relative humidity and cooler evenings during summer months since, for most of the state, the highest diurnal difference in temperature is often in the summer.

name: idaho
sentence: Winters can be cold, although extended periods of bitter cold weather below zero are unusual.

name: idaho
sentence: Idaho's all-time highest temperature of 118 °F (48 °C) was recorded at Orofino on July 28, 1934; the all-time lowest temperature of −60 °F (−51 °C) was recorded at Island Park Dam on January 18, 1943.

name: idaho
sentence: Humans may have been present in the Idaho area as long as 14,500 years ago.

name: idaho
sentence: Excavations at Wilson Butte Cave near Twin Falls in 1959 revealed evidence of human activity, including arrowheads, that rank among the oldest dated artifacts in North America.

name: idaho
sentence: American Indian peoples predominant in the area included the Nez Percé in the north and the Northern and Western Shoshone in the south.

name: idaho
sentence: A Late Upper Paleolithic site was identified at Cooper's Ferry in western Idaho near the town of Cottonwood by archaeologists in 2019.

name: idaho
sentence: Based on evidence found at the site, first people lived in this area 15,300 to 16,600 years ago, predating the Beringia land bridge by about a thousand years.

name: idaho
sentence: The discoverers, anthropology professor Loren Davis and colleagues, emphasized that they possess similarities with tools and artifacts discovered in Japan that date from 16,000 to 13,000 years ago.

name: idaho
sentence: The discovery also showed that the first people might not have come to North America by land, as previously theorized.

name: idaho
sentence: On the contrary, they probably came through the water, using a Pacific coastal road.

name: idaho
sentence: An early presence of French-Canadian trappers is visible in names and toponyms: Nez Percé, Cœur d'Alène, Boisé, Payette, some preexisting the Lewis and Clark and Astorian expeditions which themselves included significant numbers of French and Métis guides recruited for their familiarity with the terrain.

name: idaho
sentence: Idaho, as part of the Oregon Country, was claimed by both the United States and Great Britain until the United States gained undisputed jurisdiction in 1846.

name: idaho
sentence: From 1843 to 1849, present-day Idaho was under the de facto jurisdiction of the Provisional Government of Oregon.

name: idaho
sentence: When Oregon became a state, what is now Idaho was in what remained of the original Oregon Territory not part of the new state, and designated as the Washington Territory.

name: idaho
sentence: Between then and the creation of the Idaho Territory on March 4, 1863, at Lewiston, parts of the present-day state were included in the Oregon, Washington, and Dakota Territories.

name: idaho
sentence: The new territory included present-day Idaho, Montana, and most of Wyoming.

name: idaho
sentence: The Lewis and Clark expedition crossed Idaho in 1805 on the way to the Pacific and in 1806 on the return, largely following the Clearwater River both directions.

name: idaho
sentence: The first non-indigenous settlement was Kullyspell House, established on the shore of Lake Pend Oreille for fur trading in 1809 by David Thompson of the North West Company.

name: idaho
sentence: In 1812 Donald Mackenzie, working for the Pacific Fur Company at the time, established a post on the lower Clearwater River near present-day Lewiston.

name: idaho
sentence: This post, known as "MacKenzie's Post" or "Clearwater", operated until the Pacific Fur Company was bought out by the North West Company in 1813, after which it was abandoned.

name: idaho
sentence: The first attempts at organized communities, within the present borders of Idaho, were established in 1860.

name: idaho
sentence: The first permanent, substantial incorporated community was Lewiston in 1861.

name: idaho
sentence: After some tribulation as a territory, including the chaotic transfer of the territorial capital from Lewiston to Boise, disenfranchisement of Mormon polygamists upheld by the US Supreme Court in 1877, and a federal attempt to split the territory between Washington Territory which gained statehood in 1889, a year before Idaho, and the state of Nevada which had been a state since 1864, Idaho achieved statehood in 1890.

name: idaho
sentence: Idaho was one of the hardest hit of the Pacific Northwest states during the Great Depression.

name: idaho
sentence: Prices plummeted for Idaho's major crops: in 1932 a bushel of potatoes brought only ten cents compared to $1.51 in 1919, while Idaho farmers saw their annual income of $686 in 1929 drop to $250 by 1932.

name: idaho
sentence: In recent years, Idaho has expanded its commercial base as a tourism and agricultural state to include science and technology industries.

name: idaho
sentence: Science and technology have become the largest single economic center (over 25% of the state's total revenue) within the state and are greater than agriculture, forestry and mining combined.

name: idaho
sentence: The United States Census Bureau estimates Idaho's population was 1,787,065 on July 1, 2018, a 14% increase since 2010.

name: idaho
sentence: Idaho had an estimated population of 1,754,208 in 2018, which was an increase of 37,265, from the prior year and an increase of 186,626, or 11.91%, since 2010.

name: idaho
sentence: This includes a natural increase since the last census of 58,884 (111,131 births minus 52,247 deaths) and an increase due to net migration of 75,795 people into the state.

name: idaho
sentence: There are large numbers of Americans of English and German ancestry in Idaho.

name: idaho
sentence: Immigration from outside the United States resulted in a net increase of 14,522 people, and migration within the country produced a net increase of 61,273 people.

name: idaho
sentence: This made Idaho the tenth fastest-growing state after District of Columbia (+16.74%), Utah (+14.37%), Texas (+14.14%), Florida (+13.29%), Colorado (+13.25%), North Dakota (+13.01%), Nevada (+12.36%), Arizona (+12.20%) and Washington.

name: idaho
sentence: From 2017 to 2018, Idaho grew the second-fastest, surpassed only by Nevada.

name: idaho
sentence: Nampa, about 20 miles (30 km) west of downtown Boise, became the state's second largest city in the late 1990s, passing Pocatello and Idaho Falls.

name: idaho
sentence: Nampa's population was under 29,000 in 1990 and grew to over 81,000 by 2010.

name: idaho
sentence: Located between Nampa and Boise, Meridian also experienced high growth, from fewer than 10,000 residents in 1990 to more than 75,000 in 2010 and is now Idaho's third largest city.

name: idaho
sentence: Growth of 5% or more over the same period has also been observed in Caldwell, Coeur d'Alene, Post Falls, and Twin Falls.

name: idaho
sentence: From 1990 to 2010, Idaho's population increased by over 560,000 (55%).

name: idaho
sentence: The Boise metropolitan area (officially known as the Boise City-Nampa, ID Metropolitan Statistical Area) is Idaho's largest metropolitan area.

name: idaho
sentence: Other metropolitan areas in order of size are Coeur d'Alene, Idaho Falls, Pocatello and Lewiston.

name: idaho
sentence: The table below shows the racial composition of Idaho's population as of 2016.

name: idaho
sentence: According to the 2017 American Community Survey, 12.2% of Idaho's population were of Hispanic or Latino origin (of any race): Mexican (10.6%), Puerto Rican (0.2%), Cuban (0.1%), and other Hispanic or Latino origin (1.3%).

name: idaho
sentence: The five largest ancestry groups were: German (17.5%), English (16.4%), Irish (9.3%), American (8.1%), and Scottish (3.2%).

name: idaho
sentence: Note: Births in table don't add up, because Hispanics are counted both by their ethnicity and by their race, giving a higher overall number.

name: idaho
sentence: According to the Pew Research Center on Religion & Public Life, the self-identified religious affiliations of Idahoans over the age of 18 in 2008 and 2014 were:

name: idaho
sentence: According to the Association of Religion Data Archives, the largest denominations by number of members in 2010 were The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints with 409,265; the Catholic Church with 123,400; the non-denominational Evangelical Protestant with 62,637; and the Assemblies of God with 22,183.

name: idaho
sentence: English is the state's predominant language.

name: idaho
sentence: Minority languages include Spanish and various Native American languages.

name: idaho
sentence: Gross state product for 2015 was $64.9 billion, and the per capita income based on 2015 GDP and 2015 population estimates was $39,100.

name: idaho
sentence: Idaho is an important agricultural state, producing nearly one-third of the potatoes grown in the United States.

name: idaho
sentence: All three varieties of wheat, dark northern spring, hard red, and soft white are grown in the state.

name: idaho
sentence: Nez Perce County is considered a premier soft white growing locale.

name: idaho
sentence: Important industries in Idaho are food processing, lumber and wood products, machinery, chemical products, paper products, electronics manufacturing, silver and other mining, and tourism.

name: idaho
sentence: The world's largest factory for barrel cheese, the raw product for processed cheese is in Gooding, Idaho.

name: idaho
sentence: It has a capacity of 120,000 metric tons per year of barrel cheese and belongs to the Glanbia group.

name: idaho
sentence: The Idaho National Laboratory (INL) is the largest Department of Energy facility in the country by area.

name: idaho
sentence: INL is an important part of the eastern Idaho economy.

name: idaho
sentence: Idaho also is home to three facilities of Anheuser-Busch which provide a large part of the malt for breweries across the nation.

name: idaho
sentence: A variety of industries are important.

name: idaho
sentence: Outdoor recreation is a common example ranging from numerous snowmobile and downhill and cross-country ski areas in winter to the evolution of Lewiston as a retirement community based on mild winters, dry, year-round climate and one of the lowest median wind velocities anywhere, combined with the rivers for a wide variety of activities.

name: idaho
sentence: Other examples would be ATK Corporation, which operates three ammunition and ammunition components plants in Lewiston.

name: idaho
sentence: Two are sporting and one is defense contract.

name: idaho
sentence: The Lewis-Clark valley has an additional independent ammunition components manufacturer and the Chipmunk rifle factory until it was purchased in 2007 by Keystone Sporting Arms and production was moved to Milton, Pennsylvania.

name: idaho
sentence: Four of the world's six welded aluminum jet boat (for running river rapids) manufacturers are in the Lewiston-Clarkston, WA valley.

name: idaho
sentence: Wine grapes were grown between Kendrick and Juliaetta in the Idaho Panhandle by the French Rothschilds until Prohibition.

name: idaho
sentence: In keeping with this, while there are no large wineries or breweries in Idaho, there are numerous and growing numbers of award-winning boutique wineries and microbreweries in the northern part of the state.

name: idaho
sentence: Today, Idaho's largest industry is the science and technology sector.

name: idaho
sentence: It accounts for over 25% of the state's revenue and over 70% of the state's exports.

name: idaho
sentence: Idaho's industrial economy is growing, with high-tech products leading the way.

name: idaho
sentence: Since the late 1970s, Boise has emerged as a center for semiconductor manufacturing.

name: idaho
sentence: Boise is the home of Micron Technology, the only US manufacturer of dynamic random-access memory (DRAM) chips.

name: idaho
sentence: Micron at one time manufactured desktop computers, but with very limited success.

name: idaho
sentence: Hewlett-Packard has operated a large plant in Boise since the 1970s, which is devoted primarily to LaserJet printers production.

name: idaho
sentence: Boise-based Clearwater Analytics is another rapidly growing investment accounting and reporting software firm, reporting on over $1 trillion in assets.

name: idaho
sentence: ON Semiconductor, whose worldwide headquarters is in Pocatello, is a widely recognized innovator of modern integrated mixed-signal semiconductor products, mixed-signal foundry services, and structured digital products.

name: idaho
sentence: Coldwater Creek, a women's clothing retailer, is headquartered in Sandpoint.

name: idaho
sentence: Sun Microsystems (now a part of Oracle Corporation) has two offices in Boise and a parts depot in Pocatello.

name: idaho
sentence: Sun brings $4 million in annual salaries and over $300 million of revenue to the state each year.

name: idaho
sentence: A number of Fortune 500 companies started in or trace their roots to Idaho, including Safeway in American Falls, Albertsons in Boise, JR Simplot across southern Idaho, and Potlatch Corp. in Lewiston.

name: idaho
sentence: Zimmerly Air Transport in Lewiston-Clarkston was one of the five companies in the merger centered around Varney Air Lines of Pasco, Washington, which became United Airlines and subsequently Varney Air Group which became Continental Airlines.

name: idaho
sentence: In 2014, Idaho emerged as the second most small business friendly state, ranking behind Utah, based on a study drawing upon data from more than 12,000 small business owners.

name: idaho
sentence: Idaho has a state gambling lottery which contributed $333.5 million in payments to all Idaho public schools and Idaho higher education from 1990 to 2006.

name: idaho
sentence: Tax is collected by the Idaho State Tax Commission.

name: idaho
sentence: The state personal income tax ranges from 1.6% to 7.8% in eight income brackets.

name: idaho
sentence: Idahoans may apply for state tax credits for taxes paid to other states, as well as for donations to Idaho state educational entities and some nonprofit youth and rehabilitation facilities.

name: idaho
sentence: The state sales tax is 6% with a very limited, selective local option up to 6.5%.

name: idaho
sentence: Sales tax applies to the sale, rental or lease of tangible personal property and some services.

name: idaho
sentence: Food is taxed, but prescription drugs are not.

name: idaho
sentence: Hotel, motel, and campground accommodations are taxed at a higher rate (7% to 11%).

name: idaho
sentence: Some jurisdictions impose local option sales tax.

name: idaho
sentence: The sales tax was introduced at 3% in 1965, easily approved by voters, where it remained at 3% until 1983.

name: idaho
sentence: As of 2017, the primary energy source in Idaho was hydropower, and the energy companies had a total retail sales of 23,793,790 megawatthours (MWh).

name: idaho
sentence: As of 2017, Idaho had a regulated electricity market, with the Idaho Public Utilities Commission regulating the three major utilities of Avista Utilities, Idaho Power, and Rocky Mountain Power.

name: idaho
sentence: Idaho's energy landscape is favorable to the development of renewable energy systems.

name: idaho
sentence: The state is rich in renewable energy resources but has limited fossil fuel resources.

name: idaho
sentence: The Snake River Plain and smaller river basins provide Idaho with some of the nation's best hydroelectric power resources and its geologically active mountain areas have significant geothermal power and wind power potential.

name: idaho
sentence: These realities have shaped much of the state's energy landscape.

name: idaho
sentence: Idaho imports most of the energy it consumes.

name: idaho
sentence: Imports account for more than 80% of energy consumption, including all of Idaho's natural gas and petroleum supplies and more than half of its electricity.

name: idaho
sentence: Of the electricity consumed in Idaho in 2005, 48% came from hydroelectricity, 42% was generated by burning coal and 9% was generated by burning natural gas.

name: idaho
sentence: The remainder came from other renewable sources such as wind.

name: idaho
sentence: The state's numerous river basins allow hydroelectric power plants to provide 556,000 MWh, which amounts to about three-fourths of Idaho's electricity generated in the state.

name: idaho
sentence: Washington State provides most of the natural gas used in Idaho through one of the two major pipeline systems supplying the state.

name: idaho
sentence: Although the state relies on out-of-state sources for its entire natural gas supply, it uses natural gas-fired plants to generate 127,000 MWh, or about ten percent of its output.

name: idaho
sentence: Coal-fired generation and the state's small array of wind turbines supplies the remainder of the state's electricity output.

name: idaho
sentence: The state produces 739,000 MWh but still needs to import half of its electricity from out-of-state to meet demand.

name: idaho
sentence: While Idaho's 515 trillion British thermal units (151 TWh) total energy consumption is low compared with other states and represents just 0.5% of United States consumption, the state also has the nation's 11th smallest population, 1.5 million, so its per capita energy consumption of 352 million BTU (103 MWh) is just above the national average of 333 million BTU (98 MWh).

name: idaho
sentence: As the 13th‑largest state in terms of land area of 83,570 square miles (53,480,000 acres; 216,400 km2), distance creates the additional problem of "line loss".

name: idaho
sentence: When the length of an electrical transmission line is doubled, the resistance to an electric current passing through it is also doubled.

name: idaho
sentence: In addition, Idaho also has the 6th fastest growing population in the United States with the population expected to increase by 31% from 2008 to 2030.

name: idaho
sentence: This projected increase in population will contribute to a 42% increase in demand by 2030, further straining Idaho's finite hydroelectric resources.

name: idaho
sentence: Idaho has an upper-boundary estimate of development potential to generate 44,320 GWh/year from 18,076 MW of wind power, and 7,467,000 GWh/year from solar power using 2,061,000 MW of photovoltaics (PV), including 3,224 MW of rooftop photovoltaics, and 1,267,000 MW of concentrated solar power.

name: idaho
sentence: The Idaho Transportation Department is the government agency responsible for Idaho's transportation infrastructure, including operations and maintenance as well as planning for future needs.

name: idaho
sentence: The agency is also responsible for overseeing the disbursement of federal, state, and grant funding for the transportation programs of the state.

name: idaho
sentence: Idaho is among the few states in the nation without a major freeway linking its two largest metropolitan areas, Boise in the south and Coeur d'Alene in the north.

name: idaho
sentence: US-95 links the two ends of the state, but like many other highways in Idaho, it is badly in need of repair and upgrade.

name: idaho
sentence: In 2007, the Idaho Transportation Department stated the state's highway infrastructure faces a $200 million per year shortfall in maintenance and upgrades.

name: idaho
sentence: I-84 is the main highway linking the southeast and southwest portions of the state, along with I-86 and I-15.

name: idaho
sentence: Major federal aid highways in Idaho:

name: idaho
sentence: Major airports include the Boise International Airport which serves the southwest region of Idaho and the Spokane International Airport (in Spokane, Washington) which serves northern Idaho.

name: idaho
sentence: Other airports with scheduled service are the Pullman-Moscow Regional Airport serving the Palouse; the Lewiston-Nez Perce County Airport, serving the Lewis-Clark Valley and north central and west central Idaho; The Magic Valley Regional Airport in Twin Falls; the Idaho Falls Regional Airport; and the Pocatello Regional Airport.

name: idaho
sentence: Idaho is served by three transcontinental railroads.

name: idaho
sentence: The Burlington Northern Santa Fe (BNSF) connects the Idaho Panhandle with Seattle, Portland, and Spokane to the west, and Minneapolis and Chicago to the east.

name: idaho
sentence: The BNSF travels through Kootenai, Bonner, and Boundary counties.

name: idaho
sentence: The Union Pacific Railroad crosses North Idaho entering from Canada through Boundary and Bonner, and proceeding to Spokane.

name: idaho
sentence: Canadian Pacific Railway uses Union Pacific Railroad tracks in North Idaho carrying products from Alberta to Spokane and Portland, Oregon.

name: idaho
sentence: Amtrak's Empire Builder crosses northern Idaho, with its only stop being in Sandpoint.

name: idaho
sentence: Montana Rail Link also operates between Billings, Montana and Sandpoint, Idaho

name: idaho
sentence: The Union Pacific Railroad also crosses southern Idaho traveling between Portland, Oregon, Green River, Wyoming, and Ogden, Utah and serves Boise, Nampa, Twin Falls, and Pocatello.

name: idaho
sentence: The Port of Lewiston is the farthest inland Pacific port on the west coast.

name: idaho
sentence: A series of dams and locks on the Snake River and Columbia River facilitate barge travel from Lewiston to Portland, where goods are loaded on ocean-going vessels.

name: idaho
sentence: The constitution of Idaho is roughly modeled on the national constitution with several additions.

name: idaho
sentence: The constitution defines the form and functions of the state government, and may be amended through plebiscite.

name: idaho
sentence: Notably, the state constitution presently requires the state government to maintain a balanced budget.

name: idaho
sentence: As result, Idaho has limited debt (construction bonds, etc.

name: idaho
sentence: All of Idaho's state laws are contained in the Idaho Code and Statutes.

name: idaho
sentence: The code is amended through the legislature with the approval of the governor.

name: idaho
sentence: Idaho still operates under its original (1889) state constitution.

name: idaho
sentence: The constitution of Idaho provides for three branches of government: the executive, legislative and judicial branches.

name: idaho
sentence: Idaho has a bicameral legislature, elected from 35 legislative districts, each represented by one senator and two representatives.

name: idaho
sentence: Since 1946, statewide elected constitutional officers have been elected to four-year terms.

name: idaho
sentence: They include: Governor, Lieutenant Governor, Secretary of State, Idaho state controller (Auditor before 1994), Treasurer, Attorney General, and Superintendent of Public Instruction.

name: idaho
sentence: Last contested in 1966, Inspector of Mines was an originally elected constitutional office.

name: idaho
sentence: Afterward it was an appointed position and ultimately done away with entirely in 1974.

name: idaho
sentence: Idaho's government has an alcohol monopoly.

name: idaho
sentence: The governor of Idaho serves a four-year term, and is elected during what is nationally referred to as midterm elections.

name: idaho
sentence: As such, the governor is not elected in the same election year as the president of the United States.

name: idaho
sentence: The current governor is Republican Brad Little, who was elected in 2018.

name: idaho
sentence: Idaho's legislature is part-time.

name: idaho
sentence: However, the session may be extended if necessary, and often is.

name: idaho
sentence: Because of this, Idaho's legislators are considered "citizen legislators", meaning their position as a legislator is not their main occupation.

name: idaho
sentence: Terms for both the Senatorte and House of Representatives are two years.

name: idaho
sentence: Legislative elections occur every even numbered year.

name: idaho
sentence: The Idaho Legislature has been continuously controlled by the Republican Party since the late 1950s, although Democratic legislators are routinely elected from Boise, Pocatello, Blaine County and the northern Panhandle.

name: idaho
sentence: The highest court in Idaho is the Idaho Supreme Court.

name: idaho
sentence: There is also an intermediate appellate court, the Idaho Court of Appeals, which hears cases assigned to it from the Supreme Court.

name: idaho
sentence: The state's District Courts serve seven judicial districts.

name: idaho
sentence: Idaho is divided into political jurisdictions designated as counties.

name: idaho
sentence: Since 1919 there are 44 counties in the state, ranging in size from 410 to 8,502 square miles (1,060 to 22,020 km2).

name: idaho
sentence: Three counties were first designated as such by the Washington Territorial Legislature in 1861

name: idaho
sentence: The 1861 Nez Percé county has since been broken up into Nez Percé, Lewis, Boundary, Benewah, Latah, Kootenai, and Clearwater counties.

name: idaho
sentence: Idaho license plates begin with a county designation based on the first letter of the county's name.

name: idaho
sentence: Where a letter is at the beginning of more than one name, a number accompanies precedingly in alphabetical order.

name: idaho
sentence: This reflects an anomalous coincidental situation wherein 10 counties begin with B, seven with C and four with L, which is 21 of the 44 counties.

name: idaho
sentence: After the Civil War, many Midwestern and Southern Democrats moved to the Idaho Territory.

name: idaho
sentence: As a result, the early territorial legislatures were solidly Democrat-controlled.

name: idaho
