sentence: In contrast, most of the territorial governors were appointed by Republican presidents and were Republicans.

name: idaho
sentence: This led to sometimes-bitter clashes between the two parties, including a range war with the Democrats backing the sheepherders and the Republicans the cattlemen, which ended in the "Diamondfield" Jack Davis murder trial.

name: idaho
sentence: In the 1880s, Republicans became more prominent in local politics.

name: idaho
sentence: In 1864, Clinton DeWitt Smith removed the territorial seal and the state constitution from a locked safe, and took them to Boise.

name: idaho
sentence: This effectively moved the capital from where they were stored (Lewiston, Idaho) to the current capital Boise.

name: idaho
sentence: Since statehood, the Republican Party has usually been the dominant party in Idaho.

name: idaho
sentence: At one time, Idaho had two Democratic parties, one being the mainstream and the other called the Anti-Mormon Democrats, lasting into the early 20th century.

name: idaho
sentence: In the 1890s and early 1900s, the Populist Party enjoyed prominence while the Democratic Party maintained a brief dominance in the 1930s during the Great Depression.

name: idaho
sentence: Since World War II most statewide-elected officials have been Republicans, though the Democrats did hold the majority in the House (by one seat) in 1958 and the governorship from 1971 to 1995.

name: idaho
sentence: Idaho Congressional delegations have also been generally Republican since statehood.

name: idaho
sentence: Several Idaho Democrats have had electoral success in the House over the years, but the Senatorte delegation has been a Republican stronghold for decades.

name: idaho
sentence: Several Idaho Republicans, including current Senatortor Mike Crapo, have won reelection to the Senatorte, but only Frank Church has won reelection as a Democrat.

name: idaho
sentence: Church was the last Idaho Democrat to win a US Senatorte race, in 1974.

name: idaho
sentence: Walt Minnick's 2008 win in the First Congressional District was the state's first Democratic Congressional victory in 16 years.

name: idaho
sentence: In modern times, Idaho has been a reliably Republican state in presidential politics.

name: idaho
sentence: It has not supported a Democrat for president since 1964.

name: idaho
sentence: Even in that election, Lyndon Johnson defeated Barry Goldwater in the state by fewer than two percentage points, compared to a landslide nationally.

name: idaho
sentence: In 2004, Republican George W. Bush carried Idaho by a margin of 38 percentage points and with 68.4% of the vote, winning in 43 of 44 counties.

name: idaho
sentence: Only Blaine County, which contains the Sun Valley ski resort, supported John Kerry, who owns a home in the area.

name: idaho
sentence: In 2008 Barack Obama's 36.1 percent showing was the best for a Democratic presidential candidate in Idaho since 1976.

name: idaho
sentence: However, Republican margins were narrower in 1992 and 1976.

name: idaho
sentence: In the 2006 elections, Republicans, led by gubernatorial candidate CL "Butch" Otter, won all the state's constitutional offices and retained both of the state's seats in the United States House of Representatives.

name: idaho
sentence: However, Democrats picked up several seats in the Idaho Legislature, notably in the Boise area.

name: idaho
sentence: Republicans lost one of the House seats in 2008 to Minnick, but Republican Jim Risch retained Larry Craig's Senatorte seat for the GOP by a comfortable margin.

name: idaho
sentence: Minnick lost his seat in the 2010 election to Republican State Rep. Raul Labrador.

name: idaho
sentence: In 2020, Idaho overwhelmingly voted for President Donald Trump.

name: idaho
sentence: Despite the view that Idaho's bigger cities are "blue islands in a sea of red", as several articles have put it; that was not the case in 2020.

name: idaho
sentence: Only 3 Idaho counties went blue, and those were Latah, Blaine, and Teton counties, respectively.

name: idaho
sentence: Every Republican candidate running won their respective race and Idaho residents voted overwhelmingly to retain Republican judges.

name: idaho
sentence: Additionally, ballot measures leaned towards the right.

name: idaho
sentence: Medical/recreational marijuana and a crime bill to give victims more rights were absent from the ballot.

name: idaho
sentence: Former Vice President, Joe Biden, received roughly 33.6 percent of the votes, which was slightly lower than what was received by former president, Barack Obama.

name: idaho
sentence: As of January 2020, the State of Idaho contains 105 school districts and 62 charter schools.

name: idaho
sentence: The school districts range in enrollment from two to 39,507 students.

name: idaho
sentence: Idaho school districts are governed by elected school boards, which are elected in November of odd-numbered years, except for the Boise School District, whose elections are held in September.

name: idaho
sentence: The Idaho State Board of Education oversees three comprehensive universities.

name: idaho
sentence: The University of Idaho in Moscow was the first university in the state (founded in 1889).

name: idaho
sentence: It opened its doors in 1892 and is the land-grant institution and primary research university of the state.

name: idaho
sentence: Idaho State University in Pocatello opened in 1901 as the Academy of Idaho, attained four-year status in 1947 and university status in 1963.

name: idaho
sentence: Boise State University is the most recent school to attain university status in Idaho.

name: idaho
sentence: The school opened in 1932 as Boise Junior College and became Boise State University in 1974.

name: idaho
sentence: Lewis-Clark State College in Lewiston is the only public, non-university four-year college in Idaho.

name: idaho
sentence: It opened as a normal school in 1893.

name: idaho
sentence: Idaho has four regional community colleges: North Idaho College in Coeur d'Alene; College of Southern Idaho in Twin Falls; College of Western Idaho in Nampa, which opened in 2009, College of Eastern Idaho in Idaho Falls, which transitioned from a technical college in 2017.

name: idaho
sentence: Private institutions in Idaho are Boise Bible College, affiliated with congregations of the Christian churches and churches of Christ; Brigham Young University-Idaho in Rexburg, which is affiliated with The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints and a sister college to Brigham Young University; The College of Idaho in Caldwell, which still maintains a loose affiliation with the Presbyterian Church; Northwest Nazarene University in Nampa; and New Saint Andrews College in Moscow, of reformed Christian theological background.

name: idaho
sentence: McCall College is a non-affiliated two-year private college in McCall, which was founded in 2011 and later opened in 2013.

name: idaho
sentence: Central Idaho is home to one of North America's oldest ski resorts, Sun Valley, where the world's first chairlift was installed in 1936.

name: idaho
sentence: Other noted outdoor sites include Hells Canyon, the Salmon River, and its embarkation point of Riggins.

name: idaho
sentence: The Boise Open professional golf tournament has been played at Hillcrest Country Club since 1990 as part of the Web.com Tour.

name: idaho
sentence: High school sports are overseen by the Idaho High School Activities Association (IHSAA).

name: idaho
sentence: In 2016, Meridian's Michael Slagowski ran 800 meters in 1:48.70.

name: idaho
sentence: That is one of the 35 fastest 800-meter times ever run by a high school boy in the United States.

name: idaho
sentence: Weeks later, he would become only the ninth high school boy to complete a mile in under four minutes, running 3:59.53.

name: idaho
sentence: Judy Garland performed the elaborate song-and-dance routine "Born in a Trunk in the Princess Theater in Pocatello, Idaho" in the 1954 version of the film A Star is Born.

name: idaho
sentence: The 1985 film Pale Rider was primarily filmed in the Boulder Mountains and the Sawtooth National Recreation Area in central Idaho, just north of Sun Valley.

name: idaho
sentence: The 1988 film Moving, starring Richard Pryor, has the main character take a promotion in Idaho.

name: idaho
sentence: River Phoenix and Keanu Reeves starred in the 1991 movie My Own Private Idaho, portions of which take place in Idaho.

name: idaho
sentence: The 2004 cult film Napoleon Dynamite takes place in Preston, Idaho; the film's director, Jared Hess, attended Preston High School.

name: illinois
sentence: Illinois ( (listen) IL-ə-NOY) is a state in the Midwestern and Great Lakes regions of the United States.

name: illinois
sentence: It has the fifth largest gross domestic product (GDP),the sixth largest population, and the 25th largest land area of all US states.

name: illinois
sentence: Illinois has been noted as a microcosm of the entire United States.

name: illinois
sentence: With Chicago in northeastern Illinois, small industrial cities and immense agricultural productivity in the north and center of the state, and natural resources such as coal, timber, and petroleum in the south, Illinois has a diverse economic base, and is a major transportation hub.

name: illinois
sentence: The Port of Chicago connects the state to international ports via two main routes: from the Great Lakes, via the Saint Lawrence Seaway, to the Atlantic Ocean and from the Great Lakes to the Mississippi River, via the Illinois River, through the Illinois Waterway.

name: illinois
sentence: The Mississippi River, the Ohio River, and the Wabash River form parts of the boundaries of Illinois.

name: illinois
sentence: For decades, Chicago's O'Hare International Airport has been ranked as one of the world's busiest airports.

name: illinois
sentence: Illinois has long had a reputation as a bellwether both in social and cultural terms and, through the 1980s, in politics.

name: illinois
sentence: The capital of Illinois is Springfield, which is located in the central part of the state.

name: illinois
sentence: Although today Illinois's largest population center is in its northeast, the state's European population grew first in the west as the French settled lands near the Mississippi River, when the region was known as Illinois Country and was part of New France.

name: illinois
sentence: Following the American Revolutionary War, American settlers began arriving from Kentucky in the 1780s via the Ohio River, and the population grew from south to north.

name: illinois
sentence: In 1818, Illinois achieved statehood.

name: illinois
sentence: Following increased commercial activity in the Great Lakes after the construction of the Erie Canal, Chicago was incorporated in the 1830s on the banks of the Chicago River at one of the few natural harbors on the southern section of Lake Michigan.

name: illinois
sentence: John Deere's invention of the self-scouring steel plow turned Illinois's rich prairie into some of the world's most productive and valuable farmland, attracting immigrant farmers from Germany and Sweden.

name: illinois
sentence: The Illinois and Michigan Canal (1848) made transportation between the Great Lakes and the Mississippi River valley faster and cheaper, and new railroads carried immigrants to new homes in the country's west and shipped commodity crops to the nation's east.

name: illinois
sentence: The state became a transportation hub for the nation.

name: illinois
sentence: By 1900, the growth of industrial jobs in the northern cities and coal mining in the central and southern areas attracted immigrants from Eastern and Southern Europe.

name: illinois
sentence: Illinois was an important manufacturing center during both world wars.

name: illinois
sentence: The Great Migration from the South established a large community of African Americans in the state, including Chicago, who founded the city's famous jazz and blues cultures.

name: illinois
sentence: Chicago, the center of the Chicago Metropolitan Area, is now recognized as a global city.

name: illinois
sentence: Chicagoland, Chicago's metropolitan area, encompasses about 65% of the state's population.

name: illinois
sentence: The most populous metropolitan areas outside the Chicago area include, Metro East (of Greater St. Louis), Peoria and Rockford.

name: illinois
sentence: Three US presidents have been elected while living in Illinois: Abraham Lincoln, Ulysses S. Grant, and Barack Obama.

name: illinois
sentence: Additionally, Ronald Reagan, whose political career was based in California, was born and raised in the state.

name: illinois
sentence: Today, Illinois honors Lincoln with its official state slogan Land of Lincoln, which has been displayed on its license plates since 1954.

name: illinois
sentence: The state is the site of the Abraham Lincoln Presidential Library and Museum in Springfield and the future home of the Barack Obama Presidential Center in Chicago.

name: illinois
sentence: "Illinois" is the modern spelling for the early French Catholic missionaries and explorers' name for the Illinois Native Americans, a name that was spelled in many different ways in the early records.

name: illinois
sentence: American scholars previously thought the name "Illinois" meant "man" or "men" in the Miami-Illinois language, with the original iliniwek transformed via French into Illinois.

name: illinois
sentence: This etymology is not supported by the Illinois language, as the word for "man" is ireniwa, and plural of "man" is ireniwaki.

name: illinois
sentence: The name Illiniwek has also been said to mean "tribe of superior men", which is a false etymology.

name: illinois
sentence: The name "Illinois" derives from the Miami-Illinois verb irenwe·wa—"he speaks the regular way".

name: illinois
sentence: This was taken into the Ojibwe language, perhaps in the Ottawa dialect, and modified into ilinwe· (pluralized as ilinwe·k).

name: illinois
sentence: The French borrowed these forms, spelling the /we/ ending as -ois, a transliteration of that sound in the French of that time.

name: illinois
sentence: The current spelling form, Illinois, began to appear in the early 1670s, when French colonists had settled in the western area.

name: illinois
sentence: The Illinois's name for themselves, as attested in all three of the French missionary-period dictionaries of Illinois, was Inoka, of unknown meaning and unrelated to the other terms.

name: illinois
sentence: During the early part of the Paleozoic Era, the area that would one day become Illinois was submerged beneath a shallow sea and located near the Equator.

name: illinois
sentence: Diverse marine life lived at this time, including trilobites, brachiopods, and crinoids.

name: illinois
sentence: Changing environmental conditions led to the formation of large coal swamps in the Carboniferous.

name: illinois
sentence: Illinois was above sea level for at least part of the Mesozoic, but by its end was again submerged by the Western Interior Seaway.

name: illinois
sentence: This receded by the Eocene Epoch.

name: illinois
sentence: During the Pleistocene Epoch, vast ice sheets covered much of Illinois, with only the Driftless Area remaining exposed.

name: illinois
sentence: These glaciers carved the basin of Lake Michigan and left behind traces of ancient glacial lakes and moraines.

name: illinois
sentence: American Indians of successive cultures lived along the waterways of the Illinois area for thousands of years before the arrival of Europeans.

name: illinois
sentence: The Koster Site has been excavated and demonstrates 7,000 years of continuous habitation.

name: illinois
sentence: Cahokia, the largest regional chiefdom and Urban Center of the Pre-Columbian Mississippian culture, was located near present-day Collinsville, Illinois.

name: illinois
sentence: They built an urban complex of more than 100 platform and burial mounds, a 50-acre (20 ha) plaza larger than 35 football fields, and a woodhenge of sacred cedar, all in a planned design expressing the culture's cosmology.

name: illinois
sentence: Monks Mound, the center of the site, is the largest Pre-Columbian structure north of the Valley of Mexico.

name: illinois
sentence: It is 100 feet (30 m) high, 951 feet (290 m) long, 836 feet (255 m) wide, and covers 13.8 acres (5.6 ha).

name: illinois
sentence: It contains about 814,000 cubic yards (622,000 m3) of earth.

name: illinois
sentence: It was topped by a structure thought to have measured about 105 feet (32 m) in length and 48 feet (15 m) in width, covered an area 5,000 square feet (460 m2), and been as much as 50 feet (15 m) high, making its peak 150 feet (46 m) above the level of the plaza.

name: illinois
sentence: The finely crafted ornaments and tools recovered by archaeologists at Cahokia include elaborate ceramics, finely sculptured stonework, carefully embossed and engraved copper and mica sheets, and one funeral blanket for an important chief fashioned from 20,000 shell beads.

name: illinois
sentence: These artifacts indicate that Cahokia was truly an urban center, with clustered housing, markets, and specialists in toolmaking, hide dressing, potting, jewelry making, shell engraving, weaving and salt making.

name: illinois
sentence: The civilization vanished in the 15th century for unknown reasons, but historians and archeologists have speculated that the people depleted the area of resources.

name: illinois
sentence: Many indigenous tribes engaged in constant warfare.

name: illinois
sentence: According to Suzanne Austin Alchon, "At one site in the central Illinois River valley, one third of all adults died as a result of violent injuries."

name: illinois
sentence: The next major power in the region was the Illinois Confederation or Illini, a political alliance.

name: illinois
sentence: As the Illini declined during the Beaver Wars era, members of the Algonquian-speaking Potawatomi, Miami, Sauk, and other tribes including the Fox (Mesquakie), Ioway, Kickapoo, Mascouten, Piankashaw, Shawnee, Wea, and Winnebago (Ho-Chunk) came into the area from the east and north around the Great Lakes.

name: illinois
sentence: French explorers Jacques Marquette and Louis Jolliet explored the Illinois River in 1673.

name: illinois
sentence: Marquette soon after founded a mission at the Grand Village of the Illinois in Illinois Country.

name: illinois
sentence: In 1680, French explorers under René-Robert Cavelier, Sieur de La Salle and Henri de Tonti constructed a fort at the site of present-day Peoria, and in 1682, a fort atop Starved Rock in today's Starved Rock State Park.

name: illinois
sentence: French Empire Canadiens came south to settle particularly along the Mississippi River, and Illinois was part of first New France, and then of La Louisiane until 1763, when it passed to the British with their defeat of France in the Seven Years' War.

name: illinois
sentence: The small French settlements continued, although many French migrated west to Ste.

name: illinois
sentence: Genevieve and St. Louis, Missouri, to evade British rule.

name: illinois
sentence: A few British soldiers were posted in Illinois, but few British or American settlers moved there, as the Crown made it part of the territory reserved for Indians west of the Appalachians, and then part of the British Province of Quebec.

name: illinois
sentence: In 1778, George Rogers Clark claimed Illinois County for Virginia.

name: illinois
sentence: In a compromise, Virginia (and other states that made various claims) ceded the area to the new United States in the 1780s and it became part of the Northwest Territory, administered by the federal government and later organized as states.

name: illinois
sentence: The Illinois-Wabash Company was an early claimant to much of Illinois.

name: illinois
sentence: The Illinois Territory was created on February 3, 1809, with its capital at Kaskaskia, an early French settlement.

name: illinois
sentence: During the discussions leading up to Illinois's admission to the Union, the proposed northern boundary of the state was moved twice.

name: illinois
sentence: The original provisions of the Northwest Ordinance had specified a boundary that would have been tangent to the southern tip of Lake Michigan.

name: illinois
sentence: Such a boundary would have left Illinois with no shoreline on Lake Michigan at all.

name: illinois
sentence: However, as Indiana had successfully been granted a 10-mile (16 km) northern extension of its boundary to provide it with a usable lakefront, the original bill for Illinois statehood, submitted to Congress on January 23, 1818, stipulated a northern border at the same latitude as Indiana's, which is defined as 10 miles north of the southernmost extremity of Lake Michigan.

name: illinois
sentence: However, the Illinois delegate, Nathaniel Pope, wanted more, and lobbied to have the boundary moved further north.

name: illinois
sentence: The final bill passed by Congress included an amendment to shift the border to 42° 30' north, which is approximately 51 miles (82 km) north of the Indiana northern border.

name: illinois
sentence: This shift added 8,500 square miles (22,000 km2) to the state, including the lead mining region near Galena.

name: illinois
sentence: More importantly, it added nearly 50 miles of Lake Michigan shoreline and the Chicago River.

name: illinois
sentence: Pope and others envisioned a canal that would connect the Chicago and Illinois rivers and thus connect the Great Lakes to the Mississippi.

name: illinois
sentence: In 1818, Illinois became the 21st US state.

name: illinois
sentence: The capital remained at Kaskaskia, headquartered in a small building rented by the state.

name: illinois
sentence: In 1819, Vandalia became the capital, and over the next 18 years, three separate buildings were built to serve successively as the capitol building.

name: illinois
sentence: In 1837, the state legislators representing Sangamon County, under the leadership of state representative Abraham Lincoln, succeeded in having the capital moved to Springfield, where a fifth capitol building was constructed.

name: illinois
sentence: A sixth capitol building was erected in 1867, which continues to serve as the Illinois capitol today.

name: illinois
sentence: Though it was ostensibly a "free state", there was nonetheless slavery in Illinois.

name: illinois
sentence: The ethnic French had owned black slaves since the 1720s, and American settlers had already brought slaves into the area from Kentucky.

name: illinois
sentence: Slavery was nominally banned by the Northwest Ordinance, but that was not enforced for those already holding slaves.

name: illinois
sentence: When Illinois became a sovereign state in 1818, the Ordinance no longer applied, and about 900 slaves were held in the state.

name: illinois
sentence: As the southern part of the state, later known as "Egypt" or "Little Egypt", was largely settled by migrants from the South, the section was hostile to free blacks.

name: illinois
sentence: Settlers were allowed to bring slaves with them for labor, but, in 1822, state residents voted against making slavery legal.

name: illinois
sentence: Still, most residents opposed allowing free blacks as permanent residents.

name: illinois
sentence: Some settlers brought in slaves seasonally or as house servants.

name: illinois
sentence: The Illinois Constitution of 1848 was written with a provision for exclusionary laws to be passed.

name: illinois
sentence: In 1853, John A. Logan helped pass a law to prohibit all African Americans, including freedmen, from settling in the state.

name: illinois
sentence: The winter of 1830–1831 is called the "Winter of the Deep Snow"; a sudden, deep snowfall blanketed the state, making travel impossible for the rest of the winter, and many travelers perished.

name: illinois
sentence: Several severe winters followed, including the "Winter of the Sudden Freeze".

name: illinois
sentence: On December 20, 1836, a fast-moving cold front passed through, freezing puddles in minutes and killing many travelers who could not reach shelter.

name: illinois
sentence: The adverse weather resulted in crop failures in the northern part of the state.

name: illinois
sentence: The southern part of the state shipped food north, and this may have contributed to its name: "Little Egypt", after the Biblical story of Joseph in Egypt supplying grain to his brothers.

name: illinois
sentence: In 1832, the Black Hawk War was fought in Illinois and present-day Wisconsin between the United States and the Sauk, Fox (Meskwaki), and Kickapoo Indian tribes.

name: illinois
sentence: It represents the end of Indian resistance to white settlement in the Chicago region.

name: illinois
sentence: The Indians had been forced to leave their homes and move to Iowa in 1831; when they attempted to return, they were attacked and eventually defeated by US militia.

name: illinois
sentence: The survivors were forced back to Iowa.

name: illinois
sentence: By 1839, the Latter Day Saints had founded a utopian city called Nauvoo.

name: illinois
sentence: Located in Hancock County along the Mississippi River, Nauvoo flourished, and soon rivaled Chicago for the position of the state's largest city.

name: illinois
sentence: But in 1844, the Latter Day Saint movement founder Joseph Smith was killed in the Carthage Jail, about 30 miles away from Nauvoo.

name: illinois
sentence: Following a succession crisis (Latter Day Saints), Brigham Young led most Latter Day Saints out of Illinois in a mass exodus to present-day Utah; after close to six years of rapid development, Nauvoo rapidly declined afterward.

name: illinois
sentence: After it was established in 1833, Chicago gained prominence as a Great Lakes port, and then as an Illinois and Michigan Canal port after 1848, and as a rail hub soon afterward.

name: illinois
sentence: By 1857, Chicago was Illinois's largest city.

name: illinois
sentence: With the tremendous growth of mines and factories in the state in the 19th century, Illinois was the ground for the formation of labor unions in the United States.

name: illinois
sentence: In 1847, after lobbying by Dorothea L. Dix, Illinois became one of the first states to establish a system of state-supported treatment of mental illness and disabilities, replacing local almshouses.

name: illinois
sentence: Dix came into this effort after having met J. O.

name: illinois
sentence: King, a Jacksonville, Illinois businessman, who invited her to Illinois, where he had been working to build an asylum for the insane.

name: illinois
sentence: With the lobbying expertise of Dix, plans for the Jacksonville State Hospital (now known as the Jacksonville Developmental Center) were signed into law on March 1, 1847.

name: illinois
sentence: During the American Civil War, Illinois ranked fourth in men who served (more than 250,000) in the Union Army, a figure surpassed by only New York, Pennsylvania, and Ohio.

name: illinois
sentence: Beginning with President Abraham Lincoln's first call for troops and continuing throughout the war, Illinois mustered 150 infantry regiments, which were numbered from the 7th to the 156th regiments.

name: illinois
sentence: Seventeen cavalry regiments were also gathered, as well as two light artillery regiments.

name: illinois
sentence: The town of Cairo, at the southern tip of the state at the confluence of the Mississippi and Ohio Rivers, served as a strategically important supply base and training center for the Union army.

name: illinois
sentence: For several months, both General Grant and Admiral Foote had headquarters in Cairo.

name: illinois
sentence: During the Civil War, and more so afterwards, Chicago's population skyrocketed, which increased its prominence.

name: illinois
sentence: The Pullman Strike and Haymarket Riot, in particular, greatly influenced the development of the American labor movement.

name: illinois
sentence: From Sunday, October 8, 1871, until Tuesday, October 10, 1871, the Great Chicago Fire burned in downtown Chicago, destroying four square miles (10 km2).

name: illinois
sentence: At the turn of the 20th century, Illinois had a population of nearly 5 million.

name: illinois
sentence: Many people from other parts of the country were attracted to the state by employment caused by the expanding industrial base.

name: illinois
sentence: Whites were 98% of the state's population.

name: illinois
sentence: Bolstered by continued immigration from southern and eastern Europe, and by the African-American Great Migration from the South, Illinois grew and emerged as one of the most important states in the union.

name: illinois
sentence: By the end of the century, the population had reached 12.4 million.

name: illinois
sentence: The Century of Progress World's fair was held at Chicago in 1933.

name: illinois
sentence: Oil strikes in Marion County and Crawford County led to a boom in 1937, and by 1939, Illinois ranked fourth in US oil production.

name: illinois
sentence: Illinois manufactured 6.1 percent of total United States military armaments produced during World War II, ranking seventh among the 48 states.

name: illinois
sentence: Chicago became an ocean port with the opening of the Saint Lawrence Seaway in 1959.

name: illinois
sentence: The seaway and the Illinois Waterway connected Chicago to both the Mississippi River and the Atlantic Ocean.

name: illinois
sentence: In 1960, Ray Kroc opened the first McDonald's franchise in Des Plaines (which still exists as a museum, with a working McDonald's across the street).

name: illinois
sentence: Illinois had a prominent role in the emergence of the nuclear age.

name: illinois
sentence: In 1942, as part of the Manhattan Project, the University of Chicago conducted the first sustained nuclear chain reaction.

name: illinois
sentence: In 1957, Argonne National Laboratory, near Chicago, activated the first experimental nuclear power generating system in the United States.

name: illinois
sentence: By 1960, the first privately financed nuclear plant in the United States, Dresden 1, was dedicated near Morris.

name: illinois
sentence: In 1967, Fermilab, a national nuclear research facility near Batavia, opened a particle accelerator, which was the world's largest for over 40 years.

name: illinois
sentence: With eleven plants currently operating, Illinois leads all states in the amount of electricity generated from nuclear power.

name: illinois
sentence: In 1961, Illinois became the first state in the nation to adopt the recommendation of the American Law Institute and pass a comprehensive criminal code revision that repealed the law against sodomy.

name: illinois
sentence: The code also abrogated common law crimes and established an age of consent of 18.

name: illinois
sentence: The state's fourth constitution was adopted in 1970, replacing the 1870 document.

name: illinois
sentence: The first Farm Aid concert was held in Champaign to benefit American farmers, in 1985.

name: illinois
sentence: The worst upper Mississippi River flood of the century, the Great Flood of 1993, inundated many towns and thousands of acres of farmland.

name: illinois
sentence: On August 28, 2017, Illinois Governor Bruce Rauner signed a bill into law that prohibited state and local police from arresting anyone solely due to their immigration status or due to federal detainers.

name: illinois
sentence: Some fellow Republicans criticized Rauner for his action, claiming the bill made Illinois a sanctuary state.

name: illinois
sentence: Illinois is located in the Midwest region of the United States and is one of the eight states and Ontario, Canada, in the Great Lakes region of North America.

name: illinois
sentence: Illinois's eastern border with Indiana consists of a north–south line at 87° 31′ 30″ west longitude in Lake Michigan at the north, to the Wabash River in the south above Post Vincennes.

name: illinois
sentence: The Wabash River continues as the eastern/southeastern border with Indiana until the Wabash enters the Ohio River.

name: illinois
sentence: This marks the beginning of Illinois's southern border with Kentucky, which runs along the northern shoreline of the Ohio River.

name: illinois
sentence: Most of the western border with Missouri and Iowa is the Mississippi River; Kaskaskia is an exclave of Illinois, lying west of the Mississippi and reachable only from Missouri.

name: illinois
sentence: The state's northern border with Wisconsin is fixed at 42° 30′ north latitude.

name: illinois
sentence: The northeastern border of Illinois lies in Lake Michigan, within which Illinois shares a water boundary with the state of Michigan, as well as Wisconsin and Indiana.

name: illinois
sentence: Though Illinois lies entirely in the Interior Plains, it does have some minor variation in its elevation.

name: illinois
sentence: In extreme northwestern Illinois, the Driftless Area, a region of unglaciated and therefore higher and more rugged topography, occupies a small part of the state.

name: illinois
sentence: Southern Illinois includes the hilly areas around the Shawnee National Forest.

name: illinois
sentence: Charles Mound, located in the Driftless region, has the state's highest natural elevation above sea level at 1,235 feet (376 m).

name: illinois
sentence: Other highlands include the Shawnee Hills in the south, and there is varying topography along its rivers; the Illinois River bisects the state northeast to southwest.

name: illinois
sentence: The floodplain on the Mississippi River from Alton to the Kaskaskia River is known as the American Bottom.

name: illinois
sentence: Illinois has three major geographical divisions.

name: illinois
sentence: Northern Illinois is dominated by Chicago metropolitan area, or Chicagoland, which is the city of Chicago and its suburbs, and the adjoining exurban area into which the metropolis is expanding.

name: illinois
sentence: As defined by the federal government, the Chicago metro area includes several counties in Illinois, Indiana, and Wisconsin, and has a population of over 9.8 million.

name: illinois
sentence: Chicago itself is a cosmopolitan city, densely populated, industrialized, the transportation hub of the nation, and settled by a wide variety of ethnic groups.

name: illinois
sentence: The city of Rockford, Illinois's third-largest city and center of the state's fourth largest metropolitan area, sits along Interstates 39 and 90 some 75 miles (121 km) northwest of Chicago.

name: illinois
sentence: The Quad Cities region, located along the Mississippi River in northern Illinois, had a population of 381,342 in 2011.

name: illinois
sentence: The midsection of Illinois is the second major division, called Central Illinois.

name: illinois
sentence: It is an area of mainly prairie and known as the Heart of Illinois.

name: illinois
sentence: It is characterized by small towns and medium–small cities.

name: illinois
sentence: The western section (west of the Illinois River) was originally part of the Military Tract of 1812 and forms the conspicuous western bulge of the state.

name: illinois
sentence: Agriculture, particularly corn and soybeans, as well as educational institutions and manufacturing centers, figure prominently in Central Illinois.

name: illinois
sentence: Cities include Peoria; Springfield, the state capital; Quincy; Decatur; Bloomington-Normal; and Champaign-Urbana.

name: illinois
sentence: The third division is Southern Illinois, comprising the area south of US Route 50, including Little Egypt, near the juncture of the Mississippi River and Ohio River.

name: illinois
sentence: Southern Illinois is the site of the ancient city of Cahokia, as well as the site of the first state capital at Kaskaskia, which today is separated from the rest of the state by the Mississippi River.

name: illinois
sentence: This region has a somewhat warmer winter climate, different variety of crops (including some cotton farming in the past), more rugged topography (due to the area remaining unglaciated during the Illinoian Stage, unlike most of the rest of the state), as well as small-scale oil deposits and coal mining.

name: illinois
sentence: The Illinois suburbs of St. Louis, such as East St. Louis, are located in this region, and collectively, they are known as the Metro-East.

name: illinois
sentence: The other somewhat significant concentration of population in Southern Illinois is the Carbondale-Marion-Herrin, Illinois Combined Statistical Area centered on Carbondale and Marion, a two-county area that is home to 123,272 residents.

name: illinois
sentence: A portion of southeastern Illinois is part of the extended Evansville, Indiana, Metro Area, locally referred to as the Tri-State with Indiana and Kentucky.

name: illinois
sentence: Seven Illinois counties are in the area.

name: illinois
sentence: In addition to these three, largely latitudinally defined divisions, all of the region outside the Chicago Metropolitan area is often called "downstate" Illinois.

name: illinois
sentence: This term is flexible, but is generally meant to mean everything outside the influence of the Chicago area.

name: illinois
sentence: Thus, some cities in Northern Illinois, such as DeKalb, which is west of Chicago, and Rockford—which is actually north of Chicago—are sometimes incorrectly considered to be 'downstate'.

name: illinois
sentence: Illinois has a climate that varies widely throughout the year.

name: illinois
sentence: Because of its nearly 400-mile distance between its northernmost and southernmost extremes, as well as its mid-continental situation, most of Illinois has a humid continental climate (Köppen climate classification Dfa), with hot, humid summers and cold winters.

name: illinois
sentence: The southern part of the state, from about Carbondale southward, has a humid subtropical climate (Koppen Cfa), with more moderate winters.

name: illinois
sentence: Average yearly precipitation for Illinois varies from just over 48 inches (1,219 mm) at the southern tip to around 35 inches (889 mm) in the northern portion of the state.

name: illinois
sentence: Normal annual snowfall exceeds 38 inches (965 mm) in the Chicago area, while the southern portion of the state normally receives less than 14 inches (356 mm).

name: illinois
sentence: The all-time high temperature was 117 °F (47 °C), recorded on July 14, 1954, at East St. Louis, and the all-time low temperature was −38 °F (−39 °C), recorded on January 31, 2019, during the January 2019 North American cold wave at a weather station near Mount Carroll, and confirmed on March 5, 2019.

name: illinois
sentence: This followed the previous record of −36 °F (−38 °C) recorded on January 5, 1999, near Congerville.

name: illinois
sentence: Prior to the Mount Carroll record, a temperature of −37 °F (−38 °C) was recorded on January 15, 2009, at Rochelle, but at a weather station not subjected to the same quality control as official records.

name: illinois
sentence: Illinois averages approximately 51 days of thunderstorm activity a year, which ranks somewhat above average in the number of thunderstorm days for the United States.

name: illinois
sentence: Illinois is vulnerable to tornadoes, with an average of 35 occurring annually, which puts much of the state at around five tornadoes per 10,000 square miles (30,000 km2) annually.

name: illinois
sentence: While tornadoes are no more powerful in Illinois than other states, some of Tornado Alley's deadliest tornadoes on record have occurred in the state.

name: illinois
sentence: The Tri-State Tornado of 1925 killed 695 people in three states

name: illinois
sentence: The United States Census Bureau estimates that the population of Illinois was 12,671,821 in 2019, moving from the fifth-largest state to the sixth-largest state (losing out to Pennsylvania).

name: illinois
sentence: Illinois's population declined by 69,259 people from July 2018 to July 2019, making it the worst decline of any state in the US in raw terms.

name: illinois
sentence: This includes a natural increase since the last census of 462,146 people (i.e., 1,438,187 births minus 976,041 deaths) and an decrease due to net migration of 622,928 people.

name: illinois
sentence: Immigration resulted in a net increase of 242,945 people, and migration from within the US resulted in a net decrease of 865,873 people.

name: illinois
sentence: Illinois is the most populous state in the Midwest region.

name: illinois
sentence: Chicago, the third-most populous city in the United States, is the center of the Chicago metropolitan area or Chicagoland, as this area is nicknamed.

name: illinois
sentence: Although Chicagoland comprises only 9% of the land area of the state, it contains 65% of the state's residents.

name: illinois
sentence: According to the 2010 Census, the racial composition of the state was:

name: illinois
sentence: In the same year 15.8% of the total population was of Hispanic or Latino origin (they may be of any race).

name: illinois
sentence: According to 2018 US Census Bureau estimates, Illinois's population was 71.7% White (60.9% Non-Hispanic White), 5.6% Asian, 5.6% Some Other Race, 14.1% Black or African American, 0.3% Native Americans and Alaskan Native, 0.1% Pacific Islander and 2.7% from two or more races.

name: illinois
sentence: The White population continues to remain the largest racial category in Illinois as Hispanics primarily identify as White (62.2%) with others identifying as Some Other Race (31.2%), Multiracial (3.9%), Black (1.5%), American Indian and Alaskan Native (0.8%), Asian (0.3%), and Hawaiian and Pacific Islander (0.1%).

name: illinois
sentence: By ethnicity, 17.3% of the total population is Hispanic-Latino (of any race) and 82.7% is Non-Hispanic (of any race).

name: illinois
sentence: If treated as a separate category, Hispanics are the largest minority group in Illinois.

name: illinois
sentence: The state's most populous ethnic group, non-Hispanic white, has declined from 83.5% in 1970 to 60.90% in 2018.

name: illinois
sentence: As of 2011, 49.4% of Illinois's population younger than age 1 were minorities (Note: Children born to white Hispanics or to a sole full or partial minority parent are counted as minorities).

name: illinois
sentence: At the 2007 estimates from the US Census Bureau, there were 1,768,518 foreign-born inhabitants of the state or 13.8% of the population, with 48.4% from Latin America, 24.6% from Asia, 22.8% from Europe, 2.9% from Africa, 1.2% from Canada, and 0.2% from Oceania.

name: illinois
sentence: Of the foreign-born population, 43.7% were naturalized US citizens, and 56.3% were not US citizens.

name: illinois
sentence: In 2007, 6.9% of Illinois's population was reported as being under age 5, 24.9% under age 18 and 12.1% were age 65 and over.

name: illinois
sentence: Females made up approximately 50.7% of the population.

name: illinois
sentence: According to the 2007 estimates, 21.1% of the population had German ancestry, 13.3% had Irish ancestry, 8% had British ancestry, 7.9% had Polish ancestry, 6.4% had Italian ancestry, 4.6% listed themselves as American, 2.4% had Swedish ancestry, 2.2% had French ancestry, other than Basque, 1.6% had Dutch ancestry, and 1.4% had Norwegian ancestry.

name: illinois
sentence: Illinois also has large numbers of African Americans and Latinos (mostly Mexicans and Puerto Ricans).

name: illinois
sentence: Chicago, along the shores of Lake Michigan, is the nation's third largest city.

name: illinois
sentence: In 2000, 23.3% of Illinois's population lived in the city of Chicago, 43.3% in Cook County, and 65.6% in the counties of the Chicago metropolitan area: Will, DuPage, Kane, Lake, and McHenry counties, as well as Cook County.

name: illinois
sentence: The remaining population lives in the smaller cities and rural areas that dot the state's plains.

name: illinois
sentence: As of 2000, the state's center of population was at 41.278216°N 88.380238°W﻿ / 41.278216; -88.380238, located in Grundy County, northeast of the village of Mazon.

name: illinois
sentence: Births do not add up, because Hispanics are counted both by ethnicity and by race.

name: illinois
sentence: Chicago is the largest city in the state and the third-most populous city in the United States, with its 2010 population of 2,695,598.

name: illinois
sentence: The US Census Bureau currently lists seven other cities with populations of over 100,000 within Illinois.

name: illinois
sentence: Based upon the Census Bureau's official 2010 population: Aurora, a Chicago satellite town that eclipsed Rockford for the title of second-most populous city in Illinois; its 2010 population was 197,899.

name: illinois
sentence: Rockford, at 152,871, is the third-largest city in the state, and is the largest city in the state not located within the Chicago suburbs.

name: illinois
sentence: Joliet, located in metropolitan Chicago, is the fourth-largest city in the state, with a population of 147,433.

name: illinois
sentence: Naperville, a suburb of Chicago, is fifth with 141,853.

name: illinois
sentence: Naperville and Aurora share a boundary along Illinois Route 59.

name: illinois
sentence: Springfield, the state's capital, comes in as sixth-most populous with 117,352 residents.

name: illinois
sentence: Peoria, which decades ago was the second-most populous city in the state, is seventh with 115,007.

name: illinois
sentence: The eighth-largest and final city in the 100,000 club is Elgin, a northwest suburb of Chicago, with a 2010 population of 108,188.

name: illinois
sentence: The most populated city in the state south of Springfield is Belleville, with 44,478 people at the 2010 census.

name: illinois
sentence: It is located in the Illinois portion of Greater St. Louis (often called the Metro-East area), which has a rapidly growing population of over 700,000.

name: illinois
sentence: Other major urban areas include the Champaign-Urbana Metropolitan Area, which has a combined population of almost 230,000 people, the Illinois portion of the Quad Cities area with about 215,000 people, and the Bloomington-Normal area with a combined population of over 165,000.

name: illinois
sentence: The official language of Illinois is English, although between 1923 and 1969, state law gave official status to "the American language".

name: illinois
sentence: Nearly 80% of people in Illinois speak English natively, and most of the rest speak it fluently as a second language.

name: illinois
sentence: A number of dialects of American English are spoken, ranging from Inland Northern American English and African-American English around Chicago, to Midland American English in Central Illinois, to Southern American English in the far south.

name: illinois
sentence: Over 20% of Illinoians speak a language other than English at home, of which Spanish is by far the most widespread, at more than 12% of the total population.

name: illinois
sentence: A sizeable number of Polish speakers is present in the Chicago Metropolitan Area.

name: illinois
sentence: Illinois Country French has mostly gone extinct in Illinois, although it is still celebrated in the French Colonial Historic District.

name: illinois
sentence: Roman Catholics constitute the single largest religious denomination in Illinois; they are heavily concentrated in and around Chicago, and account for nearly 30% of the state's population.

name: illinois
sentence: However, taken together as a group, the various Protestant denominations comprise a greater percentage of the state's population than do Catholics.

name: illinois
sentence: In 2010 Catholics in Illinois numbered 3,648,907.

name: illinois
sentence: The largest Protestant denominations were the United Methodist Church with 314,461, and the Southern Baptist Convention, with 283,519 members.

name: illinois
sentence: Illinois has one of the largest concentrations of Missouri Synod Lutherans in the United States.

name: illinois
sentence: Illinois played an important role in the early Latter Day Saint movement, with Nauvoo, Illinois, becoming a gathering place for Mormons in the early 1840s.

name: illinois
sentence: Nauvoo was the location of the succession crisis, which led to the separation of the Mormon movement into several Latter Day Saint sects.

name: illinois
sentence: The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints, the largest of the sects to emerge from the Mormon schism, has more than 55,000 adherents in Illinois today.

name: illinois
sentence: A significant number of adherents of other Abrahamic faiths can be found in Illinois.

name: illinois
sentence: Largely concentrated in the Chicago metropolitan area, followers of the Muslim, Baháʼí, and Jewish religions all call the state home.

name: illinois
sentence: Muslims constituted the largest non-Christian group, with 359,264 adherents.

name: illinois
sentence: Illinois has the largest concentration of Muslims by state in the country, with 2,800 Muslims per 100,000 citizens.

name: illinois
sentence: The largest and oldest surviving Baháʼí House of Worship in the world is located in Wilmette, Illinois, The Chicago area has a very large Jewish community, particularly in the suburbs of Skokie, Buffalo Grove, Highland Park, and surrounding suburbs.

name: illinois
sentence: Former Chicago Mayor Rahm Emanuel is the Windy City's first Jewish mayor.

name: illinois
sentence: Chicago is also home to a very large population of Hindus, Sikhs, Jains, and Buddhists.

name: illinois
sentence: The Baháʼí House of Worship in Wilmette is the center of that religion's worship in North America.

name: illinois
sentence: The dollar gross state product for Illinois was estimated to be US$909 billion in 2019.

name: illinois
sentence: The state's 2019 per capita gross state product was estimated to be around $72,000.

name: illinois
sentence: As of February 2019, the unemployment rate in Illinois reached 4.2%.

name: illinois
sentence: Illinois's minimum wage will rise to $15 per hour by 2025, making it one of the highest in the nation.

name: illinois
sentence: Illinois's major agricultural outputs are corn, soybeans, hogs, cattle, dairy products, and wheat.

name: illinois
sentence: In most years, Illinois is either the first or second state for the highest production of soybeans, with a harvest of 427.7 million bushels (11.64 million metric tons) in 2008, after Iowa's production of 444.82 million bushels (12.11 million metric tons).

name: illinois
sentence: Illinois ranks second in US corn production with more than 1.5 billion bushels produced annually.

name: illinois
sentence: With a production capacity of 1.5 billion gallons per year, Illinois is a top producer of ethanol, ranking third in the United States in 2011.

name: illinois
sentence: Illinois is a leader in food manufacturing and meat processing.

name: illinois
sentence: Although Chicago may no longer be "Hog Butcher for the World", the Chicago area remains a global center for food manufacture and meat processing, with many plants, processing houses, and distribution facilities concentrated in the area of the former Union Stock Yards.

name: illinois
sentence: Illinois also produces wine, and the state is home to two American viticultural areas.

name: illinois
sentence: In the area of The Meeting of the Great Rivers Scenic Byway, peaches and apples are grown.

name: illinois
sentence: The German immigrants from agricultural backgrounds who settled in Illinois in the mid- to late 19th century are in part responsible for the profusion of fruit orchards in that area of Illinois.

name: illinois
sentence: Illinois's universities are actively researching alternative agricultural products as alternative crops.

name: illinois
sentence: Illinois is one of the nation's manufacturing leaders, boasting annual value added productivity by manufacturing of over $107 billion in 2006.

name: illinois
sentence: As of 2011, Illinois is ranked as the 4th-most productive manufacturing state in the country, behind California, Texas, and Ohio.

name: illinois
sentence: About three-quarters of the state's manufacturers are located in the Northeastern Opportunity Return Region, with 38 percent of Illinois's approximately 18,900 manufacturing plants located in Cook County.

name: illinois
sentence: As of 2006, the leading manufacturing industries in Illinois, based upon value-added, were chemical manufacturing ($18.3 billion), machinery manufacturing ($13.4 billion), food manufacturing ($12.9 billion), fabricated metal products ($11.5 billion), transportation equipment ($7.4 billion), plastics and rubber products ($7.0 billion), and computer and electronic products ($6.1 billion).

name: illinois
sentence: By the early 2000s, Illinois's economy had moved toward a dependence on high-value-added services, such as financial trading, higher education, law, logistics, and medicine.

name: illinois
sentence: In some cases, these services clustered around institutions that hearkened back to Illinois's earlier economies.

name: illinois
sentence: For example, the Chicago Mercantile Exchange, a trading exchange for global derivatives, had begun its life as an agricultural futures market.

name: illinois
sentence: Other important non-manufacturing industries include publishing, tourism, and energy production and distribution.

name: illinois
sentence: Venture capitalists funded a total of approximately $62 billion in the US economy in 2016.

name: illinois
sentence: Of this amount, Illinois-based companies received approximately $1.1 billion.

name: illinois
sentence: Similarly, in FY 2016, the federal government spent $461 billion on contracts in the US Of this amount, Illinois-based companies received approximately $8.7 billion.

name: illinois
sentence: Illinois is a net importer of fuels for energy, despite large coal resources and some minor oil production.

name: illinois
sentence: Illinois exports electricity, ranking fifth among states in electricity production and seventh in electricity consumption.

name: illinois
sentence: The coal industry of Illinois has its origins in the middle 19th century, when entrepreneurs such as Jacob Loose discovered coal in locations such as Sangamon County.

name: illinois
sentence: Jacob Bunn contributed to the development of the Illinois coal industry, and was a founder and owner of the Western Coal & Mining Company of Illinois.

name: illinois
sentence: About 68% of Illinois has coal-bearing strata of the Pennsylvanian geologic period.

name: illinois
sentence: According to the Illinois State Geological Survey, 211 billion tons of bituminous coal are estimated to lie under the surface, having a total heating value greater than the estimated oil deposits in the Arabian Peninsula.

name: illinois
sentence: However, this coal has a high sulfur content, which causes acid rain, unless special equipment is used to reduce sulfur dioxide emissions.

name: illinois
sentence: Many Illinois power plants are not equipped to burn high-sulfur coal.

name: illinois
sentence: In 1999, Illinois produced 40.4 million tons of coal, but only 17 million tons (42%) of Illinois coal was consumed in Illinois.

name: illinois
sentence: Most of the coal produced in Illinois is exported to other states and countries.

name: illinois
sentence: In 2008, Illinois exported three million tons of coal, and was projected to export nine million in 2011, as demand for energy grows in places such as China, India, and elsewhere in Asia and Europe.

name: illinois
sentence: As of 2010, Illinois was ranked third in recoverable coal reserves at producing mines in the nation.

name: illinois
sentence: Most of the coal produced in Illinois is exported to other states, while much of the coal burned for power in Illinois (21 million tons in 1998) is mined in the Powder River Basin of Wyoming.

name: illinois
sentence: Mattoon was recently chosen as the site for the Department of Energy's FutureGen project, a 275-megawatt experimental zero emission coal-burning power plant that the DOE just gave a second round of funding.

name: illinois
sentence: In 2010, after a number of setbacks, the city of Mattoon backed out of the project.

name: illinois
sentence: Illinois is a leading refiner of petroleum in the American Midwest, with a combined crude oil distillation capacity of nearly 900,000 barrels per day (140,000 m3/d).

name: illinois
sentence: However, Illinois has very limited crude oil proved reserves that account for less than 1% of the US total reserves.

name: illinois
sentence: Residential heating is 81% natural gas compared to less than 1% heating oil.

name: illinois
sentence: Illinois is ranked 14th in oil production among states, with a daily output of approximately 28,000 barrels (4,500 m3) in 2005.

name: illinois
sentence: Nuclear power arguably began in Illinois with the Chicago Pile-1, the world's first artificial self-sustaining nuclear chain reaction in the world's first nuclear reactor, built on the University of Chicago campus.

name: illinois
sentence: There are six operating nuclear power plants in Illinois: Braidwood, Byron, Clinton, Dresden, LaSalle, and Quad Cities.

name: illinois
sentence: With the exception of the single-unit Clinton plant, each of these facilities has two reactors.

name: illinois
sentence: Three reactors have been permanently shut down and are in various stages of decommissioning: Dresden-1 and Zion-1 and 2.

name: illinois
sentence: Illinois ranked first in the nation in 2010 in both nuclear capacity and nuclear generation.

name: illinois
sentence: Generation from its nuclear power plants accounted for 12 percent of the nation's total.

name: illinois
sentence: In 2007, 48% of Illinois's electricity was generated using nuclear power.

name: illinois
sentence: The Morris Operation is the only de facto high-level radioactive waste storage site in the United States.

name: illinois
sentence: Illinois has seen growing interest in the use of wind power for electrical generation.

name: illinois
sentence: Most of Illinois was rated in 2009 as "marginal or fair" for wind energy production by the US Department of Energy, with some western sections rated "good" and parts of the south rated "poor".

name: illinois
sentence: These ratings are for wind turbines with 50-meter (160 ft) hub heights; newer wind turbines are taller, enabling them to reach stronger winds farther from the ground.

name: illinois
sentence: As a result, more areas of Illinois have become prospective wind farm sites.

name: illinois
sentence: As of September 2009, Illinois had 1116.06 MW of installed wind power nameplate capacity with another 741.9 MW under construction.

name: illinois
sentence: Illinois ranked ninth among US states in installed wind power capacity, and sixteenth by potential capacity.

name: illinois
sentence: Large wind farms in Illinois include Twin Groves, Rail Splitter, EcoGrove, and Mendota Hills.

name: illinois
sentence: As of 2007, wind energy represented only 1.7% of Illinois's energy production, and it was estimated that wind power could provide 5–10% of the state's energy needs.

name: illinois
sentence: Also, the Illinois General Assembly mandated in 2007 that by 2025, 25% of all electricity generated in Illinois is to come from renewable resources.

name: illinois
sentence: Illinois is ranked second in corn production among US states, and Illinois corn is used to produce 40% of the ethanol consumed in the United States.

name: illinois
sentence: The Archer Daniels Midland corporation in Decatur, Illinois, is the world's leading producer of ethanol from corn.

name: illinois
sentence: The National Corn-to-Ethanol Research Center (NCERC), the world's only facility dedicated to researching the ways and means of converting corn (maize) to ethanol is located on the campus of Southern Illinois University Edwardsville.

name: illinois
sentence: University of Illinois at Urbana–Champaign is one of the partners in the Energy Biosciences Institute (EBI), a $500 million biofuels research project funded by petroleum giant BP.

name: illinois
sentence: Tax is collected by the Illinois Department of Revenue.

name: illinois
sentence: State income tax is calculated by multiplying net income by a flat rate.

name: illinois
sentence: In 1990, that rate was set at 3%, but in 2010, the General Assembly voted for a temporary increase in the rate to 5%; the new rate went into effect on January 1, 2011; the personal income rate partially sunset on January 1, 2015, to 3.75%, while the corporate income tax fell to 5.25%.

name: illinois
sentence: Illinois failed to pass a budget from 2015 to 2017, after the 736-day budget impasse, a budget was passed in Illinois after lawmakers overturned Governor Bruce Rauner's veto; this budget raised the personal income rate to 4.95% and the corporate rate to 7%.

name: illinois
sentence: There are two rates for state sales tax: 6.25% for general merchandise and 1% for qualifying food, drugs, and medical appliances.

name: illinois
sentence: The property tax is a major source of tax revenue for local government taxing districts.

name: illinois
sentence: The property tax is a local—not state—tax, imposed by local government taxing districts, which include counties, townships, municipalities, school districts, and special taxation districts.

name: illinois
sentence: The property tax in Illinois is imposed only on real property.

name: illinois
sentence: On May 1, 2019, the Illinois Senatorte voted to approve a constitutional amendment that would have stricken language from the Illinois Constitution requiring a flat state income tax, in a 73–44 vote.

name: illinois
sentence: If approved, the amendment would have allowed the state legislature to impose a graduated income tax based on annual income.

name: illinois
sentence: The governor, J.B. Pritzker, approved the bill on May 27, 2019.

name: illinois
sentence: It was scheduled for a 2020 general election ballot vote and required 60 percent voter approval to effectively amend the state constitution.

name: illinois
sentence: The amendment was not approved by Illinoisans, with 55.1% of voters voting "No" on approval and 44.9% voting "Yes."

name: illinois
sentence: As of 2017 Chicago had the highest state and local sales tax rate for a US city with a populations above 200,000, at 10.250%.

name: illinois
sentence: The state of Illinois has the second highest rate of real estate tax: 2.31%, which is second only to New Jersey at 2.44%.

name: illinois
sentence: Toll roads are a de facto user tax on the citizens and visitors to the state of Illinois.

name: illinois
sentence: Illinois ranks seventh out of the 11 states with the most miles of toll roads, at 282.1 miles.

name: illinois
sentence: Chicago ranks fourth in most expensive toll roads in America by the mile, with the Chicago Skyway charging 51.2 cents per mile.

name: illinois
sentence: Illinois also has the 11th highest gasoline tax by state, at 37.5 cents per gallon.

name: illinois
sentence: Illinois has numerous museums

name: illinois
sentence: Several museums in Chicago are ranked as some of the best in the world.

name: illinois
sentence: These include the John G. Shedd Aquarium, the Field Museum of Natural History, the Art Institute of Chicago, the Adler Planetarium, and the Museum of Science and Industry.

name: illinois
sentence: The modern Abraham Lincoln Presidential Library and Museum in Springfield is the largest and most attended presidential library in the country.

name: illinois
sentence: The Illinois State Museum boasts a collection of 13.5 million objects that tell the story of Illinois life, land, people, and art.

name: illinois
sentence: The ISM is among only 5% of the nation's museums that are accredited by the American Alliance of Museums.

name: illinois
sentence: Other historical museums in the state include the Polish Museum of America in Chicago; Magnolia Manor in Cairo; Easley Pioneer Museum in Ipava; the Elihu Benjamin Washburne; Ulysses S. Grant Homes, both in Galena; and the Chanute Air Museum, located on the former Chanute Air Force Base in Rantoul.

name: illinois
sentence: The Chicago metropolitan area also hosts two zoos: The Brookfield Zoo, located about ten miles west of the city center in suburban Brookfield, contains more than 2,300 animals and covers 216 acres (87 ha).

name: illinois
sentence: The Lincoln Park Zoo is located in Lincoln Park on Chicago's North Side, approximately 3 miles (4.8 km) north of the Loop.

name: illinois
sentence: The zoo accounts for more than 35 acres (14 ha) of the park.

name: illinois
sentence: Illinois is a leader in music education, having hosted the Midwest Clinic International Band and Orchestra Conference since 1946, as well being home to the Illinois Music Educators Association (IMEA), one of the largest professional music educator's organizations in the country.

name: illinois
sentence: Each summer since 2004, Southern Illinois University Carbondale has played host to the Southern Illinois Music Festival, which presents dozens of performances throughout the region.

name: illinois
sentence: Past featured artists include the Eroica Trio and violinist David Kim.

name: illinois
sentence: Chicago, in the northeast corner of the state, is a major center for music in the midwestern United States where distinctive forms of blues (greatly responsible for the future creation of rock and roll), and house music, a genre of electronic dance music, were developed.

name: illinois
sentence: The Great Migration of poor black workers from the South into the industrial cities brought traditional jazz and blues music to the city, resulting in Chicago blues and "Chicago-style" Dixieland jazz.

name: illinois
sentence: Notable blues artists included Muddy Waters, Junior Wells, Howlin' Wolf and both Sonny Boy Williamsons; jazz greats included Nat King Cole, Gene Ammons, Benny Goodman, and Bud Freeman.

name: illinois
sentence: Chicago is also well known for its soul music.

name: illinois
sentence: In the early 1930s, Gospel music began to gain popularity in Chicago due to Thomas A. Dorsey's contributions at Pilgrim Baptist Church.

name: illinois
sentence: In the 1980s and 1990s, heavy rock, punk, and hip hop also became popular in Chicago.

name: illinois
sentence: Orchestras in Chicago include the Chicago Symphony Orchestra, the Lyric Opera of Chicago, and the Chicago Sinfonietta.

name: illinois
sentence: John Hughes, who moved from Grosse Pointe to Northbrook, based many films of his in Chicago, and its suburbs.

name: illinois
sentence: Ferris Bueller's Day Off, Home Alone, The Breakfast Club, and all his films take place in the fictional Shermer, Illinois (the original name of Northbrook was Shermerville, and Hughes's High School, Glenbrook North High School, is on Shermer Road).

name: illinois
sentence: Most locations in his films include Glenbrook North, the former Maine North High School, the Ben Rose House in Highland Park, and the famous Home Alone house in Winnetka, Illinois.

name: illinois
sentence: As one of the United States' major metropolises, all major sports leagues have teams headquartered in Chicago.

name: illinois
sentence: Many minor league teams also call Illinois their home.

name: illinois
sentence: They include:

name: illinois
sentence: The state features 13 athletic programs that compete in NCAA Division I, the highest level of US college sports.

name: illinois
sentence: The two most prominent are the Illinois Fighting Illini and Northwestern Wildcats, both members of the Big Ten Conference and the only ones competing in one of the so-called "Power Five conferences".

name: illinois
sentence: The Fighting Illini football team has won five national championships and three Rose Bowl Games, whereas the men's basketball team has won 17 conference seasons and played five Final Fours.

name: illinois
sentence: Meanwhile, the Wildcats have won eight football conference championships and one Rose Bowl Game.

name: illinois
sentence: The Northern Illinois Huskies from DeKalb, Illinois compete in the Mid-American Conference winning four conference championships and earning a bid in the Orange Bowl along with producing Heisman candidate Jordan Lynch at quarterback.

name: illinois
sentence: The Huskies are the state's only other team competing in the Football Bowl Subdivision, the top level of NCAA football.

name: illinois
sentence: Four schools have football programs that compete in the second level of Division I football, the Football Championship Subdivision.

name: illinois
sentence: The Illinois State Redbirds (Normal, adjacent to Bloomington) and Southern Illinois Salukis (the latter representing Southern Illinois University's main campus in Carbondale) are members of the Missouri Valley Conference (MVC) for non-football sports and the Missouri Valley Football Conference (MVFC).

name: illinois
sentence: The Western Illinois Leathernecks (Macomb) are full members of the Summit League, which does not sponsor football, and also compete in the MVFC.

name: illinois
sentence: The Eastern Illinois Panthers (Charleston) are members of the Ohio Valley Conference (OVC).

name: illinois
sentence: The city of Chicago is home to four Division I programs that do not sponsor football.

name: illinois
sentence: The DePaul Blue Demons, with main campuses in Lincoln Park and the Loop, are members of the Big East Conference.

name: illinois
sentence: The Loyola Ramblers, with their main campus straddling the Edgewater and Rogers Park community areas on the city's far north side, compete in the MVC.

name: illinois
sentence: The UIC Flames, from the Near West Side next to the Loop, are in the Horizon League.

name: illinois
sentence: The Chicago State Cougars, from the city's south side, compete in the Western Athletic Conference.

name: illinois
sentence: Finally, two non-football Division I programs are located downstate.

name: illinois
sentence: The Bradley Braves (Peoria) are MVC members, and the SIU Edwardsville Cougars (in the Metro East region across the Mississippi River from St. Louis) compete in the OVC.

name: illinois
sentence: The city was formerly home to several other teams that either failed to survive or belonged to leagues that folded.

name: illinois
sentence: The NFL's Arizona Cardinals, who currently play in the Phoenix suburb of Glendale, Arizona, played in Chicago as the Chicago Cardinals, until moving to St. Louis, Missouri after the 1959 season.

name: illinois
sentence: An NBA expansion team known as the Chicago Packers in 1961–1962, and as the Chicago Zephyrs the following year, moved to Baltimore after the 1962–1963 season.

name: illinois
sentence: The franchise is now known as the Washington Wizards.

name: illinois
sentence: The Peoria Chiefs and Kane County Cougars are minor league baseball teams affiliated with MLB.

name: illinois
sentence: The Schaumburg Boomers and Lake County Fielders are members of the North American League, and the Southern Illinois Miners, Gateway Grizzlies, Joliet Slammers, Windy City ThunderBolts, and Normal CornBelters belong to the Frontier League.

name: illinois
sentence: In addition to the Chicago Wolves, the AHL also has the Rockford IceHogs serving as the AHL affiliate of the Chicago Blackhawks.

name: illinois
sentence: The second incarnation of the Peoria Rivermen plays in the SPHL.

name: illinois
sentence: Motor racing oval tracks at the Chicagoland Speedway in Joliet, the Chicago Motor Speedway in Cicero and the Gateway International Raceway in Madison, near St. Louis, have hosted NASCAR, CART, and IRL races, whereas the Sports Car Club of America, among other national and regional road racing clubs, have visited the Autobahn Country Club in Joliet, the Blackhawk Farms Raceway in South Beloit and the former Meadowdale International Raceway in Carpentersville.

name: illinois
sentence: Illinois also has several short tracks and dragstrips.

name: illinois
sentence: The dragstrip at Gateway International Raceway and the Route 66 Raceway, which sits on the same property as the Chicagoland Speedway, both host NHRA drag races.

name: illinois
sentence: Illinois features several golf courses, such as Olympia Fields, Medinah, Midlothian, Cog Hill, and Conway Farms, which have often hosted the BMW Championship, Western Open, and Women's Western Open.

name: illinois
sentence: Also, the state has hosted 13 editions of the US Open (latest at Olympia Fields in 2003), six editions of the PGA Championship (latest at Medinah in 2006), three editions of the US Women's Open (latest at The Merit Club), the 2009 Solheim Cup (at Rich Harvest Farms), and the 2012 Ryder Cup (at Medinah).

name: illinois
sentence: The John Deere Classic is a regular PGA Tour event played in the Quad Cities since 1971, whereas the Encompass Championship is a Champions Tour event since 2013.

name: illinois
sentence: Previously, the LPGA State Farm Classic was an LPGA Tour event from 1976 to 2011.

name: illinois
sentence: The Illinois state parks system began in 1908 with what is now Fort Massac State Park, becoming the first park in a system encompassing more than 60 parks and about the same number of recreational and wildlife areas.

name: illinois
sentence: Areas under the protection of the National Park Service include: the Illinois and Michigan Canal National Heritage Corridor near Lockport, the Lewis and Clark National Historic Trail, the Lincoln Home National Historic Site in Springfield, the Mormon Pioneer National Historic Trail, the Trail of Tears National Historic Trail, the American Discovery Trail, and the Pullman National Monument.

name: illinois
sentence: The federal government also manages the Shawnee National Forest and the Midewin National Tallgrass Prairie.

name: illinois
sentence: The government of Illinois, under the Constitution of Illinois, has three branches of government: executive, legislative and judicial.

name: illinois
sentence: The executive branch is split into several statewide elected offices, with the governor as chief executive.

name: illinois
sentence: Legislative functions are granted to the Illinois General Assembly.

name: illinois
sentence: The judiciary is composed of the Supreme Court and lower courts.

name: illinois
sentence: The Illinois General Assembly is the state legislature, composed of the 118-member Illinois House of Representatives and the 59-member Illinois Senatorte.

name: illinois
sentence: The members of the General Assembly are elected at the beginning of each even-numbered year.

name: illinois
sentence: The Illinois Compiled Statutes (ILCS) are the codified statutes of a general and permanent nature.

name: illinois
sentence: The executive branch is composed of six elected officers and their offices as well as numerous other departments.

name: illinois
sentence: The six elected officers are: Governor, Lieutenant Governor, Attorney General, Secretary of State, Comptroller, and Treasurer.

name: illinois
sentence: The government of Illinois has numerous departments, agencies, boards and commissions, but the so-called code departments provide most of the state's services.

name: illinois
sentence: The Judiciary of Illinois is the unified court system of Illinois.

name: illinois
sentence: It consists of the Supreme Court, Appellate Court, and Circuit Courts.

name: illinois
sentence: The Supreme Court oversees the administration of the court system.

name: illinois
sentence: The administrative divisions of Illinois are counties, townships, precincts, cities, towns, villages, and special-purpose districts.

name: illinois
sentence: The basic subdivision of Illinois are the 102 counties.

name: illinois
sentence: Eighty-five of the 102 counties are in turn divided into townships and precincts.

name: illinois
sentence: Municipal governments are the cities, villages, and incorporated towns.

name: illinois
sentence: Some localities possess home rule, which allows them to govern themselves to a certain extent.

name: illinois
sentence: Illinois is a Democratic stronghold.

name: illinois
sentence: Historically, Illinois was a political swing state, with near-parity existing between the Republican and the Democratic parties.

name: illinois
sentence: However, in recent elections, the Democratic Party has gained ground, and Illinois has come to be seen as a solid "blue" state in presidential campaigns.

name: illinois
sentence: Votes from Chicago and most of Cook County have long been strongly Democratic.

name: illinois
sentence: However, the "collar counties" (the suburbs surrounding Chicago's Cook County, Illinois), can be seen as moderate voting districts.

name: illinois
sentence: College towns like Carbondale, Champaign, and Normal also lean Democratic.

name: illinois
sentence: Republicans continue to prevail in the rural areas of northern and central Illinois, as well as southern Illinois outside of East St. Louis.

name: illinois
sentence: From 1920 until 1972, Illinois was carried by the victor of each of these 14 presidential elections.

name: illinois
sentence: In fact, the state was long seen as a national bellwether, supporting the winner in every election in the 20th century, except for 1916 and 1976.

name: illinois
sentence: By contrast, Illinois has trended more toward the Democratic party, and has voted for their presidential candidates in the last six elections; in 2000, George W. Bush became the first Republican to win the presidency without carrying either Illinois or Vermont.

name: illinois
sentence: Local politician and Chicago resident Barack Obama easily won the state's 21 electoral votes in 2008, with 61.9% of the vote.

name: illinois
sentence: In 2010, incumbent governor Pat Quinn was re-elected with 47% of the vote, while Republican Mark Kirk was elected to the Senatorte with 48% of the vote.

name: illinois
sentence: In 2012, President Obama easily carried Illinois again, with 58% to Republican candidate Mitt Romney's 41%.

name: illinois
sentence: In 2014, Republican Bruce Rauner defeated Governor Quinn 50% to 46% to become Illinois's first Republican governor in 12 years after being sworn in on January 12, 2015, while Democratic senator Dick Durbin was re-elected with 53% of the vote.

name: illinois
sentence: In 2016, Hillary Clinton carried Illinois with 55% of the vote, and Tammy Duckworth defeated incumbent Mark Kirk 54% to 40%.

name: illinois
sentence: George W. Bush and Donald Trump are the only Republican presidential candidates to win without carrying either Illinois or Vermont.

name: illinois
sentence: In 2018, Democrat JB Pritzker defeated the incumbent Bruce Rauner for the governorship with 54% of the vote.

name: illinois
sentence: Politics in the state have been infamous for highly visible corruption cases, as well as for crusading reformers, such as governors Adlai Stevenson and James R. Thompson.

name: illinois
sentence: In 2006, former governor George Ryan was convicted of racketeering and bribery, leading to a six-and-a-half-year prison sentence.

name: illinois
sentence: In 2008, then-Governor Rod Blagojevich was served with a criminal complaint on corruption charges, stemming from allegations that he conspired to sell the vacated Senatorte seat left by President Barack Obama to the highest bidder.

name: illinois
sentence: Subsequently, on December 7, 2011, Rod Blagojevich was sentenced to 14 years in prison for those charges, as well as perjury while testifying during the case, totaling 18 convictions.

name: illinois
