sentence: Blagojevich was impeached and convicted by the legislature, resulting in his removal from office.

name: illinois
sentence: In the late 20th century, Congressman Dan Rostenkowski was imprisoned for mail fraud; former governor and federal judge Otto Kerner, Jr. was imprisoned for bribery; Secretary of State Paul Powell was investigated and found to have gained great wealth through bribes, and State Auditor of Public Accounts (Comptroller) Orville Hodge was imprisoned for embezzlement.

name: illinois
sentence: In 1912, William Lorimer, the GOP boss of Chicago, was expelled from the US Senatorte for bribery and in 1921, Governor Len Small was found to have defrauded the state of a million dollars.

name: illinois
sentence: Illinois has shown a strong presence in presidential elections.

name: illinois
sentence: Three presidents have claimed Illinois as their political base when running for president: Abraham Lincoln, Ulysses S. Grant, and most recently Barack Obama.

name: illinois
sentence: Lincoln was born in Kentucky, but he moved to Illinois at age 21.

name: illinois
sentence: He served in the General Assembly and represented the 7th congressional district in the US House of Representatives before his election to the presidency in 1860.

name: illinois
sentence: Ulysses S. Grant was born in Ohio and had a military career that precluded settling down, but on the eve of the Civil War and approaching middle age, he moved to Illinois and thus utilized the state as his home and political base when running for president.

name: illinois
sentence: Barack Obama was born in Hawaii and made Illinois his home after graduating from law school, and later represented Illinois in the US Senatorte.

name: illinois
sentence: He then became president in 2008, running as a candidate from his Illinois base.

name: illinois
sentence: Ronald Reagan was born in Illinois, in the city of Tampico, raised in Dixon, Illinois, and educated at Eureka College, outside Peoria.

name: illinois
sentence: Reagan later moved to California during his young adulthood.

name: illinois
sentence: He then became an actor, and later became California's Governor before being elected president.

name: illinois
sentence: Hillary Clinton was born and raised in the suburbs of Chicago and became the first woman to represent a major political party in the general election of the US presidency.

name: illinois
sentence: Clinton ran from a platform based in New York State.

name: illinois
sentence: Nine African-Americans have served as members of the United States Senatorte.

name: illinois
sentence: Of which three have represented Illinois, the most of any single state: Carol Moseley-Braun, Barack Obama, and Roland Burris, who was appointed to replace Obama after his election to the presidency.

name: illinois
sentence: Moseley-Braun was the first African-American woman to become a US

name: illinois
sentence: Senatortor.

name: illinois
sentence: Three families from Illinois have played particularly prominent roles in the Democratic Party, gaining both statewide and national fame.

name: illinois
sentence: The Stevenson family, initially rooted in central Illinois and later based in the Chicago metropolitan area, has provided four generations of Illinois officeholders.

name: illinois
sentence: The Daley family's powerbase was in Chicago.

name: illinois
sentence: The Pritzker family is based in Chicago and have played important roles in both the private and the public sectors.

name: illinois
sentence: The Illinois State Board of Education (ISBE) is autonomous of the governor and the state legislature, and administers public education in the state.

name: illinois
sentence: Local municipalities and their respective school districts operate individual public schools, but the ISBE audits performance of public schools with the Illinois School Report Card.

name: illinois
sentence: The ISBE also makes recommendations to state leaders concerning education spending and policies.

name: illinois
sentence: Education is compulsory for ages 7–17 in Illinois.

name: illinois
sentence: Schools are commonly, but not exclusively, divided into three tiers of primary and secondary education: elementary school, middle school or junior high school, and high school.

name: illinois
sentence: District territories are often complex in structure.

name: illinois
sentence: Many areas in the state are actually located in two school districts—one for high school, the other for elementary and middle schools.

name: illinois
sentence: And such districts do not necessarily share boundaries.

name: illinois
sentence: A given high school may have several elementary districts that feed into it, yet some of those feeder districts may themselves feed into multiple high school districts.

name: illinois
sentence: Using the criterion established by the Carnegie Foundation for the Advancement of Teaching, there are eleven "National Universities" in the state.

name: illinois
sentence: The University of Chicago is continuously ranked as one of the world's top ten universities on various independent university rankings, and its Booth School of Business, along with Northwestern's Kellogg School of Management consistently rank within the top five graduate business schools in the country and top ten globally.

name: illinois
sentence: The University of Illinois at Urbana–Champaign is often ranked among the best engineering schools in the world and in United States.

name: illinois
sentence: As of 19 August 2010, six of these rank in the "first tier" among the top 500 National Universities in the nation, as determined by the US News & World Report rankings: the University of Chicago, Northwestern University, the University of Illinois at Urbana–Champaign, Loyola University Chicago, the Illinois Institute of Technology, DePaul University, University of Illinois at Chicago, Illinois State University, Southern Illinois University Carbondale, and Northern Illinois University.

name: illinois
sentence: Illinois also has more than twenty additional accredited four-year universities, both public and private, and dozens of small liberal arts colleges across the state.

name: illinois
sentence: Additionally, Illinois supports 49 public community colleges in the Illinois Community College System.

name: illinois
sentence: Schools in Illinois are funded primarily by property taxes, based on state assessment of property values, rather than direct state contributions.

name: illinois
sentence: Scholar Tracy Steffes has described Illinois public education as historically “inequitable,” a system where one of “the wealthiest of states” is “the stingiest in its support for education.” There have been several attempts to reform school funding in Illinois.

name: illinois
sentence: The most notable attempt came in 1973 with the adoption of the Illinois Resource Equalizer Formula, a measure through which it was hoped funding could be collected and distributed to Illinois schools more equitably.

name: illinois
sentence: However, opposition from affluent Illinois communities who objected to having to pay for the less well-off school districts (many of them Black majority communities, produced by redlining, white flight, and other “soft” segregation methods) resulted in the formula’s abolition in the late 1980s.

name: illinois
sentence: Because of its central location and its proximity to the Rust Belt and Grain Belt, Illinois is a national crossroads for air, auto, rail, and truck traffic.

name: illinois
sentence: From 1962 until 1998, Chicago's O'Hare International Airport (ORD) was the busiest airport in the world, measured both in terms of total flights and passengers.

name: illinois
sentence: While it was surpassed by Atlanta's Hartsfield in 1998 (as Chicago splits its air traffic between O'Hare and Midway airports, while Atlanta uses only one airport), with 59.3 million domestic passengers annually, along with 11.4 million international passengers in 2008, O'Hare consistently remains one of the two or three busiest airports globally, and in some years still ranks number one in total flights.

name: illinois
sentence: It is a major hub for both United Airlines and American Airlines, and a major airport expansion project is currently underway.

name: illinois
sentence: Midway Airport (MDW), which had been the busiest airport in the world at one point until it was supplanted by O'Hare as the busiest airport in 1962, is now the secondary airport in the Chicago metropolitan area and still ranks as one of the nation's busiest airports.

name: illinois
sentence: Midway is a major hub for Southwest Airlines and services many other carriers as well.

name: illinois
sentence: Midway served 17.3 million domestic and international passengers in 2008.

name: illinois
sentence: Illinois has an extensive passenger and freight rail transportation network.

name: illinois
sentence: Chicago is a national Amtrak hub and in-state passengers are served by Amtrak's Illinois Service, featuring the Chicago to Carbondale Illini and Saluki, the Chicago to Quincy Carl Sandburg and Illinois Zephyr, and the Chicago to St. Louis Lincoln Service.

name: illinois
sentence: Currently there is trackwork on the Chicago–St.

name: illinois
sentence: Louis line to bring the maximum speed up to 110 mph (180 km/h), which would reduce the trip time by an hour and a half.

name: illinois
sentence: Nearly every North American railway meets at Chicago, making it the largest and most active rail hub in the country.

name: illinois
sentence: Extensive commuter rail is provided in the city proper and some immediate suburbs by the Chicago Transit Authority's 'L' system.

name: illinois
sentence: One of the largest suburban commuter rail system in the United States, operated by Metra, uses existing rail lines to provide direct commuter rail access for hundreds of suburbs to the city and beyond.

name: illinois
sentence: In addition to the state's rail lines, the Mississippi River and Illinois River provide major transportation routes for the state's agricultural interests.

name: illinois
sentence: Lake Michigan gives Illinois access to the Atlantic Ocean by way of the Saint Lawrence Seaway.

name: illinois
sentence: The Interstate Highways in Illinois are all segments of the Interstate Highway System that are owned and maintained by the state.

name: illinois
sentence: Illinois has the distinction of having the most primary (two-digit) interstates pass through it among all the 50 states with 13.

name: illinois
sentence: Illinois also ranks third among the fifty states with the most interstate mileage, coming in after California and Texas, which are much bigger states in area.

name: illinois
sentence: Major US Interstate highways crossing the state include: Interstate 24 (I-24), I-39, I-41, I-55, I-57, I-64, I-70, I-72, I-74, I-80, I-88, I-90, and I-94.

name: illinois
sentence: The Illinois Department of Transportation (IDOT) is responsible for maintaining the USHighways in Illinois.

name: illinois
sentence: The system in Illinois consists of 21 primary highways.

name: illinois
sentence: Among the US highways that pass through the state, the primary ones are: US 6, US 12, US 14, US 20, US 24, US 30, US 34, US 36, US 40, US 41, US 45, US 50, US 51, US 52, US 54, US 60, US 62, and US 67.

name: indiana
sentence: Indiana ( (listen)) is a US state in the Midwestern and Great Lakes regions of North America.

name: indiana
sentence: It is the 38th-largest by area and the 17th-most populous of the 50 United States.

name: indiana
sentence: Its capital and largest city is Indianapolis.

name: indiana
sentence: Indiana was admitted to the United States as the 19th state on December 11, 1816.

name: indiana
sentence: It borders Lake Michigan to the northwest, Michigan to the north, Ohio to the east, the Ohio River and Kentucky to the south and southeast, and the Wabash River and Illinois to the west.

name: indiana
sentence: Before becoming a territory, various indigenous peoples inhabited Indiana for thousands of years.

name: indiana
sentence: Since its founding as a territory, settlement patterns in Indiana have reflected regional cultural segmentation present in the Eastern United States; the state's northernmost tier was settled primarily by people from New England and New York, Central Indiana by migrants from the Mid-Atlantic states and adjacent Ohio, and Southern Indiana by settlers from the Southern states, particularly Kentucky and Tennessee.

name: indiana
sentence: Indiana has a diverse economy with a gross state product of $359.12 billion in 2017.

name: indiana
sentence: It has several metropolitan areas with populations greater than 100,000 and a number of smaller industrial cities and towns.

name: indiana
sentence: Indiana is home to professional sports teams, including the NFL's Indianapolis Colts and the NBA's Indiana Pacers, and hosts several notable competitive events, including the Indianapolis 500.

name: indiana
sentence: Indiana's name means "Land of the Indians", or simply "Indian Land".

name: indiana
sentence: It also stems from Indiana's territorial history.

name: indiana
sentence: On May 7, 1800, the United States Congress passed legislation to divide the Northwest Territory into two areas and named the western section the Indiana Territory.

name: indiana
sentence: In 1816, when Congress passed an Enabling Act to begin the process of establishing statehood for Indiana, a part of this territorial land became the geographic area for the new state.

name: indiana
sentence: A resident of Indiana is officially known as a Hoosier.

name: indiana
sentence: The etymology of this word is disputed, but the leading theory, advanced by the Indiana Historical Bureau and the Indiana Historical Society, has its origin in Virginia, the Carolinas, and Tennessee (the Upland South) as a term for a backwoodsman, a rough countryman, or a country bumpkin.

name: indiana
sentence: The first inhabitants in what is now Indiana were the Paleo-Indians, who arrived about 8000 BCE after the melting of the glaciers at the end of the Ice Age.

name: indiana
sentence: Divided into small groups, the Paleo-Indians were nomads who hunted large game such as mastodons.

name: indiana
sentence: They created stone tools made out of chert by chipping, knapping and flaking.

name: indiana
sentence: The Archaic period, which began between 5000 and 4000 BC, covered the next phase of indigenous culture.

name: indiana
sentence: The people developed new tools as well as techniques to cook food, an important step in civilization.

name: indiana
sentence: These new tools included different types of spear points and knives, with various forms of notches.

name: indiana
sentence: They made ground-stone tools such as stone axes, woodworking tools and grinding stones.

name: indiana
sentence: During the latter part of the period, they built earthwork mounds and middens, which showed settlements were becoming more permanent.

name: indiana
sentence: The Archaic period ended at about 1500 BC, although some Archaic people lived until 700 BC.

name: indiana
sentence: The Woodland period began around 1500 BC, when new cultural attributes appeared.

name: indiana
sentence: The people created ceramics and pottery, and extended their cultivation of plants.

name: indiana
sentence: An early Woodland period group named the Adena people had elegant burial rituals, featuring log tombs beneath earth mounds.

name: indiana
sentence: In the middle of the Woodland period, the Hopewell people began to develop long-range trade of goods.

name: indiana
sentence: Nearing the end of the stage, the people developed highly productive cultivation and adaptation of agriculture, growing such crops as corn and squash.

name: indiana
sentence: The Woodland period ended around 1000 AD.

name: indiana
sentence: The Mississippian culture emerged, lasting from 1000 AD until the 15th century, shortly before the arrival of Europeans.

name: indiana
sentence: During this stage, the people created large urban settlements designed according to their cosmology, with large mounds and plazas defining ceremonial and public spaces.

name: indiana
sentence: The concentrated settlements depended on the agricultural surpluses.

name: indiana
sentence: One such complex was the Angel Mounds.

name: indiana
sentence: They had large public areas such as plazas and platform mounds, where leaders lived or conducted rituals.

name: indiana
sentence: Mississippian civilization collapsed in Indiana during the mid-15th century for reasons that remain unclear.

name: indiana
sentence: The historic Native American tribes in the area at the time of European encounter spoke different languages of the Algonquian family.

name: indiana
sentence: They included the Shawnee, Miami, and Illini.

name: indiana
sentence: Refugee tribes from eastern regions, including the Delaware who settled in the White and Whitewater River Valleys, later joined them.

name: indiana
sentence: In 1679, French explorer René-Robert Cavelier, Sieur de La Salle was the first European to cross into Indiana after reaching present-day South Bend at the Saint Joseph River.

name: indiana
sentence: He returned the following year to learn about the region.

name: indiana
sentence: French-Canadian fur traders soon arrived, bringing blankets, jewelry, tools, whiskey and weapons to trade for skins with the Native Americans.

name: indiana
sentence: By 1702, Sieur Juchereau established the first trading post near Vincennes.

name: indiana
sentence: In 1715, Sieur de Vincennes built Fort Miami at Kekionga, now Fort Wayne.

name: indiana
sentence: In 1717, another Canadian, Picote de Beletre, built Fort Ouiatenon on the Wabash River, to try to control Native American trade routes from Lake Erie to the Mississippi River.

name: indiana
sentence: In 1732, Sieur de Vincennes built a second fur trading post at Vincennes.

name: indiana
sentence: French Canadian settlers, who had left the earlier post because of hostilities, returned in larger numbers.

name: indiana
sentence: In a period of a few years, British colonists arrived from the East and contended against the Canadians for control of the lucrative fur trade.

name: indiana
sentence: Fighting between the French and British colonists occurred throughout the 1750s as a result.

name: indiana
sentence: The Native American tribes of Indiana sided with the French Canadians during the French and Indian War (also known as the Seven Years' War).

name: indiana
sentence: With British victory in 1763, the French were forced to cede to the British crown all their lands in North America east of the Mississippi River and north and west of the colonies.

name: indiana
sentence: The tribes in Indiana did not give up: they captured Fort Ouiatenon and Fort Miami during Pontiac's Rebellion.

name: indiana
sentence: The British royal proclamation of 1763 designated the land west of the Appalachians for Native American use, and excluded British colonists from the area, which the Crown called "Indian Territory".

name: indiana
sentence: In 1775, the American Revolutionary War began as the colonists sought self-government and independence from the British.

name: indiana
sentence: The majority of the fighting took place near the East Coast, but the Patriot military officer George Rogers Clark called for an army to help fight the British in the west.

name: indiana
sentence: Clark's army won significant battles and took over Vincennes and Fort Sackville on February 25, 1779.

name: indiana
sentence: During the war, Clark managed to cut off British troops, who were attacking the eastern colonists from the west.

name: indiana
sentence: His success is often credited for changing the course of the American Revolutionary War.

name: indiana
sentence: At the end of the war, through the Treaty of Paris, the British crown ceded their claims to the land south of the Great Lakes to the newly formed United States, including Native American lands.

name: indiana
sentence: In 1787, the US defined the Northwest Territory which included the area of present-day Indiana.

name: indiana
sentence: In 1800, Congress separated Ohio from the Northwest Territory, designating the rest of the land as the Indiana Territory.

name: indiana
sentence: President Thomas Jefferson chose William Henry Harrison as the governor of the territory, and Vincennes was established as the capital.

name: indiana
sentence: After the Michigan Territory was separated and the Illinois Territory was formed, Indiana was reduced to its current size and geography.

name: indiana
sentence: Starting with the Battle of Fallen Timbers in 1794 and the Treaty of Greenville in 1795, Native American titles to Indiana lands were extinguished by usurpation, purchase, or war and treaty.

name: indiana
sentence: About half the state was acquired in the Treaty of St. Mary's from the Miami in 1818.

name: indiana
sentence: Purchases were not complete until the Treaty of Mississinewas in 1826 acquired the last of the reserved Native American lands in the northeast.

name: indiana
sentence: A portrait of the Indiana frontier about 1810: The frontier was defined by the Treaty of Fort Wayne in 1809, adding much of the southwestern lands around Vincennes and southeastern lands adjacent to Cincinnati, to areas along the Ohio River as part of US territory.

name: indiana
sentence: Settlements were military outposts such as Fort Ouiatenon in the northwest and Fort Miami (later Fort Wayne) in the northeast, Fort Knox and Vincennes settlement on the lower Wabash.

name: indiana
sentence: Other settlements included Clarksville (across from Louisville), Vevay, and Corydon along the Ohio River, the Quaker Colony in Richmond on the eastern border, and Conner's Post (later Connersville) on the east central frontier.

name: indiana
sentence: Indianapolis would not be populated for 15 more years, and central and northern Indiana Territory remained wilderness populated primarily by Indigenous communities.

name: indiana
sentence: Only two counties in the extreme southeast, Clark and Dearborn, had been organized by European settlers.

name: indiana
sentence: Land titles issued out of Cincinnati were sparse.

name: indiana
sentence: Settler migration was chiefly via flatboat on the Ohio River westerly, and by wagon trails up the Wabash/White River Valleys (west) and Whitewater River Valleys (east).

name: indiana
sentence: In 1810, the Shawnee tribal chief Tecumseh and his brother Tenskwatawa encouraged other indigenous tribes in the territory to resist European settlement.

name: indiana
sentence: Tensions rose and the US authorized Harrison to launch a preemptive expedition against Tecumseh's Confederacy; the US gained victory at the Battle of Tippecanoe on November 7, 1811.

name: indiana
sentence: Tecumseh was killed in 1813 during the Battle of Thames.

name: indiana
sentence: After his death, armed resistance to United States control ended in the region.

name: indiana
sentence: Most Native American tribes in the state were later removed to west of the Mississippi River in the 1820s and 1830s after US negotiations and the purchase of their lands.

name: indiana
sentence: Corydon, a town in the far southern part of Indiana, was named the second capital of the Indiana Territory in May 1813 in order to decrease the threat of Native American raids following the Battle of Tippecanoe.

name: indiana
sentence: Two years later, a petition for statehood was approved by the territorial general assembly and sent to Congress.

name: indiana
sentence: An Enabling Act was passed to provide an election of delegates to write a constitution for Indiana.

name: indiana
sentence: On June 10, 1816, delegates assembled at Corydon to write the constitution, which was completed in 19 days.

name: indiana
sentence: Jonathan Jennings was elected the fledgling state's first governor in August 1816.

name: indiana
sentence: President James Madison approved Indiana's admission into the union as the nineteenth state on December 11, 1816.

name: indiana
sentence: In 1825, the state capital was moved from Corydon to Indianapolis.

name: indiana
sentence: Many European immigrants went west to settle in Indiana in the early 19th century.

name: indiana
sentence: The largest immigrant group to settle in Indiana were Germans, as well as many immigrants from Ireland and England.

name: indiana
sentence: Americans who were primarily ethnically English migrated from the Northern Tier of New York and New England, as well as from the mid-Atlantic state of Pennsylvania.

name: indiana
sentence: The arrival of steamboats on the Ohio River in 1811, and the National Road at Richmond in 1829, greatly facilitated settlement of northern and western Indiana.

name: indiana
sentence: Following statehood, the new government worked to transform Indiana from a frontier into a developed, well-populated, and thriving state, beginning significant demographic and economic changes.

name: indiana
sentence: In 1836, the state's founders initiated a program, the Indiana Mammoth Internal Improvement Act, that led to the construction of roads, canals, railroads and state-funded public schools.

name: indiana
sentence: The plans bankrupted the state and were a financial disaster, but increased land and produce value more than fourfold.

name: indiana
sentence: In response to the crisis and in order to avert another, in 1851, a second constitution was adopted.

name: indiana
sentence: Among its provisions were a prohibition on public debt, as well as the extension of suffrage to African-Americans.

name: indiana
sentence: During the American Civil War, Indiana became politically influential and played an important role in the affairs of the nation.

name: indiana
sentence: Indiana was the first western state to mobilize for the United States in the war, and soldiers from Indiana participated in all the war's major engagements.

name: indiana
sentence: The state provided 126 infantry regiments, 26 batteries of artillery and 13 regiments of cavalry to the Union.

name: indiana
sentence: In 1861, Indiana was assigned a quota of 7,500 men to join the Union Army.

name: indiana
sentence: So many volunteered in the first call that thousands had to be turned away.

name: indiana
sentence: Before the war ended, Indiana had contributed 208,367 men.

name: indiana
sentence: Casualties were over 35% among these men: 24,416 lost their lives and over 50,000 more were wounded.

name: indiana
sentence: The only Civil War conflicts fought in Indiana were the Newburgh Raid, a bloodless capture of the city; and the Battle of Corydon, which occurred during Morgan's Raid leaving 15 dead, 40 wounded, and 355 captured.

name: indiana
sentence: After the war, Indiana remained a largely agricultural state.

name: indiana
sentence: Post-war industries included mining, including limestone extraction; meatpacking; food processing, such as milling grain, distilling it into alcohol; and the building of wagons, buggies, farm machinery, and hardware.

name: indiana
sentence: However, the discovery of natural gas in the 1880s in northern Indiana led to an economic boom: the abundant and cheap fuel attracted heavy industry; the availability of jobs in turn attracted new settlers from other parts of the country as well as from Europe.

name: indiana
sentence: This led to the rapid expansion of cities such as South Bend, Gary, Indianapolis, and Fort Wayne.

name: indiana
sentence: With the onset of the industrial revolution, Indiana industry began to grow at an accelerated rate across the northern part of the state.

name: indiana
sentence: With industrialization, workers developed labor unions and suffrage movements arose in relation to the progress of women.

name: indiana
sentence: In the early 20th century, Indiana developed into a strong manufacturing state with ties to the new auto industry.

name: indiana
sentence: Haynes-Apperson, the nation's first commercially successful auto company, operated in Kokomo until 1925.

name: indiana
sentence: The construction of the Indianapolis Motor Speedway and the start of auto-related industries were also related to the auto industry boom.

name: indiana
sentence: During the 1930s, Indiana, like the rest of the nation, was affected by the Great Depression.

name: indiana
sentence: The economic downturn had a wide-ranging negative impact on Indiana, such as the decline of urbanization.

name: indiana
sentence: The Dust Bowl further to the west led many migrants to flee to the more industrialized Midwest.

name: indiana
sentence: Governor Paul V. McNutt's administration struggled to build a state-funded welfare system to help overwhelmed private charities.

name: indiana
sentence: During his administration, spending and taxes were both cut drastically in response to the Depression, and the state government was completely reorganized.

name: indiana
sentence: McNutt ended Prohibition in the state and enacted the state's first income tax.

name: indiana
sentence: On several occasions, he declared martial law to put an end to worker strikes.

name: indiana
sentence: World War II helped lift the economy in Indiana, as the war required steel, food and other goods that were produced in the state.

name: indiana
sentence: Roughly ten percent of Indiana's population joined the armed forces, while hundreds of industries earned war production contracts and began making war material.

name: indiana
sentence: Indiana manufactured 4.5 percent of total United States military armaments produced during World War II, ranking eighth among the 48 states.

name: indiana
sentence: The expansion of industry to meet war demands helped end the Great Depression.

name: indiana
sentence: With the conclusion of World War II, Indiana rebounded to pre-Depression levels of production.

name: indiana
sentence: Industry became the primary employer, a trend that continued into the 1960s.

name: indiana
sentence: Urbanization during the 1950s and 1960s led to substantial growth in the state's cities.

name: indiana
sentence: The auto, steel and pharmaceutical industries topped Indiana's major businesses.

name: indiana
sentence: Indiana's population continued to grow after the war, exceeding five million by the 1970 census.

name: indiana
sentence: In the 1960s the administration of Matthew E. Welsh adopted its first sales tax of two percent.

name: indiana
sentence: Indiana schools were desegregated in 1949.

name: indiana
sentence: In 1950, the Census Bureau reported Indiana's population as 95.5% white and 4.4% black.

name: indiana
sentence: Governor Welsh also worked with the General Assembly to pass the Indiana Civil Rights Bill, granting equal protection to minorities in seeking employment.

name: indiana
sentence: On December 8, 1964, a Convair B-58 carrying nuclear weapons slid off an icy runway on Bunker Hill Air Force Base in Bunker Hill, Indiana and caught fire during a training drill.

name: indiana
sentence: The five nuclear weapons on board were burned, including one 9-megaton thermonuclear weapon, causing radioactive contamination of the crash area.

name: indiana
sentence: Beginning in 1970, a series of amendments to the state constitution were proposed.

name: indiana
sentence: With adoption, the Indiana Court of Appeals was created and the procedure of appointing justices on the courts was adjusted.

name: indiana
sentence: The 1973 oil crisis created a recession that hurt the automotive industry in Indiana.

name: indiana
sentence: Companies such as Delco Electronics and Delphi began a long series of downsizing that contributed to high unemployment rates in manufacturing in Anderson, Muncie, and Kokomo.

name: indiana
sentence: The restructuring and deindustrialization trend continued until the 1980s, when the national and state economy began to diversify and recover.

name: indiana
sentence: With a total area (land and water) of 36,418 square miles (94,320 km2), Indiana ranks as the 38th largest state in size.

name: indiana
sentence: The state has a maximum dimension north to south of 250 miles (400 km) and a maximum east to west dimension of 145 miles (233 km).

name: indiana
sentence: The state's geographic center (39° 53.7'N, 86° 16.0W) is in Marion County.

name: indiana
sentence: Located in the Midwestern United States, Indiana is one of eight states that make up the Great Lakes Region.

name: indiana
sentence: Indiana is bordered on the north by Michigan, on the east by Ohio, and on the west by Illinois, partially separated by the Wabash River.

name: indiana
sentence: Lake Michigan borders Indiana on the northwest and the Ohio River separates Indiana from Kentucky on the south.

name: indiana
sentence: The average altitude of Indiana is about 760 feet (230 m) above sea level.

name: indiana
sentence: The highest point in the state is Hoosier Hill in Wayne County at 1,257 feet (383 m) above sea level.

name: indiana
sentence: The lowest point at 320 feet (98 m) above sea level is in Posey County, where the Wabash River meets the Ohio River.

name: indiana
sentence: The resulting elevation span, 937 feet (286 m), is the narrowest of any non-coastal US state.

name: indiana
sentence: Only 2,850 square miles (7,400 km2) have an altitude greater than 1,000 feet (300 m) and this area is enclosed within 14 counties.

name: indiana
sentence: About 4,700 square miles (12,000 km2) have an elevation of less than 500 feet (150 m), mostly concentrated along the Ohio and lower Wabash Valleys, from Tell City and Terre Haute to Evansville and Mount Vernon.

name: indiana
sentence: The state includes two natural regions of the United States: the Central Lowlands and the Interior Low Plateaus.

name: indiana
sentence: The till plains make up the northern and central regions of Indiana.

name: indiana
sentence: Much of its appearance is a result of elements left behind by glaciers.

name: indiana
sentence: Central Indiana is mainly flat with some low rolling hills (except where rivers cut deep valleys through the plain, like at the Wabash River and Sugar Creek) and soil composed of glacial sands, gravel and clay, which results in exceptional farmland.

name: indiana
sentence: Northern Indiana is similar, except for the presence of higher and hillier terminal moraines and hundreds of kettle lakes.

name: indiana
sentence: In northwest Indiana there are various sand ridges and dunes, some reaching nearly 200 feet in height.

name: indiana
sentence: These are along the Lake Michigan shoreline and also inland to the Kankakee Outwash Plain.

name: indiana
sentence: Southern Indiana is characterized by valleys and rugged, hilly terrain, contrasting from much of the state.

name: indiana
sentence: Here, bedrock is exposed at the surface and isn't buried in glacial till like further north.

name: indiana
sentence: Because of the prevalent Indiana limestone, the area has many caves, caverns, and quarries.

name: indiana
sentence: Major river systems in Indiana include the Whitewater, White, Blue, Wabash, St. Joseph, and Maumee rivers.

name: indiana
sentence: According to the Indiana Department of Natural Resources, there were 65 rivers, streams, and creeks of environmental interest or scenic beauty, which included only a portion of an estimated 24,000 total river miles within the state.

name: indiana
sentence: The Wabash River, which is the longest free-flowing river east of the Mississippi River, is the official river of Indiana.

name: indiana
sentence: At 475 miles (764 kilometers) in length, the river bisects the state from northeast to southwest, forming part of the state's border with Illinois, before converging with the Ohio River.

name: indiana
sentence: The river has been the subject of several songs, such as On the Banks of the Wabash, The Wabash Cannonball and Back Home Again, In Indiana.

name: indiana
sentence: There are about 900 lakes listed by the Indiana Department of Natural Resources.

name: indiana
sentence: To the northwest, Indiana borders Lake Michigan, one of five lakes comprising the Great Lakes, the largest group of freshwater lakes in the world.

name: indiana
sentence: Tippecanoe Lake, the deepest lake in the state, reaches depths at nearly 120 feet (37 m), while Lake Wawasee is the largest natural lake in Indiana.

name: indiana
sentence: At 10,750 acres (summer pool level), Lake Monroe is the largest lake in Indiana.

name: indiana
sentence: In the past, almost all of Indiana had a humid continental climate, with cold winters and hot, wet summers; only the extreme southern portion of the state lay within the humid subtropical climate, which receives more precipitation than other parts of Indiana.

name: indiana
sentence: But as of the 2016 update, about half the state is now classified as humid subtropical.

name: indiana
sentence: Temperatures generally diverge from the north and south sections of the state.

name: indiana
sentence: In midwinter, average high/low temperatures range from around 30 °F/15 °F (−1 °C/−10 °C) in the far north to 41 °F/24 °F (5 °C/−4 °C) in the far south.

name: indiana
sentence: In midsummer there is generally a little less variation across the state, as average high/low temperatures range from around 84 °F/64 °F (29 °C/18 °C) in the far north to 90 °F/69 °F (32 °C/21 °C) in the far south.

name: indiana
sentence: Indiana's record high temperature was 116 °F (47 °C) set on July 14, 1936, at Collegeville.

name: indiana
sentence: The record low was −36 °F (−38 °C) on January 19, 1994 at New Whiteland.

name: indiana
sentence: The growing season typically spans from 155 days in the north to 185 days in the south.

name: indiana
sentence: While droughts occasionally occur in the state, rainfall totals are distributed relatively equally throughout the year.

name: indiana
sentence: Precipitation totals range from 35 inches (89 cm) near Lake Michigan in northwest Indiana to 45 inches (110 cm) along the Ohio River in the south, while the state's average is 40 inches (100 cm).

name: indiana
sentence: Annual snowfall in Indiana varies widely across the state, ranging from 80 inches (200 cm) in the northwest along Lake Michigan to 14 inches (36 cm) in the far south.

name: indiana
sentence: Lake effect snow accounts for roughly half the snowfall in northwest and north central Indiana due to the effects of the moisture and relative warmth of Lake Michigan upwind.

name: indiana
sentence: The mean wind speed is 8 miles per hour (13 km/h).

name: indiana
sentence: In a 2012 report, Indiana was ranked eighth in a list of the top 20 tornado-prone states based on National Weather Service data from 1950 through 2011.

name: indiana
sentence: A 2011 report ranked South Bend 15th among the top 20 tornado-prone US cities, while another report from 2011 ranked Indianapolis eighth.

name: indiana
sentence: Despite its vulnerability, Indiana is not part of tornado alley.

name: indiana
sentence: Indiana is one of 13 US states that are divided into more than one time zone.

name: indiana
sentence: Indiana's time zones have fluctuated over the past century.

name: indiana
sentence: At present most of the state observes Eastern Time

name: indiana
sentence: Debate continues on the matter.

name: indiana
sentence: Before 2006, most of Indiana did not observe daylight saving time (DST).

name: indiana
sentence: Some counties within this area, particularly Floyd, Clark, and Harrison counties near Louisville, Kentucky, and Ohio and Dearborn counties near Cincinnati, Ohio, unofficially observed DST by local custom.

name: indiana
sentence: Since April 2006 the entire state observes DST.

name: indiana
sentence: Indiana is divided into 92 counties.

name: indiana
sentence: As of 2010, the state includes 16 metropolitan and 25 micropolitan statistical areas, 117 incorporated cities, 450 towns, and several other smaller divisions and statistical areas.

name: indiana
sentence: Marion County and Indianapolis have a consolidated city-county government.

name: indiana
sentence: Indianapolis is the capital of Indiana and its largest city.

name: indiana
sentence: Indiana's four largest metropolitan areas are Indianapolis, Fort Wayne, Evansville, and South Bend.

name: indiana
sentence: The table below lists the state's twenty largest municipalities based on the 2019 United States Census Estimate.

name: indiana
sentence: The United States Census Bureau estimates Indiana's population was 6,732,219 on July 1, 2019, a 3.83% increase since the 2010 United States Census.

name: indiana
sentence: The state's population density was 181.0 persons per square mile, the 16th-highest in the United States.

name: indiana
sentence: As of the 2010 US Census, Indiana's population center is northwest of Sheridan, in Hamilton County (+40.149246, −086.259514).

name: indiana
sentence: In 2005, 77.7% of Indiana residents lived in metropolitan counties, 16.5% lived in micropolitan counties and 5.9% lived in non-core counties.

name: indiana
sentence: The racial makeup of the state (based on the 2019 population estimate) was:

name: indiana
sentence: Hispanic or Latino of any race made up 7.3% of the population.

name: indiana
sentence: The Hispanic population is Indiana's fastest-growing ethnic minority.

name: indiana
sentence: 28.2% of Indiana's children under the age of 1 belonged to minority groups (note: children born to white hispanics are counted as minority group).

name: indiana
sentence: German is the largest ancestry reported in Indiana, with 22.7% of the population reporting that ancestry in the Census.

name: indiana
sentence: Persons citing American (12.0%) and English ancestry (8.9%) are also numerous, as are Irish (10.8%) and Polish (3.0%).

name: indiana
sentence: Most of those citing American ancestry are actually of English descent, but have family that has been in North America for so long, in many cases since the early colonial era, that they identify simply as American.

name: indiana
sentence: In the 1980 census 1,776,144 people claimed German ancestry, 1,356,135 claimed English ancestry and 1,017,944 claimed Irish ancestry out of a total population of 4,241,975 making the state 42% German, 32% English and 24% Irish.

name: indiana
sentence: Population growth since 1990 has been concentrated in the counties surrounding Indianapolis, with four of the five fastest-growing counties in that area: Hamilton, Hendricks, Johnson, and Hancock.

name: indiana
sentence: The other county is Dearborn County, which is near Cincinnati, Ohio.

name: indiana
sentence: Hamilton County has also grown faster than any county in the states bordering Indiana (Illinois, Michigan, Ohio and Kentucky), and is the 20th-fastest growing county in the country.

name: indiana
sentence: With a population of 829,817, Indianapolis is the largest city in Indiana and the 12th-largest in the United States, according to the 2010 Census.

name: indiana
sentence: Three other cities in Indiana have a population greater than 100,000: Fort Wayne (253,617), Evansville (117,429) and South Bend (101,168).

name: indiana
sentence: Since 2000, Fishers has seen the largest population rise amongst the state's twenty largest cities with an increase of 100 percent.

name: indiana
sentence: Gary and Hammond have seen the largest population declines regarding the twenty largest cities since 2000, with a decrease of 21.0 and 6.8 percent respectively.

name: indiana
sentence: Other cities that have seen extensive growth since 2000 are Greenwood (81 percent), Noblesville (39.4 percent), Carmel (21.4 percent) and Lawrence (9.3 percent).

name: indiana
sentence: Meanwhile, Evansville (−4.2 percent), Anderson (−4.0 percent) and Muncie (−3.9 percent) have seen the steepest decline.

name: indiana
sentence: Columbus also saw strong growth (12.8%) in the 2000-2010 period.

name: indiana
sentence: Indianapolis has the largest population of the state's metropolitan areas and the 33rd-largest in the country.

name: indiana
sentence: The Indianapolis metropolitan area encompasses Marion County and nine surrounding counties in central Indiana.

sentence: Note: Births in table don't add up, because Hispanics are counted both by their ethnicity and by their race, giving a higher overall number.

name: indiana
sentence: Based on population estimates for 2011, 6.6% of the state's population is under the age of five, 24.5% is under the age of 18, and 13.2% is 65 years of age or older.

name: indiana
sentence: From the 2010 US Census demographic data for Indiana, the median age is 37.

name: indiana
sentence: As of the 2010 census, Indiana's median household income was $44,616, ranking it 36th among the United States and the District of Columbia.

name: indiana
sentence: In 2005, the median household income for Indiana residents was $43,993.

name: indiana
sentence: Nearly 498,700 Indiana households had incomes between $50,000 and $75,000, accounting for 20% of all households.

name: indiana
sentence: Hamilton County's median household income is nearly $35,000 higher than the Indiana average.

name: indiana
sentence: At $78,932, it ranks seventh in the country among counties with fewer than 250,000 people.

name: indiana
sentence: The next highest median incomes in Indiana are also found in the Indianapolis suburbs; Hendricks County has a median of $57,538, followed by Johnson County at $56,251.

name: indiana
sentence: Although the largest single religious denomination in the state is Catholic (747,706 members), most of the population are members of various Protestant denominations.

name: indiana
sentence: The largest Protestant denomination by number of adherents in 2010 was the United Methodist Church with 355,043.

name: indiana
sentence: A study by the Graduate Center at the City University of New York found 20 percent are Roman Catholic, 14 percent belong to different Baptist churches, 10 percent are other Christians, 9 percent are Methodist, and 6 percent are Lutheran.

name: indiana
sentence: The study found 16 percent of Indiana is affiliated with no religion.

name: indiana
sentence: Indiana is home to the Benedictine St. Meinrad Archabbey, one of two Catholic archabbeys in the United States and one of 11 in the world.

name: indiana
sentence: The Lutheran Church–Missouri Synod has one of its two seminaries in Fort Wayne.

name: indiana
sentence: Two conservative denominations, the Free Methodist Church and the Wesleyan Church, have their headquarters in Indianapolis as does the Christian Church.

name: indiana
sentence: The Fellowship of Grace Brethren Churches maintains offices and publishing work in Winona Lake.

name: indiana
sentence: Huntington serves as the home to the Church of the United Brethren in Christ.

name: indiana
sentence: Anderson is home to the headquarters of the Church of God.

name: indiana
sentence: The headquarters of the Missionary Church is in Fort Wayne.

name: indiana
sentence: The Friends United Meeting of the Religious Society of Friends, the largest branch of American Quakerism, is based in Richmond, which also houses the oldest Quaker seminary in the United States, the Earlham School of Religion.

name: indiana
sentence: The Islamic Society of North America is headquartered in Plainfield.

name: indiana
sentence: Indiana has a constitutional democratic republican form of government with three branches: the executive, including an elected governor and lieutenant governor; the legislative, consisting of an elected bicameral General Assembly; and the judicial, the Supreme Court of Indiana, the Indiana Court of Appeals and circuit courts.

name: indiana
sentence: The Governor of Indiana serves as the state's chief executive and has the authority to manage the government as established in the Constitution of Indiana.

name: indiana
sentence: The governor and the lieutenant governor are jointly elected to four-year terms, with gubernatorial elections running concurrent with United States presidential elections (1996, 2000, 2004, 2008, etc.).

name: indiana
sentence: The governor may not serve more than two consecutive terms.

name: indiana
sentence: The governor works with the Indiana General Assembly and the Indiana Supreme Court to govern the state and has the authority to adjust the other branches.

name: indiana
sentence: The governor can call special sessions of the General Assembly and select and remove leaders of nearly all state departments, boards and commissions.

name: indiana
sentence: Other notable powers include calling out the Indiana Guard Reserve or the Indiana National Guard in times of emergency or disaster, issuing pardons or commuting the sentence of any criminal offenders except in cases of treason or impeachment and possessing an abundant amount of statutory authority.

name: indiana
sentence: The lieutenant governor serves as the President of the Senatorte and ensures the senate rules are acted in accordance with by its constituents.

name: indiana
sentence: The lieutenant governor votes only when needed to break ties.

name: indiana
sentence: If the governor dies in office, becomes permanently incapacitated, resigns or is impeached, the lieutenant governor becomes governor.

name: indiana
sentence: If both the governor and lieutenant governor positions are unoccupied, the Senatorte President pro tempore becomes governor.

name: indiana
sentence: The Indiana General Assembly is composed of a 50-member Senatorte and 100-member House of Representatives.

name: indiana
sentence: The Senatorte is the upper house of the General Assembly and the House of Representatives is the lower house.

name: indiana
sentence: The General Assembly has exclusive legislative authority within the state government.

name: indiana
sentence: Both the Senatorte and the House can introduce legislation, with the exception that the Senatorte is not authorized to initiate legislation that will affect revenue.

name: indiana
sentence: Bills are debated and passed separately in each house, but both houses must pass them before they can be submitted to the Governor.

name: indiana
sentence: The legislature can nullify a veto from the governor with a majority vote of full membership in the Senatorte and House of Representatives.

name: indiana
sentence: Each law passed by the General Assembly must be used without exception to the entire state.

name: indiana
sentence: The General Assembly has no authority to create legislation that targets a particular community.

name: indiana
sentence: The General Assembly can manage the state's judiciary system by arranging the size of the courts and the bounds of their districts.

name: indiana
sentence: It also can oversee the activities of the executive branch of the state government, has restricted power to regulate the county governments within the state, and has exclusive power to initiate the method to alter the Indiana Constitution.

name: indiana
sentence: The Indiana Supreme Court is made up of five judges with a Court of Appeals composed of 15 judges.

name: indiana
sentence: The governor selects judges for the supreme and appeal courts from a group of applicants chosen by a special commission.

name: indiana
sentence: After serving for two years, the judges must acquire the support of the electorate to serve for a 10-year term.

name: indiana
sentence: In nearly all cases, the Supreme Court does not have original jurisdiction and can hear only cases petitioned to it after being heard in lower courts.

name: indiana
sentence: Local circuit courts are where most cases begin with a trial and the consequence is decided by the jury.

name: indiana
sentence: The Supreme Court has original and sole jurisdiction in certain areas including the practice of law, discipline or disbarment of Judges appointed to the lower state courts, and supervision over the exercise of jurisdiction by the other lower courts of the State.

name: indiana
sentence: The state is divided into 92 counties, which are led by a board of county commissioners.

name: indiana
sentence: 90 counties in Indiana have their own circuit court with a judge elected for a six-year term.

name: indiana
sentence: The remaining two counties, Dearborn and Ohio, are combined into one circuit.

name: indiana
sentence: Many counties operate superior courts in addition to the circuit court.

name: indiana
sentence: In densely populated counties where the caseload is traditionally greater, separate courts have been established to solely hear either juvenile, criminal, probate or small claims cases.

name: indiana
sentence: The establishment, frequency and jurisdiction of these additional courts varies greatly from county to county.

name: indiana
sentence: There are 85 city and town courts in Indiana municipalities, created by local ordinance, typically handling minor offenses and not considered courts of record.

name: indiana
sentence: County officials elected to four-year terms include an auditor, recorder, treasurer, sheriff, coroner and clerk of the circuit court.

name: indiana
sentence: All incorporated cities in Indiana have a mayor and council form of municipal government.

name: indiana
sentence: Towns are governed by a town council and townships are governed by a township trustee and advisory board.

name: indiana
sentence: US News & World Report ranked Indiana first in the publication's inaugural 2017 Best States for Government listing.

name: indiana
sentence: Among individual categories, Indiana ranked above average in budget transparency (#1), government digitization (#6), and fiscal stability (#8), and ranked average in state integrity (#25).

name: indiana
sentence: From 1880 to 1924, a resident of Indiana was included in all but one presidential election.

name: indiana
sentence: Indiana Representative William Hayden English was nominated for vice president and ran with Winfield Scott Hancock in the 1880 election.

name: indiana
sentence: Former Indiana Governor Thomas A. Hendricks was elected vice president in 1884.

name: indiana
sentence: He served until his death on November 25, 1885, under President Grover Cleveland.

name: indiana
sentence: In 1888, former Senatortor from Indiana Benjamin Harrison was elected president and served one term.

name: indiana
sentence: He remains the only President from Indiana.

name: indiana
sentence: Indiana Senatortor Charles W. Fairbanks was elected vice president in 1904, serving under President Theodore Roosevelt until 1909.

name: indiana
sentence: Fairbanks made another run for vice president with Charles Evans Hughes in 1916, but they both lost to Woodrow Wilson and former Indiana Governor Thomas R. Marshall, who served as vice president from 1913 until 1921.

name: indiana
sentence: Not until 1988 did another presidential election involve a native of Indiana, when Senatortor Dan Quayle was elected vice president and served one term with George H W Bush.

name: indiana
sentence: Governor Mike Pence was elected vice president in 2016, to serve with Donald Trump.

name: indiana
sentence: Indiana has long been considered a Republican stronghold, particularly in Presidential races.

name: indiana
sentence: The Cook Partisan Voting Index (CPVI) now rates Indiana as R+9.

name: indiana
sentence: Indiana was one of only ten states to support Republican Wendell Willkie in 1940.

name: indiana
sentence: On 14 occasions the Republican candidate has defeated the Democrat by a double-digit margin in the state, including six times where a Republican won the state by more than twenty percentage points.

name: indiana
sentence: In 2000 and 2004 George W. Bush won the state by a wide margin while the election was much closer overall.

name: indiana
sentence: The state has supported a Democrat for president only five times since 1900.

name: indiana
sentence: In 1912, Woodrow Wilson became the first Democrat to win the state in the twentieth century, with 43% of the vote.

name: indiana
sentence: Twenty years later, Franklin D. Roosevelt won the state with 55% of the vote over incumbent Republican Herbert Hoover.

name: indiana
sentence: Roosevelt won the state again in 1936.

name: indiana
sentence: In 1964, 56% of voters supported Democrat Lyndon B. Johnson over Republican Barry Goldwater.

name: indiana
sentence: Forty-four years later, Democrat Barack Obama narrowly won the state against John McCain 50% to 49%.

name: indiana
sentence: In the following election, Republican Mitt Romney won back the state for the Republican Party with 54% of the vote over the incumbent President Obama who won 43%.

name: indiana
sentence: While only five Democratic presidential nominees have carried Indiana since 1900, 11 Democrats were elected governor during that time.

name: indiana
sentence: Before Mitch Daniels became governor in 2005, Democrats had held the office for 16 consecutive years.

name: indiana
sentence: Indiana elects two senators and nine representatives to Congress.

name: indiana
sentence: The state has 11 electoral votes in presidential elections.

name: indiana
sentence: Seven of the districts favor the Republican Party according to the CPVI rankings

name: indiana
sentence: Historically, Republicans have been strongest in the eastern and central portions of the state, while Democrats have been strongest in the northwestern part of the state.

name: indiana
sentence: Occasionally, certain counties in the southern part of the state will vote Democratic.

name: indiana
sentence: Marion County, Indiana's most populous county, supported the Republican candidates from 1968 to 2000, before backing the Democrats in the 2004, 2008, 2012, and 2016 elections.

name: indiana
sentence: Indiana's second-most populous county, Lake County, strongly supports the Democratic party and has not voted for a Republican since 1972.

name: indiana
sentence: In 2005, the Bay Area Center for Voting Research rated the most liberal and conservative cities in the United States on voting statistics in the 2004 presidential election, based on 237 cities with populations of more than 100,000.

name: indiana
sentence: Five Indiana cities were mentioned in the study.

name: indiana
sentence: On the liberal side, Gary was ranked second and South Bend came in at 83.

name: indiana
sentence: Among conservative cities, Fort Wayne was 44th, Evansville was 60th and Indianapolis was 82nd on the list.

name: indiana
sentence: Indiana is home to several current and former military installations.

name: indiana
sentence: The largest of these is the Naval Surface Warfare Center Crane Division, approximately 25 miles southwest of Bloomington, which is the third largest naval installation in the world, comprising approximately 108 square miles of territory.

name: indiana
sentence: Other active installations include Air National Guard fighter units at Fort Wayne, and Terre Haute airports (to be consolidated at Fort Wayne under the 2005 BRAC proposal, with the Terre Haute facility remaining open as a non-flying installation).

name: indiana
sentence: The Army National Guard conducts operations at Camp Atterbury in Edinburgh, Indiana, helicopter operations out of Shelbyville Airport and urban training at Muscatatuck Urban Training Center.

name: indiana
sentence: The Army's Newport Chemical Depot, which is now closed and turning into a coal purifier plant.

name: indiana
sentence: Indiana was formerly home to two major military installations; Grissom Air Force Base near Peru (realigned to an Air Force Reserve installation in 1994) and Fort Benjamin Harrison near Indianapolis, now closed, though the Department of Defense continues to operate a large finance center there (Defense Finance and Accounting Service).

name: indiana
sentence: Indiana has an extensive history with auto racing.

name: indiana
sentence: Indianapolis hosts the Indianapolis 500 mile race over Memorial Day weekend at the Indianapolis Motor Speedway every May.

name: indiana
sentence: The name of the race is usually shortened to "Indy 500" and also goes by the nickname "The Greatest Spectacle in Racing".

name: indiana
sentence: The race attracts more than 250,000 people every year, making it the largest single day sporting event in the world.

name: indiana
sentence: The track also hosts the Brickyard 400 (NASCAR) and the Red Bull Indianapolis Grand Prix.

name: indiana
sentence: From 2000 to 2007, it hosted the United States Grand Prix (Formula One).

name: indiana
sentence: Indiana features the world's largest and most prestigious drag race, the NHRA Mac Tools US Nationals, held each Labor Day weekend at Lucas Oil Raceway at Indianapolis in Clermont, Indiana.

name: indiana
sentence: Indiana is also host to a major unlimited hydroplane racing power boat race circuits in the major H1 Unlimited league, the Madison Regatta (Madison, Indiana).

name: indiana
sentence: As of 2013 Indiana has produced more National Basketball Association (NBA) players per capita than any other state.

name: indiana
sentence: Muncie has produced the most per capita of any American city, with two other Indiana cities in the top ten.

name: indiana
sentence: It has a rich basketball heritage that reaches back to the sport's formative years.

name: indiana
sentence: The NBA's Indiana Pacers play their home games at Bankers Life Fieldhouse

name: indiana
sentence: Although James Naismith developed basketball in Springfield, Massachusetts in 1891, high school basketball was born in Indiana.

name: indiana
sentence: In 1925, Naismith visited an Indiana basketball state finals game along with 15,000 screaming fans and later wrote "Basketball really had its origin in Indiana, which remains the center of the sport."

name: indiana
sentence: The 1986 film Hoosiers is inspired by the story of the 1954 Indiana state champions Milan High School.

name: indiana
sentence: Professional basketball player Larry Bird was born in West Baden Springs and was raised in French Lick.

name: indiana
sentence: He went on to lead the Boston Celtics to the NBA championship in 1981, 1984, and 1986.

name: indiana
sentence: Indianapolis is home to the Indianapolis Colts.

name: indiana
sentence: The Colts are members of the South Division of the American Football Conference.

name: indiana
sentence: The Colts have roots back to 1913 as the Dayton Triangles.

name: indiana
sentence: They became an official team after moving to Baltimore, MD, in 1953.

name: indiana
sentence: In 1984, the Colts relocated to Indianapolis, leading to an eventual rivalry with the Baltimore Ravens.

name: indiana
sentence: After calling the RCA Dome home for 25 years, the Colts play their home games at Lucas Oil Stadium in Indianapolis.

name: indiana
sentence: While in Baltimore, the Colts won the 1970 Super Bowl.

name: indiana
sentence: In Indianapolis, the Colts won Super Bowl XLI, bringing the franchise total to two.

name: indiana
sentence: In recent years the Colts have regularly competed in the NFL playoffs.

name: indiana
sentence: Indiana was home to two charter members of the National Football League teams, the Hammond Pros and the Muncie Flyers.

name: indiana
sentence: Another early NFL franchise, the Evansville Crimson Giants spent two seasons in the league before folding.

sentence: Indiana has had great sports success at the collegiate level.

name: indiana
sentence: In men's basketball, the Indiana Hoosiers have won five NCAA national championships and 22 Big Ten Conference championships.

name: indiana
sentence: The Purdue Boilermakers were selected as the national champions in 1932 before the creation of the tournament, and have won 23 Big Ten championships.

name: indiana
sentence: The Boilermakers along with the Notre Dame Fighting Irish have both won a national championship in women's basketball.

name: indiana
sentence: In college football, the Notre Dame Fighting Irish have won 11 consensus national championships, as well as the Rose Bowl Game, Cotton Bowl Classic, Orange Bowl and Sugar Bowl.

name: indiana
sentence: Meanwhile, the Purdue Boilermakers have won 10 Big Ten championships and have won the Rose Bowl and Peach Bowl.
