name: indiana
sentence: In 2017, Indiana had a civilian labor force of nearly 3.4 million, the 15th largest in the US Indiana has an unemployment rate of 3.4 percent, lower than the national average.

name: indiana
sentence: The total gross state product in 2016 was $347.2 billion.

name: indiana
sentence: A high percentage of Indiana's income is from manufacturing.

name: indiana
sentence: According to the Bureau of Labor Statistics, nearly 17 percent of the state's non-farm workforce is employed in manufacturing, the highest of any state in the US

name: indiana
sentence: The state's five leading exports were motor vehicles and auto parts, pharmaceutical products, industrial machinery, optical and medical equipment, and electric machinery.

name: indiana
sentence: Despite its reliance on manufacturing, Indiana has been less affected by declines in traditional Rust Belt manufactures than many of its neighbors.

name: indiana
sentence: The explanation appears to be certain factors in the labor market.

name: indiana
sentence: First, much of the heavy manufacturing, such as industrial machinery and steel, requires highly skilled labor, and firms are often willing to locate where hard-to-train skills already exist.

name: indiana
sentence: Second, Indiana's labor force is primarily in medium-sized and smaller cities rather than in very large and expensive metropolises.

name: indiana
sentence: This makes it possible for firms to offer somewhat lower wages for these skills than would normally be paid.

name: indiana
sentence: Firms often see in Indiana a chance to obtain higher than average skills at lower than average wages.

name: indiana
sentence: In 2016, Indiana was home to seven Fortune 500 companies with a combined $142.5 billion in revenue.

name: indiana
sentence: Columbus-based Cummins, Inc. and Indianapolis-based Eli Lilly and Company and Simon Property Group were recognized in Fortune publication's "2017 World's Most Admired Companies List", ranking in each of their respective industries.

name: indiana
sentence: Northwest Indiana has been the largest steel producing center in the US since 1975 and accounted for 27 percent of American-made steel in 2016.

name: indiana
sentence: Indiana is home to the international headquarters and research facilities of pharmaceutical company Eli Lilly in Indianapolis, the state's largest corporation, as well as the world headquarters of Mead Johnson Nutritionals in Evansville.

name: indiana
sentence: Overall, Indiana ranks fifth among all US states in total sales and shipments of pharmaceutical products and second highest in the number of biopharmaceutical related jobs.

name: indiana
sentence: Indiana is within the US Corn Belt and Grain Belt.

name: indiana
sentence: The state has a feedlot-style system raising corn to fatten hogs and cattle.

name: indiana
sentence: Along with corn, soybeans are also a major cash crop.

name: indiana
sentence: Its proximity to large urban centers, such as Indianapolis and Chicago, assure dairying, egg production, and specialty horticulture occur.Other crops include melons, tomatoes, grapes, mint, popping corn, and tobacco in the southern counties.

name: indiana
sentence: Most of the original land was not prairie and had to be cleared of deciduous trees.

name: indiana
sentence: Many parcels of woodland remain and support a furniture-making sector in the southern portion of the state.

name: indiana
sentence: In 2011 Indiana was ranked first in the Midwest and sixth in the country for best places to do business according to CEO magazine.

name: indiana
sentence: Tax is collected by the Indiana Department of Revenue.

name: indiana
sentence: Indiana has a flat state income tax rate of 3.23%.

name: indiana
sentence: Many of the state's counties also collect income tax.

name: indiana
sentence: The state sales tax rate is 7% with exemptions for food, prescription medications and over-the-counter medications.

name: indiana
sentence: In some jurisdictions, an additional Food and Beverage Tax is charged, at a rate of 1% (Marion County's rate is 2%), on sales of prepared meals and beverages.

name: indiana
sentence: Property taxes are imposed on both real and personal property in Indiana and are administered by the Department of Local Government Finance.

name: indiana
sentence: Property is subject to taxation by a variety of taxing units (schools, counties, townships, municipalities, and libraries), making the total tax rate the sum of the tax rates imposed by all taxing units in which a property is located.

name: indiana
sentence: However, a "circuit breaker" law enacted on March 19, 2008 limits property taxes to 1% of assessed value for homeowners, 2% for rental properties and farmland, and 3% for businesses.

name: indiana
sentence: Indiana does not have a legal requirement to balance the state budget either in law or its constitution.

name: indiana
sentence: Instead, it has a constitutional ban on assuming debt.

name: indiana
sentence: The state has a Rainy Day Fund and for healthy reserves proportional to spending.

name: indiana
sentence: Indiana is one of six US states to not allow a line-item veto.

name: indiana
sentence: Since 2010, Indiana has been one of a few states to hold AAA bond credit ratings with the Big Three credit rating agencies, the highest possible rating.

name: indiana
sentence: Indiana's power production chiefly consists of the consumption of fossil fuels, mainly coal.

name: indiana
sentence: It has 24 coal power plants, including the country's largest coal power plant, Gibson Generating Station, across the Wabash River from Mount Carmel, Illinois.

name: indiana
sentence: Indiana is also home to the coal-fired plant with the highest sulfur dioxide emissions in the United States, the Gallagher power plant, just west of New Albany.

name: indiana
sentence: In 2010, Indiana had estimated coal reserves of 57 billion tons, and state mining operations produced 35 million tons of coal annually.

name: indiana
sentence: Indiana also has at least 900 million barrels of petroleum reserves in the Trenton Field, though they are not easily recoverable.

name: indiana
sentence: While Indiana has made commitments to increasing use of renewable resources such as wind, hydroelectric, biomass, or solar power, progress has been very slow, mainly because of the continued abundance of coal in southern Indiana.

name: indiana
sentence: Most of the new plants in the state have been coal gasification plants.

name: indiana
sentence: Another source is hydroelectric power.

name: indiana
sentence: Wind power has been developed.

name: indiana
sentence: Estimates in 2006 raised Indiana's wind capacity from 30 MW at 50 m turbine height to 40,000 MW at 70 m, and to 130,000 MW at 100 m, in 2010, the height of newer turbines.

name: indiana
sentence: By the end of 2011, Indiana had installed 1,340 MW of wind turbines.

name: indiana
sentence: Indianapolis International Airport serves the greater Indianapolis area.

name: indiana
sentence: It opened in November 2008 and offers a midfield passenger terminal, concourses, air traffic control tower, parking garage, and airfield and apron improvements.

name: indiana
sentence: Other major airports include Evansville Regional Airport, Fort Wayne International Airport (which houses the 122d Fighter Wing of the Air National Guard), and South Bend International Airport.

name: indiana
sentence: A long-standing proposal to turn Gary Chicago International Airport into Chicago's third major airport received a boost in early 2006 with the approval of $48 million in federal funding over the next ten years.

name: indiana
sentence: No airlines operate out of Terre Haute Regional Airport but it is used for private planes.

name: indiana
sentence: Since 1954, the 181st Fighter Wing of the Indiana Air National Guard was stationed at there, but the Base Realignment and Closure (BRAC) Proposal of 2005 stated the 181st would lose its fighter mission and F-16 aircraft, leaving the Terre Haute facility a general-aviation-only facility.

name: indiana
sentence: Louisville International Airport, across the Ohio River in Louisville, Kentucky, serves southern Indiana, as does Cincinnati/Northern Kentucky International Airport in Hebron, Kentucky.

name: indiana
sentence: Many residents of Northwest Indiana, which is primarily in the Chicago Metropolitan Area, use Chicago's airports, O'Hare International Airport and Chicago Midway International Airport.

name: indiana
sentence: The major US Interstate highways in Indiana are I-64, I-65, I-265, I-465, I-865, I-69, I-469, I-70, I-74, I-80, I-90, I-94, and I-275.

name: indiana
sentence: The various highways intersecting in and around Indianapolis, along with its historical status as a major railroad hub, and the canals that once crossed Indiana, are the source of the state's motto, the Crossroads of America.

name: indiana
sentence: There are also many US routes and state highways maintained by the Indiana Department of Transportation.

name: indiana
sentence: These are numbered according to the same convention as US

name: indiana
sentence: Highways.

name: indiana
sentence: Indiana allows highways of different classifications to have the same number.

name: indiana
sentence: For example, I-64 and Indiana State Road 64 both exist (rather close to each other) in Indiana, but are two distinct roads with no relation to one another.

name: indiana
sentence: A $3 billion project extending I-69 is underway.

name: indiana
sentence: The project was divided into six sections, with the first five sections (linking Evansville to Martinsville) now complete.

name: indiana
sentence: The sixth and final phase to Indianapolis is in planning.

name: indiana
sentence: When complete, I-69 will traverse an additional 142 miles (229 km) through the state.

name: indiana
sentence: Most Indiana counties use a grid-based system to identify county roads; this system replaced the older arbitrary system of road numbers and names, and (among other things) makes it much easier to identify the sources of calls placed to the 9-1-1 system.

name: indiana
sentence: Such systems are easier to implement in the glacially flattened northern and central portions of the state.

name: indiana
sentence: Rural counties in the southern third of the state are less likely to have grids and more likely to rely on unsystematic road names (for example, Crawford, Harrison, Perry, Scott, and Washington Counties).

name: indiana
sentence: There are also counties in northern portions of the state that have never implemented a grid, or have only partially implemented one.

name: indiana
sentence: Some counties are also laid out in an almost diamond-like grid system (e.g., Clark, Floyd, Gibson, and Knox Counties).

name: indiana
sentence: Such a system is also almost useless in those situations as well.

name: indiana
sentence: Knox County once operated two different grid systems for county roads because the county was laid out using two different survey grids, but has since decided to use road names and combine roads instead.

name: indiana
sentence: Notably, the county road grid system of St. Joseph County, whose major city is South Bend, uses perennial (tree) names (i.e.

name: indiana
sentence: Ash, Hickory, Ironwood, etc.)

name: indiana
sentence: in alphabetical order for north–south roads and presidential and other noteworthy names (i.e., Adams, Edison, Lincoln Way, etc.)

name: indiana
sentence: in alphabetical order for east–west roads.

name: indiana
sentence: There are exceptions to this rule in downtown South Bend and Mishawaka.

name: indiana
sentence: Hamilton County's east-west roads continue Indianapolis's numbered street system from 96th Street at the Marion County line to 296th street at the Tipton County line.

name: indiana
sentence: Indiana has more than 4,255 railroad route miles, of which 91 percent are operated by Class I railroads, principally CSX Transportation and the Norfolk Southern Railway.

name: indiana
sentence: Other Class I railroads in Indiana include the Canadian National Railway and Soo Line Railroad, a Canadian Pacific Railway subsidiary, as well as Amtrak.

name: indiana
sentence: The remaining miles are operated by 37 regional, local, and switching and terminal railroads.

name: indiana
sentence: The South Shore Line is one of the country's most notable commuter rail systems, extending from Chicago to South Bend.

name: indiana
sentence: Indiana is implementing an extensive rail plan prepared in 2002 by the Parsons Corporation.

name: indiana
sentence: Many recreational trails, such as the Monon Trail and Cardinal Greenway, have been created from abandoned rails routes.

name: indiana
sentence: Indiana annually ships more than 70 million tons of cargo by water each year, which ranks 14th among all US states.

name: indiana
sentence: More than half of Indiana's border is water, which includes 400 miles (640 km) of direct access to two major freight transportation arteries: the Great Lakes/St.

name: indiana
sentence: Lawrence Seaway (via Lake Michigan) and the Inland Waterway System (via the Ohio River).

name: indiana
sentence: The Ports of Indiana manages three major ports which include Burns Harbor, Jeffersonville, and Mount Vernon.

name: indiana
sentence: In Evansville, three public and several private port facilities receive year-round service from five major barge lines operating on the Ohio River.

name: indiana
sentence: Evansville has been a US Customs Port of Entry for more than 125 years.

name: indiana
sentence: Because of this, it is possible to have international cargo shipped to Evansville in bond.

name: indiana
sentence: The international cargo can then clear Customs in Evansville rather than a coastal port.

name: indiana
sentence: Indiana's 1816 constitution was the first in the country to implement a state-funded public school system.

name: indiana
sentence: It also allotted one township for a public university.

name: indiana
sentence: However, the plan turned out to be far too idealistic for a pioneer society, as tax money was not accessible for its organization.

name: indiana
sentence: In the 1840s, Caleb Mills pressed the need for tax-supported schools, and in 1851 his advice was included in the new state constitution.

name: indiana
sentence: In 1843 the Legislature ruled that African Americans could not attend the public schools, leading to the foundation of Union Literary Institute and other schools for them, funded by donations or the students themselves.

name: indiana
sentence: Although the growth of the public school system was held up by legal entanglements, many public elementary schools were in use by 1870.

name: indiana
sentence: Most children in Indiana attend public schools, but nearly ten percent attend private schools and parochial schools.

name: indiana
sentence: About half of all college students in Indiana are enrolled in state-supported four-year schools.

name: indiana
sentence: Indiana public schools have gone through several changes throughout Indiana's history.

name: indiana
sentence: Modern, public school standards, have been implemented all throughout the state.

name: indiana
sentence: These new standards were adopted in April 2014.

name: indiana
sentence: The overall goal of these new state standards is to ensure Indiana students have the necessary skills and requirements needed to enter college or the workforce upon high school graduation.

name: indiana
sentence: State standards can be found for nearly every major subject taught in Indiana public schools.

name: indiana
sentence: Mathematics, English/Language Arts, Science, and Social Studies are among the top, prioritized standards.

name: indiana
sentence: In 2017, the Indiana Department of Education reported that the state's overall graduation rates were 87.19% for waivered graduations and 80.10% for non-waiver graduations.

name: indiana
sentence: The largest educational institution is Indiana University, the flagship campus of which was endorsed as Indiana Seminary in 1820.

name: indiana
sentence: Indiana State University was established as the state's Normal School in 1865

name: indiana
sentence: The three other independent state universities are Vincennes University (Founded in 1801 by the Indiana Territory), Ball State University (1918) and University of Southern Indiana (1965 as ISU – Evansville).

name: indiana
sentence: Many of Indiana's private colleges and universities are affiliated with religious groups.

name: indiana
sentence: The University of Notre Dame, Marian University, and the University of Saint Francis are popular Roman Catholic schools.

name: indiana
sentence: Universities affiliated with Protestant denominations include Anderson University, Butler University, Huntington University, Manchester University, Indiana Wesleyan University, Taylor University, Franklin College, Hanover College, DePauw University, Earlham College, Valparaiso University, University of Indianapolis, and University of Evansville.

name: indiana
sentence: The state's community college system, Ivy Tech Community College of Indiana, serves nearly 200,000 students annually, making it the state's largest public post-secondary educational institution and the nation's largest singly accredited statewide community college system.

name: indiana
sentence: In 2008, the Indiana University system agreed to shift most of its associate (2-year) degrees to the Ivy Tech Community College System.

name: indiana
sentence: The state has several universities ranked among the best in 2013 rankings of the US News & World Report.

name: indiana
sentence: The University of Notre Dame is ranked among the top 20, with Indiana University Bloomington and Purdue University ranking in the top 100.

name: indiana
sentence: Indiana University – Purdue University Indianapolis (IUPUI) has recently made it into the top 200 US News & World Report rankings.

name: indiana
sentence: Butler, Valparaiso, and the University of Evansville are ranked among the top ten in the Regional University Midwest Rankings.

name: indiana
sentence: Purdue's engineering programs are ranked eighth in the country.

name: indiana
sentence: In addition, Taylor University is ranked first in the Regional College Midwest Rankings and Rose-Hulman Institute of Technology has been considered the top Undergraduate Engineering school (where a doctorate is not offered) for 15 consecutive years.

name: iowa
sentence: Iowa ( (listen)) is a state in the Midwestern United States, bordered by the Mississippi River to the east and the Missouri River and Big Sioux River to the west.

name: iowa
sentence: It is bordered by six states: Wisconsin to the northeast, Illinois to the east and southeast, Missouri to the south, Nebraska to the west, South Dakota to the northwest, and Minnesota to the north.

name: iowa
sentence: In colonial times, Iowa was a part of French Louisiana and Spanish Louisiana; its state flag is patterned after the flag of France.

name: iowa
sentence: After the Louisiana Purchase, people laid the foundation for an agriculture-based economy in the heart of the Corn Belt.

name: iowa
sentence: In the latter half of the 20th century, Iowa's agricultural economy made the transition to a diversified economy of advanced manufacturing, processing, financial services, information technology, biotechnology, and green energy production.

name: iowa
sentence: Iowa is the 26th most extensive in total area and the 30th most populous of the 50 US states.

name: iowa
sentence: The state's capital, most populous city, and largest metropolitan area fully located within the state is Des Moines.

name: iowa
sentence: A portion of the larger Omaha, Nebraska, metropolitan area extends into three counties of southwest Iowa.

name: iowa
sentence: Iowa has been listed as one of the safest US states to live in.

name: iowa
sentence: Iowa derives its name from the Ioway people, one of the many Native American nations whose territory comprised the future state at the time of European colonization.

name: iowa
sentence: Iowa is bordered by the Mississippi River on the east and the Missouri River and the Big Sioux River on the west.

name: iowa
sentence: The northern boundary is a line along 43 degrees, 30 minutes north latitude.

name: iowa
sentence: The southern border is the Des Moines River and a not-quite-straight line along approximately 40 degrees 35 minutes north, as decided by the US Supreme Court in Missouri v. Iowa (1849) after a standoff between Missouri and Iowa known as the Honey War.

name: iowa
sentence: Iowa is the only state whose east and west borders are formed almost entirely by rivers.

name: iowa
sentence: Carter Lake, Iowa, is the only city in the state located west of the Missouri River.

name: iowa
sentence: Iowa has 99 counties, but 100 county seats because Lee County has two.

name: iowa
sentence: The state capital, Des Moines, is in Polk County.

name: iowa
sentence: Iowa's bedrock geology generally increases in age from west to east.

name: iowa
sentence: In northwest Iowa, Cretaceous bedrock can be 74 million years old; in eastern Iowa Cambrian bedrock dates to c. 500 million years ago.

name: iowa
sentence: Iowa is generally not flat

name: iowa
sentence: Iowa can be divided into eight landforms based on glaciation, soils, topography, and river drainage.

name: iowa
sentence: Loess hills lie along the western border of the state, some of which are several hundred feet thick.

name: iowa
sentence: Northeast Iowa along the Upper Mississippi River is part of the Driftless Area, consisting of steep hills and valleys which appear almost mountainous.

name: iowa
sentence: Several natural lakes exist, most notably Spirit Lake, West Okoboji Lake, and East Okoboji Lake in northwest Iowa (see Iowa Great Lakes).

name: iowa
sentence: To the east lies Clear Lake.

name: iowa
sentence: Man-made lakes include Lake Odessa, Saylorville Lake, Lake Red Rock, Coralville Lake, Lake MacBride, and Rathbun Lake.

name: iowa
sentence: Before European settlement, 4 to 6 million acres of the state was covered with wetlands, about 95% of these wetlands have been drained.

name: iowa
sentence: Iowa's natural vegetation is tallgrass prairie and savanna in upland areas, with dense forest and wetlands in flood plains and protected river valleys, and pothole wetlands in northern prairie areas.

name: iowa
sentence: Most of Iowa is used for agriculture; crops cover 60% of the state, grasslands (mostly pasture and hay with some prairie and wetland) cover 30%, and forests cover 7%; urban areas and water cover another 1% each.

name: iowa
sentence: The southern part of Iowa is categorized as the Central forest-grasslands transition ecoregion.

name: iowa
sentence: The Northern, drier part of Iowa is categorized as part of the Central tall grasslands.

name: iowa
sentence: There is a dearth of natural areas in Iowa; less than 1% of the tallgrass prairie that once covered most of Iowa remains intact; only about 5% of the state's prairie pothole wetlands remain, and most of the original forest has been lost.

name: iowa
sentence: As of 2005 Iowa ranked 49th of US states in public land holdings.

name: iowa
sentence: Threatened or endangered animals in Iowa include the interior least tern, piping plover, Indiana bat, pallid sturgeon, the Iowa Pleistocene land snail, Higgins' eye pearly mussel, and the Topeka shiner.

name: iowa
sentence: Endangered or threatened plants include western prairie fringed orchid, eastern prairie fringed orchid, Mead's milkweed, prairie bush clover, and northern wild monkshood.

name: iowa
sentence: The explosion in the number of high-density livestock facilities in Iowa has led to increased rural water contamination and a decline in air quality.

name: iowa
sentence: Other factors negatively affecting Iowa's environment include the extensive use of older coal-fired power plants, fertilizer and pesticide runoff from crop production, and diminishment of the Jordan Aquifer.

name: iowa
sentence: Iowa has a humid continental climate throughout the state (Köppen climate classification Dfa) with extremes of both heat and cold.

name: iowa
sentence: The average annual temperature at Des Moines is 50 °F (10 °C); for some locations in the north, such as Mason City, the figure is about 45 °F (7 °C), while Keokuk, on the Mississippi River, averages 52 °F (11 °C).

name: iowa
sentence: Snowfall is common, with Des Moines getting about 26 days of snowfall a year, and other places, such as Shenandoah getting about 11 days of snowfall in a year.

name: iowa
sentence: Spring ushers in the beginning of the severe weather season.

name: iowa
sentence: Iowa averages about 50 days of thunderstorm activity per year.

name: iowa
sentence: The 30-year annual average Tornadoes in Iowa is 47.

name: iowa
sentence: In 2008, twelve people were killed by tornadoes in Iowa, making it the deadliest year since 1968 and also the second most tornadoes in a year with 105, matching the total from 2001.

name: iowa
sentence: Iowa summers are known for heat and humidity, with daytime temperatures sometimes near 90 °F (32 °C) and occasionally exceeding 100 °F (38 °C).

name: iowa
sentence: Average winters in the state have been known to drop well below freezing, even dropping below −18 °F (−28 °C).

name: iowa
sentence: Iowa's all-time hottest temperature of 118 °F (48 °C) was recorded at Keokuk on July 20, 1934, during a nationwide heat wave; the all-time lowest temperature of −47 °F (−44 °C) was recorded at Washta on January 12, 1912.

name: iowa
sentence: Iowa has a relatively smooth gradient of varying precipitation across the state, with areas in the southeast of the state receiving an average of over 38 inches (97 cm) of rain annually, and the northwest of the state receiving less than 28 inches (71 cm).

name: iowa
sentence: The pattern of precipitation across Iowa is seasonal, with more rain falling in the summer months.

name: iowa
sentence: Virtually statewide, the driest month is January or February, and the wettest month is June, owing to frequent showers and thunderstorms, some of which produce hail, damaging winds and/or tornadoes.

name: iowa
sentence: In Des Moines, roughly in the center of the state, over two-thirds of the 34.72 inches (88.2 cm) of rain falls from April through September, and about half the average annual precipitation falls from May through August, peaking in June.

name: iowa
sentence: When American Indians first arrived in what is now Iowa more than 13,000 years ago, they were hunters and gatherers living in a Pleistocene glacial landscape.

name: iowa
sentence: By the time European explorers and traders visited Iowa, American Indians were largely settled farmers with complex economic, social, and political systems.

name: iowa
sentence: This transformation happened gradually.

name: iowa
sentence: During the Archaic period (10,500 to 2,800 years ago), American Indians adapted to local environments and ecosystems, slowly becoming more sedentary as populations increased.

name: iowa
sentence: More than 3,000 years ago, during the Late Archaic period, American Indians in Iowa began utilizing domesticated plants.

name: iowa
sentence: The subsequent Woodland period saw an increased reliance on agriculture and social complexity, with increased use of mounds, ceramics, and specialized subsistence.

name: iowa
sentence: During the Late Prehistoric period (beginning about AD 900) increased use of maize and social changes led to social flourishing and nucleated settlements.

name: iowa
sentence: The arrival of European trade goods and diseases in the Protohistoric period led to dramatic population shifts and economic and social upheaval, with the arrival of new tribes and early European explorers and traders.

name: iowa
sentence: There were numerous Indian tribes living in Iowa at the time of early European exploration.

name: iowa
sentence: Tribes which were probably descendants of the prehistoric Oneota include the Dakota, Ho-Chunk, Ioway, and Otoe.

name: iowa
sentence: Tribes which arrived in Iowa in the late prehistoric or protohistoric periods include the Illiniwek, Meskwaki, Omaha, and Sauk.

name: iowa
sentence: The first known European explorers to document Iowa were Jacques Marquette and Louis Jolliet who traveled the Mississippi River in 1673 documenting several Indigenous villages on the Iowa side.

name: iowa
sentence: The area of Iowa was claimed for France and remained a French territory until 1763.

name: iowa
sentence: The French, before their impending defeat in the French and Indian War, transferred ownership to their ally, Spain.

name: iowa
sentence: Spain practiced very loose control over the Iowa region, granting trading licenses to French and British traders, who established trading posts along the Mississippi and Des Moines Rivers.

name: iowa
sentence: Iowa was part of a territory known as La Louisiane or Louisiana, and European traders were interested in lead and furs obtained by Indigenous people.

name: iowa
sentence: The Sauk and Meskwaki effectively controlled trade on the Mississippi in the late 18th century and early 19th century.

name: iowa
sentence: Among the early traders on the Mississippi were Julien Dubuque, Robert de la Salle, and Paul Marin.

name: iowa
sentence: Along the Missouri River at least five French and English trading houses were built before 1808.

name: iowa
sentence: In 1800, Napoleon Bonaparte took control of Louisiana from Spain in a treaty.

name: iowa
sentence: After the 1803 Louisiana Purchase, Congress divided the Louisiana Purchase into two parts—the Territory of Orleans and the District of Louisiana, with present-day Iowa falling in the latter.

name: iowa
sentence: The Indiana Territory was created in 1800 to exercise jurisdiction over this portion of the District

name: iowa
sentence: Much of Iowa was mapped by Zebulon Pike in 1805, but it was not until the construction of Fort Madison in 1808 that the US established tenuous military control over the region.

name: iowa
sentence: Fort Madison was built to control trade and establish US dominance over the Upper Mississippi, but it was poorly designed and disliked by the Sauk and Fox, many of whom allied with the British, who had not abandoned claims to the territory.

name: iowa
sentence: Fort Madison was defeated by British-supported Indigenous people in 1813 during the War of 1812, and Fort Shelby in Prairie du Chien, Wisconsin, also fell to the British.

name: iowa
sentence: Black Hawk took part in the siege of Fort Madison.

name: iowa
sentence: Another small military outpost was established along the Mississippi River in present-day Bellevue.

name: iowa
sentence: This poorly situated stockade was similarly attacked by hundreds of Indigenous people in 1813, but was successfully defended and later abandoned until settlers returned to the area in the mid-1830s.

name: iowa
sentence: After the war, the US re-established control of the region through the construction of Fort Armstrong, Fort Snelling in Minnesota, and Fort Atkinson in Nebraska.

name: iowa
sentence: The US encouraged settlement of the east side of the Mississippi and removal of Indians to the west.

name: iowa
sentence: A disputed 1804 treaty between Quashquame and William Henry Harrison that surrendered much of Illinois to the US enraged many Sauk and led to the 1832 Black Hawk War.

name: iowa
sentence: The Sauk and Meskwaki sold their land in the Mississippi Valley during 1832 in the Black Hawk Purchase and sold their remaining land in Iowa in 1842, most of them moving to a reservation in Kansas.

name: iowa
sentence: Many Meskwaki later returned to Iowa and settled near Tama, Iowa; the Meskwaki Settlement remains to this day.

name: iowa
sentence: In 1856 the Iowa Legislature passed an unprecedented act allowing the Meskawki to purchase the land.

name: iowa
sentence: However, in contrast to the unprecidented act of the Iowa Legislature, the United States Federal Government, through the use of Treaties, forced the Ho-Chunk from Iowa in 1848, and forced the Dakota from Iowa by 1858.

name: iowa
sentence: Western Iowa around modern Council Bluffs was used as an Indian Reservation for members of the Council of Three Fires.

name: iowa
sentence: The first American settlers officially moved to Iowa in June 1833.

name: iowa
sentence: Primarily, they were families from Ohio, Pennsylvania, New York, Indiana, Kentucky, and Virginia who settled along the western banks of the Mississippi River, founding the modern day cities of Dubuque and Bellevue.

name: iowa
sentence: On July 4, 1838, the US Congress established the Territory of Iowa.

name: iowa
sentence: President Martin Van Buren appointed Robert Lucas governor of the territory, which at the time had 22 counties and a population of 23,242.

name: iowa
sentence: Almost immediately after achieving territorial status, a clamor arose for statehood.

name: iowa
sentence: On December 28, 1846, Iowa became the 29th state in the Union when President James K. Polk signed Iowa's admission bill into law.

name: iowa
sentence: Once admitted to the Union, the state's boundary issues resolved, and most of its land purchased from Natives, Iowa set its direction to development and organized campaigns for settlers and investors, boasting the young frontier state's rich farmlands, fine citizens, free and open society, and good government.

name: iowa
sentence: Iowa has a long tradition of state and county fairs.

name: iowa
sentence: The first and second Iowa State Fairs were held in the more developed eastern part of the state at Fairfield.

name: iowa
sentence: The first fair was held October 25–27, 1854, at a cost of around $323.

name: iowa
sentence: Thereafter, the fair moved to locations closer to the center of the state and in 1886 found a permanent home in Des Moines.

name: iowa
sentence: The State Fair has been held annually since then, except for a few exceptions: 1898 due to the Spanish–American War and the World's Fair being held in nearby Omaha, Nebraska; from 1942 to 1945, due to World War II, as the fairgrounds were being used as an army supply depot; and in 2020 due to the COVID-19 pandemic in the United States.

name: iowa
sentence: Iowa supported the Union during the Civil War, voting heavily for Abraham Lincoln, though there was an antiwar "Copperhead" movement in the state, caused partially by a drop in crop prices caused by the war.

name: iowa
sentence: There were no battles in the state, although the Battle of Athens, Missouri, 1861, was fought just across the Des Moines River from Croton, Iowa, and shots from the battle landed in Iowa.

name: iowa
sentence: Iowa sent large supplies of food to the armies and the eastern cities.

name: iowa
sentence: Much of Iowa's support for the Union can be attributed to Samuel J. Kirkwood, its first wartime governor.

name: iowa
sentence: Of a total population of 675,000, about 116,000 men were subjected to military duty.

name: iowa
sentence: Iowa contributed proportionately more men to Civil War military service than did any other state, north or south, sending more than 75,000 volunteers to the armed forces, over one-sixth of whom were killed before the Confederates surrendered at Appomattox.

name: iowa
sentence: Most fought in the great campaigns in the Mississippi Valley and in the South.

name: iowa
sentence: Iowa troops fought at Wilson's Creek in Missouri, Pea Ridge in Arkansas, Forts Henry and Donelson, Shiloh, Chattanooga, Chickamauga, Missionary Ridge, and Rossville Gap as well as Vicksburg, Iuka, and Corinth.

name: iowa
sentence: They served with the Army of the Potomac in Virginia and fought under Union General Philip Sheridan in the Shenandoah Valley.

name: iowa
sentence: Many died and were buried at Andersonville.

name: iowa
sentence: They marched on General Nathaniel Banks' ill-starred expedition to the Red River.

name: iowa
sentence: Twenty-seven Iowans have been awarded the Medal of Honor, the highest military decoration awarded by the United States government, which was first awarded in the Civil War.

name: iowa
sentence: Iowa had several brigadier generals and four major generals—Grenville Mellen Dodge, Samuel R. Curtis, Francis J. Herron, and Frederick Steele—and saw many of its generals go on to state and national prominence following the war.

name: iowa
sentence: Following the Civil War, Iowa's population continued to grow dramatically, from 674,913 people in 1860 to 1,624,615 in 1880.

name: iowa
sentence: The American Civil War briefly brought higher profits.

name: iowa
sentence: In 1917, the United States entered World War I and farmers as well as all Iowans experienced a wartime economy.

name: iowa
sentence: For farmers, the change was significant.

name: iowa
sentence: Since the beginning of the war in 1914, Iowa farmers had experienced economic prosperity, which lasted until the end of the war.

name: iowa
sentence: In the economic sector, Iowa also has undergone considerable change.

name: iowa
sentence: Beginning with the first industries developed in the 1830s, which were mainly for processing materials grown in the area, Iowa has experienced a gradual increase in the number of business and manufacturing operations.

name: iowa
sentence: The transition from an agricultural economy to a mixed economy happened slowly.

name: iowa
sentence: The Great Depression and World War II accelerated the shift away from smallholder farming to larger farms, and began a trend of urbanization.

name: iowa
sentence: The period after World War II witnessed a particular increase in manufacturing operations.

name: iowa
sentence: The farm crisis of the 1980s caused a major recession in Iowa, causing poverty not seen since the Depression.

name: iowa
sentence: The crisis spurred a major, decade-long population decline.

name: iowa
sentence: After bottoming out in the 1980s, Iowa's economy began to become increasingly less dependent on agriculture.

name: iowa
sentence: By the early 21st century, it was characterized by a mix of manufacturing, biotechnology, finance and insurance services, and government services.

name: iowa
sentence: The population of Iowa has increased at a faster rate than the US as a whole, and Iowa now has a predominantly urban population.

name: iowa
sentence: The Iowa Economic Development Authority, created in 2011 has replaced the Iowa Department of Economic Development and its annual reports are a source of economic information.

name: iowa
sentence: The United States Census Bureau estimates the population of Iowa was 3,155,070 on July 1, 2019, a 3.57% increase since the 2010 Census.

name: iowa
sentence: Of the residents of Iowa, 70.8% were born in Iowa, 23.6% were born in a different US state, 0.6% were born in Puerto Rico, US Island areas, or born abroad to American parent(s), and 5% were foreign born.

name: iowa
sentence: Immigration from outside the United States resulted in a net increase of 29,386 people, while migration within the country produced a net loss of 41,140 people.

name: iowa
sentence: 6.5% of Iowa's population were reported as under the age of five, 22.6% under 18, and 14.7% were 65 or older.

name: iowa
sentence: Males made up approximately 49.6% of the population.

name: iowa
sentence: Iowa has banned sanctuary cities.

name: iowa
sentence: The population density of the state is 52.7 people per square mile.

name: iowa
sentence: As of the 2010 Census, the center of population of Iowa is in Marshall County, near Melbourne.

name: iowa
sentence: As of the 2010 Census, the population of Iowa was 3,046,355.

name: iowa
sentence: The gender makeup of the state was 49.5% male and 50.5% female.

name: iowa
sentence: 23.9% of the population were under the age of 18

name: iowa
sentence: The table below shows the racial composition of Iowa's population as of 2018.

name: iowa
sentence: According to the 2016 American Community Survey, 5.6% of Iowa's population were of Hispanic or Latino origin (of any race): Mexican (4.3%), Puerto Rican (0.2%), Cuban (0.1%), and other Hispanic or Latino origin (1.0%).

name: iowa
sentence: The five largest ancestry groups were: German (35.1%), Irish (13.5%), English (8.2%), American (5.8%), and Norwegian (5.0%).

name: iowa
sentence: Iowa's population is more urban than rural, with 61 percent living in urban areas in 2000, a trend that began in the early 20th century.

name: iowa
sentence: Urban counties in Iowa grew 8.5% from 2000 to 2008, while rural counties declined by 4.2%.

name: iowa
sentence: The shift from rural to urban has caused population increases in more urbanized counties such as Dallas, Johnson, Linn, Polk, and Scott, at the expense of more rural counties.

name: iowa
sentence: Iowa, in common with other Midwestern states (especially Kansas, Nebraska, North Dakota, and South Dakota), is feeling the brunt of rural flight, although Iowa has been gaining population since approximately 1990.

name: iowa
sentence: Some smaller communities, such as Denison and Storm Lake, have mitigated this population loss through gains in immigrant laborers.

name: iowa
sentence: Another demographic problem for Iowa is the brain drain, in which educated young adults leave the state in search of better prospects in higher education or employment.

name: iowa
sentence: During the 1990s, Iowa had the second highest exodus rate for single, educated young adults, second only to North Dakota.

name: iowa
sentence: Note: Births in table don't add up, because Hispanics are counted both by their ethnicity and by their race, giving a higher overall number.

name: iowa
sentence: A 2014 survey by Pew Research Center found 60% of Iowans are Protestant, while 18% are Catholic, and 1% are of non-Christian religions.

name: iowa
sentence: 21% responded with non-religious, and 1% did not answer.

name: iowa
sentence: A survey from the Association of Religion Data Archives (ARDA) in 2010 found that the largest Protestant denominations were the United Methodist Church with 235,190 adherents and the Evangelical Lutheran Church in America with 229,557.

name: iowa
sentence: The largest non-Protestant religion was Catholicism with 503,080 adherents.

name: iowa
sentence: The state has a great number of Reformed denominations.

name: iowa
sentence: The Presbyterian Church (USA) had almost 290 congregations and 51,380 members followed by the Reformed Church in America with 80 churches and 40,000 members, and the United Church of Christ had 180 churches and 39,000 members.

name: iowa
sentence: The study Religious Congregations & Membership: 2000 found in the southernmost two tiers of Iowa counties and in other counties in the center of the state, the largest religious group was the United Methodist Church; in the northeast part of the state, including Dubuque and Linn counties (where Cedar Rapids is located), the Catholic Church was the largest; and in ten counties, including three in the northern tier, the Evangelical Lutheran Church in America was the largest.

name: iowa
sentence: The study also found rapid growth in Evangelical Christian denominations.

name: iowa
sentence: Dubuque is home to the Archdiocese of Dubuque, which serves as the ecclesiastical province for all three other dioceses in the state and for all the Catholics in the entire state of Iowa.

name: iowa
sentence: Historically, religious sects and orders who desired to live apart from the rest of society established themselves in Iowa, such as the Amish and Mennonite near Kalona and in other parts of eastern Iowa such as Davis County and Buchanan County.

name: iowa
sentence: Other religious sects and orders living apart include Quakers around West Branch and Le Grand, German Pietists who founded the Amana Colonies, followers of Transcendental Meditation who founded Maharishi Vedic City, and Order of Cistercians of the Strict Observance monks and nuns at the New Melleray and Our Lady of the Mississippi Abbies near Dubuque.

name: iowa
sentence: As of 2016 about 6,000 Jews live in Iowa, with about 3,000 of them in Des Moines.

name: iowa
sentence: English is the most common language in Iowa, used by 94% of the population.

name: iowa
sentence: William Labov and colleagues, in the monumental Atlas of North American English found the English spoken in Iowa divides into multiple linguistic regions.

name: iowa
sentence: Natives of northern Iowa—including Sioux City, Fort Dodge, and the Waterloo region—tend to speak the dialect linguists call North Central American English, which is also found in North and South Dakota, Minnesota, Wisconsin, and Michigan.

name: iowa
sentence: Natives of central and southern Iowa—including such cities as Council Bluffs, Davenport, Des Moines, and Iowa City—tend to speak the North Midland dialect also found in eastern Nebraska, central Illinois, and central Indiana.

name: iowa
sentence: Natives of East-Central Iowa—including cities such as Cedar Rapids, Dubuque, and Clinton tend to speak with the Northern Cities Vowel Shift, a dialect that extends from this area and east across the Great Lakes Region.

name: iowa
sentence: After English, Spanish is the second-most-common language spoken in Iowa, with 120,000 people in Iowa of Hispanic or Latino origin and 47,000 people born in Latin America.

name: iowa
sentence: The third-most-common language is German, spoken by 17,000 people in Iowa; two notable German dialects used in Iowa include Amana German spoken around the Amana Colonies, and Pennsylvania German, spoken among the Amish in Iowa.

name: iowa
sentence: The Babel Proclamation of 1918 banned the speaking of German in public.

name: iowa
sentence: Around Pella, residents of Dutch descent once spoke the Pella Dutch dialect.

name: iowa
sentence: No other language is spoken by more than 0.5 percent of the Iowa population.

name: iowa
sentence: The only indigenous language used regularly in Iowa is Meskwaki, used around the Meskwaki Settlement.

name: iowa
sentence: Ames is the home of Iowa State University, the Iowa State Center, and Reiman Gardens.

name: iowa
sentence: Des Moines is the largest city and metropolitan area in Iowa and the state's political and economic center.

name: iowa
sentence: It is home to the Iowa State Capitol, the State Historical Society of Iowa Museum, Drake University, Des Moines Art Center, Greater Des Moines Botanical Garden, Principal Riverwalk, the Iowa State Fair, Terrace Hill, and the World Food Prize.

name: iowa
sentence: Nearby attractions include Adventureland and Prairie Meadows Racetrack Casino in Altoona, Living History Farms in Urbandale, Trainland USA in Colfax, and the Iowa Speedway and Valle Drive-In in Newton.

name: iowa
sentence: Boone hosts the biennial Farm Progress Show and is home to the Mamie Doud Eisenhower museum, the Boone & Scenic Valley Railroad, and Ledges State Park.

name: iowa
sentence: The Meskwaki Settlement west of Tama is the only American Indian settlement in Iowa and is host to a large annual Pow-wow.

name: iowa
sentence: Madison County is known for its covered bridges.

name: iowa
sentence: Also in Madison County is the John Wayne Birthplace Museum is in Winterset.

name: iowa
sentence: Other communities with vibrant historic downtown areas include Newton, Indianola, Pella, Knoxville, Marshalltown, Perry, and Story City.

name: iowa
sentence: Iowa City is home to the University of Iowa, which includes the Iowa Writers' Workshop, and the Old Capitol building.

name: iowa
sentence: Because of the extraordinary history in the teaching and sponsoring of creative writing that emanated from the Iowa Writers' Workshop and related programs, Iowa City was the first American city designated by the United Nations as a "City of Literature" in the UNESCO Creative Cities Network.

name: iowa
sentence: The Herbert Hoover National Historic Site and Herbert Hoover Presidential Library and Museum are in West Branch.

name: iowa
sentence: The Amana Colonies are a group of settlements of German Pietists comprising seven villages listed as National Historic Landmarks.

name: iowa
sentence: The Cedar Rapids Museum of Art has collections of paintings by Grant Wood and Marvin Cone.

name: iowa
sentence: Cedar Rapids is also home to the National Czech & Slovak Museum & Library and Iowa's only National Trust for Historic Preservation Site, Brucemore mansion.

name: iowa
sentence: Davenport boasts the Figge Art Museum, River Music Experience, Putnam Museum, Davenport Skybridge, Quad City Symphony Orchestra, Ballet Quad Cities, and plays host to the annual Bix Beiderbecke Memorial Jazz Festival, and the Quad City Air Show, which is the largest airshow in the state.

name: iowa
sentence: Other communities with vibrant historic downtown areas include West Liberty, Fairfield, Burlington, Mount Pleasant, Fort Madison, LeClaire, Mount Vernon, Ottumwa, Washington, and Wilton.

name: iowa
sentence: Along Interstate 80 near Walcott lies the world's largest truck stop, Iowa 80.

name: iowa
sentence: Some of the most dramatic scenery in Iowa is found in the unique Loess Hills which are found along Iowa's western border.

name: iowa
sentence: Sioux City is the largest city in western Iowa and is found on the convergence of the Missouri, Floyd, and Big Sioux Rivers.

name: iowa
sentence: The Sioux City Metropolitan Area encompasses areas in three states: Iowa, Nebraska, and South Dakota.

name: iowa
sentence: Sioux City boasts a revitalized downtown and includes attractions such as the Hard Rock Hotel and Casino, Sergeant Floyd Monument, Sergeant Floyd River Museum, the Tyson Events Center, Southern Hills Mall, the Orpheum Theater, and more.

name: iowa
sentence: The historic downtown area is also filled with multiple restaurants, bars, and other entertainment venues.

name: iowa
sentence: Sioux City is home to two higher education institutions, Morningside College and Briar Cliff University.

name: iowa
sentence: Le Mars is in the northeastern part of the Sioux City Metropolitan Area and is the self-proclaimed "Ice Cream Capital of the World".

name: iowa
sentence: Le Mars is home to Wells Enterprises, one of the largest ice cream manufacturers in the world.

name: iowa
sentence: Attractions in Le Mars include the Wells Visitor Center and Ice Cream Parlor, Archie's Waeside (steak house), Bob's Drive Inn, Tonsfeldt Round Barn, Plymouth County Fairgrounds, Plymouth County Museum, and Plymouth County Courthouse.

name: iowa
sentence: Le Mars hosts multiple ice cream themed community events each year.

name: iowa
sentence: Council Bluffs, part of the Omaha (Nebr.)

name: iowa
sentence: Metropolitan Area and a hub of southwest Iowa, sits at the base of the Loess Hills National Scenic Byway.

name: iowa
sentence: With three casino resorts, the city also includes such cultural attractions as the Western Hills Trails Center, Union Pacific Railroad Museum, the Grenville M. Dodge House, and the Lewis and Clark Monument, with clear views of the Downtown Omaha skyline found throughout the city.

name: iowa
sentence: The Iowa Great Lakes is made up of multiple small towns, such as Spirit Lake, Arnolds Park, Milford, and Okoboji.

name: iowa
sentence: Multiple resorts and other tourist attractions are found in and around these towns surrounding the popular lakes.

name: iowa
sentence: Arnolds Park, one of the oldest amusement parks in the country, is located on Lake Okoboji in Arnolds Park.

name: iowa
sentence: The Sanford Museum and Planetarium in Cherokee, Grotto of the Redemption in West Bend, The Danish Immigrant Museum in Elk Horn, and the Fort Museum and Frontier Village in Fort Dodge are other regional destinations.

name: iowa
sentence: Every year in early May, the city of Orange City holds the annual Tulip Festival, a celebration of the strong Dutch heritage in the region.

name: iowa
sentence: Northwest Iowa is home to some of the largest concentrations of wind turbine farms in the world.

name: iowa
sentence: Other western communities with vibrant historic downtown areas include Storm Lake, Spencer, Glenwood, Carroll, Harlan, Atlantic, Red Oak, Denison, Creston, Mount Ayr, Sac City, and Walnut.

name: iowa
sentence: The Driftless Area of northeast Iowa has many steep hills and deep valleys, checkered with forest and terraced fields.

name: iowa
sentence: Effigy Mounds National Monument in Allamakee and Clayton Counties has the largest assemblage of animal-shaped prehistoric mounds in the world.

name: iowa
sentence: Waterloo is home of the Grout Museum and is headquarters of the Silos & Smokestacks National Heritage Area.

name: iowa
sentence: Cedar Falls is home of the University of Northern Iowa.

name: iowa
sentence: Dubuque is a regional tourist destination with attractions such as the National Mississippi River Museum and Aquarium and the Port of Dubuque.

name: iowa
sentence: Dyersville is home to the famed Field of Dreams baseball diamond.

name: iowa
sentence: Maquoketa Caves State Park, near Maquoketa, contains more caves than any other state park.

name: iowa
sentence: Fort Atkinson State Preserve in Fort Atkinson has the remains of an original 1840s Dragoon fortification.

name: iowa
sentence: Fort Dodge is home of The Fort historical museum and the Blanden Art Museum, and host Frontiers Days which celebrate the town history.

name: iowa
sentence: Other communities with vibrant historic downtown areas include Decorah, McGregor, Mason City, Elkader, Bellevue, Guttenberg, Algona, Spillville, Charles City, and Independence.

name: iowa
sentence: RAGBRAI, the Register's Annual Great Bike Ride Across Iowa, attracts thousands of bicyclists and support personnel.

name: iowa
sentence: It has crossed the state on various routes each year since 1973.

name: iowa
sentence: Iowa is home to more than 70 wineries, and hosts five regional wine tasting trails.

name: iowa
sentence: Many Iowa communities hold farmers' markets during warmer months; these are typically weekly events, but larger cities can host multiple markets.

name: iowa
sentence: CNBC's list of "Top States for Business in 2010" has recognized Iowa as the sixth best state in the nation.

name: iowa
sentence: Scored in 10 individual categories, Iowa was ranked 1st when it came to the "Cost of Doing Business"; this includes all taxes, utility costs, and other costs associated with doing business.

name: iowa
sentence: Iowa was also ranked 10th in "Economy", 12th in "Business Friendliness", 16th in "Education", 17th in both "Cost of Living" and "Quality of Life", 20th in "Workforce", 29th in "Technology and Innovation", 32nd in "Transportation" and the lowest ranking was 36th in "Access to Capital".

name: iowa
sentence: While Iowa is often viewed as a farming state, agriculture is a relatively small portion of the state's diversified economy, with manufacturing, biotechnology, finance and insurance services, and government services contributing substantially to Iowa's economy.

name: iowa
sentence: This economic diversity has helped Iowa weather the late 2000s recession better than most states, with unemployment substantially lower than the rest of the nation.

name: iowa
sentence: If the economy is measured by gross domestic product, in 2005 Iowa's GDP was about $124 billion.

name: iowa
sentence: If measured by gross state product, for 2005 it was $113.5 billion.

name: iowa
sentence: Its per capita income for 2006 was $23,340.

name: iowa
sentence: On July 2, 2009, Standard & Poor's rated the state of Iowa's credit as AAA (the highest of its credit ratings, held by only 11 US state governments).

name: iowa
sentence: As of December 2015, the state's unemployment rate is 3.4%.

name: iowa
sentence: Manufacturing is the largest sector of Iowa's economy, with $20.8 billion (21%) of Iowa's 2003 gross state product.

name: iowa
sentence: Major manufacturing sectors include food processing, heavy machinery, and agricultural chemicals.

name: iowa
sentence: Sixteen percent of Iowa's workforce is dedicated to manufacturing.

name: iowa
sentence: Food processing is the largest component of manufacturing.

name: iowa
sentence: Besides processed food, industrial outputs include machinery, electric equipment, chemical products, publishing, and primary metals.

name: iowa
sentence: Companies with direct or indirect processing facilities in Iowa include ConAgra Foods, Wells Blue Bunny, Barilla, Heinz, Tone's Spices, General Mills, and Quaker Oats.

name: iowa
sentence: Meatpacker Tyson Foods has 11 locations, second only to its headquarter state Arkansas.

name: iowa
sentence: Major non-food manufacturing firms with production facilities in Iowa include 3M, Arconic, Amana Corporation, Emerson Electric, The HON Company, SSAB, John Deere, Lennox Manufacturing, Pella Corporation, Procter & Gamble, Vermeer Company, and Winnebago Industries.

name: iowa
sentence: Though industrial-scale, commodity agriculture predominates in much of the state, Iowa has seen growth in the organic farming sector.

name: iowa
sentence: Iowa ranks fifth in the nation in total number of organic farms.

name: iowa
sentence: In 2016, there were approximately 732 organic farms in the state, an increase of about 5% from the previous year, and 103,136 organic acres, an increase of 9,429 from the previous year.

name: iowa
sentence: Iowa has also seen an increase in demand for local, sustainably-grown food.

name: iowa
sentence: Northeast Iowa, part of the Driftless Area, has led the state in development of its regional food system and grows and consumes more local food than any other region in Iowa.

name: iowa
sentence: Iowa's Driftless Region is also home to the nationally recognized Seed Savers Exchange, a non-profit seed bank housed at an 890-acre heritage farm near Decorah, in the northeast corner of the state.

name: iowa
sentence: The largest nongovernmental seed bank of its kind in the United States, Seed Savers Exchange safeguards more than 20,000 varieties of rare, heirloom seeds.

name: iowa
sentence: As of 2007, the direct production and sale of conventional agricultural commodities contributed only about 3.5% of Iowa's gross state product.

name: iowa
sentence: In 2002 the impact of the indirect role of agriculture in Iowa's economy, including agriculture-affiliated business, was calculated at 16.4% in terms of value added and 24.3% in terms of total output.

name: iowa
sentence: This was lower than the economic impact of non-farm manufacturing, which accounted for 22.4% of total value added and 26.5% of total output.

name: iowa
sentence: Iowa's main conventional agricultural commodities are hogs, corn, soybeans, oats, cattle, eggs, and dairy products.

name: iowa
sentence: Iowa is the nation's largest producer of ethanol and corn and some years is the largest grower of soybeans.

name: iowa
sentence: In 2008, the 92,600 farms in Iowa produced 19% of the nation's corn, 17% of the soybeans, 30% of the hogs, and 14% of the eggs.

name: iowa
sentence: As of 2009 major Iowa agricultural product processors include Archer Daniels Midland, Cargill, Inc., Diamond V Mills, and Quaker Oats.

name: iowa
sentence: As of 2014, there were 16 organizations offering health insurance products in Iowa, per the State of Iowa Insurance Division.Iowa was the 4th out of 10 states with the biggest drop in competition levels of health insurance between 2010 and 2011, per the 2013 annual report on the level of competition in the health insurance industry by the American Medical Association using 2011 data from HealthLeaders-Interstudy, the most comprehensive source of data on enrollment in health maintenance organization (HMO), preferred provider organization (PPO), point-of-service (POS) and consumer-driven health care plans.According to the AMA annual report from 2007 Wellmark Blue Cross Blue Shield had provided 71% of the state's health insurance.

name: iowa
sentence: The Iowa Insurance Division "Annual report to the Iowa Governor and the Iowa Legislature" from November 2014 looked at the 95% of health insurers by premium, which are 10 companies.

name: iowa
sentence: It found Wellmark Inc. to dominate the three health insurance markets it examined (individual, small group and large group) at 52–67%.

name: iowa
sentence: Wellmark HealthPlan of Iowa and Wellmark Inc had the highest risk-based capital percentages of all 10 providers at 1158% and 1132%, respectively.

name: iowa
sentence: Rising RBC is an indication of profits.

name: iowa
sentence: Iowa has a strong financial and insurance sector, with approximately 6,100 firms, including AEGON, Nationwide Group, Aviva USA, Farm Bureau Financial Services, Voya Financial, Marsh Affinity Group, MetLife, Principal Financial Group, Principal Capital Management, Wells Fargo, and University of Iowa Community Credit Union.

name: iowa
sentence: Iowa is host to at least two business incubators, Iowa State University Research Park and the BioVentures Center at the University of Iowa.

name: iowa
sentence: The Research Park hosts about 50 companies, among them NewLink Genetics, which develops cancer immunotherapeutics, and the US animal health division of Boehringer Ingelheim, Vetmedica.

name: iowa
sentence: Ethanol production consumes about a third of Iowa's corn production, and renewable fuels account for eight percent of the state's gross domestic product.

name: iowa
sentence: A total of 39 ethanol plants produced 3.1 billion US gallons (12,000,000 m3) of fuel in 2009.

name: iowa
sentence: Renewable energy has become a major economic force in northern and western Iowa, with wind turbine electrical generation increasing exponentially since 1990.

name: iowa
sentence: In 2019, wind power in Iowa accounted for 42% of electrical energy produced, and 10,201 megawatts of generating capacity had been installed at the end of the year.

name: iowa
sentence: Iowa ranked first of US states in percentage of total power generated by wind and second in wind generating capacity behind Texas.

name: iowa
sentence: Major producers of turbines and components in Iowa include Acciona Energy of West Branch, TPI Composites of Newton, and Siemens Energy of Fort Madison.

name: iowa
sentence: In 2016, Iowa was the headquarters for three of the top 2,000 companies for revenue.

name: iowa
sentence: They include Principal Financial, Rockwell Collins, and American Equity Investment.

name: iowa
sentence: Iowa is also headquarters to other companies including Hy-Vee, Pella Corporation, Vermeer Company, Kum & Go gas stations, Von Maur, Pioneer Hi-Bred, and Fareway.

name: iowa
sentence: Tax is collected by the Iowa Department of Revenue.

name: iowa
sentence: Iowa imposes taxes on net state income of individuals, estates, and trusts.

name: iowa
sentence: There are nine income tax brackets, ranging from 0.36% to 8.98%, as well as four corporate income tax brackets ranging from 6% to 12%, giving Iowa the country's highest marginal corporate tax rate.

name: iowa
sentence: The state sales tax rate is 6%, with non-prepared food having no tax.

name: iowa
sentence: Iowa has one local option sales tax that may be imposed by counties after an election.

name: iowa
sentence: Property tax is levied on the taxable value of real property.

name: iowa
sentence: Iowa has more than 2,000 taxing authorities.

name: iowa
sentence: Most property is taxed by more than one taxing authority.

name: iowa
sentence: The tax rate differs in each locality and is a composite of county, city or rural township, school district and special levies.

name: iowa
sentence: Iowa allows its residents to deduct their federal income taxes from their state income taxes.

name: iowa
sentence: Iowa has four primary interstate highways.

name: iowa
sentence: Interstate 29 (I-29) travels along the state's western edge through Council Bluffs and Sioux City.

name: iowa
sentence: I-35 travels from the Missouri state line to the Minnesota state line through the state's center, including Des Moines.

name: iowa
sentence: I-74 begins at I-80 just northeast of Davenport.

name: iowa
sentence: I-80 travels from the Nebraska state line to the Illinois state line through the center of the state, including Council Bluffs, Des Moines, Iowa City, and the Quad Cities.

name: iowa
sentence: I-380 is an auxiliary Interstate Highway, which travels from I-80 near Iowa City through Cedar Rapids ending in Waterloo and is part of the Avenue of the Saints highway.

name: iowa
sentence: Iowa is among the few jurisdictions where municipalities install speed cameras on interstate highways providing a substantial revenue source from out of state drivers.

name: iowa
sentence: Iowa is served by several regional airports including the Des Moines International Airport, the Eastern Iowa Airport, in Cedar Rapids, Quad City International Airport, in Moline, Illinois, and Eppley Airfield, in Omaha, Nebraska.

name: iowa
sentence: Smaller airports in the state include the Davenport Municipal Airport (Iowa), Dubuque Regional Airport, Fort Dodge Regional Airport, Mason City Municipal Airport, Sioux Gateway Airport, Southeast Iowa Regional Airport, and Waterloo Regional Airport.

name: iowa
sentence: Amtrak's California Zephyr serves the south of Iowa with stops at Burlington, Mount Pleasant, Ottumwa, Osceola, and Creston on its daily route between Chicago and Emeryville, California.

name: iowa
sentence: Fort Madison is served by Amtrak's Southwest Chief, running daily between Chicago and Los Angeles.

name: iowa
sentence: As of 2018, the 43rd and current Governor of Iowa is Kim Reynolds (R).

name: iowa
sentence: Other statewide elected officials are:

name: iowa
sentence: The Code of Iowa contains Iowa's statutory laws.

name: iowa
sentence: It is periodically updated by the Iowa Legislative Service Bureau, with a new edition published in odd-numbered years and a supplement published in even-numbered years.

name: iowa
sentence: Iowa is an alcohol monopoly or alcoholic beverage control state.

name: iowa
sentence: The two US

name: iowa
sentence: Senatortors:

name: iowa
sentence: The four US

name: iowa
sentence: Representatives:

name: iowa
sentence: After the 2010 United States Census and the resulting redistricting, Iowa lost one seat in Congress, falling to four seats in the US House of Representatives.

name: iowa
sentence: Incumbent US

name: iowa
sentence: Representatives Leonard Boswell (D) and Tom Latham (R) ran against each other in 2012 in the third congressional district which had new boundaries

name: iowa
sentence: King represented the old fifth congressional district.

name: iowa
sentence: In Iowa, the term "political party" refers to political organizations which have received two percent or more of the votes cast for president or governor in the "last preceding general election".

name: iowa
sentence: Iowa recognizes three political parties—the Republican Party, the Democratic Party, and the Libertarian Party.

name: iowa
sentence: The Libertarian Party obtained official political party status in 2017 as a result of presidential candidate Gary Johnson receiving 3.8% of the Iowa vote in the 2016 general election.

name: iowa
sentence: Third parties, officially termed "nonparty political organizations", can appear on the ballot as well.

name: iowa
sentence: Four of these have had candidates on the ballot in Iowa since 2004 for various positions: the Constitution Party, the Green Party, the Pirate Party, and the Socialist Workers Party.

name: iowa
sentence: As a result of the 2010 elections, each party controlled one house of the Iowa General Assembly: the House had a Republican majority, while the Senatorte had a Democratic majority.

name: iowa
sentence: As a result of the 2016 elections, Republicans gained control of the Senatorte.

name: iowa
sentence: Incumbent Democratic governor Chet Culver was defeated in 2010 by Republican Terry Branstad, who had served as governor from 1983 to 1999.

name: iowa
sentence: On December 14, 2015, Branstad became the longest serving governor in US history, serving (at that time) 20 years, 11 months, and 3 days; eclipsing George Clinton, who served 21 years until 1804.

name: iowa
sentence: Lieutenant Governor Kim Reynolds succeeded him on May 24, 2017, following Branstad's appointment as US

name: iowa
sentence: Ambassador to China.

name: iowa
sentence: As of February 1, 2016, there were 2,095,639 registered voters.

name: iowa
sentence: 635,687 or 30.3% were Democrats, 800,629 or 38.2% of voters were not registered in a party, 651,039 or 31.1% were Republicans, and 8,284 or 0.004% were registered with another party.

name: iowa
sentence: The state gets considerable attention every four years because the Iowa caucus, gatherings of voters to select delegates to the state conventions, is the first presidential caucus in the country.

name: iowa
sentence: The caucuses, held in January or February of the election year, involve people gathering in homes or public places and choosing their candidates, rather than casting secret ballots as is done in a presidential primary election.Along with the New Hampshire primary the following week, Iowa's caucuses have become the starting points for choosing the two major-party candidates for president.

name: iowa
sentence: The national and international media give Iowa and New Hampshire extensive attention, which gives Iowa voters leverage.

name: iowa
sentence: In 2007 presidential campaign spending was the seventh highest in the country.

name: iowa
sentence: In the 19th century Iowa was among the earliest states to enact prohibitions against race discrimination, especially in education, but was slow to achieve full integration in the 20th century.

name: iowa
sentence: In the first decision of the Iowa Supreme Court—In Re the Matter of Ralph, decided July 1839—the Court rejected slavery in a decision that found a slave named Ralph became free when he stepped on Iowa soil, 26 years before the end of the Civil War.

name: iowa
sentence: The state did away with racial barriers to marriage in 1851, more than 100 years before the US Supreme Court would ban miscegenation statutes nationwide.

name: iowa
sentence: The Iowa Supreme Court decided Clark v. The board of directors in 1868, ruling that racially segregated "separate but equal" schools had no place in Iowa, 85 years before Brown v. Board of Education.

name: iowa
sentence: By 1875, a number of additional court rulings effectively ended segregation in Iowa schools.

name: iowa
sentence: Social and housing discrimination continued against Blacks at state universities until the 1950s.

name: iowa
sentence: The Court heard Coger v. The North Western Union Packet Co. in 1873, ruling against racial discrimination in public accommodations 91 years before the US Supreme Court reached the same decision.

name: iowa
sentence: In 1884, the Iowa Civil Rights Act apparently outlawed discrimination by businesses, reading: "All persons within this state shall be entitled to the full and equal enjoyment of the accommodations, advantages, facilities, and privileges of inns, restaurants, chophouses, eating houses, lunch counters, and all other places where refreshments are served, public conveyances, barber shops, bathhouses, theaters, and all other places of amusement."

name: iowa
sentence: However, the courts chose to narrowly apply this act, allowing de facto discrimination to continue.

name: iowa
sentence: Racial discrimination at public businesses was not deemed illegal until 1949, when the court ruled in State of Iowa v. Katz that businesses had to serve customers regardless of race; the case began when Edna Griffin was denied service at a Des Moines drugstore.

name: iowa
sentence: Full racial civil rights were codified under the Iowa Civil Rights Act of 1965.

name: iowa
sentence: As with racial equality, Iowa was a vanguard in women's rights in the mid-19th century, but did not allow women the right to vote until the Nineteenth Amendment to the United States Constitution was ratified in 1920, Iowa legislature being one of the ratifying votes.

name: iowa
sentence: In 1847, the University of Iowa became the first public university in the US to admit men and women on an equal basis.

name: iowa
sentence: In 1869, Iowa became the first state in the union to admit women to the practice of law, with the Court ruling women may not be denied the right to practice law in Iowa and admitting Arabella A. Mansfield to the practice of law.

name: iowa
sentence: Several attempts to grant full voting rights to Iowa women were defeated between 1870 and 1919.

name: iowa
sentence: In 1894 women were given "partial suffrage", which allowed them to vote on issues, but not for candidates.

name: iowa
sentence: It was not until the ratification of the Nineteenth Amendment that women had full suffrage in Iowa.

name: iowa
sentence: Although Iowa supported the Federal Equal Rights Amendment, in 1980 and 1992 Iowa voters rejected an Equal Rights Amendment to the state constitution.

name: iowa
sentence: Iowa added the word "women" to the Iowa Constitution in 1998.

name: iowa
sentence: After the amendment, it reads: "All men and women are, by nature, free and equal, and have certain inalienable rights—among which are those of enjoying and defending life and liberty, acquiring, possessing and protecting property, and pursuing and obtaining safety and happiness."

name: iowa
sentence: In May 2018 Iowa signed into law one of the country's most restrictive abortion bans: the requirement that a doctor cannot perform an abortion if they can detect a fetal heartbeat, which in many cases would restrict abortions pregnancies less than six weeks old.

name: iowa

name: iowa

sentence: Iowa was one of the leading states in the high school movement, and continues to be among the top educational performers today.

name: kansas
sentence: Kansas ( (listen)) is a US state in the Midwestern United States.

name: kansas
sentence: Its capital is Topeka and its largest city is Wichita.

name: kansas
sentence: Kansas is bordered by Nebraska to the north

name: kansas
sentence: Kansas is named after the Kansas River, which in turn was named after the Kansa Native Americans who lived along its banks.

name: kansas
sentence: The tribe's name (natively kką:ze) is often said to mean "people of the (south) wind" although this was probably not the term's original meaning.

name: kansas
sentence: For thousands of years, what is now Kansas was home to numerous and diverse Native American tribes.

name: kansas
sentence: Tribes in the eastern part of the state generally lived in villages along the river valleys.

name: kansas
sentence: Tribes in the western part of the state were semi-nomadic and hunted large herds of bison.

name: kansas
sentence: Kansas was first settled by Americans in 1827 with the establishment of Fort Leavenworth.

name: kansas
sentence: The pace of settlement accelerated in the 1850s, in the midst of political wars over the slavery debate.

name: kansas
sentence: When it was officially opened to settlement by the US government in 1854 with the Kansas–Nebraska Act, abolitionist Free-Staters from New England and pro-slavery settlers from neighboring Missouri rushed to the territory to determine whether Kansas would become a free state or a slave state.

name: kansas
sentence: Thus, the area was a hotbed of violence and chaos in its early days as these forces collided, and was known as Bleeding Kansas.

name: kansas
sentence: The abolitionists prevailed, and on January 29, 1861, Kansas entered the Union as a free state, hence the unofficial nickname "The Free State".

name: kansas
sentence: By 2015, Kansas was one of the most productive agricultural states, producing high yields of wheat, corn, sorghum, and soybeans.

name: kansas
sentence: Kansas, which has an area of 82,278 square miles (213,100 square kilometers) is the 15th-largest state by area and is the 34th most-populous of the 50 states with a population of 2,913,314.

name: kansas
sentence: Residents of Kansas are called Kansans.

name: kansas
sentence: Mount Sunflower is Kansas's highest point at 4,039 feet (1,231 meters).

name: kansas
sentence: Before European colonization, Kansas was occupied by the Caddoan Wichita and later the Siouan Kaw people.

name: kansas
sentence: The first European to set foot in present-day Kansas was the Spanish conquistador Francisco Vázquez de Coronado, who explored the area in 1541.

name: kansas
sentence: Between 1763 and 1803 the territory of Kansas was integrated into Spanish Louisiana.

name: kansas
sentence: The governor Luis de Unzaga 'le Conciliateur', during that period, promoted expeditions and good relations with the Amerindians peoples, among the explorers were Antoine de Marigny and others who continued trading across the Kansas River, especially at its confluence with the Missouri River, tributaries of the Mississippi River.

name: kansas
sentence: In 1803, most of modern Kansas was acquired by the United States as part of the Louisiana Purchase.

name: kansas
sentence: Southwest Kansas, however, was still a part of Spain, Mexico, and the Republic of Texas until the conclusion of the Mexican–American War in 1848, when these lands were ceded to the United States.

name: kansas
sentence: From 1812 to 1821, Kansas was part of the Missouri Territory.

name: kansas
sentence: The Santa Fe Trail traversed Kansas from 1821 to 1880, transporting manufactured goods from Missouri and silver and furs from Santa Fe, New Mexico.

name: kansas
sentence: Wagon ruts from the trail are still visible in the prairie today.

name: kansas
sentence: In 1827, Fort Leavenworth became the first permanent settlement of white Americans in the future state.

name: kansas
sentence: The Kansas–Nebraska Act became law on May 30, 1854, establishing Nebraska Territory and Kansas Territory, and opening the area to broader settlement by whites.

name: kansas
sentence: Kansas Territory stretched all the way to the Continental Divide and included the sites of present-day Denver, Colorado Springs, and Pueblo.

name: kansas
sentence: Missouri and Arkansas sent settlers into Kansas all along its eastern border.

name: kansas
sentence: These settlers attempted to sway votes in favor of slavery.

name: kansas
sentence: The secondary settlement of Americans in Kansas Territory were abolitionists from Massachusetts and other Free-Staters, who attempted to stop the spread of slavery from neighboring Missouri.

name: kansas
sentence: Directly presaging the American Civil War, these forces collided, entering into skirmishes that earned the territory the name of Bleeding Kansas.

name: kansas
sentence: Kansas was admitted to the Union as a free state on January 29, 1861, making it the 34th state to join the United States.

name: kansas
sentence: By that time, the violence in Kansas had largely subsided, but during the Civil War, on August 21, 1863, William Quantrill led several hundred men on a raid into Lawrence, destroying much of the city and killing nearly 200 people.

name: kansas
sentence: He was roundly condemned by both the conventional Confederate military and the partisan rangers commissioned by the Missouri legislature.

name: kansas
sentence: His application to that body for a commission was flatly rejected due to his pre-war criminal record.

name: kansas
sentence: After the Civil War, many veterans constructed homesteads in Kansas.

name: kansas
sentence: Many African Americans also looked to Kansas as the land of "John Brown" and, led by freedmen like Benjamin "Pap" Singleton, began establishing black colonies in the state.

name: kansas
sentence: Leaving southern states in the late 1870s because of increasing discrimination, they became known as Exodusters.
