sentence: The word "maroon" comes from the Spanish "cimarron", meaning "fugitive cattle".

name: louisiana
sentence: In the late 18th century, the last Spanish governor of the Louisiana territory wrote:

name: louisiana
sentence: When the United States purchased Louisiana in 1803, it was soon accepted that enslaved Africans could be brought to Louisiana as easily as they were brought to neighboring Mississippi, though it violated US law to do so.

name: louisiana
sentence: Despite demands by United States Rep. James Hillhouse and by the pamphleteer Thomas Paine to enforce existing federal law against slavery in the newly acquired territory, slavery prevailed because it was the source of great profits and the lowest-cost labor.

name: louisiana
sentence: At the start of the 19th century, Louisiana was a small producer of sugar with a relatively small number of slaves, compared to Saint-Domingue and the West Indies.

name: louisiana
sentence: It soon thereafter became a major sugar producer as new settlers arrived to develop plantations.

name: louisiana
sentence: William C. C. Claiborne, Louisiana's first United States governor, said African slave labor was needed because white laborers "cannot be had in this unhealthy climate".

name: louisiana
sentence: Hugh Thomas wrote that Claiborne was unable to enforce the abolition of the African slave trade, which the US and Great Britain adopted in 1808.

name: louisiana
sentence: The United States continued to protect the domestic slave trade, including the coastwise trade—the transport of slaves by ship along the Atlantic Coast and to New Orleans and other Gulf ports.

name: louisiana
sentence: By 1840, New Orleans had the biggest slave market in the United States, which contributed greatly to the economy of the city and of the state.

name: louisiana
sentence: New Orleans had become one of the wealthiest cities, and the third largest city, in the nation.

name: louisiana
sentence: The ban on the African slave trade and importation of slaves had increased demand in the domestic market.

name: louisiana
sentence: During the decades after the American Revolutionary War, more than one million enslaved African Americans underwent forced migration from the Upper South to the Deep South, two thirds of them in the slave trade.

name: louisiana
sentence: Others were transported by their owners as slaveholders moved west for new lands.

name: louisiana
sentence: With changing agriculture in the Upper South as planters shifted from tobacco to less labor-intensive mixed agriculture, planters had excess laborers.

name: louisiana
sentence: Many sold slaves to traders to take to the Deep South.

name: louisiana
sentence: Slaves were driven by traders overland from the Upper South or transported to New Orleans and other coastal markets by ship in the coastwise slave trade.

name: louisiana
sentence: After sales in New Orleans, steamboats operating on the Mississippi transported slaves upstream to markets or plantation destinations at Natchez and Memphis.

name: louisiana
sentence: Spanish occupation of Louisiana lasted from 1769 to 1800.

name: louisiana
sentence: Beginning in the 1790s, waves of immigration took place from Saint-Domingue, following a slave rebellion that started in 1791.

name: louisiana
sentence: Over the next decade, thousands of migrants landed in Louisiana from the island, including ethnic Europeans, free people of color, and African slaves, some of the latter brought in by each free group.

name: louisiana
sentence: They greatly increased the French-speaking population in New Orleans and Louisiana, as well as the number of Africans, and the slaves reinforced African culture in the city.

name: louisiana
sentence: The process of gaining independence in Saint-Domingue was complex, but uprisings continued.

name: louisiana
sentence: In 1803, France pulled out its surviving troops from the island, having suffered the loss of two-thirds sent to the island two years before, mostly to yellow fever.

name: louisiana
sentence: In 1804, Haiti, the second republic in the western hemisphere, proclaimed its independence, achieved by slave leaders.

name: louisiana
sentence: Pierre Clément de Laussat (Governor, 1803) said: "Saint-Domingue was, of all our colonies in the Antilles, the one whose mentality and customs influenced Louisiana the most."

name: louisiana
sentence: When the United States won its independence from Great Britain in 1783, one of its major concerns was having a European power on its western boundary, and the need for unrestricted access to the Mississippi River.

name: louisiana
sentence: As American settlers pushed west, they found that the Appalachian Mountains provided a barrier to shipping goods eastward.

name: louisiana
sentence: The easiest way to ship produce was to use a flatboat to float it down the Ohio and Mississippi Rivers to the port of New Orleans, where goods could be put on ocean-going vessels.

name: louisiana
sentence: The problem with this route was that the Spanish owned both sides of the Mississippi below Natchez.

name: louisiana
sentence: Napoleon's ambitions in Louisiana involved the creation of a new empire centered on the Caribbean sugar trade.

name: louisiana
sentence: By the terms of the Treaty of Amiens of 1802, Great Britain returned ownership of the islands of Martinique and Guadeloupe to the French.

name: louisiana
sentence: Napoleon looked upon Louisiana as a depot for these sugar islands, and as a buffer to US settlement.

name: louisiana
sentence: In October 1801 he sent a large military force to take back Saint-Domingue, then under control of Toussaint Louverture after a slave rebellion.When the army led by Napoleon's brother-in-law Leclerc was defeated, Napoleon decided to sell Louisiana.

name: louisiana
sentence: Thomas Jefferson, third president of the United States, was disturbed by Napoleon's plans to re-establish French colonies in America.

name: louisiana
sentence: With the possession of New Orleans, Napoleon could close the Mississippi to US commerce at any time.

name: louisiana
sentence: Jefferson authorized Robert R. Livingston, US Minister to France, to negotiate for the purchase of the City of New Orleans, portions of the east bank of the Mississippi, and free navigation of the river for US commerce.

name: louisiana
sentence: Livingston was authorized to pay up to $2 million.

name: louisiana
sentence: An official transfer of Louisiana to French ownership had not yet taken place, and Napoleon's deal with the Spanish was a poorly kept secret on the frontier.

name: louisiana
sentence: On October 18, 1802, however, Juan Ventura Morales, Acting Intendant of Louisiana, made public the intention of Spain to revoke the right of deposit at New Orleans for all cargo from the United States.

name: louisiana
sentence: The closure of this vital port to the United States caused anger and consternation.

name: louisiana
sentence: Commerce in the west was virtually blockaded.

name: louisiana
sentence: Historians believe the revocation of the right of deposit was prompted by abuses by the Americans, particularly smuggling, and not by French intrigues as was believed at the time.

name: louisiana
sentence: President Jefferson ignored public pressure for war with France, and appointed James Monroe a special envoy to Napoleon, to assist in obtaining New Orleans for the United States.

name: louisiana
sentence: Jefferson also raised the authorized expenditure to $10 million.

name: louisiana
sentence: However, on April 11, 1803, French Foreign Minister Talleyrand surprised Livingston by asking how much the United States was prepared to pay for the entirety of Louisiana, not just New Orleans and the surrounding area (as Livingston's instructions covered).

name: louisiana
sentence: Monroe agreed with Livingston that Napoleon might withdraw this offer at any time (leaving them with no ability to obtain the desired New Orleans area), and that approval from President Jefferson might take months, so Livingston and Monroe decided to open negotiations immediately.

name: louisiana
sentence: By April 30, they closed a deal for the purchase of the entire Louisiana territory of 828,000 square miles (2,100,000 km2) for sixty million Francs (approximately $15 million).

name: louisiana
sentence: Part of this sum, $3.5 million, was used to forgive debts owed by France to the United States.

name: louisiana
sentence: The payment was made in United States bonds, which Napoleon sold at face value to the Dutch firm of Hope and Company, and the British banking house of Baring, at a discount of ​87 1⁄2 per each $100 unit.

name: louisiana
sentence: As a result, France received only $8,831,250 in cash for Louisiana.

name: louisiana
sentence: English banker Alexander Baring conferred with Marbois in Paris, shuttled to the United States to pick up the bonds, took them to Britain, and returned to France with the money—which Napoleon used to wage war against Baring's own country.

name: louisiana
sentence: When news of the purchase reached the United States, Jefferson was surprised.

name: louisiana
sentence: He had authorized the expenditure of $10 million for a port city, and instead received treaties committing the government to spend $15 million on a land package which would double the size of the country.

name: louisiana
sentence: Jefferson's political opponents in the Federalist Party argued the Louisiana purchase was a worthless desert, and that the Constitution did not provide for the acquisition of new land or negotiating treaties without the consent of the Senatorte.

name: louisiana
sentence: What really worried the opposition was the new states which would inevitably be carved from the Louisiana territory, strengthening Western and Southern interests in Congress, and further reducing the influence of New England Federalists in national affairs.

name: louisiana
sentence: President Jefferson was an enthusiastic supporter of westward expansion, and held firm in his support for the treaty.

name: louisiana
sentence: Despite Federalist objections, the US Senatorte ratified the Louisiana treaty on October 20, 1803.

name: louisiana
sentence: By statute enacted on October 31, 1803, President Thomas Jefferson was authorized to take possession of the territories ceded by France and provide for initial governance.

name: louisiana
sentence: A transfer ceremony was held in New Orleans on November 29, 1803.

name: louisiana
sentence: Since the Louisiana territory had never officially been turned over to the French, the Spanish took down their flag, and the French raised theirs.

name: louisiana
sentence: The following day, General James Wilkinson accepted possession of New Orleans for the United States.

name: louisiana
sentence: A similar ceremony was held in St. Louis on March 9, 1804, when a French tricolor was raised near the river, replacing the Spanish national flag.

name: louisiana
sentence: The following day, Captain Amos Stoddard of the First US

name: louisiana
sentence: Artillery marched his troops into town and had the American flag run up the fort's flagpole.

name: louisiana
sentence: The Louisiana territory was officially transferred to the United States government, represented by Meriwether Lewis.

name: louisiana
sentence: The Louisiana Territory, purchased for less than three cents an acre, doubled the size of the United States overnight, without a war or the loss of a single American life, and set a precedent for the purchase of territory.

name: louisiana
sentence: It opened the way for the eventual expansion of the United States across the continent to the Pacific.

name: louisiana
sentence: Shortly after the United States took possession, the area was divided into two territories along the 33rd parallel north on March 26, 1804, thereby organizing the Territory of Orleans to the south and the District of Louisiana (subsequently formed as the Louisiana Territory) to the north.

name: louisiana
sentence: Louisiana became the eighteenth US state on April 30, 1812; the Territory of Orleans became the State of Louisiana and the Louisiana Territory was simultaneously renamed the Missouri Territory.

name: louisiana
sentence: An area known as the Florida Parishes was soon annexed into the state of Louisiana on April 14, 1812.

name: louisiana
sentence: From 1824 to 1861, Louisiana moved from a political system based on personality and ethnicity to a distinct two-party system, with Democrats competing first against Whigs, then Know Nothings, and finally only other Democrats.

name: louisiana
sentence: According to the 1860 census, 331,726 people were enslaved, nearly 47% of the state's total population of 708,002.

name: louisiana
sentence: The strong economic interest of elite whites in maintaining the slave society contributed to Louisiana's decision to secede from the Union on January 26, 1861.

name: louisiana
sentence: It followed other Southern states in seceding after the election of Abraham Lincoln as president of the United States.

name: louisiana
sentence: Louisiana's secession was announced on January 26, 1861, and it became part of the Confederate States of America.

name: louisiana
sentence: The state was quickly defeated in the Civil War, a result of Union strategy to cut the Confederacy in two by seizing the Mississippi.

name: louisiana
sentence: Federal troops captured New Orleans on April 25, 1862.

name: louisiana
sentence: Because a large part of the population had Union sympathies (or compatible commercial interests), the federal government took the unusual step of designating the areas of Louisiana under federal control as a state within the Union, with its own elected representatives to the US Congress.

name: louisiana
sentence: Following the Civil War and emancipation of slaves, violence rose in the South as the war was carried on by insurgent private and paramilitary groups.

name: louisiana
sentence: Initially state legislatures were dominated by former Confederates, who passed Black Codes to regulate freedmen and generally refused to give the vote.

name: louisiana
sentence: They refused to extend voting rights to African Americans who had been free before the war and had sometimes obtained education and property (as in New Orleans.)

name: louisiana
sentence: Following the Memphis riots of 1866 and the New Orleans riot the same year, the Fourteenth Amendment was passed that provided suffrage and full citizenship for freedmen.

name: louisiana
sentence: Congress passed the Reconstruction Act, establishing military districts for those states where conditions were considered the worst, including Louisiana.

name: louisiana
sentence: It was grouped with Texas in what was administered as the Fifth Military District.

name: louisiana
sentence: African Americans began to live as citizens with some measure of equality before the law.

name: louisiana
sentence: Both freedmen and people of color who had been free before the war began to make more advances in education, family stability and jobs.

name: louisiana
sentence: At the same time, there was tremendous social volatility in the aftermath of war, with many whites actively resisting defeat and the free labor market.

name: louisiana
sentence: White insurgents mobilized to enforce white supremacy, first in Ku Klux Klan chapters.

name: louisiana
sentence: By 1877, when federal forces were withdrawn, white Democrats in Louisiana and other states had regained control of state legislatures, often by paramilitary groups such as the White League, which suppressed black voting through intimidation and violence.

name: louisiana
sentence: Following Mississippi's example in 1890, in 1898, the white Democratic, planter-dominated legislature passed a new constitution that effectively disenfranchised people of color, by raising barriers to voter registration, such as poll taxes, residency requirements and literacy tests.

name: louisiana
sentence: The effect was immediate and long lasting.

name: louisiana
sentence: In 1896, there were 130,334 black voters on the rolls and about the same number of white voters, in proportion to the state population, which was evenly divided.

name: louisiana
sentence: The state population in 1900 was 47% African-American: a total of 652,013 citizens.

name: louisiana
sentence: Many in New Orleans were descendants of Creoles of color, the sizeable population of free people of color before the Civil War.

name: louisiana
sentence: By 1900, two years after the new constitution, only 5,320 black voters were registered in the state.

name: louisiana
sentence: Because of disfranchisement, by 1910 there were only 730 black voters (less than 0.5 percent of eligible African-American men), despite advances in education and literacy among blacks and people of color.

name: louisiana
sentence: Blacks were excluded from the political system and also unable to serve on juries.

name: louisiana
sentence: White Democrats had established one-party Democratic rule, which they maintained in the state for decades deep into the 20th century until after congressional passage of the 1965 Voting Rights Act provided federal oversight and enforcement of the constitutional right to vote.

name: louisiana
sentence: In the early decades of the 20th century, thousands of African Americans left Louisiana in the Great Migration north to industrial cities for jobs and education, and to escape Jim Crow society and lynchings.

name: louisiana
sentence: The boll weevil infestation and agricultural problems cost many sharecroppers and farmers their jobs.

name: louisiana
sentence: The mechanization of agriculture also reduced the need for laborers.

name: louisiana
sentence: Beginning in the 1940s, blacks went West to California for jobs in its expanding defense industries.

name: louisiana
sentence: During some of the Great Depression, Louisiana was led by Governor Huey Long.

name: louisiana
sentence: He was elected to office on populist appeal.

name: louisiana
sentence: His public works projects provided thousands of jobs to people in need, and he supported education and increased suffrage for poor whites, but Long was criticized for his allegedly demogogic and autocratic style.

name: louisiana
sentence: He extended patronage control through every branch of Louisiana's state government.

name: louisiana
sentence: Especially controversial were his plans for wealth redistribution in the state.

name: louisiana
sentence: Long's rule ended abruptly when he was assassinated in the state capitol in 1935.

name: louisiana
sentence: Mobilization for World War II created jobs in the state.

name: louisiana
sentence: But thousands of other workers, black and white alike, migrated to California for better jobs in its burgeoning defense industry.

name: louisiana
sentence: Many African Americans left the state in the Second Great Migration, from the 1940s through the 1960s to escape social oppression and seek better jobs.

name: louisiana
sentence: The mechanization of agriculture in the 1930s had sharply cut the need for laborers.

name: louisiana
sentence: They sought skilled jobs in the defense industry in California, better education for their children, and living in communities where they could vote.

name: louisiana
sentence: On November 26, 1958, at Chennault Air Force Base, a USAF B-47 bomber with a nuclear weapon on board developed a fire while on the ground.

name: louisiana
sentence: The aircraft wreckage and the site of the accident were contaminated after a limited explosion of non-nuclear material.

name: louisiana
sentence: In the 1950s the state created new requirements for a citizenship test for voter registration.

name: louisiana
sentence: Despite opposition by the States Rights Party, downstate black voters had begun to increase their rate of registration, which also reflected the growth of their middle classes.

name: louisiana
sentence: In 1960 the state established the Louisiana State Sovereignty Commission, to investigate civil rights activists and maintain segregation.

name: louisiana
sentence: Despite this, gradually black voter registration and turnout increased to 20% and more, and it was 32% by 1964, when the first national civil rights legislation of the era was passed.

name: louisiana
sentence: The percentage of black voters ranged widely in the state during these years, from 93.8% in Evangeline Parish to 1.7% in Tensas Parish, for instance, where there were white efforts to suppress the vote in the black-majority parish.

name: louisiana
sentence: Violent attacks on civil rights activists in two mill towns were catalysts to the founding of the first two chapters of the Deacons for Defense and Justice in late 1964 and early 1965, in Jonesboro and Bogalusa, respectively.

name: louisiana
sentence: Made up of veterans of World War II and the Korean War, they were armed self-defense groups established to protect activists and their families.

name: louisiana
sentence: Continued violent white resistance in Bogalusa to blacks trying to use public facilities in 1965, following passage of the Civil Rights Act of 1964, caused the federal government to order local police to protect the activists.

name: louisiana
sentence: Other chapters were formed in Louisiana, Mississippi, and Alabama.

name: louisiana
sentence: By 1960 the proportion of African Americans in Louisiana had dropped to 32%.

name: louisiana
sentence: The 1,039,207 black citizens were still suppressed by segregation and disfranchisement.

name: louisiana
sentence: African Americans continued to suffer disproportionate discriminatory application of the state's voter registration rules.

name: louisiana
sentence: Because of better opportunities elsewhere, from 1965 to 1970, blacks continued to migrate out of Louisiana, for a net loss of more than 37,000 people.

name: louisiana
sentence: Based on official census figures, the African American population in 1970 stood at 1,085,109, a net gain of more than 46,000 people compared to 1960.

name: louisiana
sentence: During the latter period, some people began to migrate to cities of the New South for opportunities.

name: louisiana
sentence: Since that period, blacks entered the political system and began to be elected to office, as well as having other opportunities.

name: louisiana
sentence: On May 21, 1919, the Nineteenth Amendment to the United States Constitution, giving women full rights to vote, was passed at a national level, and was made the law throughout the United States on August 18, 1920.

name: louisiana
sentence: Louisiana finally ratified the amendment on June 11, 1970.

name: louisiana
sentence: Due to its location on the Gulf Coast, Louisiana has regularly suffered the effects of tropical storms and damaging hurricanes.

name: louisiana
sentence: On August 29, 2005, New Orleans and many other low-lying parts of the state along the Gulf of Mexico were hit by the catastrophic Hurricane Katrina.

name: louisiana
sentence: It caused widespread damage due to breaching of levees and large-scale flooding of more than 80% of the city.

name: louisiana
sentence: Officials had issued warnings to evacuate the city and nearby areas, but tens of thousands of people, mostly African Americans, stayed behind, many of them stranded.

name: louisiana
sentence: Many people died and survivors suffered through the damage of the widespread floodwaters.

name: louisiana
sentence: In July 2016 the shooting of Alton Sterling sparked protests throughout the state capital of Baton Rouge.

name: louisiana
sentence: In August 2016, an unnamed storm dumped trillions of gallons of rain on southern Louisiana, including the cities of Denham Springs, Baton Rouge, Gonzales, St. Amant and Lafayette, causing catastrophic flooding.

name: louisiana
sentence: An estimated 110,000 homes were damaged and thousands of residents were displaced.

name: louisiana
sentence: In 2019, three Louisiana black churches were set on fire.

name: louisiana
sentence: The suspect used gasoline, destroying each church completely.

name: louisiana
sentence: Holden Matthews, 21 years old, was charged with the destruction of the churches.

name: louisiana
sentence: The first case of COVID-19 in Louisiana was announced on March 9, 2020.

name: louisiana
sentence: Since the first confirmed case as of October 27, 2020, there had been 180,069 confirmed cases; 5,854 people have died of COVID-19.

name: louisiana
sentence: Louisiana entered phase one of re-opening the state on May 15.

name: louisiana
sentence: On June 4, Governor John Bel Edwards signed an order moving to phase two.

name: louisiana
sentence: Gov.

name: louisiana
sentence: Edwards extended phase two until September 11, and phase three began with speculation on October 9.

name: louisiana
sentence: Louisiana is bordered to the west by Texas

name: louisiana
sentence: The state may properly be divided into two parts, the uplands of the north, and the alluvial along the coast.

name: louisiana
sentence: The alluvial region includes low swamp lands, coastal marshlands and beaches, and barrier islands that cover about 20,000 square miles (52,000 km2).

name: louisiana
sentence: This area lies principally along the Gulf of Mexico and the Mississippi River, which traverses the state from north to south for a distance of about 600 mi (970 km) and empties into the Gulf of Mexico; the Red River; the Ouachita River and its branches; and other minor streams (some of which are called bayous).

name: louisiana
sentence: The breadth of the alluvial region along the Mississippi is 10–60 miles (15–100 km), and along the other rivers, the alluvial region averages about 10 miles (15 km) across.

name: louisiana
sentence: The Mississippi River flows along a ridge formed by its natural deposits (known as a levee), from which the lands decline toward a river beyond at an average fall of six feet per mile (3 m/km).

name: louisiana
sentence: The alluvial lands along other streams present similar features.

name: louisiana
sentence: The higher and contiguous hill lands of the north and northwestern part of the state have an area of more than 25,000 square miles (65,000 km2).

name: louisiana
sentence: They consist of prairie and woodlands.

name: louisiana
sentence: The elevations above sea level range from 10 feet (3 m) at the coast and swamp lands to 50–60 feet (15–18 m) at the prairie and alluvial lands.

name: louisiana
sentence: In the uplands and hills, the elevations rise to Driskill Mountain, the highest point in the state only 535 feet (163 m) above sea level.

name: louisiana
sentence: From 1932 to 2010 the state lost 1,800 square miles due to rises in sea level and erosion.

name: louisiana
sentence: The Louisiana Coastal Protection and Restoration Authority (CPRA) spends around $1 billion per year to help shore up and protect Louisiana shoreline and land in both federal and state funding.

name: louisiana
sentence: Besides the waterways already named, there are the Sabine, forming the western boundary; and the Pearl, the eastern boundary; the Calcasieu, the Mermentau, the Vermilion, Bayou Teche, the Atchafalaya, the Boeuf, Bayou Lafourche, the Courtableau River, Bayou D'Arbonne, the Macon River, the Tensas, Amite River, the Tchefuncte, the Tickfaw, the Natalbany River, and a number of other smaller streams, constituting a natural system of navigable waterways, aggregating over 4,000 miles (6,400 km) long.

name: louisiana
sentence: The state also has political jurisdiction over the approximately 3-mile (4.8 km)-wide portion of subsea land of the inner continental shelf in the Gulf of Mexico.

name: louisiana
sentence: Through a peculiarity of the political geography of the United States, this is substantially less than the 9-mile (14 km)-wide jurisdiction of nearby states Texas and Florida, which, like Louisiana, have extensive Gulf coastlines.

name: louisiana
sentence: The southern coast of Louisiana in the United States is among the fastest-disappearing areas in the world.

name: louisiana
sentence: This has largely resulted from human mismanagement of the coast (see Wetlands of Louisiana).

name: louisiana
sentence: At one time, the land was added to when spring floods from the Mississippi River added sediment and stimulated marsh growth; the land is now shrinking.

name: louisiana
sentence: There are multiple causes.

name: louisiana
sentence: Artificial levees block spring flood water that would bring fresh water and sediment to marshes.

name: louisiana
sentence: Swamps have been extensively logged, leaving canals and ditches that allow salt water to move inland.

name: louisiana
sentence: Canals dug for the oil and gas industry also allow storms to move sea water inland, where it damages swamps and marshes.

name: louisiana
sentence: Rising sea waters have exacerbated the problem.

name: louisiana
sentence: Some researchers estimate that the state is losing a landmass equivalent to 30 football fields every day.

name: louisiana
sentence: There are many proposals to save coastal areas by reducing human damage, including restoring natural floods from the Mississippi.

name: louisiana
sentence: Without such restoration, coastal communities will continue to disappear.

name: louisiana
sentence: And as the communities disappear, more and more people are leaving the region.

name: louisiana
sentence: Since the coastal wetlands support an economically important coastal fishery, the loss of wetlands is adversely affecting this industry.

name: louisiana
sentence: The Gulf of Mexico 'dead zone' off the coast of Louisiana is the largest recurring hypoxic zone in the United States.

name: louisiana
sentence: It was 8,776 square miles (22,730 km2) in 2017, the largest ever recorded.

name: louisiana
sentence: The Gulf of Mexico did not exist 250 million years ago when there was but one supercontinent, Pangea.

name: louisiana
sentence: As Pangea split apart, the Atlantic Ocean and Gulf of Mexico opened.

name: louisiana
sentence: Louisiana slowly developed, over millions of years, from water into land, and from north to south.

name: louisiana
sentence: The oldest rocks are exposed in the north, in areas such as the Kisatchie National Forest.

name: louisiana
sentence: The oldest rocks date back to the early Cenozoic Era, some 60 million years ago.

name: louisiana
sentence: The history of the formation of these rocks can be found in D. Spearing's Roadside Geology of Louisiana.

name: louisiana
sentence: The youngest parts of the state were formed during the last 12,000 years as successive deltas of the Mississippi River: the Maringouin, Teche, St. Bernard, Lafourche, the modern Mississippi, and now the Atchafalaya.

name: louisiana
sentence: The sediments were carried from north to south by the Mississippi River.

name: louisiana
sentence: In between the Tertiary rocks of the north, and the relatively new sediments along the coast, is a vast belt known as the Pleistocene Terraces.

name: louisiana
sentence: Their age and distribution can be largely related to the rise and fall of sea levels during past ice ages.

name: louisiana
sentence: In general, the northern terraces have had sufficient time for rivers to cut deep channels, while the newer terraces tend to be much flatter.

name: louisiana
sentence: Salt domes are also found in Louisiana.

name: louisiana
sentence: Their origin can be traced back to the early Gulf of Mexico when the shallow ocean had high rates of evaporation.

name: louisiana
sentence: There are several hundred salt domes in the state; one of the most familiar is Avery Island, Louisiana.

name: louisiana
sentence: Salt domes are important not only as a source of salt

name: louisiana
sentence: Louisiana has a humid subtropical climate (Köppen climate classification Cfa), with long, hot, humid summers and short, mild winters.

name: louisiana
sentence: The subtropical characteristics of the state are due to its low latitude, low lying topography, and the influence of the Gulf of Mexico, which at its farthest point is no more than 200 mi (320 km) away.

name: louisiana
sentence: Rain is frequent throughout the year, although from April to September is slightly wetter than the rest of the year, which is the state's wet season.

name: louisiana
sentence: There is a dip in precipitation in October.

name: louisiana
sentence: In summer, thunderstorms build during the heat of the day and bring intense but brief, tropical downpours.

name: louisiana
sentence: In winter, rainfall is more frontal and less intense.

name: louisiana
sentence: Summers in southern Louisiana have high temperatures from June through September averaging 90 °F (32 °C) or more, and overnight lows averaging above 70 °F (21 °C).

name: louisiana
sentence: At times, temperatures in the 90s F, combined with dew points in the upper 70s F, create sensible temperatures over 120 °F (49 °C).

name: louisiana
sentence: The humid, thick, jungle-like heat in southern Louisiana is a famous subject of countless stories and movies.

name: louisiana
sentence: Temperatures are generally warm in the winter in the southern part of the state, with highs around New Orleans, Baton Rouge, the rest of south Louisiana, and the Gulf of Mexico averaging 66 °F (19 °C).

name: louisiana
sentence: The northern part of the state is mildly cool in the winter, with highs averaging 59 °F (15 °C).

name: louisiana
sentence: The overnight lows in the winter average well above freezing throughout the state, with 46 °F (8 °C) the average near the Gulf and an average low of 37 °F (3 °C) in the winter in the northern part of the state.

name: louisiana
sentence: On occasion, cold fronts from low-pressure centers to the north, reach Louisiana in winter.

name: louisiana
sentence: Low temperatures near 20 °F (−7 °C) occur on occasion in the northern part of the state but rarely do so in the southern part of the state.

name: louisiana
sentence: Snow is rare near the Gulf of Mexico, although residents in the northern parts of the state might receive a dusting of snow a few times each decade.

name: louisiana
sentence: Louisiana's highest recorded temperature is 114 °F (46 °C) in Plain Dealing on August 10, 1936, while the coldest recorded temperature is −16 °F (−27 °C) at Minden on February 13, 1899.

name: louisiana
sentence: Louisiana is often affected by tropical cyclones and is very vulnerable to strikes by major hurricanes, particularly the lowlands around and in the New Orleans area.

name: louisiana
sentence: The unique geography of the region, with the many bayous, marshes and inlets, can result in water damage across a wide area from major hurricanes.

name: louisiana
sentence: The area is also prone to frequent thunderstorms, especially in the summer.

name: louisiana
sentence: The entire state averages over 60 days of thunderstorms a year, more than any other state except Florida.

name: louisiana
sentence: Louisiana averages 27 tornadoes annually.

name: louisiana
sentence: The entire state is vulnerable to a tornado strike, with the extreme southern portion of the state slightly less so than the rest of the state.

name: louisiana
sentence: Tornadoes are more common from January to March in the southern part of the state, and from February through March in the northern part of the state.

name: louisiana
sentence: Owing to its location and geology, the state has high biological diversity.

name: louisiana
sentence: Some vital areas, such as southwestern prairie, have experienced a loss in excess of 98 percent.

name: louisiana
sentence: The pine flatwoods are also at great risk, mostly from fire suppression and urban sprawl.

name: louisiana
sentence: There is not yet a properly organized system of natural areas to represent and protect Louisiana's biological diversity.

name: louisiana
sentence: Such a system would consist of a protected system of core areas linked by biological corridors, such as Florida is planning.

name: louisiana
sentence: Louisiana contains a number of areas which, to varying degrees, prevent people from using them.

name: louisiana
sentence: In addition to National Park Service areas and a United States National Forest, Louisiana operates a system of state parks, state historic sites, one state preservation area, one state forest, and many Wildlife Management Areas.

name: louisiana
sentence: One of Louisiana's largest government-owned areas is Kisatchie National Forest.

name: louisiana
sentence: It is some 600,000 acres in area, more than half of which is flatwoods vegetation, which supports many rare plant and animal species.

name: louisiana
sentence: These include the Louisiana pinesnake and red-cockaded woodpecker.

name: louisiana
sentence: The system of government-owned cypress swamps around Lake Pontchartrain is another large area, with southern wetland species including egrets, alligators, and sturgeon.

name: louisiana
sentence: At least 12 core areas would be needed to build a "protected areas system" for the state; these would range from southwestern prairies, to the Pearl River Floodplain in the east, to the Mississippi River alluvial swamps in the north.

name: louisiana
sentence: Historic or scenic areas managed, protected, or otherwise recognized by the National Park Service include:

name: louisiana
sentence: Louisiana operates a system of 22 state parks, 17 state historic sites and one state preservation area.

name: louisiana
sentence: Louisiana has 955,973 acres, in four ecoregions under the wildlife management of the Louisiana Department of Wildlife and Fisheries.

name: louisiana
sentence: The Nature Conservancy also owns and manages a set of natural areas.

name: louisiana
sentence: The Louisiana Natural and Scenic Rivers System provides a degree of protection for 51 rivers, streams and bayous in the state.

name: louisiana
sentence: It is administered by the Louisiana Department of Wildlife and Fisheries.

name: louisiana
sentence: Louisiana contains 308 incorporated municipalities, consisting of four consolidated city-parishes, and 304 cities, towns, and villages.

name: louisiana
sentence: Louisiana's municipalities cover only 7.9% of the state's land mass but are home to 45.3% of its population.

name: louisiana
sentence: The majority of urban Louisianans live along the coast or in northern Louisiana.

name: louisiana
sentence: The oldest permanent settlement in the state is Nachitoches.

name: louisiana
sentence: Baton Rouge, the state capital, is the second-largest city in the state.

name: louisiana
sentence: The most populous city is New Orleans.

name: louisiana
sentence: As defined by the US Census Bureau, Louisiana contains nine metropolitan statistical areas.

name: louisiana
sentence: Major areas include Greater New Orleans, Greater Baton Rouge, Lafayette, and Shreveport–Bossier City.

name: louisiana
sentence: The United States Census Bureau estimated that the population of Louisiana was 4,648,794 on July 1, 2019, a 2.55% increase since the 2010 United States Census.

name: louisiana
sentence: In 2010, the state of Louisiana had a population of 4,533,372, and in 2018 an estimated 4,659,978.

name: louisiana
sentence: Louisiana is the second-most populous of the South Central United States after Texas.

name: louisiana
sentence: In 2014, approximately 64,500 undocumented immigrants lived in Louisiana.

name: louisiana
sentence: Louisiana's undocumented immigrant population earned more than a billion US dollars and payed $136 million in taxes.

name: louisiana
sentence: The undocumented immigrant population increased to 70,000 in 2016 and comprised two percent of the state population.

name: louisiana
sentence: In 2018, it was estimated that four percent of Louisianans are immigrants, while another four percent were native-born US citizens with at least one immigrant parent.

name: louisiana
sentence: The majority of Louisianan immigrants came from Mexico (16%), Honduras (15%), Vietnam (10%), the Philippines (5%), and Guatemala (4%).

name: louisiana
sentence: The population density of the state is 104.9 people per square mile.

name: louisiana
sentence: The center of population of Louisiana is located in Pointe Coupee Parish, in the city of New Roads.

name: louisiana
sentence: According to the 2010 United States Census, 5.4% of the population age 5 and older spoke Spanish at home, up from 3.5% in 2000; and 4.5% spoke French (including Louisiana French and Louisiana Creole), down from 4.8% in 2000.

name: louisiana
sentence: At the US 2014 census estimates, the racial and ethnic composition of Louisiana was White Americans 63.4% (59.3% non-Hispanic white, 4.1% White Hispanic), Black or African American (32.5%), Asian 1.8%, multiracial 1.5%, Native American 0.8%, and Hispanic or Latino of any race 4.8%.

name: louisiana
sentence: As of 2010, the major ancestry groups of Louisiana are African American (30.4%), French (16.8%), American (9.5%), German (8.3%), Irish (7.5%), English (6.6%), Italian (4.8%) and Scottish (1.1%).

name: louisiana
sentence: As of 2011, 49.0% of Louisiana's population younger than age 1 were minorities.

name: louisiana
sentence: In the American Community Survey's 2018 population estimates, 58.4% of the population was non-Hispanic white and 32.2% were Black or African American.

name: louisiana
sentence: American Indians and Alaska Natives made up an estimated 0.5% of the state population and Asians were 1.6% of the populace.

name: louisiana
sentence: Roughly 606 Louisianans were Native Hawaiian or of other Pacific Islander heritage, 0.2% some other race, and 2.0% from two or more races.

name: louisiana
sentence: Increasing from 2010 and 2014's census information, Hispanics or Latinos of any race made up 5.1% of Louisiana's population in 2018.

name: louisiana
sentence: The largest single Latin American ethnicity were Mexican Americans (2.0%), followed by Puerto Ricans (0.3%) and Cuban Americans (0.2%).

name: louisiana
sentence: Other Hispanics and Latinos altogether made up 2.6% of Louisiana's Hispanic or Latino residents.

name: louisiana
sentence: Christians make up 84% of the total state population, making Louisiana one of the most Christian-dominated states in the United States.

name: louisiana
sentence: The largest Christian denominations by number of adherents in 2010 were the Catholic Church with 1,200,900; Southern Baptist Convention with 709,650; and the United Methodist Church with 146,848.

name: louisiana
sentence: Non-denominational Evangelical Protestant congregations had 195,903 members.

name: louisiana
sentence: As in other Southern states, the majority of Louisianians, particularly in the north of the state, belong to various Protestant denominations, with Protestants comprising 57% of the state's adult population.

name: louisiana
sentence: Protestants are concentrated in the northern and central parts of the state and in the northern tier of the Florida Parishes.

name: louisiana
sentence: According to the Pew Research Center in 2014, Louisiana's largest Protestant Christian denominations were the Southern Baptist Convention, non-denominational Evangelicals, the National Baptist Convention USA, National Baptist Convention of America, Progressive National Baptist Convention, Assemblies of God, the African Methodist Episcopal and Christian Methodist Episcopal churches, the American Baptist Churches USA and United Methodist Church.

name: louisiana
sentence: Because of French and Spanish heritage, and their descendants the Creoles, and later Irish, Italian, Portuguese and German immigrants, southern Louisiana and the Greater New Orleans area are predominantly Catholic.

name: louisiana
sentence: Since Creoles were the first settlers, planters and leaders of the territory, they have traditionally been well represented in politics.

name: louisiana
sentence: For instance, most of the early governors were Creole Catholics.

name: louisiana
sentence: Because Catholics still constitute a significant fraction of Louisiana's population, they have continued to be influential in state politics.

name: louisiana
sentence: The high proportion and influence of the Catholic population makes Louisiana distinct among Southern states.

name: louisiana
sentence: The Roman Catholic Archdiocese of New Orleans and Diocese of Baton Rouge are the largest Catholic jurisdictions in the state, located within the Greater New Orleans and Greater Baton Rouge metropolitan statistical areas.

name: louisiana
sentence: Jewish communities are established in the state's larger cities, notably New Orleans and Baton Rouge.

name: louisiana
sentence: The most significant of these is the Jewish community of the New Orleans area.

name: louisiana
sentence: In 2000, before the 2005 Hurricane Katrina, its population was about 12,000.

name: louisiana
sentence: Louisiana was among the southern states with a significant Jewish population before the 20th century; Virginia, South Carolina, and Georgia also had influential Jewish populations in some of their major cities from the 18th and 19th centuries.

name: louisiana
sentence: The earliest Jewish colonists were Sephardic Jews who immigrated with English colonists from London.

name: louisiana
sentence: Later in the 19th century, German Jews began to immigrate, followed by those from eastern Europe and the Russian Empire in the late 19th and early 20th centuries.

name: louisiana
sentence: Prominent Jews in Louisiana's political leadership have included Whig (later Democrat) Judah P. Benjamin (1811–1884), who represented Louisiana in the US Senatorte before the American Civil War and then became the Confederate secretary of state; Democrat-turned-Republican Michael Hahn who was elected as governor, serving 1864–1865 when Louisiana was occupied by the Union Army, and later elected in 1884 as a US congressman; Democrat Adolph Meyer (1842–1908), Confederate Army officer who represented the state in the US House of Representatives from 1891 until his death in 1908; Republican secretary of state Jay Dardenne (1954–), and Republican (Democrat before 2011) attorney general Buddy Caldwell (1946–).

name: louisiana
sentence: Other non-Christian religions are also primarily established in the metropolitan areas of Louisiana, including Islam and Hinduism.

name: louisiana
sentence: In the Greater Shreveport metropolitan area, Muslims made up an estimated 14% of Louisiana's total Muslim population as of 2014.

name: louisiana
sentence: The total gross state product in 2010 for Louisiana was $213.6 billion, placing it 24th in the nation.

name: louisiana
sentence: In 2019, the gross state product increased to $240.48 billion.

name: louisiana
sentence: Its per capita personal income was $30,952, ranking 41st in the United States as of 2014.

name: louisiana
sentence: In 2014, Louisiana was ranked as one of the most small business friendly states, based on a study drawing upon data from more than 12,000 small business owners.

name: louisiana
sentence: As of July 2017, the state's unemployment rate was 5.3%.

name: louisiana
sentence: The state's principal agricultural products include seafood (it is the biggest producer of crawfish in the world, supplying approximately 90%), cotton, soybeans, cattle, sugarcane, poultry and eggs, dairy products, and rice.

name: louisiana
sentence: Industry generates chemical products, petroleum and coal products, processed foods and transportation equipment, and paper products.

name: louisiana
sentence: Tourism is an important element in the economy, especially in the New Orleans area.

name: louisiana
sentence: Gaming is also very popular part of the economy in the southwestern part of the state.

name: louisiana
sentence: The Port of South Louisiana, located on the Mississippi River between New Orleans and Baton Rouge, was the largest volume shipping port in the Western Hemisphere and 4th largest in the world, as well as the largest bulk cargo port in the US in 2004.

name: louisiana
sentence: The Port of South Louisiana continued to be the busiest port by tonnage in the US through 2018, the latest available data.

name: louisiana
sentence: South Louisiana was number 15 among world ports in 2016.

name: louisiana
sentence: New Orleans, Shreveport, and Baton Rouge are home to a thriving film industry.

name: louisiana
sentence: State financial incentives since 2002 and aggressive promotion have given Louisiana the nickname "Hollywood South".

name: louisiana
sentence: Because of its distinctive culture within the United States, only Alaska is Louisiana's rival in popularity as a setting for reality television programs.

name: louisiana
sentence: In late 2007 and early 2008, a 300,000-square-foot (28,000 m2) film studio was scheduled to open in Tremé, with state-of-the-art production facilities, and a film training institute.

name: louisiana
sentence: Tabasco sauce, which is marketed by one of the United States' biggest producers of hot sauce, the McIlhenny Company, originated on Avery Island.

name: louisiana
sentence: Louisiana has three personal income tax brackets, ranging from 2% to 6%.

name: louisiana
sentence: The state sales tax rate is 4.45%, and parishes can levy additional sales tax on top of this.

name: louisiana
sentence: The state also has a use tax, which includes 4% to be distributed by the Department of Revenue to local governments.

name: louisiana
sentence: Property taxes are assessed and collected at the local level.

name: louisiana
sentence: Louisiana is a subsidized state, receiving $1.44 from the federal government for every dollar paid in.

name: louisiana
sentence: Tourism and culture are major players in Louisiana's economy, earning an estimated $5.2 billion per year.

name: louisiana
sentence: Louisiana also hosts many important cultural events, such as the World Cultural Economic Forum, which is held annually in the fall at the New Orleans Morial Convention Center.

name: louisiana
sentence: Louisiana taxpayers receive more federal funding per dollar of federal taxes paid compared to the average state.

name: louisiana
sentence: Per dollar of federal tax collected in 2005, Louisiana citizens received approximately $1.78 in the way of federal spending.

name: louisiana
sentence: This ranks the state fourth highest nationally and represents a rise from 1995 when Louisiana received $1.35 per dollar of taxes in federal spending (ranked seventh nationally).

name: louisiana
sentence: Neighboring states and the amount of federal spending received per dollar of federal tax collected were: Texas ($0.94), Arkansas ($1.41), and Mississippi ($2.02).

name: louisiana
sentence: Federal spending in 2005 and subsequent years since has been exceptionally high due to the recovery from Hurricane Katrina.

name: louisiana
sentence: Louisiana is rich in petroleum and natural gas.

name: louisiana
sentence: Petroleum and gas deposits are found in abundance both onshore and offshore in state-owned waters.

name: louisiana
sentence: In addition, vast petroleum and natural gas reserves are found offshore from Louisiana in the federally administered Outer Continental Shelf (OCS) in the Gulf of Mexico.

name: louisiana
sentence: According to the Energy Information Administration, the Gulf of Mexico OCS is the largest US petroleum-producing region.

name: louisiana
sentence: Excluding the Gulf of Mexico OCS, Louisiana ranks fourth in petroleum production and is home to about two percent of the total US petroleum reserves.

name: louisiana
sentence: Louisiana's natural gas reserves account for about five percent of the US total.

name: louisiana
sentence: The Haynesville Shale formation in parts of or all of Caddo, Bossier, Bienville, Sabine, De Soto, Red River, and Natchitoches parishes have made it the world's fourth largest gas field with some wells initially producing over 25 million cubic feet of gas daily.

name: louisiana
sentence: Louisiana was the first site of petroleum drilling over water in the world, on Caddo Lake in the northwest corner of the state.

name: louisiana
sentence: The petroleum and gas industry, as well as its subsidiary industries such as transport and refining, have dominated Louisiana's economy since the 1940s.

name: louisiana
sentence: Beginning in 1950, Louisiana was sued several times by the US

name: louisiana
sentence: Interior Department, in efforts by the federal government to strip Louisiana of its submerged land property rights.

name: louisiana
sentence: These control vast stores of reservoirs of petroleum and natural gas.

name: louisiana
sentence: When petroleum and gas boomed in the 1970s, so did Louisiana's economy.

name: louisiana
sentence: The Louisiana economy as well as its politics of the last half-century cannot be understood without thoroughly accounting for the influence of the petroleum and gas industries.

name: louisiana
sentence: For example, in the 1970s over 40 percent of Louisiana's state revenues came directly from severance taxes and mineral royalties.

name: louisiana
sentence: Since the 1980s, these industries' headquarters have consolidated in Houston, but many of the jobs that operate or provide logistical support to the US Gulf of Mexico crude-oil-and-gas industry remain in Louisiana.

name: louisiana
sentence: While the energy industry is still an important component of Louisiana's economy, the composition of this industry has changed dramatically over time.

name: louisiana
sentence: As of 2019 the refining and chemical manufacturing sector employs more people in Louisiana than the up-stream oil and gas extraction sector.

name: louisiana
sentence: Louisiana is home to many, especially notable are the distinct culture of the Louisiana Creoles, typically people of color, descendants of free mixed-race families of the colonial and early statehood periods.

name: louisiana
sentence: The French colony of La Louisiane struggled for decades to survive.

name: louisiana
sentence: Conditions were harsh, the climate and soil were unsuitable for certain crops the colonists knew, and they suffered from regional tropical diseases.

name: louisiana
sentence: Both colonists and the slaves they imported had high mortality rates.

name: louisiana
sentence: The settlers kept importing slaves, which resulted in a high proportion of native Africans from West Africa, who continued to practice their culture in new surroundings.

name: louisiana
sentence: As described by historian Gwendolyn Midlo Hall, they developed a marked Afro-Creole culture in the colonial era.

name: louisiana
sentence: At the turn of the 18th century and in the early 1800s, New Orleans received a major influx of white and mixed-race refugees fleeing the violence of the Haitian Revolution, many of whom brought their slaves with them.

name: louisiana
sentence: This added another infusion of African culture to the city, as more slaves in Saint-Domingue were from Africa than in the United States.

name: louisiana
sentence: They strongly influenced the African-American culture of the city in terms of dance, music and religious practices.

name: louisiana
sentence: Creole culture is an amalgamation of French, African, Spanish (and other European), and Native American cultures.

name: louisiana
sentence: Creole comes from the Portuguese word crioulo; originally it referred to a colonist of European (specifically French) descent who was born in the New World, in comparison to immigrants from France.

name: louisiana
sentence: The oldest Louisiana manuscript to use the word "Creole", from 1782, applied it to a slave born in the French colony.

name: louisiana
sentence: But originally it referred more generally to the French colonists born in Louisiana.

name: louisiana
sentence: Over time, there developed in the French colony a relatively large group of Creoles of Color (gens de couleur libres), who were primarily descended from African slave women and French men (later other Europeans became part of the mix, as well as some Native Americans.)

name: louisiana
sentence: Often the French would free their concubines and mixed-race children, and pass on social capital to them.

name: louisiana
sentence: They might educate sons in France, for instance, and help them enter the French Army for a career.

name: louisiana
sentence: They also settled capital or property on their mistresses and children.

name: louisiana
sentence: The free people of color gained more rights in the colony and sometimes education

name: louisiana
sentence: Many became artisans and property owners.

name: louisiana
sentence: Over time, the term "Creole" became associated with this class of Creoles of Color, many of whom achieved freedom long before the Civil War.

name: louisiana
sentence: Wealthy French Creoles generally maintained town houses in New Orleans as well as houses on their large sugar plantations outside town along the Mississippi River.

name: louisiana
sentence: New Orleans had the largest population of free people of color in the region; they could find work there and created their own culture, marrying among themselves for decades.

name: louisiana
sentence: The ancestors of Cajuns immigrated mostly from west central France to New France, where they settled in the Atlantic provinces of New Brunswick, Nova Scotia and Prince Edward Island, known originally as Acadia.

name: louisiana
sentence: After the British defeated France in the French and Indian War (Seven Years' War) in 1763, France ceded its territory east of the Mississippi River to Britain.

name: louisiana
sentence: The British forcibly separated families and evicted them from Acadia because they refused to vow loyalty to the new British regime.

name: louisiana
sentence: The Acadians were deported to England, New England, and France.

name: louisiana
sentence: Some, who escaped the British, remained in French Canada.

name: louisiana
sentence: Others scattered, to France, Canada, Mexico, or the Falkland Islands.

name: louisiana
sentence: Many Acadian refugees settled in south Louisiana in the region around Lafayette and the LaFourche Bayou country.

name: louisiana
sentence: They developed a distinct rural culture there, different from the French Creole colonists of New Orleans.

name: louisiana
sentence: Intermarrying with others in the area, they developed what was called Cajun music, cuisine and culture.

name: louisiana
sentence: Until the 1970s, the term "Cajun" was considered somewhat derogatory.

name: louisiana
sentence: A third distinct culture in Louisiana is that of the Isleños.

name: louisiana
sentence: Its members are descendants of colonists from the Canary Islands who settled in Spanish Louisiana between 1778 and 1783 and intermarried with other communities such as Frenchman, Acadians, Creoles, Spaniards, and other groups, mainly through the 19th and early 20th centuries.

name: louisiana
sentence: In Louisiana, the Isleños originally settled in four communities which included Galveztown, Valenzuela, Barataria, and San Bernardo.

name: louisiana
sentence: Of those settlements, Valenzuela and San Bernardo were the most successful as the other two were plagued with both disease and flooding.

name: louisiana
sentence: The large migration of Acadian refugees to Bayou Lafourche led to the rapid gallicization of the Valenzuela community while the community of San Bernardo (Saint Bernard) was able to preserve much of its unique culture and language into the 21st century.

name: louisiana
sentence: This being said, the transmission of Spanish and other customs has completely halted in St. Bernard with those having competency in Spanish being octogenarians.

name: louisiana
sentence: Through the centuries, the various Isleño communities of Louisiana have kept alive different elements of their Canary Islander heritage while also adopting and building upon the customs and traditions of the communities that surround them.

name: louisiana
sentence: Today two heritage associates exist for the communities: Los Isleños Heritage and Cultural Society of St. Bernard as well as the Canary Islanders Heritage Society of Louisiana.

name: louisiana
sentence: The Fiesta de los Isleños is celebrated annually in St. Bernard Parish which features heritage performances from local groups and the Canary Islands.

name: louisiana
sentence: According to a 2010 study by the Modern Language Association, among persons five years old and older, 91.26% of Louisiana residents speak only English at home, 3.45% speak French (standard French, French Creole, or Cajun French), 3.30% speak Spanish, and 0.59% speak Vietnamese.

name: louisiana
sentence: Historically, Native American peoples in the area at the time of European encounter were seven tribes distinguished by their languages: Caddo, Tunica, Natchez, Houma, Choctaw, Atakapa, and Chitimacha.

name: louisiana
sentence: Of these, only Tunica, Caddo and Choctaw still have living native speakers, although several other tribes are working to teach and revitalize their languages.

name: louisiana
sentence: Other Native American peoples migrated into the region, escaping from European pressure from the east.

name: louisiana
sentence: Among these were Alabama, Biloxi, Koasati, and Ofo peoples.

name: louisiana
sentence: Starting in the 1700s, French colonists began to settle along the coast and founded New Orleans.

name: louisiana
sentence: They established French culture and language institutions.

name: louisiana
sentence: They imported thousands of slaves from tribes of West Africa, who spoke several different languages.

name: louisiana
sentence: In the creolization process, the slaves developed a Louisiana Creole dialect incorporating both French and African forms, which colonists adopted to communicate with them, and which persisted beyond slavery.

name: louisiana
sentence: In the 20th century, there were still people of mixed race, particularly, who spoke Louisiana Creole French.

name: louisiana
sentence: During the 19th century after the Louisiana Purchase by the United States, English gradually gained prominence for business and government due to the shift in population with settlement by numerous Americans who were English speakers.

name: louisiana
sentence: Many ethnic French families continued to use French in private.

name: louisiana
sentence: Slaves and some free people of color also spoke Louisiana Creole French.

name: louisiana
sentence: The State Constitution of 1812 gave English official status in legal proceedings, but use of French remained widespread.

name: louisiana
sentence: Subsequent state constitutions reflect the diminishing importance of French.

name: louisiana
sentence: The 1868 constitution, passed during the Reconstruction era before Louisiana was re-admitted to the Union, banned laws requiring the publication of legal proceedings in languages other than English.

name: louisiana
sentence: Subsequently, the legal status of French recovered somewhat, but it never regained its pre-Civil War prominence.

name: louisiana
sentence: Several unique dialects of French, Creole, and English are spoken in Louisiana.

name: louisiana
sentence: Dialects of the French language are: Colonial French and Houma French.

name: louisiana
sentence: Louisiana Creole French is the term for one of the Creole languages.

name: louisiana
sentence: Two unique dialects developed of the English language: Louisiana English, a French-influenced variety of English in which dropping of postvocalic /r/ is common ; and what is informally known as Yat, which resembles the New York City dialect sometimes with southern influences, particularly that of historical Brooklyn.

name: louisiana
sentence: Both accents were influenced by large communities of immigrant Irish and Italians, but the Yat dialect, which developed in New Orleans, was also influenced by French and Spanish.

name: louisiana
sentence: Colonial French was the dominant language of white settlers in Louisiana during the French colonial period

name: louisiana
sentence: In addition to this dialect, the mixed-race people and slaves developed Louisiana Creole, with a base in West African languages.

name: louisiana
sentence: The limited years of Spanish rule at the end of the 18th century did not result in widespread adoption of the Spanish language.

name: louisiana
sentence: French and Louisiana Creole are still used in modern-day Louisiana, often in family gatherings.

name: louisiana
sentence: English and its associated dialects became predominant after the Louisiana Purchase of 1803, after which the area became dominated by numerous English speakers.

name: louisiana
sentence: In some regions, English was influenced by French, as seen with Louisiana English.

name: louisiana
sentence: Colonial French, although mistakenly named Cajun French by some Cajuns, has persisted alongside English.

name: louisiana
sentence: Renewed interest in the French language in Louisiana has led to the establishment of Canadian-modeled French immersion schools, as well as bilingual signage in the historic French neighborhoods of New Orleans and Lafayette.

name: louisiana
sentence: In addition to private organizations, since 1968 the state has maintained the Council for the Development of French in Louisiana (CODOFIL), which promotes use of the French language in the state's tourism, economic development, culture, education and international relations.

name: louisiana
sentence: In 2018, Louisiana became the first US state to join the Organisation internationale de la Francophonie as an observer.

name: louisiana
sentence: Louisiana is home to over 40 public and private colleges and universities, including Louisiana State University in Baton Rouge and Tulane University in New Orleans.

name: louisiana
sentence: Louisiana State University is the largest and most comprehensive university in Louisiana.

name: louisiana
sentence: Tulane University is a major private research university and the wealthiest university in Louisiana with an endowment over $1.1 billion.

name: louisiana
sentence: Tulane is also highly regarded for its academics nationwide, consistently ranked in the top 50 on US News & World Report's list of best national universities.

name: louisiana
sentence: Louisiana's two oldest and largest HBCUs (Historically black colleges and universities) are Southern University in Baton Rouge and Grambling State University in Grambling.

name: louisiana
sentence: Both these Southwestern Athletic Conference (SWAC) schools compete against each other in football annually in the much anticipated Bayou Classic during Thanksgiving weekend in the Mercedes-Benz Superdome.

name: louisiana
sentence: The Louisiana Science Education Act is a controversial law passed by the Louisiana Legislature on June 11, 2008, and signed into law by Governor Bobby Jindal on June 25.

name: louisiana
sentence: The act allows public school teachers to use supplemental materials in the science classroom which are critical of established science on such topics as the theory of evolution and global warming.

name: louisiana
sentence: In 2000, of all of the states, Louisiana had the highest percentage of students in private schools.

name: louisiana
sentence: Danielle Dreilinger of The Times Picayune wrote in 2014 that "Louisiana parents have a national reputation for favoring private schools."

name: louisiana
sentence: The number of students in enrolled in private schools in Louisiana declined by 9% from circa 2000-2005 until 2014, due to the proliferation of charter schools, the 2008 recession and Hurricane Katrina.

name: louisiana
sentence: Ten parishes in the Baton Rouge and New Orleans area had a combined 17% decline in private school enrollment in that period.

name: louisiana
sentence: This prompted private schools to lobby for school vouchers.

name: louisiana
sentence: Louisiana's school voucher program is known as the Louisiana Scholarship Program.

name: louisiana
sentence: It was available in the New Orleans area beginning in 2008 and in the rest of the state beginning in 2012.

name: louisiana
sentence: In 2013 the number of students using school vouchers to attend private schools was 6,751, and for 2014 it was projected to over 8,800.

name: louisiana
sentence: As per a ruling from Ivan Lemelle, a US district judge, the federal government has the right to review the charter school placements to ensure they do not further racial segregation.

name: louisiana
sentence: The Louisiana Department of Transportation and Development is the state government organization in charge of maintaining public transportation, roadways, bridges, canals, select levees, floodplain management, port facilities, commercial vehicles, and aviation which includes 69 airports.

name: louisiana
sentence: The Intracoastal Waterway is an important means of transporting commercial goods such as petroleum and petroleum products, agricultural produce, building materials and manufactured goods.

name: louisiana
sentence: In 2011, Louisiana ranked among the five deadliest states for debris/litter-caused vehicle accidents per total number of registered vehicles and population size.

name: louisiana
sentence: Figures derived from the NHTSA show at least 25 persons in Louisiana were killed per year in motor vehicle collisions with non-fixed objects, including debris, dumped litter, animals and their carcasses.

name: louisiana
sentence: In 1849, the state moved the capital from New Orleans to Baton Rouge.

name: louisiana
sentence: Donaldsonville, Opelousas, and Shreveport have briefly served as the seat of Louisiana state government.

name: louisiana
sentence: The Louisiana State Capitol and the Louisiana Governor's Mansion are both located in Baton Rouge.

name: louisiana
sentence: The Louisiana Supreme Court, however, did not move to Baton Rouge but remains headquartered in New Orleans.

name: louisiana
sentence: The current Louisiana governor is Democrat John Bel Edwards.

name: louisiana
sentence: The current United States senators are Republicans John Neely Kennedy and Bill Cassidy.

name: louisiana
sentence: Louisiana has six congressional districts and is represented in the US House of Representatives by five Republicans and one Democrat.

name: louisiana
sentence: Louisiana had eight votes in the Electoral College for the 2012 election.

name: louisiana
sentence: It lost one House seat due to stagnant population growth in the 2010 Census.

name: louisiana
sentence: Louisiana is divided into 64 parishes (the equivalent of counties in most other states).

name: louisiana
sentence: Most parishes have an elected government known as the Police Jury, dating from the colonial days.

name: louisiana
sentence: It is the legislative and executive government of the parish, and is elected by the voters.

name: louisiana
sentence: Its members are called Jurors, and together they elect a president as their chairman.

name: louisiana
sentence: A more limited number of parishes operate under home rule charters, electing various forms of government.

name: louisiana
sentence: This include mayor–council, council–manager (in which the council hires a professional operating manager for the parish), and others.

name: louisiana
sentence: The Louisiana political and legal structure has maintained several elements from the times of French and Spanish governance.

name: louisiana
sentence: One is the use of the term "parish" (from the French: paroisse) in place of "county" for administrative subdivision.

name: louisiana
sentence: Another is the legal system of civil law based on French, German, and Spanish legal codes and ultimately Roman law, as opposed to English common law.

name: louisiana
sentence: Louisiana's civil law system is what the majority of nations in the world use, especially in Europe and its former colonies, excluding those that derive from the British Empire.

name: louisiana
sentence: However, it is incorrect to equate the Louisiana Civil Code with the Napoleonic Code.

name: louisiana
sentence: Although the Napoleonic Code and Louisiana law draw from common legal roots, the Napoleonic Code was never in force in Louisiana, as it was enacted in 1804, after the United States had purchased and annexed Louisiana in 1803.

name: louisiana
sentence: While the Louisiana Civil Code of 1808 has been continuously revised and updated since its enactment, it is still considered the controlling authority in the state.

name: louisiana
sentence: Differences are found between Louisianan civil law and the common law found in the other US states.

name: louisiana
sentence: While some of these differences have been bridged due to the strong influence of common law tradition, the civil law tradition is still deeply rooted in most aspects of Louisiana private law.

name: louisiana
sentence: Thus property, contractual, business entities structure, much of civil procedure, and family law, as well as some aspects of criminal law, are still based mostly on traditional Roman legal thinking.

name: louisiana
sentence: In 1997, Louisiana became the first state to offer the option of a traditional marriage or a covenant marriage.

name: louisiana
sentence: In a covenant marriage, the couple waives their right to a "no-fault" divorce after six months of separation, which is available in a traditional marriage.

name: louisiana
sentence: To divorce under a covenant marriage, a couple must demonstrate cause.

name: louisiana
sentence: Marriages between ascendants and descendants, and marriages between collaterals within the fourth degree (i.e., siblings, aunt and nephew, uncle and niece, first cousins) are prohibited.

name: louisiana
sentence: Same-sex marriages were prohibited by statute, but the Supreme Court declared such bans unconstitutional in 2015, in its ruling in Obergefell v. Hodges.

name: louisiana
sentence: Same-sex marriages are now performed statewide.

name: louisiana
sentence: Louisiana is a community property state.

name: louisiana
sentence: From 1898 to 1965, a period when Louisiana had effectively disfranchised most African Americans and many poor whites by provisions of a new constitution, this was essentially a one-party state dominated by white Democrats.

name: louisiana
sentence: Elites had control in the early 20th century, before populist Huey Long came to power as governor.

name: louisiana
sentence: In multiple acts of resistance, blacks left behind the segregation, violence and oppression of the state and moved out to seek better opportunities in northern and western industrial cities during the Great Migrations of 1910–1970, markedly reducing their proportion of population in Louisiana.

name: louisiana
sentence: The franchise for whites was expanded somewhat during these decades, but blacks remained essentially disfranchised until after the civil rights movement of the mid-20th century, gaining enforcement of their constitutional rights through passage by Congress of the Voting Rights Act of 1965.

name: louisiana
sentence: Since the 1960s, when civil rights legislation was passed under President Lyndon Johnson to protect voting and civil rights, most African Americans in the state have affiliated with the Democratic Party.

name: louisiana
sentence: In the same years, many white social conservatives have moved to support Republican Party candidates in national, gubernatorial and statewide elections.

name: louisiana
sentence: In 2004, David Vitter was the first Republican in Louisiana to be popularly elected as a US senator.

name: louisiana
sentence: The previous Republican senator, John S. Harris, who took office in 1868 during Reconstruction, was chosen by the state legislature under the rules of the 19th century.

name: louisiana
sentence: Louisiana is unique among US states in using a system for its state and local elections similar to that of modern France.

name: louisiana
sentence: All candidates, regardless of party affiliation, run in a nonpartisan blanket primary (or "jungle primary") on Election Day.

name: louisiana
sentence: If no candidate has more than 50% of the vote, the two candidates with the highest vote totals compete in a runoff election approximately one month later.

name: louisiana
sentence: This run-off method does not take into account party identification; therefore, it is not uncommon for a Democrat to be in a runoff with a fellow Democrat or a Republican to be in a runoff with a fellow Republican.

name: louisiana
sentence: Congressional races have also been held under the jungle primary system.

name: louisiana
sentence: All other states (except Washington, California, and Maine) use single-party primaries followed by a general election between party candidates, each conducted by either a plurality voting system or runoff voting, to elect senators, representatives, and statewide officials.

name: louisiana
sentence: Between 2008 and 2010, federal congressional elections were run under a closed primary system—limited to registered party members.

name: louisiana
sentence: However, upon the passage of House Bill 292, Louisiana again adopted a nonpartisan blanket primary for its federal congressional elections.

name: louisiana
sentence: Louisiana has six seats in the US House of Representatives, five of which are currently held by Republicans and one by a Democrat.

name: louisiana
sentence: The state lost a House seat at the end of the 112th Congress due to stagnant population growth as recorded by the 2010 United States Census.

name: louisiana
sentence: Louisiana is not classified as a swing state for future presidential elections, as it has regularly supported Republican candidates since the late 20th century.

name: louisiana
sentence: The state's two US senators are Bill Cassidy (R) and John Neely Kennedy (R).

name: louisiana
sentence: Louisiana's statewide police force is the Louisiana State Police.

name: louisiana
sentence: It began in 1922 with the creation of the Highway Commission.

name: louisiana
sentence: In 1927, a second branch, the Bureau of Criminal Investigations, was formed.

name: louisiana
sentence: In 1932, the State Highway Patrol was authorized to carry weapons.

name: louisiana
sentence: On July 28, 1936, the two branches were consolidated to form the Louisiana Department of State Police; its motto was "courtesy, loyalty, service".

name: louisiana
sentence: In 1942, this office was abolished and became a division of the Department of Public Safety, called the Louisiana State Police.

name: louisiana
sentence: In 1988, the Criminal Investigation Bureau was reorganized.

name: louisiana
sentence: Its troopers have statewide jurisdiction with power to enforce all laws of the state, including city and parish ordinances.

name: louisiana
sentence: Each year, they patrol over 12 million miles (20 million km) of roadway and arrest about 10,000 impaired drivers.

name: louisiana
sentence: The State Police are primarily a traffic enforcement agency, with other sections that delve into trucking safety, narcotics enforcement, and gaming oversight.

name: louisiana
sentence: The elected sheriff in each parish is the chief law enforcement officer in the parish.

name: louisiana
sentence: They are the keepers of the local parish prisons, which house felony and misdemeanor prisoners.

name: louisiana
sentence: They are the primary criminal patrol and first responder agency in all matters criminal and civil.

name: louisiana
sentence: They are also the official tax collectors in each parish.

name: louisiana
sentence: The sheriffs are responsible for general law enforcement in their respective parishes.

name: louisiana
sentence: Orleans Parish is an exception, as the general law enforcement duties fall to the New Orleans Police Department.

name: louisiana
