sentence: Before 2010, Orleans Parish was the only parish to have two sheriff's offices.

name: louisiana
sentence: Orleans Parish divided sheriffs' duties between criminal and civil, with a different elected sheriff overseeing each aspect.

name: louisiana
sentence: In 2006, a bill was passed which eventually consolidated the two sheriff's departments into one parish sheriff responsible for both civil and criminal matters.

name: louisiana
sentence: In 2015, Louisiana had a higher murder rate (10.3 per 100,000) than any other state in the country for the 27th straight year.

name: louisiana
sentence: Louisiana is the only state with an annual average murder rate (13.6 per 100,000) at least twice as high as the US annual average (6.6 per 100,000) during that period, according to Bureau of Justice Statistics from FBI Uniform Crime Reports.

name: louisiana
sentence: In a different kind of criminal activity, the Chicago Tribune reports that Louisiana is the most corrupt state in the United States.

name: louisiana
sentence: According to the Times Picayune, Louisiana is the prison capital of the world.

name: louisiana
sentence: Many for-profit private prisons and sheriff-owned prisons have been built and operate here.

name: louisiana
sentence: Louisiana's incarceration rate is nearly five times Iran's, 13 times China's and 20 times Germany's.

name: louisiana
sentence: Minorities are incarcerated at rates disproportionate to their share of the state's population.

name: louisiana
sentence: The New Orleans Police Department began a new sanctuary policy to "no longer cooperate with federal immigration enforcement" beginning on February 28, 2016.

name: louisiana
sentence: The judiciary of Louisiana is defined under the Constitution and law of Louisiana and is composed of the Louisiana Supreme Court, the Louisiana Circuit Courts of Appeal, the District Courts, the Justice of the Peace Courts, the Mayor's Courts, the City Courts, and the Parish Courts.

name: louisiana
sentence: The chief justice of the Louisiana Supreme Court is the chief administrator of the judiciary.

name: louisiana
sentence: Its administration is aided by the Judiciary Commission of Louisiana, the Louisiana Attorney Disciplinary Board, and the Judicial Council of the Supreme Court of Louisiana.

name: louisiana
sentence: Louisiana has more than 9,000 soldiers in the Louisiana Army National Guard, including the 225th Engineer Brigade and the 256th Infantry Brigade.

name: louisiana
sentence: Both these units have served overseas during the War on Terror.

name: louisiana
sentence: The Louisiana Air National Guard has more than 2,000 airmen, and its 159th Fighter Wing has likewise seen combat.

name: louisiana
sentence: Training sites in the state include Camp Beauregard near Pineville, Camp Villere near Slidell, Camp Minden near Minden, England Air Park (formerly England Air Force Base) near Alexandria, Gillis Long Center near Carville, and Jackson Barracks in New Orleans.

name: louisiana
sentence: Louisiana is nominally the least populous state with more than one major professional sports league franchise: the National Basketball Association's New Orleans Pelicans and the National Football League's New Orleans Saints.

name: louisiana
sentence: Louisiana has 12 collegiate NCAA Division I programs, a high number given its population.

name: louisiana
sentence: The state has no NCAA Division II teams and only two NCAA Division III teams.

name: louisiana
sentence: The LSU Tigers football team has won 11 Southeastern Conference titles, six Sugar Bowls and four national championships.

name: louisiana
sentence: Each year New Orleans plays host to the Sugar Bowl, the Bayou Classic, and the New Orleans Bowl college football games, and Shreveport hosts the Independence Bowl.

name: louisiana
sentence: Also, New Orleans has hosted the Super Bowl a record seven times, as well as the BCS National Championship Game, NBA All-Star Game and NCAA Men's Division I Basketball Championship.

name: louisiana
sentence: The Zurich Classic of New Orleans, is a PGA Tour golf tournament held since 1938.

name: louisiana
sentence: The Rock 'n' Roll Mardi Gras Marathon and Crescent City Classic are two road running competitions held at New Orleans.

name: louisiana
sentence: As of 2016, Louisiana was the birthplace of the most NFL players per capita for the eighth year in a row.

name: maine
sentence: Maine ( (listen)) is a state in the New England region of the Northeastern United States, bordered by New Hampshire to the west; the Atlantic Ocean to the southeast; and the Canadian provinces of New Brunswick and Quebec to the northeast and northwest, respectively.

name: maine
sentence: Maine is the 12th-smallest by area, the 9th-least populous, and the 13th-least densely populated of the 50 US states.

name: maine
sentence: It is also the northeasternmost among the contiguous United States, the northernmost state east of the Great Lakes, and the only state to border only one other state.

name: maine
sentence: Maine is known for its jagged, rocky coastline; low, rolling mountains; heavily forested interior; picturesque waterways; and its seafood cuisine, especially lobster and clams.

name: maine
sentence: There is a humid continental climate throughout most of the state, including coastal areas.

name: maine
sentence: Its most populous city is Portland, and its capital is Augusta.

name: maine
sentence: For thousands of years after the glaciers retreated during the last Ice Age, indigenous peoples were the only inhabitants of the territory that is now Maine.

name: maine
sentence: At the time of European arrival, several Algonquian-speaking peoples inhabited the area.

name: maine
sentence: The first European settlement in the area was by the French in 1604 on Saint Croix Island, by Pierre Dugua, Sieur de Mons.

name: maine
sentence: The first English settlement was the short-lived Popham Colony, established by the Plymouth Company in 1607.

name: maine
sentence: A number of English settlements were established along the coast of Maine in the 1620s, although the rugged climate, deprivations, and conflict with the local peoples caused many to fail.

name: maine
sentence: As Maine entered the 18th century, only a half dozen European settlements had survived.

name: maine
sentence: Loyalist and Patriot forces contended for Maine's territory during the American Revolution.

name: maine
sentence: During the War of 1812, the largely undefended eastern region of Maine was occupied by British forces with the goal of annexing it to Canada via the Colony of New Ireland, but returned to the United States following failed British offensives on the northern border, mid-Atlantic and south which produced a peace treaty that restored the pre-war boundaries.

name: maine
sentence: Maine was part of the Commonwealth of Massachusetts until 1820 when it voted to secede from Massachusetts to become a separate state.

name: maine
sentence: On March 15, 1820, under the Missouri Compromise, it was admitted to the Union as the 23rd state.

name: maine
sentence: There is no definitive explanation for the origin of the name "Maine", but the most likely is that early explorers named it after the former province of Maine in France.

name: maine
sentence: Whatever the origin, the name was fixed for English settlers in 1665 when the English King's Commissioners ordered that the "Province of Maine" be entered from then on in official records.

name: maine
sentence: The state legislature in 2001 adopted a resolution establishing Franco-American Day, which stated that the state was named after the former French province of Maine.

name: maine
sentence: Other theories mention earlier places with similar names or claim it is a nautical reference to the mainland.

name: maine
sentence: Captain John Smith, in his "Description of New England" (1614) laments the lack of exploration: "Thus you may see, of this 2000. miles more then halfe is yet vnknowne to any purpose: no not so much as the borders of the Sea are yet certainly discouered.

name: maine
sentence: As for the goodnes and true substances of the Land, wee are for most part yet altogether ignorant of them, vnlesse it bee those parts about the Bay of Chisapeack and Sagadahock: but onely here and there wee touched or haue seene a little the edges of those large dominions, which doe stretch themselues into the Maine, God doth know how many thousand miles;" Note that his description of the mainland of North America is "the Maine".

name: maine
sentence: The word "main" was a frequent shorthand for the word "mainland" (as in "The Spanish Main")

name: maine
sentence: Attempts to uncover the history of the name of Maine began with James Sullivan's 1795 "History of the District of Maine."

name: maine
sentence: He made the unsubstantiated claim that the Province of Maine was a compliment to the queen of Charles I, Henrietta Maria, who once "owned" the Province of Maine in France.

name: maine
sentence: Maine historians quoted this until the 1845 biography of that queen by Agnes Strickland established that she had no connection to the province; further, King Charles I married Henrietta Maria in 1625, three years after the name Maine first appeared on the charter.

name: maine
sentence: A new theory put forward by Carol B. Smith Fisher in 2002 postulated that Sir Ferdinando Gorges chose the name in 1622 to honor the village where his ancestors first lived in England, rather than the province in France.

name: maine
sentence: "MAINE" appears in the Domesday Book of 1086 in reference to the county of Dorset, which is today Broadmayne, just southeast of Dorchester.

name: maine
sentence: The view generally held among British place name scholars is that Mayne in Dorset is Brythonic, corresponding to modern Welsh "maen", plural "main" or "meini".

name: maine
sentence: Some early spellings are: MAINE 1086, MEINE 1200, MEINES 1204, MAYNE 1236.

name: maine
sentence: Today the village is known as Broadmayne, which is primitive Welsh or Brythonic, "main" meaning rock or stone, considered a reference to the many large sarsen stones still present around Little Mayne farm, half a mile northeast of Broadmayne village.

name: maine
sentence: The first known record of the name appears in an August 10, 1622 land charter to Sir Ferdinando Gorges and Captain John Mason, English Royal Navy veterans, who were granted a large tract in present-day Maine that Mason and Gorges "intend to name the Province of Maine".

name: maine
sentence: Mason had served with the Royal Navy in the Orkney Islands, where the chief island is called Mainland, a possible name derivation for these English sailors.

name: maine
sentence: In 1623, the English naval captain Christopher Levett, exploring the New England coast, wrote: "The first place I set my foote upon in New England was the Isle of Shoals, being Ilands [sic] in the sea, above two Leagues from the Mayne."

name: maine
sentence: Initially, several tracts along the coast of New England were referred to as Main or Maine (cf.

name: maine
sentence: the Spanish Main).

name: maine
sentence: A reconfirmed and enhanced April 3, 1639 charter, from England's King Charles I, gave Sir Ferdinando Gorges increased powers over his new province and stated that it "shall forever hereafter, be called and named the PROVINCE OR COUNTIE OF MAINE, and not by any other name or names whatsoever ..." Maine is the only US state whose name has only one syllable.

name: maine
sentence: The original inhabitants of the territory that is now Maine were Algonquian-speaking Wabanaki peoples, including the Passamaquoddy, Maliseet, Penobscot, Androscoggin, and Kennebec.

name: maine
sentence: During the later King Philip's War, many of these peoples would merge in one form or another to become the Wabanaki Confederacy, aiding the Wampanoag of Massachusetts & the Mahican of New York.

name: maine
sentence: Afterwards, many of these people were driven from their natural territories, but most of Maine's tribes continued, unchanged, until the American Revolution.

name: maine
sentence: Before this point, however, most of these people were considered separate nations.

name: maine
sentence: Many had adapted to living in permanent, Iroquois-inspired settlements, while those along the coast tended to be semi-nomadic—traveling from settlement to settlement on a yearly cycle.

name: maine
sentence: They would usually winter inland & head to the coasts by summer.

name: maine
sentence: European contact with what is now called Maine may have started around 1200 CE when Norwegians are believed to have interacted with the native Penobscot in present-day Hancock County, most likely through trade.

name: maine
sentence: If confirmed, this would make Maine the site of the earliest European landfall in the entire US.

name: maine
sentence: About 200 years earlier, from the settlements in Iceland and Greenland, Norwegians first identified America and attempted to settle areas such as Newfoundland, but failed to establish a permanent settlement.

name: maine
sentence: Archeological evidence suggests that Norwegians in Greenland returned to North America for several centuries after the initial discovery to trade and collect timber, with the most relevant evidence being the Maine Penny, an 11th-century Norwegian coin found at a Native American dig site in 1954.

name: maine
sentence: The first European confirmed settlement in modern-day Maine was in 1604 on Saint Croix Island, led by French explorer Pierre Dugua, Sieur de Mons.

name: maine
sentence: His party included Samuel de Champlain, noted as an explorer.

name: maine
sentence: The French named the entire area Acadia, including the portion that later became the state of Maine.

name: maine
sentence: The Plymouth Company established the first English settlement in Maine at the Popham Colony in 1607, the same year as the settlement at Jamestown, Virginia.

name: maine
sentence: The Popham colonists returned to Britain after 14 months.

name: maine
sentence: The French established two Jesuit missions: one on Penobscot Bay in 1609, and the other on Mount Desert Island in 1613.

name: maine
sentence: The same year, Claude de La Tour established Castine.

name: maine
sentence: In 1625, Charles de Saint-Étienne de la Tour erected Fort Pentagouet to protect Castine.

name: maine
sentence: The coastal areas of eastern Maine first became the Province of Maine in a 1622 land patent.

name: maine
sentence: The part of western Maine north of the Kennebec River was more sparsely settled and was known in the 17th century as the Territory of Sagadahock.

name: maine
sentence: A second settlement was attempted in 1623 by English explorer and naval Captain Christopher Levett at a place called York, where he had been granted 6,000 acres (24 km2) by King Charles I of England.

name: maine
sentence: It also failed.

name: maine
sentence: Central Maine was formerly inhabited by the Androscoggin tribe of the Abenaki nation, also known as Arosaguntacook.

name: maine
sentence: They were driven out of the area in 1690 during King William's War.

name: maine
sentence: They were relocated to St. Francis, Canada, which was destroyed by Rogers' Rangers in 1759, and is now Odanak.

name: maine
sentence: The other Abenaki tribes suffered several severe defeats, particularly during Dummer's War, with the capture of Norridgewock in 1724 and the defeat of the Pequawket in 1725, which significantly reduced their numbers.

name: maine
sentence: They finally withdrew to Canada, where they were settled at Bécancour and Sillery, and later at St. Francis, along with other refugee tribes from the south.

name: maine
sentence: The province within its current boundaries became part of the Massachusetts Bay Colony in 1652.

name: maine
sentence: Maine was much fought over by the French, English, and allied natives during the 17th and 18th centuries, who conducted raids against each other, taking captives for ransom or, in some cases, adoption by Native American tribes.

name: maine
sentence: A notable example was the early 1692 Abenaki raid on York, where about 100 English settlers were killed and another estimated 80 taken hostage.

name: maine
sentence: The Abenaki took captives taken during raids of Massachusetts in Queen Anne's War of the early 1700s to Kahnewake, a Catholic Mohawk village near Montreal, where some were adopted and others ransomed.

name: maine
sentence: After the British defeated the French in Acadia in the 1740s, the territory from the Penobscot River east fell under the nominal authority of the Province of Nova Scotia, and together with present-day New Brunswick formed the Nova Scotia county of Sunbury, with its court of general sessions at Campobello.

name: maine
sentence: American and British forces contended for Maine's territory during the American Revolution and the War of 1812, with the British occupying eastern Maine in both conflicts via the Colony of New Ireland.

name: maine
sentence: The territory of Maine was confirmed as part of Massachusetts when the United States was formed following the Treaty of Paris ending the revolution, although the final border with British North America was not established until the Webster–Ashburton Treaty of 1842.

name: maine
sentence: Maine was physically separate from the rest of Massachusetts.

name: maine
sentence: Long-standing disagreements over land speculation and settlements led to Maine residents and their allies in Massachusetts proper forcing an 1807 vote in the Massachusetts Assembly on permitting Maine to secede

name: maine
sentence: Secessionist sentiment in Maine was stoked during the War of 1812 when Massachusetts pro-British merchants opposed the war and refused to defend Maine from British invaders.

name: maine
sentence: In 1819, Massachusetts agreed to permit secession, sanctioned by voters of the rapidly growing region the following year.

name: maine
sentence: Formal secession and formation of the state of Maine as the 23rd state occurred on March 15, 1820, as part of the Missouri Compromise, which geographically limited the spread of slavery and enabled the admission to statehood of Missouri the following year, keeping a balance between slave and free states.

name: maine
sentence: Maine's original state capital was Portland, Maine's largest city, until it was moved to the more central Augusta in 1832.

name: maine
sentence: The principal office of the Maine Supreme Judicial Court remains in Portland.

name: maine
sentence: The 20th Maine Volunteer Infantry Regiment, under the command of Colonel Joshua Lawrence Chamberlain, prevented the Union Army from being flanked at Little Round Top by the Confederate Army during the Battle of Gettysburg.

name: maine
sentence: Four US Navy ships have been named USMaine, most famously the armored cruiser USMaine (ACR-1), whose sinking by an explosion on February 15, 1898 precipitated the Spanish–American War.

name: maine
sentence: To the south and east is the Atlantic Ocean and to the north and northeast is New Brunswick, a province of Canada.

name: maine
sentence: The Canadian province of Québec is to the northwest.

name: maine
sentence: Maine is the northernmost state in New England and the largest, accounting for almost half of the region's entire land area.

name: maine
sentence: Maine is the only state to border exactly one other American state (New Hampshire).

name: maine
sentence: Maine is the easternmost state in the United States both in its extreme points and in its geographic center.

name: maine
sentence: The town of Lubec is the easternmost organized settlement in the United States.

name: maine
sentence: Its Quoddy Head Lighthouse is also the closest place in the United States to Africa and Europe.

name: maine
sentence: Estcourt Station is Maine's northernmost point, as well as the northernmost point in New England.

name: maine
sentence: (For more information see extreme points of the United States.)

name: maine
sentence: Maine's Moosehead Lake is the largest lake wholly in New England, since Lake Champlain is located between Vermont, New York and Québec.

name: maine
sentence: A number of other Maine lakes, such as South Twin Lake, are described by Thoreau in The Maine Woods (1864).

name: maine
sentence: Mount Katahdin is the northern terminus of the Appalachian Trail, which extends southerly to Springer Mountain, Georgia, and the southern terminus of the new International Appalachian Trail which, when complete, will run to Belle Isle, Newfoundland and Labrador.

name: maine
sentence: Machias Seal Island and North Rock, off the state's Downeast coast, are claimed by both Canada and the American town of Cutler, and are within one of four areas between the two countries whose sovereignty is still in dispute, but it is the only one of the disputed areas containing land.

name: maine
sentence: Also in this easternmost area in the Bay of Fundy is the Old Sow, the largest tidal whirlpool in the Western Hemisphere.

name: maine
sentence: Maine is the least densely populated US state east of the Mississippi River.

name: maine
sentence: It is called the Pine Tree State; over 80% of its total land is forested or unclaimed, the most forest cover of any US state.

name: maine
sentence: In the wooded areas of the interior lies much uninhabited land, some of which does not have formal political organization into local units (a rarity in New England).

name: maine
sentence: The Northwest Aroostook, Maine unorganized territory in the northern part of the state, for example, has an area of 2,668 square miles (6,910 km2) and a population of 10, or one person for every 267 square miles (690 km2).

name: maine
sentence: Maine is in the temperate broadleaf and mixed forests biome.

name: maine
sentence: The land near the southern and central Atlantic coast is covered by the mixed oaks of the Northeastern coastal forests.

name: maine
sentence: The remainder of the state, including the North Woods, is covered by the New England-Acadian forests.

name: maine
sentence: Maine has almost 230 miles (400 km) of coastline (and 3,500 miles (5,600 km) of tidal coastline).

name: maine
sentence: West Quoddy Head, in Lubec, Maine, is the easternmost point of land in the 48 contiguous states.

name: maine
sentence: Along the famous rock-bound coast of Maine are lighthouses, beaches, fishing villages, and thousands of offshore islands, including the Isles of Shoals which straddle the New Hampshire border.

name: maine
sentence: There are jagged rocks and cliffs and many bays and inlets.

name: maine
sentence: Inland are lakes, rivers, forests, and mountains.

name: maine
sentence: This visual contrast of forested slopes sweeping down to the sea has been summed up by American poet Edna St. Vincent Millay of Rockland and Camden, Maine, in "Renascence":

name: maine
sentence: Geologists describe this type of landscape as a "drowned coast", where a rising sea level has invaded former land features, creating bays out of valleys and islands out of mountain tops.

name: maine
sentence: A rise in land elevation due to the melting of heavy glacier ice caused a slight rebounding effect of underlying rock; this land rise, however, was not enough to eliminate all the effect of the rising sea level and its invasion of former land features.

name: maine
sentence: Much of Maine's geomorphology was created by extended glacial activity at the end of the last ice age.

name: maine
sentence: Prominent glacial features include Somes Sound and Bubble Rock, both part of Acadia National Park on Mount Desert Island.

name: maine
sentence: Carved by glaciers, Somes Sound is considered to be the only fjord on the eastern seaboard and reaches depths of 175 feet (50 m).

name: maine
sentence: The extreme depth and steep drop-off allow large ships to navigate almost the entire length of the sound.

name: maine
sentence: These features also have made it attractive for boat builders, such as the prestigious Hinckley Yachts.

name: maine
sentence: Bubble Rock, a glacial erratic, is a large boulder perched on the edge of Bubble Mountain in Acadia National Park.

name: maine
sentence: By analyzing the type of granite, geologists discovered that glaciers carried Bubble Rock to its present location from near Lucerne, 30 miles (48 km) away.

name: maine
sentence: The Iapetus Suture runs through the north and west of the state, being underlain by the ancient Laurentian terrane, and the south and east underlain by the Avalonian terrane.

name: maine
sentence: Acadia National Park is the only national park in New England.

name: maine
sentence: Areas under the protection and management of the National Park Service include:

name: maine
sentence: Maine has a humid continental climate (Köppen climate classification Dfb), with warm and sometimes humid summers, and long, cold and very snowy winters.

name: maine
sentence: Winters are especially severe in the Northern and Western parts of Maine, while coastal areas are moderated slightly by the Atlantic Ocean, resulting in marginally milder winters and cooler summers than inland regions.

name: maine
sentence: Daytime highs are generally in the 75–80 °F (24–27 °C) range throughout the state in July, with overnight lows in the high 50s °F (around 15 °C).

name: maine
sentence: January temperatures range from highs near 30 °F (−1 °C) on the southern coast to overnight lows averaging below 0 °F (−18 °C) in the far north.

name: maine
sentence: The state's record high temperature is 105 °F (41 °C), set in July 1911, at North Bridgton.Precipitation in Maine is evenly distributed year-round, but with a slight summer maximum in northern/northwestern Maine and a slight late-fall or early-winter maximum along the coast due to "nor'easters" or intense cold-season rain and snowstorms.

name: maine
sentence: In coastal Maine, the late spring and summer months are usually driest—a rarity across the Eastern United States.

name: maine
sentence: Maine has fewer days of thunderstorms than any other state east of the Rockies, with most of the state averaging fewer than twenty days of thunderstorms a year.

name: maine
sentence: Tornadoes are rare in Maine, with the state averaging fewer than four per year, although this number is increasing.

name: maine
sentence: Most severe thunderstorms and tornadoes occur in the Sebago Lakes & Foothills region of the state.

name: maine
sentence: Maine rarely sees the effect of tropical cyclones, as they tend to pass well east and south or are greatly weakened by the time they reach Maine.

name: maine
sentence: In January 2009, a new record low temperature for the state was set at Big Black River of −50 °F (−46 °C), tying the New England record.

name: maine
sentence: Annual precipitation varies from 909 mm (35.8 in) in Presque Isle, to 1,441 mm (56.7 in) in Acadia National Park.

name: maine
sentence: The United States Census Bureau estimates that the population of Maine was 1,344,212 on July 1, 2019, a 1.19% increase since the 2010 United States Census.

name: maine
sentence: The state's population density is 41.3 people per square mile, making it the least densely populated state east of the Mississippi River.

name: maine
sentence: As of 2010, Maine was also the most rural state in the Union, with only 38.7% of the state's population living within urban areas.

name: maine
sentence: As explained in detail under "Geography", there are large tracts of uninhabited land in some remote parts of the interior of the state, particularly in the North Maine Woods.

name: maine
sentence: The mean population center of Maine is located in Kennebec County, just east of Augusta.

name: maine
sentence: The Greater Portland metropolitan area is the most densely populated with nearly 40% of Maine's population.

name: maine
sentence: This area spans three counties and includes many farms and wooded areas; the 2016 population of Portland proper was 66,937.

name: maine
sentence: Maine has experienced a very slow rate of population growth since the 1990 census

name: maine
sentence: The modest population growth in the state has been concentrated in the southern coastal counties

name: maine
sentence: However, the northern, more rural areas of the state have experienced a slight decline in population in recent years.

name: maine
sentence: According to the 2010 Census, Maine has the highest percentage of non-Hispanic whites of any state, at 94.4% of the total population.

name: maine
sentence: In 2011, 89.0% of all births in the state were to non-Hispanic white parents.

name: maine
sentence: Maine also has the second-highest residential senior population.

name: maine
sentence: The table below shows the racial composition of Maine's population as of 2016.

name: maine
sentence: According to the 2016 American Community Survey, 1.5% of Maine's population were of Hispanic or Latino origin (of any race): Mexican (0.4%), Puerto Rican (0.4%), Cuban (0.1%), and other Hispanic or Latino origin (0.6%).

name: maine
sentence: The five largest ancestry groups were: English (20.7%), Irish (17.3%), French (15.7%), German (8.1%), and American (7.8%).

name: maine
sentence: People citing that they are American are of overwhelmingly English descent, but have ancestry that has been in the region for so long (often since the 1600s) that they choose to identify simply as Americans.

name: maine
sentence: Maine has the highest percentage of French Americans of any state.

name: maine
sentence: Most of them are of Canadian origin, but in some cases have been living there since prior to the American Revolutionary War.

name: maine
sentence: There are particularly high concentrations in the northern part of Maine in Aroostook County, which is part of a cultural region known as Acadia that goes over the border into New Brunswick.

name: maine
sentence: Along with the Acadian population in the north, many French came from Quebec as immigrants between 1840 and 1930.

name: maine
sentence: The upper Saint John River valley area was once part of the so-called Republic of Madawaska, before the frontier was decided in the Webster-Ashburton Treaty of 1842.

name: maine
sentence: Over a quarter of the population of Lewiston, Waterville, and Biddeford are Franco-American.

name: maine
sentence: Most of the residents of the Mid Coast and Down East sections are chiefly of British heritage.

name: maine
sentence: Smaller numbers of various other groups, including Irish, Italian and Polish, have settled throughout the state since the late 19th and early 20th century immigration waves.

name: maine
sentence: Note: Births in table don't add up, because Hispanics are counted both by their ethnicity and by their race, giving a higher overall number.

name: maine
sentence: Maine does not have an official language, but the most widely spoken language in the state is English.

name: maine
sentence: The 2000 Census reported 92.25% of Maine residents aged five and older spoke only English at home.

name: maine
sentence: French-speakers are the state's chief linguistic minority; census figures show that Maine has the highest percentage of people speaking French at home of any state: 5.28% of Maine households are French-speaking, compared with 4.68% in Louisiana, which is the second highest state.

name: maine
sentence: Although rarely spoken, Spanish is the third-most-common language in Maine, after English and French.

name: maine
sentence: According to the Association of Religion Data Archives (ARDA), the religious affiliations of Maine in 2010 were:

name: maine
sentence: The Catholic Church was the largest religious institution with 202,106 members, the United Methodist Church had 28,329 members, the United Church of Christ had 22,747 members

name: maine
sentence: In 2010, a study named Maine as the least religious state in the United States.

name: maine
sentence: Total employment 2016

name: maine
sentence: Total employer establishments 2016

name: maine
sentence: The Bureau of Economic Analysis estimates that Maine's total gross state product for 2010 was $52 billion.

name: maine
sentence: Its per capita personal income for 2007 was $33,991, 34th in the nation.

name: maine
sentence: As of May 2018, Maine's unemployment rate is 3.0%

name: maine
sentence: Maine's agricultural outputs include poultry, eggs, dairy products, cattle, wild blueberries, apples, maple syrup, and maple sugar.

name: maine
sentence: Aroostook County is known for its potato crops.

name: maine
sentence: Commercial fishing, once a mainstay of the state's economy, maintains a presence, particularly lobstering and groundfishing.

name: maine
sentence: While lobster is the main seafood focus for Maine, the harvest of both oysters and seaweed are on the rise.

name: maine
sentence: In 2015, 14% of the Northeast's total oyster supply came from Maine.

name: maine
sentence: In 2017, the production of Maine's seaweed industry was estimated at $20 million per year.

name: maine
sentence: The shrimp industry of Maine is on a government-mandated hold.

name: maine
sentence: With an ever-decreasing Northern shrimp population, Maine fishermen are no longer allowed to catch and sell shrimp.

name: maine
sentence: The hold began in 2014 and is expected to continue until 2021.

name: maine
sentence: Western Maine aquifers and springs are a major source of bottled water.

name: maine
sentence: Maine's industrial outputs consist chiefly of paper, lumber and wood products, electronic equipment, leather products, food products, textiles, and bio-technology.

name: maine
sentence: Naval shipbuilding and construction remain key as well, with Bath Iron Works in Bath and Portsmouth Naval Shipyard in Kittery.

name: maine
sentence: Brunswick Landing, formerly Naval Air Station Brunswick, is also in Maine.

name: maine
sentence: Formerly a large support base for the US Navy, the BRAC campaign initiated the Naval Air Station's closing, despite a government-funded effort to upgrade its facilities.

name: maine
sentence: The former base has since been changed into a civilian business park, as well as a new satellite campus for Southern Maine Community College.

name: maine
sentence: Maine is the number one US producer of low-bush blueberries (Vaccinium angustifolium).

name: maine
sentence: Preliminary data from the USDA for 2012 also indicate Maine was the largest blueberry producer of the major blueberry producing states, with 91,100,000 lbs.

name: maine
sentence: This data includes both low (wild), and high-bush (cultivated) blueberries: Vaccinium corymbosum.

name: maine
sentence: The largest toothpick manufacturing plant in the United States used to be located in Strong, Maine.

name: maine
sentence: The Strong Wood Products plant produced 20 million toothpicks a day.

name: maine
sentence: It closed in May 2003.

name: maine
sentence: Tourism and outdoor recreation play a major and increasingly important role in Maine's economy.

name: maine
sentence: The state is a popular destination for sport hunting (particularly deer, moose and bear), sport fishing, snowmobiling, skiing, boating, camping and hiking, among other activities.

name: maine
sentence: Historically, Maine ports played a key role in national transportation.

name: maine
sentence: Beginning around 1880, Portland's rail link and ice-free port made it Canada's principal winter port, until the aggressive development of Halifax, Nova Scotia, in the mid-1900s.

name: maine
sentence: In 2013, 12,039,600 short tons passed into and out of Portland by sea, which places it 45th of US water ports.

name: maine
sentence: Portland Maine's Portland International Jetport was recently expanded, providing the state with increased air traffic from carriers such as JetBlue and Southwest Airlines.

name: maine
sentence: Maine has very few large companies that maintain headquarters in the state, and that number has fallen due to consolidations and mergers, particularly in the pulp and paper industry.

name: maine
sentence: Some of the larger companies that do maintain headquarters in Maine include Fairchild Semiconductor in South Portland; IDEXX Laboratories, in Westbrook; Hannaford Bros. Co. in Scarborough; TD Bank in Portland; L.L.Bean in Freeport; and Cole Haan in Yarmouth.

name: maine
sentence: Maine is also the home of the Jackson Laboratory, the world's largest non-profit mammalian genetic research facility and the world's largest supplier of genetically purebred mice.

name: maine
sentence: Maine has an income tax structure containing two brackets, 6.5 and 7.95 percent of personal income.

name: maine
sentence: Before July 2013 Maine had four brackets: 2, 4.5, 7, and 8.5 percent.

name: maine
sentence: Maine's general sales tax rate is 5.5 percent.

name: maine
sentence: The state also levies charges of nine percent on lodging and prepared food and ten percent on short-term auto rentals.

name: maine
sentence: Commercial sellers of blueberries, a Maine staple, must keep records of their transactions and pay the state 1.5 cents per pound ($1.50 per 100 pounds) of the fruit sold each season.

name: maine
sentence: All real and tangible personal property located in the state of Maine is taxable unless specifically exempted by statute.

name: maine
sentence: The administration of property taxes is handled by the local assessor in incorporated cities and towns, while property taxes in the unorganized territories are handled by the State Tax Assessor.

name: maine
sentence: Maine has a long-standing tradition of being home to many shipbuilding companies.

name: maine
sentence: In the 18th and 19th centuries, Maine was home to many shipyards that produced wooden sailing ships.

name: maine
sentence: The main function of these ships was to transport either cargos or passengers overseas.

name: maine
sentence: One of these yards was located in Pennellville Historic District in what is now Brunswick, Maine.

name: maine
sentence: This yard, owned by the Pennell family, was typical of the many family-owned shipbuilding companies of the time period.

name: maine
sentence: Other such examples of shipbuilding families were the Skolfields and the Morses.

name: maine
sentence: During the 18th and 19th centuries, wooden shipbuilding of this sort made up a sizable portion of the economy.

name: maine
sentence: Maine receives passenger jet service at its two largest airports, the Portland International Jetport in Portland, and the Bangor International Airport in Bangor.

name: maine
sentence: Both are served daily by many major airlines to destinations such as New York, Atlanta, and Orlando.

name: maine
sentence: Essential Air Service also subsidizes service to a number of smaller airports in Maine, bringing small turboprop aircraft to regional airports such as the Augusta State Airport, Hancock County-Bar Harbor Airport, Knox County Regional Airport, and the Northern Maine Regional Airport at Presque Isle.

name: maine
sentence: These airports are served by regional providers such as Cape Air with Cessna 402s, PenAir with Saab 340s, and CommutAir with Embraer ERJ 145 aircraft.

name: maine
sentence: Many smaller airports are scattered throughout Maine, serving only general aviation traffic.

name: maine
sentence: The Eastport Municipal Airport, for example, is a city-owned public-use airport with 1,200 general aviation aircraft operations each year from single-engine and ultralight aircraft.

name: maine
sentence: Interstate 95 (I-95) travels through Maine, as well as its easterly branch I-295 and spurs I-195, I-395 and the unsigned I-495 (the Falmouth Spur).

name: maine
sentence: In addition, US Route 1 (US 1) starts in Fort Kent and travels to Florida.

name: maine
sentence: The eastern terminus of the eastern section of US 2 starts in Houlton, near the New Brunswick, Canada border to Rouses Point, New York, at US 11.

name: maine
sentence: US 2A connects Old Town and Orono, primarily serving the University of Maine campus.

name: maine
sentence: US 201 and US 202 flow through the state.

name: maine
sentence: US 2, Maine State Route 6 (SR 6), and SR 9 are often used by truckers and other motorists of the Maritime Provinces en route to other destinations in the United States or as a short cut to Central Canada.

name: maine
sentence: The Downeaster passenger train, operated by Amtrak, provides passenger service between Brunswick and Boston's North Station, with stops in Freeport, Portland, Old Orchard Beach, Saco, and Wells.

name: maine
sentence: The Downeaster makes five daily trips.

name: maine
sentence: Freight service throughout the state is provided by a handful of regional and shortline carriers: Pan Am Railways (formerly known as Guilford Rail System), which operates the former Boston & Maine and Maine Central railroads; St. Lawrence and Atlantic Railroad; Maine Eastern Railroad; Central Maine and Quebec Railway; and New Brunswick Southern Railway.

name: maine
sentence: The Maine Constitution structures Maine's state government, composed of three co-equal branches—the executive, legislative, and judicial branches.

name: maine
sentence: The state of Maine also has three Constitutional Officers (the Secretary of State, the State Treasurer, and the State Attorney General) and one Statutory Officer (the State Auditor).

name: maine
sentence: The legislative branch is the Maine Legislature, a bicameral body composed of the Maine House of Representatives, with 151 members, and the Maine Senatorte, with 35 members.

name: maine
sentence: The Legislature is charged with introducing and passing laws.

name: maine
sentence: The executive branch is responsible for the execution of the laws created by the Legislature and is headed by the Governor of Maine (currently Janet Mills).

name: maine
sentence: The Governor is elected every four years

name: maine
sentence: The current attorney general of Maine is Aaron Frey.

name: maine
sentence: As with other state legislatures, the Maine Legislature can by a two-thirds majority vote from both the House and Senatorte override a gubernatorial veto.

name: maine
sentence: Maine is one of seven states that do not have a lieutenant governor.

name: maine
sentence: The judicial branch is responsible for interpreting state laws.

name: maine
sentence: The highest court of the state is the Maine Supreme Judicial Court.

name: maine
sentence: The lower courts are the District Court, Superior Court and Probate Court.

name: maine
sentence: All judges except for probate judges serve full-time, are nominated by the Governor and confirmed by the Legislature for terms of seven years.

name: maine
sentence: Probate judges serve part-time and are elected by the voters of each county for four-year terms.

name: maine
sentence: Maine is divided into political jurisdictions designated as counties.

name: maine
sentence: Since 1860 there have been 16 counties in the state, ranging in size from 370 to 6,829 square miles (958 to 17,700 km2).

name: maine
sentence: In state general elections, Maine voters tend to accept independent and third-party candidates more frequently than most states.

name: maine
sentence: Maine has had two independent governors recently (James B. Longley, 1975–1979 and current US

name: maine
sentence: Senatortor Angus King, 1995–2003).

name: maine
sentence: Maine state politicians, Democrats and Republicans alike, are noted for having more moderate views than many in the national wings of their respective parties.

name: maine
sentence: Maine is an alcoholic beverage control state.

name: maine
sentence: On May 6, 2009, Maine became the fifth state to legalize same-sex marriage; however, the law was repealed by voters on November 3, 2009.

name: maine
sentence: On November 6, 2012, Maine, along with Maryland and Washington, became the first state to legalize same-sex marriage at the ballot box.

name: maine
sentence: In the 1930s, Maine was one of very few states which retained Republican sentiments.

name: maine
sentence: In the 1936 presidential election, Franklin D. Roosevelt received the electoral votes of every state other than Maine and Vermont; these were the only two states in the nation that never voted for Roosevelt in any of his presidential campaigns, though Maine was closely fought in 1940 and 1944.

name: maine
sentence: In the 1960s, Maine began to lean toward the Democrats, especially in presidential elections.

name: maine
sentence: In 1968, Hubert Humphrey became just the second Democrat in half a century to carry Maine, perhaps because of the presence of his running mate, Maine Senatortor Edmund Muskie, although the state voted Republican in every presidential election in the 1970s and 1980s.

name: maine
sentence: Since 1969, two of Maine's four electoral votes have been awarded based on the winner of the statewide election; the other two go to the highest vote-getter in each of the state's two congressional districts.

name: maine
sentence: Every other state except Nebraska gives all its electoral votes to the candidate who wins the popular vote in the state at large, without regard to performance within districts.

name: maine
sentence: Maine split its electoral vote for the first time in 2016, with Donald Trump's strong showing in the more rural central and northern Maine allowing him to capture one of the state's four votes in the Electoral College.

name: maine
sentence: Ross Perot achieved a great deal of success in Maine in the presidential elections of 1992 and 1996.

name: maine
sentence: In 1992, as an independent candidate, Perot came in second to Democrat Bill Clinton, despite the long-time presence of the Bush family summer home in Kennebunkport.

name: maine
sentence: In 1996, as the nominee of the Reform Party, Perot did better in Maine than in any other state.

name: maine
sentence: Maine has voted for Democratic Bill Clinton twice, Al Gore in 2000, John Kerry in 2004, and Barack Obama in 2008 and 2012.

name: maine
sentence: In 2016, Republican Donald Trump won one of Maine's electoral votes with Democratic opponent Hillary Clinton winning the other three.

name: maine
sentence: Although Democrats have mostly carried the state in presidential elections in recent years, Republicans have largely maintained their control of the state's US Senatorte seats, with Edmund Muskie, William Hathaway and George J. Mitchell being the only Maine Democrats serving in the US Senatorte in the past fifty years.

name: maine
sentence: In the 2010 midterm elections, Republicans made major gains in Maine.

name: maine
sentence: They captured the governor's office as well as majorities in both chambers of the state legislature for the first time since the early 1970s.

name: maine
sentence: However, in the 2012 elections Democrats managed to recapture both houses of Maine Legislature.

name: maine
sentence: Maine's US senators are Republican Susan Collins and Independent Angus King.

name: maine
sentence: The governor is Democrat Janet Mills.

name: maine
sentence: The state's two members of the United States House of Representatives are Democrats Chellie Pingree and Jared Golden.

name: maine
sentence: Maine is the first state to have introduced ranked-choice voting in federal elections.

name: maine
sentence: An organized municipality has a form of elected local government which administers and provides local services, keeps records, collects licensing fees, and can pass locally binding ordinances, among other responsibilities of self-government.

name: maine
sentence: The governmental format of most organized towns and plantations is the town meeting, while the format of most cities is the council-manager form.

name: maine
sentence: As of 2013 the organized municipalities of Maine consist of 23 cities, 431 towns, and 34 plantations.

name: maine
sentence: Collectively these 488 organized municipalities cover less than half of the state's territory.

name: maine
sentence: Maine also has three Reservations: Indian Island, Indian Township Reservation, and Pleasant Point Indian Reservation.

name: maine
sentence: Unorganized territory (UT) has no local government.

name: maine
sentence: Administration, services, licensing, and ordinances are handled by the state government as well as by respective county governments who have townships within each county's bounds.

name: maine
sentence: The unorganized territory of Maine consists of more than 400 townships (towns are incorporated, townships are unincorporated), plus many coastal islands that do not lie within any municipal bounds.

name: maine
sentence: The UT land area is slightly over half the entire area of the State of Maine.

name: maine
sentence: Year-round residents in the UT number approximately 9,000 (about 1.3% of the state's total population), with many more people staying there only seasonally.

name: maine
sentence: Only four of Maine's sixteen counties (Androscoggin, Cumberland, Waldo and York) are entirely incorporated, although a few others are nearly so, and most of the unincorporated area is in the vast and sparsely populated Great North Woods of Maine.

name: maine
sentence: QuickFacts US Census Maine Portland:

name: maine
sentence: Throughout Maine, many municipalities, although each separate governmental entities, nevertheless form portions of a much larger population base.

name: maine
sentence: There are many such population clusters throughout Maine, but some examples from the municipalities appearing in the above listing are:

name: maine
sentence: There are thirty institutions of higher learning in Maine.

name: maine
sentence: These institutions include the University of Maine, which is the oldest, largest and only research university in the state.

name: maine
sentence: UMaine was founded in 1865 and is the state's only land grant and sea grant college.

name: maine
sentence: The University of Maine is located in the town of Orono and is the flagship of Maine.

name: maine
sentence: There are also branch campuses in Augusta, Farmington, Fort Kent, Machias, and Presque Isle.

name: maine
sentence: Bowdoin College is a liberal arts college founded in 1794 in Brunswick, making it the oldest institution of higher learning in the state.

name: maine
sentence: Colby College in Waterville was founded in 1813 making it the second oldest college in Maine.

name: maine
sentence: Bates College in Lewiston was founded in 1855 making it the third oldest institution in the state and the oldest coeducational college in New England.

name: maine
sentence: The three colleges collectively form the Colby-Bates-Bowdoin Consortium and are ranked among the best colleges in the United States

name: maine
sentence: Maine's per-student public expenditure for elementary and secondary schools was 21st in the nation in 2012, at $12,344.

name: maine
sentence: The collegiate system of Maine also includes numerous baccalaureate colleges such as: the Maine Maritime Academy (MMA), Unity College, and Thomas College.

name: maine
sentence: There is only one medical school in the state, (University of New England's College of Osteopathic Medicine) and only one law school (The University of Maine School of Law).

name: maine
sentence: Private schools in Maine are funded independently of the state and its furthered domains.

name: maine
sentence: Private schools are less common than public schools.

name: maine
sentence: A large number of private elementary schools with under 20 students exist, but most private high schools in Maine can be described as "semi-private".

name: maine
sentence: Maine was a center of agriculture before it achieved statehood.

name: maine
sentence: Prior to colonization, Wabanaki nations farmed large crops of corn and other produce in southern Maine.

name: maine
sentence: The state is a major producer of potatoes, wild blueberries, apples, maple syrup and sweet corn.

name: maine
sentence: Dairy products and chicken's eggs are other major industries.

name: maine
sentence: Maine has many vegetable farms and other small, diversified farms.

name: maine
sentence: In the 1960s and 1970s, the book "Living the Good Life" by Helen Nearing and Scott Nearing caused many young people to move to Maine and engage in small-scale farming and homesteading.

name: maine
sentence: These back-to-the-land migrants increased the population of some counties.

name: maine
sentence: Maine has a smaller number of commodity farms and confined animal feeding operations.

name: maine
sentence: Maine is home to the Maine Organic Farmers and Gardeners Association and had 535 certified organic farms in 2019.

name: maine
sentence: Since the 1980s, the state has gotten a reputation for its local food and restaurant meals.

name: maine
sentence: Portland was named Bon Appetit magazine's Restaurant City of the Year in 2018.

name: maine
sentence: In 2018, HealthIQ.com named Maine the 3rd most vegan state.

name: maine
sentence: Adapted from the Maine facts site.

name: maine
sentence: A citizen of Maine is known as a "Mainer", though the term is often reserved for those whose roots in Maine go back at least three generations.

name: maine
sentence: The term "Downeaster" may be applied to residents of the northeast coast of the state.

name: maine
sentence: The term "Mainiac" is considered by some to be derogatory, but embraced with pride by others, and is used for a variety of organizations and for events such as the YMCA Mainiac Sprint Triathlon & Duathlon.

name: maryland
sentence: Maryland (US: (listen) MERR-ə-lənd) is a state in the Mid-Atlantic region of the Southern United States, bordering Virginia, West Virginia, and the District of Columbia to its south and west; Pennsylvania to its north; and Delaware and the Atlantic Ocean to its east.

name: maryland
sentence: The state's largest city is Baltimore, and its capital is Annapolis.

name: maryland
sentence: Among its occasional nicknames are Old Line State, the Free State, and the Chesapeake Bay State.

name: maryland
sentence: It is named after the English Queen Henrietta Maria, known in England as Queen Mary, who was the wife of King Charles I.

name: maryland
sentence: Sixteen of Maryland's twenty-three counties, as well as the city of Baltimore, border the tidal waters of the Chesapeake Bay estuary and its many tributaries, which combined total more than 4,000 miles of shoreline.

name: maryland
sentence: Although one of the smallest states in the US, it features a variety of climates and topographical features that have earned it the moniker of America in Miniature.

name: maryland
sentence: In a similar vein, Maryland's geography, culture, and history combine elements of the Mid-Atlantic, Northeastern, and Southern regions of the country.

name: maryland
sentence: Before its coastline was explored by Europeans in the 16th century, Maryland was inhabited by several groups of Native Americans, mostly by the Algonquin, and to a lesser degree by the Iroquois and Sioux.

name: maryland
sentence: As one of the original Thirteen Colonies of Great Britain Maryland was founded by George Calvert, 1st Baron Baltimore, a Catholic convert who sought to provide a religious haven for Catholics persecuted in England.

name: maryland
sentence: In 1632, Charles I of England granted Lord Baltimore a colonial charter, naming the colony after his wife, Queen Mary (Henrietta Maria of France).

name: maryland
sentence: Unlike the Pilgrims and Puritans, who rejected Catholicism in their settlements, Lord Baltimore envisioned a colony where people of different religious sects would coexist under the principle of toleration.

name: maryland
sentence: Accordingly, in 1649 the Maryland General Assembly passed an Act Concerning Religion, which enshrined this principle by penalizing anyone who "reproached" a fellow Marylander based on religious affiliation.

name: maryland
sentence: Nevertheless, religious strife was common in the early years, and Catholics remained a minority, albeit in greater numbers than in any other English colony.

name: maryland
sentence: Maryland's early settlements and population centers clustered around rivers and other waterways that empty into the Chesapeake Bay.

name: maryland
sentence: Its economy was heavily plantation-based and centered mostly on the cultivation of tobacco.

name: maryland
sentence: Britain's need for cheap labor led to a rapid expansion of indentured servants, penal labor, and African slaves.

name: maryland
sentence: In 1760, Maryland's current boundaries took form following the settlement of a long-running border dispute with Pennsylvania.

name: maryland
sentence: Maryland was an active participant in the events leading up to the American Revolution, and by 1776, its delegates signed the Declaration of Independence.

name: maryland
sentence: Many of its citizens subsequently played key political and military roles in the war.

name: maryland
sentence: In 1790, the state ceded land for the establishment of the US capital of Washington, D.C.

name: maryland
sentence: Although then a slave state, Maryland remained in the Union during the American Civil War, its strategic location giving it a significant role in the conflict.

name: maryland
sentence: After the war, Maryland took part in the Industrial Revolution, driven by its seaports, railroad networks, and mass immigration from Europe.

name: maryland
sentence: Since the Second World War, the state's population has grown rapidly, to approximately six million residents, and it is among the most densely populated US states.

name: maryland
sentence: As of 2015, Maryland had the highest median household income of any state, owing in large part to its proximity to Washington, D.C. and a highly diversified economy spanning manufacturing, services, higher education, and biotechnology.

name: maryland
sentence: The state's central role in US history is reflected by its hosting of some of the highest numbers of historic landmarks per capita.

name: maryland
sentence: Maryland has an area of 12,406.68 square miles (32,133.2 km2) and is comparable in overall area with Belgium [11,787 square miles (30,530 km2)].

name: maryland
sentence: It is the 42nd largest and 9th smallest state and is closest in size to the state of Hawaii [10,930.98 square miles (28,311.1 km2)], the next smaller state.

name: maryland
sentence: The next larger state, its neighbor West Virginia, is almost twice the size of Maryland [24,229.76 square miles (62,754.8 km2)].

name: maryland
sentence: Maryland possesses a variety of topography within its borders, contributing to its nickname America in Miniature.

name: maryland
sentence: It ranges from sandy dunes dotted with seagrass in the east, to low marshlands teeming with wildlife and large bald cypress near the Chesapeake Bay, to gently rolling hills of oak forests in the Piedmont Region, and pine groves in the Maryland mountains to the west.

name: maryland
sentence: Maryland is bounded on its north by Pennsylvania, on its west by West Virginia, on its east by Delaware and the Atlantic Ocean, and on its south, across the Potomac River, by West Virginia and Virginia.

name: maryland
sentence: The mid-portion of this border is interrupted by District of Columbia, which sits on land that was originally part of Montgomery and Prince George's counties and including the town of Georgetown, Maryland.

name: maryland
sentence: This land was ceded to the United States Federal Government in 1790 to form the District of Columbia.

name: maryland
sentence: (The Commonwealth of Virginia gave land south of the Potomac, including the town of Alexandria, Virginia, however, Virginia retroceded its portion in 1846).

name: maryland
sentence: The Chesapeake Bay nearly bisects the state and the counties east of the bay are known collectively as the Eastern Shore.

name: maryland
sentence: Most of the state's waterways are part of the Chesapeake Bay watershed, with the exceptions of a tiny portion of extreme western Garrett County (drained by the Youghiogheny River as part of the watershed of the Mississippi River), the eastern half of Worcester County (which drains into Maryland's Atlantic coastal bays), and a small portion of the state's northeast corner (which drains into the Delaware River watershed).

name: maryland
sentence: So prominent is the Chesapeake in Maryland's geography and economic life that there has been periodic agitation to change the state's official nickname to the "Bay State", a nickname that has been used by Massachusetts for decades.

name: maryland
sentence: The highest point in Maryland, with an elevation of 3,360 feet (1,020 m), is Hoye Crest on Backbone Mountain, in the southwest corner of Garrett County, near the border with West Virginia, and near the headwaters of the North Branch of the Potomac River.

name: maryland
sentence: Close to the small town of Hancock, in western Maryland, about two-thirds of the way across the state, less than 2 miles (3.2 km) separates its borders, the Mason–Dixon line to the north, and the northwards-arching Potomac River to the south.

name: maryland
sentence: Portions of Maryland are included in various official and unofficial geographic regions.

name: maryland
sentence: For example, the Delmarva Peninsula is composed of the Eastern Shore counties of Maryland, the entire state of Delaware, and the two counties that make up the Eastern Shore of Virginia, whereas the westernmost counties of Maryland are considered part of Appalachia.

name: maryland
sentence: Much of the Baltimore–Washington corridor lies just south of the Piedmont in the Coastal Plain, though it straddles the border between the two regions.

name: maryland
sentence: Earthquakes in Maryland are infrequent and small due to the state's distance from seismic/earthquake zones.

name: maryland
sentence: The M5.8 Virginia earthquake in 2011 was felt moderately throughout Maryland.

name: maryland
sentence: Buildings in the state are not well-designed for earthquakes and can suffer damage easily.

name: maryland
sentence: Maryland has no natural lakes, mostly due to the lack of glacial history in the area.

name: maryland
sentence: All lakes in the state today were constructed, mostly via dams.

name: maryland
sentence: Buckel's Bog is believed by geologists to have been a remnant of a former natural lake.

name: maryland
sentence: Maryland has shale formations containing natural gas, where fracking is theoretically possible.

name: maryland
sentence: As is typical of states on the East Coast, Maryland's plant life is abundant and healthy.

name: maryland
sentence: A modest volume of annual precipitation helps to support many types of plants, including seagrass and various reeds at the smaller end of the spectrum to the gigantic Wye Oak, a huge example of white oak, the state tree, which can grow over 70 feet (21 m) tall.

name: maryland
sentence: Middle Atlantic coastal forests, typical of the southeastern Atlantic coastal plain, grow around Chesapeake Bay and on the Delmarva Peninsula.

name: maryland
sentence: Moving west, a mixture of Northeastern coastal forests and Southeastern mixed forests cover the central part of the state.

name: maryland
sentence: The Appalachian Mountains of western Maryland are home to Appalachian-Blue Ridge forests.

name: maryland
sentence: These give way to Appalachian mixed mesophytic forests near the West Virginia border.

name: maryland
sentence: Many foreign species are cultivated in the state, some as ornamentals, others as novelty species.

name: maryland
sentence: Included among these are the crape myrtle, Italian cypress, southern magnolia, live oak in the warmer parts of the state, and even hardy palm trees in the warmer central and eastern parts of the state.

name: maryland
sentence: USDA plant hardiness zones in the state range from Zones 5 and 6 in the extreme western part of the state to Zone 7 in the central part, and Zone 8 around the southern part of the coast, the bay area, and parts of metropolitan Baltimore.

name: maryland
sentence: Invasive plant species, such as kudzu, tree of heaven, multiflora rose, and Japanese stiltgrass, stifle growth of endemic plant life.

name: maryland
sentence: Maryland's state flower, the black-eyed susan, grows in abundance in wild flower groups throughout the state.

name: maryland
sentence: The state harbors a considerable number of white-tailed deer, especially in the woody and mountainous west of the state, and overpopulation can become a problem.

name: maryland
sentence: Mammals can be found ranging from the mountains in the west to the central areas and include black bears, bobcats, foxes, coyotes, raccoons, and otters.

name: maryland
sentence: There is a population of rare wild (feral) horses found on Assateague Island.

name: maryland
sentence: They are believed to be descended from horses who escaped from Spanish galleon shipwrecks.

name: maryland
sentence: Every year during the last week of July, they are captured and swim across a shallow bay for sale at Chincoteague, Virginia, a conservation technique which ensures the tiny island is not overrun by the horses.

name: maryland
sentence: The ponies and their sale were popularized by the children's book, Misty of Chincoteague.

name: maryland
sentence: The purebred Chesapeake Bay Retriever dog was bred specifically for water sports, hunting and search and rescue in the Chesapeake area.

name: maryland
sentence: In 1878, the Chesapeake Bay Retriever was the first individual retriever breed recognized by the American Kennel Club.

name: maryland
sentence: and was later adopted by the University of Maryland, Baltimore County as their mascot.

name: maryland
sentence: Maryland's reptile and amphibian population includes the diamondback terrapin turtle, which was adopted as the mascot of University of Maryland, College Park, as well as the threatened Eastern box turtle.

name: maryland
sentence: The state is part of the territory of the Baltimore oriole, which is the official state bird and mascot of the MLB team the Baltimore Orioles.

name: maryland
sentence: Aside from the oriole, 435 other species of birds have been reported from Maryland.

name: maryland
sentence: The state insect is the Baltimore checkerspot butterfly, although it is not as common in Maryland as it is in the southern edge of its range.

name: maryland
sentence: Maryland joined with neighboring states during the end of the 20th century to improve the health of the Chesapeake Bay.

name: maryland
sentence: The bay's aquatic life and seafood industry have been threatened by development and by fertilizer and livestock waste entering the bay.

name: maryland
sentence: In 2007, Forbes.com rated Maryland as the fifth "Greenest" state in the country behind three of the Pacific States and Vermont.

name: maryland
sentence: Maryland ranks 40th in total energy consumption nationwide, and it managed less toxic waste per capita than all but six states in 2005.

name: maryland
sentence: In April 2007 Maryland joined the Regional Greenhouse Gas Initiative (RGGI)—a regional initiative formed by all the Northeastern states, Washington, D.C., and three Canadian provinces to reduce greenhouse gas emissions.

name: maryland
sentence: In March 2017, Maryland became the first state with proven gas reserves to ban fracking by passing a law against it.

name: maryland
sentence: Vermont has such a law, but no shale gas, and New York has such a ban, though it was made by executive order.

name: maryland
sentence: Maryland has a wide array of climates, due to local variances in elevation, proximity to water, and protection from colder weather due to downslope winds.

name: maryland
sentence: The eastern half of Maryland—which includes the cities of Ocean City, Salisbury, Annapolis, and the southern and eastern suburbs of Washington, D.C. and Baltimore—lies on the Atlantic Coastal Plain, with flat topography and sandy or muddy soil.

name: maryland
sentence: This region has a humid subtropical climate (Köppen Cfa), with hot, humid summers and a short, mild to cool winter; it falls under USDA Hardiness zone 8a.

name: maryland
sentence: The Piedmont region—which includes northern and western greater Baltimore, Westminster, Gaithersburg, Frederick, and Hagerstown—has average seasonal snowfall totals generally exceeding 20 inches (51 cm) and, as part of USDA Hardiness zones 7b and 7a, temperatures below 10 °F (−12 °C) are less rare.

name: maryland
sentence: From the Cumberland Valley on westward, the climate begins to transition to a humid continental climate (Köppen Dfa).

name: maryland
sentence: In western Maryland, the higher elevations of Allegany and Garrett counties—including the cities of Cumberland, Frostburg, and Oakland—display more characteristics of the humid continental zone, due in part to elevation.

name: maryland
sentence: They fall under USDA Hardiness zones 6b and below.

name: maryland
sentence: Precipitation in the state is characteristic of the East Coast.

name: maryland
sentence: Annual rainfall ranges from 35 to 45 inches (890 to 1,140 mm) with more in higher elevations.

name: maryland
sentence: Nearly every part of Maryland receives 3.5–4.5 inches (89–114 mm) per month of rain.

name: maryland
sentence: Average annual snowfall varies from 9 inches (23 cm) in the coastal areas to over 100 inches (250 cm) in the western mountains of the state.

name: maryland
sentence: Because of its location near the Atlantic Coast, Maryland is somewhat vulnerable to tropical cyclones, although the Delmarva Peninsula and the outer banks of North Carolina provide a large buffer, such that strikes from major hurricanes (category 3 or above) occur infrequently.

name: maryland
sentence: More often, Maryland gets the remnants of a tropical system which has already come ashore and released most of its energy.

name: maryland
sentence: Maryland averages around 30–40 days of thunderstorms a year, and averages around six tornado strikes annually.

name: maryland
sentence: George Calvert, 1st Lord Baltimore (1579–1632), sought a charter from King Charles I for the territory between Massachusetts to the north and Virginia to the immediate south.After the first Lord Baltimore died in April 1632, the charter was granted to his son, Cecilius Calvert, 2nd Baron Baltimore (1605–1675), on June 20, 1632.

name: maryland
sentence: Officially, the new "Maryland Colony" was named in honor of Henrietta Maria of France, wife of Charles I of England.

name: maryland
sentence: The 1st Lord Baltimore initially proposed the name "Crescentia", the land of growth or increase, but "the King proposed Terra Mariae [Mary Land], which was concluded on and Inserted in the bill."

name: maryland
sentence: The original capital of Maryland was St. Mary's City, on the north shore of the Potomac River, and the county surrounding it, the first erected/created in the province, was first called Augusta Carolina, after the King, and later named St. Mary's County.

name: maryland
sentence: Lord Baltimore's first settlers arrived in the new colony in March 1634, with his younger brother the Honorable Leonard Calvert (1606–1647), as first provincial Governor of Maryland.

name: maryland
sentence: They made their first permanent settlement at St. Mary's City in what is now St. Mary's County.

name: maryland
sentence: They purchased the site from the paramount chief of the region, who was eager to establish trade.

name: maryland
sentence: St. Mary's became the first capital of Maryland, and remained so for 60 years until 1695.

name: maryland
sentence: More settlers soon followed.

name: maryland
sentence: Their tobacco crops were successful and quickly made the new colony profitable.

name: maryland
sentence: However, given the incidence of malaria, yellow fever and typhoid, life expectancy in Maryland was about 10 years less than in New England.

name: maryland
sentence: Maryland was founded to provide a haven for England's Roman Catholic minority.Although Maryland was the most heavily Catholic of the English mainland colonies, the religion was still in the minority, consisting of less than 10% of the total population.

name: maryland
sentence: In 1642, a number of Puritans left Virginia for Maryland and founded Providence (now called Annapolis) on the western shore of the upper Chesapeake Bay.

name: maryland
sentence: A dispute with traders from Virginia over Kent Island in the Chesapeake led to armed conflict.

name: maryland
sentence: In 1644, William Claiborne, a Puritan, seized Kent Island while his associate, the pro-Parliament Puritan Richard Ingle, took over St. Mary's.

name: maryland
sentence: Both used religion as a tool to gain popular support.

name: maryland
sentence: The two years from 1644 to 1646 when Claiborne and his Puritan associates held sway were known as "The Plundering Time".

name: maryland
sentence: They captured Jesuit priests, imprisoned them, then sent them back to England.

name: maryland
sentence: In 1646 Leonard Calvert returned with troops, recaptured St. Mary's City, and restored order.

name: maryland
sentence: The House of Delegates passed the "Act concerning Religion" in 1649 granting religious liberty to all Trinitarian Christians.

name: maryland
sentence: In 1650, the Puritans revolted against the proprietary government.

name: maryland
sentence: "Protestants swept the Catholics out of the legislature ... and religious strife returned."

name: maryland
sentence: The Puritans set up a new government prohibiting both Roman Catholicism and Anglicanism.

name: maryland
sentence: The Puritan revolutionary government persecuted Maryland Catholics during its reign, known as the "plundering time".

name: maryland
sentence: Mobs burned down all the original Catholic churches of southern Maryland.

name: maryland
sentence: The Puritan rule lasted until 1658 when the Calvert family and Lord Baltimore regained proprietary control and re-enacted the Toleration Act.

name: maryland
sentence: After England's "Glorious Revolution" of 1688, Maryland outlawed Catholicism.

name: maryland
sentence: In 1704, the Maryland General Assembly prohibited Catholics from operating schools, limited the corporate ownership of property to hamper religious orders from expanding or supporting themselves, and encouraged the conversion of Catholic children.

name: maryland
sentence: The celebration of the Catholic sacraments was also officially restricted.

name: maryland
sentence: This state of affairs lasted until after the American Revolutionary War (1775–1783).

name: maryland
sentence: Wealthy Catholic planters built chapels on their land to practice their religion in relative secrecy.

name: maryland
sentence: Into the 18th century, individual priests and lay leaders claimed Maryland farms belonging to the Jesuits as personal property and bequeathed them in order to evade the legal restrictions on religious organizations' owning property.

name: maryland
sentence: The royal charter granted Maryland the land north of the Potomac River up to the 40th parallel.

name: maryland
sentence: A problem arose when Charles II granted a charter for Pennsylvania.

name: maryland
sentence: The grant defined Pennsylvania's southern border as identical to Maryland's northern border, the 40th parallel.

name: maryland
sentence: But the grant indicated that Charles II and William Penn assumed the 40th parallel would pass close to New Castle, Delaware when it falls north of Philadelphia, the site of which Penn had already selected for his colony's capital city.

name: maryland
sentence: Negotiations ensued after the problem was discovered in 1681.

name: maryland
sentence: A compromise proposed by Charles II in 1682 was undermined by Penn's receiving the additional grant of what is now Delaware.

name: maryland
sentence: Penn successfully argued that the Maryland charter entitled Lord Baltimore only to unsettled lands, and Dutch settlement in Delaware predated his charter.

name: maryland
sentence: The dispute remained unresolved for nearly a century, carried on by the descendants of William Penn and Lord Baltimore—the Calvert family, which controlled Maryland, and the Penn family, which controlled Pennsylvania.

name: maryland
sentence: The border dispute with Pennsylvania led to Cresap's War in the 1730s.

name: maryland
sentence: Hostilities erupted in 1730 and escalated through the first half of the decade, culminating in the deployment of military forces by Maryland in 1736 and by Pennsylvania in 1737.

name: maryland
sentence: The armed phase of the conflict ended in May 1738 with the intervention of King George II, who compelled the negotiation of a cease-fire.

name: maryland
sentence: A provisional agreement had been established in 1732.

name: maryland
sentence: Negotiations continued until a final agreement was signed in 1760.

name: maryland
sentence: The agreement defined the border between Maryland and Pennsylvania as the line of latitude now known as the Mason–Dixon line.

name: maryland
sentence: Maryland's border with Delaware was based on a Transpeninsular Line and the Twelve-Mile Circle around New Castle.

name: maryland
sentence: Most of the English colonists arrived in Maryland as indentured servants, and had to serve a several years' term as laborers to pay for their passage.

name: maryland
sentence: In the early years, the line between indentured servants and African slaves or laborers was fluid, and white and black laborers commonly lived and worked together, and formed unions.

name: maryland
sentence: Mixed-race children born to white mothers were considered free by the principle of partus sequitur ventrem, by which children took the social status of their mothers, a principle of slave law that was adopted throughout the colonies, following Virginia in 1662.

name: maryland
sentence: During the colonial era, families of free people of color were formed most often by unions of white women and African men.

name: maryland
sentence: Many of the free black families migrated to Delaware, where land was cheaper.

name: maryland
sentence: As the flow of indentured laborers to the colony decreased with improving economic conditions in England, planters in Maryland imported thousands more slaves and racial caste lines hardened.

name: maryland
sentence: The economy's growth and prosperity was based on slave labor, devoted first to the production of tobacco as the commodity crop.

name: maryland
sentence: Maryland was one of the thirteen colonies that revolted against British rule in the American Revolution.

name: maryland
sentence: Near the end of the American Revolutionary War (1775–1783), on February 2, 1781, Maryland became the last and 13th state to approve the ratification of the Articles of Confederation and Perpetual Union, first proposed in 1776 and adopted by the Second Continental Congress in 1778, which brought into being the United States as a united, sovereign and national state.

name: maryland
sentence: It also became the seventh state admitted to the Union after ratifying the new federal Constitution in 1788.

name: maryland
sentence: In December 1790, Maryland donated land selected by first President George Washington to the federal government for the creation of the new national capital of Washington, D.C.

name: maryland
sentence: The land was provided along the north shore of the Potomac River from Montgomery and Prince George's counties, as well as from Fairfax County and Alexandria on the south shore of the Potomac in Virginia; however, the land donated by the Commonwealth of Virginia was later returned to that state by the District of Columbia retrocession in 1846.

name: maryland
