sentence: It was included in the 2016 United States presidential election ballot in Massachusetts as an indirectly initiated state statute.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Massachusetts is the 7th-smallest state in the United States.

name: massachusetts
sentence: It is located in the New England region of the northeastern United States and has an area of 10,555 square miles (27,340 km2), 25.7% of which is water.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Several large bays distinctly shape its coast.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Boston is the largest city, at the inmost point of Massachusetts Bay, and the mouth of the Charles River.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Despite its small size, Massachusetts features numerous topographically distinctive regions.

name: massachusetts
sentence: The large coastal plain of the Atlantic Ocean in the eastern section of the state contains Greater Boston, along with most of the state's population, as well as the distinctive Cape Cod peninsula.

name: massachusetts
sentence: To the west lies the hilly, rural region of Central Massachusetts, and beyond that, the Connecticut River Valley.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Along the western border of Western Massachusetts lies the highest elevated part of the state, the Berkshires.

name: massachusetts
sentence: The US National Park Service administers a number of natural and historical sites in Massachusetts.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Along with twelve national historic sites, areas, and corridors, the National Park Service also manages the Cape Cod National Seashore and the Boston Harbor Islands National Recreation Area.

name: massachusetts
sentence: In addition, the Department of Conservation and Recreation maintains a number of parks, trails, and beaches throughout Massachusetts.

name: massachusetts
sentence: The primary biome of inland Massachusetts is temperate deciduous forest.Although much of Massachusetts had been cleared for agriculture, leaving only traces of old-growth forest in isolated pockets, secondary growth has regenerated in many rural areas as farms have been abandoned.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Currently, forests cover around 62% of Massachusetts.

name: massachusetts
sentence: The areas most affected by human development include the Greater Boston area in the east and the Springfield metropolitan area in the west, although the latter includes agricultural areas throughout the Connecticut River Valley.

name: massachusetts
sentence: There are currently 219 endangered species in Massachusetts.

name: massachusetts
sentence: A number of species are doing well in the increasingly urbanized Massachusetts.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Peregrine falcons utilize office towers in larger cities as nesting areas, and the population of coyotes, whose diet may include garbage and roadkill, has been increasing in recent decades.

name: massachusetts
sentence: White-tailed deer, raccoons, wild turkeys, and eastern gray squirrels are also found throughout Massachusetts.

name: massachusetts
sentence: In more rural areas in the western part of Massachusetts, larger mammals such as moose and black bears have returned, largely due to reforestation following the regional decline in agriculture.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Massachusetts is located along the Atlantic Flyway, a major route for migratory waterfowl along the eastern coast.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Lakes in central Massachusetts provide habitat for many species of fish and waterfowl, but some species such as the common loon are becoming rare.

name: massachusetts
sentence: A significant population of long-tailed ducks winter off Nantucket.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Small offshore islands and beaches are home to roseate terns and are important breeding areas for the locally threatened piping plover.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Protected areas such as the Monomoy National Wildlife Refuge provide critical breeding habitat for shorebirds and a variety of marine wildlife including a large population of grey seals.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Since 2009, there has been a significant increase in the number of Great white sharks spotted and tagged in the coastal waters off of Cape Cod.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Freshwater fish species in Massachusetts include bass, carp, catfish, and trout, while saltwater species such as Atlantic cod, haddock, and American lobster populate offshore waters.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Other marine species include Harbor seals, the endangered North Atlantic right whales, as well as humpback whales, fin whales, minke whales, and Atlantic white-sided dolphins.

name: massachusetts
sentence: The European corn borer, a significant agricultural pest, was first found in North America near Boston, Massachusetts in 1917.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Most of Massachusetts has a humid continental climate, with cold winters and warm summers.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Far southeast coastal areas are the broad transition zone to Humid Subtropical climates.

name: massachusetts
sentence: The warm to hot summers render the oceanic climate rare in this transition, only applying to exposed coastal areas such as on the peninsula of Barnstable County.

name: massachusetts
sentence: The climate of Boston is quite representative for the commonwealth, characterized by summer highs of around 81 °F (27 °C) and winter highs of 35 °F (2 °C), and is quite wet.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Frosts are frequent all winter, even in coastal areas due to prevailing inland winds.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Due to its location near the Atlantic, Massachusetts is vulnerable to nor'easters, hurricanes and tropical storms.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Climate change in Massachusetts will affect both urban and rural environments, including forestry, fisheries, agriculture, and coastal development.

name: massachusetts
sentence: The Northeast is projected to warm faster than global average temperatures; by 2035, the Northeast is "projected to be more than 3.6°F (2°C) warmer on average than during the preindustrial era".

name: massachusetts
sentence: As of August 2016, the EPA reports that Massachusetts has warmed by over two degrees Fahrenheit, or 1.1 degrees Celsius.

name: massachusetts
sentence: This is almost twice as much as the average for the contiguous United States.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Shifting temperatures also result in the shifting of rainfall patterns and the intensification of precipitation events.

name: massachusetts
sentence: To that end, average precipitation in the Northeast United States has risen by ten percent from 1895 to 2011, and the number of heavy precipitation events has increased by seventy percent during that time.

name: massachusetts
sentence: These increased precipitation patterns are focused in the winter and spring.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Increasing temperatures coupled with increasing precipitation will result in earlier snow melts and subsequent drier soil in the summer months.

name: massachusetts
sentence: The shifting climate in Massachusetts will result in a significant change to the built environment and ecosystems.

name: massachusetts
sentence: In Boston alone, costs of climate change-related storms will result in 5 to 100 billion dollars in damage.

name: massachusetts
sentence: These costs are attributed to expected coastal home damage, roadway destruction, and existing utility infrastructure exposure.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Warmer temperatures will also disrupt the migration of birds and the blooming of flora.

name: massachusetts
sentence: With these changes, deer populations are expected to increase, resulting in a decrease in underbrush which smaller fauna use as camouflage.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Additionally, rising temperatures will increase the number of reported Lyme disease cases in the state.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Ticks can transmit the disease once temperatures reach 45 degrees, so shorter winters will increase the window of transmission.

name: massachusetts
sentence: These warmer temperatures will also increase the prevalence of mosquitos, a carrier of the West Nile virus.

name: massachusetts
sentence: To combat this change, the state of Massachusetts’ Executive Office of Energy and Environmental Affairs has outlined a path to decarbonization of the state’s economy.

name: massachusetts
sentence: On April 22, 2020, the Secretary of Energy and Environmental Affairs of Massachusetts, Kathleen A. Theoharides, released a Determination of Statewide Emissions limits for 2050.

name: massachusetts
sentence: In her letter, Theoharides stresses that as of 2020, the Commonwealth has experienced property damage attributable to climate change of more than $60 billion.

name: massachusetts
sentence: To ensure that the Commonwealth experiences warming no more than 1.5°C of pre-industrialization levels, the state will work to achieve net-zero emissions and the overall reduction of greenhouse gas emissions by 85 percent by the year 2050.

name: massachusetts
sentence: The State of Massachusetts has developed a plethora of incentives to encourage the implementation of renewable energy and efficient appliances and home facilities.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Mass Save has been formed in conjunction with the State by Berkshire Gas, Blackstone Gas Company, Cape Light Compact, Eversource, Liberty Utilities, National Grid and Unitil to provide homeowners and renters with incentives to retrofit their homes with efficient HVAC equipment and other household appliances.

name: massachusetts
sentence: For example, up to a 100-dollar rebate can be obtained for upgrading to an ENERGY STAR certified smart or programmable thermostat.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Other appliances such as water heaters, air conditioners, washers and driers, and heat pumps are eligible for additional rebates.

name: massachusetts
sentence: The concept of Mass Save was created in 2008 by the passing of the Green Communities Act of 2008 during Deval Patrick’s tenure as governor.

name: massachusetts
sentence: The main goal of the Green Communities Act was to reduce the consumption of fossil fuels in the State and to encourage new, more efficient technologies.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Among others, one result of this act was a requirement for Program Administrators of utilities to invest in saving energy, as opposed to purchasing and generating additional energy where economically feasible.

name: massachusetts
sentence: In Massachusetts, eleven Program Administrators, including NSTAR, National Grid, Western Massachusetts Electric, Cape Light Compact, Until, and Berkshire Gas, jointly own the rights to this program, in conjunction with the MA Department of Energy Resources (DOER) and the Energy Efficiency Advisory Council (EEAC).

name: massachusetts
sentence: Mass Save also conducts no-cost in-home energy assessments so that homeowners, renters, and small business owners may educate themselves about energy efficiency-related home improvements and find opportunities to save money and energy.

name: massachusetts
sentence: During the home assessment, Mass Save provides ENERGY STAR certified LED light bulbs, power strips, low flow showerheads, faucet aerators, and efficient thermostats free of charge.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Additionally, air leaks will be detected in the home or building and patched, and recommendations will be made to install additional insulation to decrease the loss of heated or cooled air.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Discounts of 75 percent or more are available on these insulation improvements.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Due to COVID-19, Mass Save is currently conducting assessments remotely.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Residents can schedule a remote assessment using the program's website or phone line.

name: massachusetts
sentence: The State Revenue Service provides incentives for the installation of solar panels.

name: massachusetts
sentence: In addition to the Federal Residential Renewable energy credit, Massachusetts residents may be eligible for a tax credit of up to 15 percent of the project.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Once installed, arrays are eligible for net metering.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Certain municipalities will offer up to $1.20 per watt, up to 50 percent of the system’s cost on PV arrays 25 kW or less.

name: massachusetts
sentence: The Massachusetts Department of Energy Resources also offers low-interest, fixed-rate financing with loan support for low-income residents.

name: massachusetts
sentence: This program is currently set to terminate on December 31, 2020.

name: massachusetts
sentence: As a part of the Massachusetts Department of Energy Resources’ effort to incentivize the usage of renewable energy, the MOR-EV, or Massachusetts Offers Rebates for Electric Vehicles initiative was created.

name: massachusetts
sentence: With this incentive, residents may qualify for a State incentive of up to $2,500 dollars for the purchase or lease of an electric vehicle, or $1,500 for the purchase or lease of a plug-in hybrid vehicle.

name: massachusetts
sentence: This rebate is available in addition to the tax credits offered by the United States Department of Energy for the purchase of electric and plug-in hybrid vehicles.

name: massachusetts
sentence: For income-eligible residents, Mass Save has partnered with Massachusetts Community Action Program Agencies and Low-Income Energy Affordability Network (LEAN) to offer residents assistance with upgrades to their homes that will result in more efficient energy usage.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Residents may qualify for a replacement of their heating system, insulation installation, appliances, and thermostats if they meet the income qualifications provided on Mass Save’s website.

name: massachusetts
sentence: For residents of 5+ family residential buildings, there are additional income-restricted benefits available through LEAN.

name: massachusetts
sentence: If at least 50 percent of the residents of the building qualify as low income, energy efficiency improvements like those available through Mass Save are available.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Residential structures operated by non-profit organizations, for profit operations, or housing authorities may take advantage of these programs.

name: massachusetts
sentence: In late 2020, the Baker Administration released a Decarbonization Roadmap that aims for net-zero greenhouse gas emissions by 2050.

name: massachusetts
sentence: The plan calls for major investments in offshore wind and solar energy and would require all new automobiles sold to be zero-emissions (electric or hydrogen powered) by 2035.

name: massachusetts
sentence: The United States Census Bureau estimated that the population of Massachusetts was 6,892,503 on July 1, 2019, a 5.27% increase since the 2010 United States Census.

name: massachusetts
sentence: As of 2015, Massachusetts was estimated to be the third-most densely populated US state, with 871.0 people per square mile, behind New Jersey and Rhode Island.

name: massachusetts
sentence: In 2014, Massachusetts had 1,011,811 foreign-born residents or 15% of the population.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Most Bay State residents live within the Boston Metropolitan Area, also known as Greater Boston, which includes Boston and its proximate surroundings but also extending to Greater Lowell and to Worcester.

name: massachusetts
sentence: The Springfield metropolitan area, also known as Greater Springfield, is also a major center of population.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Demographically, the center of population of Massachusetts is located in the town of Natick.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Like the rest of the Northeastern United States, the population of Massachusetts has continued to grow in the late 20th and early 21st centuries.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Massachusetts is the fastest-growing state in New England and the 25th fastest-growing state in the United States.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Population growth was largely due to a relatively high quality of life and a large higher education system in the state.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Foreign immigration is also a factor in the state's population growth, causing the state's population to continue to grow as of the 2010 Census (particularly in Massachusetts gateway cities where costs of living are lower).

name: massachusetts
sentence: 40% of foreign immigrants were from Central or South America, according to a 2005 Census Bureau study, with many of the remainder from Asia.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Many residents who have settled in Greater Springfield claim Puerto Rican descent.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Many areas of Massachusetts showed relatively stable population trends between 2000 and 2010.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Exurban Boston and coastal areas grew the most rapidly, while Berkshire County in far Western Massachusetts and Barnstable County on Cape Cod were the only counties to lose population as of the 2010 Census.

name: massachusetts
sentence: By sex, 48.4% were male, and 51.6% were female in 2014.

name: massachusetts
sentence: In terms of age, 79.2% were over 18 and 14.8% were over 65.

name: massachusetts
sentence: As of 2014, in terms of race and ethnicity, Massachusetts was 83.2% White (73.7% Non-Hispanic White), 8.8% Black or African American, 0.5% Native American and Alaska Native, 6.3% Asian American, <0.1% Native Hawaiian and Other Pacific Islander, 2.1% from some other race, and 3.1% from two or more races.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Hispanics and Latinos of any race made up 11.2% of the population.

name: massachusetts
sentence: The state's most populous ethnic group, non-Hispanic white, has declined from 95.4% in 1970 to 73.7% in 2014.

name: massachusetts
sentence: As of 2011, non-Hispanic whites were involved in 63.6% of all the births, while 36.4% of the population of Massachusetts younger than age 1 was minorities (at least one parent who was not non-Hispanic white).

name: massachusetts
sentence: One major reason for this is that non-Hispanic whites in Massachusetts recorded a total fertility rate of 1.36 in 2017, the second-lowest in the country after neighboring Rhode Island.

name: massachusetts
sentence: As late as 1795, the population of Massachusetts was nearly 95% of English ancestry.

name: massachusetts
sentence: During the early and mid-19th century, immigrant groups began arriving in Massachusetts in large numbers; first from Ireland in the 1840s; today the Irish and part-Irish are the largest ancestry group in the state at nearly 25% of the total population.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Others arrived later from Quebec as well as places in Europe such as Italy, Portugal, and Poland.

name: massachusetts
sentence: In the early 20th century, a number of African Americans migrated to Massachusetts, although in somewhat fewer numbers than many other Northern states.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Later in the 20th century, immigration from Latin America increased considerably.

name: massachusetts
sentence: More than 156,000 Chinese Americans made their home in Massachusetts in 2014, and Boston hosts a growing Chinatown accommodating heavily traveled Chinese-owned bus lines to and from Chinatown, Manhattan in New York City.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Massachusetts also has large Dominican, Puerto Rican, Haitian, Cape Verdean and Brazilian populations.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Boston's South End and Jamaica Plain are both gay villages, as is nearby Provincetown, Massachusetts on Cape Cod.

name: massachusetts
sentence: The largest ancestry group in Massachusetts are the Irish (22.5% of the population), who live in significant numbers throughout the state but form more than 40% of the population along the South Shore in Norfolk and Plymouth counties (in both counties overall, Irish-Americans comprise more than 30% of the population).

name: massachusetts
sentence: Italians form the second-largest ethnic group in the state (13.5%), but form a plurality only in some suburbs north of Boston and in a few towns in the Berkshires.

name: massachusetts
sentence: English Americans, the third-largest (11.4%) group, have lived there the longest but form a plurality only in some western towns.

name: massachusetts
sentence: French and French Canadians also form a significant part (10.7%), with sizable populations in Bristol, Hampden, and Worcester Counties.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Lowell is home to the second-largest Cambodian community of the nation.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Massachusetts is home to a small community of Greek Americans as well, which according to the American Community Survey there are 83,701 of them scattered along the state (1.2% of the total state population).

name: massachusetts
sentence: There are also several populations of Native Americans in Massachusetts.

name: massachusetts
sentence: The Wampanoag tribe maintains reservations at Aquinnah on Martha's Vineyard and at Mashpee on Cape Cod—with an ongoing native language revival project underway since 1993, while the Nipmuc maintain two state-recognized reservations in the central part of the state, including one at Grafton.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Massachusetts has avoided many forms of racial strife seen elsewhere in the US, but examples such as the successful electoral showings of the nativist (mainly anti-Catholic) Know Nothings in the 1850s, the controversial Sacco and Vanzetti executions in the 1920s, and Boston's opposition to desegregation busing in the 1970s show that the ethnic history of Massachusetts was not completely harmonious.

name: massachusetts
sentence: The most common varieties of American English spoken in Massachusetts, other than General American, are the cot-caught distinct, rhotic, western Massachusetts dialect and the cot-caught merged, non-rhotic, eastern Massachusetts dialect (popularly known as a "Boston accent").

name: massachusetts
sentence: As of 2010, 78.93% (4,823,127) of Massachusetts residents 5 and older spoke English at home as a first language, while 7.50% (458,256) spoke Spanish, 2.97% (181,437) Portuguese, 1.59% (96,690) Chinese (which includes Cantonese and Mandarin), 1.11% (67,788) French, 0.89% (54,456) French Creole, 0.72% (43,798) Italian, 0.62% (37,865) Russian, and Vietnamese was spoken as a primary language by 0.58% (35,283) of the population over 5.

name: massachusetts
sentence: In total, 21.07% (1,287,419) of Massachusetts's population 5 and older spoke a first language other than English.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Massachusetts was founded and settled by Brownist Puritans in 1620 and soon after by other groups of Separatists/Dissenters, Nonconformists and Independents from 17th century England.

name: massachusetts
sentence: A majority of people in Massachusetts today remain Christians.

name: massachusetts
sentence: The descendants of the Puritans belong to many different churches; in the direct line of inheritance are the various Congregational churches, the United Church of Christ and congregations of the Unitarian Universalist Association.

name: massachusetts
sentence: The headquarters of the Unitarian Universalist Association, long located on Beacon Hill, is now located in South Boston.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Many Puritan descendants also dispersed to other Protestant denominations.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Some disaffiliated along with Roman Catholics and other Christian groups in the wake of modern secularization.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Today, Christians make up 57% of the state's population, with Protestants making up 21% of them.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Roman Catholics make up 34% and now predominate because of massive immigration from primarily Catholic countries and regions—chiefly Ireland, Italy, Poland, Portugal, Quebec, and Latin America.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Both Protestant and Roman Catholic communities have been in decline since the late 20th century, due to the rise of irreligion in New England.

name: massachusetts
sentence: It is the most irreligious region of the country, along with the Western United States.

name: massachusetts
sentence: A significant Jewish population immigrated to the Boston and Springfield areas between 1880 and 1920.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Jews currently make up 3% of the population.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Mary Baker Eddy made the Boston Mother Church of Christian Science serve as the world headquarters of this new religious movement.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Buddhists, Pagans, Hindus, Seventh-day Adventists, Muslims, and Mormons may also be found.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Kripalu Center in Stockbridge, the Shaolin Meditation Temple in Springfield, and the Insight Meditation Center in Barre are examples of non-Abrahamic religious centers in Massachusetts.

name: massachusetts
sentence: According to 2010 data from The Association of Religion Data Archives, (ARDA) the largest single denominations are the Catholic Church with 2,940,199 adherents; the United Church of Christ with 86,639 adherents; and the Episcopal Church with 81,999 adherents.

name: massachusetts
sentence: 32% of the population identifies as having no religion.

name: massachusetts
sentence: In 2018, Massachusetts's overall educational system was ranked the top among all fifty US states by US News & World Report.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Massachusetts was the first state in North America to require municipalities to appoint a teacher or establish a grammar school with the passage of the Massachusetts Education Law of 1647, and 19th century reforms pushed by Horace Mann laid much of the groundwork for contemporary universal public education which was established in 1852.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Massachusetts is home to the oldest school in continuous existence in North America (The Roxbury Latin School, founded in 1645), as well as the country's oldest public elementary school (The Mather School, founded in 1639), its oldest high school (Boston Latin School, founded in 1635), its oldest continuously operating boarding school (The Governor's Academy, founded in 1763), its oldest college (Harvard University, founded in 1636), and its oldest women's college (Mount Holyoke College, founded in 1837).

name: massachusetts
sentence: Massachusetts is also home to the highest ranked private high school in the United States, Phillips Academy in Andover, Massachusetts, which was founded in 1778.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Massachusetts's per-student public expenditure for elementary and secondary schools was eighth in the nation in 2012, at $14,844.

name: massachusetts
sentence: In 2013, Massachusetts scored highest of all the states in math and third-highest in reading on the National Assessment of Educational Progress.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Massachusetts' public-school students place among the top tier in the world in academic performance.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Massachusetts is home to 121 institutions of higher education.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Harvard University and the Massachusetts Institute of Technology, both located in Cambridge, consistently rank among the world's best private universities and universities in general.

name: massachusetts
sentence: In addition to Harvard and MIT, several other Massachusetts universities currently rank in the top 50 at the undergraduate level nationally in the widely cited rankings of US News and World Report: Tufts University (#27), Boston College (#32), Brandeis University (#34), Boston University (#37) and Northeastern University (#40).

name: massachusetts
sentence: Massachusetts is also home to three of the top five US News and World Report's best Liberal Arts Colleges: Williams College (#1), Amherst College (#2), and Wellesley College (#4).

name: massachusetts
sentence: The public University of Massachusetts (nicknamed UMass) features five campuses in the state, with its flagship campus in Amherst, which enrolls more than 25,000.

name: massachusetts
sentence: The United States Bureau of Economic Analysis estimates that the Massachusetts gross state product in 2017 was $527 billion.

name: massachusetts
sentence: The per capita personal income in 2012 was $53,221, making it the third-highest state in the nation.

name: massachusetts
sentence: As of January 2020, Massachusetts state general minimum wage is $13.50 per hour while the minimum wage for tipped workers is $5.55 an hour.

name: massachusetts
sentence: In 2015, twelve Fortune 500 companies were located in Massachusetts: Liberty Mutual, Massachusetts Mutual Life Insurance Company, TJX Companies, General Electric, Raytheon, American Tower, Global Partners, Thermo Fisher Scientific, State Street Corporation, Biogen, Eversource Energy, and Boston Scientific.

name: massachusetts
sentence: CNBC's list of "Top States for Business for 2014" has recognized Massachusetts as the 25th-best state in the nation for business, and for the second year in a row the state was ranked by Bloomberg as the most innovative state in America.

name: massachusetts
sentence: According to a 2013 study by Phoenix Marketing International, Massachusetts had the sixth-largest number of millionaires per capita in the United States, with a ratio of 6.73 percent.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Billionaires living in the state include past and present leaders (and related family) of local companies such as Fidelity Investments, New Balance, Kraft Group, Boston Scientific, and the former Continental Cablevision.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Massachusetts has three foreign-trade zones, the Massachusetts Port Authority of Boston, the Port of New Bedford, and the City of Holyoke.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Boston-Logan International Airport is the busiest airport in New England, serving 33.4 million total passengers in 2015, and witnessing rapid growth in international air traffic since 2010.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Sectors vital to the Massachusetts economy include higher education, biotechnology, information technology, finance, health care, tourism, manufacturing, and defense.

name: massachusetts
sentence: The Route 128 corridor and Greater Boston continue to be a major center for venture capital investment, and high technology remains an important sector.

name: massachusetts
sentence: In recent years tourism has played an ever-important role in the state's economy, with Boston and Cape Cod being the leading destinations.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Other popular tourist destinations include Salem, Plymouth, and the Berkshires.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Massachusetts is the sixth-most popular tourist destination for foreign travelers.

name: massachusetts
sentence: In 2010, the Great Places in Massachusetts Commission published '1,000 Great Places in Massachusetts' that identified 1,000 sites across the commonwealth to highlight the diverse historic, cultural, and natural attractions.

name: massachusetts
sentence: While manufacturing comprised less than 10% of Massachusetts's gross state product in 2016, the Commonwealth ranked 16th in the nation in total manufacturing output in the United States.

name: massachusetts
sentence: This includes a diverse array of manufactured goods such as medical devices, paper goods, specialty chemicals and plastics, telecommunications and electronics equipment, and machined components.

name: massachusetts
sentence: As of 2012, there were 7,755 farms in Massachusetts encompassing a total of 523,517 acres (2,120 km2), averaging 67.5 acres (0.273 km2) apiece.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Particular agricultural products of note include green house products making up more than one third of the state's agricultural output, cranberries, sweet corn and apples are also large sectors of production.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Massachusetts is the second-largest cranberry-producing state in the union after Wisconsin.

name: massachusetts
sentence: The more than 33,000 nonprofits in Massachusetts employ one-sixth of the state's workforce.

name: massachusetts
sentence: In 2007, Governor Deval Patrick signed into law a state holiday, Nonprofit Awareness Day.

name: massachusetts
sentence: In February 2017, US News & World Report ranked Massachusetts the best state in the United States based upon 60 metrics including healthcare, education, crime, infrastructure, opportunity, economy, and government.

name: massachusetts
sentence: The Bay State ranked number one in education, number two in healthcare, and number five in the handling of the economy.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Depending on how it is calculated, state and local tax burden in Massachusetts has been estimated among US states and Washington D.C. as 21st-highest (11.44% or $6,163 per year for a household with nationwide median income) or 25th-highest overall with below-average corporate taxes (39th-highest), above-average personal income taxes, (13th-highest), above-average sales tax (18th-highest), and below-average property taxes (46th-highest).

name: massachusetts
sentence: In the 1970s, the Commonwealth ranked as a relatively high-tax state, gaining the pejorative nickname "Taxachusetts".

name: massachusetts
sentence: This was followed by a round of tax limitations during the 1980s—a conservative period in American politics—including Proposition 2½.

name: massachusetts
sentence: As of January 1, 2019, Massachusetts has a flat-rate personal income tax of 5.05%, after a 2002 voter referendum to eventually lower the rate to 5.0% as amended by the legislature.

name: massachusetts
sentence: There is a tax exemption for income below a threshold that varies from year to year.

name: massachusetts
sentence: The corporate income tax rate is 8.8%, and the short-term capital gains tax rate is 12%.

name: massachusetts
sentence: An unusual provision allows filers to voluntarily pay at the pre-referendum 5.85% income tax rate, which is done by between one and two thousand taxpayers per year.

name: massachusetts
sentence: The state imposes a 6.25% sales tax on retail sales of tangible personal property—except for groceries, clothing (up to $175.00), and periodicals.

name: massachusetts
sentence: The sales tax is charged on clothing that costs more than $175.00, for the amount exceeding $175.00.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Massachusetts also charges a use tax when goods are bought from other states and the vendor does not remit Massachusetts sales tax; taxpayers report and pay this on their income tax forms or dedicated forms, though there are "safe harbor" amounts that can be paid without tallying up actual purchases (except for purchases over $1,000).

name: massachusetts
sentence: There is no inheritance tax and limited Massachusetts estate tax related to federal estate tax collection.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Massachusetts's electricity generation market was made competitive in 1998, enabling retail customers to change suppliers without changing utility companies.

name: massachusetts
sentence: In 2018, Massachusetts consumed 1,459 trillion BTU, making it the seventh-lowest state in terms of consumption of energy per capita, and 31 percent of that energy came from natural gas.

name: massachusetts
sentence: In 2014 and 2015, Massachusetts was ranked as the most energy efficient state the United States while Boston is the most efficient city, but it had the fourth-highest average residential retail electricity prices of any state.

name: massachusetts
sentence: In 2018, renewable energy was about 7.2 percent of total energy consumed in the state, ranking 34th.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Massachusetts has 10 regional metropolitan planning organizations and three non-metropolitan planning organizations covering the remainder of the state

name: massachusetts
sentence: Transportation is the single largest source of greenhouse gas emissions by economic sector in Massachusetts.

name: massachusetts
sentence: The Massachusetts Bay Transportation Authority (MBTA), also known as "The T", operates public transportation in the form of subway, bus, and ferry systems in the Metro Boston area.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Fifteen other regional transit authorities provide public transportation in the form of bus services in the rest of the state.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Four heritage railways are also in operation:

name: massachusetts
sentence: Amtrak operates several inter-city rail lines connecting Massachusetts.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Boston's South Station serves as the terminus for three lines, namely the high-speed Acela Express, which links to cities such as Providence, New Haven, New York City, and eventually Washington DC; the Northeast Regional, which follows the same route but includes many more stops, and also continues further south to Newport News in Virginia; and the Lake Shore Limited, which runs westward to Worcester, Springfield, and eventually Chicago.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Boston's other major station, North Station, serves as the southern terminus for Amtrak's Downeaster, which connects to Portland and Brunswick in Maine.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Outside of Boston, Amtrak connects several cities across Massachusetts, along the aforementioned Acela, Northeast Regional, Lake Shore Limited, and Downeaster lines, as well as other routes in central and western Massachusetts.

name: massachusetts
sentence: The Hartford Line connects Springfield to New Haven, operated in conjunction with the Connecticut Department of Transportation, and the Valley Flyer runs a similar route but continues further north to Greenfield.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Several stations in western Massachusetts are also served by the Vermonter, which connects St. Albans, Vermont to Washington DC.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Amtrak carries more passengers between Boston and New York than all airlines combined (about 54% of market share in 2012), but service between other cities is less frequent.

name: massachusetts
sentence: There, more frequent intercity service is provided by private bus carriers, including Peter Pan Bus Lines (headquartered in Springfield), Greyhound Lines, OurBus and BoltBus.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Various Chinatown bus lines depart for New York from South Station in Boston.

name: massachusetts
sentence: MBTA Commuter Rail services run throughout the larger Greater Boston area, including service to Worcester, Fitchburg, Haverhill, Newburyport, Lowell, and Plymouth.

name: massachusetts
sentence: This overlaps with the service areas of neighboring regional transportation authorities.

name: massachusetts
sentence: As of the summer of 2013 the Cape Cod Regional Transit Authority in collaboration with the MBTA and the Massachusetts Department of Transportation (MassDOT) is operating the CapeFLYER providing passenger rail service between Boston and Cape Cod.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Ferry services are operated throughout different regions of the states.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Most ports north of Cape Cod are served by Boston Harbor Cruises, which operates ferry services in and around Greater Boston under contract with the Massachusetts Bay Transportation Authority.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Several routes connect the downtown area with Hingham, Hull, Winthrop, Salem, Logan Airport, Charlestown, and some of the islands located within the harbor.

name: massachusetts
sentence: The same company also operates seasonal service between Boston and Provincetown.

name: massachusetts
sentence: On the southern shore of the state, several different passenger ferry lines connect Martha's Vineyard to ports along the mainland, including Woods Hole, Hyannis, New Bedford, and Falmouth, all in Massachusetts, as well as North Kingstown in Rhode Island, Highlands in New Jersey, and New York City in New York.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Similarly, several different lines connect Nantucket to ports including Hyannis, New Bedford, Harwich, and New York City.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Service between the two islands is also offered.

name: massachusetts
sentence: The dominant companies serving these routes include SeaStreak, Hy-Line Cruises, and The Steamship Authority, the latter of which regulates all passenger services in the region and is also the only company permitted to offer freight ferry services to the islands.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Other ferry connections in the state include a line between Fall River and Block Island via Newport, seasonal ferry service connecting Plymouth to Provincetown, and a service between New Bedford and Cuttyhunk.

name: massachusetts
sentence: As of 2018, a number of freight railroads were operating in Massachusetts, with Class I railroad CSX being the largest carrier, and another Class 1, Norfolk Southern serving the state via its Pan Am Southern joint partnership.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Several regional and short line railroads also provide service and connect with other railroads.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Massachusetts has a total of 1,110 miles (1,790 km) of freight trackage in operation.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Boston Logan International Airport served 33.5 million passengers in 2015 (up from 31.6 million in 2014) through 103 gates.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Logan, Hanscom Field in Bedford, and Worcester Regional Airport are operated by Massport, an independent state transportation agency.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Massachusetts has 39 public-use airfields and more than 200 private landing spots.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Some airports receive funding from the Aeronautics Division of the Massachusetts Department of Transportation and the Federal Aviation Administration

name: massachusetts
sentence: There are a total of 36,800 miles (59,200 km) of interstates and other highways in Massachusetts.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Interstate 90 (I-90, also known as the Massachusetts Turnpike), is the longest interstate in Massachusetts.

name: massachusetts
sentence: The route travels 136 mi (219 km) generally west to east, entering Massachusetts at the New York state line in the town of West Stockbridge, and passes just north of Springfield, just south of Worcester and through Framingham before terminating near Logan International Airport in Boston.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Other major interstates include I-91, which travels generally north and south along the Connecticut River; I-93, which travels north and south through central Boston, then passes through Methuen before entering New Hampshire; and I-95, which connects Providence, Rhode Island with Greater Boston, forming a partial loop concurrent with Route 128 around the more urbanized areas before continuing north along the coast into New Hampshire.

name: massachusetts
sentence: I-495 forms a wide loop around the outer edge of Greater Boston.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Other major interstates in Massachusetts include I-291, I-391, I-84, I-195, I-395, I-290, and I-190.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Major non-interstate highways in Massachusetts include US

name: massachusetts
sentence: Routes 1, 3, 6, and 20, and state routes 2, 3, 9, 24, and 128.

name: massachusetts
sentence: A great majority of interstates in Massachusetts were constructed during the mid-20th century, and at times were controversial, particularly the intent to route I-95 northeastwards from Providence, Rhode Island, directly through central Boston, first proposed in 1948.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Opposition to continued construction grew, and in 1970 Governor Francis W. Sargent issued a general prohibition on most further freeway construction within the I-95/Route 128 loop in the Boston area.

name: massachusetts
sentence: A massive undertaking to bring I-93 underground in downtown Boston, called the Big Dig, brought the city's highway system under public scrutiny for its high cost and construction quality.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Massachusetts has a long political history; earlier political structures included the Mayflower Compact of 1620, the separate Massachusetts Bay and Plymouth colonies, and the combined colonial Province of Massachusetts.

name: massachusetts
sentence: The Massachusetts Constitution was ratified in 1780 while the Revolutionary War was in progress, four years after the Articles of Confederation was drafted, and eight years before the present United States Constitution was ratified on June 21, 1788.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Drafted by John Adams, the Massachusetts Constitution is currently the oldest functioning written constitution in continuous effect in the world.

name: massachusetts
sentence: It has been amended 120 times, most recently in 2000.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Massachusetts politics since the second half of the 20th century have generally been dominated by the Democratic Party, and the state has a reputation for being the most liberal state in the country.

name: massachusetts
sentence: In 1974, Elaine Noble became the first openly lesbian or gay candidate elected to a state legislature in US history.

name: massachusetts
sentence: The state housed the first openly gay member of the United States House of Representatives, Gerry Studds, in 1972 and in 2004, Massachusetts became the first state to allow same-sex marriage.

name: massachusetts
sentence: In 2006, Massachusetts became the first state to approve a law that provided for nearly universal healthcare.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Massachusetts has a pro-sanctuary city law.

name: massachusetts
sentence: The Government of Massachusetts is divided into three branches: executive, legislative, and judicial.

name: massachusetts
sentence: The governor of Massachusetts heads the executive branch; duties of the governor include signing or vetoing legislation, filling judicial and agency appointments, granting pardons, preparing an annual budget, and commanding the Massachusetts National Guard.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Massachusetts governors, unlike those of most other states, are addressed as His/Her Excellency.

name: massachusetts
sentence: The current governor is Charlie Baker, a Republican from Swampscott.

name: massachusetts
sentence: The executive branch also includes the Executive Council, which is made up of eight elected councilors and the Lieutenant Governor seat, currently occupied by Karyn Polito, a Republican from Shrewsbury).

name: massachusetts
sentence: Abilities of the Council include confirming gubernatorial appointments and certifying elections.

name: massachusetts
sentence: The Massachusetts House of Representatives and Massachusetts Senatorte comprise the legislature of Massachusetts, known as the Massachusetts General Court.

name: massachusetts
sentence: The House consists of 160 members while the Senatorte has 40 members.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Leaders of the House and Senatorte are chosen by the members of those bodies

name: massachusetts
sentence: Each branch consists of several committees.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Members of both bodies are elected to two-year terms.

name: massachusetts
sentence: The Massachusetts Supreme Judicial Court (a chief justice and six associates) are appointed by the governor and confirmed by the executive council, as are all other judges in the state.

name: massachusetts
sentence: The Congressional delegation from Massachusetts is entirely Democratic.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Currently, the Senatortors are Elizabeth Warren and Ed Markey while the Representatives are Richard Neal (1st), Jim McGovern (2nd), Lori Trahan (3rd), Joseph Kennedy III (4th), Katherine Clark (5th), Seth Moulton (6th), Ayanna Pressley (7th), Stephen Lynch (8th), and Bill Keating (9th).

name: massachusetts
sentence: Federal court cases are heard in the United States District Court for the District of Massachusetts, and appeals are heard by the United States Court of Appeals for the First Circuit.

name: massachusetts
sentence: In US presidential elections since 2012, Massachusetts has been allotted 11 votes in the electoral college, out of a total of 538.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Like most states, Massachusetts's electoral votes are granted in a winner-take-all system.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Massachusetts has gradually shifted from a Republican-leaning state to one largely dominated by Democrats; the 1952 victory of John F. Kennedy over incumbent Senatortor Henry Cabot Lodge, Jr. is seen as a watershed moment in this transformation.

name: massachusetts
sentence: His younger brother Edward M. Kennedy held that seat until his death from a brain tumor in 2009.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Since the 1950s, Massachusetts has gained a reputation as being a politically liberal state and is often used as an archetype of modern liberalism, hence the phrase "Massachusetts liberal".

name: massachusetts
sentence: Massachusetts is easily one of the most Democratic states in the country.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Democratic core concentrations are everywhere, except for a handful of Republican leaning towns in the Central and Southern parts of the state.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Until recently, Republicans were dominant in the Western and Northern suburbs of Boston, however both areas heavily swung Democratic in the Trump era.

name: massachusetts
sentence: The state as a whole has not given its Electoral College votes to a Republican in a presidential election since Ronald Reagan carried it in 1984.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Additionally, Massachusetts provided Reagan with his smallest margins of victory in both the 1980 and 1984 elections.

name: massachusetts
sentence: In 2020, Biden received 65.6% of the vote, the best performance in over 50 years for a Democrat.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Democrats have an absolute grip on the Massachusetts congressional delegation

name: massachusetts
sentence: Both Senatortors and all nine Representatives are Democrats

name: massachusetts
sentence: Massachusetts is the most populous state to be represented in the United States Congress entirely by a single party.

name: massachusetts
sentence: As of the 2018 elections, the Democratic Party holds a super-majority over the Republican Party in both chambers of the Massachusetts General Court (state legislature).

name: massachusetts
sentence: Out of the state house's 160 seats, Democrats hold 127 seats (79%) compared to the Republican Party's 32 seats (20%), an independent sits in the remaining one, and 34 out of the 40 seats in the state senate (85%) belong to the Democratic Party compared to the Republican Party's six seats (15%).

name: massachusetts
sentence: Both houses of the legislature have had Democratic majorities since the 1950s.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Despite the state's Democratic-leaning tendency, Massachusetts has generally elected Republicans as Governor: only one Democrat (Deval Patrick) has served as governor since 1991, and among gubernatorial election results from 2002 to 2018, Republican nominees garnered 48.4% of the vote compared to 45.7% for Democratic nominees.

name: massachusetts
sentence: These have been considered to be among the most moderate Republican leaders in the nation

name: massachusetts
sentence: A number of contemporary national political issues have been influenced by events in Massachusetts, such as the decision in 2003 by the state Supreme Judicial Court allowing same-sex marriage and a 2006 bill which mandated health insurance for all Bay Staters.

name: massachusetts
sentence: In 2008, Massachusetts voters passed an initiative decriminalizing possession of small amounts of marijuana.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Voters in Massachusetts also approved a ballot measure in 2012 that legalized the medical use of marijuana.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Following the approval of a ballot question endorsing legalization in 2016, Massachusetts began issuing licenses for the regulated sale of recreational marijuana in June 2018.

name: massachusetts
sentence: The licensed sale of recreational marijuana became legal on July 1, 2018; however, the lack of state-approved testing facilities prevented the sale of any product for several weeks.

name: massachusetts
sentence: In 2020, the state legislature overrode Governor Charlie Baker's veto of the ROE Act, a controversial law that codified existing abortion laws in the event that the Supreme Court overturned Roe v. Wade, dropped the age of parental consent for those seeking an abortion from 18 to 16, and legalized abortion after 24 weeks, if a fetus had fatal anomalies.

name: massachusetts
sentence: There are 50 cities and 301 towns in Massachusetts, grouped into 14 counties.

name: massachusetts
sentence: The fourteen counties, moving roughly from west to east, are Berkshire, Franklin, Hampshire, Hampden, Worcester, Middlesex, Essex, Suffolk, Norfolk, Bristol, Plymouth, Barnstable, Dukes, and Nantucket.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Eleven communities which call themselves "towns" are, by law, cities since they have traded the town meeting form of government for a mayor-council or manager-council form.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Boston is the state capital and largest city in Massachusetts.

name: massachusetts
sentence: The population of the city proper is 692,600, and Greater Boston, with a population of 4,873,019, is the 11th largest metropolitan area in the nation.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Other cities with a population over 100,000 include Worcester, Springfield, Lowell, and Cambridge.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Plymouth is the largest municipality in the state by land area, followed by Middleborough.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Massachusetts, along with the five other New England states, features the local governmental structure known as the New England town.

name: massachusetts
sentence: In this structure, incorporated towns—as opposed to townships or counties—hold many of the responsibilities and powers of local government.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Most of the county governments were abolished by the state of Massachusetts beginning in 1997 including Middlesex County, the largest county in the state by population.

name: massachusetts
sentence: The voters of these now-defunct counties elect only Sheriffs and Registers of Deeds, who are part of the state government.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Other counties have been reorganized, and a few still retain county councils.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Massachusetts has contributed to American arts and culture.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Drawing from its Native American and Yankee roots, along with later immigrant groups, Massachusetts has produced several writers, artists, and musicians.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Some major museums and important historical sites are also located there, and events and festivals throughout the year celebrate the state's history and heritage.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Massachusetts was an early center of the Transcendentalist movement, which emphasized intuition, emotion, human individuality and a deeper connection with nature.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Ralph Waldo Emerson, who was born in Boston but spent much of his later life in Concord, largely created the philosophy with his 1836 work Nature, and continued to be a key figure in the movement for the remainder of his life.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Emerson's friend, Henry David Thoreau, who was also involved in Transcendentalism, recorded his year spent alone in a small cabin at nearby Walden Pond in the 1854 work Walden; or, Life in the Woods.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Other famous authors and poets born or strongly associated with Massachusetts include Nathaniel Hawthorne, Louisa May Alcott, John Updike, Emily Dickinson, Henry Wadsworth Longfellow, E.E.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Cummings, Sylvia Plath, H.P.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Lovecraft, Edgar Allan Poe, and Theodor Seuss Geisel, better known as "Dr. Seuss".

name: massachusetts
sentence: Famous painters from Massachusetts include Winslow Homer and Norman Rockwell

name: massachusetts
sentence: Massachusetts is also an important center for the performing arts.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Both the Boston Symphony Orchestra and Boston Pops Orchestra are based in Massachusetts.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Other orchestras in Massachusetts include the Cape Cod Symphony Orchestra in Barnstable, the New Bedford Symphony Orchestra, and the Springfield Symphony Orchestra.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Tanglewood, in western Massachusetts, is a music venue that is home to both the Tanglewood Music Festival and Tanglewood Jazz Festival, as well as the summer host for the Boston Symphony Orchestra.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Other performing arts and theater organizations in Massachusetts include the Boston Ballet, the Boston Lyric Opera, and the Lenox-based Shakespeare & Company.

name: massachusetts
sentence: In addition to classical and folk music, Massachusetts has produced musicians and bands spanning a number of contemporary genres, such as the classic rock band Aerosmith, the proto-punk band The Modern Lovers, the new wave band The Cars, and the alternative rock band Pixies.

name: massachusetts
sentence: The state has also been the birthplace of the Nu Metal and Heavy Metal bands Staind and Godsmack, since they both formed in 1995, in Springfield and in Lawrence respectively.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Film events in the state include the Boston Film Festival, the Boston International Film Festival, and a number of smaller film festivals in various cities throughout Massachusetts.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Massachusetts is home to a large number of museums and historical sites.

name: massachusetts
sentence: The Museum of Fine Arts, Boston, the Institute of Contemporary Art, Boston, and the DeCordova contemporary art and sculpture museum in Lincoln are all located within Massachusetts, and the Maria Mitchell Association in Nantucket includes several observatories, museums, and an aquarium.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Historically themed museums and sites such as the Springfield Armory National Historic Site in Springfield, Boston's Freedom Trail and nearby Minute Man National Historical Park, both of which preserve a number of sites important during the American Revolution, the Lowell National Historical Park, which focuses on some of the earliest mills and canals of the industrial revolution in the US, the Black Heritage Trail in Boston, which includes important African-American and abolitionist sites in Boston, and the New Bedford Whaling National Historical Park all showcase various periods of Massachusetts's history.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Plimoth Plantation and Old Sturbridge Village are two open-air or "living" museums in Massachusetts, recreating life as it was in the 17th and early 19th centuries, respectively.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Boston's annual St. Patrick's Day parade and "Harborfest", a week-long Fourth of July celebration featuring a fireworks display and concert by the Boston Pops as well as a turnaround cruise in Boston Harbor by the USConstitution, are popular events.

name: massachusetts
sentence: The Boston Marathon is also a popular event in the state drawing more than 30,000 runners and tens of thousands of spectators annually.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Long-distance hiking trails in Massachusetts include the Appalachian Trail, the New England National Scenic Trail, the Metacomet-Monadnock Trail, the Midstate Trail, and the Bay Circuit Trail.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Other outdoor recreational activities in Massachusetts include sailing and yachting, freshwater and deep-sea fishing, whale watching, downhill and cross-country skiing, and hunting.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Massachusetts is one of the states with the largest percentage of Catholics.

sentence: It has many sanctuaries such as the National Shrine of The Divine Mercy (Stockbridge, Massachusetts).

sentence: The Boston/Manchester market is the fifth-largest in the United States.

sentence: WGBH-TV in Boston is a major public television station and produces national programs such as Nova, Frontline, and American Experience.

name: massachusetts
sentence: The Boston Globe, Boston Herald, Springfield Republican, and the Worcester Telegram & Gazette are Massachusetts's largest daily newspapers.

name: massachusetts
sentence: The Associated Press maintains a bureau in Boston, and local news wire the State House News Service feeds coverage of state government to other Massachusetts media outlets.

name: massachusetts

name: massachusetts

sentence: Massachusetts has the most doctors per 100,000 residents, the second-lowest infant mortality rate, and the lowest percentage of uninsured residents (children as well as the total population).

name: massachusetts
sentence: According to Businessweek, commonwealth residents have an average life expectancy of 80.41 years, the fifth-longest in the country.

name: massachusetts
sentence: 37.2% of the population is overweight and 21.7% is obese, and Massachusetts ranks sixth-highest in the percentage of residents who are considered neither obese nor overweight (41.1%).

name: massachusetts
