name: michigan
sentence: Michigan ( (listen)) is a state in the Great Lakes and Midwestern regions of the United States.

name: michigan
sentence: Its name comes from the Ojibwe word mishigami, meaning "large water" or "large lake".

name: michigan
sentence: With a population of approximately 10 million, Michigan is the tenth most populous state, the 11th most extensive state by area, and the largest by area east of the Mississippi River.

name: michigan
sentence: Its capital is Lansing, and its largest city is Detroit.

name: michigan
sentence: Metro Detroit is among the nation's most populous and largest metropolitan economies.

name: michigan
sentence: Michigan is the only state to consist of two peninsulas.

name: michigan
sentence: The Lower Peninsula is shaped like a mitten.

name: michigan
sentence: The Upper Peninsula (often called "the U.P.")

name: michigan
sentence: is separated from the Lower Peninsula by the Straits of Mackinac, a five-mile (8 km) channel that joins Lake Huron to Lake Michigan.

name: michigan
sentence: The Mackinac Bridge connects the peninsulas.

name: michigan
sentence: Michigan has the longest freshwater coastline of any political subdivision in the world, being bordered by four of the five Great Lakes, plus Lake Saint Clair.

name: michigan
sentence: It also has 64,980 inland lakes and ponds.

name: michigan
sentence: The area was first occupied by a succession of Native American tribes over thousands of years.

name: michigan
sentence: Inhabited by Natives, Métis, and French explorers in the 17th century, it was claimed as part of New France colony.

name: michigan
sentence: After France's defeat in the French and Indian War in 1762, the region came under British rule.

name: michigan
sentence: Britain ceded the territory to the newly independent United States after Britain's defeat in the American Revolutionary War.

name: michigan
sentence: The area was part of the larger Northwest Territory until 1800, when western Michigan became part of the Indiana Territory.

name: michigan
sentence: Michigan Territory was formed in 1805, but some of the northern border with Canada was not agreed upon until after the War of 1812.

name: michigan
sentence: Michigan was admitted into the Union in 1837 as the 26th state, a free one.

name: michigan
sentence: It soon became an important center of industry and trade in the Great Lakes region and a popular émigré destination in the late 19th and early 20th centuries; immigration from many European countries to Michigan was also the busiest at that time, especially for those who emigrated from Finland, Macedonia and the Netherlands.

name: michigan
sentence: Although Michigan developed a diverse economy, it is widely known as the center of the US automotive industry, which developed as a major economic force in the early 20th century.

name: michigan
sentence: It is home to the country's three major automobile companies (whose headquarters are all in Metro Detroit).

name: michigan
sentence: While sparsely populated, the Upper Peninsula is important for tourism due to its abundance of natural resources, while the Lower Peninsula is a center of manufacturing, forestry, agriculture, services, and high-tech industry.

name: michigan
sentence: When the first European explorers arrived, the most populous tribes were Algonquian peoples, which include the Anishinaabe groups of Ojibwe (referred to as "Chippewa" in the United States), Odaawaa/Odawa (Ottawa), and the Boodewaadamii/Bodéwadmi (Potawatomi).

name: michigan
sentence: The three nations co-existed peacefully as part of a loose confederation called the Council of Three Fires.

name: michigan
sentence: The Ojibwe, whose numbers are estimated to have been between 25,000 and 35,000, were the largest.

name: michigan
sentence: The Ojibwe were established in Michigan's Upper Peninsula and northern and central Michigan, and also inhabited Ontario and southern Manitoba, Canada; and northern Wisconsin, and northern and north-central Minnesota.

name: michigan
sentence: The Ottawa lived primarily south of the Straits of Mackinac in northern, western and southern Michigan, but also in southern Ontario, northern Ohio and eastern Wisconsin.

name: michigan
sentence: The Potawatomi were in southern and western Michigan, in addition to northern and central Indiana, northern Illinois, southern Wisconsin, and southern Ontario.

name: michigan
sentence: Other Algonquian tribes in Michigan, in the south and east, were the Mascouten, the Menominee, the Miami, the Sac (or Sauk), and the Meskwaki (Fox).

name: michigan
sentence: The Wyandot were an Iroquoian-speaking people in this area

name: michigan
sentence: French voyageurs and coureurs des bois explored and settled in Michigan in the 17th century.

name: michigan
sentence: The first Europeans to reach what became Michigan were those of Étienne Brûlé's expedition in 1622.

name: michigan
sentence: The first permanent European settlement was founded in 1668 on the site where Père Jacques Marquette established Sault Ste.

name: michigan
sentence: Marie, Michigan, as a base for Catholic missions.

name: michigan
sentence: Missionaries in 1671–75 founded outlying stations at Saint Ignace and Marquette.

name: michigan
sentence: Jesuit missionaries were well received by the area's Indian populations, with few difficulties or hostilities.

name: michigan
sentence: In 1679, Robert Cavelier, Sieur de la Salle built Fort Miami at present-day St. Joseph.

name: michigan
sentence: In 1691, the French established a trading post and Fort St. Joseph along the St. Joseph River at the present-day city of Niles.

name: michigan
sentence: In 1701, French explorer and army officer Antoine de la Mothe Cadillac founded Fort Pontchartrain du Détroit or "Fort Pontchartrain on-the-Strait" on the strait, known as the Detroit River, between lakes Saint Clair and Erie.

name: michigan
sentence: Cadillac had convinced King Louis XIV's chief minister, Louis Phélypeaux, Comte de Pontchartrain, that a permanent community there would strengthen French control over the upper Great Lakes and discourage British aspirations.

name: michigan
sentence: The hundred soldiers and workers who accompanied Cadillac built a fort enclosing one arpent (about 0.85 acres (3,400 m2), the equivalent of just under 200 feet (61 m) per side) and named it Fort Pontchartrain.

name: michigan
sentence: Cadillac's wife, Marie Thérèse Guyon, soon moved to Detroit, becoming one of the first European women to settle in what was considered the wilderness of Michigan.

name: michigan
sentence: The town quickly became a major fur-trading and shipping post.

name: michigan
sentence: The Église de Saint-Anne (Church of Saint Ann) was founded the same year.

name: michigan
sentence: While the original building does not survive, the congregation remains active.

name: michigan
sentence: Cadillac later departed to serve as the French governor of Louisiana from 1710 to 1716.

name: michigan
sentence: French attempts to consolidate the fur trade led to the Fox Wars involving the Meskwaki (Fox) and their allies versus the French and their Native allies.

name: michigan
sentence: At the same time, the French strengthened Fort Michilimackinac at the Straits of Mackinac to better control their lucrative fur-trading empire.

name: michigan
sentence: By the mid-18th century, the French also occupied forts at present-day Niles and Sault Ste.

name: michigan
sentence: Marie, though most of the rest of the region remained unsettled by Europeans.

name: michigan
sentence: France offered free land to attract families to Detroit, which grew to 800 people in 1765, and was the largest city between Montreal and New Orleans.

name: michigan
sentence: French settlers also established small farms south of the Detroit River opposite the fort, near a Jesuit mission and Huron village.

name: michigan
sentence: From 1660 until the end of French rule, Michigan was part of the Royal Province of New France.

name: michigan
sentence: In 1760, Montreal fell to the British forces ending the French and Indian War (1754–1763).

name: michigan
sentence: Under the 1763 Treaty of Paris, Michigan and the rest of New France east of the Mississippi River passed to Great Britain.

name: michigan
sentence: After the Quebec Act was passed in 1774, Michigan became part of the British Province of Quebec.

name: michigan
sentence: By 1778, Detroit's population was up to 2,144 and it was the third-largest city in Quebec.

name: michigan
sentence: During the American Revolutionary War, Detroit was an important British supply center.

name: michigan
sentence: Most of the inhabitants were French-Canadians or Native Americans, many of whom had been allied with the French because of long trading ties.

name: michigan
sentence: Because of imprecise cartography and unclear language defining the boundaries in the 1783 Treaty of Paris, the British retained control of Detroit and Michigan after the American Revolution.

name: michigan
sentence: When Quebec split into Lower and Upper Canada in 1791, Michigan was part of Kent County, Upper Canada.

name: michigan
sentence: It held its first democratic elections in August 1792 to send delegates to the new provincial parliament at Newark (now Niagara-on-the-Lake).

name: michigan
sentence: Under terms negotiated in the 1794 Jay Treaty, Britain withdrew from Detroit and Michilimackinac in 1796.

name: michigan
sentence: It retained control of territory east and south of the Detroit River, which are now included in Ontario, Canada.

name: michigan
sentence: Questions remained over the boundary for many years, and the United States did not have uncontested control of the Upper Peninsula and Drummond Island until 1818 and 1847, respectively.

name: michigan
sentence: During the War of 1812, the United States forces at Fort Detroit surrendered Michigan Territory (effectively consisting of Detroit and the surrounding area) after a nearly bloodless siege in 1812.

name: michigan
sentence: A US attempt to retake Detroit resulted in a severe American defeat in the River Raisin Massacre.

name: michigan
sentence: This battle, still ranked as the bloodiest ever fought in the state, had the highest number of American casualties of any battle in the war.

name: michigan
sentence: Michigan was recaptured by the Americans in 1813 after the Battle of Lake Erie.

name: michigan
sentence: They used Michigan as a base to launch an invasion of Canada, which culminated in the Battle of the Thames.

name: michigan
sentence: But the more northern areas of Michigan were held by the British until the peace treaty restored the old boundaries.

name: michigan
sentence: A number of forts, including Fort Wayne, were built by the United States in Michigan during the 19th century out of fears of renewed fighting with Britain.

name: michigan
sentence: Michigan Territory governor and judges established the University of Michigan in 1817, as the Catholepistemiad, or the University of Michigania.

name: michigan
sentence: The population grew slowly until the opening in 1825 of the Erie Canal through the Mohawk Valley in New York, connecting the Great Lakes to the Hudson River and New York City.

name: michigan
sentence: The new route attracted a large influx of settlers to the Michigan territory.

name: michigan
sentence: They worked as farmers, lumbermen, shipbuilders, and merchants and shipped out grain, lumber, and iron ore. By the 1830s, Michigan had 80,000 residents, more than enough to apply and qualify for statehood.

name: michigan
sentence: A Constitutional Convention of Assent, led by Gershom Mott Williams, was held to lead the territory to statehood.In October 1835 the people approved the Constitution of 1835, thereby forming a state government, although Congressional recognition was delayed pending resolution of a boundary dispute with Ohio known as the Toledo War.

name: michigan
sentence: Congress awarded the "Toledo Strip" to Ohio.

name: michigan
sentence: Michigan received the western part of the Upper Peninsula as a concession and formally entered the Union as a free state on January 26, 1837.

name: michigan
sentence: The Upper Peninsula proved to be a rich source of lumber, iron, and copper.

name: michigan
sentence: Michigan led the nation in lumber production from the 1850s to the 1880s.

name: michigan
sentence: Railroads became a major engine of growth from the 1850s onward, with Detroit the chief hub.

name: michigan
sentence: A second wave of French-Canadian immigrants settled in Michigan during the late 19th to early 20th century, working in lumbering areas in counties on the Lake Huron side of the Lower Peninsula, such as the Saginaw Valley, Alpena, and Cheboygan counties, as well as throughout the Upper Peninsula, with large concentrations in Escanaba and the Keweenaw Peninsula.

name: michigan
sentence: This was also a period of development of the gypsum industry in Alabaster, Michigan, which became nationally prominent.

name: michigan
sentence: The first statewide meeting of the Republican Party took place July 6, 1854, in Jackson, Michigan, where the party adopted its platform.

name: michigan
sentence: The state was heavily Republican until the 1930s.

name: michigan
sentence: Michigan made a significant contribution to the Union in the American Civil War and sent more than forty regiments of volunteers to the federal armies.

name: michigan
sentence: Michigan modernized and expanded its system of education in this period.

name: michigan
sentence: The Michigan State Normal School, now Eastern Michigan University, was founded in 1849, for the training of teachers.

name: michigan
sentence: It adopted this model from the German educational system.

name: michigan
sentence: In 1899, Michigan State became the first normal college in the nation to offer a four-year curriculum.

name: michigan
sentence: Michigan Agricultural College (1855), now Michigan State University in East Lansing, was founded as the pioneer land-grant college, a model for those authorized under the Morrill Act (1862).

name: michigan
sentence: Many private colleges were founded as well, and the smaller cities established high schools late in the century.

name: michigan
sentence: Michigan's economy underwent a transformation at the turn of the 20th century.

name: michigan
sentence: Many individuals, including Ransom E. Olds, John and Horace Dodge, Henry Leland, David Dunbar Buick, Henry Joy, Charles King, and Henry Ford, provided the concentration of engineering know-how and technological enthusiasm to develop the automotive industry.

name: michigan
sentence: Ford's development of the moving assembly line in Highland Park marked a new era in transportation.

name: michigan
sentence: Like the steamship and railroad, mass production of automobiles was a far-reaching development.

name: michigan
sentence: More than the forms of public transportation, the affordable automobile transformed private life.

name: michigan
sentence: Automobile production became the major industry of Detroit and Michigan, and permanently altered the socio-economic life of the United States and much of the world.

name: michigan
sentence: With the growth, the auto industry created jobs in Detroit that attracted immigrants from Europe and migrants from across the United States, including both blacks and whites from the rural South.

name: michigan
sentence: By 1920, Detroit was the fourth-largest city in the US.

name: michigan
sentence: Residential housing was in short supply, and it took years for the market to catch up with the population boom.

name: michigan
sentence: By the 1930s, so many immigrants had arrived that more than 30 languages were spoken in the public schools, and ethnic communities celebrated in annual heritage festivals.

name: michigan
sentence: Over the years immigrants and migrants contributed greatly to Detroit's diverse urban culture, including popular music trends.

name: michigan
sentence: The influential Motown Sound of the 1960s was led by a variety of individual singers and groups.

name: michigan
sentence: Grand Rapids, the second-largest city in Michigan, is also an important center of manufacturing.

name: michigan
sentence: Since 1838, the city has been noted for its furniture industry.

name: michigan
sentence: In the 21st century, it is home to five of the world's leading office furniture companies.

name: michigan
sentence: Grand Rapids is home to a number of major companies including Steelcase, Amway, and Meijer.

name: michigan
sentence: Grand Rapids is also an important center for GE Aviation Systems.

name: michigan
sentence: Michigan held its first United States presidential primary election in 1910.

name: michigan
sentence: With its rapid growth in industry, it was an important center of industry-wide union organizing, such as the rise of the United Auto Workers.

name: michigan
sentence: In 1920 WWJ (AM) in Detroit became the first radio station in the United States to regularly broadcast commercial programs.

name: michigan
sentence: Throughout that decade, some of the country's largest and most ornate skyscrapers were built in the city.

name: michigan
sentence: Particularly noteworthy are the Fisher Building, Cadillac Place, and the Guardian Building, each of which has been designated as a National Historic Landmark (NHL).

name: michigan
sentence: In 1927 a school bombing took place in Clinton County.

name: michigan
sentence: The Bath School disaster, perpetrated by an adult man, resulted in the deaths of 38 schoolchildren and constitutes the deadliest mass murder in a school in US history.

name: michigan
sentence: Michigan converted much of its manufacturing to satisfy defense needs during World War II; it manufactured 10.9 percent of the United States military armaments produced during the war, ranking second (behind New York) among the 48 states.

name: michigan
sentence: Detroit continued to expand through the 1950s, at one point doubling its population in a decade.

name: michigan
sentence: After World War II, housing was developed in suburban areas outside city cores to meet demand for residences.

name: michigan
sentence: The federal government subsidized the construction of interstate highways, which were intended to strengthen military access, but also allowed commuters and business traffic to travel the region more easily.

name: michigan
sentence: Since 1960, modern advances in the auto industry have led to increased automation, high-tech industry, and increased suburban growth.

name: michigan
sentence: Michigan is the leading auto-producing state in the US, with the industry primarily located throughout the Midwestern United States; Ontario, Canada; and the Southern United States.

name: michigan
sentence: With almost ten million residents, Michigan is a large and influential state, ranking tenth in population among the fifty states.

name: michigan
sentence: Detroit is the centrally located metropolitan area of the Great Lakes Megalopolis and the second-largest metropolitan area in the US (after Chicago) linking the Great Lakes system.

name: michigan
sentence: The Metro Detroit area in Southeast Michigan is the state's largest metropolitan area (roughly 50% of the population resides there) and the eleventh largest in the United States.

name: michigan
sentence: The Grand Rapids metropolitan area in Western Michigan is the state's fastest-growing metro area, with more than 1.3 million residents as of 2006.

name: michigan
sentence: Metro Detroit receives more than 15 million visitors each year.

name: michigan
sentence: Michigan has many popular tourist destinations, including areas such as Frankenmuth in The Thumb, and Traverse City on the Grand Traverse Bay in Northern Michigan.

name: michigan
sentence: Tourists spend about $17 billion annually in Michigan supporting 193,000 jobs.

name: michigan
sentence: Michigan typically ranks third or fourth in overall Research & development (R&D) expenditures in the US.

name: michigan
sentence: The state's leading research institutions include the University of Michigan, Michigan State University, and Wayne State University, which are important partners in the state's economy and the state's University Research Corridor.

name: michigan
sentence: Michigan's public universities attract more than $1.5 B in research and development grants each year.

name: michigan
sentence: Agriculture also serves a significant role, making the state a leading grower of fruit in the US, including blueberries, cherries, apples, grapes, and peaches.

name: michigan
sentence: The 2020 coronavirus pandemic in Michigan saw the state suffer one of the largest death tolls in the United States with the metro Detroit area particularly hard hit.

name: michigan
sentence: Michigan is governed as a republic, with three branches of government: the executive branch consisting of the Governor of Michigan and the other independently elected constitutional officers; the legislative branch consisting of the House of Representatives and Senatorte; and the judicial branch.

name: michigan
sentence: The Michigan Constitution allows for the direct participation of the electorate by statutory initiative and referendum, recall, and constitutional initiative and referral (Article II, § 9, defined as "the power to propose laws and to enact and reject laws, called the initiative, and the power to approve or reject laws enacted by the legislature, called the referendum.

name: michigan
sentence: The power of initiative extends only to laws which the legislature may enact under this constitution").

name: michigan
sentence: Lansing is the state capital and is home to all three branches of state government.

name: michigan
sentence: The governor and the other state constitutional officers serve four-year terms and may be re-elected only once.

name: michigan
sentence: The current governor is Gretchen Whitmer.

name: michigan
sentence: Michigan has two official Governor's Residences; one is in Lansing, and the other is at Mackinac Island.

name: michigan
sentence: The other constitutionally elected executive officers are the lieutenant governor, who is elected on a joint ticket with the governor, the secretary of state, and the attorney general.

name: michigan
sentence: The lieutenant governor presides over the Senatorte (voting only in case of a tie) and is also a member of the cabinet.

name: michigan
sentence: The secretary of state is the chief elections officer and is charged with running many licensure programs including motor vehicles, all of which are done through the branch offices of the secretary of state.

name: michigan
sentence: The Michigan Legislature consists of a 38-member Senatorte and 110-member House of Representatives.

name: michigan
sentence: Members of both houses of the legislature are elected through first past the post elections by single-member electoral districts of near-equal population that often have boundaries which coincide with county and municipal lines.

name: michigan
sentence: Senatortors serve four-year terms concurrent to those of the governor, while representatives serve two-year terms.

name: michigan
sentence: The Michigan State Capitol was dedicated in 1879 and has hosted the executive and legislative branches of the state ever since.

name: michigan
sentence: The Michigan judiciary consists of two courts with primary jurisdiction (the Circuit Courts and the District Courts), one intermediate level appellate court (the Michigan Court of Appeals), and the Michigan Supreme Court.

name: michigan
sentence: There are several administrative courts and specialized courts.

name: michigan
sentence: District courts are trial courts of limited jurisdiction, handling most traffic violations, small claims, misdemeanors, and civil suits where the amount contended is below $25,000.

name: michigan
sentence: District courts are often responsible for handling the preliminary examination and for setting bail in felony cases.

name: michigan
sentence: District court judges are elected to terms of six years.

name: michigan
sentence: In a few locations, municipal courts have been retained to the exclusion of the establishment of district courts.

name: michigan
sentence: There are 57 circuit courts in the State of Michigan, which have original jurisdiction over all civil suits where the amount contended in the case exceeds $25,000 and all criminal cases involving felonies.

name: michigan
sentence: Circuit courts are also the only trial courts in the State of Michigan which possess the power to issue equitable remedies.

name: michigan
sentence: Circuit courts have appellate jurisdiction from district and municipal courts, as well as from decisions and decrees of state agencies.

name: michigan
sentence: Most counties have their own circuit court, but sparsely populated counties often share them.

name: michigan
sentence: Circuit court judges are elected to terms of six years.

name: michigan
sentence: State appellate court judges are elected to terms of six years, but vacancies are filled by an appointment by the governor.

name: michigan
sentence: There are four divisions of the Court of Appeals in Detroit, Grand Rapids, Lansing, and Marquette.

name: michigan
sentence: Cases are heard by the Court of Appeals by panels of three judges, who examine the application of the law and not the facts of the case unless there has been grievous error pertaining to questions of fact.

name: michigan
sentence: The Michigan Supreme Court consists of seven members who are elected on non-partisan ballots for staggered eight-year terms.

name: michigan
sentence: The Supreme Court has original jurisdiction only in narrow circumstances but holds appellate jurisdiction over the entire state judicial system.

name: michigan
sentence: Michigan has had four constitutions, the first of which was ratified on October 5 and 6, 1835.

name: michigan
sentence: There were also constitutions from 1850 and 1908, in addition to the current constitution from 1963.

name: michigan
sentence: The current document has a preamble, 11 articles, and one section consisting of a schedule and temporary provisions.

name: michigan
sentence: Michigan, like every US state except Louisiana, has a common law legal system.

name: michigan
sentence: Michigan voters commonly elect candidates from both major parties, and it is generally regarded as a "swing" state which can be won by either Democratic or Republican presidential candidates.

name: michigan
sentence: Governors since the 1970s have alternated between the two parties, and statewide offices including attorney general, secretary of state, and senator have been held by members of both parties in varying proportion.

name: michigan
sentence: The Republican Party holds a majority in both the House and Senatorte of the Michigan Legislature.

name: michigan
sentence: The state's congressional delegation is commonly split, with one party or the other typically holding a narrow majority.

name: michigan
sentence: Republican strongholds of the state include rural areas of Western and Northern Michigan, the Upper Peninsula, the outer suburbs around Grand Rapids, and Livingston County.

name: michigan
sentence: Areas of Democratic strength include the cities of Detroit, Ann Arbor, Lansing, Flint, urban Grand Rapids, and Muskegon.

name: michigan
sentence: Much of suburban Detroit—which includes parts of Oakland, Macomb, and Wayne counties—is politically competitive between the two parties.

name: michigan
sentence: Historically, the first county-level meeting of the Republican Party took place in Jackson on July 6, 1854, and the party thereafter dominated Michigan until the Great Depression.

name: michigan
sentence: In the 1912 election, Michigan was one of the six states to support progressive Republican and third-party candidate Theodore Roosevelt for president after he lost the Republican nomination to William Howard Taft.

name: michigan
sentence: Michigan remained fairly reliably Republican at the presidential level for much of the 20th century.

name: michigan
sentence: It was part of Greater New England, the northern tier of states settled chiefly by migrants from New England who carried their culture with them.

name: michigan
sentence: The state was one of only a handful to back Wendell Willkie over Franklin Roosevelt in 1940, and supported Thomas E. Dewey in his losing bid against Harry S. Truman in 1948.

name: michigan
sentence: Michigan went to the Democrats in two presidential elections during the 1960s but voted for the Republican candidate in every election from 1972 to 1988, including "native son" Gerald Ford in 1976.

name: michigan
sentence: Since 1992 it has supported the Democrats by moderate margins, except for a narrow win by Donald Trump in 2016.

name: michigan
sentence: Michigan was the home of Gerald Ford, the 38th president of the United States.

name: michigan
sentence: Born in Nebraska, he moved as an infant to Grand Rapids.

name: michigan
sentence: The Gerald R. Ford Museum is in Grand Rapids, and the Gerald R. Ford Presidential Library is on the campus of his alma mater, the University of Michigan in Ann Arbor.

name: michigan
sentence: In 1846, Michigan became the first state in the Union, as well as the first government in the world, to abolish the death penalty.

name: michigan
sentence: Historian David Chardavoyne has suggested the movement to abolish capital punishment in Michigan grew out of enmity toward Canada, which made public executions a regular practice under British rule.

name: michigan
sentence: Michigan approved plans to expand Medicaid coverage in 2014 to adults with incomes up to 133% of the federal poverty level (approximately $15,500 for a single adult in 2014).

name: michigan
sentence: In 2018, the state electorate passed proposals to create an independent redistricting commission, and to legalize the recreational use of marijuana.

name: michigan
sentence: In 2020, voters approved two ballot measures, one to increase the limit of money from sales of gas and oil from state-owned land that can benefit state parks, and another to require a warrant for search or seizure of electronic data and communications.

name: michigan
sentence: State government is decentralized among three tiers—statewide, county and township.

name: michigan
sentence: Counties are administrative divisions of the state, and townships are administrative divisions of a county.

name: michigan
sentence: Both of them exercise state government authority, localized to meet the particular needs of their jurisdictions, as provided by state law.

name: michigan
sentence: There are 83 counties in Michigan.

name: michigan
sentence: Cities, state universities, and villages are vested with home rule powers of varying degrees.

name: michigan
sentence: Home rule cities can generally do anything not prohibited by law.

name: michigan
sentence: The fifteen state universities have broad power and can do anything within the parameters of their status as educational institutions that is not prohibited by the state constitution.

name: michigan
sentence: Villages, by contrast, have limited home rule and are not completely autonomous from the county and township in which they are located.

name: michigan
sentence: There are two types of township in Michigan: general law township and charter.

name: michigan
sentence: Charter township status was created by the Legislature in 1947 and grants additional powers and stream-lined administration in order to provide greater protection against annexation by a city.

name: michigan
sentence: As of April 2001, there were 127 charter townships in Michigan.

name: michigan
sentence: In general, charter townships have many of the same powers as a city but without the same level of obligations.

name: michigan
sentence: For example, a charter township can have its own fire department, water and sewer department, police department, and so on—just like a city—but it is not required to have those things, whereas cities must provide those services.

name: michigan
sentence: Charter townships can opt to use county-wide services instead, such as deputies from the county sheriff's office instead of a home-based force of ordinance officers.

name: michigan
sentence: Michigan consists of two peninsulas separated by the Straits of Mackinac.

name: michigan
sentence: The 45th parallel north runs through the state, marked by highway signs and the Polar-Equator Trail—along a line including Mission Point Light near Traverse City, the towns of Gaylord and Alpena in the Lower Peninsula and Menominee in the Upper Peninsula.

name: michigan
sentence: With the exception of two tiny areas drained by the Mississippi River by way of the Wisconsin River in the Upper Peninsula and by way of the Kankakee-Illinois River in the Lower Peninsula, Michigan is drained by the Great Lakes-St. Lawrence watershed and is the only state with the majority of its land thus drained.

name: michigan
sentence: No point in the state is more than six miles (9.7 km) from a natural water source or more than 85 miles (137 km) from a Great Lakes shoreline.

name: michigan
sentence: The Great Lakes that border Michigan from east to west are Lake Erie, Lake Huron, Lake Michigan and Lake Superior.

name: michigan
sentence: The state is bounded on the south by the states of Ohio and Indiana, sharing land and water boundaries with both.

name: michigan
sentence: Michigan's western boundaries are almost entirely water boundaries, from south to north, with Illinois and Wisconsin in Lake Michigan; then a land boundary with Wisconsin and the Upper Peninsula, that is principally demarcated by the Menominee and Montreal Rivers; then water boundaries again, in Lake Superior, with Wisconsin and Minnesota to the west, capped around by the Canadian province of Ontario to the north and east.

name: michigan
sentence: The heavily forested Upper Peninsula is relatively mountainous in the west.

name: michigan
sentence: The Porcupine Mountains, which are part of one of the oldest mountain chains in the world, rise to an altitude of almost 2,000 feet (610 m) above sea level and form the watershed between the streams flowing into Lake Superior and Lake Michigan.

name: michigan
sentence: The surface on either side of this range is rugged.

name: michigan
sentence: The state's highest point, in the Huron Mountains northwest of Marquette, is Mount Arvon at 1,979 feet (603 m).

name: michigan
sentence: The peninsula is as large as Connecticut, Delaware, Massachusetts, and Rhode Island combined but has fewer than 330,000 inhabitants.

name: michigan
sentence: They are sometimes called "Yoopers" (from "U.P.

name: michigan
sentence: 'ers"), and their speech (the "Yooper dialect") has been heavily influenced by the numerous Scandinavian and Canadian immigrants who settled the area during the lumbering and mining boom of the late 19th century.

name: michigan
sentence: The Lower Peninsula is shaped like a mitten and many residents hold up a hand to depict where they are from.

name: michigan
sentence: It is 277 miles (446 km) long from north to south and 195 miles (314 km) from east to west and occupies nearly two-thirds of the state's land area.

name: michigan
sentence: The surface of the peninsula is generally level, broken by conical hills and glacial moraines usually not more than a few hundred feet tall.

name: michigan
sentence: It is divided by a low water divide running north and south.

name: michigan
sentence: The larger portion of the state is on the west of this and gradually slopes toward Lake Michigan.

name: michigan
sentence: The highest point in the Lower Peninsula is either Briar Hill at 1,705 feet (520 m), or one of several points nearby in the vicinity of Cadillac.

name: michigan
sentence: The lowest point is the surface of Lake Erie at 571 feet (174 m).

name: michigan
sentence: The geographic orientation of Michigan's peninsulas makes for a long distance between the ends of the state.

name: michigan
sentence: Ironwood, in the far western Upper Peninsula, lies 630 miles (1,010 kilometers) by highway from Lambertville in the Lower Peninsula's southeastern corner.

name: michigan
sentence: The geographic isolation of the Upper Peninsula from Michigan's political and population centers makes the U.P.

name: michigan
sentence: culturally and economically distinct.

name: michigan
sentence: Occasionally U.P.

name: michigan
sentence: residents have called for secession from Michigan and establishment as a new state to be called "Superior".

name: michigan
sentence: A feature of Michigan that gives it the distinct shape of a mitten is the Thumb.

name: michigan
sentence: This peninsula projects out into Lake Huron and the Saginaw Bay.

name: michigan
sentence: The geography of the Thumb is mainly flat with a few rolling hills.

name: michigan
sentence: Other peninsulas of Michigan include the Keweenaw Peninsula, making up the Copper Country region of the state.

name: michigan
sentence: The Leelanau Peninsula lies in the Northern Lower Michigan region.

name: michigan
sentence: See Also Michigan Regions

name: michigan
sentence: Numerous lakes and marshes mark both peninsulas, and the coast is much indented.

name: michigan
sentence: Keweenaw Bay, Whitefish Bay, and the Big and Little Bays De Noc are the principal indentations on the Upper Peninsula.

name: michigan
sentence: The Grand and Little Traverse, Thunder, and Saginaw bays indent the Lower Peninsula.

name: michigan
sentence: Michigan has the second longest shoreline of any state—3,288 miles (5,292 km), including 1,056 miles (1,699 km) of island shoreline.

name: michigan
sentence: The state has numerous large islands, the principal ones being the North Manitou and South Manitou, Beaver, and Fox groups in Lake Michigan; Isle Royale and Grande Isle in Lake Superior; Marquette, Bois Blanc, and Mackinac islands in Lake Huron; and Neebish, Sugar, and Drummond islands in St. Mary's River.

name: michigan
sentence: Michigan has about 150 lighthouses, the most of any US state.

name: michigan
sentence: The first lighthouses in Michigan were built between 1818 and 1822.

name: michigan
sentence: They were built to project light at night and to serve as a landmark during the day to safely guide the passenger ships and freighters traveling the Great Lakes.

name: michigan
sentence: See Lighthouses in the United States.

name: michigan
sentence: The state's rivers are generally small, short and shallow, and few are navigable.

name: michigan
sentence: The principal ones include the Detroit River, St. Marys River, and St. Clair River which connect the Great Lakes; the Au Sable, Cheboygan, and Saginaw, which flow into Lake Huron; the Ontonagon, and Tahquamenon, which flow into Lake Superior; and the St. Joseph, Kalamazoo, Grand, Muskegon, Manistee, and Escanaba, which flow into Lake Michigan.

name: michigan
sentence: The state has 11,037 inland lakes—totaling 1,305 square miles (3,380 km2) of inland water—in addition to 38,575 square miles (99,910 km2) of Great Lakes waters.

name: michigan
sentence: No point in Michigan is more than six miles (9.7 km) from an inland lake or more than 85 miles (137 km) from one of the Great Lakes.

name: michigan
sentence: The state is home to several areas maintained by the National Park Service including: Isle Royale National Park, in Lake Superior, about 30 miles (48 km) southeast of Thunder Bay, Ontario.

name: michigan
sentence: Other national protected areas in the state include: Keweenaw National Historical Park, Pictured Rocks National Lakeshore, Sleeping Bear Dunes National Lakeshore, Huron National Forest, Manistee National Forest, Hiawatha National Forest, Ottawa National Forest and Father Marquette National Memorial.

name: michigan
sentence: The largest section of the North Country National Scenic Trail passes through Michigan.

name: michigan
sentence: With 78 state parks, 19 state recreation areas, and six state forests, Michigan has the largest state park and state forest system of any state.

name: michigan
sentence: These parks and forests include Holland State Park, Mackinac Island State Park, Au Sable State Forest, and Mackinaw State Forest.

name: michigan
sentence: Michigan has a continental climate, although there are two distinct regions.

name: michigan
sentence: The southern and central parts of the Lower Peninsula (south of Saginaw Bay and from the Grand Rapids area southward) have a warmer climate (Köppen climate classification Dfa) with hot summers and cold winters.

name: michigan
sentence: The northern part of Lower Peninsula and the entire Upper Peninsula has a more severe climate (Köppen Dfb), with warm, but shorter summers and longer, cold to very cold winters.

name: michigan
sentence: Some parts of the state average high temperatures below freezing from December through February, and into early March in the far northern parts.

name: michigan
sentence: During the winter through the middle of February, the state is frequently subjected to heavy lake-effect snow.

name: michigan
sentence: The state averages from 30 to 40 inches (76 to 102 cm) of precipitation annually; however, some areas in the northern lower peninsula and the upper peninsula average almost 160 inches (4,100 mm) of snowfall per year.

name: michigan
sentence: Michigan's highest recorded temperature is 112 °F (44 °C) at Mio on July 13, 1936, and the coldest recorded temperature is −51 °F (−46 °C) at Vanderbilt on February 9, 1934.

name: michigan
sentence: The state averages 30 days of thunderstorm activity per year.

name: michigan
sentence: These can be severe, especially in the southern part of the state.

name: michigan
sentence: The state averages 17 tornadoes per year, which are more common in the state's extreme southern section.

name: michigan
sentence: Portions of the southern border have been almost as vulnerable historically as states further west and in Tornado Alley.

name: michigan
sentence: For this reason, many communities in the very southern portions of the state have tornado sirens to warn residents of approaching tornadoes.

name: michigan
sentence: Farther north, in Central Michigan, Northern Michigan, and the Upper Peninsula, tornadoes are rare.

name: michigan
sentence: The geological formation of the state is greatly varied, with the Michigan Basin being the most major formation.

name: michigan
sentence: Primary boulders are found over the entire surface of the Upper Peninsula (being principally of primitive origin), while Secondary deposits cover the entire Lower Peninsula.

name: michigan
sentence: The Upper Peninsula exhibits Lower Silurian sandstones, limestones, copper and iron bearing rocks, corresponding to the Huronian system of Canada.

name: michigan
sentence: The central portion of the Lower Peninsula contains coal measures and rocks of the Pennsylvanian period.

name: michigan
sentence: Devonian and sub-Carboniferous deposits are scattered over the entire state.

name: michigan
sentence: Michigan rarely experiences earthquakes, thus far mostly smaller ones that do not cause significant damage.

name: michigan
sentence: A 4.6-magnitude earthquake struck in August 1947.

name: michigan
sentence: More recently, a 4.2-magnitude earthquake occurred on Saturday, May 2, 2015, shortly after noon, about five miles south of Galesburg, Michigan (9 miles southeast of Kalamazoo) in central Michigan, about 140 miles west of Detroit, according to the Colorado-based US Geological Survey's National Earthquake Information Center.

name: michigan
sentence: No major damage or injuries were reported, according to Governor Rick Snyder's office.

name: michigan
sentence: The United States Census Bureau estimates the population of Michigan was 9,986,857 on July 1, 2019, an increase of 1.04% from 9,883,635 recorded at the 2010 United States Census.

name: michigan
sentence: This includes an natural increase since the last census of 177,254 people (i.e., 1,043,213 births minus 865,959 deaths) and an decrease due to net migration of 73,053 people.

name: michigan
sentence: Immigration resulted in a net increase of 193,031 people, and migration from within the US resulted in a net decrease of 266,084 people.

name: michigan
sentence: The center of population of Michigan is in Shiawassee County, in the southeastern corner of the civil township of Bennington, which is northwest of the village of Morrice.

name: michigan
sentence: As of the 2010 American Community Survey for the US Census, the state had a foreign-born population of 592,212, or 6.0% of the total.

name: michigan
sentence: Michigan has the largest Dutch, Finnish, and Macedonian populations in the United States.

name: michigan
sentence: The 2010 Census reported:

name: michigan
sentence: In the same year Hispanics or Latinos (of any race) made up 4.4% of the population.

name: michigan
sentence: The large majority of Michigan's population is white.

name: michigan
sentence: Americans of European descent live throughout Michigan and most of Metro Detroit.

name: michigan
sentence: Large European American groups include those of German, British, Irish, Polish and Belgian ancestry.

name: michigan
sentence: People of Scandinavian descent, and those of Finnish ancestry, have a notable presence in the Upper Peninsula.

name: michigan
sentence: Western Michigan is known for the Dutch heritage of many residents (the highest concentration of any state), especially in Holland and metropolitan Grand Rapids.

name: michigan
sentence: African-Americans, who came to Detroit and other northern cities in the Great Migration of the early 20th century, form a majority of the population of the city of Detroit and of other cities, including Flint and Benton Harbor.

name: michigan
sentence: As of 2007 about 300,000 people in Southeastern Michigan trace their descent from the Middle East.

name: michigan
sentence: Dearborn has a sizeable Arab community, with many Assyrian/Chaldean/Syriac, and Lebanese who immigrated for jobs in the auto industry in the 1920s along with more recent Yemenis and Iraqis.

name: michigan
sentence: As of 2007, almost 8,000 Hmong people lived in the State of Michigan, about double their 1999 presence in the state.

name: michigan
sentence: As of 2007 most lived in northeastern Detroit, but they had been increasingly moving to Pontiac and Warren.

name: michigan
sentence: By 2015 the number of Hmong in the Detroit city limits had significantly declined.

name: michigan
sentence: Lansing hosts a statewide Hmong New Year Festival.

name: michigan
sentence: The Hmong community also had a prominent portrayal in the 2008 film Gran Torino, which was set in Detroit.

name: michigan
sentence: As of 2015, 80% of Michigan's Japanese population lived in the counties of Macomb, Oakland, Washtenaw, and Wayne in the Detroit and Ann Arbor areas.

name: michigan
sentence: As of April 2013, the largest Japanese national population is in Novi, with 2,666 Japanese residents, and the next largest populations are respectively in Ann Arbor, West Bloomfield Township, Farmington Hills, and Battle Creek.

name: michigan
sentence: The state has 481 Japanese employment facilities providing 35,554 local jobs.

name: michigan
sentence: 391 of them are in Southeast Michigan, providing 20,816 jobs, and the 90 in other regions in the state provide 14,738 jobs.

name: michigan
sentence: The Japanese Direct Investment Survey of the Consulate-General of Japan, Detroit stated more than 2,208 additional Japanese residents were employed in the State of Michigan as of 1 October 2012, than in 2011.

name: michigan
sentence: During the 1990s the Japanese population of Michigan experienced an increase, and many Japanese people with children moved to particular areas for their proximity to Japanese grocery stores and high-performing schools.

name: michigan
sentence: A person from Michigan is called a Michigander or Michiganian; also at times, but rarely, a "Michiganite".

name: michigan
sentence: Residents of the Upper Peninsula are sometimes referred to as "Yoopers" (a phonetic pronunciation of "U.P.ers"), and they sometimes refer to those from the Lower Peninsula as "trolls" because they live below the bridge (see Three Billy Goats Gruff).

name: michigan
sentence: As of 2011, 34.3% of Michigan's children under the age of one belonged to racial or ethnic minority groups, meaning they had at least one parent who was not non-Hispanic white.

name: michigan
sentence: Note: Percentages in the table can exceed 100% as Hispanics are counted both by their ethnicity and by their race.

name: michigan
sentence: As of 2010, 91.11% (8,507,947) of Michigan residents age five and older spoke only English at home, while 2.93% (273,981) spoke Spanish, 1.04% (97,559) Arabic, 0.44% (41,189) German, 0.36% (33,648) Chinese (which includes Mandarin), 0.31% (28,891) French, 0.29% (27,019) Polish, and Syriac languages (such as Modern Aramaic and Northeastern Neo-Aramaic) was spoken as a main language by 0.25% (23,420) of the population over the age of five.

name: michigan
sentence: In total, 8.89% (830,281) of Michigan's population age five and older spoke a mother language other than English.

name: michigan
sentence: The Roman Catholic Church has six dioceses and one archdiocese in Michigan; Gaylord, Grand Rapids, Kalamazoo, Lansing, Marquette, Saginaw and Detroit.

name: michigan
sentence: The Roman Catholic Church is the largest denomination by number of adherents, according to the Association of Religion Data Archives (ARDA) 2010 survey, with 1,717,296 adherents.

name: michigan
sentence: The Roman Catholic Church was the only organized religion in Michigan until the 19th century, reflecting the territory's French colonial roots.

name: michigan
sentence: Detroit's Saint Anne's parish, established in 1701 by Antoine de la Mothe Cadillac, is the second-oldest Roman Catholic parish in the United States.

name: michigan
sentence: On March 8, 1833, the Holy See formally established a diocese in the Michigan territory, which included all of Michigan, Wisconsin, Minnesota, and the Dakotas east of the Mississippi River.

name: michigan
sentence: When Michigan became a state in 1837, the boundary of the Diocese of Detroit was redrawn to coincide with that of the State; the other dioceses were later carved out from the Diocese of Detroit but remain part of the Ecclesiastical Province of Detroit.

name: michigan
sentence: In 2010, the largest Protestant denominations were the United Methodist Church with 228,521 adherents; followed by the Lutheran Church–Missouri Synod with 219,618, and the Evangelical Lutheran Church in America with 120,598 adherents.

name: michigan
sentence: The Christian Reformed Church in North America had almost 100,000 members and more than 230 congregations in Michigan.

name: michigan
sentence: The Reformed Church in America had 76,000 members and 154 congregations in the state.

name: michigan
sentence: In the same survey, Jewish adherents in the state of Michigan were estimated at 44,382, and Muslims at 120,351.

name: michigan
sentence: The Lutheran Church was introduced by German and Scandinavian immigrants

name: michigan
sentence: The first Jewish synagogue in the state was Temple Beth El, founded by twelve German Jewish families in Detroit in 1850.

name: michigan
sentence: In West Michigan, Dutch immigrants fled from the specter of religious persecution and famine in the Netherlands around 1850 and settled in and around what is now Holland, Michigan, establishing a "colony" on American soil that fervently held onto Calvinist doctrine that established a significant presence of Reformed churches.

name: michigan
sentence: Islam was introduced by immigrants from the Near East during the 20th century.

name: michigan
sentence: Michigan is home to the largest mosque in North America, the Islamic Center of America in Dearborn.

name: michigan
sentence: Battle Creek, Michigan, is also the birthplace of the Seventh-day Adventist Church, which was founded on May 21, 1863.

name: michigan
sentence: In 2017, 3,859,949 people in Michigan were employed at 222,553 establishments, according to the US Census Bureau.

name: michigan
sentence: The US Bureau of Economic Analysis estimated Michigan's Q3 2018 gross state product to be $538 billion, ranking 14th out of the 50 states.

name: michigan
sentence: According to the Bureau of Labor Statistics, as of December 2018, the state's seasonally adjusted unemployment rate was estimated at 4.0%.

name: michigan
sentence: Products and services include automobiles, food products, information technology, aerospace, military equipment, furniture, and mining of copper and iron ore. Michigan is the third leading grower of Christmas trees with 60,520 acres (245 km2) of land dedicated to Christmas tree farming.

name: michigan
sentence: The beverage Vernors was invented in Michigan in 1866, sharing the title of oldest soft drink with Hires Root Beer.

name: michigan
sentence: Faygo was founded in Detroit on November 4, 1907.

name: michigan
sentence: Two of the top four pizza chains were founded in Michigan and are headquartered there: Domino's Pizza by Tom Monaghan and Little Caesars Pizza by Mike Ilitch.

name: michigan
sentence: Michigan became the 24th right-to-work state in US in 2012.

name: michigan
sentence: Since 2009, GM, Ford and Chrysler have managed a significant reorganization of their benefit funds structure after a volatile stock market which followed the September 11 attacks and early 2000s recession impacted their respective US pension and benefit funds (OPEB).

name: michigan
sentence: General Motors, Ford, and Chrysler reached agreements with the United Auto Workers Union to transfer the liabilities for their respective health care and benefit funds to a 501(c)(9) Voluntary Employee Beneficiary Association (VEBA).

name: michigan
sentence: Manufacturing in the state grew 6.6% from 2001 to 2006, but the high speculative price of oil became a factor for the US auto industry during the economic crisis of 2008 impacting industry revenues.

name: michigan
sentence: In 2009, GM and Chrysler emerged from Chapter 11 restructurings with financing provided in part by the US and Canadian governments.

name: michigan
sentence: GM began its initial public offering (IPO) of stock in 2010.

name: michigan
sentence: For 2010, the Big Three domestic automakers have reported significant profits indicating the beginning of rebound.

name: michigan
sentence: As of 2002, Michigan ranked fourth in the US in high tech employment with 568,000 high tech workers, which includes 70,000 in the automotive industry.

name: michigan
sentence: Michigan typically ranks third or fourth in overall research and development (R&D) expenditures in the United States.

name: michigan
sentence: Its research and development, which includes automotive, comprises a higher percentage of the state's overall gross domestic product than for any other US state.

name: michigan
sentence: The state is an important source of engineering job opportunities.

name: michigan
sentence: The domestic auto industry accounts directly and indirectly for one of every ten jobs in the US

name: michigan
sentence: Michigan was second in the US in 2004 for new corporate facilities and expansions.

name: michigan
sentence: From 1997 to 2004, Michigan was the only state to top the 10,000 mark for the number of major new developments; however, the effects of the late 2000s recession have slowed the state's economy.

name: michigan
sentence: In 2008, Michigan placed third in a site selection survey among the states for luring new business which measured capital investment and new job creation per one million population.

name: michigan
sentence: In August 2009, Michigan and Detroit's auto industry received $1.36 B in grants from the US Department of Energy for the manufacture of electric vehicle technologies which is expected to generate 6,800 immediate jobs and employ 40,000 in the state by 2020.

name: michigan
sentence: From 2007 to 2009, Michigan ranked 3rd in the US for new corporate facilities and expansions.

name: michigan
sentence: As leading research institutions, the University of Michigan, Michigan State University, and Wayne State University are important partners in the state's economy and its University Research Corridor.

name: michigan
sentence: Michigan's public universities attract more than $1.5 B in research and development grants each year.

name: michigan
sentence: The National Superconducting Cyclotron Laboratory is at Michigan State University.

name: michigan
sentence: Michigan's workforce is well-educated and highly skilled, making it attractive to companies.

name: michigan
sentence: It has the third highest number of engineering graduates nationally.

name: michigan
sentence: Detroit Metropolitan Airport is one of the nation's most recently expanded and modernized airports with six major runways, and large aircraft maintenance facilities capable of servicing and repairing a Boeing 747 and is a major hub for Delta Air Lines.

name: michigan
sentence: Michigan's schools and colleges rank among the nation's best.

name: michigan
sentence: The state has maintained its early commitment to public education.

name: michigan
sentence: The state's infrastructure gives it a competitive edge

name: michigan
sentence: In 2007, Bank of America announced that it would commit $25 billion to community development in Michigan following its acquisition of LaSalle Bank in Troy.

name: michigan
sentence: Michigan led the nation in job creation improvement in 2010.

name: michigan
sentence: Michigan's personal income tax is a flat rate of 4.25%.

name: michigan
sentence: In addition, 22 cities impose income taxes; rates are set at 1% for residents and 0.5% for non-residents in all but four cities.

name: michigan
sentence: Michigan's state sales tax is 6%, though items such as food and medication are exempted.

name: michigan
sentence: Property taxes are assessed on the local level, but every property owner's local assessment contributes six mills (a rate of $6 per $1000 of property value) to the statutory State Education Tax.

name: michigan
sentence: Property taxes are appealable to local boards of review and need the approval of the local electorate to exceed millage rates prescribed by state law and local charters.

name: michigan
sentence: In 2011, the state repealed its business tax and replaced it with a 6% corporate income tax which substantially reduced taxes on business.

name: michigan
sentence: Article IX of the Constitution of the State of Michigan also provides limitations on how much the state can tax.

name: michigan
sentence: A 6% use tax is levied on goods purchased outside the state (that are brought in and used in state), at parity with the sales tax.

name: michigan
sentence: The use tax applies to internet sales/purchases from outside Michigan and is equivalent to the sales tax.

name: michigan
sentence: A wide variety of commodity crops, fruits, and vegetables are grown in Michigan, making it second only to California among US states in the diversity of its agriculture.

name: michigan
sentence: The state has 54,800 farms utilizing 10,000,000 acres (40,000 km2) of land which sold $6.49 billion worth of products in 2010.

name: michigan
sentence: The most valuable agricultural product is milk.

name: michigan
sentence: Leading crops include corn, soybeans, flowers, wheat, sugar beets, and potatoes.

name: michigan
sentence: Livestock in the state included 78,000 sheep, a million cattle, a million hogs, and more than three million chickens.

name: michigan
sentence: Livestock products accounted for 38% of the value of agricultural products while crops accounted for the majority.

name: michigan
sentence: Michigan is a leading grower of fruit in the US, including blueberries, tart cherries, apples, grapes, and peaches.

name: michigan
sentence: Plums, pears, and strawberries are also grown in Michigan.

name: michigan
sentence: These fruits are mainly grown in West Michigan due to the moderating effect of Lake Michigan on the climate.

name: michigan
sentence: There is also significant fruit production, especially cherries, but also grapes, apples, and other fruits, in Northwest Michigan along Lake Michigan.

name: michigan
sentence: Michigan produces wines, beers and a multitude of processed food products.

name: michigan
sentence: Kellogg's cereal is based in Battle Creek, Michigan and processes many locally grown foods.

name: michigan
sentence: Thornapple Valley, Ball Park Franks, Koegel Meat Company, and Hebrew National sausage companies are all based in Michigan.

name: michigan
sentence: Michigan is home to very fertile land in the Saginaw Valley and Thumb areas.

name: michigan
sentence: Products grown there include corn, sugar beets, navy beans, and soybeans.

name: michigan
sentence: Sugar beet harvesting usually begins the first of October.
