name: minnesota
sentence: Minnesota ( (listen)) is a state in the Upper Midwest, Great Lakes, and northern region of the United States.

name: minnesota
sentence: Minnesota was admitted as the 32nd US state on May 11, 1858, created from the eastern half of the Minnesota Territory.

name: minnesota
sentence: The state is known as the "Land of 10,000 Lakes".

name: minnesota
sentence: Its official motto is L'Étoile du Nord, French for "The Star of the North".

name: minnesota
sentence: Minnesota is the 12th largest in area and the 22nd most populous of the US states.

name: minnesota
sentence: Nearly 55% of its residents live in the Minneapolis–Saint Paul metropolitan area (known as the "Twin Cities"), the state's main hub of transportation, business, industry, education, arts, and government.

name: minnesota
sentence: Urban centers in "Greater Minnesota" include Duluth, Mankato, Moorhead, Rochester and St.

name: minnesota
sentence: Cloud.

name: minnesota
sentence: The state's geography is defined by western prairies now given over to intensive agriculture; deciduous forests in the southeast, now partially cleared, farmed, and settled; and the less populated North Woods, used for mining, forestry, and recreation.

name: minnesota
sentence: Before Europeans arrived, Minnesota was inhabited by various indigenous peoples going back to the archaic hunter-gatherers of the Woodland period.

name: minnesota
sentence: During the Middle Woodland Period two areas of Hopewell tradition existed in Minnesota.

name: minnesota
sentence: The Laural Complex covered part of the north while the Tremplau Hopewell was in the Mississippi river Valley (100 BCE – 500 CE).

name: minnesota
sentence: After that was the Upper Mississippian culture, which in Minnesota was the Oneota people.

name: minnesota
sentence: It is believed the Siouan languages derive from them.

name: minnesota
sentence: French voyageurs, explorers, and missionaries entered the region in the 17th century, encountering the Dakota and Ojibwe/Anishinaabe tribes.

name: minnesota
sentence: Much of what is now Minnesota was part of the vast French holding of Louisiana, which the United States purchased in 1803.

name: minnesota
sentence: After the territorial reorganizations of Missouri, Michigan, Indiana, Illinois, Iowa, Wisconsin and Minnesota, the state was admitted to the Union in 1858.

name: minnesota
sentence: Minnesota's growth was centered on timber, agriculture and railroads.

name: minnesota
sentence: During the mid-19th and early 20th centuries, European immigrants began settling Minnesota.

name: minnesota
sentence: Many of them came from Scandinavia, Germany, and Central Europe (such as Czechs and Slovaks).

name: minnesota
sentence: Minnesota remains a center of Scandinavian American, German American, and Czech American culture.

name: minnesota
sentence: Historical evidence suggests that many people immigrated to Minnesota as a result of the failed European Revolutions of 1848.

name: minnesota
sentence: Minnesota's standard of living index is among the highest in the United States, and the state is among the best-educated in the nation.

name: minnesota
sentence: In recent decades its economy has diversified, shifting from traditional industries such as agriculture and resource extraction to services and finance.

name: minnesota
sentence: While Minnesota's population is still mostly Scandinavian- and German-American, domestic migration and immigration from Asia, the Horn of Africa, the Middle East, and Latin America have broadened its demographic profile.

name: minnesota
sentence: The word Minnesota comes from the Dakota name for the Minnesota River, which got its name from one of two words in Dakota: "mní sóta", which means "clear blue water", or "Mníssota", which means "cloudy water".

name: minnesota
sentence: Dakota people demonstrated the name to early settlers by dropping milk into water and calling it mní sóta.

name: minnesota
sentence: Many places in the state have similar Dakota names, such as Minnehaha Falls ("curling water" or waterfall), Minneiska ("white water"), Minneota ("much water"), Minnetonka ("big water"), Minnetrista ("crooked water"), and Minneapolis, a hybrid word combining Dakota mní ("water") and -polis (Greek for "city").

name: minnesota
sentence: Minnesota is the second northernmost US state (after Alaska) and northernmost contiguous state, as the isolated Northwest Angle in Lake of the Woods county is the only part of the 48 contiguous states north of the 49th parallel.

name: minnesota
sentence: The state is part of the US region known as the Upper Midwest and part of North America's Great Lakes Region.

name: minnesota
sentence: It shares a Lake Superior water border with Michigan and a land and water border with Wisconsin to the east.

name: minnesota
sentence: Iowa is to the south, North Dakota and South Dakota are to the west, and the Canadian provinces of Ontario and Manitoba are to the north.

name: minnesota
sentence: With 86,943 square miles (225,180 km2), or approximately 2.25% of the United States, Minnesota is the 12th-largest state.

name: minnesota
sentence: Minnesota has some of the earth's oldest rocks, gneisses that are about 3.6 billion years old (80% as old as the planet).

name: minnesota
sentence: About 2.7 billion years ago basaltic lava poured out of cracks in the floor of the primordial ocean

name: minnesota
sentence: The roots of these volcanic mountains and the action of Precambrian seas formed the Iron Range of northern Minnesota.

name: minnesota
sentence: Since a period of volcanism 1.1 billion years ago, Minnesota's geological activity has been more subdued, with no volcanism or mountain formation, but with repeated incursions of the sea, which left behind multiple strata of sedimentary rock.

name: minnesota
sentence: In more recent times, massive ice sheets at least one kilometer thick ravaged the state's landscape and sculpted its terrain.

name: minnesota
sentence: The Wisconsin glaciation left 12,000 years ago.

name: minnesota
sentence: These glaciers covered all of Minnesota except the far southeast, an area characterized by steep hills and streams that cut into the bedrock.

name: minnesota
sentence: This area is known as the Driftless Zone for its absence of glacial drift.

name: minnesota
sentence: Much of the remainder of the state has fifty feet (15 m) or more of glacial till left behind as the last glaciers retreated.

name: minnesota
sentence: Gigantic Lake Agassiz formed in the northwest 13,000 years ago.

name: minnesota
sentence: Its flat bed now is the fertile Red River valley, and its outflow, glacial River Warren, carved the valley of the Minnesota River and the Upper Mississippi downstream from Fort Snelling.

name: minnesota
sentence: Minnesota is geologically quiet today; it experiences earthquakes infrequently, most of them minor.

name: minnesota
sentence: The state's high point is Eagle Mountain at 2,301 feet (701 m), which is only 13 miles (21 km) away from the low point of 601 feet (183 m) at the shore of Lake Superior.

name: minnesota
sentence: Notwithstanding dramatic local differences in elevation, much of the state is a gently rolling peneplain.

name: minnesota
sentence: Two major drainage divides meet in Minnesota's northeast in rural Hibbing, forming a triple watershed.

name: minnesota
sentence: Precipitation can follow the Mississippi River south to the Gulf of Mexico, the Saint Lawrence Seaway east to the Atlantic Ocean, or the Hudson Bay watershed to the Arctic Ocean.

name: minnesota
sentence: The state's nickname "Land of 10,000 Lakes" is apt, as there are 11,842 Minnesota lakes over 10 acres (4 ha) in size.

name: minnesota
sentence: Minnesota's portion of Lake Superior is the largest at 962,700 acres (389,600 ha; 3,896 km2) and deepest (at 1,290 ft (390 m)) body of water in the state.

name: minnesota
sentence: Minnesota has 6,564 natural rivers and streams that cumulatively flow for 69,000 miles (111,000 km).

name: minnesota
sentence: The Mississippi River begins its journey from its headwaters at Lake Itasca and crosses the Iowa border 680 miles (1,090 km) downstream.

name: minnesota
sentence: It is joined by the Minnesota River at Fort Snelling, by the St. Croix River near Hastings, by the Chippewa River at Wabasha, and by many smaller streams.

name: minnesota
sentence: The Red River drains the northwest part of the state northward toward Canada's Hudson Bay.

name: minnesota
sentence: Approximately 10.6 million acres (4,300,000 ha; 43,000 km2) of wetlands are within Minnesota's borders, the most of any state outside Alaska.

name: minnesota
sentence: Minnesota has four ecological provinces: prairie parkland, in the southwestern and western parts of the state; the eastern broadleaf forest (Big Woods) in the southeast, extending in a narrowing strip to the state's northwestern part, where it transitions into tallgrass aspen parkland; and the northern Laurentian mixed forest, a transitional forest between the northern boreal forest and the broadleaf forests to the south.

name: minnesota
sentence: These northern forests are a vast wilderness of pine and spruce trees mixed with patchy stands of birch and poplar.

name: minnesota
sentence: Much of Minnesota's northern forest has undergone logging, leaving only a few patches of old growth forest today in areas such as in the Chippewa National Forest and the Superior National Forest, where the Boundary Waters Canoe Area Wilderness has some 400,000 acres (162,000 ha) of unlogged land.

name: minnesota
sentence: Although logging continues, regrowth and replanting keep about a third of the state forested.

name: minnesota
sentence: Nearly all Minnesota's prairies and oak savannas have been fragmented by farming, grazing, logging, and suburban development.

name: minnesota
sentence: While loss of habitat has affected native animals such as the pine marten, elk, woodland caribou, and bison, others like whitetail deer and bobcat thrive.

name: minnesota
sentence: Minnesota has the nation's largest population of timber wolves outside Alaska, and supports healthy populations of black bears, moose, and gophers.

name: minnesota
sentence: Located on the Mississippi Flyway, Minnesota hosts migratory waterfowl such as geese and ducks, and game birds such as grouse, pheasants, and turkeys.

name: minnesota
sentence: It is home to birds of prey, including the largest number of breeding pairs of bald eagles in the lower 48 states as of 2007, red-tailed hawks, and snowy owls.

name: minnesota
sentence: Hawk Ridge is one of the premier bird watching sites in North America.

name: minnesota
sentence: The lakes teem with sport fish such as walleye, bass, muskellunge, and northern pike, and brook, brown, and rainbow trout populate streams in the southeast and northeast.

name: minnesota
sentence: Minnesota experiences temperature extremes characteristic of its continental climate, with cold winters and hot summers.

name: minnesota
sentence: The lowest temperature recorded was −60 °F (−51 °C) at Tower on February 2, 1996, and the highest was 114 °F (46 °C) at Moorhead on July 6, 1936.

name: minnesota
sentence: Meteorological events include rain, snow, blizzards, thunderstorms, hail, derechos, tornadoes, and high-velocity straight-line winds.

name: minnesota
sentence: The growing season varies from 90 days in the far northeast to 160 days in southeast Minnesota near the Mississippi River, and average temperatures range from 37 to 49 °F (3 to 9 °C).

name: minnesota
sentence: Average summer dewpoints range from about 58 °F (14 °C) in the south to about 48 °F (9 °C) in the north.

name: minnesota
sentence: Average annual precipitation ranges from 19 to 35 inches (48 to 89 cm), and droughts occur every 10 to 50 years.

name: minnesota
sentence: Minnesota's first state park, Itasca State Park, was established in 1891, and is the source of the Mississippi River.

name: minnesota
sentence: Today Minnesota has 72 state parks and recreation areas, 58 state forests covering about four million acres (16,000 km2), and numerous state wildlife preserves, all managed by the Minnesota Department of Natural Resources.

name: minnesota
sentence: The Chippewa and Superior national forests comprise 5.5 million acres (22,000 km2).

name: minnesota
sentence: The Superior National Forest in the northeast contains the Boundary Waters Canoe Area Wilderness, which encompasses over a million acres (4,000 km2) and a thousand lakes.

name: minnesota
sentence: To its west is Voyageurs National Park.

name: minnesota
sentence: The Mississippi National River and Recreation Area (MNRRA) is a 72-mile-long (116 km) corridor along the Mississippi River through the Minneapolis–St.

name: minnesota
sentence: Paul Metropolitan Area connecting a variety of sites of historic, cultural, and geologic interest.

name: minnesota
sentence: When Europeans arrived in North America, a subculture of Sioux called the Dakota people lived in Minnesota.

name: minnesota
sentence: The first Europeans to enter the region were French voyageurs, fur traders who arrived in the 17th century.

name: minnesota
sentence: They used the Grand Portage to access trapping and trading areas further into Minnesota.

name: minnesota
sentence: The Anishinaabe (also known as Ojibwe or Chippewa) were migrating into Minnesota, causing tensions with the Dakota people, and dislocated the Mdewakaton.

name: minnesota
sentence: Explorers such as Daniel Greysolon, Sieur du Lhut, Father Louis Hennepin, Jonathan Carver, Henry Schoolcraft, and Joseph Nicollet mapped the state.

name: minnesota
sentence: The region was part of Spanish Louisiana from 1762 to 1802.

name: minnesota
sentence: The portion of the state east of the Mississippi River became part of the United States at the end of the American Revolutionary War, when the Second Treaty of Paris was signed.

name: minnesota
sentence: Land west of the Mississippi was acquired with the Louisiana Purchase, though part of the Red River Valley was disputed until the Treaty of 1818.

name: minnesota
sentence: In 1805 Zebulon Pike bargained with Native Americans to acquire land at the confluence of the Minnesota and Mississippi rivers to create a military reservation.

name: minnesota
sentence: The construction of Fort Snelling followed between 1819 and 1825.

name: minnesota
sentence: Its soldiers built a grist mill and a sawmill at Saint Anthony Falls.

name: minnesota
sentence: They were harbingers of the water-powered industries around which Minneapolis later grew.

name: minnesota
sentence: Meanwhile, squatters, government officials, and others had settled near the fort.

name: minnesota
sentence: In 1839 the army forced them off military lands.

name: minnesota
sentence: They moved downriver to the area that became St. Paul just outside the military reservation.

name: minnesota
sentence: From 1812 to 1821 Minnesota was part of the Territory of Missouri.

name: minnesota
sentence: From 1821 to 1834 it was part of an Unorganized Territory.

name: minnesota
sentence: From 1834 to 1836 Minnesota, Wisconsin, Iowa and half the Dakotas were part of the Territory of Michigan.

name: minnesota
sentence: From 1836 to 1848 Minnesota and Iowa were part of the Territory of Wisconsin.

name: minnesota
sentence: From 1838 to 1846 Minnesota west of the Mississippi River was part of the Territory of Iowa.

name: minnesota
sentence: Minnesota east of the Mississippi was part of Wisconsin until 1848.

name: minnesota
sentence: When Iowa gained statehood western Minnesota was in an Unorganized Territory again.

name: minnesota
sentence: Minnesota Territory was formed on March 3, 1849.

name: minnesota
sentence: The first territorial legislature, held on September 2, 1849, was dominated by men of New England ancestry.

name: minnesota
sentence: Thousands of pioneers had come to create farms and cut timber.

name: minnesota
sentence: Minnesota became the 32nd US state on May 11, 1858.

name: minnesota
sentence: The founding population was so overwhelmingly of New England origins that the state was dubbed "the New England of the West".

name: minnesota
sentence: Treaties between the US Government and the Dakota and Ojibwe gradually forced the natives off their lands and onto reservations.

name: minnesota
sentence: In 1861 residents of Mankato formed the Knights of the Forest, with a goal of eliminating all Native Americans from Minnesota.

name: minnesota
sentence: As conditions deteriorated for the Dakota, tensions rose, leading to the Dakota War of 1862.

name: minnesota
sentence: The six-week war ended with the execution of 38 Dakota and the exile of many to the Crow Creek Reservation in Dakota Territory.

name: minnesota
sentence: As many as 800 settlers died during the war.

name: minnesota
sentence: Minnesota Governor Alexander Ramsey subsequently declared that "the Sioux Indians of Minnesota must be exterminated or driven forever beyond the borders of the state.” He also placed a bounty of $25/scalp on the heads of the Dakota men.

name: minnesota
sentence: Over 1,600 Dakota women, children and elderly walked from the Lower Sioux Agency to Fort Snelling to be held until the spring thaw allowed riverboats to take them out of Minnesota to Crow Creek by the Great Sioux Reservation.

name: minnesota
sentence: Shortly after arriving at the fort, one of the women was raped by soldiers while gathering firewood.

name: minnesota
sentence: William Crooks, commander of 6th Minnesota, had a palisade erected around the encampment on Pike island, just below the fort, to protect native people from the soldiers and settlers.

name: minnesota
sentence: Conditions there were poor.

name: minnesota
sentence: The food was meager, measles and cholera swept the enclosure and nothing had been done to provide sanitation.

name: minnesota
sentence: Many died.

name: minnesota
sentence: The men were imprisoned or had fled.

name: minnesota
sentence: In early 1863, Ramsey resigned as governor to become the Federal Indian Commissioner.

name: minnesota
sentence: His successor, Governor Henry Swift, raised the bounty to $200/scalp immediately.

name: minnesota
sentence: When hostilities broke out there were 6,500-7,000 Sioux in the state.

name: minnesota
sentence: When hostilities ended there were 2,000 in custody.

name: minnesota
sentence: The remainder had fled, the Canadians having set aside two parcels of 7,000 and 8,000 acres for those who crossed into Manitoba.

name: minnesota
sentence: The Canadians were not eager to take in the displaced Minnesota Sioux, but went on to set aside even more land for them.

name: minnesota
sentence: Upon becoming Indian Commissioner, Ramsey set out to get the Ojibwe too.

name: minnesota
sentence: In 1863 he negotiated the Treaty of Old Crossing, whereby the Ojibwe ceded all their land in northern Minnesota and moved to reservations.

name: minnesota
sentence: Logging, farming and railroads were mainstays of Minnesota's early economy.

name: minnesota
sentence: The sawmills at Saint Anthony Falls and logging centers of Pine City, Marine on St. Croix, Stillwater, and Winona processed vast quantities of timber.

name: minnesota
sentence: These cities were on rivers that were ideal for transportation.

name: minnesota
sentence: St. Anthony Falls was later tapped to provide power for flour mills.

name: minnesota
sentence: Innovations by Minneapolis millers led to the production of Minnesota "patent" flour, which commanded almost double the price of "bakers'" or "clear" flour, which it replaced.

name: minnesota
sentence: By 1900 Minnesota mills, led by Pillsbury, Northwestern and the Washburn-Crosby Company (a forerunner of General Mills), were grinding 14.1% of the nation's grain.

name: minnesota
sentence: The state's iron-mining industry was established with the discovery of iron in the Vermilion and Mesabi ranges in the 1880s, followed by the Cuyuna Range in the early 1900s.

name: minnesota
sentence: The ore went by rail to Duluth and Two Harbors for ship transport east via the Great Lakes.

name: minnesota
sentence: Industrial development and the rise of manufacturing caused the population to shift gradually from rural areas to cities during the early 20th century.

name: minnesota
sentence: Nevertheless, farming remained prevalent.

name: minnesota
sentence: Minnesota's economy was hit hard by the Great Depression, resulting in lower prices for farmers, layoffs among iron miners, and labor unrest.

name: minnesota
sentence: Compounding the adversity, western Minnesota and the Dakotas were hit by drought from 1931 to 1935.

name: minnesota
sentence: New Deal programs provided some economic turnaround.

name: minnesota
sentence: The Civilian Conservation Corps and other programs around the state established some jobs for Indians on their reservations, and the Indian Reorganization Act of 1934 provided the tribes with a mechanism of self-government.

name: minnesota
sentence: This gave Natives a greater voice within the state, and promoted more respect for tribal customs because religious ceremonies and native languages were no longer suppressed.

name: minnesota
sentence: After the war, industrial development quickened.

name: minnesota
sentence: New technology increased farm productivity through automation of feedlots for hogs and cattle, machine milking at dairy farms, and raising chickens in large buildings.

name: minnesota
sentence: Planting became more specialized with hybridization of corn and wheat, and farm machinery such as tractors and combines became the norm.

name: minnesota
sentence: University of Minnesota professor Norman Borlaug contributed to these developments as part of the Green Revolution.

name: minnesota
sentence: Suburban development accelerated due to increased postwar housing demand and convenient transportation.

name: minnesota
sentence: Increased mobility in turn enabled more specialized jobs.

name: minnesota
sentence: Minnesota became a center of technology after World War II.

name: minnesota
sentence: Engineering Research Associates was formed in 1946 to develop computers for the United States Navy.

name: minnesota
sentence: It later merged with Remington Rand, and then became Sperry Rand.

name: minnesota
sentence: William Norris left Sperry in 1957 to form Control Data Corporation (CDC).

name: minnesota
sentence: Cray Research was formed when Seymour Cray left CDC to form his own company.

name: minnesota
sentence: Medical device maker Medtronic also started business in the Twin Cities in 1949.

name: minnesota
sentence: The United States Navy and Coast Guard have recognized Minnesota with:

name: minnesota
sentence: Saint Paul, in east-central Minnesota along the banks of the Mississippi River, has been Minnesota's capital city since 1849, first as capital of the Territory of Minnesota, and then as the state capital since 1858.

name: minnesota
sentence: Saint Paul is adjacent to Minnesota's most populous city, Minneapolis; they and their suburbs are collectively known as the Twin Cities metropolitan area, the country's 16th-largest metropolitan area and home to about 55 percent of the state's population.

name: minnesota
sentence: The remainder of the state is known as "Greater Minnesota" or "Outstate Minnesota".

name: minnesota
sentence: The state has 17 cities with populations above 50,000 as of the 2010 census.

name: minnesota
sentence: In descending order of population, they are Minneapolis, Saint Paul, Rochester, Duluth, Bloomington, Brooklyn Park, Plymouth, Saint Cloud, Woodbury, Eagan, Maple Grove, Coon Rapids, Eden Prairie, Minnetonka, Burnsville, Apple Valley, Blaine, and Lakeville.

name: minnesota
sentence: Of these only Rochester, Duluth, and Saint Cloud are outside the Twin Cities metropolitan area.

name: minnesota
sentence: Minnesota's population continues to grow, primarily in the urban centers.

name: minnesota
sentence: The populations of metropolitan Sherburne and Scott counties doubled between 1980 and 2000, while 40 of the state's 87 counties lost residents over the same period.

name: minnesota
sentence: The United States Navy has recognized multiple Minnesota communities.

name: minnesota
sentence: From fewer than 6,120 white settlers in 1850, Minnesota's official population grew to over 1.7 million by 1900.

name: minnesota
sentence: Each of the next six decades saw a 15 percent increase in population, reaching 3.4 million in 1960.

name: minnesota
sentence: Growth then slowed, rising 11 percent to 3.8 million in 1970, and an average of 9 percent over the next three decades to 4.9 million in the 2000 Census.

name: minnesota
sentence: The United States Census Bureau estimates the population of Minnesota was 5,639,632 on July 1, 2019, a 6.33 percent increase since the 2010 United States Census.

name: minnesota
sentence: The rate of population change, and age and gender distributions, approximate the national average.

name: minnesota
sentence: Minnesota's center of population is in Hennepin County.

name: minnesota
sentence: As of the 2010 Census Minnesota's population was 5,303,925.

name: minnesota
sentence: The gender makeup of the state was 49.6% male and 50.4% female.

name: minnesota
sentence: 24.2% of the population was under the age of 18

name: minnesota
sentence: The table below shows the racial composition of Minnesota's population as of 2017.

name: minnesota
sentence: According to the 2017 American Community Survey, 5.1% of Minnesota's population were of Hispanic or Latino origin (of any race): Mexican (3.5%), Puerto Rican (0.2%), Cuban (0.1%), and other Hispanic or Latino origin (1.2%).

name: minnesota
sentence: The ancestry groups claimed by more than five percent of the population were: German (33.8%), Norwegian (15.3%), Irish (10.5%), Swedish (8.1%), and English (5.4%).

name: minnesota
sentence: In 2011 non-Hispanic whites were involved in 72.3 percent of all the births.

name: minnesota
sentence: Minnesota's growing minority groups, however, still form a smaller percentage of the population than in the nation as a whole.

name: minnesota
sentence: Minnesota has the country's largest Somali population, with an estimated 57,000 people, the largest concentration outside of the Horn of Africa.

name: minnesota
sentence: The majority of Minnesotans are Protestants, including a large Lutheran contingent, owing to the state's largely Northern European ethnic makeup.

name: minnesota
sentence: Roman Catholics (of largely German, Irish, French and Slavic descent) make up the largest single Christian denomination.

name: minnesota
sentence: A 2010 survey by the Pew Forum on Religion and Public Life showed that 32 percent of Minnesotans were affiliated with Mainline Protestant traditions, 21 percent were Evangelical Protestants, 28 percent Roman Catholic, 1 percent each Jewish, Muslim, Buddhist, and Black Protestant, and smaller amounts of other faiths, with 13 percent unaffiliated.

name: minnesota
sentence: According to the Association of Religion Data Archives, the denominations with the most adherents in 2010 were the Roman Catholic Church with 1,150,367; the Evangelical Lutheran Church in America with 737,537; and the Lutheran Church–Missouri Synod with 182,439.

name: minnesota
sentence: This is broadly consistent with the results of the 2001 American Religious Identification Survey, which also gives detailed percentages for many individual denominations.

name: minnesota
sentence: The international Confessional Evangelical Lutheran Conference is headquartered in Mankato, Minnesota.

name: minnesota
sentence: Although Christianity is dominant, Minnesota has a long history with non-Christian faiths.

name: minnesota
sentence: Ashkenazi Jewish pioneers set up Saint Paul's first synagogue in 1856.

name: minnesota
sentence: Minnesota is home to more than 30 mosques, mostly in the Twin Cities metro area.

name: minnesota
sentence: The Temple of ECK, the spiritual home of Eckankar, is based in Minnesota.

name: minnesota
sentence: Once primarily a producer of raw materials, Minnesota's economy has transformed to emphasize finished products and services.

name: minnesota
sentence: Perhaps the most significant characteristic of the economy is its diversity

name: minnesota
sentence: Minnesota's economy had a gross domestic product of $383 billion in 2019, with 33 of the United States' top 1,000 publicly traded companies by revenue headquartered in Minnesota, including Target, UnitedHealth Group, 3M, General Mills, US Bancorp, Ameriprise, Hormel, Land O' Lakes, SuperValu, Best Buy, and Valspar.

name: minnesota
sentence: Private companies based in Minnesota include Cargill, the largest privately owned company in the United States, and Carlson Companies, the parent company of Radisson Hotels.

name: minnesota
sentence: Minnesota's per capita personal income in 2019 was $58,834, the thirteenth-highest in the nation.

name: minnesota
sentence: Its 2019 median household income was $74,593, ranking thirteenth in the US and fifth among the 36 states not on the Atlantic coast.

name: minnesota
sentence: As of December 2018 the state's unemployment rate was 2.8 percent.

name: minnesota
sentence: Minnesota's earliest industries were fur trading and agriculture.

name: minnesota
sentence: Minneapolis grew around the flour mills powered by St. Anthony Falls.

name: minnesota
sentence: Although less than one percent of the population is now employed in the agricultural sector, it remains a major part of the state's economy, ranking sixth in the nation in the value of products sold.

name: minnesota
sentence: The state is the nation's largest producer of sugar beets, sweet corn, and peas for processing, and farm-raised turkeys.

name: minnesota
sentence: Minnesota is also a large producer of corn and soybeans, and has the most food cooperatives per capita in the United States.

name: minnesota
sentence: Forestry remains strong, including logging, pulpwood processing and paper production, and forest products manufacturing.

name: minnesota
sentence: Minnesota was famous for its soft-ore mines, which produced a significant portion of the world's iron ore for more than a century.

name: minnesota
sentence: Although the high-grade ore is now depleted, taconite mining continues, using processes developed locally to save the industry.

name: minnesota
sentence: In 2016 the state produced 60 percent of the country's usable iron ore.

name: minnesota
sentence: The mining boom created the port of Duluth, which continues to be important for shipping ore, coal, and agricultural products.

name: minnesota
sentence: The manufacturing sector now includes technology and biomedical firms, in addition to the older food processors and heavy industry.

name: minnesota
sentence: The nation's first indoor shopping mall was Edina's Southdale Center, and its largest is Bloomington's Mall of America.

name: minnesota
sentence: Minnesota is one of 45 US states with its own lottery; its games include multi-jurisdiction draws, in-house draws, and other games.

name: minnesota
sentence: Minnesota produces ethanol fuel and is the first to mandate its use, a ten percent mix (E10).

name: minnesota
sentence: In 2019 there were more than 411 service stations supplying E85 fuel, comprising 85 percent ethanol and 15 percent gasoline.

name: minnesota
sentence: A two percent biodiesel blend has been required in diesel fuel since 2005.

name: minnesota
sentence: Minnesota is ranked in the top ten for wind energy production.

name: minnesota
sentence: The state gets nearly one fifth of all its electrical energy from wind.

name: minnesota
sentence: Xcel Energy is the state's largest utility and is headquartered in the state

name: minnesota
sentence: There are also a number of municipal utilities.

name: minnesota
sentence: Minnesota has a progressive income tax structure; the four brackets of state income tax rates are 5.35, 7.05, 7.85 and 9.85 percent.

name: minnesota
sentence: As of 2008 Minnesota was ranked 12th in the nation in per capita total state and local taxes.

name: minnesota
sentence: In 2008 Minnesotans paid 10.2 percent of their income in state and local taxes

name: minnesota
sentence: The state sales tax in Minnesota is 6.875 percent, but clothing, prescription drug medications and food items for home consumption are exempt.

name: minnesota
sentence: The state legislature may allow municipalities to institute local sales taxes and special local taxes, such as the 0.5 percent supplemental sales tax in Minneapolis.

name: minnesota
sentence: Excise taxes are levied on alcohol, tobacco, and motor fuel.

name: minnesota
sentence: The state imposes a use tax on items purchased elsewhere but used within Minnesota.

name: minnesota
sentence: Owners of real property in Minnesota pay property tax to their county, municipality, school district, and special taxing districts.

name: minnesota
sentence: Minnesota's leading fine art museums include the Minneapolis Institute of Art, the Walker Art Center, the Frederick R. Weisman Art Museum, and The Museum of Russian Art (TMORA).

name: minnesota
sentence: All are in Minneapolis.

name: minnesota
sentence: The Minnesota Orchestra and the Saint Paul Chamber Orchestra are prominent full-time professional musical ensembles who perform concerts and offer educational programs to the Twin Cities' community.

name: minnesota
sentence: The world-renowned Guthrie Theater moved into a new Minneapolis facility in 2006, boasting three stages and overlooking the Mississippi River.

name: minnesota
sentence: Attendance at theatrical, musical, and comedy events in the area is strong.

name: minnesota
sentence: In the United States, Minneapolis's number of theater companies ranks behind only New York City's, and about 2.3 million theater tickets were sold in the Twin Cities annually as of 2006.

name: minnesota
sentence: The Minnesota Fringe Festival in Minneapolis is an annual celebration of theatre, dance, improvisation, puppetry, kids' shows, visual art, and musicals with more than 800 performances over 11 days.

name: minnesota
sentence: It is the country's largest non-juried performing arts festival.

name: minnesota
sentence: The rigors and rewards of pioneer life on the prairie are the subject of Giants in the Earth by Ole Rolvaag and the Little House series of children's books by Laura Ingalls Wilder.

name: minnesota
sentence: Small-town life is portrayed grimly by Sinclair Lewis in the novel Main Street, and more gently and affectionately by Garrison Keillor in his tales of Lake Wobegon.

name: minnesota
sentence: St. Paul native F. Scott Fitzgerald writes of the social insecurities and aspirations of the young city in stories such as Winter Dreams and The Ice Palace (published in Flappers and Philosophers).

name: minnesota
sentence: Henry Wadsworth Longfellow's epic poem The Song of Hiawatha was inspired by Minnesota and names many of the state's places and bodies of water.

name: minnesota
sentence: Minnesota native Robert Zimmerman (Bob Dylan) won the 2016 Nobel Prize in Literature.

name: minnesota
sentence: Science fiction writer Marissa Lingen lives here.

name: minnesota
sentence: Minnesota musicians include Holly Henry, Bob Dylan, Eddie Cochran, The Andrews Sisters, The Castaways, The Trashmen, Prince, Soul Asylum, David Ellefson, Chad Smith, John Wozniak, Hüsker Dü, Owl City, The Replacements, and Dessa.

name: minnesota
sentence: Minnesotans helped shape the history of music through popular American culture: the Andrews Sisters' "Boogie Woogie Bugle Boy" was an iconic tune of World War II, while the Trashmen's "Surfin' Bird" and Bob Dylan epitomize two sides of the 1960s.

name: minnesota
sentence: In the 1980s, influential hit radio groups and musicians included Prince, The Original 7ven, Jimmy Jam & Terry Lewis, The Jets, Lipps Inc., and Information Society.

name: minnesota
sentence: Minnesotans have also made significant contributions to comedy, theater, media, and film.

name: minnesota
sentence: The comic strip Peanuts was created by St. Paul native Charles M. Schulz.

name: minnesota
sentence: A Prairie Home Companion which first aired in 1974, became a long-running comedy radio show on National Public Radio.

name: minnesota
sentence: A cult scifi cable TV show, Mystery Science Theater 3000, was created by Joel Hodgson in Hopkins, and Minneapolis, MN.

name: minnesota
sentence: Another popular comedy staple developed in the 1990s, The Daily Show, was originated through Lizz Winstead and Madeleine Smithberg.

name: minnesota
sentence: Joel and Ethan Coen, Terry Gilliam, Bill Pohlad, and Mike Todd contributed to the art of filmmaking as writers, directors, and producers.

name: minnesota
sentence: Notable actors from Minnesota include Loni Anderson, Richard Dean Anderson, James Arness, Jessica Biel, Rachael Leigh Cook, Julia Duffy, Mike Farrell, Judy Garland, Peter Graves, Josh Hartnett, Garrett Hedlund, Tippi Hedren, Jessica Lange, Kelly Lynch, E.G.

name: minnesota
sentence: Marshall, Laura Osnes, Melissa Peterman, Chris Pratt, Marion Ross, Jane Russell, Winona Ryder, Seann William Scott, Kevin Sorbo, Lea Thompson, Vince Vaughn, Jesse Ventura, and Steve Zahn.

name: minnesota
sentence: Stereotypical traits of Minnesotans include "Minnesota nice", Lutheranism, a strong sense of community and shared culture, and a distinctive brand of North Central American English sprinkled with Scandinavian expressions.

name: minnesota
sentence: Potlucks, usually with a variety of hotdishes, are popular small-town church activities.

name: minnesota
sentence: A small segment of the Scandinavian population attend a traditional lutefisk dinner to celebrate Christmas.

name: minnesota
sentence: Life in Minnesota has also been depicted or used as a backdrop, in movies such as Fargo, Grumpy Old Men, Grumpier Old Men, Juno, Drop Dead Gorgeous, Young Adult, A Serious Man, New in Town, Rio, The Mighty Ducks films, and in famous television series like Little House on the Prairie, The Mary Tyler Moore Show, The Golden Girls, Coach, The Rocky and Bullwinkle Show, How I Met Your Mother and Fargo.

name: minnesota
sentence: Major movies shot on location in Minnesota include That Was Then...

name: minnesota
sentence: This Is Now, Purple Rain, Airport, Beautiful Girls, North Country, Untamed Heart, Feeling Minnesota, Jingle All The Way, A Simple Plan, and The Mighty Ducks films.

name: minnesota
sentence: The Minnesota State Fair, advertised as The Great Minnesota Get-Together, is an icon of state culture.

name: minnesota
sentence: In a state of 5.5 million people, there were more than 1.8 million visitors to the fair in 2014, setting a new attendance record.

name: minnesota
sentence: The fair covers the variety of Minnesota life, including fine art, science, agriculture, food preparation, 4-H displays, music, the midway, and corporate merchandising.

name: minnesota
sentence: It is known for its displays of seed art, butter sculptures of dairy princesses, the birthing barn, and the "fattest pig" competition.

name: minnesota
sentence: One can also find dozens of varieties of food on a stick, such as Pronto Pups, cheese curds, and deep-fried candy bars.

name: minnesota
sentence: On a smaller scale, many of these attractions are offered at numerous county fairs.

name: minnesota
sentence: Other large annual festivals include the Saint Paul Winter Carnival, the Minnesota Renaissance Festival, Minneapolis' Aquatennial and Mill City Music Festival, Moondance Jam in Walker, Sonshine Christian music festival in Willmar, the Judy Garland Festival in Grand Rapids, the Eelpout Festival on Leech Lake, and the WE Fest in Detroit Lakes.

name: minnesota
sentence: Minnesotans have low rates of premature death, infant mortality, cardiovascular disease, and occupational fatalities.

name: minnesota
sentence: They have long life expectancies, and high rates of health insurance and regular exercise.

name: minnesota
sentence: These and other measures have led two groups to rank Minnesota as the healthiest state in the nation; however, in one of these rankings, Minnesota descended from first to sixth in the nation between 2005 and 2009 because of low levels of public health funding and the prevalence of binge drinking.

name: minnesota
sentence: While overall health indicators are strong, Minnesota does have significant health disparities in minority populations.

name: minnesota
sentence: On October 1, 2007, Minnesota became the 17th state to enact the Freedom to Breathe Act, a statewide smoking ban in restaurants and bars.

name: minnesota
sentence: The Minnesota Department of Health is the primary state health agency responsible for public policy and regulation.

name: minnesota
sentence: Medical care in the state is provided by a comprehensive network of hospitals and clinics operated by a number of large providers including Allina Hospitals & Clinics, CentraCare Health System, Essentia Health, HealthPartners, M Health Fairview and the Mayo Clinic Health System.

name: minnesota
sentence: There are two teaching hospitals and medical schools in Minnesota.

name: minnesota
sentence: The University of Minnesota Medical School is a high-rated teaching institution that has made a number of breakthroughs in treatment, and its research activities contribute significantly to the state's growing biotechnology industry.

name: minnesota
sentence: The Mayo Clinic, a world-renowned hospital based in Rochester, was founded by William Worrall Mayo, an immigrant from England.

name: minnesota
sentence: US News & World Report's 2014–2015 survey ranked 4,743 hospitals in the United States in 16 specialized fields of care, and placed the Mayo Clinic in the top four in all fields except psychiatry, where it ranked seventh.

name: minnesota
sentence: The hospital ranked #1 in eight fields and #2 in three others.

name: minnesota
sentence: The Mayo Clinic and the University of Minnesota are partners in the Minnesota Partnership for Biotechnology and Medical Genomics, a state-funded program that conducts research into cancer, Alzheimer's disease, heart health, obesity, and other areas.

name: minnesota
sentence: One of the Minnesota Legislature's first acts when it opened in 1858 was the creation of a normal school in Winona.

name: minnesota
sentence: Minnesota's commitment to education has contributed to a literate and well-educated populace.

name: minnesota
sentence: In 2009, according to the US Census Bureau, Minnesota had the second-highest proportion of high school graduates, with 91.5% of people 25 and older holding a high school diploma, and the tenth-highest proportion of people with bachelor's degrees.

name: minnesota
sentence: In 2015, Minneapolis was named the nation's "Most Literate City", while St. Paul placed fourth, according to a major annual survey.

name: minnesota
sentence: In a 2013 study conducted by the National Center for Educational Statistics comparing the performance of eighth-grade students internationally in math and science, Minnesota ranked eighth in the world and third in the United States, behind Massachusetts and Vermont.

name: minnesota
sentence: In 2014, Minnesota students earned the tenth-highest average composite score in the nation on the ACT exam.

name: minnesota
sentence: In 2013, nationwide in per-student public education spending, Minnesota ranked 21st.

name: minnesota
sentence: While Minnesota has chosen not to implement school vouchers, it is home to the first charter school.

name: minnesota
sentence: The state supports a network of public universities and colleges, including 37 institutions in the Minnesota State Colleges and Universities System, and five major campuses of the University of Minnesota system.

name: minnesota
sentence: It is also home to more than 20 private colleges and universities, six of which rank among the nation's top 100 liberal arts colleges, according to US News & World Report.

name: minnesota
sentence: Transportation in Minnesota is overseen by the Minnesota Department of Transportation (MnDOT) at the state level and by regional and local governments at the local level.

name: minnesota
sentence: Principal transportation corridors radiate from the Twin Cities metropolitan area and along interstate corridors in Greater Minnesota.

name: minnesota
sentence: The major Interstate highways are Interstate 35 (I-35), I-90, and I-94, with I-35 and I-94 connecting the Minneapolis–St.

name: minnesota
sentence: Paul area, and I-90 traveling east-west along the southern edge of the state.

name: minnesota
sentence: In 2006, a constitutional amendment was passed that required sales and use taxes on motor vehicles to fund transportation, with at least forty percent dedicated to public transit.

name: minnesota
sentence: There are nearly two dozen rail corridors in Minnesota, most of which go through Minneapolis–St.

name: minnesota
sentence: Paul or Duluth.

name: minnesota
sentence: There is water transportation along the Mississippi River system and from the ports of Lake Superior.

name: minnesota
sentence: Minnesota's principal airport is Minneapolis–St.

name: minnesota
sentence: Paul International Airport (MSP), a major passenger and freight hub for Delta Air Lines and Sun Country Airlines.

name: minnesota
sentence: Most other domestic carriers serve the airport.

name: minnesota
sentence: Large commercial jet service is provided at Duluth and Rochester, with scheduled commuter service to four smaller cities via Delta Connection carriers SkyWest Airlines, Compass Airlines, and Endeavor Air.

name: minnesota
sentence: Public transit services are available in the regional urban centers in Minnesota including Metro Transit in the Twin Cities, opt out suburban operators Minnesota Valley Transit Authority, SouthWest Transit, Plymouth Metrolink, Maple Grove Transit and others.

name: minnesota
sentence: In Greater Minnesota transit services are provided by city systems such as Duluth Transit Authority, Mankato Transit System, MATBUS (Fargo-Moorhead), Rochester Public Transit, Saint Cloud Metro Bus, Winona Public Transit and others.

name: minnesota
sentence: Dial-a-Ride service is available for persons with disabilities in a majority of Minnesota Counties.

name: minnesota
sentence: In addition to bus services, Amtrak's daily Empire Builder (Chicago–Seattle/Portland) train runs through Minnesota, calling at the Saint Paul Union Depot and five other stations.

name: minnesota
sentence: Intercity bus providers include Jefferson Lines, Greyhound, and Megabus.

name: minnesota
sentence: Local public transit is provided by bus networks in the larger cities and by two rail services.

name: minnesota
sentence: The Northstar Line commuter rail service runs from Big Lake to the Target Field station in downtown Minneapolis.

name: minnesota
sentence: From there, light rail runs to Saint Paul Union Depot on the Green Line, and to the MSP airport and the Mall of America via the Blue Line.

name: minnesota
sentence: As with the federal government of the United States, power in Minnesota is divided into three branches: executive, legislative, and judicial.

name: minnesota
sentence: The executive branch is headed by the governor.

name: minnesota
sentence: Governor Tim Walz, DFL (Democratic–Farmer–Labor), took office on January 7, 2019.

name: minnesota
sentence: The governor has a cabinet consisting of the leaders of various state government agencies, called commissioners.

name: minnesota
sentence: The other elected constitutional offices are secretary of state, attorney general, and state auditor.

name: minnesota
sentence: Constitutional officeholders:

name: minnesota
sentence: The Minnesota Legislature is a bicameral body consisting of the Senatorte and the House of Representatives.

name: minnesota
sentence: The state has 67 districts, each with about 60,000 people.

name: minnesota
sentence: Each district has one senator and two representatives, each senatorial district being divided into A and B sections for members of the House.

name: minnesota
sentence: Senatortors serve for four years and representatives for two years.

name: minnesota
sentence: In the November 2010 Minnesota House election, the Republicans gained 25 house seats, giving them control of the body by a 72–62 margin.

name: minnesota
sentence: The 2010 Senatorte election also saw Minnesota voters elect a Republican majority in the state Senatorte for the first time since 1972.

name: minnesota
sentence: In 2012, the Democrats regained the House of Representatives by a margin of 73–61, picking up 11 seats; the Democrats also regained the Minnesota Senatorte.

name: minnesota
sentence: Control of the House shifted back to Republicans in the 2014 election, and returned to the DFL in the 2018 midterm election.

name: minnesota
sentence: Since 2016, the Senatorte has had a slim Republican majority.

name: minnesota
sentence: House Leadership

name: minnesota
sentence: Senatorte Leadership

name: minnesota
sentence: Minnesota's court system has three levels.

name: minnesota
sentence: Most cases start in the district courts, which are courts of general jurisdiction.

name: minnesota
sentence: There are 279 district court judgeships in ten judicial districts.

name: minnesota
sentence: Appeals from the trial courts and challenges to certain governmental decisions are heard by the Minnesota Court of Appeals, consisting of 19 judges who typically sit in three-judge panels.

name: minnesota
sentence: The seven-justice Minnesota Supreme Court hears all appeals from the tax court, the workers' compensation court of appeals, first-degree murder convictions, and discretionary appeals from the court of appeals; it also has original jurisdiction over election disputes.

name: minnesota
sentence: Two specialized courts within administrative agencies have been established: the workers' compensation court of appeals, and the tax court, which deals with non-criminal tax cases.

name: minnesota
sentence: Supreme Court Justices

name: minnesota
sentence: Associate Justices

name: minnesota
sentence: In addition to the city and county levels of government found in the United States, Minnesota has other entities that provide governmental oversight and planning.

name: minnesota
sentence: Regional development commissions (RDCs) provide technical assistance to local governments in broad multi-county area of the state.

name: minnesota
sentence: Along with this Metropolitan Planning Organizations (MPOs), such as the Metropolitan Council, provide planning and oversight of land use actions in metropolitan areas.

name: minnesota
sentence: Many lakes and rivers are overseen by watershed districts and soil and water conservation districts.

name: minnesota
sentence: Minnesota's United States senators are Democrat Amy Klobuchar and Democrat Tina Smith.

name: minnesota
sentence: The state has eight congressional districts; they are represented by Jim Hagedorn (1st district; R), Angie Craig (2nd; DFL), Dean Phillips (3rd; DFL), Betty McCollum (4th; DFL), Ilhan Omar (5th; DFL), Tom Emmer (6th; R), Michelle Fischbach (7th; R), and Pete Stauber (8th; R).

name: minnesota
sentence: Federal court cases are heard in the United States District Court for the District of Minnesota, in Minneapolis, St. Paul, Duluth, and Fergus Falls.

name: minnesota
sentence: Appeals are heard by the Eighth Circuit Court of Appeals in St. Louis, Missouri and St. Paul.

name: minnesota
sentence: The State of Minnesota was created by the United States federal government in the traditional and cultural range of lands occupied by the Dakota and Anishinaabe peoples as well as other Native American groups.

name: minnesota
sentence: After many years of unequal treaties and forced resettlement by the state and federal government, the tribes re-organized into sovereign tribal governments.

name: minnesota
sentence: Today, the tribal governments are divided into 11 semi-autonomous reservations that negotiate with the US and the state on a bilateral basis:

name: minnesota
sentence: Four Dakota Mdewakanton communities:

name: minnesota
sentence: Seven Anishinaabe reservations:

name: minnesota
sentence: The first six of the Anishinaabe bands compose the Minnesota Chippewa Tribe, the collective federally recognized tribal government of the Bois Forte, Fond du Lac, Grand Portage, Leech Lake, Mille Lacs, and White Earth reservations.

name: minnesota
sentence: Minnesota is known for a politically active citizenry, and populism has been a long-standing force among the state's political parties.

name: minnesota
sentence: Minnesota has a consistently high voter turnout.

name: minnesota
sentence: In the 2008 US presidential election, 78.2% of eligible Minnesotans voted – the highest percentage of any US state – versus the national average of 61.2%.

name: minnesota
sentence: Voters can register on election day at their polling places with evidence of residency.

name: minnesota
sentence: Hubert Humphrey brought national attention to the state with his address at the 1948 Democratic National Convention.

name: minnesota
sentence: Minnesotans have consistently cast their Electoral College votes for Democratic presidential candidates since 1976, longer than any other state.

name: minnesota
sentence: Minnesota is the only state in the nation that did not vote for Ronald Reagan in either of his presidential runs.

name: minnesota
sentence: Minnesota has gone for the Democratic Party in every presidential election since 1960, with the exception of 1972, when it was carried by Republican Richard Nixon.

name: minnesota
sentence: Both the Democratic and Republican parties have major-party status in Minnesota, but its state-level Democratic party has a different name, officially known as the Minnesota Democratic-Farmer-Labor Party (DFL).

name: minnesota
sentence: It was formed out of a 1944 alliance of the Minnesota Democratic and Farmer-Labor parties.

name: minnesota
sentence: The state has had active third-party movements.

name: minnesota
sentence: The Reform Party, now the Independence Party, was able to elect former mayor of Brooklyn Park and professional wrestler Jesse Ventura to the governorship in 1998.

name: minnesota
sentence: The Independence Party has received enough support to keep major-party status.

name: minnesota
sentence: The Green Party, while no longer having major-party status, has a large presence in municipal government, notably in Minneapolis and Duluth, where it competes directly with the DFL party for local offices.

name: minnesota
sentence: Major-party status in Minnesota (which grants state funding for elections) is reserved to parties whose candidates receive five percent or more of the vote in any statewide election (e.g., governor, secretary of state, US president).

name: minnesota
sentence: The state's US Senatorte seats have generally been split since the early 1990s, and in the 108th and 109th Congresses, Minnesota's congressional delegation was split, with four representatives and one senator from each party.

name: minnesota
sentence: In the 2006 mid-term election, Democrats were elected to all state offices, except governor and lieutenant governor, where Republicans Tim Pawlenty and Carol Molnau narrowly won re-election.

name: minnesota
sentence: The DFL posted double-digit gains in both houses of the legislature, elected Amy Klobuchar to the US Senatorte, and increased the party's US House caucus by one.

name: minnesota
sentence: Keith Ellison (DFL) was elected as the first African American US Representative from Minnesota, as well as the first Muslim elected to Congress nationwide.

name: minnesota
sentence: In 2008, DFLer and former comedian and radio talk show host Al Franken defeated incumbent Republican Norm Coleman in the US Senatorte race by 312 votes out of three million cast.

name: minnesota
sentence: In the 2010 election, Republicans took control of both chambers of the Minnesota legislature for the first time in 38 years and, with Mark Dayton's election, the DFL party took the governor's office for the first time in 20 years.

name: minnesota
sentence: Two years later, the DFL regained control of both houses, and with Dayton in office, the party had same-party control of both the legislative and executive branches for the first time since 1990.

name: minnesota
sentence: Two years later, the Republicans regained control of the Minnesota House, and in 2016, the GOP also regained control of the State Senatorte.

name: minnesota
sentence: In 2018, the DFL retook control of the Minnesota House, while electing DFLer Tim Walz as Governor.

name: minnesota
sentence: The Twin Cities area is the fifteenth-largest media market in the United States, as ranked by Nielsen Media Research.

name: minnesota
sentence: The state's other top markets are Fargo–Moorhead (118th nationally), Duluth–Superior (137th), Rochester–Mason City–Austin (152nd), and Mankato (200th).

name: minnesota
sentence: Broadcast television in Minnesota and the Upper Midwest started on April 27, 1948, when KSTP-TV began broadcasting.

name: minnesota
sentence: Hubbard Broadcasting, which owns KSTP, is now the only locally owned television company in Minnesota.

name: minnesota
sentence: Twin Cities CBS station WCCO-TV and FOX station KMSP-TV are owned-and-operated by their respective networks.

name: minnesota
sentence: There are 39 analog broadcast stations and 23 digital channels broadcast over Minnesota.

name: minnesota
sentence: The four largest daily newspapers are the Star Tribune in Minneapolis, the Pioneer Press in Saint Paul, the Duluth News Tribune in Duluth, and the Post-Bulletin in Rochester.

name: minnesota
sentence: The Minnesota Daily is the largest student-run newspaper in the US Sites offering daily news on the Web include The UpTake, MinnPost, the Twin Cities Daily Planet, business news site Finance and Commerce and Washington D.C.-based Minnesota Independent.

name: minnesota
sentence: Weeklies including City Pages and monthly publications such as Minnesota Monthly are available.

name: minnesota
sentence: Two of the largest public radio networks, Minnesota Public Radio (MPR) and Public Radio International (PRI), are based in the state.

name: minnesota
sentence: MPR has the largest audience of any regional public radio network in the nation, broadcasting on 46 radio stations as of 2019.

name: minnesota
sentence: PRI weekly provides more than 400 hours of programming to almost 800 affiliates.

name: minnesota
sentence: The state's oldest radio station, KUOM-AM, was launched in 1922 and is among the 10-oldest radio stations in the United States.

name: minnesota
sentence: The University of Minnesota-owned station is still on the air, and since 1993 broadcasts a college rock format.

name: minnesota
sentence: Minnesota has an active program of organized amateur and professional sports.

name: minnesota
sentence: Tourism has become an important industry, especially in the Lake region.

name: minnesota
sentence: In the North Country, what had been an industrial area focused on mining and timber has largely been transformed into a vacation destination.

name: minnesota
sentence: Popular interest in the environment and environmentalism, added to traditional interests in hunting and fishing, has attracted a large urban audience within driving range.

name: minnesota
sentence: Minnesota has professional men's teams in all major sports.

name: minnesota
sentence: The Minnesota Vikings have played in the National Football League since their admission as an expansion franchise in 1961.

name: minnesota
sentence: They played in Metropolitan Stadium from 1961 through 1981 and in the Hubert H. Humphrey Metrodome from 1982 until its demolition after the 2013 season for the construction of the team's new home, US Bank Stadium.

name: minnesota
sentence: The Vikings' current stadium hosted Super Bowl LII in February, 2018.

name: minnesota
sentence: Super Bowl XXVI was played in the Metrodome in 1992.

name: minnesota
sentence: The Vikings have advanced to the Super Bowl Super Bowl IV, Super Bowl VIII, Super Bowl IX, and Super Bowl XI, losing all four games to their AFC/AFL opponent

name: minnesota
sentence: The Minnesota Twins have played in the Major League Baseball in the Twin Cities since 1961.

name: minnesota
sentence: The Twins began play as the original Washington Senatortors, a founding member of the American League in 1901, relocating to Minnesota in 1961.

name: minnesota
sentence: The Twins won the 1987 and 1991 World Series in seven game matches where the home team was victorious in all games.

name: minnesota
sentence: The Twins also advanced to the 1965 World Series, where they lost to the Los Angeles Dodgers in seven games.

name: minnesota
sentence: The team has played at Target Field since 2010.

name: minnesota
sentence: The Minneapolis Lakers of the National Basketball Association played in the Minneapolis Auditorium from 1947 to 1960, after which they relocated to Los Angeles.

name: minnesota
sentence: The Minnesota Timberwolves joined the NBA in 1989, and have played in Target Center since 1990.

name: minnesota
sentence: The National Hockey League's Minnesota Wild play in St. Paul's Xcel Energy Center, and reached 300 consecutive sold-out games on January 16, 2008.

name: minnesota
sentence: Previously, the Minnesota North Stars competed in NHL from 1967 to 1993, which played in and lost the 1981 and 1991 Stanley Cup Finals.

name: minnesota
sentence: Minnesota United FC joined Major League Soccer as an expansion team in 2017, having played in the lower-division North American Soccer League from 2010 to 2016.

name: minnesota
sentence: The team plays at Allianz Field in St. Paul.

name: minnesota
sentence: Previous professional soccer teams have included the Minnesota Kicks, which played at Metropolitan Stadium from 1976 to 1981, and the Minnesota Strikers from 1984 to 1988.

name: minnesota
sentence: Minnesota also has minor-league professional sports teams.

name: minnesota
sentence: The Minnesota Swarm of the National Lacrosse League played at the Xcel Energy Center until the team moved to Georgia in 2015.

name: minnesota
sentence: Minor league baseball is represented by major league-sponsored teams and independent teams such as the St. Paul Saints, who play at CHS Field in St. Paul.

name: minnesota
sentence: Professional women's sports include the Minnesota Lynx of the Women's National Basketball Association, winners of the 2011, 2013, 2015, and 2017 WNBA Championships, the Minnesota Lightning of the United Soccer Leagues W-League, the Minnesota Vixen of the Independent Women's Football League, the Minnesota Valkyrie of the Legends Football League, and the Minnesota Whitecaps of the National Women's Hockey League.

name: minnesota
sentence: The Twin Cities campus of the University of Minnesota is a National Collegiate Athletic Association (NCAA) Division I school competing in the Big Ten Conference.

name: minnesota
sentence: Four additional schools in the state compete in NCAA Division I ice hockey: the University of Minnesota Duluth; Minnesota State University, Mankato; St.

name: minnesota
sentence: Cloud State University and Bemidji State University.

name: minnesota
sentence: There are nine NCAA Division II colleges in the Northern Sun Intercollegiate Conference, and twenty NCAA Division III colleges in the Minnesota Intercollegiate Athletic Conference and Upper Midwest Athletic Conference.

name: minnesota
sentence: Minneapolis has hosted the NCAA Men's Division I Basketball Championship in 1951, 1992, 2001, and 2019.

name: minnesota
sentence: The Hazeltine National Golf Club has hosted the US Open, US Women's Open, US Senatoror Open and PGA Championship.

name: minnesota
sentence: The course also hosted the Ryder Cup in the fall of 2016, when it became one of two courses in the US to host all major golf competitions.

name: minnesota
sentence: The Ryder Cup is scheduled to return in 2028.

name: minnesota
sentence: Interlachen Country Club has hosted the US Open, US Women's Open, and Solheim Cup.

name: minnesota
sentence: Winter Olympic Games medalists from the state include twelve of the twenty members of the gold medal 1980 ice hockey team (coached by Minnesota native Herb Brooks) and the bronze medalist US men's curling team in the 2006 Winter Olympics.

name: minnesota
sentence: Swimmer Tom Malchow won an Olympic gold medal in the 2000 Summer games and a silver medal in 1996.

name: minnesota
sentence: Grandma's Marathon is run every summer along the scenic North Shore of Lake Superior, and the Twin Cities Marathon winds around lakes and the Mississippi River during the peak of the fall color season.

name: minnesota
sentence: Farther north, Eveleth is the location of the United States Hockey Hall of Fame.

name: minnesota
sentence: Minnesotans participate in high levels of physical activity, and many of these activities are outdoors.

name: minnesota
sentence: The strong interest of Minnesotans in environmentalism has been attributed to the popularity of these pursuits.

name: minnesota
sentence: In the warmer months, these activities often involve water.

name: minnesota
sentence: Weekend and longer trips to family cabins on Minnesota's numerous lakes are a way of life for many residents.

name: minnesota
sentence: Activities include water sports such as water skiing, which originated in the state, boating, canoeing, and fishing.

name: minnesota
sentence: More than 36 percent of Minnesotans fish, second only to Alaska.

name: minnesota
sentence: Fishing does not cease when the lakes freeze

name: minnesota
sentence: Minnesotans have learned to embrace their long, harsh winters in ice sports such as skating, hockey, curling, and broomball, and snow sports such as cross-country skiing, alpine skiing, luge, snowshoeing, and snowmobiling.

name: minnesota
sentence: Minnesota is the only US state where bandy is played.

name: minnesota
sentence: State and national forests and the seventy-two state parks are used year-round for hunting, camping, and hiking.

name: minnesota
sentence: There are almost 20,000 miles (32,000 km) of snowmobile trails statewide.

name: minnesota
sentence: Minnesota has more miles of bike trails than any other state, and a growing network of hiking trails, including the 235-mile (378 km) Superior Hiking Trail in the northeast.

name: minnesota
sentence: Many hiking and bike trails are used for cross-country skiing during the winter.

name: mississippi
sentence: Mississippi ( (listen)) is a state in the Deep South region of the Southern United States, bordered to the north by Tennessee; to the east by Alabama; to the south by the Gulf of Mexico; to the southwest by Louisiana; and to the northwest by Arkansas.

name: mississippi
sentence: Mississippi's western boundary is largely defined by the Mississippi River.

name: mississippi
sentence: Mississippi is the 32nd largest and 34th-most populous of the 50 US states.

name: mississippi
sentence: Jackson is both the state's capital and largest city.

name: mississippi
sentence: Greater Jackson is the state's most populous metropolitan area, with an estimated population of 580,166 in 2018.

name: mississippi
sentence: On December 10, 1817, Mississippi became the 20th state admitted to the Union.

name: mississippi
sentence: By 1860, Mississippi was the nation's top cotton-producing state and enslaved persons accounted for 55% of the state population.

name: mississippi
sentence: Mississippi declared its secession from the Union on March 23, 1861, and was one of the seven original Confederate States, which constituted the largest slaveholding states in the nation.

name: mississippi
sentence: Following the Civil War, it was restored to the Union on February 23, 1870.

name: mississippi
sentence: Until the Great Migration of the 1930s, African Americans were a majority of Mississippi's population.

name: mississippi
sentence: Mississippi was the site of many prominent events during the civil rights movement, including the Ole Miss riot of 1962 by white students objecting to desegregation, the 1963 assassination of Medgar Evers, and the 1964 Freedom Summer murders of three activists working on voting rights.

name: mississippi
sentence: With large areas of agriculture and rural towns, Mississippi frequently ranks low among states in measures of health, education, and development, and high in measures of poverty.

name: mississippi
sentence: In 2010, 37.3% of Mississippi's population was African American, the highest percentage of any state.

name: mississippi
sentence: Mississippi is almost entirely within the Gulf coastal plain, and generally consists of lowland plains and low hills.

name: mississippi
sentence: The northwest remainder of the state consists of the Mississippi Delta, a section of the Mississippi Alluvial Plain.

name: mississippi
sentence: Mississippi's highest point is Woodall Mountain at 807 feet (246 m) above sea level adjacent to the Cumberland Plateau

name: mississippi
sentence: Mississippi has a humid subtropical climate classification.

name: mississippi
sentence: The state's name is derived from the Mississippi River, which flows along and defines its western boundary.

name: mississippi
sentence: European-American settlers named it after the Ojibwe word misi-ziibi (English: Great river).

name: mississippi
sentence: Mississippi is bordered to the north by Tennessee, to the east by Alabama, to the south by Louisiana and a narrow coast on the Gulf of Mexico; and to the west, across the Mississippi River, by Louisiana and Arkansas.

name: mississippi
sentence: In addition to its namesake, major rivers in Mississippi include the Big Black River, the Pearl River, the Yazoo River, the Pascagoula River, and the Tombigbee River.

name: mississippi
sentence: Major lakes include Ross Barnett Reservoir, Arkabutla, Sardis, and Grenada, with the largest being Sardis Lake.

name: mississippi
sentence: Mississippi is entirely composed of lowlands, the highest point being Woodall Mountain, in the foothills of the Cumberland Mountains, 807 ft (246 m) above sea level.

name: mississippi
sentence: The lowest point is sea level at the Gulf Coast.

name: mississippi
sentence: The state's mean elevation is 300 ft (91 m) above sea level.

name: mississippi
sentence: Most of Mississippi is part of the East Gulf Coastal Plain.

name: mississippi
sentence: The coastal plain is generally composed of low hills, such as the Pine Hills in the south and the North Central Hills.

name: mississippi
sentence: The Pontotoc Ridge and the Fall Line Hills in the northeast have somewhat higher elevations.

name: mississippi
sentence: Yellow-brown loess soil is found in the western parts of the state.

name: mississippi
sentence: The northeast is a region of fertile black earth uplands, a geology that extend into the Alabama Black Belt.

name: mississippi
sentence: The coastline includes large bays at Bay St. Louis, Biloxi, and Pascagoula.

name: mississippi
sentence: It is separated from the Gulf of Mexico proper by the shallow Mississippi Sound, which is partially sheltered by Petit Bois Island, Horn Island, East and West Ship Islands, Deer Island, Round Island, and Cat Island.

name: mississippi
sentence: The northwest remainder of the state consists of the Mississippi Delta, a section of the Mississippi Alluvial Plain.

name: mississippi
sentence: The plain is narrow in the south and widens north of Vicksburg.

name: mississippi
sentence: The region has rich soil, partly made up of silt which had been regularly deposited by the flood waters of the Mississippi River.

name: mississippi
sentence: Areas under the management of the National Park Service include:

name: mississippi
sentence: Mississippi City Population Rankings of at least 50,000 (United States Census Bureau as of 2017):

name: mississippi
sentence: Mississippi City Population Rankings of at least 20,000 but fewer than 50,000 (United States Census Bureau as of 2017):
