sentence: Although by the end of the 19th century, two-thirds of the farm owners were black, continued low prices for cotton and national financial pressures resulted in most of them losing their land.

name: mississippi
sentence: More problems built up with the boll weevil infestation, when thousands of agricultural jobs were lost.

name: mississippi
sentence: Jimmie Rodgers, a native of Meridian and guitarist/singer/songwriter known as the "Father of Country Music", played a significant role in the development of the blues.

name: mississippi
sentence: He and Chester Arthur Burnett were friends and admirers of each other's music.

name: mississippi
sentence: Their friendship and respect is an important example of Mississippi's musical legacy.

name: mississippi
sentence: While the state has had a reputation for being racist, Mississippi musicians created new forms by combining and creating variations on musical traditions from Africa, African American traditions, and the musical traditions of white Southerners strongly shaped by Scots-Irish and other styles.

name: mississippi
sentence: The state is creating a Mississippi Blues Trail, with dedicated markers explaining historic sites significant to the history of blues music, such as Clarksdale's Riverside Hotel, where Bessie Smith died after her auto accident on Highway 61.

name: mississippi
sentence: The Riverside Hotel is just one of many historical blues sites in Clarksdale.

name: mississippi
sentence: The Delta Blues Museum there is visited by tourists from all over the world.

name: mississippi
sentence: Close by is "Ground Zero", a contemporary blues club and restaurant co-owned by actor Morgan Freeman.

name: mississippi
sentence: Elvis Presley, who created a sensation in the 1950s as a crossover artist and contributed to rock 'n' roll, was a native of Tupelo.

name: mississippi
sentence: From opera star Leontyne Price to the alternative rock band 3 Doors Down, to gulf and western singer Jimmy Buffett, modern rock/jazz/world music guitarist-producer Clifton Hyde, to rappers David Banner, Big K.R.I.T.

name: mississippi
sentence: and Afroman, Mississippi musicians have been significant in all genres.

name: missouri
sentence: Missouri is a state in the Midwestern United States.

name: missouri
sentence: With more than six million residents, it is the 18th-most populous state of the country.

name: missouri
sentence: The largest urban areas are St. Louis, Kansas City, Springfield and Columbia; the capital is Jefferson City.

name: missouri
sentence: The state is the 21st-most extensive in area.

name: missouri
sentence: Missouri is bordered by eight states (tied for the most with Tennessee): Iowa to the north, Illinois, Kentucky and Tennessee (via the Mississippi River) to the east, Arkansas to the south and Oklahoma, Kansas and Nebraska to the west.

name: missouri
sentence: In the south are the Ozarks, a forested highland, providing timber, minerals, and recreation.

name: missouri
sentence: The Missouri River, after which the state is named, flows through the center of the state into the Mississippi River, which makes up Missouri's eastern border.

name: missouri
sentence: Humans have inhabited the land now known as Missouri for at least 12,000 years.

name: missouri
sentence: The Mississippian culture built cities and mounds, before declining in the 14th century.

name: missouri
sentence: When European explorers arrived in the 17th century, they encountered the Osage and Missouria nations.

name: missouri
sentence: The French established Louisiana, a part of New France, founding Ste.

name: missouri
sentence: Genevieve in 1735 and St. Louis in 1764.

name: missouri
sentence: After a brief period of Spanish rule, the United States acquired the Louisiana Purchase in 1803.

name: missouri
sentence: Americans from the Upland South, including enslaved African Americans, rushed into the new Missouri Territory.

name: missouri
sentence: Missouri was admitted as a slave state as part of the Missouri Compromise.

name: missouri
sentence: Many from Virginia, Kentucky and Tennessee settled in the Boonslick area of Mid-Missouri.

name: missouri
sentence: Soon after, heavy German immigration formed the Missouri Rhineland.

name: missouri
sentence: Missouri played a central role in the westward expansion of the United States, as memorialized by the Gateway Arch.

name: missouri
sentence: The Pony Express, Oregon Trail, Santa Fe Trail and California Trail all began in Missouri.

name: missouri
sentence: As a border state, Missouri's role in the American Civil War was complex and there were many conflicts within.

name: missouri
sentence: After the war, both Greater St. Louis and the Kansas City metropolitan area became centers of industrialization and business.

name: missouri
sentence: Today the state is divided into 114 counties and the independent city of St. Louis.

name: missouri
sentence: Missouri's culture blends elements from the Midwestern and Southern United States.

name: missouri
sentence: The musical styles of ragtime, Kansas City jazz and St. Louis blues developed in Missouri.

name: missouri
sentence: The well-known Kansas City-style barbecue and lesser-known St. Louis-style barbecue, can be found across the state and beyond.

name: missouri
sentence: Missouri is also a major center of beer brewing

name: missouri
sentence: Missouri wine is produced in the Missouri Rhineland and Ozarks.

name: missouri
sentence: Missouri's alcohol laws are among the most permissive in the United States.

name: missouri
sentence: Outside of the state's major cities, popular tourist destinations include the Lake of the Ozarks, Table Rock Lake and Branson.

name: missouri
sentence: Well-known Missourians include Chuck Berry, Sheryl Crow, Walt Disney, Edwin Hubble, Nelly, Brad Pitt, Harry S. Truman, and Mark Twain.

name: missouri
sentence: Some of the largest companies based in the state include Cerner, Express Scripts, Monsanto, Emerson Electric, Edward Jones, HRBlock, Wells Fargo Advisors, Centene Corporation, and O'Reilly Auto Parts.

name: missouri
sentence: Well-known universities in Missouri include the University of Missouri, St. Louis University, Washington University in St. Louis and Missouri Western State University.

name: missouri
sentence: Missouri has been called the "Mother of the West" and the "Cave State", but its most famous nickname is the "Show Me State".

name: missouri
sentence: The state is named for the Missouri River, which was named after the indigenous Missouri Indians, a Siouan-language tribe.

name: missouri
sentence: It is said they were called the ouemessourita (wimihsoorita), meaning "those who have dugout canoes", by the Miami-Illinois language speakers.

name: missouri
sentence: This appears to be folk etymology—the Illinois spoke an Algonquian language and the closest approximation that can be made in that of their close neighbors, the Ojibwe, is "You Ought to Go Downriver & Visit Those People."

name: missouri
sentence: This would be an odd occurrence, as the French who first explored and attempted to settle the Mississippi River usually got their translations during that time fairly accurate, often giving things French names that were exact translations of the native tongue(s).

name: missouri
sentence: Assuming Missouri were deriving from the Siouan language, it would translate as "It connects to the side of it," in reference to the river itself.

name: missouri
sentence: This is not entirely likely either, as this would be coming out as "Maya Sunni" (Mah-yah soo-nee).

name: missouri
sentence: Most likely, though, the name Missouri comes from Chiwere, a Siouan language spoken by people who resided in the modern-day states of Wisconsin, Iowa, South Dakota, Missouri & Nebraska.

name: missouri
sentence: The name "Missouri" has several different pronunciations even among its present-day natives, the two most common being (listen) miz-UR-ee and (listen) miz-UR-ə.

name: missouri
sentence: Further pronunciations also exist in Missouri or elsewhere in the United States, involving the realization of the medial consonant as either or ; the vowel in the second syllable as either or ; and the third syllable as (phonetically [i] (listen), [ɪ] (listen) or [ɪ̈] (listen)) or .

name: missouri
sentence: Any combination of these phonetic realizations may be observed coming from speakers of American English.

name: missouri
sentence: In British received pronunciation, the preferred variant is miz-OOR-ee, with mis-OOR-ee being a possible alternative.

name: missouri
sentence: The linguistic history was treated definitively by Donald M. Lance, who acknowledged that the question is sociologically complex, but no pronunciation could be declared "correct", nor could any be clearly defined as native or outsider, rural or urban, southern or northern, educated or otherwise.

name: missouri
sentence: Politicians often employ multiple pronunciations, even during a single speech, to appeal to a greater number of listeners.

name: missouri
sentence: In informal contexts respellings of the state's name, such as "Missour-ee" or "Missour-uh", are occasionally used to distinguish pronunciations phonetically.

name: missouri
sentence: There is no official state nickname.

name: missouri
sentence: However, Missouri's unofficial nickname is the "Show Me State," which appears on its license plates.

name: missouri
sentence: This phrase has several origins.

name: missouri
sentence: One is popularly ascribed to a speech by Congressman Willard Vandiver in 1899, who declared that "I come from a state that raises corn and cotton, cockleburs and Democrats, and frothy eloquence neither convinces nor satisfies me.

name: missouri
sentence: I'm from Missouri, and you have got to show me."

name: missouri
sentence: This is in keeping with the saying "I'm from Missouri," which means "I'm skeptical of the matter and not easily convinced."

name: missouri
sentence: However, according to researchers, the phrase "show me" was already in use before the 1890s.

name: missouri
sentence: Another one states that it is a reference to Missouri miners who were taken to Leadville, Colorado to replace striking workers.

name: missouri
sentence: Since the new men were unfamiliar with the mining methods, they required frequent instruction.

name: missouri
sentence: Other nicknames for Missouri include "The Lead State", "The Bullion State", "The Ozark State", "The Mother of the West", "The Iron Mountain State", and "Pennsylvania of the West".

name: missouri
sentence: It is also known as the "Cave State" because there are more than 7,300 recorded caves in the state (second to Tennessee).

name: missouri
sentence: Perry County is the county with the largest number of caves and the single longest cave.

name: missouri
sentence: The official state motto is Latin: "Salus Populi Suprema Lex Esto", which means "Let the welfare of the people be the supreme law."

name: missouri
sentence: Indigenous peoples inhabited Missouri for thousands of years before European exploration and settlement.

name: missouri
sentence: Archaeological excavations along the rivers have shown continuous habitation for more than 7,000 years.

name: missouri
sentence: Beginning before 1000 CE, there arose the complex Mississippian culture, whose people created regional political centers at present-day St. Louis and across the Mississippi River at Cahokia, near present-day Collinsville, Illinois.

name: missouri
sentence: Their large cities included thousands of individual residences.

name: missouri
sentence: Still, they are known for their surviving massive earthwork mounds, built for religious, political and social reasons, in platform, ridgetop and conical shapes.

name: missouri
sentence: Cahokia was the center of a regional trading network that reached from the Great Lakes to the Gulf of Mexico.

name: missouri
sentence: The civilization declined by 1400 CE, and most descendants left the area long before the arrival of Europeans.

name: missouri
sentence: St. Louis was at one time known as Mound City by the European Americans because of the numerous surviving prehistoric mounds since lost to urban development.

name: missouri
sentence: The Mississippian culture left mounds throughout the middle Mississippi and Ohio river valleys, extending into the southeast and the upper river.

name: missouri
sentence: The land that became the state of Missouri was part of numerous different territories possessed changing and often indeterminate borders and had many different Native American and European names between the 1600s and statehood.

name: missouri
sentence: For much of the first half of the 1700s, the west bank of the Mississippi River that would become Missouri was mostly uninhabited, something of a no man's land that kept peace between the Illinois on the east bank of the Mississippi River and to the North, and the Osage and Missouri Indians of the lower Missouri Valley.

name: missouri
sentence: In the early 1700s, French traders and missionaries explored the whole of the Mississippi Valley, named the region “Louisiana.” Around the same time, a different group of French Canadians who established five villages on the east bank of the Mississippi River placed their settlements in the le pays des Illinois, “the country of the Illinois.” When habitants - settlers of French Canadian descent - began crossing the Mississippi River to establish settlements such as Ste.

name: missouri
sentence: Genevieve, they continued to place their settlements in the Illinois Country.

name: missouri
sentence: At the same time, the French settlements on both sides of the Mississippi River were part of the French province of Louisiana.

name: missouri
sentence: To distinguish the settlements in the Middle Mississippi Valley from French settlements in the lower Mississippi Valley around New Orleans, French officials and inhabitants referred to the Middle Mississippi Valley as La Haute Louisiane, “The High Louisiana,” or “Upper Louisiana.”

name: missouri
sentence: The first European settlers were mostly ethnic French Canadians, who created their first settlement in Missouri at present-day Ste.

name: missouri
sentence: Genevieve, about an hour south of St. Louis.

name: missouri
sentence: They had migrated about 1750 from the Illinois Country.

name: missouri
sentence: They came from colonial villages on the east side of the Mississippi River, where soils were becoming exhausted, and there was insufficient river bottom land for the growing population.

name: missouri
sentence: The early Missouri settlements included many enslaved Africans and Native Americans, and slave labor was central to both commercial agriculture and the fur trade.

name: missouri
sentence: Sainte-Geneviève became a thriving agricultural center, producing enough surplus wheat, corn and tobacco to ship tons of grain annually downriver to Lower Louisiana for trade.

name: missouri
sentence: Grain production in the Illinois Country was critical to the survival of Lower Louisiana and especially the city of New Orleans.

name: missouri
sentence: St. Louis was founded soon after by French fur traders, Pierre Laclède and stepson Auguste Chouteau from New Orleans in 1764.

name: missouri
sentence: From 1764 to 1803, European control of the area west of the Mississippi to the northernmost part of the Missouri River basin, called Louisiana, was assumed by the Spanish as part of the Viceroyalty of New Spain, due to Treaty of Fontainebleau (in order to have Spain join with France in the war against England).

name: missouri
sentence: The arrival of the Spanish in St. Louis was in September 1767.

name: missouri
sentence: St. Louis became the center of a regional fur trade with Native American tribes that extended up the Missouri and Mississippi rivers, which dominated the regional economy for decades.

name: missouri
sentence: Trading partners of major firms shipped their furs from St. Louis by river down to New Orleans for export to Europe.

name: missouri
sentence: They provided a variety of goods to traders for sale and trade with their Native American clients.

name: missouri
sentence: The fur trade and associated businesses made St. Louis an early financial center and provided the wealth for some to build fine houses and import luxury items.

name: missouri
sentence: Its location near the confluence of the Illinois River meant it also handled produce from the agricultural areas.

name: missouri
sentence: River traffic and trade along the Mississippi were integral to the state's economy.

name: missouri
sentence: As the area's first major city, St. Louis expanded greatly after the invention of the steamboat and the increased river trade.

name: missouri
sentence: Napoleon Bonaparte had gained Louisiana for French ownership from Spain in 1800 under the Treaty of San Ildefonso after it had been a Spanish colony since 1762.

name: missouri
sentence: But the treaty was kept secret.

name: missouri
sentence: Louisiana remained nominally under Spanish control until a transfer of power to France on November 30, 1803, just three weeks before the cession to the United States.

name: missouri
sentence: Part of the 1803 Louisiana Purchase by the United States, Missouri earned the nickname Gateway to the West because it served as a significant departure point for expeditions and settlers heading to the West during the 19th century.

name: missouri
sentence: St. Charles, just west of St. Louis, was the starting point and the return destination of the Lewis and Clark Expedition, which ascended the Missouri River in 1804, to explore the western lands to the Pacific Ocean.

name: missouri
sentence: St. Louis was a major supply point for decades, for parties of settlers heading west.

name: missouri
sentence: As many of the early settlers in western Missouri migrated from the Upper South, they brought enslaved African Americans as agricultural laborers, and they desired to continue their culture and the institution of slavery.

name: missouri
sentence: They settled predominantly in 17 counties along the Missouri River, in an area of flatlands that enabled plantation agriculture and became known as "Little Dixie."

name: missouri
sentence: The state was rocked by the 1811–12 New Madrid earthquakes.

name: missouri
sentence: Casualties were few due to the sparse population.

name: missouri
sentence: In 1821, the former Missouri Territory was admitted as a slave state, under the Missouri Compromise, and with a temporary state capital in St. Charles.

name: missouri
sentence: In 1826, the capital was shifted to its current, permanent location of Jefferson City, also on the Missouri River.

name: missouri
sentence: Originally the state's western border was a straight line, defined as the meridian passing through the Kawsmouth, the point where the Kansas River enters the Missouri River.

name: missouri
sentence: The river has moved since this designation.

name: missouri
sentence: This line is known as the Osage Boundary.

name: missouri
sentence: In 1836 the Platte Purchase was added to the northwest corner of the state after purchase of the land from the native tribes, making the Missouri River the border north of the Kansas River.

name: missouri
sentence: This addition increased the land area of what was already the largest state in the Union at the time (about 66,500 square miles (172,000 km2) to Virginia's 65,000 square miles, which then included West Virginia).

name: missouri
sentence: In the early 1830s, Mormon migrants from northern states and Canada began settling near Independence and areas just north of there.

name: missouri
sentence: Conflicts over religion and slavery arose between the 'old settlers' (mainly from the South) and the Mormons (mainly from the North).

name: missouri
sentence: The Mormon War erupted in 1838.

name: missouri
sentence: By 1839, with the help of an "Extermination Order" by Governor Lilburn Boggs, the old settlers forcefully expelled the Mormons from Missouri and confiscated their lands.

name: missouri
sentence: Conflicts over slavery exacerbated border tensions among the states and territories.

name: missouri
sentence: From 1838 to 1839, a border dispute with Iowa over the so-called Honey Lands resulted in both states' calling-up of militias along the border.

name: missouri
sentence: With increasing migration, from the 1830s to the 1860s, Missouri's population almost doubled with every decade.

name: missouri
sentence: Most newcomers were American-born, but many Irish and German immigrants arrived in the late 1840s and 1850s.

name: missouri
sentence: As a majority were Catholic, they set up their own religious institutions in the state, which had been mostly Protestant.

name: missouri
sentence: Many settled in cities, creating a regional and then state network of Catholic churches and schools.

name: missouri
sentence: Nineteenth-century German immigrants created the wine industry along the Missouri River and the beer industry in St. Louis.

name: missouri
sentence: While many German immigrants were strongly anti-slavery, many Irish immigrants living in cities were pro-slavery, fearing that liberating African-American slaves would create a glut of unskilled labor, driving wages down.

name: missouri
sentence: Most Missouri farmers practiced subsistence farming before the American Civil War.

name: missouri
sentence: The majority of those who held slaves had fewer than five each.

name: missouri
sentence: Planters, defined by some historians as those holding twenty slaves or more, were concentrated in the counties known as "Little Dixie," in the central part of the state along the Missouri River.

name: missouri
sentence: The tensions over slavery chiefly had to do with the future of the state and nation.

name: missouri
sentence: In 1860, enslaved African Americans made up less than 10% of the state's population of 1,182,012.

name: missouri
sentence: In order to control the flooding of farmland and low-lying villages along the Mississippi, the state had completed construction of 140 miles (230 km) of levees along the river by 1860.

name: missouri
sentence: After the secession of Southern states began in 1861, the Missouri legislature called for the election of a special convention on secession.

name: missouri
sentence: Pro-Southern Governor Claiborne F. Jackson ordered the mobilization of several hundred members of the state militia who had gathered in a camp in St. Louis for training.

name: missouri
sentence: Alarmed at this action, Union General Nathaniel Lyon struck first, encircling the camp and forcing the state troops to surrender.

name: missouri
sentence: Lyon directed his soldiers, largely non-English-speaking German immigrants, to march the prisoners through the streets, and they opened fire on the largely hostile crowds of civilians who gathered around them.

name: missouri
sentence: Soldiers killed unarmed prisoners as well as men, women, and children of St. Louis in the incident that became known as the "St. Louis Massacre".

name: missouri
sentence: These events heightened Confederate support within the state.

name: missouri
sentence: Governor Jackson appointed Sterling Price, president of the convention on secession, as head of the new Missouri State Guard.

name: missouri
sentence: In the face of Union General Lyon's rapid advance through the state, Jackson and Price were forced to flee the capital of Jefferson City on June 14, 1861.

name: missouri
sentence: In Neosho, Missouri, Jackson called the state legislature into session to call for secession.

name: missouri
sentence: However, the elected legislative body was split between pro-Union and pro-Confederate.

name: missouri
sentence: As such, few of the pro-unionist attended the session called in Neosho, and the ordinance of secession was quickly adopted.

name: missouri
sentence: The Confederacy recognized Missouri secession on October 30, 1861.

name: missouri
sentence: With the elected governor absent from the capital and the legislators largely dispersed, the state convention was reassembled with most of its members present, save twenty who fled south with Jackson's forces.

name: missouri
sentence: The convention declared all offices vacant and installed Hamilton Gamble as the new governor of Missouri.

name: missouri
sentence: President Lincoln's administration immediately recognized Gamble's government as the legal Missouri government.

name: missouri
sentence: The federal government's decision enabled raising pro-Union militia forces for service within the state and volunteer regiments for the Union Army.

name: missouri
sentence: Fighting ensued between Union forces and a combined army of General Price's Missouri State Guard and Confederate troops from Arkansas and Texas under General Ben McCulloch.

name: missouri
sentence: After winning victories at the battle of Wilson's Creek and the siege of Lexington, Missouri and suffering losses elsewhere, the Confederate forces retreated to Arkansas and later Marshall, Texas, in the face of a largely reinforced Union Army.

name: missouri
sentence: Though regular Confederate troops staged some large-scale raids into Missouri, the fighting in the state for the next three years consisted chiefly of guerrilla warfare.

name: missouri
sentence: "Citizen soldiers" or insurgents such as Captain William Quantrill, Frank and Jesse James, the Younger brothers, and William T. Anderson made use of quick, small-unit tactics.

name: missouri
sentence: Pioneered by the Missouri Partisan Rangers, such insurgencies also arose in portions of the Confederacy occupied by the Union during the Civil War.

name: missouri
sentence: Historians have portrayed stories of the James brothers' outlaw years as an American "Robin Hood" myth.

name: missouri
sentence: The vigilante activities of the Bald Knobbers of the Ozarks in the 1880s were an unofficial continuation of insurgent mentality long after the official end of the war, and they are a favorite theme in Branson's self-image.

name: missouri
sentence: The Progressive Era (1890s to 1920s) saw numerous prominent leaders from Missouri trying to end corruption and modernize politics, government, and society.

name: missouri
sentence: Joseph "Holy Joe" Folk was a key leader who made a strong appeal to the middle class and rural evangelical Protestants.

name: missouri
sentence: Folk was elected governor as a progressive reformer and Democrat in the 1904 election.

name: missouri
sentence: He promoted what he called "the Missouri Idea," the concept of Missouri as a leader in public morality through popular control of law and strict enforcement.

name: missouri
sentence: He successfully conducted antitrust prosecutions, ended free railroad passes for state officials, extended bribery statutes, improved election laws, required formal registration for lobbyists, made racetrack gambling illegal and enforced the Sunday-closing law.

name: missouri
sentence: He helped enact Progressive legislation, including an initiative and referendum provision, regulation of elections, education, employment and child labor, railroads, food, business, and public utilities.

name: missouri
sentence: Several efficiency-oriented examiner boards and commissions were established during Folk's administration, including many agricultural boards and the Missouri library commission.

name: missouri
sentence: Between the Civil War and the end of World War II, Missouri transitioned from a rural economy to a hybrid industrial-service-agricultural economy as the Midwest rapidly industrialized.

name: missouri
sentence: The expansion of railroads to the West transformed Kansas City into a major transportation hub within the nation.

name: missouri
sentence: The growth of the Texas cattle industry along with this increased rail infrastructure and the invention of the refrigerated boxcar also made Kansas City a major meatpacking center, as large cattle drives from Texas brought herds of cattle to Dodge City and other Kansas towns.

name: missouri
sentence: There, the cattle were loaded onto trains destined for Kansas City, where they were butchered and distributed to the eastern markets.

name: missouri
sentence: The first half of the twentieth century was the height of Kansas City's prominence, and its downtown became a showcase for stylish Art Deco skyscrapers as construction boomed.

name: missouri
sentence: In 1930, there was a diphtheria epidemic in the area around Springfield, which killed approximately 100 people.

name: missouri
sentence: Serum was rushed to the area, and medical personnel stopped the epidemic.

name: missouri
sentence: During the mid-1950s and 1960s, St. Louis and Kansas City suffered deindustrialization and loss of jobs in railroads and manufacturing, as did other Midwestern industrial cities.

name: missouri
sentence: In 1956 St. Charles claims to be the site of the first interstate highway project.

name: missouri
sentence: Such highway construction made it easy for middle-class residents to leave the city for newer housing developed in the suburbs, often former farmland where land was available at lower prices.

name: missouri
sentence: These major cities have gone through decades of readjustment to develop different economies and adjust to demographic changes.

name: missouri
sentence: Suburban areas have developed separate job markets, both in knowledge industries and services, such as major retail malls.

name: missouri
sentence: In 2014, Missouri received national attention for the protests and riots that followed the shooting of Michael Brown by a police officer of Ferguson, which led Governor Jay Nixon to call out the Missouri National Guard.

name: missouri
sentence: A grand jury declined to indict the officer, and the US Department of Justice concluded, after careful investigation, that the police officer legitimately feared for his safety.

name: missouri
sentence: However, in a separate investigation, the Department of Justice also found that the Ferguson Police Department and the City of Ferguson relied on unconstitutional practices in order to balance the city's budget through racially motivated excessive fines and punishments, that the Ferguson police "had used excessive and dangerous force and had disproportionately targeted blacks," and that the municipal court "emphasized revenue over public safety, leading to routine breaches of citizens' constitutional guarantees of due process and equal protection under the law."

name: missouri
sentence: A series of student protests at the University of Missouri against what the protesters viewed as poor response by the administration to racist incidents on campus began in September 2015.

name: missouri
sentence: On June 7, 2017, the National Association for the Advancement of Colored People issued a warning to prospective African-American travelers to Missouri.

name: missouri
sentence: This is the first NAACP warning ever covering an entire state.

name: missouri
sentence: According to a 2018 report by the Missouri Attorney General's office, for the past 18 years, "African Americans, Hispanics and other people of color are disproportionately affected by stops, searches and arrests."

name: missouri
sentence: The same report found that the biggest discrepancy was in 2017, when "black motorists were 85% more likely to be pulled over in traffic stops".

name: missouri
sentence: In 2018 the USDA announced its plans to relocate Economic Research Service (ERS) and National Institute of Food & Agriculture (NIFA) to Kansas City.

name: missouri
sentence: They have since decided on a specific location in downtown Kansas City, MO.

name: missouri
sentence: With the addition of the KC Streetcar project and construction of the Sprint Center Arena, the downtown area in KC has attracted investment in new offices, hotels, and residential complexes.

name: missouri
sentence: Both Kansas City and Saint Louis are undergoing a rebirth in their downtown areas with the addition of the new Power & Light (KC) and Ballpark Village (STL) districts and the renovation of existing historical buildings in each downtown area.

name: missouri
sentence: The 2019 announcement of an MLS expansion team in Saint Louis is driving even more development in the downtown west area of Saint Louis.

name: missouri
sentence: Missouri is landlocked and borders eight different states, a figure equaled only by its neighbor, Tennessee.

name: missouri
sentence: Missouri is bounded by Iowa on the north; by Illinois, Kentucky, and Tennessee across the Mississippi River on the east; on the south by Arkansas; and by Oklahoma, Kansas, and Nebraska (the last across the Missouri River) on the west.

name: missouri
sentence: Whereas the northern and southern boundaries are straight lines, the Missouri Bootheel extends south between the St. Francis and the Mississippi rivers.

name: missouri
sentence: The two largest rivers are the Mississippi (which defines the eastern boundary of the state) and the Missouri River (which flows from west to east through the state), essentially connecting the two largest metros of Kansas City and St. Louis.

name: missouri
sentence: Although today it is usually considered part of the Midwest, Missouri was historically seen by many as a border state, chiefly because of the settlement of migrants from the South and its status as a slave state before the Civil War, balanced by the influence of St. Louis.

name: missouri
sentence: The counties that made up "Little Dixie" were those along the Missouri River in the center of the state, settled by Southern migrants who held the greatest concentration of slaves.

name: missouri
sentence: In 2005, Missouri received 16,695,000 visitors to its national parks and other recreational areas totaling 101,000 acres (410 km2), giving it $7.41 million in annual revenues, 26.6% of its operating expenditures.

name: missouri
sentence: North of, and in some cases just south of, the Missouri River lie the Northern Plains that stretch into Iowa, Nebraska, and Kansas.

name: missouri
sentence: Here, rolling hills remain from the glaciation that once extended from the Canadian Shield to the Missouri River.

name: missouri
sentence: Missouri has many large river bluffs along the Mississippi, Missouri, and Meramec Rivers.

name: missouri
sentence: Southern Missouri rises to the Ozark Mountains, a dissected plateau surrounding the Precambrian igneous St. Francois Mountains.

name: missouri
sentence: This region also hosts karst topography characterized by high limestone content with the formation of sinkholes and caves.

name: missouri
sentence: The southeastern part of the state is known as the Missouri Bootheel region, which is part of the Mississippi Alluvial Plain or Mississippi embayment.

name: missouri
sentence: This region is the lowest, flattest, warmest, and wettest part of the state.

name: missouri
sentence: It is also among the poorest, as the economy there is mostly agricultural.

name: missouri
sentence: It is also the most fertile, with cotton and rice crops predominant.

name: missouri
sentence: The Bootheel was the epicenter of the four New Madrid Earthquakes of 1811 and 1812.

name: missouri
sentence: Missouri generally has a humid continental climate with cool, sometimes cold, winters and hot, humid, and wet summers.

name: missouri
sentence: In the southern part of the state, particularly in the Bootheel, the climate becomes humid subtropical.

name: missouri
sentence: Located in the interior United States, Missouri often experiences extreme temperatures.

name: missouri
sentence: Without high mountains or oceans nearby to moderate temperature, its climate is alternately influenced by air from the cold Arctic and the hot and humid Gulf of Mexico.

name: missouri
sentence: Missouri's highest recorded temperature is 118 °F (48 °C) at Warsaw and Union on July 14, 1954, while the lowest recorded temperature is −40 °F (−40 °C) also at Warsaw on February 13, 1905.

name: missouri
sentence: Located in Tornado Alley, Missouri also receives extreme weather in the form of severe thunderstorms and tornadoes.

name: missouri
sentence: On May 22, 2011, a massive EF-5 tornado, killed 158 people and destroyed roughly one-third of the city of Joplin.

name: missouri
sentence: The tornado caused an estimated $1–3 billion in damages, killed 159 people and injured more than a thousand.

name: missouri
sentence: It was the first EF5 to hit the state since 1957 and the deadliest in the US since 1947, making it the seventh deadliest tornado in American history and 27th deadliest in the world.

name: missouri
sentence: St. Louis and its suburbs also have a history of experiencing particularly severe tornadoes, the most recent memorable one being an EF4 that damaged Lambert-St. Louis International Airport on April 22, 2011.

name: missouri
sentence: One of the worst tornadoes in American history struck St. Louis on May 27, 1896, killing at least 255 and causing $10 million in damage (equivalent to $3.9 billion in 2009 or $4.65 billion in today's dollars).

name: missouri
sentence: Missouri is home to diverse flora and fauna, including several endemic species.

name: missouri
sentence: There is a large amount of fresh water present due to the Mississippi River, Missouri River, Table Rock Lake and Lake of the Ozarks, with numerous smaller tributary rivers, streams, and lakes.

name: missouri
sentence: North of the Missouri River, the state is primarily rolling hills of the Great Plains, whereas south of the Missouri River, the state is dominated by the Oak-Hickory Central US hardwood forest.

name: missouri
sentence: Recreational and commercial uses of public forests, including grazing, logging, and mining, increased after World War II.

name: missouri
sentence: Fishermen, hikers, campers, and others started lobbying to protect forest areas with a "wilderness character."

name: missouri
sentence: During the 1930s and 1940s Aldo Leopold, Arthur Carhart and Bob Marshall developed a "wilderness" policy for the Forest Service.

name: missouri
sentence: Their efforts bore fruit with The Wilderness Act of 1964 which designated wilderness areas "where the earth and its community of life are untrammeled by men, where man himself is a visitor and does not remain."

name: missouri
sentence: This included second growth public forests like the Mark Twain National Forest.

name: missouri
sentence: The United States Census Bureau estimates that the population of Missouri was 6,137,428 on July 1, 2019, a 2.48% increase since the 2010 United States Census.

name: missouri
sentence: Missouri had a population of 5,988,927, according to the 2010 Census; an increase of 137,525 (2.3 percent) since the year 2010.

name: missouri
sentence: From 2010 to 2018, this includes a natural increase of 137,564 people since the last census (480,763 births less 343,199 deaths) and an increase of 88,088 people due to net migration into the state.

name: missouri
sentence: Immigration from outside the United States resulted in a net increase of 50,450 people, and migration within the country produced a net increase of 37,638 people.

name: missouri
sentence: More than half of Missourians (3,294,936 people, or 55.0%) live within the state's two largest metropolitan areas—St.

name: missouri
sentence: Louis and Kansas City.

name: missouri
sentence: The state's population density 86.9 in 2009, is also closer to the national average (86.8 in 2009) than any other state.

name: missouri
sentence: In 2011, the racial composition of the state was:

name: missouri
sentence: In 2011, 3.7% of the total population was of Hispanic or Latino origin (they may be of any race).

name: missouri
sentence: The US Census of 2010 found that the population center of the United States is in Texas County, while the 2000 Census found the mean population center to be in Phelps County.

name: missouri
sentence: The center of population of Missouri is in Osage County, in the city of Westphalia.

name: missouri
sentence: In 2004, the population included 194,000 foreign-born (3.4 percent of the state population).

name: missouri
sentence: The five largest ancestry groups in Missouri are: German (27.4 percent), Irish (14.8 percent), English (10.2 percent), American (8.5 percent) and French (3.7 percent).

name: missouri
sentence: German Americans are an ancestry group present throughout Missouri.

name: missouri
sentence: African Americans are a substantial part of the population in St. Louis (56.6% of African Americans in the state lived in St. Louis or St. Louis County as of the 2010 census), Kansas City, Boone County and in the southeastern Bootheel and some parts of the Missouri River Valley, where plantation agriculture was once important.

name: missouri
sentence: Missouri Creoles of French ancestry are concentrated in the Mississippi River Valley south of St. Louis (see Missouri French).

name: missouri
sentence: Kansas City is home to large and growing immigrant communities from Latin America esp.

name: missouri
sentence: Mexico and Colombia, Africa (i.e.

name: missouri
sentence: Sudan, Somalia and Nigeria), and Southeast Asia including China and the Philippines; and Europe like the former Yugoslavia (see Bosnian American).

name: missouri
sentence: A notable Cherokee Indian population exists in Missouri.

name: missouri
sentence: In 2004, 6.6 percent of the state's population was reported as younger than 5, 25.5 percent younger than 18, and 13.5 percent 65 or older.

name: missouri
sentence: Females were approximately 51.4 percent of the population.

name: missouri
sentence: 81.3 percent of Missouri residents were high school graduates (more than the national average), and 21.6 percent had a bachelor's degree or higher.

name: missouri
sentence: 3.4 percent of Missourians were foreign-born, and 5.1 percent reported speaking a language other than English at home.

name: missouri
sentence: In 2010, there were 2,349,955 households in Missouri, with 2.45 people per household.

name: missouri
sentence: The homeownership rate was 70.0 percent, and the median value of an owner-occupied housing unit was $137,700.

name: missouri
sentence: The median household income for 2010 was $46,262, or $24,724 per capita.

name: missouri
sentence: There was 14.0 percent (1,018,118) of Missourians living below the poverty line in 2010.

name: missouri
sentence: The mean commute time to work was 23.8 minutes.

name: missouri
sentence: In 2011, 28.1% of Missouri's population younger than age 1 were minorities.

name: missouri
sentence: Note: Births in table don't add up, because Hispanics are counted both by their ethnicity and by their race, giving a higher overall number.

name: missouri
sentence: The vast majority of people in Missouri speak English.

name: missouri
sentence: Approximately 5.1% of the population reported speaking a language other than English at home.

name: missouri
sentence: The Spanish language is spoken in small Latino communities in the St. Louis and Kansas City Metro areas.

name: missouri
sentence: Missouri is home to an endangered dialect of the French language known as Missouri French.

name: missouri
sentence: Speakers of the dialect, who call themselves Créoles, are descendants of the French pioneers who settled the area then known as the Illinois Country beginning in the late 17th century.

name: missouri
sentence: It developed in isolation from French speakers in Canada and Louisiana, becoming quite distinct from the varieties of Canadian French and Louisiana Creole French.

name: missouri
sentence: Once widely spoken throughout the area, Missouri French is now nearly extinct, with only a few elderly speakers able to use it.

name: missouri
sentence: According to a Pew Research study conducted in 2014, 80% of Missourians identify with a religion.

name: missouri
sentence: 77% affiliate with Christianity and its various denominations and the other 3% are adherents of non-Christian religions.

name: missouri
sentence: The remaining 20% have no religion, with 2% specifically identifying as atheists and 3% identifying as agnostics (the other 15% do not identify as "anything in particular").

name: missouri
sentence: The religious demographics of Missouri are as follows:

name: missouri
sentence: The largest denominations by number of adherents in 2010 were the Southern Baptist Convention with 749,685; the Roman Catholic Church with 724,315; and the United Methodist Church with 226,409.

name: missouri
sentence: Among the other denominations there are approximately 93,000 Mormons in 253 congregations, 25,000 Jewish adherents in 21 synagogues, 12,000 Muslims in 39 masjids, 7,000 Buddhists in 34 temples, 20,000 Hindus in 17 temples, 2,500 Unitarians in nine congregations, 2,000 of the Baháʼí Faith in 17 temples, five Sikh temples, a Zoroastrian temple, a Jain temple and an uncounted number of neopagans.

name: missouri
sentence: Several religious organizations have headquarters in Missouri, including the Lutheran Church–Missouri Synod, which has its headquarters in Kirkwood, as well as the United Pentecostal Church International in Hazelwood, both outside St. Louis.

name: missouri
sentence: Independence, near Kansas City, is the headquarters for the Community of Christ (formerly the Reorganized Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints), the Church of Christ (Temple Lot) and the group Remnant Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints.

name: missouri
sentence: This area and other parts of Missouri are also of significant religious and historical importance to The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints (LDS Church), which maintains several sites and visitor centers.

name: missouri
sentence: Springfield is the headquarters of the Assemblies of God USA and the Baptist Bible Fellowship International.

name: missouri
sentence: The General Association of General Baptists has its headquarters in Poplar Bluff.

name: missouri
sentence: The Unity Church is headquartered in Unity Village.

name: missouri
sentence: Hindu Temple of St. Louis is the largest Hindu Temple in Missouri, serving more than 14,000 Hindus.

name: missouri
sentence: The US Department of Commerce's Bureau of Economic Analysis estimated Missouri's 2016 gross state product at $299.1 billion, ranking 22nd among US states.

name: missouri
sentence: Per capita personal income in 2006 was $32,705, ranking 26th in the nation.

name: missouri
sentence: Major industries include aerospace, transportation equipment, food processing, chemicals, printing/publishing, electrical equipment, light manufacturing, financial services and beer.

name: missouri
sentence: The agriculture products of the state are beef, soybeans, pork, dairy products, hay, corn, poultry, sorghum, cotton, rice, and eggs.

name: missouri
sentence: Missouri is ranked 6th in the nation for the production of hogs and 7th for cattle.

name: missouri
sentence: Missouri is ranked in the top five states in the nation for production of soy beans, and it is ranked fourth in the nation for the production of rice.

name: missouri
sentence: In 2001, there were 108,000 farms, the second-largest number in any state after Texas.

name: missouri
sentence: Missouri actively promotes its rapidly growing wine industry.

name: missouri
sentence: According to the Missouri Partnership, Missouri's agriculture industry contributes $33 billion in GDP to Missouri's economy, and generates $88 billion in sales and more than 378,000 jobs.

name: missouri
sentence: Missouri has vast quantities of limestone.

name: missouri
sentence: Other resources mined are lead, coal, and crushed stone.

name: missouri
sentence: Missouri produces the most lead of all the states.

name: missouri
sentence: Most of the lead mines are in the central eastern portion of the state.

name: missouri
sentence: Missouri also ranks first or near first in the production of lime, a key ingredient in Portland cement.

name: missouri
sentence: Missouri also has a growing science, agricultural technology, and biotechnology field.

name: missouri
sentence: Monsanto, formerly one of the largest biotech companies in America, was based in St. Louis until it was acquired by Bayer AG in 2018.

name: missouri
sentence: It is now part of the Crop Science Division of Bayer Corporation, Bayer’s US subsidiary.

name: missouri
sentence: Tourism, services, and wholesale/retail trade follow manufacturing in importance—tourism benefits from the many rivers, lakes, caves, parks, etc., throughout the state.

name: missouri
sentence: In addition to a network of state parks, Missouri is home to Gateway Arch National Park in St. Louis and the Ozark National Scenic Riverways.

name: missouri
sentence: A much-visited show cave is Meramec Caverns in Stanton.

name: missouri
sentence: Missouri is the only state in the Union to have two Federal Reserve Banks: one in Kansas City (serving western Missouri, Kansas, Nebraska, Oklahoma, Colorado, northern New Mexico, and Wyoming) and one in St. Louis (serving eastern Missouri, southern Illinois, southern Indiana, western Kentucky, western Tennessee, northern Mississippi, and all of Arkansas).

name: missouri
sentence: The state's seasonally adjusted unemployment rate in April 2017 was 3.9 percent.

name: missouri
sentence: In 2017, Missouri became a right-to-work state, but in August 2018, Missouri voters rejected a right-to-work law with 67% to 33%.

name: missouri
sentence: Personal income is taxed in ten different earning brackets, ranging from 1.5% to 6.0%.

name: missouri
sentence: Missouri's sales tax rate for most items is 4.225%, with some additional local levies.

name: missouri
sentence: More than 2,500 Missouri local governments rely on property taxes levied on real property (real estate) and personal property.

name: missouri
sentence: Most personal property is exempt, except for motorized vehicles.

name: missouri
sentence: Exempt real estate includes property owned by governments and property used as nonprofit cemeteries, exclusively for religious worship, for schools and colleges, and purely charitable purposes.

name: missouri
sentence: There is no inheritance tax and limited Missouri estate tax related to federal estate tax collection.

name: missouri
sentence: In 2017, the Tax Foundation rated Missouri as having the 5th-best corporate tax index, and the 15th-best overall tax climate.

name: missouri
sentence: Missouri's corporate income tax rate is 6.25%; however, 50% of federal income tax payments may be deducted before computing taxable income, leading to an effective rate of 5.2%.

name: missouri
sentence: In 2012, Missouri had roughly 22,000 MW of installed electricity generation capacity.

name: missouri
sentence: In 2011, 82% of Missouri's electricity was generated by coal.

name: missouri
sentence: Ten percent was generated from the state's only nuclear power plant, the Callaway Plant in Callaway County, northeast of Jefferson City.

name: missouri
sentence: Five percent was generated by natural gas.

name: missouri
sentence: One percent was generated by hydroelectric sources, such as the dams for Truman Lake and Lake of the Ozarks.

name: missouri
sentence: Missouri has a small but growing amount of wind and solar power—wind capacity increased from 309 MW in 2009 to 459 MW in 2011, while photovoltaics have increased from 0.2 MW to 1.3 MW over the same period.

name: missouri
sentence: As of 2016, Missouri's solar installations had reached 141 MW.

name: missouri
sentence: Oil wells in Missouri produced 120,000 barrels of crude oil in fiscal 2012.

name: missouri
sentence: There are no oil refineries in Missouri.

name: missouri
sentence: Missouri has two major airport hubs: St. Louis Lambert International Airport and Kansas City International Airport.

name: missouri
sentence: Southern Missouri has the Springfield–Branson National Airport (SGF) with multiple non-stop destinations.

name: missouri
sentence: Residents of Mid-Missouri use Columbia Regional Airport (COU) to fly to Chicago (ORD), Dallas (DFW) or Denver (DEN).

name: missouri
sentence: Two of the nation's three busiest rail centers are in Missouri.

name: missouri
sentence: Kansas City is a major railroad hub for BNSF Railway, Norfolk Southern Railway, Kansas City Southern Railway, and Union Pacific Railroad, and every class 1 railroad serves Missouri.

name: missouri
sentence: Kansas City is the second-largest freight rail center in the US (but is first in the amount of tonnage handled).

name: missouri
sentence: Like Kansas City, St. Louis is a major destination for train freight.

name: missouri
sentence: Springfield remains an operational hub for BNSF Railway.

name: missouri
sentence: Amtrak passenger trains serve Kansas City, La Plata, Jefferson City, St. Louis, Lee's Summit, Independence, Warrensburg, Hermann, Washington, Kirkwood, Sedalia, and Poplar Bluff.

name: missouri
sentence: A proposed high-speed rail route in Missouri as part of the Chicago Hub Network has received $31 million in funding.

name: missouri
sentence: The only urban light rail/subway system operating in Missouri is MetroLink, which connects the city of St. Louis with suburbs in Illinois and St. Louis County.

name: missouri
sentence: It is one of the largest systems (by track mileage) in the United States.

name: missouri
sentence: The KC Streetcar in downtown Kansas City opened in May 2016.

name: missouri
sentence: The Gateway Multimodal Transportation Center in St. Louis is the largest active multi-use transportation center in the state.

name: missouri
sentence: It is in downtown St. Louis, next to the historic Union Station complex.

name: missouri
sentence: It serves as a hub center/station for MetroLink, the MetroBus regional bus system, Greyhound, Amtrak, and taxi services.

name: missouri
sentence: The proposed Missouri Hyperloop would connect St. Louis, Kansas City, and Columbia, reducing travel times to around a half hour.

name: missouri
sentence: Many cities have regular fixed-route systems, and many rural counties have rural public transit services.

name: missouri
sentence: Greyhound and Trailways provide inter-city bus service in Missouri.

name: missouri
sentence: Megabus serves St. Louis, but discontinued service to Columbia and Kansas City in 2015.

name: missouri
sentence: The Mississippi River and Missouri River are commercially navigable over their entire lengths in Missouri.

name: missouri
sentence: The Missouri was channelized through dredging and jetties, and the Mississippi was given a series of locks and dams to avoid rocks and deepen the river.

name: missouri
sentence: St. Louis is a major destination for barge traffic on the Mississippi.

name: missouri
sentence: Following the passage of Amendment 3 in late 2004, the Missouri Department of Transportation (MoDOT) began its Smoother, Safer, Sooner road-building program with a goal of bringing 2,200 miles (3,500 km) of highways up to good condition by December 2007.

name: missouri
sentence: From 2006 to 2011 traffic deaths have decreased annually from 1,257 in 2005, to 1,096 in 2006, to 992 in 2007, to 960 in 2008, to 878 in 2009, to 821 in 2010, to 786 in 2011.

name: missouri
sentence: The current Constitution of Missouri, the fourth constitution for the state, was adopted in 1945.

name: missouri
sentence: It provides for three branches of government: the legislative, judicial, and executive branches.

name: missouri
sentence: The legislative branch consists of two bodies: the House of Representatives and the Senatorte.

name: missouri
sentence: These bodies comprise the Missouri General Assembly.

name: missouri
sentence: The House of Representatives has 163 members apportioned based on the last decennial census.

name: missouri
sentence: The Senatorte consists of 34 members from districts of approximately equal populations.

name: missouri
sentence: The judicial department comprises the Supreme Court of Missouri, which has seven judges, the Missouri Court of Appeals (an intermediate appellate court divided into three districts), sitting in Kansas City, St. Louis, and Springfield, and 45 Circuit Courts which function as local trial courts.

name: missouri
sentence: The executive branch is headed by the Governor of Missouri and includes five other statewide elected offices.

name: missouri
sentence: Following the death of State Auditor Tom Schweich in 2015, only one of Missouri's statewide elected offices is held by a Democrat Nicole Galloway.

name: missouri
sentence: Harry S Truman (1884–1972), the 33rd President of the United States (Democrat, 1945–1953), was born in Lamar.

name: missouri
sentence: He was a judge in Jackson County and then represented the state in the United States Senatorte for ten years, before being elected vice-president in 1944.

name: missouri
sentence: He lived in Independence after retiring as president in 1953.

name: missouri
sentence: Missouri was widely regarded as a bellwether in American politics, often making it a swing state.

name: missouri
sentence: The state had a longer stretch of supporting the winning presidential candidate than any other state, having voted with the nation in every election from 1904 to 2004 with a single exception: 1956 when Democratic candidate Adlai Stevenson of neighboring Illinois lost the election despite carrying Missouri.

name: missouri
sentence: However, in recent years, areas of the state outside Kansas City, St. Louis, and Columbia have shifted heavily to the right, and so the state is no longer considered a bellwether by most analysts.

name: missouri
sentence: Missouri twice voted against Democrat Barack Obama, who won in 2008 and 2012.

name: missouri
sentence: Missouri voted for Romney by nearly 10% in 2012 and voted for Trump by almost 18% in 2016.

name: missouri
sentence: On October 24, 2012, there were 4,190,936 registered voters.

name: missouri
sentence: At the state level, both Democratic Senatortor Claire McCaskill and Democratic Governor Jay Nixon were re-elected.

name: missouri
sentence: On November 8, 2016, there were 4,223,787 registered voters, with 2,811,549 voting (66.6%).

name: missouri
sentence: Missouri has been known for its population's generally "stalwart, conservative, noncredulous" attitude toward regulatory regimes, which is one of the origins of the state's unofficial nickname, the "Show-Me State".

name: missouri
sentence: As a result, and combined with the fact that Missouri is one of America's leading alcohol states, regulation of alcohol and tobacco in Missouri is among the most laissez-faire in America.

name: missouri
sentence: For 2013, the annual "Freedom in the 50 States" study prepared by the Mercatus Center at George Mason University ranked Missouri as #3 in America for alcohol freedom and #1 for tobacco freedom (#7 for freedom overall).

name: missouri
sentence: The study notes that Missouri's "alcohol regime is one of the least restrictive in the United States, with no blue laws and taxes well below average", and that "Missouri ranks best in the nation on tobacco freedom".

name: missouri
sentence: Missouri law makes it "an improper employment practice" for an employer to refuse to hire, to fire, or otherwise to disadvantage any person because that person lawfully uses alcohol and/or tobacco products when he or she is not at work.

name: missouri
sentence: With a large German immigrant population and the development of a brewing industry, Missouri always has had among the most permissive alcohol laws in the United States.

name: missouri
sentence: It was never enacted statewide prohibition.

name: missouri
sentence: Missouri voters rejected prohibition in three separate referenda in 1910, 1912, and 1918.

name: missouri
sentence: Alcohol regulation did not begin in Missouri until 1934.

name: missouri
sentence: Today, alcohol laws are controlled by the state government, and local jurisdictions are prohibited from going beyond those state laws.

name: missouri
sentence: Missouri has no statewide open container law or prohibition on drinking in public, no alcohol-related blue laws, no local option, no precise locations for selling liquor by the package (allowing even drug stores and gas stations to sell any kind of liquor), and no differentiation of laws based on alcohol percentage.

name: missouri
sentence: State law protects persons from arrest or criminal penalty for public intoxication.

name: missouri
sentence: Missouri law expressly prohibits any jurisdiction from going dry.

name: missouri
sentence: Missouri law also expressly allows parents and guardians to serve alcohol to their children.

name: missouri
sentence: The Power & Light District in Kansas City is one of the few places in the United States where a state law explicitly allows persons over 21 to possess and consume open containers of alcohol in the street (as long as the beverage is in a plastic cup).

name: missouri
sentence: As for tobacco (as of July 2016), Missouri has the lowest cigarette excise taxes in the United States, at 17 cents per pack, and the state electorate voted in 2002, 2006, 2012, and twice in 2016 to keep it that way.

name: missouri
sentence: In 2007, Forbes named Missouri's largest metropolitan area, St. Louis, America's "best city for smokers".

name: missouri
sentence: According to the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention, in 2008 Missouri had the fourth highest percentage of adult smokers among USstates, at 24.5%.

name: missouri
sentence: Although Missouri's minimum age for purchase and distribution of tobacco products is 18, tobacco products can be distributed to persons under 18 by family members on private property.

name: missouri
sentence: No statewide smoking ban ever has been seriously entertained before the Missouri General Assembly, and in October 2008, a statewide survey by the Missouri Department of Health and Senatoror Services found that only 27.5% of Missourians support a statewide ban on smoking in all bars and restaurants.

name: missouri
sentence: Missouri state law permits restaurants seating less than 50 people, bars, bowling alleys, and billiard parlors to decide their own smoking policies, without limitation.

name: missouri
sentence: In 2014, a Republican-led legislature and Democratic governor Jay Nixon enacted a series of laws to partially decriminalize possession of cannabis by making first-time possession of up to 10 grams no longer punishable with jail time and legalizing CBD oil.

name: missouri
sentence: In November 2018, 66% of voters approved a constitutional amendment that established a right to medical marijuana and a system for licensing, regulating, and taxing medical marijuana.

name: missouri
sentence: Missouri has 114 counties and one independent city, St. Louis, which is Missouri's most densely populated—5,140 people per square mile.

name: missouri
sentence: The largest counties by population are St. Louis (996,726), Jackson (698,895), and St. Charles (395,504).

name: missouri
sentence: Worth County is the smallest (2,057).

name: missouri
sentence: The largest counties by size are Texas (1,179 square miles) and Shannon (1,004).

name: missouri
sentence: Worth County is the smallest (266).

name: missouri
sentence: Jefferson City is the capital city of Missouri, while the state's five largest cities are Kansas City, St. Louis, Springfield, Columbia, and Independence.

name: missouri
sentence: St. Louis is the principal city of the largest metropolitan area in Missouri, composed of 17 counties and the independent city of St. Louis; eight of its counties are in Illinois.

name: missouri
sentence: As of 2019, St. Louis was the 21st-largest metropolitan area in the nation with 2.91 million people.

name: missouri
sentence: However, if ranked using Combined Statistical Area, it is 20th-largest with 2.91 million people in 2019.

name: missouri
sentence: Some of the major cities making up the St. Louis metro area in Missouri are O'Fallon, St. Charles, St. Peters, Florissant, Chesterfield, Wentzville, Wildwood, University City, and Ballwin.

name: missouri
sentence: Kansas City is Missouri's largest city and the principal city of the fourteen-county Kansas City Metropolitan Statistical Area, including five counties in the state of Kansas.

name: missouri
sentence: As of 2019, it was the 31st-largest metropolitan area in the US, with 2.16 million people.

name: missouri
sentence: In the Combined Statistical Area in 2019, it ranked 27th with 2.51 million.

name: missouri
sentence: Some of the other major cities comprising the Kansas City metro area in Missouri include Independence, Lee's Summit, Blue Springs, Liberty, Raytown, Gladstone, and Grandview.

name: missouri
sentence: Springfield is Missouri's third-largest city and the principal city of the Springfield-Branson Metropolitan Area, which has a population of 549,423 and includes seven counties in southwestern Missouri.

name: missouri
sentence: Branson is a major tourist attraction in the Ozarks in southwest Missouri.

name: missouri
sentence: Some of the other major cities comprising the Springfield-Branson metro area include Nixa, Ozark, and Republic.

name: missouri
sentence: The Missouri State Board of Education has general authority over all public education in the state of Missouri.

name: missouri
sentence: It is made up of eight citizens appointed by the governor and confirmed by the Missouri Senatorte.

name: missouri
sentence: Education is compulsory from ages seven to seventeen.

name: missouri
sentence: It is required that any parent, guardian, or another person with custody of a child between the ages of seven and seventeen, the compulsory attendance age for the district, must ensure the child is enrolled in and regularly attends public, private, parochial school, home school or a combination of schools for the full term of the school year.

name: missouri
sentence: Compulsory attendance also ends when children complete sixteen credits in high school.

name: missouri
sentence: Children in Missouri between the ages of five and seven are not required to be enrolled in school.

name: missouri
sentence: However, if they are enrolled in a public school, their parent, guardian, or custodian must ensure they regularly attend.

name: missouri
sentence: Missouri schools are commonly but not exclusively divided into three tiers of primary and secondary education: elementary school, middle school or junior high school and high school.

name: missouri
sentence: The public school system includes kindergarten to 12th grade.

name: missouri
sentence: District territories are often complex in structure.

name: missouri
sentence: In some cases, elementary, middle, and junior high schools of a single district feed into high schools in another district.

name: missouri
sentence: High school athletics and competitions are governed by the Missouri State High School Activities Association (MSHSAA).

name: missouri
sentence: Homeschooling is legal in Missouri and is an option to meet the compulsory education requirement.

name: missouri
sentence: It is neither monitored nor regulated by the state's Department of Elementary and Secondary Education

name: missouri
sentence: Another gifted school is the Missouri Academy of Science, Mathematics and Computing, which is at the Northwest Missouri State University.

name: missouri
sentence: The University of Missouri System is Missouri's statewide public university system.

name: missouri
sentence: The flagship institution and largest university in the state is the University of Missouri in Columbia.

name: missouri
sentence: The others in the system are University of Missouri–Kansas City, University of Missouri–St.

name: missouri
sentence: Louis, and Missouri University of Science and Technology in Rolla.

name: missouri
sentence: During the late nineteenth and early twentieth century, the state established a series of normal schools in each region of the state, originally named after the geographic districts: Northeast Missouri State University (now Truman State University) (1867), Central Missouri State University (now the University of Central Missouri) (1871), Southeast Missouri State University (1873), Southwest Missouri State University (now Missouri State University) (1905), Northwest Missouri State University (1905), Missouri Western State University (1915), Maryville University (1872) and Missouri Southern State University (1937).

name: missouri
sentence: Lincoln University and Harris–Stowe State University were established in the mid-nineteenth century and are historically black colleges and universities.

name: missouri
sentence: Among private institutions Washington University in St. Louis and Saint Louis University are two top ranked schools in the US.

name: missouri
sentence: There are numerous junior colleges, trade schools, church universities and other private universities in the state.

name: missouri
sentence: A.T.

name: missouri
sentence: Still University was the first osteopathic medical school in the world.

name: missouri
sentence: Hannibal–LaGrange University in Hannibal, Missouri, was one of the first colleges west of the Mississippi (founded 1858 in LaGrange, Missouri, and moved to Hannibal in 1928).

name: missouri
sentence: The state funds a $2000, renewable merit-based scholarship, Bright Flight, given to the top three percent of Missouri high school graduates who attend a university in-state.

name: missouri
sentence: The 19th-century border wars between Missouri and Kansas have continued as a sports rivalry between the University of Missouri and University of Kansas.

name: missouri
sentence: The rivalry was chiefly expressed through football and basketball games between the two universities, but since Missouri left the Big 12 Conference in 2012, the teams no longer regularly play one another.

name: missouri
sentence: It was the oldest college rivalry west of the Mississippi River and the second-oldest in the nation.

name: missouri
sentence: Each year when the universities met to play, the game was coined the "Border War."

name: missouri
sentence: Following the game, an exchange occurred where the winner took a historic Indian War Drum, which had been passed back and forth for decades.

name: missouri
sentence: Though Missouri and Kansas no longer have an annual game after the University of Missouri moved to the Southeastern Conference, tension still exists between them.

name: missouri
sentence: Many well-known musicians were born or have lived in Missouri.

name: missouri
sentence: These include guitarist and rock pioneer Chuck Berry, singer and actress Josephine Baker, "Queen of Rock" Tina Turner, pop singer-songwriter Sheryl Crow, Michael McDonald of the Doobie Brothers, and rappers Nelly, Chingy and Akon, all of whom are either current or former residents of St. Louis.

name: missouri
sentence: Country singers from Missouri include Perryville native Chris Janson, New Franklin native Sara Evans, Cantwell native Ferlin Husky, West Plains native Porter Wagoner, Tyler Farr of Garden City, and Mora native Leroy Van Dyke, along with bluegrass musician Rhonda Vincent, a native of Greentop.

sentence: Rapper Eminem was born in St. Joseph and also lived in Savannah and Kansas City.

sentence: Rock and Roll singer Steve Walsh of the group Kansas was born in St. Louis and grew up in St. Joseph.

sentence: The Kansas City Symphony and the St. Louis Symphony Orchestra are the state's major orchestras.

name: missouri
sentence: The latter is the nation's second-oldest symphony orchestra and achieved prominence in recent years under conductor Leonard Slatkin.

sentence: Several film versions of Mark Twain's novels The Adventures of Tom Sawyer and The Adventures of Huckleberry Finn have been made.

sentence: Gone Girl, a 2014 film starring Ben Affleck, Rosamund Pike, Neil Patrick Harris, and Tyler Perry, was filmed in Cape Girardeau.
