sentence: Archived from the original on April 6, 2016.

name: montana
sentence: Montana is a relative hub of beer microbrewing, ranking third in the nation in number of craft breweries per capita in 2011.

name: montana
sentence: Significant industries exist for lumber and mineral extraction; the state's resources include gold, coal, silver, talc, and vermiculite.

name: montana
sentence: Ecotaxes on resource extraction are numerous.

name: montana
sentence: A 1974 state severance tax on coal (which varied from 20 to 30%) was upheld by the Supreme Court of the United States in Commonwealth Edison Co. v. Montana, 453 US 609 (1981).

name: montana
sentence: Tourism is also important to the economy, with more than ten million visitors a year to Glacier National Park, Flathead Lake, the Missouri River headwaters, the site of the Battle of Little Bighorn, and three of the five entrances to Yellowstone National Park.

name: montana
sentence: Montana's personal income tax contains seven brackets, with rates ranging from 1.0 to 6.9 percent.

name: montana
sentence: Montana has no sales tax*, and household goods are exempt from property taxes.

name: montana
sentence: However, property taxes are assessed on livestock, farm machinery, heavy equipment, automobiles, trucks, and business equipment.

name: montana
sentence: The amount of property tax owed is not determined solely by the property's value.

name: montana
sentence: The property's value is multiplied by a tax rate, set by the Montana Legislature, to determine its taxable value.

name: montana
sentence: The taxable value is then multiplied by the mill levy established by various taxing jurisdictions—city and county government, school districts, and others.

name: montana
sentence: *In the 1980s the absence of a sales tax became economically deleterious to communities bound to the state's tourism industry, as the revenue from income and property taxes provided by residents was grossly insignificant in regards to paying for the impact of non-residential travel—especially road repair.

name: montana
sentence: In 1985, the Montana Legislature passed a law allowing towns with fewer than 5,500 residents and unincorporated communities with fewer than 2,500 to levy a resort tax if more than half the community's income came from tourism.

name: montana
sentence: The resort tax is a sales tax that applies to hotels, motels and other lodging and camping facilities; restaurants, fast-food stores, and other food service establishments; taverns, bars, night clubs, lounges, or other public establishments that serve alcohol; as well as destination ski resorts or other destination recreational facilities.

name: montana
sentence: It also applies to "luxuries"- defined by law as any item item normally sold to the public or to transient visitors or tourists that does not include food purchased unprepared or unserved, medicine, medical supplies and services, appliances, hardware supplies and tools, or any necessities of life.

name: montana
sentence: Approximately 12.2 million non-residents visited Montana in 2018, and the population was estimated to be 1.06 million.

name: montana
sentence: This extremely disproportionate ratio of residents paying taxes vs. non-residents using state funded services and infrastructure makes Montana's resort tax crucial in order to safely maintain heavily used roads and highways, as well as protect and preserve state parks.

name: montana
sentence: As of September 2020, the state's unemployment rate is 5.3%.

name: montana
sentence: The Montana Territory was formed on April 26, 1864, when the US passed the Organic Act.

name: montana
sentence: Schools started forming in the area before it was officially a territory as families started settling into the area.

name: montana
sentence: The first schools were subscription schools that typically met in the teacher's home.

name: montana
sentence: The first formal school on record was at Fort Owen in Bitterroot valley in 1862.

name: montana
sentence: The students were Indian children and the children of Fort Owen employees.

name: montana
sentence: The first school term started in early winter and lasted only until February 28.

name: montana
sentence: Classes were taught by Mr. Robinson.

name: montana
sentence: Another early subscription school was started by Thomas Dimsdale in Virginia City in 1863.

name: montana
sentence: In this school students were charged $1.75 per week.

name: montana
sentence: The Montana Territorial Legislative Assembly had its inaugural meeting in 1864.

name: montana
sentence: The first legislature authorized counties to levy taxes for schools, which set the foundations for public schooling.

name: montana
sentence: Madison County was the first to take advantage of the newly authorized taxes and it formed fhe first public school in Virginia City in 1886.

name: montana
sentence: The first school year was scheduled to begin in January 1866, but severe weather postponed its opening until March.

name: montana
sentence: The first school year ran through the summer and did not end until August 17.

name: montana
sentence: One of the first teachers at the school was Sarah Raymond.

name: montana
sentence: She was a 25-year-old woman who had traveled to Virginia City via wagon train in 1865.

name: montana
sentence: To become a certified teacher, Raymond took a test in her home and paid a $6 fee in gold dust to obtain a teaching certificate.

name: montana
sentence: With the help of an assistant teacher, Mrs. Farley, Raymond was responsible for teaching 50 to 60 students each day out of the 81 students enrolled at the school.

name: montana
sentence: Sarah Raymond was paid $125 per month, and Mrs. Farley was paid $75 per month.

name: montana
sentence: No textbooks were used in the school.

name: montana
sentence: In their place was an assortment of books brought by various emigrants.

name: montana
sentence: Sarah quit teaching the following year, but she later become the Madison County superintendent of schools.

name: montana
sentence: Many well-known artists, photographers and authors have documented the land, culture and people of Montana in the last 130 years.

name: montana
sentence: Painter and sculptor Charles Marion Russell, known as "the cowboy artist", created more than 2,000 paintings of cowboys, Native Americans, and landscapes set in the Western United States and in Alberta, Canada.

name: montana
sentence: The C. M. Russell Museum Complex in Great Falls, Montana, houses more than 2,000 Russell artworks, personal objects, and artifacts.

name: montana
sentence: Pioneering feminist author, film-maker, and media personality Mary MacLane attained international fame in 1902 with her memoir of three months in her life in Butte, The Story of Mary MacLane.

name: montana
sentence: She referred to Butte throughout the rest of her career and remains a controversial figure there for her mixture of criticism and love for Butte and its people.

name: montana
sentence: Evelyn Cameron, a naturalist and photographer from Terry documented early 20th century life on the Montana prairie, taking startlingly clear pictures of everything around her: cowboys, sheepherders, weddings, river crossings, freight wagons, people working, badlands, eagles, coyotes and wolves.

name: montana
sentence: Many notable Montana authors have documented or been inspired by life in Montana in both fiction and non-fiction works.

name: montana
sentence: Pulitzer Prize winner Wallace Earle Stegner from Great Falls was often called "The Dean of Western Writers".

name: montana
sentence: James Willard Schultz ("Apikuni") from Browning is most noted for his prolific stories about Blackfeet life and his contributions to the naming of prominent features in Glacier National Park.

name: montana
sentence: Montana hosts numerous arts and cultural festivals and events every year.

name: montana
sentence: Major events include:

name: montana
sentence: There are no major league sports franchises in Montana due to the state's relatively small and dispersed population, but a number of minor league teams play in the state.

name: montana
sentence: Baseball is the minor-league sport with the longest heritage in the state, and Montana is home to three Minor League Baseball teams, all members of the Pioneer League: the Billings Mustangs, Great Falls Voyagers, and Missoula Osprey.

name: montana
sentence: All of Montana's four-year colleges and universities field intercollegiate sports teams.

name: montana
sentence: The two largest schools, the University of Montana and Montana State University, are members of the Big Sky Conference and have enjoyed a strong athletic rivalry since the early twentieth century.

name: montana
sentence: Six of Montana's smaller four-year schools are members of the Frontier Conference.

name: montana
sentence: One is a member of the Great Northwest Athletic Conference.

name: montana
sentence: A variety of sports are offered at Montana high schools.

name: montana
sentence: Montana allows the smallest—"Class C"—high schools to utilize six-man football teams, dramatized in the independent 2002 film The Slaughter Rule.

name: montana
sentence: There are junior ice hockey teams in Montana, four of which are affiliated with the North American 3 Hockey League: the Bozeman Icedogs, Great Falls Americans, Helena Bighorns, and Missoula Jr. Bruins.

name: montana
sentence: Montanans have been a part of several major sporting achievements:

name: montana
sentence: Montana provides year-round outdoor recreation opportunities for residents and visitors.

name: montana
sentence: Hiking, fishing, hunting, watercraft recreation, camping, golf, cycling, horseback riding, and skiing are popular activities.

name: montana
sentence: Montana has been a destination for its world-class trout fisheries since the 1930s.

name: montana
sentence: Fly fishing for several species of native and introduced trout in rivers and lakes is popular for both residents and tourists throughout the state.

name: montana
sentence: Montana is the home of the Federation of Fly Fishers and hosts many of the organizations annual conclaves.

name: montana
sentence: The state has robust recreational lake trout and kokanee salmon fisheries in the west, walleye can be found in many parts of the state, while northern pike, smallmouth and largemouth bass fisheries as well as catfish and paddlefish can be found in the waters of eastern Montana.

name: montana
sentence: Robert Redford's 1992 film of Norman Mclean's novel, A River Runs Through It, was filmed in Montana and brought national attention to fly fishing and the state.

name: montana
sentence: Montana is home to the Rocky Mountain Elk Foundation and has a historic big game hunting tradition.

name: montana
sentence: There are fall bow and general hunting seasons for elk, pronghorn antelope, whitetail deer and mule deer.

name: montana
sentence: A random draw grants a limited number of permits for moose, mountain goats and bighorn sheep.

name: montana
sentence: There is a spring hunting season for black bear and in most years, limited hunting of bison that leave Yellowstone National Park is allowed.

name: montana
sentence: Current law allows both hunters and trappers specified numbers ("limits") of wolves and mountain lions.

name: montana
sentence: Trapping of assorted fur-bearing animals is allowed in certain seasons and many opportunities exist for migratory waterfowl and upland bird hunting.

name: montana
sentence: Both downhill skiing and cross-country skiing are popular in Montana, which has 15 developed downhill ski areas open to the public, including:

name: montana
sentence: Big Sky Resort and Whitefish Mountain Resort are destination resorts, while the remaining areas do not have overnight lodging at the ski area, though several host restaurants and other amenities.

name: montana
sentence: Montana also has millions of acres open to cross-country skiing on nine of its national forests and in Glacier National Park.

name: montana
sentence: In addition to cross-country trails at most of the downhill ski areas, there are also 13 private cross-country skiing resorts.

name: montana
sentence: Yellowstone National Park also allows cross-country skiing.

name: montana
sentence: Snowmobiling is popular in Montana, which boasts over 4,000 miles of trails and frozen lakes available in winter.

name: montana
sentence: There are 24 areas where snowmobile trails are maintained, most also offering ungroomed trails.

name: montana
sentence: West Yellowstone offers a large selection of trails and is the primary starting point for snowmobile trips into Yellowstone National Park, where "oversnow" vehicle use is strictly limited, usually to guided tours, and regulations are in considerable flux.

name: montana
sentence: Snow coach tours are offered at Big Sky, Whitefish, West Yellowstone and into Yellowstone National Park.

name: montana
sentence: Equestrian skijoring has a niche in Montana, which hosts the World Skijoring Championships in Whitefish as part of the annual Whitefish Winter Carnival.

name: montana
sentence: Montana does not have a Trauma I hospital, but does have Trauma II hospitals in Missoula, Billings, and Great Falls.

name: montana
sentence: In 2013, AARP The Magazine named the Billings Clinic one of the safest hospitals in the United States.

name: montana
sentence: Montana is ranked as the least obese state in the US, at 19.6%, according to the 2014 Gallup Poll.

name: montana
sentence: Montana has the highest suicide rate of any state in the US as of 2017.

name: montana
sentence: As of 2010, Missoula is the 166th largest media market in the United States as ranked by Nielsen Media Research, while Billings is 170th, Great Falls is 190th, the Butte-Bozeman area 191st, and Helena is 206th.

name: montana
sentence: There are 25 television stations in Montana, representing each major US network.

name: montana
sentence: As of August 2013, there are 527 FCC-licensed FM radio stations broadcast in Montana, with 114 such AM stations.

name: montana
sentence: During the age of the Copper Kings, each Montana copper company had its own newspaper.

name: montana
sentence: This changed in 1959 when Lee Enterprises bought several Montana newspapers.

name: montana
sentence: Montana's largest circulating daily city newspapers are the Billings Gazette (circulation 39,405), Great Falls Tribune (26,733), and Missoulian (25,439).

name: montana
sentence: Railroads have been an important method of transportation in Montana since the 1880s.

name: montana
sentence: Historically, the state was traversed by the main lines of three east–west transcontinental routes: the Milwaukee Road, the Great Northern, and the Northern Pacific.

name: montana
sentence: Today, the BNSF Railway is the state's largest railroad, its main transcontinental route incorporating the former Great Northern main line across the state.

name: montana
sentence: Montana RailLink, a privately held Class II railroad, operates former Northern Pacific trackage in western Montana.

name: montana
sentence: In addition, Amtrak's Empire Builder train runs through the north of the state, stopping in Libby, Whitefish, West Glacier, Essex, East Glacier Park, Browning, Cut Bank, Shelby, Havre, Malta, Glasgow, and Wolf Point.

name: montana
sentence: Bozeman Yellowstone International Airport is the busiest airport in the state of Montana, surpassing Billings Logan International Airport in the spring of 2013.

name: montana
sentence: Montana's other major airports include Missoula International Airport, Great Falls International Airport, Glacier Park International Airport, Helena Regional Airport, Bert Mooney Airport and Yellowstone Airport.

name: montana
sentence: Eight smaller communities have airports designated for commercial service under the Essential Air Service program.

name: montana
sentence: Historically, US Route 10 was the primary east–west highway route across Montana, connecting the major cities in the southern half of the state.

name: montana
sentence: Still the state's most important east–west travel corridor, the route is today served by Interstate 90 and Interstate 94 which roughly follow the same route as the Northern Pacific.

name: montana
sentence: US

name: montana
sentence: Routes 2 and 12 and Montana Highway 200 also traverse the entire state from east to west.

name: montana
sentence: Montana's only north–south Interstate Highway is Interstate 15.

name: montana
sentence: Other major north–south highways include US

name: montana
sentence: Routes 87, 89, 93 and 191.

name: montana
sentence: Montana and South Dakota are the only states to share a land border which is not traversed by a paved road.

name: montana
sentence: Highway 212, the primary paved route between the two, passes through the northeast corner of Wyoming between Montana and South Dakota.

name: montana
sentence: Montana is governed by a constitution.

name: montana
sentence: The first constitution was drafted by a constitutional convention in 1889, in preparation for statehood.

name: montana
sentence: Ninety percent of its language came from an 1884 constitution which was never acted upon by Congress for national political reasons.

name: montana
sentence: The 1889 constitution mimicked the structure of the United States Constitution, as well as outlining almost the same civil and political rights for citizens.

name: montana
sentence: However, the 1889 Montana constitution significantly restricted the power of state government, the legislature was much more powerful than the executive branch, and the jurisdiction of the District Courts very specifically described.

name: montana
sentence: Montana voters amended the 1889 constitution 37 times between 1889 and 1972.

name: montana
sentence: In 1914, Montana granted women the vote.

name: montana
sentence: In 1916, Montana became the first state to elect a woman, Progressive Republican Jeannette Rankin, to Congress.

name: montana
sentence: In 1971, Montana voters approved the call for a state constitutional convention.

name: montana
sentence: A new constitution was drafted, which made the legislative and executive branches much more equal in power and which was much less prescriptive in outlining powers, duties, and jurisdictions.

name: montana
sentence: The draft included an expanded, more progressive list of civil and political rights, extended these rights to children for the first time, transferred administration of property taxes to the counties from the state, implemented new water rights, eliminated sovereign immunity, and gave the legislature greater power to spend tax revenues.

name: montana
sentence: The constitution was narrowly approved, 116,415 to 113,883, and declared ratified on June 20, 1972.

name: montana
sentence: Three issues which the constitutional convention were unable to resolve were submitted to voters simultaneously with the proposed constitution.

name: montana
sentence: Voters approved the legalization of gambling, a bicameral legislature, and retention of the death penalty.

name: montana
sentence: The 1972 constitution has been amended 31 times as of 2015.

name: montana
sentence: Major amendments include establishment of a reclamation trust (funded by taxes on natural resource extraction) to restore mined land (1974); restoration of sovereign immunity, when such immunity has been approved by a two-thirds vote in each house (1974); establishment of a 90-day biennial (rather than annual) legislative session (1974); establishment of a coal tax trust fund, funded by a tax on coal extraction (1976); conversion of the mandatory decennial review of county government into a voluntary one, to be approved or disallowed by residents in each county (1978); conversion of the provision of public assistance from a mandatory civil right to a non-fundamental legislative prerogative (1988); a new constitutional right to hunt and fish (2004); a prohibition on gay marriage (2004); and a prohibition on new taxes on the sale or transfer of real property (2010).

name: montana
sentence: In 1992, voters approved a constitutional amendment implementing term limits for certain statewide elected executive branch offices (governor, lieutenant governor, secretary of state, state auditor, attorney general, superintendent of public instruction) and for members of the Montana Legislature.

name: montana
sentence: Extensive new constitutional rights for victims of crime were approved in 2016.

name: montana
sentence: The 1972 constitution requires that voters determine every 20 years whether to hold a new constitutional convention.

name: montana
sentence: Voters turned down a new convention in 1990 (84 percent no) and again in 2010 (58.6 percent no).

name: montana
sentence: Montana has three branches of state government: legislative, executive, and judicial.

name: montana
sentence: The executive branch is headed by an elected governor.

name: montana
sentence: The governor is Greg Gianforte, a Republican elected in 2020.

name: montana
sentence: There are also nine other statewide elected offices in the executive branch: Lieutenant Governor, Attorney General, Secretary of State, State Auditor (who also serves as Commissioner of Securities and Insurance), and Superintendent of Public Instruction.

name: montana
sentence: There are five public service commissioners, who are elected on a regional basis.

name: montana
sentence: (The Public Service Commission's jurisdiction is statewide.)

name: montana
sentence: There are 18 departments and offices which make up the executive branch: Administration; Agriculture; Auditor (securities and insurance); Commerce; Corrections; Environmental Quality; Fish, Wildlife & Parks; Justice; Labor and Industry; Livestock; Military Affairs; Natural Resources and Conservation; Public Health and Human Services; Revenue; State; and Transportation.

name: montana
sentence: Elementary and secondary education are overseen by the Office of Public Instruction (led by the elected superintendent of public instruction), in cooperation with the governor-appointed Board of Public Education.

name: montana
sentence: Higher education is overseen by a governor-appointed Board of Regents, which in turn appoints a commissioner of higher education.

name: montana
sentence: The Office of the Commissioner of Higher Education acts in an executive capacity on behalf of the regents, and oversees the state-run Montana University System.

name: montana
sentence: Independent state agencies not within a department or office include the Montana Arts Council, Montana Board of Crime Control, Montana Historical Society, Montana Public Employees Retirement Administration, Commissioner of Political Practices, the Montana Lottery, Office of the State Public Defender, Public Service Commission, the Montana School for the Deaf and Blind, the Montana State Fund (which operates the state's unemployment insurance, worker compensation, and self-insurance operations), the Montana State Library, and the Montana Teachers Retirement System.

name: montana
sentence: Montana is an alcoholic beverage control state.

name: montana
sentence: It is an equitable distribution and no-fault divorce state.

name: montana
sentence: It is one of five states to have no sales tax.

name: montana
sentence: The Montana Legislature is bicameral, and consists of the 50-member Montana Senatorte and the 100-member Montana House of Representatives.

name: montana
sentence: The legislature meets in the Montana State Capitol in Helena in odd-numbered years for 90 days, beginning the first weekday of the year.

name: montana
sentence: The deadline for a legislator to introduce a general bill is the 40th legislative day.

name: montana
sentence: The deadline for a legislator to introduce an appropriations, revenue, or referenda bill is the 62nd legislative day.

name: montana
sentence: Senatortors serve four-year terms, while Representatives serve two-year terms.

name: montana
sentence: All members are limited to serving no more than eight years in a single 16-year period.

name: montana
sentence: The Courts of Montana are established by the Constitution of Montana.

name: montana
sentence: The constitution requires the establishment of a Montana Supreme Court and Montana District Courts, and permits the legislature to establish Justice Courts, City Courts, Municipal Courts, and other inferior courts such as the legislature sees fit to establish.

name: montana
sentence: The Montana Supreme Court is the court of last resort in the Montana court system.

name: montana
sentence: The constitution of 1889 provided for the election of no fewer than three Supreme Court justices, and one chief justice.

name: montana
sentence: Each court member served a six-year term.

name: montana
sentence: The legislature increased the number of justices to five in 1919.

name: montana
sentence: The 1972 constitution lengthened the term of office to eight years, and established the minimum number of justices at five.

name: montana
sentence: It allowed the legislature to increase the number of justices by two, which the legislature did in 1979.

name: montana
sentence: The Montana Supreme Court has the authority to declare acts of the legislature and executive unconstitutional under either the Montana or US constitutions.

name: montana
sentence: Its decisions may be appealed directly to the US Supreme Court.

name: montana
sentence: The clerk of the Supreme Court is also an elected position, and serves a six-year term.

name: montana
sentence: Neither justices nor the clerk are term limited.

name: montana
sentence: Montana District Courts are the courts of general jurisdiction in Montana.

name: montana
sentence: There are no intermediate appellate courts.

name: montana
sentence: District Courts have jurisdiction primarily over most civil cases, cases involving a monetary claim against the state, felony criminal cases, probate, and cases at law and in equity.

name: montana
sentence: When so authorized by the legislature, actions of executive branch agencies may be appealed directly to a District Court.

name: montana
sentence: The District Courts also have de novo appellate jurisdiction from inferior courts (city courts, justice courts, and municipal courts), and oversee naturalization proceedings.

name: montana
sentence: District Court judges are elected, and serve six-year terms.

name: montana
sentence: They are not term limited.

name: montana
sentence: There are 22 judicial districts in Montana, served by 56 District Courts and 46 District Court judges.

name: montana
sentence: The District Courts suffer from excessive workload, and the legislature has struggled to find a solution to the problem.

name: montana
sentence: Montana Youth Courts were established by the Montana Youth Court Act of 1974.

name: montana
sentence: They are overseen by District Court judges.

name: montana
sentence: They consist of a chief probation officer, one or more juvenile probation officers, and support staff.

name: montana
sentence: Youth Courts have jurisdiction over misdemeanor and felony acts committed by those charged as a juvenile under the law.

name: montana
sentence: There is a Youth Court in every judicial district, and decisions of the Youth Court are appealable directly to the Montana Supreme Court.

name: montana
sentence: The Montana Worker's Compensation Court was established by the Montana Workers' Compensation Act in 1975.

name: montana
sentence: There is a single Workers' Compensation Court.

name: montana
sentence: It has a single judge, appointed by the governor.

name: montana
sentence: The Worker's Compensation Court has statewide jurisdiction and holds trials in Billings, Great Falls, Helena, Kalispell, and Missoula.

name: montana
sentence: The court hears cases arising under the Montana Workers' Compensation Act, and is the court of original jurisdiction for reviews of orders and regulations issued by the Montana Department of Labor and Industry.

name: montana
sentence: Decisions of the court are appealable directly to the Montana Supreme Court.

name: montana
sentence: The Montana Water Court was established by the Montana Water Court Act of 1979.

name: montana
sentence: The Water Court consists of a chief water judge and four district water judges (Lower Missouri River Basin, Upper Missouri River Basin, Yellowstone River Basin, and Clark Fork River Basin).

name: montana
sentence: The court employs 12 permanent special masters.

name: montana
sentence: The Montana Judicial Nomination Commission develops short lists of nominees for all five Water Judges, who are then appointed by the Chief justice of the Montana Supreme Court (subject to confirmation by the Montana Senatorte).

name: montana
sentence: The Water Court adjudicates water rights claims under the Montana Water Use Act of 1973, and has statewide jurisdiction.

name: montana
sentence: District Courts have the authority to enforce decisions of the Water Court, but only the Montana Supreme Court has the authority to review decisions of the Water Court.

name: montana
sentence: From 1889 to 1909, elections for judicial office in Montana were partisan.

name: montana
sentence: Beginning in 1909, these elections became nonpartisan.

name: montana
sentence: The Montana Supreme Court struck down the nonpartisan law in 1911 on technical grounds, but a new law was enacted in 1935 which barred political parties from endorsing, making contributions to, or making expenditures on behalf of or against judicial candidates.

name: montana
sentence: In 2012, the US Supreme Court struck down Montana's judicial nonpartisan election law in American Tradition Partnership, Inc. v. Bullock, 567 US ____ (Sup.Ct.

name: montana
sentence: 2012).Although candidates must remain nonpartisan, spending by partisan entities is now permitted.

name: montana
sentence: Spending on state supreme court races exponentially increased to $1.6 million in 2014, and to more than $1.6 million in 2016 (both new records).

name: montana
sentence: The US Constitution provides each state with two senators.

name: montana
sentence: Montana's two US senators are Jon Tester (Democrat), who was reelected in 2018, and Steve Daines (Republican), first elected in 2014.

name: montana
sentence: The US Constitution provides each state with a single representative, with additional representatives apportioned based on population.

name: montana
sentence: From statehood in 1889 until 1913, Montana was represented in the United States House of Representatives by a single representative, elected at-large.

name: montana
sentence: Montana received a second representative in 1913, following the 1910 census and reapportionment.

name: montana
sentence: Both members, however, were still elected at-large.

name: montana
sentence: Beginning in 1919, Montana moved to district, rather than at-large, elections for its two House members.

name: montana
sentence: This created Montana's 1st congressional district in the west and Montana's 2nd congressional district in the east.

name: montana
sentence: In the reapportionment following the 1990 census, Montana lost one of its House seats.

name: montana
sentence: The remaining seat was again elected at-large.

name: montana
sentence: Greg Gianforte is the current officeholder.

name: montana
sentence: Montana's Senatorte district is the fourth largest by area, behind Alaska, Texas, and California.

name: montana
sentence: The most notorious of Montana's early senators was William A. Clark, a "Copper King" and one of the 50 richest Americans ever.

name: montana
sentence: He is well known for having bribed his way into the US Senatorte.

name: montana
sentence: Among Montana's most historically prominent senators are Thomas J. Walsh (serving from 1913 to 1933), who was President-elect Franklin D. Roosevelt's choice for attorney general when he died; Burton K. Wheeler (serving from 1923 to 1947), an oft-mentioned presidential candidate and strong supporter of isolationism; Mike Mansfield, the longest-serving Senatorte majority leader in US history; Max Baucus (served 1978 to 2014), longest-serving US senator in Montana history, and the senator who shepherded the Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act through the Senatorte in 2010; and Lee Metcalf (served 1961 to 1978), a pioneer of the environmental movement.

name: montana
sentence: Montana's House district is the largest congressional district in the United States by population, with just over 1,023,000 constituents.

name: montana
sentence: It is the second largest House district by area, after Alaska's at-large congressional district.

name: montana
sentence: Of Montana's House delegates, Jeannette Rankin was the first woman to hold national office in the United States when she was elected to the US House of Representatives in 1916.

name: montana
sentence: Also notable is Representative (later Senatortor) Thomas H. Carter, the first Catholic to serve as chairman of the Republican National Committee (from 1892 to 1896).

name: montana
sentence: Federal courts in Montana include the United States District Court for the District of Montana and the United States Bankruptcy Court for the District of Montana.

name: montana
sentence: Three former Montana politicians have been named judges on the US District Court: Charles Nelson Pray (who served in the US House of Representatives from 1907 to 1913), James Franklin Battin (who served in the US House of Representatives from 1961 to 1969), and Paul G. Hatfield (who served as an appointed US

name: montana
sentence: Senatortor in 1978).

name: montana
sentence: Brian Morris, who served as an associate justice of the Montana Supreme Court from 2005 to 2013, currently serves as a judge on the court.

name: montana
sentence: Elections in the state have been competitive, with the Democrats usually holding an edge, thanks to the support among unionized miners and railroad workers.

name: montana
sentence: Large-scale battles revolved around the giant Anaconda Copper company, based in Butte and controlled by Rockefeller interests, until it closed in the 1970s.

name: montana
sentence: Until 1959, the company owned five of the state's six largest newspapers.

name: montana
sentence: Historically, Montana is a swing state of cross-ticket voters who tend to fill elected offices with individuals from both parties.

name: montana
sentence: Through the mid-20th century, the state had a tradition of "sending the liberals to Washington and the conservatives to Helena".

name: montana
sentence: Between 1988 and 2006, the pattern flipped, with voters more likely to elect conservatives to federal offices.

name: montana
sentence: There have also been long-term shifts of party control.

name: montana
sentence: From 1968 through 1988, the state was dominated by the Democratic Party, with Democratic governors for a 20-year period, and a Democratic majority of both the national congressional delegation and during many sessions of the state legislature.

name: montana
sentence: This pattern shifted, beginning with the 1988 election, when Montana elected a Republican governor for the first time since 1964 and sent a Republican to the US Senatorte for the first time since 1948.

name: montana
sentence: This shift continued with the reapportionment of the state's legislative districts that took effect in 1994, when the Republican Party took control of both chambers of the state legislature, consolidating a Republican party dominance that lasted until the 2004 reapportionment produced more swing districts and a brief period of Democratic legislative majorities in the mid-2000s.

name: montana
sentence: In more recent presidential elections, Montana has voted for the Republican candidate in all but two elections from 1952 to the present.

name: montana
sentence: The state last supported a Democrat for president in 1992, when Bill Clinton won a plurality victory.

name: montana
sentence: Overall, since 1889 the state has voted for Democratic governors 60 percent of the time and Republican governors 40 percent of the time.

name: montana
sentence: In the 2008 presidential election, Montana was considered a swing state and was ultimately won by Republican John McCain, albeit by a narrow margin of two percent.

name: montana
sentence: At the state level, the pattern of split-ticket voting and divided government holds.

name: montana
sentence: Democrats hold one of the state's two US Senatorte seats with Jon Tester, as well as the governorship with Steve Bullock.

name: montana
sentence: The lone congressional district has been Republican since 1996 and in 2014 Steve Daines won one of the state's US Senatorte seats for the GOP.

name: montana
sentence: The legislative branch had split party control between the house and senate most years between 2004 and 2010, when the mid-term elections returned both branches to Republican control.

name: montana
sentence: The state Senatorte is, as of 2019, controlled by the Republicans 32 to 18, and the State House of Representatives at 59 to 41.

name: montana
sentence: Historically, Republicans are strongest in the east, while Democrats are strongest in the west.

name: montana
sentence: Montana has only one representative in the US House, having lost its second district in the 1990 census reapportionment.

name: montana
sentence: Montana's single congressional district holds the largest population of any district in the country, which means its one member in the House of Representatives represents more people than any other member of the US House (see List of US states by population).

name: montana
sentence: Montana's population grew at about the national average during the 2000s, but it failed to regain its second seat in 2010.

name: montana
sentence: Montana has 56 counties and a total of 364 "places" as defined by the United States Census Bureau; the latter comprising 129 incorporated places and 235 census-designated places.

name: montana
sentence: The incorporated places are made up of 52 cities, 75 towns, and two consolidated city-counties.

name: montana
sentence: Montana has one city, Billings, with a population over 100,000; and two cities with populations over 50,000: Missoula and Great Falls.

name: montana
sentence: These three communities are the centers of Montana's three Metropolitan Statistical Areas.

name: montana
sentence: The state also has five Micropolitan Statistical Areas, centered on Bozeman, Butte, Helena, Kalispell and Havre.

name: montana
sentence: Collectively all of these areas (excluding Havre) are known informally as the "big seven", as they are consistently the seven largest communities in the state (their rank order in terms of population is Billings, Missoula, Great Falls, Bozeman, Butte, Helena and Kalispell, according to the 2010 US Census).

name: montana
sentence: Based on 2013 census numbers, they contain 35 percent of Montana's population, and the counties in which they are located are home to 62 percent of the state's population.

name: montana
sentence: The geographic center of population of Montana is in sparsely populated Meagher County, in the town of White Sulphur Springs.

name: montana
sentence: Montana's motto, Oro y Plata, Spanish for "Gold and Silver", recognizing the significant role of mining, was first adopted in 1865, when Montana was still a territory.

name: montana
sentence: A state seal with a miner's pick and shovel above the motto, surrounded by the mountains and the Great Falls of the Missouri River, was adopted during the first meeting of the territorial legislature in 1864–65.

name: montana
sentence: The design was only slightly modified after Montana became a state and adopted it as their Great Seal in 1893.

name: montana
sentence: The state flower, the Bitterroot, was adopted in 1895 with the support of a group called the Floral Emblem Association, which formed after Montana's Women's Christian Temperance Union adopted the bitterroot as the organization's state flower.

name: montana
sentence: All other symbols were adopted throughout the 20th century, save for Montana's newest symbol, the state butterfly, the mourning cloak, adopted in 2001, and the state lullaby, "Montana Lullaby", adopted in 2007.

name: montana
sentence: The state song was not composed until 21 years after statehood, when a musical troupe led by Joseph E. Howard stopped in Butte in September 1910.

name: montana
sentence: A former member of the troupe who lived in Butte buttonholed Howard at an after-show party, asking him to compose a song about Montana and got another partygoer, the city editor for the Butte Miner newspaper, Charles C. Cohan, to help.

name: montana
sentence: The two men worked up a basic melody and lyrics in about a half-hour for the entertainment of party guests, then finished the song later that evening, with an arrangement worked up the following day.

name: montana
sentence: Upon arriving in Helena, Howard's troupe performed 12 encores of the new song to an enthusiastic audience and the governor proclaimed it the state song on the spot, though formal legislative recognition did not occur until 1945.

name: montana
sentence: Montana is one of only three states to have a "state ballad", "Montana Melody", chosen by the legislature in 1983.

name: montana
sentence: Montana was the first state to also adopt a State Lullaby.

name: montana
sentence: Montana schoolchildren played a significant role in selecting several state symbols.

name: montana
sentence: The state tree, the ponderosa pine, was selected by Montana schoolchildren as the preferred state tree by an overwhelming majority in a referendum held in 1908.

name: montana
sentence: However, the legislature did not designate a state tree until 1949, when the Montana Federation of Garden Clubs, with the support of the state forester, lobbied for formal recognition.

name: montana
sentence: Schoolchildren also chose the western meadowlark as the state bird, in a 1930 vote, and the legislature acted to endorse this decision in 1931.

name: montana
sentence: Similarly, the secretary of state sponsored a children's vote in 1981 to choose a state animal, and after 74 animals were nominated, the grizzly bear won over the elk by a 2–1 margin.

name: montana
sentence: The students of Livingston started a statewide school petition drive plus lobbied the governor and the state legislature to name the Maiasaura as the state fossil in 1985.

name: montana
sentence: Various community civic groups also played a role in selecting the state grass and the state gemstones.

name: montana
sentence: When broadcaster Norma Ashby discovered there was no state fish, she initiated a drive via her television show, Today in Montana, and an informal citizen's election to select a state fish resulted in a win for the blackspotted cutthroat trout after hot competition from the Arctic grayling.

name: montana
sentence: The legislature in turn adopted this recommendation by a wide margin.

name: montana
sentence: Media related to Montana at Wikimedia Commons

name: nebraska
sentence: Nebraska (listen) is a state that lies both in the Great Plains and in the Midwestern United States.

name: nebraska
sentence: It is bordered by South Dakota to the north; Iowa to the east and Missouri to the southeast, both across the Missouri River; Kansas to the south; Colorado to the southwest; and Wyoming to the west.

name: nebraska
sentence: It is the only triply landlocked US state.

name: nebraska
sentence: Indigenous peoples, including Omaha, Missouria, Ponca, Pawnee, Otoe, and various branches of the Lakota (Sioux) tribes, lived in the region for thousands of years before European exploration.

name: nebraska
sentence: The state is crossed by many historic trails, including that of the Lewis and Clark Expedition.

name: nebraska
sentence: Nebraska's area is just over 77,220 square miles (200,000 km2) with a population of almost 1.9 million.

name: nebraska
sentence: Its capital is Lincoln, and its largest city is Omaha, which is on the Missouri River.

name: nebraska
sentence: Nebraska was admitted into the United States in 1867, two years after the end of the American Civil War.

name: nebraska
sentence: The Nebraska Legislature is unlike any other American legislature in that it is unicameral, and its members are elected without any official reference to political party affiliation.

name: nebraska
sentence: Nebraska is composed of two major land regions: the Dissected Till Plains and the Great Plains.

name: nebraska
sentence: The Dissected Till Plains region consists of gently rolling hills and contains the state's largest cities, Omaha and Lincoln.

name: nebraska
sentence: The Great Plains region, occupying most of western Nebraska, is characterized by treeless prairie.

name: nebraska
sentence: Nebraska has two major climatic zones.

name: nebraska
sentence: The eastern half of the state has a humid continental climate (Köppen climate classification Dfa); a unique warmer subtype considered "warm-temperate" exists near the southern plains, which is analogous to that in Kansas and Oklahoma, which have a predominantly humid subtropical climate.

name: nebraska
sentence: The western half of the state has a primarily semi-arid climate (Köppen BSk).

name: nebraska
sentence: The state has wide variations between winter and summer temperatures, variations that decrease moving south within the state.

name: nebraska
sentence: Violent thunderstorms and tornadoes occur primarily during spring and summer and sometimes in autumn.

name: nebraska
sentence: Chinook wind tends to warm the state significantly in the winter and early spring.

name: nebraska
sentence: Nebraska's name is the result of anglicization of the archaic Otoe words Ñí Brásge, pronounced [ɲĩbɾasꜜkɛ] (contemporary Otoe Ñí Bráhge), or the Omaha Ní Btháska, pronounced [nĩbɫᶞasꜜka], meaning "flat water", after the Platte River which flows through the state.

name: nebraska
sentence: Indigenous peoples lived in the region of present-day Nebraska for thousands of years before European colonization.

name: nebraska
sentence: The historic tribes in the state included the Omaha, Missouria, Ponca, Pawnee, Otoe, and various branches of the Lakota (Sioux), some of which migrated from eastern areas into this region.

name: nebraska
sentence: When European exploration, trade, and settlement began, both Spain and France sought to control the region.

name: nebraska
sentence: In the 1690s, Spain established trade connections with the Apaches, whose territory then included western Nebraska.

name: nebraska
sentence: By 1703, France had developed a regular trade with the native peoples along the Missouri River in Nebraska, and by 1719 had signed treaties with several of these peoples.

name: nebraska
sentence: After war broke out between the two countries, Spain dispatched an armed expedition to Nebraska under Lieutenant General Pedro de Villasur in 1720.

name: nebraska
sentence: The party was attacked and destroyed near present-day Columbus by a large force of Pawnees and Otoes, both allied with the French.

name: nebraska
sentence: The massacre ended Spanish exploration of the area for the remainder of the 18th century.

name: nebraska
sentence: In 1762, during the Seven Years' War, France ceded the Louisiana territory to Spain.

name: nebraska
sentence: This left Britain and Spain competing for dominance along the Mississippi; by 1773, the British were trading with the native peoples of Nebraska.

name: nebraska
sentence: In response, Spain dispatched two trading expeditions up the Missouri in 1794 and 1795; the second, under James Mackay, established the first European settlement in Nebraska near the mouth of the Platte.

name: nebraska
sentence: Later that year, Mackay's party built a trading post, dubbed Fort Carlos IV (Fort Charles), near present-day Homer.

name: nebraska
sentence: In 1819, the United States established Fort Atkinson as the first US Army post west of the Missouri River, just east of present-day Fort Calhoun.

name: nebraska
sentence: The army abandoned the fort in 1827 as migration moved further west.

name: nebraska
sentence: European-American settlement was scarce until 1848 and the California Gold Rush.

name: nebraska
sentence: On May 30, 1854, the US Congress created the Kansas and the Nebraska territories, divided by the Parallel 40° North, under the Kansas–Nebraska Act.

name: nebraska
sentence: The Nebraska Territory included parts of the current states of Colorado, North Dakota, South Dakota, Wyoming, and Montana.

name: nebraska
sentence: The territorial capital of Nebraska was Omaha.

name: nebraska
sentence: In the 1860s, after the US government forced many of the Native American tribes to cede their lands and settle on reservations, it opened large tracts of land to agricultural development by Europeans and Americans.

name: nebraska
sentence: Under the Homestead Act, thousands of settlers migrated into Nebraska to claim free land granted by the federal government.

name: nebraska
sentence: Because so few trees grew on the prairies, many of the first farming settlers built their homes of sod, as had Native Americans such as the Omaha.

name: nebraska
sentence: The first wave of settlement gave the territory a sufficient population to apply for statehood.

name: nebraska
sentence: Nebraska became the 37th state on March 1, 1867, and the capital was moved from Omaha to the center at Lancaster, later renamed Lincoln after the recently assassinated President of the United States, Abraham Lincoln.

name: nebraska
sentence: The battle of Massacre Canyon, on August 5, 1873, was the last major battle between the Pawnee and the Sioux.

name: nebraska
sentence: During the 1870s to the 1880s, Nebraska experienced a large growth in population.

name: nebraska
sentence: Several factors contributed to attracting new residents.

name: nebraska
sentence: The first was that the vast prairie land was perfect for cattle grazing.

name: nebraska
sentence: This helped settlers to learn the unfamiliar geography of the area.

name: nebraska
sentence: The second factor was the invention of several farming technologies.

name: nebraska
sentence: Agricultural inventions such as barbed wire, wind mills, and the steel plow, combined with good weather, enabled settlers to use Nebraska as prime farming land.

name: nebraska
sentence: By the 1880s, Nebraska's population had soared to more than 450,000 people.

name: nebraska
sentence: The Arbor Day holiday was founded in Nebraska City by territorial governor J.

name: nebraska
sentence: Sterling Morton.

name: nebraska
sentence: The National Arbor Day Foundation is still headquartered in Nebraska City, with some offices in Lincoln.

name: nebraska
sentence: In the late 19th century, many African Americans migrated from the South to Nebraska as part of the Great Migration, primarily to Omaha which offered working class jobs in meat packing, the railroads and other industries.

name: nebraska
sentence: Omaha has a long history of civil rights activism.

name: nebraska
sentence: Blacks encountered discrimination from other Americans in Omaha and especially from recent European immigrants, ethnic whites who were competing for the same jobs.

name: nebraska
sentence: In 1912, African Americans founded the Omaha chapter of the National Association for the Advancement of Colored People to work for improved conditions in the city and state.

name: nebraska
sentence: Since the 1960s, Native American activism in the state has increased, both through open protest, activities to build alliances with state and local governments, and in the slower, more extensive work of building tribal institutions and infrastructure.

name: nebraska
sentence: Native Americans in federally recognized tribes have pressed for self-determination, sovereignty and recognition.

name: nebraska
sentence: They have created community schools to preserve their cultures, as well as tribal colleges and universities.

name: nebraska
sentence: Tribal politicians have also collaborated with state and county officials on regional issues.

name: nebraska
sentence: The state is bordered by South Dakota to the north; Iowa to the east and Missouri to the southeast, across the Missouri River; Kansas to the south; Colorado to the southwest; and Wyoming to the west.

name: nebraska
sentence: The state has 93 counties and is split between two time zones, with the state's eastern half observing Central Time and the western half observing Mountain Time.

name: nebraska
sentence: Three rivers cross the state from west to east.

name: nebraska
sentence: The Platte River, formed by the confluence of the North Platte and the South Platte, runs through the state's central portion, the Niobrara River flows through the northern part, and the Republican River runs across the southern part.

name: nebraska
sentence: The first Constitution of Nebraska in 1866 described Nebraska's boundaries as follows (Note that the description of the Northern border is no longer accurate, since the Keya Paha River and the Niobrara River no longer form the boundary of the state of Nebraska.

name: nebraska
sentence: Instead, Nebraska's Northern border now extends east along the forty-third degree of north latitude until it meets the Missouri River directly.

name: nebraska
sentence: Nebraska is composed of two major land regions: the Dissected Till Plains and the Great Plains.

name: nebraska
sentence: The easternmost portion of the state was scoured by Ice Age glaciers

name: nebraska
sentence: The Dissected Till Plains is a region of gently rolling hills

name: nebraska
sentence: The Great Plains occupy most of western Nebraska, with the region consisting of several smaller, diverse land regions, including the Sandhills, the Pine Ridge, the Rainwater Basin, the High Plains and the Wildcat Hills.

name: nebraska
sentence: Panorama Point, at 5,424 feet (1,653 m), is Nebraska's highest point; though despite its name and elevation, it is a relatively low rise near the Colorado and Wyoming borders.

name: nebraska
sentence: A past tourism slogan for the state of Nebraska was "Where the West Begins" (it has since been changed to "Honestly, it's not for everyone").

name: nebraska
sentence: Locations given for the beginning of the "West" in Nebraska include the Missouri River, the intersection of 13th and O Streets in Lincoln (where it is marked by a red brick star), the 100th meridian, and Chimney Rock.

name: nebraska

name: nebraska
sentence: Areas under the management of the National Forest Service include:

name: nebraska
sentence: Two major climatic zones are represented in Nebraska.

name: nebraska
sentence: The eastern two-thirds of the state has a humid continental climate (Köppen Dfa), although the southwest of this region may be classed as a humid subtropical climate (Cfa) using the −3 °C or 26.6 °F boundary.

name: nebraska
sentence: The Panhandle and adjacent areas bordering Colorado have a semi-arid climate (Köppen BSk).

name: nebraska
sentence: The entire state experiences wide seasonal variations in both temperature and precipitation.

name: nebraska
sentence: Average temperatures are fairly uniform across Nebraska, with hot summers and generally cold winters.

name: nebraska
sentence: However, chinook winds from the Rocky Mountains provide a temporary moderating effect on temperatures in the state's western portion during the winter.

name: nebraska
sentence: Thus, average January maximum temperatures are highest at around 43 °F or 6.1 °C in southwestern Dundy County, and lowest at about 30 °F or −1.1 °C around South Sioux City in the northeast.

name: nebraska
sentence: Average annual precipitation decreases east to west from about 31.5 inches (800 mm) in the southeast corner of the state to about 13.8 inches (350 mm) in the Panhandle.

name: nebraska
sentence: Humidity also decreases significantly from east to west.

name: nebraska
sentence: Snowfall across the state is fairly even, with most of Nebraska receiving between 25 to 35 inches (0.64 to 0.89 m) of snow each year.

name: nebraska
sentence: Nebraska's highest-recorded temperature was 118 °F (48 °C) in Minden on July 24, 1936.

name: nebraska
sentence: The state's lowest-recorded temperature was −47 °F (−44 °C) in Camp Clarke on February 12, 1899.

name: nebraska
sentence: Nebraska is located in Tornado Alley.

name: nebraska
sentence: Thunderstorms are common during both the spring and the summer.

name: nebraska
sentence: Violent thunderstorms and tornadoes happen primarily during those two seasons, although they also can occur occasionally during the autumn.

name: nebraska
sentence: The United States Census Bureau estimates that the population of Nebraska was 1,934,408 on July 1, 2019, a 5.92% increase since the 2010 United States Census.

name: nebraska
sentence: The center of population of Nebraska is in Polk County, in the city of Shelby.

name: nebraska
sentence: The table below shows the racial composition of Nebraska's population as of 2016.

name: nebraska
sentence: According to the 2016 American Community Survey, 10.2% of Nebraska's population were of Hispanic or Latino origin (of any race): Mexican (7.8%), Puerto Rican (0.2%), Cuban (0.2%), and other Hispanic or Latino origin (2.0%).

name: nebraska
sentence: The five largest ancestry groups were: German (36.1%), Irish (13.1%), English (7.8%), Czech (4.7%), and American (4.0%).

name: nebraska
sentence: Nebraska has the largest Czech American and non-Mormon Danish American population (as a percentage of the total population) in the nation.

name: nebraska
sentence: German Americans are the largest ancestry group in most of the state, particularly in the eastern counties.

name: nebraska
sentence: Thurston County (made up entirely of the Omaha and Winnebago reservations) has an American Indian majority, and Butler County is one of only two counties in the nation with a Czech-American plurality.

name: nebraska
sentence: In recent years, Nebraska has become home to many refugee communities.

name: nebraska
sentence: In 2016, it welcomed more refugees per capita than any other state.

name: nebraska
sentence: Nebraska, and in particular Lincoln, is the largest home of Yazidis refugees and Yazidi Americans in the United States.

name: nebraska
sentence: As of 2011, 31.0% of Nebraska's population younger than age 1 were minorities.

sentence: Note: Births in table don't add up, because Hispanics are counted both by their ethnicity and by their race, giving a higher overall number.

name: nebraska

name: nebraska
sentence: The largest single denominations by number of adherents in 2010 were the Roman Catholic Church (372,838), the Lutheran Church–Missouri Synod (112,585), the Evangelical Lutheran Church in America (110,110) and the United Methodist Church (109,283).

name: nebraska
sentence: Eighty-nine percent of the cities in Nebraska have fewer than 3,000 people.

name: nebraska
sentence: Nebraska shares this characteristic with five other Midwestern states: Kansas, Oklahoma, North Dakota and South Dakota, and Iowa.

name: nebraska
sentence: Hundreds of towns have a population of fewer than 1,000.

name: nebraska
sentence: Regional population declines have forced many rural schools to consolidate.

name: nebraska
sentence: Fifty-three of Nebraska's 93 counties reported declining populations between 1990 and 2000, ranging from a 0.06% loss (Frontier County) to a 17.04% loss (Hitchcock County).

name: nebraska
sentence: More urbanized areas of the state have experienced substantial growth.

name: nebraska
sentence: In 2000, the city of Omaha had a population of 390,007; in 2005, the city's estimated population was 414,521 (427,872 including the recently annexed city of Elkhorn), a 6.3% increase over five years.

name: nebraska
sentence: The 2010 census showed that Omaha has a population of 408,958.

name: nebraska
sentence: The city of Lincoln had a 2000 population of 225,581 and a 2010 population of 258,379, a 14.5% increase.

name: nebraska
sentence: As of the 2010 Census, there were 530 cities and villages in the state of Nebraska.

name: nebraska
sentence: There are five classifications of cities and villages in Nebraska, which is based upon population.

name: nebraska
sentence: All population figures are 2017 Census Bureau estimates unless flagged by a reference number.

name: nebraska
sentence: Metropolitan Class City (300,000 or more)

name: nebraska
sentence: Primary Class City (100,000–299,999)

name: nebraska
sentence: Second Class Cities (800–4,999) and Villages (100–800) make up the rest of the communities in Nebraska.

name: nebraska
sentence: There are 116 second-class cities and 382 villages in the state.

name: nebraska
sentence: Nebraska has a progressive income tax.

name: nebraska
sentence: The portion of income from $0 to $2,400 is taxed at 2.56%; from $2,400 to $17,500, at 3.57%; from $17,500 to $27,000, at 5.12%; and income over $27,000, at 6.84%.

name: nebraska
sentence: The standard deduction for a single taxpayer is $5,700; the personal exemption is $118.

name: nebraska
sentence: Nebraska has a state sales and use tax of 5.5%.

name: nebraska
sentence: In addition to the state tax, some Nebraska cities assess a city sales and use tax, in 0.5% increments, up to a maximum of 1.5%.

name: nebraska
sentence: Dakota County levies an additional 0.5% county sales tax.

name: nebraska
sentence: Food and ingredients that are generally for home preparation and consumption are not taxable.

name: nebraska
sentence: All real property within the state of Nebraska is taxable unless specifically exempted by statute.

name: nebraska
sentence: Since 1992, only depreciable personal property is subject to tax and all other personal property is exempt from tax.

name: nebraska
sentence: Inheritance tax is collected at the county level.

name: nebraska
sentence: The Bureau of Economic Analysis estimates of Nebraska's gross state product in 2010 was $89.8 billion.

name: nebraska
sentence: Per capita personal income in 2004 was $31,339, 25th in the nation.

name: nebraska
sentence: Nebraska has a large agriculture sector, and is a major producer of beef, pork, corn (maize), soybeans, and sorghum.

name: nebraska
sentence: Other important economic sectors include freight transport (by rail and truck), manufacturing, telecommunications, information technology, and insurance.

name: nebraska
sentence: As of November 2018, the state's unemployment rate was 2.8%, the fifth lowest in the nation.

name: nebraska
sentence: Kool-Aid was created in 1927 by Edwin Perkins in the city of Hastings, which celebrates the event the second weekend of every August with Kool-Aid Days, and Kool-Aid is the official soft drink of Nebraska.

name: nebraska
sentence: CliffsNotes were developed by Clifton Hillegass of Rising City.

name: nebraska
sentence: He adapted his pamphlets from the Canadian publications, Coles Notes.

name: nebraska
sentence: Omaha is home to Berkshire Hathaway, whose chief executive officer (CEO), Warren Buffett, was ranked in March 2009 by Forbes magazine as the second-richest person in the world.

name: nebraska
sentence: The city is also home to Mutual of Omaha, InfoUSA, TD Ameritrade, West Corporation, Valmont Industries, Woodmen of the World, Kiewit Corporation, Union Pacific Railroad, and Gallup.

name: nebraska
sentence: Ameritas Life Insurance Corp., Nelnet, Sandhills Publishing Company, Duncan Aviation, and Hudl are based in Lincoln.

name: nebraska
sentence: The Buckle is based in Kearney.

name: nebraska
sentence: Sidney is the national headquarters for Cabela's, a specialty retailer of outdoor goods now owned by Bass Pro Shops.

name: nebraska
sentence: Grand Island is the headquarters of Hornady, a manufacturer of ammunition.

sentence: The world's largest train yard, Union Pacific's Bailey Yard, is in North Platte.

name: nebraska
sentence: The Vise-Grip was invented by William Petersen in 1924, and was manufactured in De Witt until the plant was closed and moved to China in late 2008.

name: nebraska
sentence: Lincoln's Kawasaki Motors Manufacturing is the only Kawasaki plant in the world to produce the Jet Ski, all-terrain vehicle (ATV), and Mule product lines.

name: nebraska
sentence: The facility employs more than 1,200 people.

name: nebraska
sentence: The Spade Ranch, in the Sandhills, is one of Nebraska's oldest and largest beef cattle operations.

name: nebraska
sentence: Nebraska is the only state in the US where all electric utilities are publicly owned.

name: nebraska
sentence: The Union Pacific Railroad, headquartered in Omaha, was incorporated on July 1, 1862, in the wake of the Pacific Railway Act of 1862.

name: nebraska
sentence: Bailey Yard, in North Platte, is the largest railroad classification yard in the world.

name: nebraska
sentence: The route of the original transcontinental railroad runs through the state.

name: nebraska
sentence: Nebraska's government operates under the framework of the Nebraska Constitution, adopted in 1875, and is divided into three branches: executive, legislative, and judicial.

name: nebraska
sentence: The head of the executive branch is Governor Pete Ricketts (Republican).

name: nebraska
sentence: Other elected officials in the executive branch are Lieutenant Governor Mike Foley, Attorney General Doug Peterson, Secretary of State Bob Evnen, State Treasurer John Murante, and State Auditor Charlie Janssen.

name: nebraska
sentence: All elected officials in the executive branch serve four-year terms.

name: nebraska
sentence: Nebraska is the only state in the United States with a unicameral legislature.

name: nebraska
sentence: Although this house is officially known simply as the "Legislature", and more commonly called the "Unicameral", its members call themselves "senators".

name: nebraska
sentence: Nebraska's Legislature is also the only state legislature in the United States that is officially nonpartisan.

name: nebraska
sentence: The senators are elected with no party affiliation next to their names on the ballot, and members of any party can be elected to the positions of speaker and committee chairs.

name: nebraska
sentence: The Nebraska Legislature can also override the governor's veto with a three-fifths majority, in contrast to the two-thirds majority required in some other states.

name: nebraska
sentence: When Nebraska became a state in 1867, its legislature consisted of two houses: a House of Representatives and a Senatorte.

name: nebraska
sentence: For years, US

name: nebraska
sentence: Senatortor George Norris (Senatortor 1913–1943) and other Nebraskans encouraged the idea of a unicameral legislature, and demanded the issue be decided in a referendum.

name: nebraska
sentence: Norris argued:

name: nebraska
sentence: Unicameral supporters also argued that a bicameral legislature had a significant undemocratic feature in the committees that reconciled House and Senatorte legislation.

name: nebraska
sentence: Votes in these committees were secretive, and would sometimes add provisions to bills that neither house had approved.

name: nebraska
sentence: Nebraska's unicameral legislature today has rules that bills can contain only one subject, and must be given at least five days of consideration.

name: nebraska
sentence: In 1934, due in part to the budgetary pressure of the Great Depression, Nebraska citizens ran a state initiative to vote on a constitutional amendment creating a unicameral legislature, which was approved, which, in effect, abolished the House of Representatives (the lower house).

name: nebraska
sentence: The Legislature meets in the third Nebraska State Capitol building, built between 1922 and 1932.

name: nebraska
sentence: It was designed by Bertram G. Goodhue.

name: nebraska
sentence: Built from Indiana limestone, the capitol's base is a cross within a square.

name: nebraska
sentence: A 400-foot domed tower rises from this base.

name: nebraska
sentence: The Sower, a 19-foot bronze statue representing agriculture, crowns the building.

name: nebraska
sentence: The judicial system in Nebraska is unified, with the Nebraska Supreme Court having administrative authority over all the courts within the state.

name: nebraska
sentence: Nebraska uses the Missouri Plan for the selection of judges at all levels, including county courts (as the lowest-level courts) and twelve district courts, which contain one or more counties.

name: nebraska
sentence: The Nebraska State Court of Appeals hears appeals from the district courts, juvenile courts, and workers' compensation courts, and is the final court of appeal.

name: nebraska
sentence: Nebraska's US senators are Deb Fischer and Ben Sasse, both Republicans; Fischer, elected in 2012, is the senior.

name: nebraska
sentence: Nebraska has three representatives in the House of Representatives: Jeff Fortenberry (R) of the 1st district

name: nebraska
sentence: Nebraska is one of two states (Maine is the other) that allow for a split in the state's allocation of electoral votes in presidential elections.

name: nebraska
sentence: Under a 1991 law, two of Nebraska's five votes are awarded to the winner of the statewide popular vote, while the other three go to the highest vote-getter in each of the state's three congressional districts.

name: nebraska
sentence: For most of its history, Nebraska has been a solidly Republican state.

name: nebraska
sentence: Republicans have carried the state in all but one presidential election since 1940: the 1964 landslide election of Lyndon B. Johnson.

name: nebraska
sentence: In the 2004 presidential election, George W. Bush won the state's five electoral votes by a margin of 33 percentage points (making Nebraska's the fourth-strongest Republican vote among states) with 65.9% of the overall vote; only Thurston County, which is majority-Native American, voted for his Democratic challenger John Kerry.

name: nebraska
sentence: In 2008, the state split its electoral votes for the first time: Republican John McCain won the popular vote in Nebraska as a whole and two of its three congressional districts; the second district, which includes the city of Omaha, went for Democrat Barack Obama.

name: nebraska
sentence: Despite the current Republican domination of Nebraska politics, the state has a long tradition of electing centrist members of both parties to state and federal office; examples include George W. Norris (who served a few years in the Senatorte as an independent), J. James Exon, Bob Kerrey, and Chuck Hagel.

name: nebraska
sentence: Voters have tilted to the right in recent years, a trend evidenced when Hagel retired from the Senatorte in 2008 and was succeeded by conservative Republican Mike Johanns to the US Senatorte, as well as with the 2006 re-election of Ben Nelson, who was considered the most conservative Democrat in the Senatorte until his retirement in 2013.

name: nebraska
sentence: Johanns retired in 2015 and was succeeded by another conservative, Sasse.

name: nebraska
sentence: Nelson retired in 2013 and was replaced by conservative Republican Fischer.

name: nebraska
sentence: Former President Gerald Ford was born in Nebraska, but moved away shortly after birth.

name: nebraska
sentence: Illinois native William Jennings Bryan represented Nebraska in Congress, served as US Secretary of State under President Woodrow Wilson, and unsuccessfully ran for president three times.
