sentence: Settlement increased with the Donation Land Claim Act of 1850 and the forced relocation of the native population to Indian reservations in Oregon.

name: oregon
sentence: In December 1844, Oregon passed its Black Exclusion Law, which prohibited African Americans from entering the territory while simultaneously prohibiting slavery.

name: oregon
sentence: Slave owners who brought their slaves with them were given three years before they were forced to free them.

name: oregon
sentence: Any African Americans in the region after the law was passed were forced to leave, and those who did not comply were arrested and beaten.

name: oregon
sentence: They received no less than twenty and no more than thirty-nine stripes across their bare back if they still did not leave.

name: oregon
sentence: This process could be repeated every six months.

name: oregon
sentence: Slavery played a major part in Oregon's history and even influenced its path to statehood.

name: oregon
sentence: The territory's request for statehood was delayed several times, as members of Congress argued among themselves whether the territory should be admitted as a "free" or "slave" state.

name: oregon
sentence: Eventually politicians from the south agreed to allow Oregon to enter as a "free" state, in exchange for opening slavery to the southwest United States.

name: oregon
sentence: Oregon was admitted to the Union on February 14, 1859, though no one in Oregon knew it, until March 15.

name: oregon
sentence: Founded as a refuge from disputes over slavery, Oregon had a "whites only" clause in its original state Constitution.

name: oregon
sentence: At the outbreak of the American Civil War, regular US troops were withdrawn and sent east to aid the Union.

name: oregon
sentence: Volunteer cavalry recruited in California were sent north to Oregon to keep peace and protect the populace.

name: oregon
sentence: The First Oregon Cavalry served until June 1865.

name: oregon
sentence: Beginning in the 1880s, the growth of railroads expanded the state's lumber, wheat, and other agricultural markets, and the rapid growth of its cities.

name: oregon
sentence: Due to the abundance of timber and waterway access via the Willamette River, Portland became a major force in the lumber industry of the Pacific Northwest, and quickly became the state's largest city.

name: oregon
sentence: It would earn the nickname "Stumptown", and would later become recognized as one of the most dangerous port cities in the United States due to racketeering and illegal activities at the turn of the 20th century.

name: oregon
sentence: In 1902, Oregon introduced direct legislation by the state's citizens through initiatives and referenda, known as the Oregon System.

name: oregon
sentence: On May 5, 1945, six civilians were killed by a Japanese balloon bomb that exploded on Gearhart Mountain near Bly.

name: oregon
sentence: They remained the only people on American soil whose deaths were attributed to an enemy balloon bomb explosion during World War II.

name: oregon
sentence: The bombing site is now located in the Mitchell Recreation Area.

name: oregon
sentence: Industrial expansion began in earnest following the 1933–37 construction of the Bonneville Dam on the Columbia River.

name: oregon
sentence: Hydroelectric power, food, and lumber provided by Oregon helped fuel the development of the West, although the periodic fluctuations in the US building industry have hurt the state's economy on multiple occasions.

name: oregon
sentence: Portland in particular experienced a population boom between 1900 and 1930, tripling in size; the arrival of World War II also provided the northwest region of the state with an industrial boom, where Liberty ships and aircraft carriers were constructed.

name: oregon
sentence: During the 1970s, the Pacific Northwest was particularly affected by the 1973 oil crisis, with Oregon suffering a substantial shortage.

name: oregon
sentence: In 1994, Oregon became the first US state to legalize physician-assisted suicide through the Oregon Death with Dignity Act.

name: oregon
sentence: A measure to legalize recreational use of marijuana in Oregon was approved on November 4, 2014, making Oregon only the second state at the time to have legalized gay marriage, physician-assisted suicide, and recreational marijuana.

name: oregon
sentence: Oregon's population is largely concentrated in the Willamette Valley, which stretches from Eugene in the south (home of the University of Oregon) through Corvallis (home of Oregon State University) and Salem (the capital) to Portland (Oregon's largest city).

name: oregon
sentence: Astoria, at the mouth of the Columbia River, was the first permanent English-speaking settlement west of the Rockies in what is now the United States.

name: oregon
sentence: Oregon City, at the end of the Oregon Trail, was the Oregon Territory's first incorporated city, and was its first capital from 1848 until 1852, when the capital was moved to Salem.

name: oregon
sentence: Bend, near the geographic center of the state, is one of the ten fastest-growing metropolitan areas in the United States.

name: oregon
sentence: In southern Oregon, Medford is a rapidly growing metro area and is home to the Rogue Valley International-Medford Airport, the state's third-busiest airport.

name: oregon
sentence: To the south, near the California border, is the city of Ashland.

name: oregon
sentence: Eastern Oregon is sparsely populated, but is home to Hermiston, which with a population of 18,000 is the largest and fastest growing city in the region.

name: oregon
sentence: A writer in the Oregon Country book A Pacific Republic, written in 1839, predicted the territory was to become an independent republic.

name: oregon
sentence: Four years later, in 1843, settlers of the Willamette Valley voted in majority for a republic government.

name: oregon
sentence: The Oregon Country functioned in this way until August 13, 1848, when Oregon was annexed by the United States and a territorial government was established.

name: oregon
sentence: Oregon maintained a territorial government until February 14, 1859, when it was granted statehood.

name: oregon
sentence: Oregon state government has a separation of powers similar to the federal government.

name: oregon
sentence: It has three branches:

name: oregon
sentence: Governors in Oregon serve four-year terms and are limited to two consecutive terms, but an unlimited number of total terms.

name: oregon
sentence: Oregon has no lieutenant governor; in the event that the office of governor is vacated, Article V, Section 8a of the Oregon Constitution specifies that the Secretary of State is first in line for succession.

name: oregon
sentence: The other statewide officers are Treasurer, Attorney General, Superintendent, and Labor Commissioner.

name: oregon
sentence: The biennial Oregon Legislative Assembly consists of a thirty-member Senatorte and a sixty-member House.

name: oregon
sentence: The state supreme court has seven elected justices, currently including the only two openly gay state supreme court justices in the nation.

name: oregon
sentence: They choose one of their own to serve a six-year term as Chief Justice.

name: oregon
sentence: The debate over whether to move to annual sessions is a long-standing battle in Oregon politics, but the voters have resisted the move from citizen legislators to professional lawmakers.

name: oregon
sentence: Because Oregon's state budget is written in two-year increments and, there being no sales tax, state revenue is based largely on income taxes, it is often significantly over- or under-budget.

name: oregon
sentence: Recent legislatures have had to be called into special session repeatedly to address revenue shortfalls resulting from economic downturns, bringing to a head the need for more frequent legislative sessions.

name: oregon
sentence: Oregon Initiative 71, passed in 2010, mandates the legislature to begin meeting every year, for 160 days in odd-numbered years, and 35 days in even-numbered years.

name: oregon
sentence: Oregonians have voted for the Democratic presidential candidate in every election since 1988.

name: oregon
sentence: In 2004 and 2006, Democrats won control of the state Senatorte, and then the House.

name: oregon
sentence: Since the late 1990s, Oregon has been represented by four Democrats and one Republican in the US House of Representatives.

name: oregon
sentence: Since 2009, the state has had two Democratic US senators, Ron Wyden and Jeff Merkley.

name: oregon
sentence: Oregon voters have elected Democratic governors in every election since 1986, most recently electing Kate Brown over Republican Bud Pierce in a 2016 special election for a two-year term, and re-electing her for a full four-year term over Republican Knute Buehler in 2018.

name: oregon
sentence: The base of Democratic support is largely concentrated in the urban centers of the Willamette Valley.

name: oregon
sentence: The eastern two-thirds of the state beyond the Cascade Mountains typically votes Republican; in 2000 and 2004, George W. Bush carried every county east of the Cascades.

name: oregon
sentence: However, the region's sparse population means the more populous counties in the Willamette Valley usually outweigh the eastern counties in statewide elections.

name: oregon
sentence: In the 2002 general election, Oregon voters approved a ballot measure to increase the state minimum wage automatically each year according to inflationary changes, which are measured by the consumer price index (CPI).

name: oregon
sentence: In the 2004 general election, Oregon voters passed ballot measures banning same-sex marriage and restricting land use regulation.

name: oregon
sentence: In the 2006 general election, voters restricted the use of eminent domain and extended the state's discount prescription drug coverage.

name: oregon
sentence: In the 2020 general election, Oregon voters approved a ballot measure to decriminalize the possession of small quantities of street drugs such as cocaine and heroin, becoming the first state in the country to do so after the drugs were originally made illegal.

name: oregon
sentence: The state also approved a ballot measure to create a legal means of administering psilocybin for medicinal use.

name: oregon
sentence: Like all US states, Oregon is represented by two senators.

name: oregon
sentence: Since the 1980 census, Oregon has had five congressional districts.

name: oregon
sentence: After Oregon was admitted to the Union, it began with a single member in the House of Representatives (La Fayette Grover, who served in the 35th United States Congress for less than a month).

name: oregon
sentence: Congressional apportionment increased the size of the delegation following the censuses of 1890, 1910, 1940, and 1980.

name: oregon
sentence: A detailed list of the past and present Congressional delegations from Oregon is available.

name: oregon
sentence: The United States District Court for the District of Oregon hears federal cases in the state.

name: oregon
sentence: The court has courthouses in Portland, Eugene, Medford, and Pendleton.

name: oregon
sentence: Also in Portland is the federal bankruptcy court, with a second branch in Eugene.

name: oregon
sentence: Oregon (among other western states and territories) is in the 9th Court of Appeals.

name: oregon
sentence: One of the court's meeting places is at the Pioneer Courthouse in downtown Portland, a National Historic Landmark built in 1869.

name: oregon
sentence: Political opinions in Oregon are geographically split by the Cascade Range, with western Oregon being more liberal and Eastern Oregon being conservative.

name: oregon
sentence: In a 2008 analysis of the 2004 presidential election, a political analyst found that according to the application of a Likert scale, Oregon boasted both the most liberal Kerry voters and the most conservative Bush voters, making it the most politically polarized state in the country.

name: oregon
sentence: While Republicans typically win more counties by running up huge margins in the east, the Democratic tilt of the more populated west is usually enough to swing the entire state Democratic.

name: oregon
sentence: In 2008, for instance, Republican Senatorte incumbent Gordon H. Smith lost his bid for a third term, even though he carried all but eight counties.

name: oregon
sentence: His Democratic challenger, Jeff Merkley, won Multnomah County by 142,000 votes, more than double the overall margin of victory.

name: oregon
sentence: During Oregon's history, it has adopted many electoral reforms proposed during the Progressive Era, through the efforts of William S. U'Ren and his Direct Legislation League.

name: oregon
sentence: Under his leadership, the state overwhelmingly approved a ballot measure in 1902 that created the initiative and referendum for citizens to introduce or approve proposed laws or amendments to the state constitution directly, making Oregon the first state to adopt such a system.

name: oregon
sentence: Today, roughly half of US states do so.

name: oregon
sentence: In following years, the primary election to select party candidates was adopted in 1904, and in 1908 the Oregon Constitution was amended to include recall of public officials.

name: oregon
sentence: More recent amendments include the nation's first doctor-assisted suicide law, called the Death with Dignity Act (which was challenged, unsuccessfully, in 2005 by the Bush administration in a case heard by the US Supreme Court), legalization of medical cannabis, and among the nation's strongest anti-urban sprawl and pro-environment laws.

name: oregon
sentence: More recently, 2004's Measure 37 reflects a backlash against such land-use laws.

name: oregon
sentence: However, a further ballot measure in 2007, Measure 49, curtailed many of the provisions of 37.

name: oregon
sentence: Of the measures placed on the ballot since 1902, the people have passed 99 of the 288 initiatives and 25 of the 61 referendums on the ballot, though not all of them survived challenges in courts (see Pierce v. Society of Sisters, for an example).

name: oregon
sentence: During the same period, the legislature has referred 363 measures to the people, of which 206 have passed.

name: oregon
sentence: Oregon pioneered the American use of postal voting, beginning with experimentation approved by the Oregon Legislative Assembly in 1981 and culminating with a 1998 ballot measure mandating that all counties conduct elections by mail.

name: oregon
sentence: It remains one of just two states, the other being Washington, where voting by mail is the only method of voting.

name: oregon
sentence: In 1994, Oregon adopted the Oregon Health Plan, which made health care available to most of its citizens without private health insurance.

name: oregon
sentence: In the US

name: oregon
sentence: Electoral College, Oregon casts seven votes.

name: oregon
sentence: Oregon has supported Democratic candidates in the last nine elections.

name: oregon
sentence: Democratic incumbent Barack Obama won the state by a margin of twelve percentage points, with over 54% of the popular vote in 2012.

name: oregon
sentence: In the 2016 election, Hillary Clinton won Oregon by 11 percentage points.

name: oregon
sentence: As of 2015, Oregon ranks as the 17th highest in median household income at $60,834.

name: oregon
sentence: The gross domestic product (GDP) of Oregon in 2013 was $219.6 billion, a 2.7% increase from 2012; Oregon is the 25th wealthiest state by GDP.

name: oregon
sentence: In 2003, Oregon was 28th in the US by GDP.

name: oregon
sentence: The state's per capita personal income (PCPI) in 2013 was $39,848, a 1.5% increase from 2012.

name: oregon
sentence: Oregon ranks 33rd in the US by PCPI, compared to 31st in 2003.

name: oregon
sentence: The national PCPI in 2013 was $44,765.

name: oregon
sentence: Oregon's unemployment rate was 5.5% in September 2016, while the US unemployment rate was 5.0% that month.

name: oregon
sentence: Oregon has the third largest amount of food stamp users in the nation (21% of the population).

name: oregon
sentence: Oregon's diverse landscapes provide ideal environments for various types of farming.

name: oregon
sentence: Land in the Willamette Valley owes its fertility to the Missoula Floods, which deposited lake sediment from Glacial Lake Missoula in western Montana onto the valley floor.

name: oregon
sentence: In 2016, the Willamette Valley region produced over 100 million pounds (45 kt) of blueberries.

name: oregon
sentence: Oregon is also one of four major world hazelnut growing regions, and produces 95% of the domestic hazelnuts in the United States.

name: oregon
sentence: While the history of the wine production in Oregon can be traced to before Prohibition, it became a significant industry beginning in the 1970s.

name: oregon
sentence: In 2005, Oregon ranked third among US states with 303 wineries.

name: oregon
sentence: Due to regional similarities in climate and soil, the grapes planted in Oregon are often the same varieties found in the French regions of Alsace and Burgundy.

name: oregon
sentence: In 2014, 71 wineries opened in the state.

name: oregon
sentence: The total is currently 676, which represents growth of 12% over 2013.

name: oregon
sentence: In the southern Oregon coast, commercially cultivated cranberries account for about 7 percent of US production, and the cranberry ranks 23rd among Oregon's top 50 agricultural commodities.

name: oregon
sentence: Cranberry cultivation in Oregon uses about 27,000 acres (110 square kilometers) in southern Coos and northern Curry counties, centered around the coastal city of Bandon.

name: oregon
sentence: In the northeastern region of the state, particularly around Pendleton, both irrigated and dry land wheat is grown.

name: oregon
sentence: Oregon farmers and ranchers also produce cattle, sheep, dairy products, eggs and poultry.

name: oregon
sentence: Vast forests have historically made Oregon one of the nation's major timber-producing and logging states, but forest fires (such as the Tillamook Burn), over-harvesting, and lawsuits over proper management of the extensive federal forest holdings have reduced the timber produced.

name: oregon
sentence: Between 1989 and 2011, the amount of timber harvested from federal lands in Oregon dropped about 90%, although harvest levels on private land have remained relatively constant.

name: oregon
sentence: Even the shift in recent years towards finished goods such as paper and building materials has not slowed the decline of the timber industry in the state.

name: oregon
sentence: The effects of this decline have included Weyerhaeuser's acquisition of Portland-based Willamette Industries in January 2002, the relocation of Louisiana-Pacific's corporate headquarters from Portland to Nashville, and the decline of former lumber company towns such as Gilchrist.

name: oregon
sentence: Despite these changes, Oregon still leads the United States in softwood lumber production; in 2011, 4,134 million board feet (9,760,000 m3) was produced in Oregon, compared with 3,685 million board feet (8,700,000 m3) in Washington, 1,914 million board feet (4,520,000 m3) in Georgia, and 1,708 million board feet (4,030,000 m3) in Mississippi.

name: oregon
sentence: The slowing of the timber and lumber industry has caused high unemployment rates in rural areas.

name: oregon
sentence: Oregon has one of the largest salmon-fishing industries in the world, although ocean fisheries have reduced the river fisheries in recent years.

name: oregon
sentence: Because of the abundance of waterways in the state, it is also a major producer of hydroelectric energy.

name: oregon
sentence: Tourism is also a strong industry in the state.

name: oregon
sentence: Tourism is centered on the state's natural features – mountains, forests, waterfalls, rivers, beaches and lakes, including Crater Lake National Park, Multnomah Falls, the Painted Hills, the Deschutes River, and the Oregon Caves.

name: oregon
sentence: Mount Hood and Mount Bachelor also draw visitors year-round for skiing and other snow activities.

name: oregon
sentence: Portland is home to the Oregon Museum of Science and Industry, the Portland Art Museum, and the Oregon Zoo, which is the oldest zoo west of the Mississippi River.

name: oregon
sentence: The International Rose Test Garden is another prominent attraction in the city.

name: oregon
sentence: Portland has also been named the best city in the world for street food by several publications, including the US News & World Report and CNN.

name: oregon
sentence: Oregon is home to many breweries, and Portland has the largest number of breweries of any city in the world.

name: oregon
sentence: The state's coastal region produces significant tourism as well.

name: oregon
sentence: The Oregon Coast Aquarium comprises 23 acres (9.3 ha) along Yaquina Bay in Newport, and was also home to Keiko the orca whale.

name: oregon
sentence: It has been noted as one of the top ten aquariums in North America.

name: oregon
sentence: Fort Clatsop in Warrenton features a replica of Lewis and Clark's encampment at the mouth of the Columbia River in 1805.

name: oregon
sentence: The Sea Lion Caves in Florence are the largest system of sea caverns in the United States, and also attract many visitors.

name: oregon
sentence: In Southern Oregon, the Oregon Shakespeare Festival, held in Ashland, is also a tourist draw, as is the Oregon Vortex and the Wolf Creek Inn State Heritage Site, a historic inn where Jack London wrote his 1913 novel Valley of the Moon.

name: oregon
sentence: Oregon has also historically been a popular region for film shoots due to its diverse landscapes, as well as its proximity to Hollywood (see List of films shot in Oregon).

name: oregon
sentence: Movies filmed in Oregon include: Animal House, Free Willy, The General, The Goonies, Kindergarten Cop, One Flew Over the Cuckoo's Nest, and Stand By Me.

name: oregon
sentence: Oregon native Matt Groening, creator of The Simpsons, has incorporated many references from his hometown of Portland into the TV series.

name: oregon
sentence: Additionally, several television shows have been filmed throughout the state including Portlandia, Grimm, Bates Motel, and Leverage.

name: oregon
sentence: The Oregon Film Museum is located in the old Clatsop County Jail in Astoria.

name: oregon
sentence: High technology industries located in Silicon Forest have been a major employer since the 1970s.

name: oregon
sentence: Tektronix was the largest private employer in Oregon until the late 1980s.

name: oregon
sentence: Intel's creation and expansion of several facilities in eastern Washington County continued the growth that Tektronix had started.

name: oregon
sentence: Intel, the state's largest for-profit private employer, operates four large facilities, with Ronler Acres, Jones Farm and Hawthorn Farm all located in Hillsboro.

name: oregon
sentence: The spinoffs and startups that were produced by these two companies led to establishment of the so-called Silicon Forest.

name: oregon
sentence: The recession and dot-com bust of 2001 hit the region hard

name: oregon
sentence: Open Source Development Labs made news in 2004 when they hired Linus Torvalds, developer of the Linux kernel.

name: oregon
sentence: In 2010, biotechnology giant Genentech opened a $400 million facility in Hillsboro to expand its production capabilities.

name: oregon
sentence: Oregon is home to several large datacenters that take advantage of cheap power and a climate conducive to reducing cooling costs.

name: oregon
sentence: Google operates a large datacenter in The Dalles, and Facebook built a large datacenter near Prineville in 2010.

name: oregon
sentence: Amazon opened a datacenter near Boardman in 2011, and a fulfillment center in Troutdale in 2018.

name: oregon
sentence: Oregon is also the home of large corporations in other industries.

name: oregon
sentence: The world headquarters of Nike are located near Beaverton.

name: oregon
sentence: Medford is home to Harry and David, which sells gift items under several brands.

name: oregon
sentence: Medford is also home to the national headquarters of Lithia Motors.

name: oregon
sentence: Portland is home to one of the West's largest trade book publishing houses, Graphic Arts Center Publishing.

name: oregon
sentence: Oregon is also home to Mentor Graphics Corporation, a world leader in electronic design automation located in Wilsonville and employs roughly 4,500 people worldwide.

name: oregon
sentence: Adidas Corporations American Headquarters is located in Portland and employs roughly 900 full-time workers at its Portland campus.

name: oregon
sentence: Nike, located in Beaverton, employs roughly 5,000 full-time employees at its 200-acre (81 ha) campus.

name: oregon
sentence: Nike's Beaverton campus is continuously ranked as a top employer in the Portland area-along with competitor Adidas.

name: oregon
sentence: Intel Corporation employs 18,600 in Oregon with the majority of these employees located at the company's Hillsboro campus located about 30 minutes west of Portland.

name: oregon
sentence: Intel has been a top employer in Oregon since 1974.

name: oregon
sentence: The US Federal Government and Providence Health systems are respective contenders for top employers in Oregon with roughly 12,000 federal workers and 14,000 Providence Health workers.

name: oregon
sentence: In 2015, a total of seven companies headquartered in Oregon landed in the Fortune 1000: Nike, at 106; Precision Castparts Corp. at 302; Lithia Motors at 482; StanCorp Financial Group at 804; Schnitzer Steel Industries at 853; The Greenbrier Companies at 948; and Columbia Sportswear at 982.

name: oregon
sentence: Oregon's biennial state budget, $2.6 billion in 2017, comprises General Funds, Federal Funds, Lottery Funds, and Other Funds.

name: oregon
sentence: Oregon is one of only five states that have no sales tax.

name: oregon
sentence: Oregon voters have been resolute in their opposition to a sales tax, voting proposals down each of the nine times they have been presented.

name: oregon
sentence: The last vote, for 1993's Measure 1, was defeated by a 75–25% margin.

name: oregon
sentence: The state also has a minimum corporate tax of only $150 a year, amounting to 5.6% of the General Fund in the 2005–07 biennium; data about which businesses pay the minimum is not available to the public.

name: oregon
sentence: As a result, the state relies on property and income taxes for its revenue.

name: oregon
sentence: Oregon has the fifth highest personal income tax in the nation.

name: oregon
sentence: According to the US Census Bureau, Oregon ranked 41st out of the 50 states in taxes per capita in 2005 with an average amount paid of 1,791.45.

name: oregon
sentence: A few local governments levy sales taxes on services: the city of Ashland, for example, collects a 5% sales tax on prepared food.

name: oregon
sentence: The City of Portland imposes an Arts Education and Access Income Tax on residents over 18—a flat tax of $35 collected from individuals earning $1,000 or more per year and residing in a household with an annual income exceeding the federal poverty level.

name: oregon
sentence: The tax funds Portland school teachers, and art focused non-profit organizations in Portland.

name: oregon
sentence: The State of Oregon also allows transit district to levy an income tax on employers and the self-employed.

name: oregon
sentence: The State currently collects the tax for TriMet and the Lane Transit District.

name: oregon
sentence: Oregon is one of six states with a revenue limit.

name: oregon
sentence: The "kicker law" stipulates that when income tax collections exceed state economists' estimates by two percent or more, any excess must be returned to taxpayers.

name: oregon
sentence: Since the enactment of the law in 1979, refunds have been issued for seven of the eleven biennia.

name: oregon
sentence: In 2000, Ballot Measure 86 converted the "kicker" law from statute to the Oregon Constitution, and changed some of its provisions.

name: oregon
sentence: Federal payments to county governments that were granted to replace timber revenue when logging in National Forests was restricted in the 1990s, have been under threat of suspension for several years.

name: oregon
sentence: This issue dominates the future revenue of rural counties, which have come to rely on the payments in providing essential services.

name: oregon
sentence: 55% of state revenues are spent on public education, 23% on human services (child protective services, Medicaid, and senior services), 17% on public safety, and 5% on other services.

name: oregon
sentence: For health insurance, as of 2018 Cambia Health Solutions has the highest market share at 21%, followed by Providence Health.

name: oregon
sentence: In the Portland region, Kaiser Permanente leads.

name: oregon
sentence: Providence and Kaiser are vertically integrated delivery systems which operate hospitals and offer insurance plans.

name: oregon
sentence: Aside from Providence and Kaiser, hospital systems which are primarily Oregon-based include Legacy Health mostly covering Portland, Samaritan Health Services with five hospitals in various areas across the state, and Tuality Healthcare in the western Portland metropolitan area.

name: oregon
sentence: In Southern Oregon, Asante runs several hospitals, including Rogue Regional Medical Center.

name: oregon
sentence: Some hospitals are operated by multi-state organizations such as PeaceHealth and CommonSpirit Health.

name: oregon
sentence: Some hospitals such Salem Hospital operate independently of larger systems.

name: oregon
sentence: Oregon Health & Science University is a Portland-based medical school which operates two hospitals and clinics.

name: oregon
sentence: The Oregon Health Plan is the state's Medicaid managed care plan, and it is known for innovations.

name: oregon
sentence: The Portland area is a mature managed care and two-thirds of Medicare enrollees are in Medicare Advantage plans.

name: oregon
sentence: The United States Census Bureau estimates that the population of Oregon was 4,217,737 on July 1, 2019, a 10.09% increase over the 2010 census.

name: oregon
sentence: Oregon was the nation's "Top Moving Destination" in 2014, with two families moving into the state for every one moving out (66.4% to 33.6%).

name: oregon
sentence: Oregon was also the top moving destination in 2013, and the second-most popular destination in 2010 through 2012.

name: oregon
sentence: As of the 2010 census, the population of Oregon was 3,831,074.

name: oregon
sentence: The gender makeup of the state was 49.5% male and 50.5% female.

name: oregon
sentence: 22.6% of the population were under the age of 18

name: oregon
sentence: The table below shows the racial composition of Oregon's population as of 2016.

name: oregon
sentence: According to the 2016 American Community Survey, 12.4% of Oregon's population were of Hispanic or Latino origin (of any race): Mexican (10.4%), Puerto Rican (0.3%), Cuban (0.1%), and other Hispanic or Latino origin (1.5%).

name: oregon
sentence: The five largest ancestry groups were: German (19.1%), Irish (11.7%), English (11.3%), American (5.3%), and Norwegian (3.8%).

name: oregon
sentence: The state's most populous ethnic group, non-Hispanic white, has declined from 95.8% in 1970 to 77.8% in 2012.

name: oregon
sentence: As of 2011, 38.7% of Oregon's children under one year of age belonged to minority groups, meaning they had at least one parent who was not a non-Hispanic white.

name: oregon
sentence: Of the state's total population, 22.6% was under the age 18, and 77.4% were 18 or older.

name: oregon
sentence: The center of population of Oregon is located in Linn County, in the city of Lyons.

name: oregon
sentence: Around 60% of Oregon's population resides within the Portland metropolitan area.

name: oregon
sentence: As of 2009, Oregon's population comprised 361,393 foreign-born residents.

name: oregon
sentence: Of the foreign-born residents, the three largest groups are originally from countries in: Latin America (47.8%), Asia (27.4%), and Europe (16.5%).

name: oregon
sentence: Oregon has frequently been cited by statistical agencies for having a smaller percentage of religious communities than other US states.

name: oregon
sentence: According to a 2009 Gallup poll, Oregon was paired with Vermont as the two "least religious" states in the United States.

name: oregon
sentence: In the same 2009 Gallup poll, 69% of Oregonians identified themselves as being Christian.

name: oregon
sentence: The largest Christian denominations in Oregon by number of adherents in 2010 were the Roman Catholic Church with 398,738; The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints with 147,965; and the Assemblies of God with 45,492.

name: oregon
sentence: Oregon also contains the largest community of Russian Old Believers to be found in the United States.

name: oregon
sentence: Judaism is the largest non-Christian religion in Oregon with more than 50,000 adherents, 47,000 of whom live in the Portland area.

name: oregon
sentence: Recently, new kosher food and Jewish educational offerings have led to a rapid increase in Portland's Orthodox Jewish population.

name: oregon
sentence: The Northwest Tibetan Cultural Association is headquartered in Portland.

name: oregon
sentence: There are an estimated 6,000 to 10,000 Muslims in Oregon, most of whom live in and around Portland.

name: oregon
sentence: Most of the remainder of the population had no religious affiliation; the 2008 American Religious Identification Survey (ARIS) placed Oregon as tied with Nevada in fifth place of US states having the highest percentage of residents identifying themselves as "non-religious", at 24 percent.

name: oregon
sentence: Secular organizations include the Center for Inquiry (CFI), the Humanists of Greater Portland (HGP), and the United States Atheists (USA).

name: oregon
sentence: During much of the 1990s, a group of conservative Christians formed the Oregon Citizens Alliance, and unsuccessfully tried to pass legislation to prevent "gay sensitivity training" in public schools and legal benefits for homosexual couples.

name: oregon
sentence: Projections from the US Census Bureau show Oregon's population increasing to 4,833,918 by 2030, an increase of 41.3% compared to the state's population of 3,421,399 in 2000.

name: oregon
sentence: The state's own projections forecast a total population of 5,425,408 in 2040.

name: oregon
sentence: In the 2013–2014 school year, the state had 567,000 students in public schools.

name: oregon
sentence: There were 197 public school districts, served by 19 education service districts.

name: oregon
sentence: In 2016, the largest school districts in the state were: Portland Public Schools, comprising 47,323 students; Salem-Keizer School District, comprising 40,565 students; Beaverton School District, comprising 39,625 students; Hillsboro School District, comprising 21,118 students; and North Clackamas School District, comprising 17,053 students.

name: oregon
sentence: Approximately 90.5% of Oregon high school students graduate, improving on the national average of 88.3% as measured from the 2010 United States Census.

name: oregon
sentence: Especially since the 1990 passage of Measure 5, which set limits on property tax levels, Oregon has struggled to fund higher education.

name: oregon
sentence: Since then, Oregon has cut its higher education budget and now ranks 46th in the country in state spending per student.

name: oregon
sentence: However, 2007 legislation funded the university system far beyond the governor's requested budget though still capping tuition increases at 3% per year.

name: oregon
sentence: Oregon supports a total of seven public universities and one affiliate.

name: oregon
sentence: It is home to three public research universities: The University of Oregon (UO) in Eugene and Oregon State University (OSU) in Corvallis, both classified as research universities with very high research activity, and Portland State University which is classified as a research university with high research activity.

name: oregon
sentence: UO is the state's highest nationally ranked and most selective public university by US News & World Report and Forbes.

name: oregon
sentence: OSU is the state's only land-grant university, has the state's largest enrollment for fall 2014, and is the state's highest ranking university according to Academic Ranking of World Universities, Washington Monthly, and QS World University Rankings.

name: oregon
sentence: OSU receives more annual funding for research than all other public higher education institutions in Oregon combined.

name: oregon
sentence: The state's urban Portland State University has Oregon's second largest enrollment.

name: oregon
sentence: The state has three regional universities: Western Oregon University in Monmouth, Southern Oregon University in Ashland, and Eastern Oregon University in La Grande.

name: oregon
sentence: The Oregon Institute of Technology has its campus in Klamath Falls.

name: oregon
sentence: The quasi-public Oregon Health & Science University (OHSU) includes medical, dental, and nursing schools, and graduate programs in biomedical sciences in Portland and a science and engineering school in Hillsboro.

name: oregon
sentence: The state also supports 17 community colleges.

name: oregon
sentence: Oregon is home to a wide variety of private colleges, the majority of which are located in the Portland area.

name: oregon
sentence: The University of Portland and Marylhurst University are both Catholic universities located in or near Portland, affiliated with the Congregation of Holy Cross, and the Sisters of the Holy Names of Jesus and Mary, respectively.

name: oregon
sentence: Reed College, a rigorous liberal arts college in Portland, was ranked by Forbes as the 52nd best college in the country in 2015.

name: oregon
sentence: Other private institutions in Portland include Lewis & Clark College; Multnomah University; Portland Bible College; Warner Pacific College; Cascade College; the National University of Natural Medicine; and Western Seminary, a theological graduate school.

name: oregon
sentence: Pacific University is in the Portland suburb of Forest Grove.

name: oregon
sentence: There are also private colleges further south in the Willamette Valley.

name: oregon
sentence: McMinnville is home to Linfield College, while nearby Newberg is home to George Fox University.

name: oregon
sentence: Salem is home to two private schools: Willamette University (the state's oldest, established during the provisional period) and Corban University.

name: oregon
sentence: Also located near Salem is Mount Angel Seminary, one of America's largest Roman Catholic seminaries.

name: oregon
sentence: The state's second medical school, the College of Osteopathic Medicine of the Pacific, Northwest, is located in Lebanon.

name: oregon
sentence: Eugene is home to three private colleges: Northwest Christian University, New Hope Christian College, and Gutenberg College.

name: oregon
sentence: Oregon is home to three major professional sports teams: the Portland Trail Blazers of the NBA, the Portland Thorns of the NWSL and the Portland Timbers of MLS.

name: oregon
sentence: Until 2011, the only major professional sports team in Oregon was the Portland Trail Blazers of the National Basketball Association.

name: oregon
sentence: From the 1970s to the 1990s, the Blazers were one of the most successful teams in the NBA in terms of both win-loss record and attendance.

name: oregon
sentence: In the early 21st century, the team's popularity declined due to personnel and financial issues, but revived after the departure of controversial players and the acquisition of new players such as Brandon Roy and LaMarcus Aldridge, and still later Damian Lillard.

name: oregon
sentence: The Blazers play in the Moda Center in Portland's Lloyd District, which also is home to the Portland Winterhawks of the junior Western Hockey League.

name: oregon
sentence: The Portland Timbers play at Providence Park, just west of downtown Portland.

name: oregon
sentence: The Timbers have a strong following, with the team regularly selling out its games.

name: oregon
sentence: The Timbers repurposed the formerly multi-use stadium into a soccer-specific stadium in fall 2010, increasing the seating in the process.

name: oregon
sentence: The Timbers operate Portland Thorns FC, a women's soccer team that has played in the National Women's Soccer League since the league's first season in 2013.

name: oregon
sentence: The Thorns, who also play at Providence Park, have won two league championships, in the inaugural 2013 season and also in 2017, and have been by far the NWSL's attendance leader in each of the league's seasons.

name: oregon
sentence: Eugene, Salem and Hillsboro have minor-league baseball teams: the Eugene Emeralds, the Salem-Keizer Volcanoes, and the Hillsboro Hops all play in the Single-A Northwest League.

name: oregon
sentence: Portland has had minor-league baseball teams in the past, including the Portland Beavers and Portland Rockies, who played most recently at Providence Park when it was known as PGE Park.

name: oregon
sentence: The Oregon State Beavers and the University of Oregon Ducks football teams of the Pac-12 Conference meet annually in the Civil War.

name: oregon
sentence: Both schools have had recent success in other sports as well: Oregon State won back-to-back college baseball championships in 2006 and 2007, winning a third in 2018; and the University of Oregon won back-to-back NCAA men's cross country championships in 2007 and 2008.

name: pennsylvania
sentence: Pennsylvania ( (listen) PEN-səl-VAY-nee-ə) (Pennsylvania German: Pennsilfaani), officially the Commonwealth of Pennsylvania, is a state in the Mid-Atlantic, Appalachian, and Great Lakes regions of the Northeastern United States.

name: pennsylvania
sentence: The Commonwealth is bordered by Delaware to the southeast, Maryland to the south, West Virginia to the southwest, Ohio to the west, Lake Erie and the Canadian province of Ontario to the northwest, New York to the north, and New Jersey to the east, while the Appalachian Mountains run through its middle.

name: pennsylvania
sentence: Pennsylvania is the 33rd-largest state by area, and the 5th-most populous state according to the most recent official US Census count in 2010.

name: pennsylvania
sentence: It is the 9th-most densely populated of the 50 states.

name: pennsylvania
sentence: Pennsylvania's two most populous cities are Philadelphia (1,580,863), and Pittsburgh (302,407).

name: pennsylvania
sentence: The state capital and its 13th-largest city is Harrisburg.

name: pennsylvania
sentence: Pennsylvania has 140 miles (225 km) of waterfront along Lake Erie and the Delaware River.

name: pennsylvania
sentence: The state is one of the 13 original founding states of the United States; it came into being in 1681 as a result of a royal land grant to William Penn, the son of the state's namesake.

name: pennsylvania
sentence: Part of Pennsylvania (along the Delaware River), together with the present State of Delaware, had earlier been organized as the Colony of New Sweden.

name: pennsylvania
sentence: It was the second state to ratify the United States Constitution, on December 12, 1787.

name: pennsylvania
sentence: Independence Hall, where the United States Declaration of Independence and United States Constitution were drafted, is located in Philadelphia, the state's largest city.

name: pennsylvania
sentence: During the American Civil War, the Battle of Gettysburg was fought in the south central region of the state.

name: pennsylvania
sentence: Valley Forge near Philadelphia was General Washington's headquarters during the bitter winter of 1777–78.

name: pennsylvania
sentence: Pennsylvania is 170 miles (274 km) north to south and 283 miles (455 km) east to west.

name: pennsylvania
sentence: Of a total 46,055 square miles (119,282 km2), 44,817 square miles (116,075 km2) are land, 490 square miles (1,269 km2) are inland waters, and 749 square miles (1,940 km2) are waters in Lake Erie.

name: pennsylvania
sentence: It is the 33rd-largest state in the United States.Pennsylvania has 51 miles (82 km) of coastline along Lake Erie and 57 miles (92 km) of shoreline along the Delaware Estuary.

name: pennsylvania
sentence: Of the original Thirteen Colonies, Pennsylvania is the only state that does not border the Atlantic Ocean.

name: pennsylvania
sentence: The boundaries of the state are the Mason–Dixon line (39°43' N) to the south, the Twelve-Mile Circle on the Pennsylvania-Delaware border, the Delaware River to the east, 80°31' W to the west and the 42° N to the north, except for a short segment on the western end, where a triangle extends north to Lake Erie.

name: pennsylvania
sentence: Cities include Philadelphia, Reading, Lebanon and Lancaster in the southeast, Pittsburgh in the southwest, the tri-cities of Allentown, Bethlehem, and Easton in the central east (known as the Lehigh Valley).

name: pennsylvania
sentence: The northeast includes the former anthracite coal mining cities of Scranton, Wilkes-Barre, Pittston, Nanticoke, and Hazleton.

name: pennsylvania
sentence: Erie is located in the northwest.

name: pennsylvania
sentence: State College serves the central region while Williamsport serves the commonwealth's north-central region as does Chambersburg the south-central region, with York, Carlisle, and the state capital Harrisburg on the Susquehanna River in the east-central region of the Commonwealth and Altoona and Johnstown in the west-central region.

name: pennsylvania
sentence: The state has five geographical regions, namely the Allegheny Plateau, Ridge and Valley, Atlantic Coastal Plain, Piedmont, and the Erie Plain.

name: pennsylvania
sentence: Pennsylvania's diverse topography also produces a variety of climates, though the entire state experiences cold winters and humid summers.

name: pennsylvania
sentence: Straddling two major zones, the majority of the state, except for the southeastern corner, has a humid continental climate (Köppen climate classification Dfa).

name: pennsylvania
sentence: The southern portion of the state has a humid subtropical climate.

name: pennsylvania
sentence: The largest city, Philadelphia, has some characteristics of the humid subtropical climate (Köppen Cfa) that covers much of Delaware and Maryland to the south.

name: pennsylvania
sentence: Summers are generally hot and humid.

name: pennsylvania
sentence: Moving toward the mountainous interior of the state, the winter climate becomes colder, the number of cloudy days increases, and snowfall amounts are greater.

name: pennsylvania
sentence: Western areas of the state, particularly locations near Lake Erie, can receive over 100 inches (250 cm) of snowfall annually, and the entire state receives plentiful precipitation throughout the year.

name: pennsylvania
sentence: The state may be subject to severe weather from spring through summer into autumn.

name: pennsylvania
sentence: Tornadoes occur annually in the state, sometimes in large numbers, such as 30 recorded tornadoes in 2011; generally speaking, these tornadoes do not cause significant damage.

name: pennsylvania
sentence: Historically, as of 1600, the tribes living in Pennsylvania were the Algonquian Lenape (also Delaware), the Iroquoian Susquehannock, and Petun (also Tionontati, Kentatentonga, Tobacco, Wenro) and the presumably Siouan Monongahela Culture, who may have been the same as a little known tribe called the Calicua, or Cali.

name: pennsylvania
sentence: Other tribes who entered the region during the colonial era were the Trockwae, Tutelo, Saponi, Shawnee, Nanticoke, Conoy Piscataway, Iroquois Confederacy—likely among others.

name: pennsylvania
sentence: Other tribes, like the Erie, may have once held land in Pennsylvania, but no longer did so by the year 1600.

name: pennsylvania
sentence: Both the Dutch and the English claimed both sides of the Delaware River as part of their colonial lands in America.

name: pennsylvania
sentence: The Dutch were the first to take possession.

name: pennsylvania
sentence: By June 3, 1631, the Dutch had begun settling the Delmarva Peninsula by establishing the Zwaanendael Colony on the site of present-day Lewes, Delaware.

name: pennsylvania
sentence: In 1638, Sweden established the New Sweden Colony, in the region of Fort Christina, on the site of present-day Wilmington, Delaware.

name: pennsylvania
sentence: New Sweden claimed and, for the most part, controlled the lower Delaware River region (parts of present-day Delaware, New Jersey, and Pennsylvania) but settled few colonists there.

name: pennsylvania
sentence: On March 12, 1664, King Charles II of England gave James, Duke of York a grant that incorporated all lands included in the original Virginia Company of Plymouth Grant plus other lands.

name: pennsylvania
sentence: This grant was in conflict with the Dutch claim for New Netherland, which included parts of today's Pennsylvania.

name: pennsylvania
sentence: On June 24, 1664, the Duke of York sold the portion of his large grant that included present-day New Jersey to John Berkeley and George Carteret for a proprietary colony.

name: pennsylvania
sentence: The land was not yet in British possession, but the sale boxed in the portion of New Netherland on the West side of the Delaware River.

name: pennsylvania
sentence: The British conquest of New Netherland began on August 29, 1664, when New Amsterdam was coerced to surrender while facing cannons on British ships in New York Harbor.

name: pennsylvania
sentence: This conquest continued, and was completed in October 1664, when the British captured Fort Casimir in what today is New Castle, Delaware.

name: pennsylvania
sentence: The Peace of Breda between England, France and the Netherlands confirmed the English conquest on July 21, 1667, although there were temporary reversions.

name: pennsylvania
sentence: On September 12, 1672, during the Third Anglo-Dutch War, the Dutch re-conquered New York Colony/New Amsterdam, establishing three County Courts, which went on to become original Counties in present-day Delaware and Pennsylvania.

name: pennsylvania
sentence: The one that later transferred to Pennsylvania was Upland.

name: pennsylvania
sentence: This was partially reversed on February 9, 1674, when the Treaty of Westminster ended the Third Anglo-Dutch War, and reverted all political situations to the status quo ante bellum.

name: pennsylvania
sentence: The British retained the Dutch Counties with their Dutch names.

name: pennsylvania
sentence: By June 11, 1674, New York reasserted control over the outlying colonies, including Upland, but the names started to be changed to British names by November 11, 1674.

name: pennsylvania
sentence: Upland was partitioned on November 12, 1674, producing the general outline of the current border between Pennsylvania and Delaware.

name: pennsylvania
sentence: On February 28, 1681, Charles II granted a land charter to William Penn to repay a debt of £16,000 (around £2,100,000 in 2008, adjusting for retail inflation) owed to William's father, Admiral William Penn.

name: pennsylvania
sentence: This was one of the largest land grants to an individual in history.

name: pennsylvania
sentence: The King named it Pennsylvania (literally "Penn's Woods") in honor of Admiral Penn; the Admiral's son who proposed that the land be called New Wales and then, after objections, Sylvania (from the Latin silva: "forest, woods"), was embarrassed at the change from the latter proposed form, fearing that people would think he had named it after himself, but King Charles would not rename the grant.

name: pennsylvania
sentence: Penn established a government with two innovations that were much copied in the New World: the county commission and freedom of religious conviction.

name: pennsylvania
sentence: What had been Upland on what became the Pennsylvania side of the Pennsylvania-Delaware Border was renamed as Chester County when Pennsylvania instituted their colonial governments on March 4, 1681.

name: pennsylvania
sentence: The Quaker leader William Penn had signed a peace treaty with Tammany, leader of the Delaware tribe, beginning a long period of friendly relations between the Quakers and the Indians.

name: pennsylvania
sentence: Additional treaties between Quakers and other tribes followed.

name: pennsylvania
sentence: The treaty of William Penn was never violated.

name: pennsylvania
sentence: Between 1730 and when it was shut down by Parliament with the Currency Act of 1764, the Pennsylvania Colony made its own paper money to account for the shortage of actual gold and silver.

name: pennsylvania
sentence: The paper money was called Colonial Scrip.

name: pennsylvania
sentence: The Colony issued "bills of credit", which were as good as gold or silver coins because of their legal tender status.

name: pennsylvania
sentence: Since they were issued by the government and not a banking institution, it was an interest-free proposition, largely defraying the expense of the government and therefore taxation of the people.

name: pennsylvania
sentence: It also promoted general employment and prosperity, since the Government used discretion and did not issue too much to inflate the currency.

name: pennsylvania
sentence: Benjamin Franklin had a hand in creating this currency, of which he said its utility was never to be disputed, and it also met with the "cautious approval" of Adam Smith.

name: pennsylvania
sentence: James Smith wrote that in 1763, "the Indians again commenced hostilities, and were busily engaged in killing and scalping the frontier inhabitants in various parts of Pennsylvania."

name: pennsylvania
sentence: Further, "This state was then a Quaker government, and at the first of this war the frontiers received no assistance from the state."

name: pennsylvania
sentence: The ensuing hostilities became known as Pontiac's War.

name: pennsylvania
sentence: After the Stamp Act Congress of 1765, Delegate John Dickinson of Philadelphia wrote the Declaration of Rights and Grievances.

name: pennsylvania
sentence: The Congress was the first meeting of the Thirteen Colonies, called at the request of the Massachusetts Assembly, but only nine colonies sent delegates.

name: pennsylvania
sentence: Dickinson then wrote Letters from a Farmer in Pennsylvania, To the Inhabitants of the British Colonies, which were published in the Pennsylvania Chronicle between December 2, 1767, and February 15, 1768.

name: pennsylvania
sentence: When the Founding Fathers of the United States convened in Philadelphia in 1774, 12 colonies sent representatives to the First Continental Congress.

name: pennsylvania
sentence: The Second Continental Congress, which also met in Philadelphia (in May 1775), drew up and signed the Declaration of Independence in Philadelphia, but when that city was captured by the British, the Continental Congress escaped westward, meeting at the Lancaster courthouse on Saturday, September 27, 1777, and then to York.

name: pennsylvania
sentence: There they and its primary author, John Dickinson, drew up the Articles of Confederation that formed 13 independent States into a new union.

name: pennsylvania
sentence: Later, the Constitution was written, and Philadelphia was once again chosen to be cradle to the new American Union.

name: pennsylvania
sentence: The Constitution was drafted and signed at the Pennsylvania State House, now known as Independence Hall, and the same building where the Declaration of Independence was signed.

name: pennsylvania
sentence: Pennsylvania became the first large state, and the second state to ratify the US Constitution on December 12, 1787, five days after Delaware became the first.

name: pennsylvania
sentence: At the time it was the most ethnically and religiously diverse of the thirteen States.

name: pennsylvania
sentence: Because one-third of Pennsylvania's population spoke German, the Constitution was presented in German to include those citizens in the discussion.

name: pennsylvania
sentence: Reverend Frederick Muhlenberg acted as the chairman of the state's ratifying convention.

name: pennsylvania
sentence: Dickinson College of Carlisle was the first college founded after the States united.

name: pennsylvania
sentence: Established in 1773, the college was ratified five days after the Treaty of Paris on September 9, 1783.

name: pennsylvania
sentence: The school was founded by Benjamin Rush and named after John Dickinson.

name: pennsylvania
sentence: For half a century, the Commonwealth's General Assembly (legislature) met at various places in the general Philadelphia area before starting to meet regularly in Independence Hall in Philadelphia for 63 years.

name: pennsylvania
sentence: But it needed a more central location, as for example the Paxton Boys massacres of 1763 had made the legislature aware.

name: pennsylvania
sentence: So, in 1799 the General Assembly moved to the Lancaster Courthouse, and finally in 1812 to Harrisburg.

name: pennsylvania
sentence: The General Assembly met in the old Dauphin County Court House until December 1821, when the Federal-style "Hills Capitol" (named for its builder, Stephen Hills, a Lancaster architect) was constructed on a hilltop land grant of four acres set aside for a seat of state government by the prescient, entrepreneurial son and namesake of John Harris, Sr., a Yorkshire native who had founded a trading post in 1705 and ferry (1733) on the east shore of the Susquehanna River.

name: pennsylvania
sentence: The Hills Capitol burned down on February 2, 1897, during a heavy snowstorm, presumably because of a faulty flue.

name: pennsylvania
sentence: The General Assembly met at Grace Methodist Church on State Street (still standing) until a new capitol could be built.

name: pennsylvania
sentence: Following an architectural selection contest that many alleged had been "rigged", Chicago architect Henry Ives Cobb was charged with designing and building a replacement building; however, the legislature had little money to allocate to the project, and a roughly finished, somewhat industrial building (the Cobb Capitol) was completed.

name: pennsylvania
sentence: The General Assembly refused to occupy the building.

name: pennsylvania
sentence: Political and popular indignation in 1901 prompted a second contest that was restricted to Pennsylvania architects, and Joseph Miller Huston of Philadelphia was chosen to design the present Pennsylvania State Capitol that incorporated Cobb's building into magnificent public work finished and dedicated in 1907.

name: pennsylvania
sentence: The new state Capitol drew rave reviews.

name: pennsylvania
sentence: Its dome was inspired by the domes of St. Peter's Basilica in Rome and the United States Capitol.

name: pennsylvania
sentence: President Theodore Roosevelt called it "the most beautiful state Capital in the nation" and said, "It's the handsomest building I ever saw" at the dedication.

name: pennsylvania
sentence: In 1989, The New York Times praised it as "grand, even awesome at moments, but it is also a working building, accessible to citizens ... a building that connects with the reality of daily life".

name: pennsylvania
sentence: James Buchanan, of Franklin County, the only bachelor president of the United States (1857–1861), was the only one to be born in Pennsylvania.

name: pennsylvania
sentence: The Battle of Gettysburg—the major turning point of the Civil War—took place near Gettysburg.

name: pennsylvania
sentence: An estimated 350,000 Pennsylvanians served in the Union Army forces including 8,600 African American military volunteers.

name: pennsylvania
sentence: Pennsylvania was also the home of the first commercially drilled oil well.

name: pennsylvania
sentence: In 1859, near Titusville, Pennsylvania, Edwin Drake successfully drilled the well, which led to the first major oil boom in United States history.

name: pennsylvania
sentence: At the beginning of the 20th century, Pennsylvania's economy centered on steel production, logging, coal mining, textile production and other forms of industrial manufacturing.

name: pennsylvania
sentence: A surge in immigration to the US during the late 19th and early 20th centuries provided a steady flow of cheap labor for these industries, which often employed children and people who could not speak English.

name: pennsylvania
sentence: In 1923, President Calvin Coolidge established the Allegheny National Forest under the authority of the Weeks Act of 1911.

name: pennsylvania
sentence: The forest is located in the northwest part of the state in Elk, Forest, McKean, and Warren Counties for the purposes of timber production and watershed protection in the Allegheny River basin.

name: pennsylvania
sentence: The Allegheny is the state's only national forest.

name: pennsylvania
sentence: The Three Mile Island accident was the most significant nuclear accident in US commercial nuclear power plant history.

name: pennsylvania
sentence: United Airlines Flight 93 crashed into a field near Shanksville during the September 11th attacks, killing 44.

name: pennsylvania
sentence: Within the first half of 2003, the annual Tekko commences in Pittsburgh.

name: pennsylvania
sentence: In October 2018, the Tree of Life – Or L'Simcha Congregation experienced the Pittsburgh synagogue shooting.

name: pennsylvania
sentence: As of 2019, Pennsylvania has an estimated population of 12,801,989, which is a decrease of 5,071 from the previous year and an increase of 99,610 since the year 2010.

name: pennsylvania
sentence: Net migration to other states resulted in a decrease of 27,718, and immigration from other countries resulted in an increase of 127,007.

name: pennsylvania
sentence: Net migration to the Commonwealth was 98,289.

name: pennsylvania
sentence: Migration of native Pennsylvanians resulted in a decrease of 100,000 people.

name: pennsylvania
sentence: From 2008 to 2012, 5.8% of the population was foreign-born.

name: pennsylvania
sentence: Of the people residing in Pennsylvania, 74.5% were born in Pennsylvania, 18.4% were born in a different US state, 1.5% were born in Puerto Rico, US Island areas, or born abroad to American parent(s), and 5.6% were foreign born.

name: pennsylvania
sentence: Foreign-born Pennsylvanians are largely from Asia (36.0%), Europe (35.9%), and Latin America (30.6%), with the remainder from Africa (5%), North America (3.1%), and Oceania (0.4%).

name: pennsylvania
sentence: The largest ancestry groups are listed below, expressed as a percentage of total people who responded with a particular ancestry for the 2010 census:

name: pennsylvania
sentence: As of 2011, 32.1% of Pennsylvania's population younger than age 1 were minorities.

name: pennsylvania
sentence: Pennsylvania's Hispanic population grew by 82.6% between 2000 and 2010, making it one of the largest increases in a state's Hispanic population.

name: pennsylvania
sentence: The significant growth of the Hispanic population is due to immigration to the state mainly from Puerto Rico, which is a US territory, but to a lesser extent from countries such as the Dominican Republic, Mexico, and various Central and South American nations, as well as from the wave of Hispanics leaving New York and New Jersey for safer and more affordable living.

name: pennsylvania
sentence: The Asian population swelled by almost 60%, which was fueled by Indian, Vietnamese, and Chinese immigration, as well the many Asian transplants moving to Philadelphia from New York.

name: pennsylvania
sentence: The rapid growth of this community has given Pennsylvania one of the largest Asian populations in the nation by numerical values.

name: pennsylvania
sentence: The Black and African American population grew by 13%, which was the largest increase in that population amongst the state's peers (New York, New Jersey, Ohio, Illinois, and Michigan).

name: pennsylvania
sentence: Twelve other states saw decreases in their White populations.

name: pennsylvania
sentence: The state has a high in-migration of black and Hispanic people from other nearby states, with eastern and south-central portions of the state seeing the bulk of the increases.

name: pennsylvania
sentence: The majority of Hispanics in Pennsylvania are of Puerto Rican descent, having one of the largest and fastest-growing Puerto Rican populations in the country.

name: pennsylvania
sentence: Most of the remaining Hispanic population is made up of Mexicans and Dominicans.

name: pennsylvania
sentence: Most Hispanics are concentrated in Philadelphia, Lehigh Valley and South Central Pennsylvania.

name: pennsylvania
sentence: Pennsylvania's reported population of Hispanics, especially among the Black race, has markedly increased in recent years.

name: pennsylvania
sentence: The Hispanic population is greatest in Bethlehem, Allentown, Reading, Lancaster, York, and around Philadelphia.

name: pennsylvania
sentence: It is not clear how much of this change reflects a changing population and how much reflects increased willingness to self-identify minority status.

name: pennsylvania
sentence: As of 2010, it is estimated that about 85% of all Hispanics in Pennsylvania live within a 150-mile (240 km) radius of Philadelphia, with about 20% living within the city itself.

name: pennsylvania
sentence: Of the black population, the vast majority in the state are African American, being descendants of African slaves brought to the US south during the colonial era.

name: pennsylvania
sentence: There are also a growing number of blacks of West Indian, recent African, and Hispanic origins.

name: pennsylvania
sentence: Most blacks live in the Philadelphia area, Pittsburgh, and South Central Pennsylvania.

name: pennsylvania
sentence: Whites make up the majority of Pennsylvania; they are mostly descended from German, Irish, Scottish, Welsh, Italian, and English immigrants.

name: pennsylvania
sentence: Rural portions of South Central Pennsylvania are famous nationwide for their notable Amish communities.

name: pennsylvania
sentence: The Wyoming Valley, consisting of Scranton and Wilkes-Barre, has the highest percentage of white residents of any metropolitan area (with a population of 500,000 or above) in the US, with 96.2% of its population claiming to be white with no Hispanic background.

name: pennsylvania
sentence: The center of population of Pennsylvania is located in Perry County, in the borough of Duncannon.

name: pennsylvania
sentence: The state had the fourth-highest proportion of elderly (65+) citizens in 2010—15.4%, as compared to 13.0% nationwide.

name: pennsylvania
sentence: According to US Census Bureau estimates, the state's poverty rate was 12.5% in 2017, compared to 13.4% for the United States as a whole.

name: pennsylvania
sentence: Note: Births in table do not add up because Hispanics are counted both by their ethnicity and by their race, giving a higher overall number.

name: pennsylvania
sentence: As of 2010, 90.2% (10,710,239) of Pennsylvania residents age 5 and older spoke English at home as a primary language, while 4.1% (486,058) spoke Spanish, 0.8% (103,502) German (which includes Pennsylvania Dutch) and 0.5% (56,052) Chinese (which includes Mandarin) of the population over the age of five.

name: pennsylvania
sentence: In total, 9.9% (1,170,628) of Pennsylvania's population age 5 and older spoke a mother language other than English.

name: pennsylvania
sentence: Pennsylvania German is often—even though misleadingly—called "Pennsylvania Dutch".

name: pennsylvania
sentence: The term Dutch used to mean "German" (including the Netherlands), before the Latin name for them replaced it (but stuck with the Netherlands).

name: pennsylvania
sentence: When referring to the language spoken by the Pennsylvania Dutch people (Pennsylvania German) it means "German" or "Teutonic" rather than "Netherlander".

name: pennsylvania
sentence: Germans, in their own language, call themselves "Deutsch", (Pennsylvania German: "Deitsch").

name: pennsylvania
sentence: The Pennsylvania German language is a descendant of German, in the West Central German dialect family.

name: pennsylvania
sentence: It is closest to Palatine German.

name: pennsylvania
sentence: Pennsylvania German is still very vigorous as a first language among Old Order Amish and Old Order Mennonites (principally in the Lancaster County area), whereas it is almost extinct as an everyday language outside the plain communities, though a few words have passed into English usage.

name: pennsylvania
sentence: Of all the colonies, only Rhode Island had religious freedom as secure as in Pennsylvania.

name: pennsylvania
sentence: Voltaire, writing of William Penn in 1733, observed: "The new sovereign also enacted several wise and wholesome laws for his colony, which have remained invariably the same to this day.

name: pennsylvania
sentence: The chief is, to ill-treat no person on account of religion, and to consider as brethren all those who believe in one God."

name: pennsylvania
sentence: One result of this uncommon freedom was a wide religious diversity, which continues to the present.

name: pennsylvania
sentence: Pennsylvania's population in 2010 was 12,702,379.

name: pennsylvania
sentence: Of these, 6,838,440 (53.8%) were estimated to belong to some sort of organized religion.

name: pennsylvania
sentence: According to the Association of religion data archives (ARDA) at Pennsylvania State University, the largest religions in Pennsylvania by adherents are the Roman Catholic Church with 3,503,028 adherents, the United Methodist Church with 591,734 members, and the Evangelical Lutheran Church in America with 501,974 members.

name: pennsylvania
sentence: The fourth-largest single denomination is the Presbyterian Church (USA) with 250,000 members and 1,011 congregations.

name: pennsylvania
sentence: Pennsylvania, especially its western part and the Pittsburgh area, has one of the highest percentages of Presbyterians in the nation.

name: pennsylvania
sentence: The Presbyterian Church in America is also significant, with 112 congregations and 23,000 adherents; the EPC has around 50 congregations, as well as the ECO.

name: pennsylvania
sentence: The fourth-largest Protestant denomination, the United Church of Christ, has 180,000 members and 627 congregations.

name: pennsylvania
sentence: American Baptist Churches USA (Northern Baptist Convention) is based in King of Prussia, Pennsylvania.

name: pennsylvania
sentence: Pennsylvania was the center state of the German Reformed denomination from the 1700s.

name: pennsylvania
sentence: Bethlehem, Pennsylvania, is one of the headquarters of the Moravian Church in America.

name: pennsylvania
sentence: Pennsylvania also has a very large Amish population, second only to Ohio among the states.

name: pennsylvania
sentence: In the year 2000 there was a total Amish population of 47,860 in Pennsylvania and a further 146,416 Mennonites and 91,200 Brethren.

name: pennsylvania
sentence: The total Anabapist population including Bruderhof was 232,631, about two percent of the population.

name: pennsylvania
sentence: While Pennsylvania owes its existence to Quakers, and much of the historic character of the Commonwealth is ideologically rooted in the teachings of the Religious Society of Friends (as they are officially known), practicing Quakers are a small minority of about 10,000 adherents in 2010.

name: pennsylvania
sentence: As of 2014, the religious affiliations of the people of Pennsylvania are:

name: pennsylvania
sentence: According to a 2016 Gallup poll, 38% of Pennsylvanians are very religious, 29% are moderately religious, and 34% are non-religious.

name: pennsylvania
sentence: Pennsylvania's 2018 total gross state product (GSP) of $803 billion ranks the state 6th in the nation.

name: pennsylvania
sentence: If Pennsylvania were an independent country, its economy would rank as the 19th-largest in the world.

name: pennsylvania
sentence: On a per-capita basis, Pennsylvania's 2016 per-capita GSP of $50,665 (in chained 2009 dollars) ranks 22nd among the fifty states.

name: pennsylvania
sentence: Total employment 2016

name: pennsylvania
sentence: Total employer establishments

name: pennsylvania
sentence: Philadelphia in the southeast corner, Pittsburgh in the southwest corner, Erie in the northwest corner, Scranton-Wilkes-Barre in the northeast corner, and Allentown-Bethlehem-Easton in the east central region are urban manufacturing centers.

name: pennsylvania
sentence: Much of the Commonwealth is rural

name: pennsylvania
sentence: Philadelphia is home to six Fortune 500 companies, with more located in suburbs like King of Prussia; it is a leader in the financial and insurance industry.

name: pennsylvania
sentence: Pittsburgh is home to eight Fortune 500 companies, including US Steel, PPG Industries, and H.J.

name: pennsylvania
sentence: Heinz.

name: pennsylvania
sentence: In all, Pennsylvania is home to fifty Fortune 500 companies.Hershey is home to The Hershey Company, one of the largest chocolate manufacturers in the world.

name: pennsylvania
sentence: Erie is also home to GE Transportation, which is the largest producer of train locomotives in the United States.

name: pennsylvania
sentence: As in the US as a whole and in most states, the largest private employer in the Commonwealth is Walmart, followed by the University of Pennsylvania.

name: pennsylvania
sentence: Pennsylvania is also home to the oldest investor-owned utility company in the US, The York Water Company.

name: pennsylvania
sentence: As of May 2020, the state's unemployment rate is 13.1%.

name: pennsylvania
sentence: The first nationally chartered bank in the United States, the Bank of North America, was founded in 1781 in Philadelphia.

name: pennsylvania
sentence: After a series of mergers, the Bank of North America is part of Wells Fargo, which uses national charter 1.

name: pennsylvania
sentence: Pennsylvania is also the home to the first nationally chartered bank under the 1863 National Banking Act.

name: pennsylvania
sentence: That year, the Pittsburgh Savings & Trust Company received a national charter and renamed itself the First National Bank of Pittsburgh as part of the National Banking Act.

name: pennsylvania
sentence: That bank is still in existence today as PNC Financial Services and remains based in Pittsburgh.

name: pennsylvania
sentence: PNC is the state's largest bank and the sixth-largest in the United States.

name: pennsylvania
sentence: Pennsylvania ranks 19th overall in agricultural production.

name: pennsylvania
sentence: It also ranks 8th in the nation in Winemaking.

name: pennsylvania
sentence: The Pennsylvania Department of Agriculture worked with private companies to establish "PA Preferred" as a way to brand agricultural products grown or made in the state to support and promote Pennsylvania products and locally grown food.

name: pennsylvania
sentence: The financial impact of agriculture in Pennsylvania includes employment of more than 66,800 people employed by the food manufacturing industry; and over $1.7 billion in food product export (in 2011).

name: pennsylvania
sentence: Casino gambling was legalized in Pennsylvania in 2004.

name: pennsylvania
sentence: Currently, there are nine casinos across the state with three under construction or in planning.

name: pennsylvania
sentence: Only horse racing, slot machines and electronic table games were legal in Pennsylvania, although a bill to legalize table games was being negotiated in the fall of 2009.

name: pennsylvania
sentence: Table games such as poker, roulette, blackjack, and craps were finally approved by the state legislature in January 2010, being signed into law by the Governor on January 7.

name: pennsylvania
sentence: Former Governor Ed Rendell had considered legalizing video poker machines in bars and private clubs in 2009 since an estimated 17,000 operate illegally across the state.

name: pennsylvania
sentence: Under this plan, any establishment with a liquor license would be allowed up to five machines.

name: pennsylvania
sentence: All machines would be connected to the state's computer system, like commercial casinos.

name: pennsylvania
sentence: The state would impose a 50% tax on net gambling revenues, after winning players have been paid, with the remaining 50% going to the establishment owners.

name: pennsylvania
sentence: The Pennsylvania Film Production Tax Credit began in 2004 and stimulated the development of a film industry in the state.

name: pennsylvania
sentence: Pennsylvania has had five constitutions during its statehood: 1776, 1790, 1838, 1874, and 1968.

name: pennsylvania
sentence: Before that the province of Pennsylvania was governed for a century by a Frame of Government, of which there were four versions: 1682, 1683, 1696, and 1701.

name: pennsylvania
sentence: The capital of Pennsylvania is Harrisburg.

name: pennsylvania
sentence: The legislature meets in the State Capitol there.

name: pennsylvania
sentence: The current Governor is Tom Wolf.

name: pennsylvania
sentence: The other elected officials composing the executive branch are the Lieutenant Governor John Fetterman, Attorney General Joshua Shapiro, Auditor General Timothy DeFoor, and Pennsylvania Treasurer Stacy Garrity.

name: pennsylvania
sentence: The Governor and Lieutenant Governor run as a ticket in the general election and are up for re-election every four years during the midterm elections.

name: pennsylvania
sentence: The elections for Attorney General, Auditor General, and Treasurer are held every four years coinciding with a Presidential election.

name: pennsylvania
sentence: Pennsylvania has a bicameral legislature set up by Commonwealth's constitution in 1790.

name: pennsylvania
sentence: The original Frame of Government of William Penn had a unicameral legislature.

name: pennsylvania
sentence: The General Assembly includes 50 Senatortors and 203 Representatives.

name: pennsylvania
sentence: Joe Scarnati is currently President Pro Tempore of the State Senatorte, Jake Corman the Majority Leader, and Jay Costa the Minority Leader.

name: pennsylvania
sentence: Bryan Cutler is Speaker of the House of Representatives, with Kerry A. Benninghoff as Majority Leader and Frank Dermody as Minority Leader.

name: pennsylvania
sentence: As of the 2018 elections, the Republicans hold the majority in the State House and Senatorte.

name: pennsylvania
sentence: Pennsylvania is divided into 60 judicial districts, most of which (except Philadelphia) have magisterial district judges (formerly called district justices and justices of the peace), who preside mainly over preliminary hearings in felony and misdemeanor offenses, all minor (summary) criminal offenses, and small civil claims.

name: pennsylvania
sentence: Most criminal and civil cases originate in the Courts of Common Pleas, which also serve as appellate courts to the district judges and for local agency decisions.

name: pennsylvania
sentence: The Superior Court hears all appeals from the Courts of Common Pleas not expressly designated to the Commonwealth Court or Supreme Court.

name: pennsylvania
