sentence: The average person spent $118 per day: 29% on transportation, 24% on food, 17% on accommodation, and 28% on shopping and entertainment.

name: tennessee
sentence: Tennessee is home to the Great Smoky Mountains National Park, the most visited national park in the United States.

name: tennessee
sentence: The park anchors a large tourism industry based primarily in nearby Gatlinburg and Pigeon Forge, which consists of such attractions as Dollywood, the most visited ticketed attraction in Tennessee, Ober Gatlinburg, and Ripley's Aquarium of the Smokies.

name: tennessee
sentence: Major attractions in Memphis include Graceland, the home of Elvis Presley, Beale Street, the National Civil Rights Museum, the Memphis Zoo, and the Stax Museum of American Soul Music.

name: tennessee
sentence: Nashville contains many attractions related to its musical heritage, including Lower Broadway, the Country Music Hall of Fame, the Ryman Auditorium, Grand Ole Opry, and the Gaylord Opryland Resort.

name: tennessee
sentence: Other major attractions in Nashville include the Tennessee State Museum, Parthenon, and the Belle Meade Plantation.

name: tennessee
sentence: Major attractions in Chattanooga include Lookout Mountain, the Chattanooga Choo-Choo Hotel, Ruby Falls, and the Tennessee Aquarium, the largest freshwater aquarium in the United States.

name: tennessee
sentence: Other major attractions include the American Museum of Science and Energy in Oak Ridge, the Bristol Motor Speedway in Bristol, Jack Daniel's Distillery in Lynchburg, and the Hiwassee and Ocoee rivers in Polk County.

name: tennessee
sentence: Tennessee is home to five National Scenic Byways, including the Natchez Trace Parkway, the East Tennessee Crossing Byway, the Great River Road, The Trace, and the Cherohala Skyway.

name: tennessee
sentence: Four Civil War battlefields in Tennessee are preserved by the National Park Service: Chickamauga and Chattanooga National Military Park, Stones River National Battlefield, Shiloh National Military Park, and Fort Donelson National Battlefield.

name: tennessee
sentence: Big South Fork National River and Recreation Area is within the Cumberland Mountains in northeastern Tennessee.

name: tennessee
sentence: Other major attractions preserved by the National Park Service include Cumberland Gap National Historical Park and Overmountain Victory National Historic Trail.

name: tennessee
sentence: Tennessee's electric utilities are regulated monopolies, as in many other states.

name: tennessee
sentence: As of 2019, the Tennessee Valley Authority owned over 90% of generating capacity.

name: tennessee
sentence: Nuclear power is the largest source of electricity generation in Tennessee, producing about 43.7% of its power in 2019.

name: tennessee
sentence: The same year, 22.9% of the power was produced by coal, 20.3% from natural gas, 12.1% from hydroelectric power, and 1.6% from other renewables.

name: tennessee
sentence: About 56% of the electricity generated in Tennessee produces no greenhouse gas emissions.

name: tennessee
sentence: Tennessee is a net consumer of electricity, receiving power from other TVA facilities in neighboring states such as the Browns Ferry Nuclear Plant in northern Alabama.

name: tennessee
sentence: Tennessee is home to the two newest civilian nuclear power reactors in the United States, at Watts Bar Nuclear Plant in Rhea County.

name: tennessee
sentence: Unit 1 began operation in 1996 and Unit 2 began operation in 2016, making it the first and only new nuclear power reactor to begin operation in the United States in the 21st century.

name: tennessee
sentence: As of 2020, officials at Oak Ridge National Laboratory and the TVA are studying advancements in nuclear power as an energy source, including small modular reactors, in a joint effort.

name: tennessee
sentence: Tennessee was also an early leader in hydroelectric power, first with the now defunct Chattanooga and Tennessee Electric Power Company; later, the United States Army Corps of Engineers and the TVA constructed several hydroelectric dams on Tennessee rivers.

name: tennessee
sentence: Today, Tennessee is the third-largest hydroelectric power-producing state east of the Rocky Mountains.

name: tennessee
sentence: Tennessee has very little petroleum and natural gas reserves, but is home to one oil refinery, in Memphis.

name: tennessee
sentence: Bituminous coal is mined in small quantities in the Cumberland Plateau and Cumberland Mountains.

name: tennessee
sentence: There are sizable reserves of lignite coal in West Tennessee that remain untapped.

name: tennessee
sentence: Coal production in Tennessee peaked in 1972, and today less than 0.1% of coal production in the United States comes from Tennessee mines.

name: tennessee
sentence: Tennessee is the leading producer of ball clay in the United States.

name: tennessee
sentence: Other major mineral products produced in Tennessee include sand, gravel, crushed stone, Portland cement, marble, sandstone, common clay, lime, and zinc.

name: tennessee
sentence: The Copper Basin, in Tennessee's southeastern corner in Polk County, was one of the most productive copper mining districts in the United States between the 1840s and 1980s.

name: tennessee
sentence: Mines in the basin supplied about 90% of the copper used by the Confederacy during the Civil War, and also marketed chemical byproducts of the mining, including sulfuric acid.

name: tennessee
sentence: Mining activities in the basin resulted in a major environmental disaster, which left the landscape in the basin barren for more than a century.

name: tennessee
sentence: Iron ore was another major mineral mined in Tennessee until the early 20th century.

name: tennessee
sentence: Tennessee was also a top producer of phosphate until the early 1990s.

name: tennessee
sentence: Tennessee has played a critical role in the development of many forms of American popular music, including rock and roll, blues, country, and rockabilly.

name: tennessee
sentence: Beale Street in Memphis is considered by many to be the birthplace of the blues, with musicians such as W. C. Handy performing in its clubs as early as 1909.

name: tennessee
sentence: Memphis was historically home to Sun Records, where musicians such as Elvis Presley, Johnny Cash, Carl Perkins, Jerry Lee Lewis, Roy Orbison, and Charlie Rich began their recording careers, and where rock and roll took shape in the 1950s.

name: tennessee
sentence: The 1927 Victor recording sessions in Bristol generally mark the beginning of the country music genre and the rise of the Grand Ole Opry in the 1930s helped make Nashville the center of the country music recording industry.

name: tennessee
sentence: Multiple brick-and-mortar museums recognize Tennessee's role in nurturing various forms of popular music: the Memphis Rock N' Soul Museum, the Country Music Hall of Fame and Museum and National Museum of African American Music in Nashville, and the International Rock-A-Billy Museum in Jackson.

name: tennessee
sentence: Moreover, the Rockabilly Hall of Fame, an online site recognizing the development of rockabilly in which Tennessee played a crucial role, is based in Nashville.

name: tennessee
sentence: Notable writers with ties to Tennessee include Cormac McCarthy, Peter Taylor, James Agee, Francis Hodgson Burnett, Thomas S. Stribling, Ida B.

name: tennessee
sentence: Wells, Nikki Giovanni, Shelby Foote, Ann Patchett, Ishmael Reed, and Randall Jarrell.

name: tennessee
sentence: Tennessee is home to four major professional sports franchises: the Tennessee Titans have played in the National Football League since 1997, the Memphis Grizzlies have played in the National Basketball Association since 2001, the Nashville Predators have played in the National Hockey League since 1998, and Nashville SC has played in Major League Soccer since 2020.

name: tennessee
sentence: The state is also home to eight teams playing in minor leagues.

name: tennessee
sentence: Four Minor League Baseball teams call the state their home.

name: tennessee
sentence: The Memphis Redbirds and Nashville Sounds, each of the Pacific Coast League, compete at the Triple-A level, the highest before Major League Baseball.

name: tennessee
sentence: The Chattanooga Lookouts and Tennessee Smokies play in the Double-A Southern League.

name: tennessee
sentence: The Knoxville Ice Bears are a minor league ice hockey team of the Southern Professional Hockey League.

name: tennessee
sentence: Memphis 901 FC, a soccer team, joined the USL Championship in 2019.

name: tennessee
sentence: Chattanooga Red Wolves SC became an inaugural member of the third-level USL League One in 2019.

name: tennessee
sentence: Chattanooga FC began play in the National Independent Soccer Association in 2020.

name: tennessee
sentence: In Knoxville, the Tennessee Volunteers college team has played in the Southeastern Conference (SEC) of the National Collegiate Athletic Association since the conference was formed in 1932.

name: tennessee
sentence: The football team has won 13 SEC championships and 28 bowls, including four Sugar Bowls, three Cotton Bowls, an Orange Bowl and a Fiesta Bowl.

name: tennessee
sentence: Meanwhile, the men's basketball team has won four SEC championships and reached the NCAA Elite Eight in 2010.

name: tennessee
sentence: In addition, the women's basketball team has won a host of SEC regular-season and tournament titles along with eight national titles.

name: tennessee
sentence: In Nashville, the Vanderbilt Commodores are also charter members of the SEC.

name: tennessee
sentence: The Tennessee–Vanderbilt football rivalry began in 1892, having since played more than a hundred times.

name: tennessee
sentence: In June 2014, the Vanderbilt Commodores baseball team won its first men's national championship by winning the 2014 College World Series.

name: tennessee
sentence: The state is home to 10 other NCAA Division I programs.

name: tennessee
sentence: Two of these participate in the top level of college football, the Football Bowl Subdivision.

name: tennessee
sentence: The Memphis Tigers are members of the American Athletic Conference, and the Middle Tennessee Blue Raiders from Murfreesboro play in Conference USA.

name: tennessee
sentence: In addition to the Commodores, Nashville is also home to the Belmont Bruins and Tennessee State Tigers, both members of the Ohio Valley Conference (OVC), and the Lipscomb Bisons, members of the Atlantic Sun Conference.

name: tennessee
sentence: Tennessee State plays football in Division I's second level, the Football Championship Subdivision (FCS), while Belmont and Lipscomb do not have football teams.

name: tennessee
sentence: Belmont and Lipscomb have an intense rivalry in men's and women's basketball known as the Battle of the Boulevard, with both schools' men's and women's teams playing two games each season against each other (a rare feature among non-conference rivalries).

name: tennessee
sentence: The OVC also includes the Austin Peay Governors from Clarksville, the UT Martin Skyhawks from Martin, and the Tennessee Tech Golden Eagles from Cookeville.

name: tennessee
sentence: These three schools, along with fellow OVC member Tennessee State, play each season in football for the Sgt.

name: tennessee
sentence: York Trophy.

name: tennessee
sentence: The Chattanooga Mocs and Johnson City's East Tennessee State Buccaneers are full members, including football, of the Southern Conference.

name: tennessee
sentence: Tennessee is also home to Bristol Motor Speedway which features NASCAR Cup Series racing two weekends a year, routinely selling out more than 160,000 seats on each date; it also was the home of the Nashville Superspeedway, which held Nationwide and IndyCar races until it was shut down in 2012.

name: tennessee
sentence: Tennessee's only graded stakes horse race, the Iroquois Steeplechase, is also held in Nashville each May.

name: tennessee
sentence: The FedEx St. Jude Classic is a PGA Tour golf tournament held at Memphis since 1958.

name: tennessee
sentence: The US National Indoor Tennis Championships has been held at Memphis since 1976 (men's) and 2002 (women's).

name: tennessee
sentence: Interstate 40 crosses the state in an east–west orientation.

name: tennessee
sentence: Its branch interstate highways include I-240 in Memphis

name: tennessee
sentence: I-26, although technically an east–west interstate, runs from the North Carolina border below Johnson City to its terminus at Kingsport.

name: tennessee
sentence: I-24 is an east–west interstate that runs from Chattanooga to Clarksville.

name: tennessee
sentence: In a north–south orientation are highways I-55, I-65, I-75, and I-81.

name: tennessee
sentence: Interstate 65 crosses the state through Nashville, while Interstate 75 serves Chattanooga and Knoxville and Interstate 55 serves Memphis.

name: tennessee
sentence: Interstate 81 enters the state at Bristol and terminates at its junction with I-40 near Dandridge.

name: tennessee
sentence: I-155 is a branch highway from I-55.

name: tennessee
sentence: The only spur highway of I-75 in Tennessee is I-275, which is in Knoxville.

name: tennessee
sentence: An extension of I-69 is proposed to travel through the western part of the state, from South Fulton to Memphis.

name: tennessee
sentence: A branch interstate, I-269 also exists from Millington to Collierville.

name: tennessee
sentence: Major airports within the state include Memphis International Airport (MEM), Nashville International Airport (BNA), McGhee Tyson Airport (TYS) outside of Knoxville in Blount County, Chattanooga Metropolitan Airport (CHA), Tri-Cities Regional Airport (TRI), and McKellar-Sipes Regional Airport (MKL), in Jackson.

name: tennessee
sentence: Because Memphis International Airport is the major hub for FedEx Corporation, it is the world's largest air cargo operation.

name: tennessee
sentence: For passenger rail service, Memphis and Newbern, are served by the Amtrak City of New Orleans line on its run between Chicago, Illinois, and New Orleans, Louisiana.

name: tennessee
sentence: Nashville is served by the Music City Star commuter rail service.

name: tennessee
sentence: Cargo services in Tennessee are primarily served by CSX Transportation, which has a hump yard in Nashville called Radnor Yard.

name: tennessee
sentence: Norfolk Southern Railway operates lines in East Tennessee, through cities including Knoxville and Chattanooga, and operates a classification yard near Knoxville, the John Sevier Yard.

name: tennessee
sentence: BNSF operates a major intermodal facility in Memphis.

name: tennessee
sentence: Similar to the United States Federal Government, Tennessee's government has three parts.

name: tennessee
sentence: The Executive Branch is led by Tennessee's governor, who holds office for a four-year term and may serve a maximum of two consecutive terms.

name: tennessee
sentence: The governor is the only official who is elected statewide.

name: tennessee
sentence: Unlike most states, the state does not elect the lieutenant governor directly; the Tennessee Senatorte elects its Speaker, who serves as lieutenant governor.

name: tennessee
sentence: The governor is supported by 22 cabinet-level departments, most headed by a commissioner who serves at the pleasure of the governor:

name: tennessee
sentence: The Executive Branch also includes several agencies, boards and commissions, some of which are under the auspices of one of the cabinet-level departments.

name: tennessee
sentence: The bicameral Legislative Branch, known as the Tennessee General Assembly, consists of the 33-member Senatorte and the 99-member House of Representatives.

name: tennessee
sentence: Senatortors serve four-year terms, and House members serve two-year terms.

name: tennessee
sentence: Each chamber chooses its own speaker.

name: tennessee
sentence: The speaker of the state Senatorte also holds the title of lieutenant governor.

name: tennessee
sentence: Constitutional officials in the legislative branch are elected by a joint session of the legislature.

name: tennessee
sentence: The highest court in Tennessee is the state Supreme Court.

name: tennessee
sentence: It has a chief justice and four associate justices.

name: tennessee
sentence: No more than two justices can be from the same Grand Division.

name: tennessee
sentence: The Supreme Court of Tennessee also appoints the Attorney General, a practice not found in any of the other 49 states.

name: tennessee
sentence: Both the Court of Appeals and the Court of Criminal Appeals have 12 judges.

name: tennessee
sentence: A number of local, circuit, and federal courts provide judicial services.

name: tennessee
sentence: Tennessee's current state constitution was adopted in 1870.

name: tennessee
sentence: The state had two earlier constitutions.

name: tennessee
sentence: The first was adopted in 1796, the year Tennessee joined the union, and the second was adopted in 1834.

name: tennessee
sentence: The 1870 Constitution outlaws martial law within its jurisdiction.

name: tennessee
sentence: This may be a result of the experience of Tennessee residents and other Southerners during the period of military control by Union (Northern) forces of the US government after the American Civil War.

name: tennessee
sentence: Tennessee politics, like that of most US states, are dominated by the Republican and the Democratic parties.

name: tennessee
sentence: Historian Dewey W. Grantham traces divisions in the state to the period of the American Civil War; for decades afterward, the eastern third of the state was heavily Republican and the western two thirds mostly voted Democratic.

name: tennessee
sentence: This division was related to the state's pattern of farming, plantations and slaveholding.

name: tennessee
sentence: The eastern section was made up of yeoman farmers, but Middle and West Tennessee farmers cultivated crops such as tobacco and cotton which were dependent on the use of slave labor.

name: tennessee
sentence: These areas became defined as Democratic after the war.

name: tennessee
sentence: During Reconstruction, freedmen and former free people of color were granted the right to vote; most joined the Republican Party.

name: tennessee
sentence: Numerous African Americans were elected to local offices, and some to state office.

name: tennessee
sentence: Following Reconstruction, Tennessee continued to have competitive party politics, but in the 1880s, the white-dominated state government passed four laws, the last of which imposed a poll tax requirement for voter registration.

name: tennessee
sentence: These served to disenfranchise most African Americans, and their power in state and local politics was markedly reduced.

name: tennessee
sentence: In 1900 African Americans comprised 23.8 percent of the state's population, concentrated in Middle and West Tennessee.

name: tennessee
sentence: In the early 1900s, the state legislature approved a form of commission government for cities based on at-large voting for a few positions on a Board of Commission; several cities adopted this as another means to limit African-American political participation.

name: tennessee
sentence: In 1913 the state legislature enacted a bill enabling cities to adopt this structure without legislative approval.

name: tennessee
sentence: After disenfranchisement of blacks, the Republican Party in Tennessee became a primarily white sectional party supported only in the eastern part of the state.

name: tennessee
sentence: In the 20th century, except for two nationwide Republican landslides of the 1920s (in 1920, when Tennessee narrowly supported Warren G. Harding over Ohio Governor James Cox, and in 1928, when it more decisively voted for Herbert Hoover over New York Governor Al Smith), the state was part of the Democratic Solid South until the 1950s.

name: tennessee
sentence: In that postwar decade, it twice voted for Republican Dwight D. Eisenhower, former Allied Commander of the Armed Forces during World War II.

name: tennessee
sentence: Since then, more of the state's voters have shifted to supporting Republicans, and Democratic presidential candidates have carried Tennessee only four times.

name: tennessee
sentence: By 1960 African Americans comprised 16.45% of the state's population.

name: tennessee
sentence: It was not until after the mid-1960s and passage of the Voting Rights Act of 1965 that they were able to vote in full again, but new devices, such as at-large commission city governments, had been adopted in several jurisdictions to limit their political participation.

name: tennessee
sentence: Former Gov.

name: tennessee
sentence: Winfield Dunn and former US Senator Bill Brock wins in 1970 helped make the Republican Party competitive among whites for the statewide victory.

name: tennessee
sentence: Tennessee has selected governors from different parties since 1970.

name: tennessee
sentence: In the early 21st century, Republican voters control most of the state, especially in the more rural and suburban areas outside of the cities; Democratic strength is mostly confined to the urban cores of the four major cities, and is particularly strong in the cities of Nashville and Memphis.

name: tennessee
sentence: The latter area includes a large African-American population.

name: tennessee
sentence: Historically, Republicans had their greatest strength in East Tennessee before the 1960s.

name: tennessee
sentence: Tennessee's 1st and 2nd congressional districts, based in the Tri-Cities and Knoxville, respectively, are among the few historically Republican districts in the South.

name: tennessee
sentence: Those districts' residents supported the Union over the Confederacy during the Civil War

name: tennessee
sentence: The first has been in Republican hands continuously since 1881, and Republicans (or their antecedents) have held it for all but four years since 1859.

name: tennessee
sentence: The second has been held continuously by Republicans or their antecedents since 1859.

name: tennessee
sentence: In the 2000 presidential election, Vice President Al Gore, a Democratic US

name: tennessee
sentence: Senatortor from Tennessee, failed to carry his home state, an unusual occurrence but indicative of strengthening Republican support.

name: tennessee
sentence: Republican George W. Bush received increased support in 2004, with his margin of victory in the state increasing from 4% in 2000 to 14% in 2004.

name: tennessee
sentence: Democratic presidential nominees from Southern states, such as Lyndon B. Johnson, Jimmy Carter, and Bill Clinton, usually fare better than their Northern counterparts do in Tennessee, especially among split-ticket voters outside the metropolitan areas.

name: tennessee
sentence: Tennessee sends nine members to the US House of Representatives, of whom there are seven Republicans and two Democrats.

name: tennessee
sentence: Lieutenant Governor Ron Ramsey is the first Republican speaker of the state Senatorte in 140 years.

name: tennessee
sentence: In the 2008 elections, the Republican party gained control of both houses of the Tennessee state legislature for the first time since Reconstruction.

name: tennessee
sentence: In 2008, some 30% of the state's electorate identified as independents.

name: tennessee
sentence: The Baker v. Carr (1962) decision of the US Supreme Court established the principle of "one man, one vote", requiring state legislatures to redistrict to bring Congressional apportionment in line with decennial censuses.

name: tennessee
sentence: It also required both houses of state legislatures to be based on population for representation and not geographic districts such as counties.

name: tennessee
sentence: This case arose out of a lawsuit challenging the longstanding rural bias of apportionment of seats in the Tennessee legislature.

name: tennessee
sentence: After decades in which urban populations had been underrepresented in many state legislatures, this significant ruling led to an increased (and proportional) prominence in state politics by urban and, eventually, suburban, legislators and statewide officeholders in relation to their population within the state.

name: tennessee
sentence: The ruling also applied to numerous other states long controlled by rural minorities, such as Alabama, Vermont, and Montana.

name: tennessee
sentence: The state of Tennessee maintains four dedicated law enforcement entities: the Tennessee Highway Patrol, the Tennessee Wildlife Resources Agency (TWRA), the Tennessee Bureau of Investigation (TBI), and the Tennessee Department of Environment and Conservation (TDEC).

name: tennessee
sentence: The Highway Patrol is the primary law enforcement entity that concentrates on highway safety regulations and general non-wildlife state law enforcement and is under the jurisdiction of the Tennessee Department of Safety.

name: tennessee
sentence: The TWRA is an independent agency tasked with enforcing all wildlife, boating, and fisheries regulations outside of state parks.

name: tennessee
sentence: The TBI maintains state-of-the-art investigative facilities and is the primary state-level criminal investigative department.

name: tennessee
sentence: Tennessee State Park Rangers are responsible for all activities and law enforcement inside the Tennessee State Parks system.

name: tennessee
sentence: Local law enforcement is divided between County Sheriff's Offices and Municipal Police Departments.

name: tennessee
sentence: Tennessee's Constitution requires that each County have an elected Sheriff.

name: tennessee
sentence: In 94 of the 95 counties the Sheriff is the chief law enforcement officer in the county and has jurisdiction over the county as a whole.

name: tennessee
sentence: Each Sheriff's Office is responsible for warrant service, court security, jail operations and primary law enforcement in the unincorporated areas of a county as well as providing support to the municipal police departments.

name: tennessee
sentence: Incorporated municipalities are required to maintain a police department to provide police services within their corporate limits.

name: tennessee
sentence: The three counties in Tennessee to adopt metropolitan governments have taken different approaches to resolving the conflict that a Metro government presents to the requirement to have an elected Sheriff.

name: tennessee
sentence: Gun laws in Tennessee regulate the sale, possession, and use of firearms and ammunition.

name: tennessee
sentence: Concealed carry and open-carry of a handgun is permitted with a Tennessee handgun carry permit or an equivalent permit from a reciprocating state.

name: tennessee
sentence: As of July 1, 2014, a permit is no longer required to possess a loaded handgun in a motor vehicle.

name: tennessee
sentence: Capital punishment has existed in Tennessee at various times since statehood.

name: tennessee
sentence: Before 1913, the method of execution was hanging.

name: tennessee
sentence: From 1913 to 1915, there was a hiatus on executions but they were reinstated in 1916 when electrocution became the new method.

name: tennessee
sentence: From 1972 to 1978, after the Supreme Court ruled (Furman v. Georgia) capital punishment unconstitutional, there were no further executions.

name: tennessee
sentence: Capital punishment was restarted in 1978, although those prisoners awaiting execution between 1960 and 1978 had their sentences mostly commuted to life in prison.

name: tennessee
sentence: From 1916 to 1960 the state executed 125 inmates.

name: tennessee
sentence: For a variety of reasons there were no further executions until 2000.

name: tennessee
sentence: Since 2000, Tennessee has executed seven prisoners.

name: tennessee
sentence: Tennessee has 59 prisoners on death row (as of October 2018).

name: tennessee
sentence: Lethal injection was approved by the legislature in 1998, though those who were sentenced to death before January 1, 1999, may request electrocution.

name: tennessee
sentence: In May 2014, the Tennessee General Assembly passed a law allowing the use of the electric chair for death row executions when lethal injection drugs are not available.

name: tennessee
sentence: The Mississippi Band of Choctaw Indians is the only federally recognized Native American Indian tribe in the state.

name: tennessee
sentence: It owns 79 acres (32 ha) in Henning, which was placed into federal trust by the tribe in 2012.

name: tennessee
sentence: This is governed directly by the tribe.

name: tennessee
sentence: Tennessee has a rich variety of public, private, charter, and specialized education facilities ranging from pre-school through university.

name: tennessee
sentence: In 2015, state legislators began efforts on the "Drive to 55" movement, which plans to increase the number of college-educated residents to at least 55% of the state's population.

name: tennessee
sentence: Then Governor Bill Haslam signed legislation that started the Tennessee Promise program.

name: tennessee
sentence: Tennessee Promise, if students meet its requirements, allows in-state high school graduates to enroll in two-year post-secondary education programs such as associate's degrees and certificates at community colleges and trade schools in Tennessee tuition-free, funded by the state lottery.

name: tennessee
sentence: Public higher education is under the oversight of the Tennessee Higher Education Commission which provides guidance to two public university systems—the University of Tennessee system and the Tennessee Board of Regents.

name: tennessee
sentence: In addition a number of private colleges and universities are located throughout the state.

name: tennessee
sentence: Public primary and secondary education systems are operated by county, city, or special school districts to provide education at the local level.

name: tennessee
sentence: These school districts operate under the direction of the Tennessee Department of Education.

name: tennessee
sentence: Private schools are found in many counties.

name: tennessee
sentence: Over 250 public and private museums are located in Tennessee, including renowned museums such as the Brooks Museum, Pink Palace Museum and Planetarium, Country Music Hall of Fame, and Discovery Park of America.

name: tennessee
sentence: State symbols, found in Tennessee Code Annotated; Title 4, Chapter 1, Part 3, include:

name: texas
sentence: Texas (, also locally ; Spanish: Texas or Tejas, pronounced [ˈtexas] (listen)) is a state in the South Central Region of the United States.

name: texas
sentence: It is the second largest US state by both area (after Alaska) and population (after California).

name: texas
sentence: Texas shares borders with the states of Louisiana to the east, Arkansas to the northeast, Oklahoma to the north, New Mexico to the west, and the Mexican states of Chihuahua, Coahuila, Nuevo León, and Tamaulipas to the south and southwest, and has a coastline with the Gulf of Mexico to the southeast.

name: texas
sentence: Houston is the most populous city in Texas and the fourth largest in the US, while San Antonio is the second-most populous in the state and seventh largest in the US Dallas–Fort Worth and Greater Houston are the fourth and fifth largest metropolitan statistical areas in the country, respectively.

name: texas
sentence: Other major cities include Austin, the second-most populous state capital in the US, and El Paso.

name: texas
sentence: Texas is nicknamed the "Lone Star State" for its former status as an independent republic, and as a reminder of the state's struggle for independence from Mexico.

name: texas
sentence: The "Lone Star" can be found on the Texas state flag and on the Texas state seal.

name: texas
sentence: The origin of Texas's name is from the word táyshaʼ, which means "friends" in the Caddo language.

name: texas
sentence: Due to its size and geologic features such as the Balcones Fault, Texas contains diverse landscapes common to both the US Southern and the Southwestern regions.

name: texas
sentence: Although Texas is popularly associated with the US southwestern deserts, less than ten percent of Texas's land area is desert.

name: texas
sentence: Most of the population centers are in areas of former prairies, grasslands, forests, and the coastline.

name: texas
sentence: Traveling from east to west, one can observe terrain that ranges from coastal swamps and piney woods, to rolling plains and rugged hills, and finally the desert and mountains of the Big Bend.

name: texas
sentence: The term "six flags over Texas" refers to several nations that have ruled over the territory.

name: texas
sentence: Spain was the first European country to claim and control the area of Texas.

name: texas
sentence: France held a short-lived colony.

name: texas
sentence: Mexico controlled the territory until 1836 when Texas won its independence, becoming the Republic of Texas.

name: texas
sentence: In 1845, Texas joined the union as the 28th state.

name: texas
sentence: The state's annexation set off a chain of events that led to the Mexican–American War in 1846.

name: texas
sentence: A slave state before the American Civil War, Texas declared its secession from the US in early 1861, and officially joined the Confederate States of America on March 2 of the same year.

name: texas
sentence: After the Civil War and the restoration of its representation in the federal government, Texas entered a long period of economic stagnation.

name: texas
sentence: Historically four major industries shaped the Texas economy prior to World War II: cattle and bison, cotton, timber, and oil.

name: texas
sentence: Before and after the US Civil War the cattle industry, which Texas came to dominate, was a major economic driver for the state, thus creating the traditional image of the Texas cowboy.

name: texas
sentence: In the later 19th century cotton and lumber grew to be major industries as the cattle industry became less lucrative.

name: texas
sentence: It was ultimately, though, the discovery of major petroleum deposits (Spindletop in particular) that initiated an economic boom which became the driving force behind the economy for much of the 20th century.

name: texas
sentence: Texas developed a diversified economy and high tech industry in the mid-20th century.

name: texas
sentence: As of 2015, it is second on the list of the most Fortune 500 companies with 54.

name: texas
sentence: With a growing base of industry, the state leads in many industries, including tourism, agriculture, petrochemicals, energy, computers and electronics, aerospace, and biomedical sciences.

name: texas
sentence: Texas has led the US in state export revenue since 2002 and has the second-highest gross state product.

name: texas
sentence: If Texas were a sovereign state, it would have the 10th largest economy in the world.

name: texas
sentence: The name Texas, based on the Caddo word táyshaʼ (/tʼajʃaʔ/) "friend", was applied, in the spelling Tejas or Texas, by the Spanish to the Caddo themselves, specifically the Hasinai Confederacy, the final -s representing the Spanish plural.The Mission San Francisco de los Tejas was completed near the Hasinai village of Nabedaches in May 1690, in what is now Houston County, East Texas.

name: texas
sentence: During Spanish colonial rule, in the 18th century, the area was known as Nuevas Filipinas ("New Philippines") and Nuevo Reino de Filipinas ("New Kingdom of the Philippines"), or as provincia de los Tejas ("province of the Tejas"), later also provincia de Texas (or de Tejas), ("province of Texas").It was incorporated as provincia de Texas into the Mexican Empire in 1821, and declared a republic in 1836.

name: texas
sentence: The Royal Spanish Academy recognizes both spellings, Tejas and Texas, as Spanish-language forms of the name of the US State of Texas.

name: texas
sentence: The English pronunciation with /ks/ is unetymological, and based in the value of the letter x in historical Spanish orthography.

name: texas
sentence: Alternative etymologies of the name advanced in the late 19th century connected the Spanish teja "rooftile", the plural tejas being used to designate indigenous Pueblo settlements.

name: texas
sentence: A 1760s map by Jacques-Nicolas Bellin shows a village named Teijas on Trinity River, close to the site of modern Crockett.

name: texas
sentence: Texas lies between two major cultural spheres of Pre-Columbian North America: the Southwestern and the Plains areas.

name: texas
sentence: Archaeologists have found that three major indigenous cultures lived in this territory, and reached their developmental peak before the first European contact.

name: texas
sentence: These were:

name: texas
sentence: When Europeans arrived in the Texas region, there were several races of Native peoples divided into many smaller tribes.

name: texas
sentence: They were Caddoan, Atakapan, Athabaskan, Coahuiltecan, and Uto-Aztecan.

name: texas
sentence: The Uto-Aztecan Puebloan peoples lived neared the Rio Grande in the western portion of the state, the Athabaskan-speaking Apache tribes lived throughout the interior, the Caddoans controlled much of the Red River region and the Atakapans were mostly centered along the Gulf Coast.

name: texas
sentence: At least one tribe of Coahuiltecans, the Aranama, lived in southern Texas.

name: texas
sentence: This entire culture group, primarily centered in northeastern Mexico, is now extinct.

name: texas
sentence: It is difficult to say who lived in the northwestern region of the state originally.

name: texas
sentence: By the time the region came to be explored, it belonged to the fairly well-known Comanche, another Uto-Aztecan people who had transitioned into a powerful horse culture, but it is believed that they came later and did not live there during the 16th century.

name: texas
sentence: It may have been claimed by several different peoples, including Uto-Aztecans, Athabaskans, or even Dhegihan Siouans.

name: texas
sentence: No culture was dominant in the present-day Texas region, and many peoples inhabited the area.

name: texas
sentence: Native American tribes who lived inside the boundaries of present-day Texas include the Alabama, Apache, Atakapan, Bidai, Caddo, Aranama, Comanche, Choctaw, Coushatta, Hasinai, Jumano, Karankawa, Kickapoo, Kiowa, Tonkawa, and Wichita.

name: texas
sentence: The name Texas derives from táyshaʔ, a word in the Caddoan language of the Hasinai, which means "friends" or "allies".

name: texas
sentence: The region was primarily controlled by the Spanish for the first couple centuries of contact, until the Texas Revolution.

name: texas
sentence: They were not particularly kind to their native populations—even less so with the Caddoans, who were not trusted as their culture was split between the Spanish and the French.

name: texas
sentence: When the Spanish briefly managed to conquer the Louisiana colony, they decided to switch tactics and attempt being exceedingly friendly to the Indians, which they continued even after the French took back the colony.

name: texas
sentence: After the 1803 Louisiana Purchase, the United States inherited this odd circumstance.

name: texas
sentence: The Caddoans preferred the company of Americans and almost the entire population of them migrated into the states of Louisiana and Arkansas.

name: texas
sentence: The Spanish felt jilted after having spent so much time and effort and began trying to lure the Caddo back, even promising them more land.

name: texas
sentence: Seemingly without actually knowing how they came by it, the United States (who had begun convincing tribes to self-segregate from whites by selling everything and moving west ever since they gained the Louisiana Purchase) faced an overflow of native peoples in Missouri and Arkansas and were able to negotiate with the Caddoans to allow several displaced peoples to settle on unused lands in eastern Texas.

name: texas
sentence: They included the Muscogee, Houma Choctaw, Lenape and Mingo Senatorca, among others, who all came to view the Caddoans as saviors, making those peoples highly influential.

name: texas
sentence: Whether a Native American tribe was friendly or warlike was critical to the fates of European explorers and settlers in that land.

name: texas
sentence: Friendly tribes taught newcomers how to grow indigenous crops, prepare foods, and hunt wild game.

name: texas
sentence: Warlike tribes made life difficult and dangerous for Europeans through their attacks and resistance to the newcomers.

name: texas
sentence: During the Texas Revolution, the US became heavily involved.

name: texas
sentence: Prior treaties with the Spanish forbade either side from militarizing its native population in any potential conflict between the two nations.

name: texas
sentence: At that time, several sudden outbreaks of violence between Caddoans and Texans started to spread.

name: texas
sentence: The Caddoans were always clueless when questioned, The Texan and American authorities in the region could never find hard evidence linking them to it and often it was so far-flung from Caddoan lands, it barely made any sense.

name: texas
sentence: It seems most likely that these were false-flag attacks meant to start a cascading effect to force the natives under Caddoan influence into armed conflict without breaking any treaties—preferably on the side of the Spanish.

name: texas
sentence: While no proof was found as to who the culprit was, those in charge of Texas at the time attempted multiple times to publicly blame and punish the Caddoans for the incidents with the US government trying to keep them in check.

name: texas
sentence: Furthermore, the Caddoans never turned to violence because of it, excepting cases of self-defense.

name: texas
sentence: By the 1830s, the US had drafted the Indian Removal Act, which was used to facilitate the Trail of Tears.

name: texas
sentence: Fearing retribution of other native peoples, Indian Agents all over the eastern US began desperately trying to convince all their native peoples to uproot and move west.

name: texas
sentence: This included the Caddoans of Louisiana and Arkansas.

name: texas
sentence: Following the Texas Revolution, the Texans chose to make peace with their Native peoples but did not honor former land claims or agreements.

name: texas
sentence: This began the movement of Native populations north into what would become Indian Territory—modern-day Oklahoma.

name: texas
sentence: The first historical document related to Texas was a map of the Gulf Coast, created in 1519 by Spanish explorer Alonso Álvarez de Pineda.

name: texas
sentence: Nine years later, shipwrecked Spanish explorer Álvar Núñez Cabeza de Vaca and his cohort became the first Europeans in what is now Texas.

name: texas
sentence: Cabeza de Vaca reported that in 1528, when the Spanish landed in the area, "half the natives died from a disease of the bowels and blamed us."

name: texas
sentence: Cabeza de Vaca also made observations about the way of life of the Ignaces Natives of Texas:

name: texas
sentence: Francisco Vázquez de Coronado describes his 1541 encounter:

name: texas
sentence: European powers ignored the area until accidentally settling there in 1685.

name: texas
sentence: Miscalculations by René-Robert Cavelier de La Salle resulted in his establishing the colony of Fort Saint Louis at Matagorda Bay rather than along the Mississippi River.

name: texas
sentence: The colony lasted only four years before succumbing to harsh conditions and hostile natives.

name: texas
sentence: In 1690 Spanish authorities, concerned that France posed a competitive threat, constructed several missions in East Texas.

name: texas
sentence: After Native American resistance, the Spanish missionaries returned to Mexico.

name: texas
sentence: When France began settling Louisiana, mostly in the southern part of the state, in 1716 Spanish authorities responded by founding a new series of missions in East Texas.

name: texas
sentence: Two years later, they created San Antonio as the first Spanish civilian settlement in the area.

name: texas
sentence: Hostile native tribes and distance from nearby Spanish colonies discouraged settlers from moving to the area.

name: texas
sentence: It was one of New Spain's least populated provinces.

name: texas
sentence: In 1749, the Spanish peace treaty with the Lipan Apache angered many tribes, including the Comanche, Tonkawa, and Hasinai.

name: texas
sentence: The Comanche signed a treaty with Spain in 1785 and later helped to defeat the Lipan Apache and Karankawa tribes.

name: texas
sentence: With more numerous missions being established, priests led a peaceful conversion of most tribes.

name: texas
sentence: By the end of the 18th century only a few nomadic tribes had not converted to Christianity.

name: texas
sentence: When the United States purchased Louisiana from France in 1803, American authorities insisted the agreement also included Texas.

name: texas
sentence: The boundary between New Spain and the United States was finally set at the Sabine River in 1819, at what is now the border between Texas and Louisiana.

name: texas
sentence: Eager for new land, many United States settlers refused to recognize the agreement.

name: texas
sentence: Several filibusters raised armies to invade the area west of the Sabine River.

name: texas
sentence: In 1821, the Mexican War of Independence included the Texas territory, which became part of Mexico.

name: texas
sentence: Due to its low population, Mexico made the area part of the state of Coahuila y Tejas.

name: texas
sentence: Hoping more settlers would reduce the near-constant Comanche raids, Mexican Texas liberalized its immigration policies to permit immigrants from outside Mexico and Spain.

name: texas
sentence: Under the Mexican immigration system, large swathes of land were allotted to empresarios, who recruited settlers from the United States, Europe, and the Mexican interior.

name: texas
sentence: The first grant, to Moses Austin, was passed to his son Stephen F. Austin after his death.

name: texas
sentence: Austin's settlers, the Old Three Hundred, made places along the Brazos River in 1822.

name: texas
sentence: Twenty-three other empresarios brought settlers to the state, the majority of whom were from the United States.

name: texas
sentence: The population of Texas grew rapidly.

name: texas
sentence: In 1825, Texas had about 3,500 people, with most of Mexican descent.

name: texas
sentence: By 1834, the population had grown to about 37,800 people, with only 7,800 of Mexican descent.

name: texas
sentence: Most of these early settlers who arrived with Austin and soon after were persons less than fortunate in life, as Texas was devoid of the comforts found elsewhere in Mexico and the United States during that time.

name: texas
sentence: Early Texas settler David B. Edwards described his fellow Texans as being "banished from the pleasures of life".

name: texas
sentence: Many immigrants openly flouted Mexican law, especially the prohibition against slavery.

name: texas
sentence: Combined with United States' attempts to purchase Texas, Mexican authorities decided in 1830 to prohibit continued immigration from the United States.

name: texas
sentence: Illegal immigration from the United States into Mexico continued to increase the population of Texas anyway.

name: texas
sentence: New laws also called for the enforcement of customs duties angering native Mexican citizens (Tejanos) and recent immigrants alike.

name: texas
sentence: The Anahuac Disturbances in 1832 were the first open revolt against Mexican rule, and they coincided with a revolt in Mexico against the nation's president.

name: texas
sentence: Texians sided with the federalists against the current government and drove all Mexican soldiers out of East Texas.

name: texas
sentence: They took advantage of the lack of oversight to agitate for more political freedom.

name: texas
sentence: Texians met at the Convention of 1832 to discuss requesting independent statehood, among other issues.

name: texas
sentence: The following year, Texians reiterated their demands at the Convention of 1833.

name: texas
sentence: Within Mexico, tensions continued between federalists and centralists.

name: texas
sentence: In early 1835, wary Texians formed Committees of Correspondence and Safety.

name: texas
sentence: The unrest erupted into armed conflict in late 1835 at the Battle of Gonzales.

name: texas
sentence: This launched the Texas Revolution, and over the next two months the Texians defeated all Mexican troops in the region.

name: texas
sentence: Texians elected delegates to the Consultation, which created a provisional government.

name: texas
sentence: The provisional government soon collapsed from infighting, and Texas was without clear governance for the first two months of 1836.

name: texas
sentence: During this time of political turmoil, Mexican President Antonio López de Santa Anna personally led an army to end the revolt.

name: texas
sentence: The Mexican expedition was initially successful.

name: texas
sentence: General José de Urrea defeated all the Texian resistance along the coast culminating in the Goliad massacre.

name: texas
sentence: Santa Anna's forces, after a thirteen-day siege, overwhelmed Texian defenders at the Battle of the Alamo.

name: texas
sentence: News of the defeats sparked panic among Texas settlers.

name: texas
sentence: The newly elected Texian delegates to the Convention of 1836 quickly signed a Declaration of Independence on March 2, forming the Republic of Texas.

name: texas
sentence: After electing interim officers, the Convention disbanded.

name: texas
sentence: The new government joined the other settlers in Texas in the Runaway Scrape, fleeing from the approaching Mexican army.

name: texas
sentence: After several weeks of retreat, the Texian Army commanded by Sam Houston attacked and defeated Santa Anna's forces at the Battle of San Jacinto.

name: texas
sentence: Santa Anna was captured and forced to sign the Treaties of Velasco, ending the war.

name: texas
sentence: The Constitution of the Republic of Texas prohibited the government from restricting slavery or freeing slaves, and required free people of African descent to leave the country.

name: texas
sentence: While Texas had won its independence, political battles raged between two factions of the new Republic.

name: texas
sentence: The nationalist faction, led by Mirabeau B. Lamar, advocated the continued independence of Texas, the expulsion of the Native Americans, and the expansion of the Republic to the Pacific Ocean.

name: texas
sentence: Their opponents, led by Sam Houston, advocated the annexation of Texas to the United States and peaceful co-existence with Native Americans.

name: texas
sentence: The conflict between the factions was typified by an incident known as the Texas Archive War.

name: texas
sentence: With wide popular support, Texas first applied for annexation to the United States in 1836, but its status as a slaveholding country caused its admission to be controversial and it was initially rebuffed.

name: texas
sentence: This status, and Mexican diplomacy in support of its claims to the territory, also complicated Texas's ability to form foreign alliances and trade relationships.

name: texas
sentence: The Comanche Indians furnished the main Native American opposition to the Texas Republic, manifested in multiple raids on settlements.

name: texas
sentence: Mexico launched two small expeditions into Texas in 1842.

name: texas
sentence: The town of San Antonio was captured twice and Texans were defeated in battle in the Dawson massacre.

name: texas
sentence: Despite these successes, Mexico did not keep an occupying force in Texas, and the republic survived.

name: texas
sentence: The cotton price crash of the 1840s depressed the country's economy.

name: texas
sentence: As early as 1837, the Republic made several attempts to negotiate annexation with the United States.

name: texas
sentence: Opposition within the republic from the nationalist faction, along with strong abolitionist opposition within the United States, slowed Texas's admission into the Union.

name: texas
sentence: Texas was finally annexed when the expansionist James K. Polk won the election of 1844.

name: texas
sentence: On December 29, 1845, Congress admitted Texas to the US as a constituent state of the Union.

name: texas
sentence: The population of the new state was quite small at first, and there was a strong mix between the English-speaking American settlers who dominated in the state's eastern/northeastern portions and the Spanish-speaking former Mexicans (Tejanos) who dominated in the state's southern and western portions.

name: texas
sentence: Statehood brought many new settlers.

name: texas
sentence: Because of the long Spanish presence in Mexico and various failed colonization efforts by the Spanish and Mexicans in northern Mexico, there were large herds of Longhorn cattle that roamed the state.

name: texas
sentence: Hardy by nature, but also suitable for slaughtering and consumption, they represented an economic opportunity many entrepreneurs seized upon, thus creating the cowboy culture for which Texas is famous.

name: texas
sentence: After Texas's annexation, Mexico broke diplomatic relations with the United States.

name: texas
sentence: While the United States claimed Texas's border stretched to the Rio Grande, Mexico claimed it was the Nueces River leaving the Rio Grande Valley under contested Texan sovereignty.

name: texas
sentence: While the former Republic of Texas could not enforce its border claims, the United States had the military strength and the political will to do so.

name: texas
sentence: President Polk ordered General Zachary Taylor south to the Rio Grande on January 13, 1846.

name: texas
sentence: A few months later Mexican troops routed an American cavalry patrol in the disputed area in the Thornton Affair starting the Mexican–American War.

name: texas
sentence: The first battles of the war were fought in Texas: the Siege of Fort Texas, Battle of Palo Alto and Battle of Resaca de la Palma.

name: texas
sentence: After these decisive victories, the United States invaded Mexican territory, ending the fighting in Texas.

name: texas
sentence: After a series of United States victories, the Treaty of Guadalupe Hidalgo ended the two-year war.

name: texas
sentence: In return, for US$18,250,000, Mexico gave the US undisputed control of Texas, ceded the Mexican Cession in 1848, most of which today is called the American Southwest, and Texas's borders were established at the Rio Grande.

name: texas
sentence: The Compromise of 1850 set Texas's boundaries at their present form.

name: texas
sentence: Senatortor James Pearce of Maryland drafted the final proposal where Texas ceded its claims to land which later became half of present-day New Mexico, a third of Colorado, and small portions of Kansas, Oklahoma, and Wyoming to the federal government, in return for the assumption of $10 million of the old republic's debt.

name: texas
sentence: Post-war Texas grew rapidly as migrants poured into the cotton lands of the state.

name: texas
sentence: They also brought or purchased enslaved African Americans, whose numbers tripled in the state from 1850 to 1860, from 58,000 to 182,566.

name: texas
sentence: Texas was at war again after the election of 1860.

name: texas
sentence: At this time, blacks comprised 30 percent of the state's population, and they were overwhelmingly enslaved.

name: texas
sentence: When Abraham Lincoln was elected, South Carolina seceded from the Union.

name: texas
sentence: Five other Lower South states quickly followed.

name: texas
sentence: A State Convention considering secession opened in Austin on January 28, 1861.

name: texas
sentence: On February 1, by a vote of 166–8, the Convention adopted an Ordinance of Secession from the United States.

name: texas
sentence: Texas voters approved this Ordinance on February 23, 1861.

name: texas
sentence: Texas joined the newly created Confederate States of America on March 4, 1861 ratifying the permanent C.S.

name: texas
sentence: Constitution on March 23.

name: texas
sentence: Not all Texans favored secession initially, although many of the same would later support the Southern cause.

name: texas
sentence: Texas's most notable Unionist was the state Governor, Sam Houston.

name: texas
sentence: Not wanting to aggravate the situation, Houston refused two offers from President Lincoln for Union troops to keep him in office.

name: texas
sentence: After refusing to swear an oath of allegiance to the Confederacy, Houston was deposed as governor.

name: texas
sentence: While far from the major battlefields of the American Civil War, Texas contributed large numbers of men and equipment to the rest of the Confederacy.

name: texas
sentence: Union troops briefly occupied the state's primary port, Galveston.

name: texas
sentence: Texas's border with Mexico was known as the "backdoor of the Confederacy" because trade occurred at the border, bypassing the Union blockade.

name: texas
sentence: The Confederacy repulsed all Union attempts to shut down this route, but Texas's role as a supply state was marginalized in mid-1863 after the Union capture of the Mississippi River.

name: texas
sentence: The final battle of the Civil War was fought near Brownsville, Texas at Palmito Ranch with a Confederate victory.

name: texas
sentence: Texas descended into anarchy for two months between the surrender of the Army of Northern Virginia and the assumption of authority by Union General Gordon Granger.

name: texas
sentence: Violence marked the early months of Reconstruction.

name: texas
sentence: Juneteenth commemorates the announcement of the Emancipation Proclamation in Galveston by General Gordon Granger, almost two and a half years after the original announcement.

name: texas
sentence: President Johnson, in 1866, declared the civilian government restored in Texas.

name: texas
sentence: Despite not meeting reconstruction requirements, Congress resumed allowing elected Texas representatives into the federal government in 1870.

name: texas
sentence: Social volatility continued as the state struggled with agricultural depression and labor issues.

name: texas
sentence: Like most of the South, the Texas economy was devastated by the War.

name: texas
sentence: However, since the state had not been as dependent on slaves as other parts of the South, it was able to recover more quickly.

name: texas
sentence: The culture in Texas during the later 19th century exhibited many facets of a frontier territory.

name: texas
sentence: The state became notorious as a haven for people from other parts of the country who wanted to escape debt, war tensions, or other problems.

name: texas
sentence: Indeed, "Gone to Texas" was a common expression for those fleeing the law in other states.

name: texas
sentence: Nevertheless, the state also attracted many businessmen and other settlers with more legitimate interests as well.

name: texas
sentence: The cattle industry continued to thrive, though it gradually became less profitable.

name: texas
sentence: Cotton and lumber became major industries creating new economic booms in various regions of the state.

name: texas
sentence: Railroad networks grew rapidly as did the port at Galveston as commerce between Texas and the rest of the US (and the rest of the world) expanded.

name: texas
sentence: As with some other states before, the lumber industry quickly expanded in Texas and was its largest industry before the beginning of the 20th century.

name: texas
sentence: In 1900, Texas suffered the deadliest natural disaster in US history during the Galveston hurricane.

name: texas
sentence: On January 10, 1901, the first major oil well in Texas, Spindletop, was found south of Beaumont.

name: texas
sentence: Other fields were later discovered nearby in East Texas, West Texas, and under the Gulf of Mexico.

name: texas
sentence: The resulting "oil boom" transformed Texas.

name: texas
sentence: Oil production eventually averaged three million barrels per day at its peak in 1972.

name: texas
sentence: In 1901, the Democratic-dominated state legislature passed a bill requiring payment of a poll tax for voting, which effectively disenfranchised most blacks and many poor whites and Latinos.

name: texas
sentence: In addition, the legislature established white primaries, ensuring minorities were excluded from the formal political process.

name: texas
sentence: The number of voters dropped dramatically, and the Democrats crushed competition from the Republican and Populist parties.

name: texas
sentence: The Socialist Party became the second-largest party in Texas after 1912, coinciding with a large socialist upsurge in the United States during fierce battles in the labor movement and the popularity of national heroes like Eugene V. Debs.

name: texas
sentence: The Socialists' popularity soon waned after their vilification by the United States government for their opposition to US involvement in World War I.

name: texas
sentence: The Great Depression and the Dust Bowl dealt a double blow to the state's economy, which had significantly improved since the Civil War.

name: texas
sentence: Migrants abandoned the worst-hit sections of Texas during the Dust Bowl years.

name: texas
sentence: Especially from this period on, blacks left Texas in the Great Migration to get work in the Northern United States or California and to escape the oppression of segregation.

name: texas
sentence: In 1940, Texas was 74 percent Anglo, 14.4 percent black, and 11.5 percent Hispanic.

name: texas
sentence: World War II had a dramatic impact on Texas, as federal money poured in to build military bases, munitions factories, POW detention camps and Army hospitals; 750,000 young men left for service; the cities exploded with new industry; the colleges took on new roles; and hundreds of thousands of poor farmers left the fields for much better-paying war jobs, never to return to agriculture.

name: texas
sentence: Texas manufactured 3.1 percent of total United States military armaments produced during World War II, ranking eleventh among the 48 states.

name: texas
sentence: Texas modernized and expanded its system of higher education through the 1960s.

name: texas
sentence: The state created a comprehensive plan for higher education, funded in large part by oil revenues, and a central state apparatus designed to manage state institutions more efficiently.

name: texas
sentence: These changes helped Texas universities receive federal research funds.

name: texas
sentence: On November 22, 1963, President John F. Kennedy was assassinated in Dallas.

name: texas
sentence: Beginning around the mid-20th century, Texas began to transform from a rural and agricultural state to one urban and industrialized.

name: texas
sentence: The state's population grew quickly during this period, with large levels of migration from outside the state.

name: texas
sentence: As a part of the Sun Belt, Texas experienced strong economic growth, particularly during the 1970s and early 1980s.

name: texas
sentence: Texas's economy diversified, lessening its reliance on the petroleum industry.

name: texas
sentence: By 1990, Hispanics and Latin Americans overtook blacks to become the largest minority group in the state.

name: texas
sentence: During the late 20th century, the Republican Party replaced the Democratic Party as the dominant party in the state, as the latter became more politically liberal and as demographic changes favored the former.

name: texas
sentence: Beginning in the early 21st century, metropolitan areas including Dallas–Fort Worth and Greater Austin became centers for the Texas Democratic Party in statewide and national elections as liberal policies became more accepted in urban areas.

name: texas
sentence: On July 7, 2016, Dallas police officers were ambushed by Micah Xavier Johnson, killing five officers and injuring nine others in retaliation against white police officers.

name: texas
sentence: Johnson was the first person believed to have been killed by a robot used by US law enforcement.

name: texas
sentence: From the mid 2000s–2019, Texas gained an influx of business relocations and regional headquarters from companies in California.

name: texas
sentence: Texas became a major destination for migration during the early 21st century and was named the most popular state to move for three consecutive years.

name: texas
sentence: Another study in 2019 determined Texas's growth rate at 1,000 people per day.

name: texas
sentence: During COVID-19 pandemic in the United States, the first confirmed case of the virus in Texas was announced on March 4, 2020.

name: texas
sentence: As of December 28, 2020, there had been 1.7 million confirmed cases in Texas, with at least 27,245 deaths.

name: texas
sentence: On April 27, 2020, Governor Greg Abbott announced phase one of re-opening the economy.

name: texas
sentence: Phase-two openings began on May 18, and phase three was announced on June 3.

name: texas
sentence: Governor Abbott expressed regret over the swift reopening of bars during the COVID-19 pandemic in Texas.

name: texas
sentence: In the 2020 United States presidential election, Governor Abbott announced a controversial decision to limit one mail-in ballot drop box location for each county.

name: texas
sentence: Harris County, Texas received national media attention because the county, which is larger than the size of Rhode Island and has 2.4 million registered voters, was served by only one voting drop-box location.

name: texas
sentence: A federal judge blocked the governor's order until it was appealed in court

name: texas
sentence: Abbott was sued by voters and voters rights groups following the order.

name: texas
sentence: Amid a rise in COVID-19 cases in autumn 2020, Abbott refused to enact further lockdowns.

name: texas
sentence: Texas is the second-largest US state, after Alaska, with an area of 268,820 square miles (696,200 km2).

name: texas
sentence: Though 10% larger than France and almost twice as large as Germany or Japan and more than twice the size of the United Kingdom, it ranks only 27th worldwide amongst country subdivisions by size.

name: texas
sentence: If it were an independent country, Texas would be the 39th largest.

name: texas
sentence: Texas is in the south central part of the United States of America.

name: texas
sentence: Three of its borders are defined by rivers.

name: texas
sentence: The Rio Grande forms a natural border with the Mexican states of Chihuahua, Coahuila, Nuevo León, and Tamaulipas to the south.

name: texas
sentence: The Red River forms a natural border with Oklahoma and Arkansas to the north.

name: texas
sentence: The Sabine River forms a natural border with Louisiana to the east.

name: texas
sentence: The Texas Panhandle has an eastern border with Oklahoma at 100° W, a northern border with Oklahoma at 36°30' N and a western border with New Mexico at 103° W. El Paso lies on the state's western tip at 32° N and the Rio Grande.

name: texas
sentence: With 10 climatic regions, 14 soil regions and 11 distinct ecological regions, regional classification becomes problematic with differences in soils, topography, geology, rainfall, and plant and animal communities.

name: texas
sentence: One classification system divides Texas, in order from southeast to west, into the following: Gulf Coastal Plains, Interior Lowlands, Great Plains, and Basin and Range Province.

name: texas
sentence: The Gulf Coastal Plains region wraps around the Gulf of Mexico on the southeast section of the state.

name: texas
sentence: Vegetation in this region consists of thick piney woods.

name: texas
sentence: The Interior Lowlands region consists of gently rolling to hilly forested land and is part of a larger pine-hardwood forest.

name: texas
sentence: The Cross Timbers region and Caprock Escarpment are part of the Interior Lowlands.

name: texas
sentence: The Great Plains region in central Texas spans through the state's panhandle and Llano Estacado to the state's hill country near Austin.

name: texas
sentence: This region is dominated by prairie and steppe.

name: texas
sentence: "Far West Texas" or the "Trans-Pecos" region is the state's Basin and Range Province.

name: texas
sentence: The most varied of the regions, this area includes Sand Hills, the Stockton Plateau, desert valleys, wooded mountain slopes and desert grasslands.

name: texas
sentence: Texas has 3,700 named streams and 15 major rivers, with the Rio Grande as the largest.

name: texas
sentence: Other major rivers include the Pecos, the Brazos, Colorado, and Red River.

name: texas
sentence: While Texas has few natural lakes, Texans have built more than a hundred artificial reservoirs.

name: texas
sentence: The size and unique history of Texas make its regional affiliation debatable; it can be fairly considered a Southern or a Southwestern state, or both.

name: texas
sentence: The vast geographic, economic, and cultural diversity within the state itself prohibits easy categorization of the whole state into a recognized region of the United States.

name: texas
sentence: Notable extremes range from East Texas which is often considered an extension of the Deep South, to Far West Texas which is generally acknowledged to be part of the interior Southwest.

name: texas
sentence: Texas is the southernmost part of the Great Plains, which ends in the south against the folded Sierra Madre Occidental of Mexico.

name: texas
sentence: The continental crust forms a stable Mesoproterozoic craton which changes across a broad continental margin and transitional crust into true oceanic crust of the Gulf of Mexico.

name: texas
sentence: The oldest rocks in Texas date from the Mesoproterozoic and are about 1,600 million years old.

name: texas
sentence: These Precambrian igneous and metamorphic rocks underlie most of the state, and are exposed in three places: Llano uplift, Van Horn, and the Franklin Mountains, near El Paso.

name: texas
sentence: Sedimentary rocks overlay most of these ancient rocks.

name: texas
sentence: The oldest sediments were deposited on the flanks of a rifted continental margin, or passive margin that developed during Cambrian time.

name: texas
sentence: This margin existed until Laurasia and Gondwana collided in the Pennsylvanian subperiod to form Pangea.

name: texas
sentence: This is the buried crest of the Appalachian Mountains–Ouachita Mountains zone of Pennsylvanian continental collision.

name: texas
sentence: This orogenic crest is today buried beneath the Dallas–Waco–Austin–San Antonio trend.

name: texas
sentence: The late Paleozoic mountains collapsed as rifting in the Jurassic period began to open the Gulf of Mexico.

name: texas
sentence: Pangea began to break up in the Triassic, but seafloor spreading to form the Gulf of Mexico occurred only in the mid- and late Jurassic.

name: texas
sentence: The shoreline shifted again to the eastern margin of the state and the Gulf of Mexico's passive margin began to form.

name: texas
sentence: Today 9 to 12 miles (14 to 19 km) of sediments are buried beneath the Texas continental shelf and a large proportion of remaining US oil reserves are here.

name: texas
sentence: At the start of its formation, the incipient Gulf of Mexico basin was restricted and seawater often evaporated completely to form thick evaporite deposits of Jurassic age.

name: texas
sentence: These salt deposits formed salt dome diapirs, and are found in East Texas along the Gulf coast.

name: texas
sentence: East Texas outcrops consist of Cretaceous and Paleogene sediments which contain important deposits of Eocene lignite.

name: texas
sentence: The Mississippian and Pennsylvanian sediments in the north; Permian sediments in the west; and Cretaceous sediments in the east, along the Gulf coast and out on the Texas continental shelf contain oil.

name: texas
sentence: Oligocene volcanic rocks are found in far west Texas in the Big Bend area.

name: texas
sentence: A blanket of Miocene sediments known as the Ogallala formation in the western high plains region is an important aquifer.

name: texas
sentence: Located far from an active plate tectonic boundary, Texas has no volcanoes and few earthquakes.

name: texas
sentence: A wide range of animals and insects live in Texas.

name: texas
sentence: It is the home to 65 species of mammals, 213 species of reptiles and amphibians, and the greatest diversity of bird life in the United States—590 native species in all.

name: texas
sentence: At least 12 species have been introduced and now reproduce freely in Texas.

name: texas
sentence: Texas plays host to several species of wasps, including an abundance of Polistes exclamans, and is an important ground for the study of Polistes annularis.

name: texas
sentence: During the spring Texas wildflowers such as the state flower, the bluebonnet, line highways throughout Texas.

name: texas
sentence: During the Johnson Administration the first lady, Lady Bird Johnson, worked to draw attention to Texas wildflowers.

name: texas
sentence: The large size of Texas and its location at the intersection of multiple climate zones gives the state highly variable weather.

name: texas
sentence: The Panhandle of the state has colder winters than North Texas, while the Gulf Coast has mild winters.

name: texas
sentence: Texas has wide variations in precipitation patterns.

name: texas
sentence: El Paso, on the western end of the state, averages 8.7 inches (220 mm) of annual rainfall, while parts of southeast Texas average as much as 64 inches (1,600 mm) per year.

name: texas
sentence: Dallas in the North Central region averages a more moderate 37 inches (940 mm) per year.

name: texas
sentence: Snow falls multiple times each winter in the Panhandle and mountainous areas of West Texas, once or twice a year in North Texas, and once every few years in Central and East Texas.

name: texas
sentence: Snow falls south of San Antonio or on the coast only in rare circumstances.

name: texas
sentence: Of note is the 2004 Christmas Eve snowstorm, when 6 inches (150 mm) of snow fell as far south as Kingsville, where the average high temperature in December is 65 °F.

name: texas
sentence: Maximum temperatures in the summer months average from the 80s °F (26 °C) in the mountains of West Texas and on Galveston Island to around 100 °F (38 °C) in the Rio Grande Valley, but most areas of Texas see consistent summer high temperatures in the 90 °F (32 °C) range.

name: texas
sentence: Night-time summer temperatures range from the upper 50s °F (14 °C) in the West Texas mountains to 80 °F (27 °C) in Galveston.

name: texas
sentence: The table below consists of averages for August (generally the warmest month) and January (generally the coldest) in selected cities in various regions of the state.

name: texas
sentence: Thunderstorms strike Texas often, especially the eastern and northern portions of the state.

name: texas
sentence: Tornado Alley covers the northern section of Texas.

name: texas
sentence: The state experiences the most tornadoes in the United States, an average of 139 a year.

name: texas
sentence: These strike most frequently in North Texas and the Panhandle.

name: texas
sentence: Tornadoes in Texas generally occur in the months of April, May, and June.

name: texas
sentence: Some of the most destructive hurricanes in US history have impacted Texas.

name: texas
sentence: A hurricane in 1875 killed about 400 people in Indianola, followed by another hurricane in 1886 that destroyed the town.

name: texas
sentence: These events allowed Galveston to take over as the chief port city.

name: texas
sentence: The 1900 Galveston hurricane subsequently devastated that city, killing about 8,000 people or possibly as many as 12,000.

name: texas
sentence: This makes it the deadliest natural disaster in US history.

name: texas
sentence: In 2017, Hurricane Harvey made landfall in Rockport as a Category 4 Hurricane, causing significant damage there.

name: texas
sentence: The storm stalled over land for a very long time, allowing it to drop unprecedented amounts of rain over the Greater Houston area and surrounding counties.

name: texas
sentence: The result was widespread and catastrophic flooding that inundated hundreds of thousands of homes.

name: texas
sentence: Harvey ultimately became the costliest hurricane worldwide, causing an estimated $198.6 billion in damage, surpassing the cost of Hurricane Katrina.

name: texas
sentence: Other devastating Texas hurricanes include the 1915 Galveston hurricane, Hurricane Audrey in 1957 which killed more than 600 people, Hurricane Carla in 1961, Hurricane Beulah in 1967, Hurricane Alicia in 1983, Hurricane Rita in 2005, and Hurricane Ike in 2008.

name: texas
sentence: Tropical storms have also caused their share of damage: Allison in 1989 and again during 2001, and Claudette in 1979 among them.

name: texas
sentence: As of 2017 Texas emits the most greenhouse gases in the US almost twice the amount of California, the second most polluting state.As of 2017 the state emits about 1,600 billion pounds (707 million metric tons) of carbon dioxide annually.

name: texas
sentence: As an independent nation, Texas would rank as the world's seventh-largest producer of greenhouse gases.

name: texas
sentence: Causes of the state's vast greenhouse gas emissions include the state's large number of coal power plants and the state's refining and manufacturing industries.

name: texas
sentence: In 2010, there were 2,553 "emission events" which poured 44.6 million pounds (20,200 metric tons) of contaminants into the Texas sky.

name: texas
sentence: The state has three cities with populations exceeding one million: Houston, San Antonio, and Dallas.

name: texas
sentence: These three rank among the 10 most populous cities of the United States.

name: texas
sentence: As of 2010, six Texas cities had populations greater than 600,000 people.

name: texas
sentence: Austin, Fort Worth, and El Paso are among the 20 largest US cities.

name: texas
sentence: Texas has four metropolitan areas with populations greater than a million: Dallas–Fort Worth–Arlington, Houston–Sugar Land–The Woodlands, San Antonio–New Braunfels, and Austin–Round Rock–San Marcos.

name: texas
sentence: The Dallas–Fort Worth and Houston metropolitan areas number about 7.5 million and 7 million residents as of 2019, respectively.

name: texas
sentence: Three interstate highways—I-35 to the west (Dallas–Fort Worth to San Antonio, with Austin in between), I-45 to the east (Dallas to Houston), and I-10 to the south (San Antonio to Houston) define the Texas Urban Triangle region.

name: texas
sentence: The region of 60,000 square miles (160,000 km2) contains most of the state's largest cities and metropolitan areas as well as 17 million people, nearly 75 percent of Texas's total population.

name: texas
sentence: Houston and Dallas have been recognized as world cities.

name: texas
sentence: These cities are spread out amongst the state.

name: texas
sentence: In contrast to the cities, unincorporated rural settlements known as colonias often lack basic infrastructure and are marked by poverty.

name: texas
