sentence: On May 10, 1869, the First Transcontinental Railroad was completed at Promontory Summit, north of the Great Salt Lake.

name: utah
sentence: The railroad brought increasing numbers of people into the territory and several influential businesspeople made fortunes there.

name: utah
sentence: During the 1870s and 1880s laws were passed to punish polygamists due, in part, to stories from Utah.

name: utah
sentence: Notably, Ann Eliza Young—tenth wife to divorce Brigham Young, women's advocate, national lecturer and author of Wife No.

name: utah
sentence: 19 or My Life of Bondage and Mr. and Mrs. Fanny Stenhouse, authors of The Rocky Mountain Saints (T. B. H. Stenhouse, 1873) and Tell It All: My Life in Mormonism (Fanny Stenhouse, 1875).

name: utah
sentence: Both Ann Eliza and Fanny testify to the happiness of the very early Church members before polygamy.

name: utah
sentence: They independently published their books in 1875.

name: utah
sentence: These books and the lectures of Ann Eliza Young have been credited with the United States Congress passage of anti-polygamy laws by newspapers throughout the United States as recorded in "The Ann Eliza Young Vindicator", a pamphlet which detailed Ms Young's travels and warm reception throughout her lecture tour.

name: utah
sentence: T. B. H. Stenhouse, former Utah Mormon polygamist, Mormon missionary for thirteen years and a Salt Lake City newspaper owner, finally left Utah and wrote The Rocky Mountain Saints.

name: utah
sentence: His book gives a witnessed account of life in Utah, both the good and the bad.

name: utah
sentence: He finally left Utah and Mormonism after financial ruin occurred when Brigham Young sent Stenhouse to relocate to Ogden, Utah, according to Stenhouse, to take over his thriving pro-Mormon Salt Lake Telegraph newspaper.

name: utah
sentence: In addition to these testimonies, The Confessions of John D. Lee, written by John D. Lee—alleged "Scape goat" for the Mountain Meadow Massacre—also came out in 1877.

name: utah
sentence: The corroborative testimonies coming out of Utah from Mormons and former Mormons influenced Congress and the people of the United States.

name: utah
sentence: In the 1890 Manifesto, the LDS Church banned polygamy.

name: utah
sentence: When Utah applied for statehood again, it was accepted.

name: utah
sentence: One of the conditions for granting Utah statehood was that a ban on polygamy be written into the state constitution.

name: utah
sentence: This was a condition required of other western states that were admitted into the Union later.

name: utah
sentence: Statehood was officially granted on January 4, 1896.

name: utah
sentence: Beginning in the early 20th century, with the establishment of such national parks as Bryce Canyon National Park and Zion National Park, Utah became known for its natural beauty.

name: utah
sentence: Southern Utah became a popular filming spot for arid, rugged scenes featured in the popular mid-century western film genre.

name: utah
sentence: From such films, most US residents recognize such natural landmarks as Delicate Arch and "the Mittens" of Monument Valley.

name: utah
sentence: During the 1950s, 1960s, and 1970s, with the construction of the Interstate highway system, accessibility to the southern scenic areas was made easier.

name: utah
sentence: Since the establishment of Alta Ski Area in 1939 and the subsequent development of several ski resorts in the state's mountains, Utah's skiing has become world-renowned.

name: utah
sentence: The dry, powdery snow of the Wasatch Range is considered some of the best skiing in the world (the state license plate once claimed "the Greatest Snow on Earth").

name: utah
sentence: Salt Lake City won the bid for the 2002 Winter Olympic Games, and this served as a great boost to the economy.

name: utah
sentence: The ski resorts have increased in popularity, and many of the Olympic venues built along the Wasatch Front continue to be used for sporting events.

name: utah
sentence: Preparation for the Olympics spurred the development of the light-rail system in the Salt Lake Valley, known as TRAX, and the re-construction of the freeway system around the city.

name: utah
sentence: In 1957, Utah created the Utah State Parks Commission with four parks.

name: utah
sentence: Today, Utah State Parks manages 43 parks and several undeveloped areas totaling over 95,000 acres (380 km2) of land and more than 1,000,000 acres (4,000 km2) of water.

name: utah
sentence: Utah's state parks are scattered throughout Utah, from Bear Lake State Park at the Utah/Idaho border to Edge of the Cedars State Park Museum deep in the Four Corners region and everywhere in between.

name: utah
sentence: Utah State Parks is also home to the state's off highway vehicle office, state boating office and the trails program.

name: utah
sentence: During the late 20th century, the state grew quickly.

name: utah
sentence: In the 1970s growth was phenomenal in the suburbs of the Wasatch Front.

name: utah
sentence: Sandy was one of the fastest-growing cities in the country at that time.

name: utah
sentence: Today, many areas of Utah continue to see boom-time growth.

name: utah
sentence: Northern Davis, southern and western Salt Lake, Summit, eastern Tooele, Utah, Wasatch, and Washington counties are all growing very quickly.

name: utah
sentence: Management of transportation and urbanization are major issues in politics, as development consumes agricultural land and wilderness areas and transportation is a major reason for poor air quality in Utah.

name: utah
sentence: Utah is known for its natural diversity and is home to features ranging from arid deserts with sand dunes to thriving pine forests in mountain valleys.

name: utah
sentence: It is a rugged and geographically diverse state at the convergence of three distinct geological regions: the Rocky Mountains, the Great Basin, and the Colorado Plateau.

name: utah
sentence: Utah covers an area of 84,899 sq mi (219,890 km2).

name: utah
sentence: It is one of the Four Corners states and is bordered by Idaho in the north, Wyoming in the north and east; by Colorado in the east; at a single point by New Mexico to the southeast; by Arizona in the south; and by Nevada in the west.

name: utah
sentence: Only three US states (Utah, Colorado, and Wyoming) have exclusively latitude and longitude lines as boundaries.

name: utah
sentence: One of Utah's defining characteristics is the variety of its terrain.

name: utah
sentence: Running down the middle of the state's northern third is the Wasatch Range, which rises to heights of almost 12,000 ft (3,700 m) above sea level.

name: utah
sentence: Utah is home to world-renowned ski resorts made popular by light, fluffy snow and winter storms that regularly dump up to three feet of it overnight.

name: utah
sentence: In the state's northeastern section, running east to west, are the Uinta Mountains, which rise to heights of over 13,000 feet (4,000 m).

name: utah
sentence: The highest point in the state, Kings Peak, at 13,528 feet (4,123 m), lies within the Uinta Mountains.

name: utah
sentence: At the western base of the Wasatch Range is the Wasatch Front, a series of valleys and basins that are home to the most populous parts of the state.

name: utah
sentence: It stretches approximately from Brigham City at the north end to Nephi at the south end.

name: utah
sentence: Approximately 75 percent of the state's population lives in this corridor, and population growth is rapid.

name: utah
sentence: Western Utah is mostly arid desert with a basin and range topography.

name: utah
sentence: Small mountain ranges and rugged terrain punctuate the landscape.

name: utah
sentence: The Bonneville Salt Flats are an exception, being comparatively flat as a result of once forming the bed of ancient Lake Bonneville.

name: utah
sentence: Great Salt Lake, Utah Lake, Sevier Lake, and Rush Lake are all remnants of this ancient freshwater lake, which once covered most of the eastern Great Basin.

name: utah
sentence: West of the Great Salt Lake, stretching to the Nevada border, lies the arid Great Salt Lake Desert.

name: utah
sentence: One exception to this aridity is Snake Valley, which is (relatively) lush due to large springs and wetlands fed from groundwater derived from snow melt in the Snake Range, Deep Creek Range, and other tall mountains to the west of Snake Valley.

name: utah
sentence: Great Basin National Park is just over the Nevada state line in the southern Snake Range.

name: utah
sentence: One of western Utah's most impressive, but least visited attractions is Notch Peak, the tallest limestone cliff in North America, located west of Delta.

name: utah
sentence: Much of the scenic southern and southeastern landscape (specifically the Colorado Plateau region) is sandstone, specifically Kayenta sandstone and Navajo sandstone.

name: utah
sentence: The Colorado River and its tributaries wind their way through the sandstone, creating some of the world's most striking and wild terrain (the area around the confluence of the Colorado and Green Rivers was the last to be mapped in the lower 48 United States).

name: utah
sentence: Wind and rain have also sculpted the soft sandstone over millions of years.

name: utah
sentence: Canyons, gullies, arches, pinnacles, buttes, bluffs, and mesas are the common sight throughout south-central and southeast Utah.

name: utah
sentence: This terrain is the central feature of protected state and federal parks such as Arches, Bryce Canyon, Canyonlands, Capitol Reef, and Zion national parks, Cedar Breaks, Grand Staircase-Escalante, Hovenweep, and Natural Bridges national monuments, Glen Canyon National Recreation Area (site of the popular tourist destination, Lake Powell), Dead Horse Point and Goblin Valley state parks, and Monument Valley.

name: utah
sentence: The Navajo Nation also extends into southeastern Utah.

name: utah
sentence: Southeastern Utah is also punctuated by the remote, but lofty La Sal, Abajo, and Henry mountain ranges.

name: utah
sentence: Eastern (northern quarter) Utah is a high-elevation area covered mostly by plateaus and basins, particularly the Tavaputs Plateau and San Rafael Swell, which remain mostly inaccessible, and the Uinta Basin, where the majority of eastern Utah's population lives.

name: utah
sentence: Economies are dominated by mining, oil shale, oil, and natural gas-drilling, ranching, and recreation.

name: utah
sentence: Much of eastern Utah is part of the Uintah and Ouray Indian Reservation.

name: utah
sentence: The most popular destination within northeastern Utah is Dinosaur National Monument near Vernal.

name: utah
sentence: Southwestern Utah is the lowest and hottest spot in Utah.

name: utah
sentence: It is known as Utah's Dixie because early settlers were able to grow some cotton there.

name: utah
sentence: Beaverdam Wash in far southwestern Utah is the lowest point in the state, at 2,000 feet (610 m).

name: utah
sentence: The northernmost portion of the Mojave Desert is also located in this area.

name: utah
sentence: Dixie is quickly becoming a popular recreational and retirement destination, and the population is growing rapidly.

name: utah
sentence: Although the Wasatch Mountains end at Mount Nebo near Nephi, a complex series of mountain ranges extends south from the southern end of the range down the spine of Utah.

name: utah
sentence: Just north of Dixie and east of Cedar City is the state's highest ski resort, Brian Head.

name: utah
sentence: Like most of the western and southwestern states, the federal government owns much of the land in Utah.

name: utah
sentence: Over 70 percent of the land is either BLM land, Utah State Trustland, or US National Forest, US National Park, US National Monument, National Recreation Area or US Wilderness Area.

name: utah
sentence: Utah is the only state where every county contains some national forest.

name: utah
sentence: Utah features a dry, semi-arid to desert climate, although its many mountains feature a large variety of climates, with the highest points in the Uinta Mountains being above the timberline.

name: utah
sentence: The dry weather is a result of the state's location in the rain shadow of the Sierra Nevada in California.

name: utah
sentence: The eastern half of the state lies in the rain shadow of the Wasatch Mountains.

name: utah
sentence: The primary source of precipitation for the state is the Pacific Ocean, with the state usually lying in the path of large Pacific storms from October to May.

name: utah
sentence: In summer, the state, especially southern and eastern Utah, lies in the path of monsoon moisture from the Gulf of California.

name: utah
sentence: Most of the lowland areas receive less than 12 inches (305 mm) of precipitation annually, although the I-15 corridor, including the densely populated Wasatch Front, receives approximately 15 inches (381 mm).

name: utah
sentence: The Great Salt Lake Desert is the driest area of the state, with less than 5 inches (127 mm).

name: utah
sentence: Snowfall is common in all but the far southern valleys.

name: utah
sentence: Although St. George receives only about 3 inches (76 mm) per year, Salt Lake City sees about 60 inches (1,524 mm), enhanced by the lake-effect snow from the Great Salt Lake, which increases snowfall totals to the south, southeast, and east of the lake.

name: utah
sentence: Some areas of the Wasatch Range in the path of the lake-effect receive up to 500 inches (12,700 mm) per year.

name: utah
sentence: This micro climate of enhanced snowfall from the Great Salt Lake spans the entire proximity of the lake.

name: utah
sentence: The cottonwood canyons adjacent to Salt Lake City are located in the right position to receive more precipitation from the lake.

name: utah
sentence: The consistently deep powder snow led Utah's ski industry to adopt the slogan "the Greatest Snow on Earth" in the 1980s.

name: utah
sentence: In the winter, temperature inversions are a common phenomenon across Utah's low basins and valleys, leading to thick haze and fog that can last for weeks at a time, especially in the Uintah Basin.

name: utah
sentence: Although at other times of year its air quality is good, winter inversions give Salt Lake City some of the worst wintertime pollution in the country.

name: utah
sentence: Previous studies have indicated a widespread decline in snowpack over Utah accompanied by a decline in the snow–precipitation ratio while anecdotal evidence claims have been put forward that measured changes in Utah's snowpack are spurious and do not reflect actual change.

name: utah
sentence: A 2012 study found that the proportion of winter (January–March) precipitation falling as snow has decreased by nine percent during the last half century, a combined result from a significant increase in rainfall and a minor decrease in snowfall.

name: utah
sentence: Meanwhile, observed snow depth across Utah has decreased and is accompanied by consistent decreases in snow cover and surface albedo.

name: utah
sentence: Weather systems with the potential to produce precipitation in Utah have decreased in number with those producing snowfall decreasing at a considerably greater rate.

name: utah
sentence: Utah's temperatures are extreme, with cold temperatures in winter due to its elevation, and very hot summers statewide (with the exception of mountain areas and high mountain valleys).

name: utah
sentence: Utah is usually protected from major blasts of cold air by mountains lying north and east of the state, although major Arctic blasts can occasionally reach the state.

name: utah
sentence: Average January high temperatures range from around 30 °F (−1 °C) in some northern valleys to almost 55 °F (13 °C) in St. George.

name: utah
sentence: Temperatures dropping below 0 °F (−18 °C) should be expected on occasion in most areas of the state most years, although some areas see it often (for example, the town of Randolph averages about fifty days per year with temperatures that low).

name: utah
sentence: In July, average highs range from about 85 to 100 °F (29 to 38 °C).

name: utah
sentence: However, the low humidity and high elevation typically leads to large temperature variations, leading to cool nights most summer days.

name: utah
sentence: The record high temperature in Utah was 118 °F (48 °C), recorded south of St. George on July 4, 2007, and the record low was −69 °F (−56 °C), recorded at Peter Sinks in the Bear River Mountains of northern Utah on February 1, 1985.

name: utah
sentence: However, the record low for an inhabited location is −49 °F (−45 °C) at Woodruff on December 12, 1932.

name: utah
sentence: Utah, like most of the western United States, has few days of thunderstorms.

name: utah
sentence: On average there are fewer than 40 days of thunderstorm activity during the year, although these storms can be briefly intense when they do occur.

name: utah
sentence: They are most likely to occur during monsoon season from about mid-July through mid-September, especially in southern and eastern Utah.

name: utah
sentence: Dry lightning strikes and the general dry weather often spark wildfires in summer, while intense thunderstorms can lead to flash flooding, especially in the rugged terrain of southern Utah.

name: utah
sentence: Although spring is the wettest season in northern Utah, late summer is the wettest period for much of the south and east of the state.

name: utah
sentence: Tornadoes are uncommon in Utah, with an average of two striking the state yearly, rarely higher than EF1 intensity.

name: utah
sentence: One exception of note, however, was the unprecedented F2 Salt Lake City Tornado which moved directly across downtown Salt Lake City on August 11, 1999, killing one person, injuring sixty others, and causing approximately $170 million in damage.

name: utah
sentence: The only other reported tornado fatality in Utah's history was a 7-year-old girl who was killed while camping in Summit County on July 6, 1884.

name: utah
sentence: The last tornado of above (E)F0 intensity occurred on September 8, 2002, when an F2 tornado hit Manti.

name: utah
sentence: On August 11, 1993, an F3 tornado hit the Uinta Mountains north of Duchesne at an elevation of 10,500 feet (3,200 m), causing some damage to a Boy Scouts campsite.

name: utah
sentence: This is the strongest tornado ever recorded in Utah.

name: utah
sentence: Utah is home to more than 600 vertebrate animals as well as numerous invertebrates and insects.

name: utah
sentence: Mammals are found in every area of Utah.

name: utah
sentence: Non-predatory larger mammals include the plains bison, elk, moose, mountain goat, mule deer, pronghorn, and multiple types of bighorn sheep.

name: utah
sentence: Non-predatory small mammals include muskrat, and nutria.

name: utah
sentence: Predatory mammals include the brown and black bear, cougar, Canada lynx, bobcat, fox (gray, red, and kit), coyote, badger, gray wolf, black-footed ferret, mink, stoat, long-tailed weasel, raccoon, and otter.

name: utah
sentence: There are many different insects found in Utah.

name: utah
sentence: One of the most rare is the Coral Pink Sand Dunes tiger beetle, found only in Coral Pink Sand Dunes State Park, near Kanab.

name: utah
sentence: It was proposed in 2012 to be listed as a threatened species, but the proposal was not accepted.

name: utah
sentence: In February 2009, Africanized honeybees were found in southern Utah.

name: utah
sentence: The bees had spread into eight counties in Utah, as far north as Grand and Emery counties by May 2017.

name: utah
sentence: The white-lined sphinx moth is common to most of the United States, but there have been reported outbreaks of large groups of their larvae damaging tomato, grape and garden crops in Utah.

name: utah
sentence: Several thousand plants are native to Utah.

name: utah
sentence: The United States Census Bureau estimates that the population of Utah was 3,205,958 on July 1, 2019, an 16.00% increase since the 2010 United States Census.

name: utah
sentence: The center of population of Utah is located in Utah County in the city of Lehi.

name: utah
sentence: Much of the population lives in cities and towns along the Wasatch Front, a metropolitan region that runs north–south with the Wasatch Mountains rising on the eastern side.

name: utah
sentence: Growth outside the Wasatch Front is also increasing.

name: utah
sentence: The St. George metropolitan area is currently the second fastest-growing in the country after the Las Vegas metropolitan area, while the Heber micropolitan area is also the second fastest-growing in the country (behind Palm Coast, Florida).

name: utah
sentence: Utah contains five metropolitan areas (Logan, Ogden-Clearfield, Salt Lake City, Provo-Orem, and St. George), and six micropolitan areas (Brigham City, Heber, Vernal, Price, Richfield, and Cedar City).

name: utah
sentence: Utah ranks among the highest in total fertility rate, 47th in teenage pregnancy, lowest in percentage of births out of wedlock, lowest in number of abortions per capita, and lowest in percentage of teen pregnancies terminated in abortion.

name: utah
sentence: However, statistics relating to pregnancies and abortions may also be artificially low from teenagers going out of state for abortions because of parental notification requirements.

name: utah
sentence: Utah has the lowest child poverty rate in the country, despite its young demographics.

name: utah
sentence: According to the Gallup-Healthways Global Well-Being Index as of 2012, Utahns ranked fourth in overall well-being in the United States.

name: utah
sentence: A 2002 national prescription drug study determined that antidepressant drugs were "prescribed in Utah more often than in any other state, at a rate nearly twice the national average".

name: utah
sentence: The data shows that depression rates in Utah are no higher than the national average.

name: utah
sentence: At the 2010 Census, 86.1% of the population was non-Hispanic White, down from 93.8% in 1990, 1% non-Hispanic Black or African American, 1.2% non-Hispanic Native American and Alaska Native, 2% non-Hispanic Asian, 0.9% non-Hispanic Native Hawaiian and Other Pacific Islander, 0.1% from some other race (non-Hispanic) and 1.8% of two or more races (non-Hispanic).

name: utah
sentence: 13.0% of Utah's population was of Hispanic, Latino, or Spanish origin (of any race).

name: utah
sentence: The largest ancestry groups in the state are:

name: utah
sentence: Most Utahns are of Northern European descent.

name: utah
sentence: In 2011 one-third of Utah's workforce was reported to be bilingual, developed through a program of acquisition of second languages beginning in elementary school, and related to Mormonism's missionary goals for its young people.

name: utah
sentence: In 2011, 28.6% of Utah's population younger than the age of one were ethnic minorities, meaning they had at least one parent who was of a race other than non-Hispanic white.

name: utah
sentence: As of 2017, 62.8% of Utahns are counted as members of the LDS Church.

name: utah
sentence: This declined to 61.2% in 2018 and to 60.7% in 2019.

name: utah
sentence: Members of the LDS Church currently make up between 34%–41% of the population within Salt Lake City.

name: utah
sentence: However, many of the other major population centers such as Provo, Logan, Tooele, and St. George tend to be predominantly LDS, along with many suburban and rural areas.

name: utah
sentence: The LDS Church has the largest number of congregations, numbering 4,815 wards.

name: utah
sentence: Though the LDS Church officially maintains a policy of neutrality in regard to political parties, the church's doctrine has a strong regional influence on politics.

name: utah
sentence: Another doctrine effect can be seen in Utah's high birth rate (25 percent higher than the national average

name: utah
sentence: The Mormons in Utah tend to have conservative views when it comes to most political issues and the majority of voter-age Utahns are unaffiliated voters (60%) who vote overwhelmingly Republican.

name: utah
sentence: Mitt Romney received 72.8% of the Utahn votes in 2012, while John McCain polled 62.5% in the 2008 United States presidential election and 70.9% for George W. Bush in 2004.

name: utah
sentence: In 2010 the Association of Religion Data Archives (ARDA) reported that the three largest denominational groups in Utah are the LDS Church with 1,910,504 adherents; the Catholic Church with 160,125 adherents, and the Southern Baptist Convention with 12,593 adherents.

name: utah
sentence: There is a small but growing Jewish presence in the state.

name: utah
sentence: According to results from the 2010 United States Census, combined with official LDS Church membership statistics, church members represented 62.1% of Utah's total population.

name: utah
sentence: The Utah county with the lowest percentage of church members was Grand County, at 26.5%, while the county with the highest percentage was Morgan County, at 86.1%.

name: utah
sentence: In addition, the result for the most populated county, Salt Lake County, was 51.4%.

name: utah
sentence: According to a Gallup poll, Utah had the third-highest number of people reporting as "Very Religious" in 2015, at 55% (trailing only Mississippi and Alabama).

name: utah
sentence: However, it was near the national average of people reporting as "Nonreligious" (31%), and featured the smallest percentage of people reporting as "Moderately Religious" (15%) of any state, being eight points lower than second-lowest state Vermont.

name: utah
sentence: In addition, it had the highest average weekly church attendance of any state, at 51%.

name: utah
sentence: The official language in the state of Utah is English.

name: utah
sentence: Utah English is primarily a merger of Northern and Midland American dialects carried west by LDS Church members, whose original New York dialect later incorporated features from southern Ohio and central Illinois.

name: utah
sentence: Conspicuous in the speech of some in the central valley, although less frequent now in Salt Lake City, is a reversal of vowels, so that farm and barn sound like form and born and, conversely, form and born sound like farm and barn.

name: utah
sentence: In 2000, 87.5% of all state residents five years of age or older spoke only English at home, a decrease from 92.2% in 1990.

name: utah
sentence: Utah has the highest total birth rate and accordingly, the youngest population of any US state.

name: utah
sentence: In 2010, the state's population was 50.2% male and 49.8% female.

name: utah
sentence: The life expectancy is 79.3 years.

name: utah
sentence: According to the Bureau of Economic Analysis, the gross state product of Utah in 2012 was US$130.5 billion, or 0.87% of the total United States GDP of US$14.991 trillion for the same year.

name: utah
sentence: The per capita personal income was $45,700 in 2012.

name: utah
sentence: Major industries of Utah include: mining, cattle ranching, salt production, and government services.

name: utah
sentence: According to the 2007 State New Economy Index, Utah is ranked the top state in the nation for Economic Dynamism, determined by "the degree to which state economies are knowledge-based, globalized, entrepreneurial, information technology-driven and innovation-based".

name: utah
sentence: In 2014, Utah was ranked number one in Forbes' list of "Best States For Business".

name: utah
sentence: A November 2010 article in Newsweek magazine highlighted Utah and particularly the Salt Lake City area's economic outlook, calling it "the new economic Zion", and examined how the area has been able to bring in high-paying jobs and attract high-tech corporations to the area during a recession.

name: utah
sentence: As of September 2014, the state's unemployment rate was 3.5%.

name: utah
sentence: In terms of "small business friendliness", in 2014 Utah emerged as number one, based on a study drawing upon data from more than 12,000 small business owners.

name: utah
sentence: In eastern Utah petroleum production is a major industry.

name: utah
sentence: Near Salt Lake City, petroleum refining is done by a number of oil companies.

name: utah
sentence: In central Utah, coal production accounts for much of the mining activity.

name: utah
sentence: According to Internal Revenue Service tax returns, Utahns rank first among all US states in the proportion of income given to charity by the wealthy.

name: utah
sentence: This is due to the standard ten percent of all earnings that Mormons give to the LDS Church.

name: utah
sentence: According to the Corporation for National and Community Service, Utah had an average of 884,000 volunteers between 2008 and 2010, each of whom contributed 89.2 hours per volunteer.

name: utah
sentence: This figure equates to $3.8 billion of service contributed, ranking Utah number one for volunteerism in the nation.

name: utah
sentence: Utah collects personal income tax

name: utah
sentence: The state sales tax has a base rate of 6.45 percent, with cities and counties levying additional local sales taxes that vary among the municipalities.

name: utah
sentence: Property taxes are assessed and collected locally.

name: utah
sentence: Utah does not charge intangible property taxes and does not impose an inheritance tax.

name: utah
sentence: Tourism is a major industry in Utah.

name: utah
sentence: With five national parks (Arches, Bryce Canyon, Canyonlands, Capitol Reef, and Zion), Utah has the third most national parks of any state after Alaska and California.

name: utah
sentence: In addition, Utah features eight national monuments (Cedar Breaks, Dinosaur, Grand Staircase-Escalante, Hovenweep, Natural Bridges, Bears Ears, Rainbow Bridge, and Timpanogos Cave), two national recreation areas (Flaming Gorge and Glen Canyon), seven national forests (Ashley, Caribou-Targhee, Dixie, Fishlake, Manti-La Sal, Sawtooth, and Uinta-Wasatch-Cache), and numerous state parks and monuments.

name: utah
sentence: The Moab area, in the southeastern part of the state, is known for its challenging mountain biking trails, including Slickrock.

name: utah
sentence: Moab also hosts the famous Moab Jeep Safari semiannually.

name: utah
sentence: Utah has seen an increase in tourism since the 2002 Winter Olympics.

name: utah
sentence: Park City is home to the United States Ski Team.

name: utah
sentence: Utah's ski resorts are primarily located in northern Utah near Salt Lake City, Park City, Ogden, and Provo.

name: utah
sentence: Between 2007 and 2011 Deer Valley in Park City, has been ranked the top ski resort in North America in a survey organized by Ski Magazine.

name: utah
sentence: Utah has many significant ski resorts.

name: utah
sentence: The 2009 Ski Magazine reader survey concluded that six of the top ten resorts deemed most "accessible", and six of the top ten with the best snow conditions, were located in Utah.

name: utah
sentence: In Southern Utah, Brian Head Ski Resort is located in the mountains near Cedar City.

name: utah
sentence: Former Olympic venues including Utah Olympic Park and Utah Olympic Oval are still in operation for training and competition and allows the public to participate in numerous activities including ski jumping, bobsleigh, and speed skating.

name: utah
sentence: Utah features many cultural attractions such as Temple Square, the Sundance Film Festival, the Red Rock Film Festival, the DOCUTAH Film Festival, the Utah Data Center, and the Utah Shakespearean Festival.

name: utah
sentence: Temple Square is ranked as the 16th most visited tourist attraction in the United States by Forbes magazine, with more than five million annual visitors.

name: utah
sentence: Other attractions include Monument Valley, the Great Salt Lake, the Bonneville Salt Flats, and Lake Powell.

name: utah
sentence: The state of Utah relies heavily on income from tourists and travelers visiting the state's parks and ski resorts, and thus the need to "brand" Utah and create an impression of the state throughout the world has led to several state slogans, the most famous of which being "The Greatest Snow on Earth", which has been in use in Utah officially since 1975 (although the slogan was in unofficial use as early as 1962) and now adorns nearly 50 percent of the state's license plates.

name: utah
sentence: In 2001, Utah Governor Mike Leavitt approved a new state slogan, "Utah!

name: utah
sentence: Where Ideas Connect", which lasted until March 10, 2006, when the Utah Travel Council and the office of Governor Jon Huntsman announced that "Life Elevated" would be the new state slogan.

name: utah
sentence: Beginning in the late 19th century with the state's mining boom (including the Bingham Canyon Mine, among the world's largest open pit mines), companies attracted large numbers of immigrants with job opportunities.

name: utah
sentence: Since the days of the Utah Territory mining has played a major role in Utah's economy.

name: utah
sentence: Historical mining towns include Mercur in Tooele County, Silver Reef in Washington County, Eureka in Juab County, Park City in Summit County and numerous coal mining camps throughout Carbon County such as Castle Gate, Spring Canyon, and Hiawatha.

name: utah
sentence: These settlements were characteristic of the boom and bust cycle that dominated mining towns of the American West.

name: utah
sentence: Park City, Utah, and Alta, Utah were a boom towns in the early twentieth centuries.

name: utah
sentence: Rich silver mines in the mountains adjacent to the towns led to many people flocking to the towns in search of wealth.

name: utah
sentence: During the early part of the Cold War era, uranium was mined in eastern Utah.

name: utah
sentence: Today mining activity still plays a major role in the state's economy.

name: utah
sentence: Minerals mined in Utah include copper, gold, silver, molybdenum, zinc, lead, and beryllium.

name: utah
sentence: Fossil fuels including coal, petroleum, and natural gas continue to play a large role in Utah's economy, especially in the eastern part of the state in counties such as Carbon, Emery, Grand, and Uintah.

name: utah
sentence: In 2007, nine people were killed at the Crandall Canyon Mine collapse.

name: utah
sentence: On March 22, 2013, one miner died and another was injured after they became trapped in a cave-in at a part of the Castle Valley Mining Complex, about 16 kilometres (9.9 mi) west of the small mining town of Huntington in Emery County.

name: utah
sentence: Utah has the potential to generate 31.6 TWh/year from 13.1 GW of wind power, and 10,290 TWh/year from solar power using 4,048 GW of photovoltaic (PV), including 5.6 GW of rooftop photovoltaic, and 1,638 GW of concentrated solar power.

name: utah
sentence: I-15 and I-80 are the main interstate highways in the state, where they intersect and briefly merge near downtown Salt Lake City.

name: utah
sentence: I-15 traverses the state north-to-south, entering from Arizona near St. George, paralleling the Wasatch Front, and crossing into Idaho near Portage.

name: utah
sentence: I-80 spans northern Utah east-to-west, entering from Nevada at Wendover, crossing the Wasatch Mountains east of Salt Lake City, and entering Wyoming near Evanston.

name: utah
sentence: I-84 West enters from Idaho near Snowville (from Boise) and merges with I-15 from Tremonton to Ogden, then heads southeast through the Wasatch Mountains before terminating at I-80 near Echo Junction.

name: utah
sentence: I-70 splits from I-15 at Cove Fort in central Utah and heads east through mountains and rugged desert terrain, providing quick access to the many national parks and national monuments of southern Utah, and has been noted for its beauty.

name: utah
sentence: The 103 mi (166 km) stretch from Salina to Green River is the country's longest stretch of interstate without services and, when completed in 1970, was the longest stretch of entirely new highway constructed in the US since the Alaska Highway was completed in 1943.

name: utah
sentence: TRAX, a light rail system in the Salt Lake Valley, consists of three lines.

name: utah
sentence: The Blue Line (formerly Salt Lake/Sandy Line) begins in the suburb of Draper and ends in Downtown Salt Lake City.

name: utah
sentence: The Red Line (Mid-Jordan/University Line) begins in the Daybreak Community of South Jordan, a southwestern valley suburb, and ends at the University of Utah.

name: utah
sentence: The Green Line begins in West Valley City, passes through downtown Salt Lake City, and ends at Salt Lake City International Airport.

name: utah
sentence: The Utah Transit Authority (UTA), which operates TRAX, also operates a bus system that stretches across the Wasatch Front, west into Grantsville, and east into Park City.

name: utah
sentence: In addition, UTA provides winter service to the ski resorts east of Salt Lake City, Ogden, and Provo.

name: utah
sentence: Several bus companies also provide access to the ski resorts in winter, and local bus companies also serve the cities of Cedar City, Logan, Park City, and St. George.

name: utah
sentence: A commuter rail line known as FrontRunner, also operated by UTA, runs between Ogden and Provo via Salt Lake City.

name: utah
sentence: Amtrak's California Zephyr, with one train in each direction daily, runs east–west through Utah with stops in Green River, Helper, Provo, and Salt Lake City.

name: utah
sentence: Salt Lake City International Airport is the only international airport in the state and serves as one of the hubs for Delta Air Lines.

name: utah
sentence: The airport has consistently ranked first in on-time departures and had the fewest cancellations among US airports.

name: utah
sentence: The airport has non-stop service to more than a hundred destinations throughout the United States, Canada, and Mexico, as well as to Amsterdam, London and Paris.

name: utah
sentence: Canyonlands Field (near Moab), Cedar City Regional Airport, Ogden-Hinckley Airport, Provo Municipal Airport, St. George Regional Airport, and Vernal Regional Airport all provide limited commercial air service.

name: utah
sentence: A new regional airport at St. George opened on January 12, 2011.

name: utah
sentence: SkyWest Airlines is also headquartered in St. George and maintains a hub at Salt Lake City.

name: utah
sentence: Utah government is divided into three branches: executive, legislative, and judicial.

name: utah
sentence: The current governor of Utah is Gary Herbert, who was sworn in on August 11, 2009.

name: utah
sentence: The governor is elected for a four-year term.

name: utah
sentence: The Utah State Legislature consists of a Senatorte and a House of Representatives.

name: utah
sentence: State senators serve four-year terms and representatives two-year terms.

name: utah
sentence: The Utah Legislature meets each year in January for an annual 45-day session.

name: utah
sentence: The Utah Supreme Court is the court of last resort in Utah.

name: utah
sentence: It consists of five justices, who are appointed by the governor, and then subject to retention election.

name: utah
sentence: The Utah Court of Appeals handles cases from the trial courts.

name: utah
sentence: Trial level courts are the district courts and justice courts.

name: utah
sentence: All justices and judges, like those on the Utah Supreme Court, are subject to retention election after appointment.

name: utah
sentence: Utah is divided into political jurisdictions designated as counties.

name: utah
sentence: Since 1918 there have been 29 counties in the state, ranging from 298 to 7,819 square miles (772 to 20,300 km2).

name: utah
sentence: Utah granted full voting rights to women in 1870, 26 years before becoming a state.

name: utah
sentence: Among all US states, only Wyoming granted suffrage to women earlier.

name: utah
sentence: However, in 1887 the initial Edmunds-Tucker Act was passed by Congress in an effort to curtail Mormon influence in the territorial government.

name: utah
sentence: One of the provisions of the Act was the repeal of women's suffrage

name: utah
sentence: Utah is one of the 15 states that have not ratified the US

name: utah
sentence: Equal Rights Amendment.

name: utah
sentence: In March 2018, Utah passed America's first "free-range parenting" bill.

name: utah
sentence: The bill was signed into law by Republican Governor Gary Herbert and states that parents who allow their children to engage in certain activities without supervision are not considered neglectful.

name: utah
sentence: The constitution of Utah was enacted in 1895.

name: utah
sentence: Notably, the constitution outlawed polygamy, as requested by Congress when Utah had applied for statehood, and reestablished the territorial practice of women's suffrage.

name: utah
sentence: Utah's Constitution has been amended many times since its inception.

name: utah
sentence: Utah's laws in regard to alcohol, tobacco and gambling are strict.

name: utah
sentence: Utah is an alcoholic beverage control state.

name: utah
sentence: The Utah Department of Alcoholic Beverage Control regulates the sale of alcohol; wine and spirituous liquors may be purchased only at state liquor stores, and local laws may prohibit the sale of beer and other alcoholic beverages on Sundays.

name: utah
sentence: The state bans the sale of fruity alcoholic drinks at grocery stores and convenience stores.

name: utah
sentence: The law states that such drinks must now have new state-approved labels on the front of the products that contain capitalized letters in bold type telling consumers the drinks contain alcohol and at what percentage.

name: utah
sentence: The Utah Indoor Clean Air Act is a statewide smoking ban that prohibits it in many public places.

name: utah
sentence: Utah and Hawaii are the only two states in the United States to outlaw all forms of gambling.

name: utah
sentence: Same-sex marriage became legal in Utah on December 20, 2013 when judge Robert J. Shelby of the United States District Court for the District of Utah issued a ruling in Kitchen v. Herbert.

name: utah
sentence: As of close of business December 26, more than 1,225 marriage licenses were issued, with at least 74 percent, or 905 licenses, issued to gay and lesbian couples.

name: utah
sentence: The state Attorney General's office was granted a stay of the ruling by the United States Supreme Court on January 6, 2014 while the Tenth Circuit Court of Appeals considered the case.

name: utah
sentence: On Monday October 6, 2014, the Supreme Court of the United States declined a Writ of Certiorari, and the 10th Circuit Court issued their mandate later that day, lifting their stay.

name: utah
sentence: Same-sex marriages commenced again in Utah that day.

name: utah
sentence: In the late 19th century, the federal government took issue with polygamy in the LDS Church.

name: utah
sentence: The LDS Church discontinued plural marriage in 1890, and in 1896 Utah gained admission to the Union.

name: utah
sentence: Many new people settled the area soon after the Mormon pioneers.

name: utah
sentence: Relations have often been strained between the LDS population and the non-LDS population.

name: utah
sentence: These tensions have played a large part in Utah's history (Liberal Party vs. People's Party).

name: utah
sentence: Utah votes predominantly Republican.

name: utah
sentence: Self-identified Latter-day Saints are more likely to vote for the Republican ticket than non-Mormons.

name: utah
sentence: Utah is one of the most Republican states in the nation.

name: utah
sentence: Utah was the single most Republican-leaning state in the country in every presidential election from 1976 to 2004, measured by the percentage point margin between the Republican and Democratic candidates.

name: utah
sentence: In 2008 Utah was only the third-most Republican state (after Wyoming and Oklahoma), but in 2012, with Mormon Mitt Romney atop the Republican ticket, Utah returned to its position as the most Republican state.

name: utah
sentence: However, the 2016 presidential election result saw Republican Donald Trump carry the state (marking the thirteenth consecutive win by the Republican presidential candidate) with only a plurality, the first time this happened since 1992.

name: utah
sentence: Both Utah's US

name: utah
sentence: Senatortors, Mitt Romney and Mike Lee, are Republican.

name: utah
sentence: Three more Republicans—Rob Bishop, Chris Stewart, and John Curtis—represent Utah in the United States House of Representatives.

name: utah
sentence: Ben McAdams, the sole Democratic member of the Utah delegation, represents the 4th congressional district, though he lost re-election to Burgress Owens, a Republican, in 2020.

name: utah
sentence: After Jon Huntsman Jr. resigned to serve as US

name: utah
sentence: Ambassador to China, Gary Herbert was sworn in as governor on August 11, 2009.

name: utah
sentence: Herbert was elected to serve out the remainder of the term in a special election in 2010, defeating Democratic nominee Salt Lake County Mayor Peter Corroon with 64% of the vote.

name: utah
sentence: He won election to a full four-year term in 2012, defeating the Democrat Peter Cooke with 68% of the vote.

name: utah
sentence: The LDS Church maintains an official policy of neutrality with regard to political parties and candidates.

name: utah
sentence: In the 1970s, then-Apostle Ezra Taft Benson was quoted by the Associated Press that it would be difficult for a faithful Latter-day Saint to be a liberal Democrat.

name: utah
sentence: Although the LDS Church has officially repudiated such statements on many occasions, Democratic candidates—including LDS Democrats—believe Republicans capitalize on the perception that the Republican Party is doctrinally superior.

name: utah
sentence: Political scientist and pollster Dan Jones explains this disparity by noting that the national Democratic Party is associated with liberal positions on gay marriage and abortion, both of which the LDS Church is against.

name: utah
sentence: The Republican Party in heavily Mormon Utah County presents itself as the superior choice for Latter-day Saints.

name: utah
sentence: Even though Utah Democratic candidates are predominantly LDS, socially conservative, and pro-life, no Democrat has won in Utah County since 1994.

name: utah
sentence: David Magleby, dean of Social and Behavioral Sciences at Brigham Young University, a lifelong Democrat and a political analyst, asserts that the Republican Party actually has more conservative positions than the LDS Church.

name: utah
sentence: Magleby argues that the locally conservative Democrats are in better accord with LDS doctrine.

name: utah
sentence: For example, the Republican Party of Utah opposes almost all abortions while Utah Democrats take a more liberal approach, although more conservative than their national counterparts.

name: utah
sentence: On Second Amendment issues, the state GOP has been at odds with the LDS Church position opposing concealed firearms in places of worship and in public spaces.

name: utah
sentence: In 1998 the church expressed concern that Utahns perceived the Republican Party as an LDS institution and authorized lifelong Democrat and Seventy Marlin Jensen to promote LDS bipartisanship.

name: utah
sentence: Utah is much more conservative than the United States as a whole, particularly on social issues.

name: utah
sentence: Compared to other Republican-dominated states in the Mountain West such as Idaho and Wyoming, Utah politics have a more moralistic and less libertarian character, according to David Magleby.

name: utah
sentence: About 80% of Utah's Legislature are members of The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints, while members account for 61 percent of the population.

name: utah
sentence: Since becoming a state in 1896, Utah has had only two non-Mormon governors.

name: utah
sentence: In 2006, the legislature passed legislation aimed at banning joint-custody for a non-biological parent of a child.

name: utah
sentence: The custody measure passed the legislature and was vetoed by the governor, a reciprocal benefits supporter.

name: utah
sentence: Carbon County's Democrats are generally made up of members of the large Greek, Italian, and Southeastern European communities, whose ancestors migrated in the early 20th century to work in the extensive mining industry.

name: utah
sentence: The views common amongst this group are heavily influenced by labor politics, particularly of the New Deal Era.

name: utah
sentence: The state's most Republican areas tend to be Utah County, which is the home to Brigham Young University in the city of Provo, and nearly all the rural counties.

name: utah
sentence: These areas generally hold socially conservative views in line with that of the national Religious Right.

name: utah
sentence: The most Democratic areas of the state lie currently in and around Salt Lake City proper.

name: utah
sentence: The state has not voted for a Democrat for president since 1964.

name: utah
sentence: Historically, Republican presidential nominees score one of their best margins of victory here.

name: utah
sentence: Utah was the Republicans' best state in the 1976, 1980, 1984, 1988, 1996, 2000, and 2004 elections.

name: utah
sentence: In 1992, Utah was the only state in the nation where Democratic candidate Bill Clinton finished behind both Republican candidate George HW Bush and Independent candidate Ross Perot.

name: utah
sentence: In 2004, Republican George W. Bush won every county in the state and Utah gave him his largest margin of victory of any state.

name: utah
sentence: He won the state's five electoral votes by a margin of 46 percentage points with 71.5% of the vote.

name: utah
sentence: In the 1996 Presidential elections the Republican candidate received a smaller 54% of the vote while the Democrat earned 34%.

name: utah
sentence: Utah's population is concentrated in two areas, the Wasatch Front in the north-central part of the state, with over 2.6 million residents; and Washington County, in southwestern Utah, locally known as "Dixie", with more than 175,000 residents in the metropolitan area.

name: utah
sentence: According to the 2010 Census, Utah was the second fastest-growing state (at 23.8 percent) in the United States between 2000 and 2010 (behind Nevada).

name: utah
sentence: St. George, in the southwest, is the second fastest-growing metropolitan area in the United States, trailing Greeley, Colorado.

name: utah
sentence: The three fastest-growing counties from 2000 to 2010 were Wasatch County (54.7%), Washington County (52.9%), and Tooele County (42.9%).

name: utah
sentence: However, Utah County added the most people (148,028).

name: utah
sentence: Between 2000 and 2010, Saratoga Springs (1,673%), Herriman (1,330%), Eagle Mountain (893%), Cedar Hills (217%), South Willard (168%), Nibley (166%), Syracuse (159%), West Haven (158%), Lehi (149%), Washington (129%), and Stansbury Park (116%) all at least doubled in population.

name: utah
sentence: West Jordan (35,376), Lehi (28,379), St. George (23,234), South Jordan (20,981), West Valley City (20,584), and Herriman (20,262) all added at least 20,000 people.

name: utah
sentence: Utah is the second-least populous US state to have a major professional sports league franchise, after the Vegas Golden Knights joined the National Hockey League in 2017.

name: utah
sentence: The Utah Jazz of the National Basketball Association play at Vivint Smart Home Arena in Salt Lake City.

name: utah
sentence: The team moved to the city from New Orleans in 1979 and has been one of the most consistently successful teams in the league (although they have yet to win a championship).

name: utah
sentence: Salt Lake City was previously host to the Utah Stars, who competed in the ABA from 1970 to 1976 and won one championship, and to the Utah Starzz of the WNBA from 1997 to 2003.

name: utah
sentence: Real Salt Lake of Major League Soccer was founded in 2005 and play their home matches at Rio Tinto Stadium in Sandy.

name: utah
sentence: RSL remains the only Utah major league sports team to have won a national championship, having won the MLS Cup in 2009.

name: utah
sentence: RSL currently operates three adult teams in addition to the MLS side.

name: utah
sentence: Real Monarchs, competing in the second-level USL Championship, is the official reserve side for RSL.

name: utah
sentence: The team began play in the 2015 season at Rio Tinto Stadium, remaining there until moving to Zions Bank Stadium, located at RSL's training center in Herriman, for the 2018 season and beyond.

name: utah
sentence: Utah Royals FC, which shares ownership with RSL and also plays at Rio Tinto Stadium, has played in the National Women's Soccer League, the top level of US women's soccer, since 2018.

name: utah
sentence: Before the creation of the Royals, RSL's main women's side had been Real Salt Lake Women, which began play in the Women's Premier Soccer League in 2008 and moved to United Women's Soccer in 2016.

name: utah
sentence: RSL Women currently play at Utah Valley University in Orem.

name: utah
sentence: The Utah Blaze began play in the original version of the Arena Football League in 2006, and remained in the league until it folded in 2009.

name: utah
sentence: The Blaze returned to the league at its relaunch in 2010, playing until the team's demise in 2013.

name: utah
sentence: They competed originally at the Maverik Center in West Valley City, and later at Vivint Smart Home Arena when it was known as EnergySolutions Arena.

name: utah
sentence: Utah's highest level minor league baseball team is the Salt Lake Bees, who play at Smith's Ballpark in Salt Lake City and are part of the AAA level Pacific Coast League.

name: utah
sentence: Utah also has one minor league hockey team, the Utah Grizzlies, who play at the Maverik Center and compete in the ECHL.

name: utah
sentence: Utah has seven universities that compete in Division I of the NCAA.

name: utah
sentence: Three of the schools have football programs that participate in the top-level Football Bowl Subdivision: Utah in the Pac-12 Conference, Utah State in the Mountain West Conference, and BYU as an independent (although BYU competes in the non-football West Coast Conference for most other sports).

name: utah
sentence: In addition, Weber State and Southern Utah (SUU) compete in the Big Sky Conference of the FCS.

name: utah
sentence: Dixie State, with an FCS football program, and Utah Valley, with no football program, are members of the Western Athletic Conference (WAC).

name: utah
sentence: Dixie State began a four-year transition to Division I in 2020.

name: utah
sentence: Since the WAC has been a non-football conference since 2013, Dixie State football plays as an FCS independent.

name: utah
sentence: Salt Lake City hosted the 2002 Winter Olympics.

name: utah
sentence: After early financial struggles and scandal, the 2002 Olympics eventually became among the most successful Winter Olympics in history from a marketing and financial standpoint.

name: utah
sentence: Watched by more than two billion viewers, the Games ended up with a profit of $100 million.

name: utah
sentence: Utah has hosted professional golf tournaments such as the Uniting Fore Care Classic and currently the Utah Championship.

name: utah
sentence: Rugby has been growing quickly in the state of Utah, growing from 17 teams in 2009 to 70 as of 2013 with more than 3,000 players, and more than 55 high school varsity teams.

name: utah
sentence: The growth has been inspired in part by the 2008 movie Forever Strong.

name: utah
sentence: Utah fields two of the most competitive teams in the nation in college rugby—BYU and Utah.

name: utah
sentence: BYU has won the National Championship in 2009, 2012, 2013, 2014, and 2015.

name: utah
sentence: Formed in 2017, Utah Warriors is a Major League Rugby team based in Salt Lake City.

name: utah
sentence: Utah is the setting of or the filming location for many books, films, television series, music videos, and video games.

name: utah
sentence: Utah's capitol Salt Lake City is the final location in the video game The Last of Us.

name: utah
sentence: This article incorporates public domain material from the website of the Division of Utah State Parks and Recreation.

name: vermont
sentence: Vermont ( (listen)) is a northeastern state in the New England region of the United States.

name: vermont
sentence: It borders the states of Massachusetts to the south, New Hampshire to the east, and New York to the west, and the Canadian province of Quebec to the north.

name: vermont
sentence: Vermont is the only state in New England that does not border the Atlantic Ocean.

name: vermont
sentence: Vermont is the second-least-populated US state and the sixth-smallest by area of the 50 US states.

name: vermont
sentence: The state capital is Montpelier, the least-populous state capital in the United States.

name: vermont
sentence: The most-populous city, Burlington, is the least-populous city to be the most-populous city in a state.

name: vermont
sentence: For some 12,000 years, indigenous peoples inhabited this area.

name: vermont
sentence: The historically competitive tribes of the Algonquian-speaking Abenaki and Iroquoian-speaking Mohawk were active in the area at the time of European encounter.

name: vermont
sentence: During the 17th century, French colonists claimed the territory as part of the Kingdom of France's colony of New France.

name: vermont
sentence: After the Kingdom of Great Britain began to settle colonies to the south along the Atlantic coast, the two nations competed in North America in addition to Europe.

name: vermont
sentence: For years, each country enlisted Native American allies in continuous raiding and warfare between the New England and New France colonies.

name: vermont
sentence: This produced an active trade in captives taken during such raids, often held for ransom, although some captives were adopted by families into the Mohawk or Abenaki tribes.

name: vermont
sentence: After being defeated in 1763 in the Seven Years' War, France ceded its territory east of the Mississippi River to Great Britain.

name: vermont
sentence: Thereafter, the nearby British Thirteen Colonies, especially the provinces of New Hampshire and New York, disputed the extent of the area called the New Hampshire Grants to the west of the Connecticut River, encompassing present-day Vermont.

name: vermont
sentence: The provincial government of New York sold land grants to settlers in the region, which conflicted with earlier grants from the government of New Hampshire.

name: vermont
sentence: The Green Mountain Boys militia protected the interests of the established New Hampshire land grant settlers against the newly arrived settlers with land titles granted by New York.

name: vermont
sentence: Ultimately, a group of settlers with New Hampshire land grant titles established the Vermont Republic in 1777 as an independent state during the American Revolutionary War.

name: vermont
sentence: The Vermont Republic abolished slavery before any of the other states.

name: vermont
sentence: Vermont was also the first state to produce an African-American university graduate, Alexander Twilight, in 1823.

name: vermont
sentence: Vermont was admitted to the newly established United States as the fourteenth state in 1791.

name: vermont
sentence: Vermont is one of the four US states that were previously sovereign states (along with Texas, California, and Hawaii).

name: vermont
sentence: During the mid-19th century, Vermont was a strong source of abolitionist sentiment, although it was also tied to King Cotton through the development of textile mills in the region, which relied on southern cotton.

name: vermont
sentence: It sent a significant contingent of soldiers to participate in the American Civil War.

name: vermont
sentence: The geography of the state is marked by the Green Mountains, which run north–south up the middle of the state, separating Lake Champlain and other valley terrain on the west from the Connecticut River valley that defines much of its eastern border.

name: vermont
sentence: A majority of its terrain is forested with hardwoods and conifers, and a majority of its open land is devoted to agriculture.

name: vermont
sentence: The state's climate is characterized by warm, humid summers and cold, snowy winters.

name: vermont
sentence: Vermont's economic activity of $34 billion in 2018 ranked 52nd on the list of US states and territories by GDP (every state plus Washington, D.C. and Puerto Rico were larger), but 34th in GDP per capita.

name: vermont
sentence: In 1960, Vermonters' politics started to shift from being reliably Republican toward favoring Democratic candidates.

name: vermont
sentence: Starting in 1963, Vermont voters have alternated between electing Republican and Democratic governors.

name: vermont
sentence: Since 2007, Vermont has elected only Democrats and independents to Congress.

name: vermont
sentence: In 2000, the state legislature was the first to recognize civil unions for same-sex couples.

name: vermont
sentence: In 2011–2012, the state officially recognized four Abenaki tribes.

name: vermont
sentence: Samuel de Champlain claimed the area around what is now Lake Champlain, giving the name Verd Mont (Green Mountain) to the region he found, on a 1647 map.

name: vermont
sentence: Evidence suggests that this name came into use among English settlers, before it morphed to "Vermont", ca.

name: vermont
sentence: In 1777, Thomas Young introduced the name in writing with a broadside "To the Inhabitants of Vermont, a Free and Independent State".

name: vermont
sentence: Vermont is located in the New England region of the Northeastern United States and comprises 9,614 square miles (24,900 km2), making it the 45th-largest state.

name: vermont
sentence: It is the only state that does not have any buildings taller than 124 feet (38 m).

name: vermont
sentence: Land comprises 9,250 square miles (24,000 km2) and water comprises 365 square miles (950 km2), making it the 43rd-largest in land area and the 47th in water area.

name: vermont
sentence: In total area, it is larger than El Salvador and smaller than Haiti.

name: vermont
sentence: It is the only landlocked state in New England, and it is the easternmost and the smallest in area of all landlocked states.

name: vermont
sentence: The Green Mountains in Vermont form a north–south spine running most of the length of the state, slightly west of its center.

name: vermont
sentence: In the southwest portion of the state are located the Taconic Mountains.

name: vermont
sentence: In the northwest, near Lake Champlain, is the fertile Champlain Valley.

name: vermont
sentence: In the south of the valley is Lake Bomoseen.

name: vermont
sentence: The west bank of the Connecticut River marks the state's eastern border with New Hampshire, though much of the river flows within New Hampshire's territory.

name: vermont
sentence: 41% of Vermont's land area is part of the Connecticut River's watershed.

name: vermont
sentence: Lake Champlain, the sixth-largest body of fresh water in the United States, separates Vermont from New York in the northwest portion of the state.

name: vermont
sentence: From north to south, Vermont is 159 miles (256 km) long.

name: vermont
sentence: Its greatest width, from east to west, is 89 miles (143 km) at the Canada–US

name: vermont
sentence: border

name: vermont
sentence: The width averages 60.5 miles (97.4 km).

name: vermont
sentence: The state's geographic center is approximately three miles (5 km) east of Roxbury, in Washington County.

name: vermont
sentence: There are fifteen US federal border crossings between Vermont and Canada.

name: vermont
sentence: Several mountains have timberlines with delicate year-round alpine ecosystems, including Mount Mansfield, the highest mountain in the state; Killington Peak, the second-highest; Camel's Hump, the state's third-highest; and Mount Abraham, the fifth-highest peak.

name: vermont
sentence: Areas in Vermont administered by the National Park Service include the Marsh-Billings-Rockefeller National Historical Park (in Woodstock) and the Appalachian National Scenic Trail.

name: vermont
sentence: Vermont has nine incorporated cities.

name: vermont
sentence: The most populous city in Vermont is Burlington.

name: vermont
sentence: Its metropolitan area is also the most populous in the state, with an estimate of 218,395 as of 2017.

name: vermont
sentence: Although these towns are large enough to be considered cities, they are not incorporated as such.

name: vermont
sentence: The annual mean temperature for the state is 43 °F (6 °C).

name: vermont
sentence: Vermont has a humid continental climate, with muddy springs, in general a mild early summer, hot Augusts; it has colorful autumns: Vermont's hills reveal red, orange, and (on sugar maples) gold foliage as cold weather approaches.

name: vermont
sentence: Winters are colder at higher elevations.

name: vermont
sentence: It has a Köppen climate classification of Dfb, a warm humid continental climate.

name: vermont
sentence: The rural northeastern section known as the "Northeast Kingdom" often averages 10 °F (5.6 °C) colder than the southern areas of the state during winter.

name: vermont
sentence: The annual snowfall averages between 60 and 100 inches (1,500 and 2,500 mm) depending on elevation.

name: vermont
sentence: Vermont is the seventh coldest state in the country.

name: vermont
sentence: The highest recorded temperature was 105 °F (41 °C), at Vernon, on July 4, 1911.

name: vermont
sentence: The lowest recorded temperature was −50 °F (−46 °C), at Bloomfield, on December 30, 1933; this is the lowest temperature recorded in New England alongside Big Black River, which recorded a verified −50 °F (−46 °C) in 2009.

name: vermont
sentence: The agricultural growing season ranges from 120 to 180 days.

name: vermont
sentence: The United States Department of Agriculture plant hardiness zones for the state range between zone 3b, no colder than −35 °F (−37 °C), in the Northeast Kingdom and northern part of the state and zone 5b, no colder than −15 °F (−26 °C), in the southern part of the state.

name: vermont
sentence: The state receives between 2,200 and 2,400 hours of sunshine annually.

name: vermont
sentence: New England as a whole receives a range of less than 2,000 hours of sunshine in part of New Hampshire to as much as 2,600 hours of sunshine per year in Connecticut and Rhode Island.

name: vermont
sentence: There are five distinct physiographic regions of Vermont.

name: vermont
sentence: Categorized by geological and physical attributes, they are the Northeastern Highlands, the Green Mountains, the Taconic Mountains, the Champlain Lowlands, and the Vermont Piedmont.

name: vermont
sentence: About 500 million years ago, Vermont was part of Laurentia and located in the tropics.

name: vermont
sentence: The central and southern Green Mountain range include the oldest rocks in Vermont, formed about one billion years ago during the first mountain building period (or orogeny).

name: vermont
sentence: Subsequently, about 400 million years ago, the second mountain building period created Green Mountain peaks that were 15,000–20,000 feet (4,600–6,100 m) tall, three to four times their current height and comparable to the Himalayas.

name: vermont
sentence: The geological pressures that created those peaks remain evident as the Champlain Thrust, running north–south to the west of the mountains (now the eastern shore of Lake Champlain).

name: vermont
sentence: It is an example of geological fault thrusting where bedrock is pushed over the newer rock formation.

name: vermont
sentence: As a result of tectonic formation, Vermont east of the Green Mountains tends to be formed from rocks produced in the Silurian and Devonian periods, and western Vermont mainly from the older Pre-Cambrian and Cambrian material.

name: vermont
sentence: Several large deposits within the state contain granite.

name: vermont
sentence: The remains of the Chazy Formation can be observed in Isle La Motte.

name: vermont
sentence: It was one of the first tropical reefs.

name: vermont
sentence: It is the site of the limestone Fisk Quarry, which contains a collection of ancient marine fossils, such as stromatoporoids, that date to 200 million years ago.

name: vermont
sentence: At one point, Vermont is believed to have been connected to Africa (Pangaea); the fossils found and the rock formations found on the coasts in both Africa and America are evidence affirming the Pangaea theory.

name: vermont
sentence: In the past four centuries, Vermont has experienced a few earthquakes, rarely centered under the state.

name: vermont
sentence: The highest ranked, in 1952, had a Richter magnitude scale 6.0 and was based in Canada.

name: vermont
sentence: The state contains 41 species of reptiles and amphibians, 89 species of fish, of which 12 are non native; 193 species of breeding birds, 58 species of mammals, more than 15,000 insect species, and 2,000 higher plant species, plus fungi, algae, and 75 different types of natural communities.

name: vermont
sentence: Vermont contains one species of venomous snake, the timber rattlesnake, which is confined to a few acres in western Rutland County.

name: vermont
sentence: Wildlife has suffered because of human development of the state.

name: vermont
sentence: By the mid-19th century, wild turkeys were exterminated in the state through overhunting and destruction of habitat.

name: vermont
sentence: Sixteen were re-introduced in 1969, and had grown to a flock estimated to number 45,000 in 2009.

name: vermont
sentence: In 2013, hunters killed 6,968 of these.

name: vermont
sentence: Since 1970, reduction of farmland has resulted in reduced environment for, and resulted in a decline in numbers of various shrubland birds, including the American woodcock, brown thrasher, eastern towhee, willow flycatcher, golden-winged warbler, blue-winged warbler, field sparrow, and Baltimore oriole.

name: vermont
sentence: The use of DDT for insect control resulted in ospreys laying eggs that were too thin to support the development of young.

name: vermont
sentence: This species disappeared from the state.

name: vermont
sentence: It began to reappear in 1998, when ospreys were observed again locally.

name: vermont
sentence: As of 2010, they were no longer endangered in the state.

name: vermont
sentence: From 2008 to 2010, White-nose syndrome killed an estimated two-thirds of all cave-wintering bats in the state.

name: vermont
sentence: The New England cottontail disappeared from the state in the early 1970s, out-competed by the eastern cottontail rabbit, imported in the 1800s for hunting.

name: vermont
sentence: It is better able to detect and avoid predators.

name: vermont
sentence: Out of a total of 33 species of bumblebee, by 2013 the number declined to 19 or 20 species in the state.

name: vermont
sentence: Bombus terricola (the yellow-banded bumblebee), although once common in Vermont, has not been seen in most of its range since 1999 and is now absent from the state.

name: vermont
sentence: For honey bees, colony collapse disorder has affected bee population in the state, as elsewhere.

name: vermont
sentence: Invasive species included the Asian spotted-wing drosophila, which started damaging berry crops in 2012.

name: vermont
sentence: Vermont was the initial point of invasion in New England.

name: vermont
sentence: Since 2010, the Vermont Department of Health has worked with the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention to conduct blood serum surveys of the state's deer and moose populations.

name: vermont
sentence: Tests for eastern equine encephalitis virus antibodies were positive in moose or deer in each of Vermont's counties.

name: vermont
sentence: In 2012, 12% of deer and 2.4% of moose tested positive.

name: vermont
sentence: Vermont is in the temperate broadleaf and mixed forests biome.

name: vermont
sentence: Much of the state, in particular the Green Mountains, is covered by the conifers and northern hardwoods of the New England-Acadian forests.

name: vermont
sentence: The western border with New York and the area around Lake Champlain lies within the Eastern Great Lakes lowland forests.

name: vermont
sentence: The southwest corner of the state and parts of the Connecticut River are covered by northeastern coastal forests of mixed oak.

name: vermont
sentence: Invasive wild honeysuckle has been deemed a threat to the state's forests, native species of plants, and wildlife.

name: vermont
sentence: Many of Vermont's rivers, including the Winooski River, have been subjected to man-made barriers to prevent flooding.

name: vermont
sentence: Climate change appears to be affecting the maple sugar industry.

name: vermont
sentence: Sugar maples have been subject to stress by acid rain, asian longhorn beetles, and pear thrips.

name: vermont
sentence: In 2011 the deer herd had grown too large for habitat, and many resorted to eating bark to survive the winter, destroying trees in the process.

name: vermont
sentence: In addition, the sugar maples need a certain period of cold to produce sap for maple syrup.

name: vermont
sentence: The time to tap these trees has shrunk to one week in some years.

name: vermont
sentence: The tree may be replaced by the more aggressive Norway maples, in effect forcing the sugar maples to "migrate" north to Canada.

name: vermont
sentence: Between 8500 and 7000 BCE, at the time of the Champlain Sea, Native Americans inhabited and hunted in present-day Vermont.

name: vermont
sentence: During the Archaic period, from the 8th millennium BCE to 1000 BCE, Native Americans migrated year-round.

name: vermont
sentence: During the Woodland period, from 1000 BCE to 1600 CE, they established villages and trade networks, and developed ceramic and bow and arrow technology.

name: vermont
sentence: Their population in 1500 CE was estimated to be around 10,000 people.

name: vermont
sentence: During colonial times, where encounters and settlement were initiated by French colonists, the territory was occupied mainly by an Abenaki tribe known as the Sokoki, or Missisquois.

name: vermont
sentence: The eastern part of the state may have also been occupied by the Androscoggin and Pennacook peoples.

name: vermont
sentence: To the west, the Missisquois competed with the Iroquoian Mohawk, based in the Mohawk valley but with a large territory, and the Algonquin Mohican peoples.

name: vermont
sentence: Many of the tribes later formed the Wabanaki Confederacy during King Philip's War.

name: vermont
sentence: The warfare by English colonists defeated and scattered most of the surviving Abenaki tribes.

name: vermont
sentence: The first European to see Vermont is thought to have been French explorer Jacques Cartier in 1535.

name: vermont
sentence: On July 30, 1609, French explorer Samuel de Champlain claimed this territory as part of New France.

name: vermont
sentence: In 1666, French settlers erected Fort Sainte Anne on Isle La Motte, the first European settlement in Vermont.

name: vermont
sentence: The "violent" 1638 New Hampshire earthquake was centered in the St. Lawrence Valley and reported throughout New England.

name: vermont
sentence: This was the first seismic event noted in Vermont.

name: vermont
sentence: In 1690, a group of Dutch-British settlers from Albany established a settlement and trading post at Chimney Point, 8 miles (13 km) west of present-day Addison.

name: vermont
sentence: During Dummer's War, the first permanent English settlement was established in 1724 with the construction of Fort Dummer.

name: vermont
sentence: It was intended to protect the nearby settlements of Dummerston and Brattleboro.

name: vermont
sentence: From 1731 to 1734, the French constructed Fort St. Frédéric, which gave them control of the New France–Vermont frontier region in the Lake Champlain Valley.

name: vermont
sentence: With the outbreak of the French and Indian War in 1754, the North American front of the Seven Years' War between the French and British, the French began construction in 1755 of Fort Carillon at present-day Ticonderoga, New York.

name: vermont
sentence: The British failed to take either fort between 1755 and 1758.

name: vermont
sentence: In 1759 a combined force of 12,000 British regular and provincial troops under Sir Jeffery Amherst captured Carillon, after which the French abandoned Fort St. Frédéric.

name: vermont
sentence: Amherst constructed Fort Crown Point next to the remains of the Fort St. Frédéric, securing British control over the area.

name: vermont
sentence: Following France's loss in the French and Indian War, through the 1763 Treaty of Paris, it ceded control of land east of the Mississippi River to the British.

name: vermont
sentence: The Crown attempted to limit colonial settlement to lands east of the Appalachians, in order to prohibit encroachment on Native American lands.

name: vermont
sentence: The territory of Vermont was divided nearly in half in a jagged line running from Fort William Henry in Lake George diagonally north-eastward to Lake Memphremagog.

name: vermont
sentence: With the end of the war, new settlers arrived in Vermont.

name: vermont
sentence: Ultimately, Massachusetts, New Hampshire and New York all claimed this frontier area.

name: vermont
sentence: On July 20, 1764, King George III established the boundary between New Hampshire and New York along the west bank of the Connecticut River, north of Massachusetts, and south of 45 degrees north latitude.

name: vermont
sentence: New York refused to recognize the land titles known as the New Hampshire Grants (towns created by land grants sold by New Hampshire Governor Benning Wentworth) and dissatisfied New Hampshire settlers organized in opposition.

name: vermont
sentence: In 1770 Ethan Allen, his brothers Ira and Levi, and the Allens' cousins Seth Warner and Remember Baker, recruited an informal militia known as the Green Mountain Boys to protect the interests of the original New Hampshire settlers against newcomers from New York.

name: vermont
sentence: In 1775, after the outbreak of the American Revolutionary War, the Green Mountain Boys assisted a force from Connecticut, led by Benedict Arnold, in capturing the British fort at Ticonderoga.

name: vermont
sentence: Thereafter, the Continental Congress in Philadelphia directed the New York colony's revolutionary congress to fund and equip Allen's militia as a ranger regiment of the Continental Army, which it did.

name: vermont
sentence: Seth Warner was chosen by the men of the regiment to lead, while Ethan Allen later served as a colonel in Schuyler's Army of Northern New York.

name: vermont
sentence: On January 15, 1777, representatives of the New Hampshire Grants declared the independence of Vermont.

name: vermont
sentence: For the first six months of its existence, it was called the Republic of New Connecticut.

name: vermont
sentence: On June 2, 1777, a second convention of 72 delegates met and adopted the name "Vermont."

name: vermont
sentence: This was on the advice of a friendly Pennsylvanian, Dr. Thomas Young, friend and mentor of Ethan Allen.

name: vermont
sentence: He was advising them on how to achieve admission into the newly independent United States of America as the 14th state.
