name: vermont
sentence: On July 4, they completed the drafting of the Constitution of Vermont at the Windsor Tavern, and adopted it on July 8.

name: vermont
sentence: This was the first written constitution in North America to ban adult slavery, saying male slaves become free at the age of 21 and females at 18.

name: vermont
sentence: It provided for universal adult male suffrage and required support of public schools.

name: vermont
sentence: It was in effect from 1777 to 1786.

name: vermont
sentence: The Battle of Bennington, fought on August 16, 1777, was a seminal event in the history of the state of Vermont and the United States.

name: vermont
sentence: A combined American force, under General John Stark's command, attacked the Hessian column at Hoosick, New York, just across the border from Bennington.

name: vermont
sentence: It killed or captured virtually the entire Hessian detachment.

name: vermont
sentence: General Burgoyne never recovered from this loss and eventually surrendered the remainder of his 6,000-man force at Saratoga, New York, on October 17 that year.

name: vermont
sentence: The battles of Bennington and Saratoga together are recognized as the turning point in the Revolutionary War because they were the first major defeat of a British army.

name: vermont
sentence: The anniversary of the battle is still celebrated in Vermont as a legal holiday.

name: vermont
sentence: The Battle of Hubbardton (July 7, 1777) was the only Revolutionary battle within the present boundaries of Vermont.

name: vermont
sentence: Although the Continental forces were technically defeated, the British forces were damaged to the point that they did not pursue the Americans (retreating from Fort Ticonderoga) any further.

name: vermont
sentence: Vermont continued to govern itself as a sovereign entity based in the eastern town of Windsor for 14 years.

name: vermont
sentence: The independent state of Vermont issued its own coinage from 1785 to 1788 and operated a national postal service.

name: vermont
sentence: Thomas Chittenden was the Governor in 1778–89 and in 1790–91.

name: vermont
sentence: Because the state of New York continued to assert a disputed claim that Vermont was a part of New York, Vermont could not be admitted to the Union under Article IV, Section 3 of the Constitution until the legislature of New York consented.

name: vermont
sentence: On March 6, 1790, the legislature made its consent contingent upon a negotiated agreement on the precise boundary between the two states.

name: vermont
sentence: When commissioners from New York and Vermont met to decide on the boundary, Vermont's negotiators insisted on also settling the property ownership disputes with New Yorkers, rather than leaving that to be decided later in a federal court.

name: vermont
sentence: The negotiations were successfully concluded in October 1790 with an agreement that Vermont would pay $30,000 to New York to be distributed among New Yorkers who claimed land in Vermont under New York land patents.

name: vermont
sentence: In January 1791, a convention in Vermont voted 105–4 to petition Congress to become a state in the federal union.

name: vermont
sentence: Congress acted on February 18, 1791, to admit Vermont to the Union as the 14th state as of March 4, 1791.

name: vermont
sentence: Vermont became the first to enter the Union after the original 13 states.

name: vermont
sentence: The revised constitution of 1786, which established a greater separation of powers, continued in effect until 1793, two years after Vermont's admission to the Union.

name: vermont
sentence: Under the Act "To Secure Freedom to All Persons Within This State," slavery was officially banned by state law on November 25, 1858, less than three years before the American Civil War.

name: vermont
sentence: Vermonters provided refuge in several sites for escaped slaves, fleeing to Canada, as part of what was called the Underground Railroad.

name: vermont
sentence: From the mid-1850s on, some Vermonters became activists opposing slavery, which they had previously worked to contain in the South.

name: vermont
sentence: Abolitionist Thaddeus Stevens was born in Vermont and later represented a district in Pennsylvania in Congress.

name: vermont
sentence: He developed as a national leader and later promoted Radical Republican goals after the American Civil War.

name: vermont
sentence: While the Whig Party shriveled, and the Republican Party emerged, Vermont supported Republican candidates.

name: vermont
sentence: In 1860 it voted for Abraham Lincoln, giving him the largest margin of victory of any state.

name: vermont
sentence: During the American Civil War, Vermont sent 33,288 men into United States service.

name: vermont
sentence: 5,224 Vermonters (more than 15 percent) were killed.

name: vermont
sentence: The northernmost land action of the war was the St. Albans Raid—the robbery of three St. Albans banks, perpetrated in October 1864 by 21 Confederate agents.

name: vermont
sentence: A posse pursued the Confederate raiders into Canada and captured several of them.

name: vermont
sentence: They had to turn their captives over to Canadian officials.

name: vermont
sentence: Canada reimbursed the banks, released, and later re-arrested some of the perpetrators.

name: vermont
sentence: As English speakers came to dominate the population in Vermont, they anglicized the names of many ethnic French residents and often discriminated against them.

name: vermont
sentence: In the mid-20th century, descendants began to reclaim their French names, especially surnames.

name: vermont
sentence: Beginning in the mid-19th century, Vermont industries attracted numerous Irish, Scots-Irish and Italian immigrants, adding to its residents of mostly English and some French-Canadian ancestry.

name: vermont
sentence: Many of the immigrants migrated to Barre, where the men worked as stonecutters of granite, for which there was a national market.

name: vermont
sentence: Vermont granite was used in major public buildings in many states.

name: vermont
sentence: In this period, many Italian and Scottish women operated boarding houses to support their families.

name: vermont
sentence: Such facilities also helped absorb new residents and help them learn the new culture

name: vermont
sentence: Typically immigrants boarded with people of their own language and ethnicity, but sometimes they boarded with others.

name: vermont
sentence: Gradually the new immigrants were absorbed into the state.

name: vermont
sentence: Times of tension aroused divisions.

name: vermont
sentence: In the early 20th century, some people in Vermont became alarmed about what they considered to be a decline in rural areas; people left farming to move to cities and others seemed unable to fit within society.

name: vermont
sentence: In addition, there was a wave of immigration by French Canadians, and those of Protestant Yankee stock feared being overtaken by the new people, who added to the Catholic population of Irish and Italians.

name: vermont
sentence: Based on the colonial past, some Yankee residents considered the French Canadians to have intermarried too frequently with Native Americans.

name: vermont
sentence: In an era influenced by ideas of Social Darwinism, some Vermont leaders promoted eugenics, an idea that the population could be managed and improved by limiting marriage and reproduction by certain members classified as unfit or defective.

name: vermont
sentence: It passed a marriage law, to limit marriage by people considered unfit.

name: vermont
sentence: In 1915 the Brandon State School opened, the beginning of a related effort to segregate and control those judged unfit to reproduce.

name: vermont
sentence: The state followed efforts to improve children's welfare by establishing other institutions to house the mentally ill or disabled.

name: vermont
sentence: From 1925 to 1928 the Eugenics Survey of Vermont conducted research and recorded the histories of families it determined were degenerate or dependent.

name: vermont
sentence: It also attempted to educate the public about why restrictive measures, including voluntary sterilization, were desirable.

name: vermont
sentence: Review by current historians reveals the results were socially prejudiced, as the surveys tended to target the poor and disenfranchised minorities, including French Canadians, Abenaki, and disabled.

name: vermont
sentence: In 1931 Vermont was the 29th state to pass a eugenics law.

name: vermont
sentence: Vermont like other states, sterilized some patients in institutions and persons it had identified through surveys as degenerate or unfit.

name: vermont
sentence: It nominally had permission from the patients or their guardians, but abuses have been documented.

name: vermont
sentence: Two-thirds of the sterilizations were done on women, and poor, unwed mothers were targeted, among others.

name: vermont
sentence: The surgery was performed at institutions and hospitals in the state supposedly devoted to care of people in need.

name: vermont
sentence: There is disagreement about how many sterilizations were performed; most were completed from 1931 to 1941, but such procedures were recorded as late as 1970.

name: vermont
sentence: In addition to the increased intensity and flooding caused by climate change, the state has suffered several extreme natural disasters in the 20th and 21st centuries related to hurricanes, and extensive rain and flooding.

name: vermont
sentence: Large-scale flooding occurred in early November 1927.

name: vermont
sentence: During this incident, 84 people died, including the state's lieutenant governor.

name: vermont
sentence: The 1938 New England hurricane in the fall of that year blew down 15,000,000 acres (61,000 km2) of trees, one-third of the total forest at the time in New England.

name: vermont
sentence: Three billion board feet were salvaged.

name: vermont
sentence: Today many of the older trees in Vermont are about 75 years old, dating from after this storm.

name: vermont
sentence: A major flood occurred in 1973, causing the deaths of two people and millions of dollars in property damage.

name: vermont
sentence: The state suffered severe flooding in late August 2011 caused by Tropical Storm Irene.

name: vermont
sentence: Heavy rains caused flooding in many towns built along narrow river valleys.

name: vermont
sentence: The governor described it as one of the worst natural disasters of the 20th and 21st centuries, second only to the flood of 1927.

name: vermont
sentence: The state was classified as a federal disaster area.

name: vermont
sentence: Vermont approved women's suffrage decades before it became part of the national constitution.

name: vermont
sentence: Women were first allowed to vote in the elections of December 18, 1880, when women were granted limited suffrage.

name: vermont
sentence: They were first allowed to vote in town elections, and later in state legislative races.

name: vermont
sentence: In 1964, the US Supreme Court decision in Reynolds v. Sims required "one man, one vote" redistricting in all states.

name: vermont
sentence: It had found that many state legislatures had not redistricted and were unjustly dominated by rural interests, years after the development of densely populated and industrial urban areas.

name: vermont
sentence: In addition, it found that many states had an upper house based on geographical jurisdictions, such as counties.

name: vermont
sentence: This gave disproportionate power to rural and lightly populated counties.

name: vermont
sentence: The court ruled there was no basis for such a structure.

name: vermont
sentence: Major changes in political apportionment took place in Vermont and other affected states.

name: vermont
sentence: This ruling required districts to be reassessed after every census and to be based on roughly equal population, rather than geography (such as counties).

name: vermont
sentence: Under redistricting, residents in urban areas were to gain an equitable share of apportionment in both houses in every state.

name: vermont
sentence: Vermont and some other northern states had long been dominated by rural districts, as were several Southern states in those years, who had not redistricted since the turn of the century.

name: vermont
sentence: Until that time, apportionment of upper houses was often based on county jurisdictions, which had given more power to rural counties and failed to acknowledge the increased population in urban areas.

name: vermont
sentence: This arrangement had meant that urban areas did not have proportionate political power and often suffered from underinvestment in needed infrastructure

name: vermont
sentence: In July 2000, Vermont became the first state to introduce civil unions.

name: vermont
sentence: In 2009, Vermont became the first state to legalize same-sex marriage, unforced by court challenge or ruling.

name: vermont
sentence: Since the late 20th century, Abenaki peoples in Vermont lobbied for recognition.

name: vermont

name: vermont
sentence: In 2016 the state governor proclaimed Columbus Day as Indigenous Peoples Day.

name: vermont
sentence: On January 22, 2018, Vermont became the first of the United States to legalize cannabis for recreational use by legislative action, and the ninth state in the United States to legalize marijuana for medical purposes.

sentence: According to the United States Census Bureau, as of July 1, 2019, Vermont had an estimated population of 623,989.

name: vermont
sentence: This tension is expressed in the terms, "Woodchuck", being applied to those established in the state, and "Flatlander", applied to the newcomers.Vermont is the least populous New England state.

sentence: Linguists have identified speech patterns found among Vermonters as belonging to Western New England English, a dialect of New England English, which features full pronunciation of all r sounds, pronouncing horse and hoarse the same, and pronouncing vowels in father and bother the same, none of which are features traditionally shared in neighboring Eastern New England English.

name: vermont
sentence: Some rural speakers realize the t as a glottal stop (mitten sounds like "mi'in" and Vermont like "Vermon' ").

sentence: A dwindling segment of the Vermont population, generally both rural and male, pronounces certain vowels in a distinctive manner (e.g.

sentence: cows with a raised vowel as [kʰɛʊz] and ride with a backed, somewhat rounded vowel as [ɹɒɪd]).

name: vermont
sentence: Eastern New England English—also found in New Hampshire, Maine and eastern Massachusetts—was common in eastern Vermont in the mid-twentieth century and before, but has become rare.

name: vermont

name: vermont
sentence: Dairy farming is the primary source of agricultural income.

name: vermont
sentence: In the second half of the 20th century, developers had plans to build condos and houses on what was relatively inexpensive, open land.

name: vermont
sentence: Vermont's government responded with a series of laws controlling development and with some pioneering initiatives to prevent the loss of Vermont's dairy industry.

name: vermont
sentence: Still, the number of Vermont dairy farms has declined more than 85% from the 11,206 dairy farms operating in 1947.

name: vermont
sentence: In 2003 there were fewer than 1,500 dairy farms in the state; in 2006 there were 1,138; in 2019 there were 658.

name: vermont
sentence: The number of dairy farms has been diminishing by 10% annually.

name: vermont
sentence: 80% of open land is controlled by dairy farms.

name: vermont
sentence: The number of cattle in Vermont had declined by 40%; however, milk production has doubled in the same period due to tripling the production per cow.

name: vermont
sentence: While milk production rose, Vermont's market share declined.

name: vermont
sentence: Within a group of states supplying the Boston and New York City markets (called "Federal order Class I"), Vermont was third in market share, with 10.6%; New York has 44.9% and Pennsylvania has 32.9%.

name: vermont
sentence: In 2007 dairy farmers received a record $23.60 for 100 pounds (45 kg) (11.63 gallons at $2.03/gallon) of milk.

name: vermont
sentence: This dropped in 2008 to $17 ($1.46/gallon).

name: vermont
sentence: The average dairy farm produced 1.3 million pounds of milk annually in 2008.

name: vermont
sentence: The dairy barn remains an iconic image of Vermont, but the 87% decrease in active dairy farms between 1947 and 2003 means that preservation of the dairy barns has increasingly become dependent upon a commitment to maintaining a legacy rather than basic need in the agricultural economy.

name: vermont
sentence: The Vermont Barn Census, organized by a collaboration of educational and nonprofit state and local historic preservation programs, has developed educational and administrative systems for recording the number, condition, and features of barns throughout Vermont.

name: vermont
sentence: In 2009, there were 543 organic farms.

name: vermont
sentence: Twenty percent of the dairy farms were organic and 23% (128) vegetable farms were organic.

name: vermont
sentence: Organic farming increased in 2006–07, but leveled off in 2008–09.

sentence: A significant amount of milk is shipped into the Boston market.

name: vermont
sentence: Therefore the Commonwealth of Massachusetts certifies that Vermont farms meet Massachusetts sanitary standards.

name: vermont

sentence: In 2019, two-thirds of all milk in New England was produced by Vermont dairies.

name: vermont
sentence: Forest products have always been a staple to the economy, comprising 1% of the total gross state output and 9% of total manufacturing as of 2013.

name: vermont
sentence: In 2007, Windham County contained the largest concentration of kilns for drying lumber east of the Mississippi River.

name: vermont
sentence: The decline of farms has resulted in a regrowth of Vermont's forests due to ecological succession.

name: vermont
sentence: Today, most of Vermont's forests are secondary.

name: vermont
sentence: The state and non-profit organizations are actively encouraging regrowth and careful forest management.

name: vermont
sentence: Over 78% of the land area of the state is forested compared to only 37% in the 1880s, when sheep farming was at its peak and large amounts of acreage were cleared for grazing.

name: vermont
sentence: Over 85% of that area is non-industrial, private forestland owned by individuals or families.

name: vermont
sentence: In 2013, 73,054 million cubic feet (2,068.7 million cubic meters) of wood was harvested in Vermont.

name: vermont
sentence: A large amount of Vermont forest products are exports with 21,504 million feet (6.554×109 meters) being shipped overseas plus an additional 16,384 million cubic feet (463.9 million cubic meters) to Canada.

name: vermont
sentence: Most of it was processed within the state.

name: vermont
sentence: In this century the manufacture of wood products has fallen by almost half.

name: vermont
sentence: The annual net growth has been estimated at 172,810 million cubic feet (4,893 million cubic meters).

name: vermont
sentence: The USDA estimates that 8,584 billion cubic feet (243.1 billion cubic meters) remain in the state.

name: vermont
sentence: Forest products also add to carbon sequestration since lumber and timber used in houses and furniture hold carbon for long periods of time while the trees that were removed are replaced overtime with new growing stock.

name: vermont
sentence: In 2017, the price of wood products had either plummeted or remained the same when compared to previous decades, which meant there was cause for concern with jobs in the industry.

name: vermont
sentence: For example, in 1994, the price of a thousand board feet was $300, the same as it was in 2017.

name: vermont
sentence: For lack of demand, Vermont's forests are growing twice as fast as they are being cut.

name: vermont
sentence: An important and growing part of Vermont's economy is the manufacture and sale of artisan foods, fancy foods, and novelty items trading in part upon the Vermont "brand," which the state manages and defends.

name: vermont

name: vermont
sentence: Vermont is federally represented in the United States Congress by two senators and one representative.

name: vermont
sentence: The state is governed by a constitution which divides governmental duties into legislative, executive and judicial branches: the Vermont General Assembly, the governor of Vermont and the Vermont Supreme Court.

sentence: The governorship and the General Assembly serve two-year terms including the governor and 30 senators.

name: vermont
sentence: There are no term limits for any office.

name: vermont
sentence: The state capital is in Montpelier.

name: vermont
sentence: There are three types of incorporated municipalities in Vermont: towns, cities, and villages.

name: vermont
sentence: Like most of New England, there is slight provision for autonomous county government.

name: vermont
sentence: Counties and county seats are merely convenient repositories for various government services such as state courts, with several elected officers such as a state's Attorney and sheriff.

name: vermont
sentence: All county services are directly funded by the state of Vermont.

name: vermont
sentence: The next effective governmental level below state government are municipalities.

name: vermont
sentence: Most of these are towns.

name: vermont
sentence: Vermont is the only state in the union not to have a balanced-budget requirement, yet it has had a balanced budget every year since 1991.

sentence: In 2007 Moody's gave its top bond credit rating (Aaa) to the state.

name: vermont
sentence: The state uses enterprise funds for operations that are similar to private business enterprises.

name: vermont
sentence: The Vermont Lottery Commission, the Liquor Control Fund, and the Unemployment Compensation Trust Fund, are the largest of the State's enterprise funds.

name: vermont
sentence: In 2007, Vermont was the 14th highest out of 50 states and the District of Columbia for state and local taxation, with a per capita load of $3,681.

name: vermont
sentence: The national average was $3,447.

name: vermont
sentence: However, CNNMoney ranked Vermont highest in the nation based on the percentage of per capita income.

name: vermont
sentence: The rankings showed Vermont had a per capita tax load of $5,387, 14.1% of the per capita income of $38,306.

name: vermont
sentence: Vermont collects a state personal income tax in a progressive structure of five different income brackets, with marginal tax rates ranging from 3.6% to 9.5%.

name: vermont
sentence: In 2008, the top 1% of Vermont residents provided 30% of the income tax revenue; around 2,000 people had sufficient income to be taxed at the highest marginal rate of 9.5%.

name: vermont
sentence: Vermont's general state sales tax rate is 6%, which is imposed on sales of tangible personal property, amusement charges, fabrication charges, some public utility charges and some service contracts.

name: vermont
sentence: Some towns and cities impose an additional 1% Local Option Tax.

name: vermont
sentence: There are 46 exemptions from the sales tax, including exemptions for food, medical items, manufacturing machinery, equipment and fuel, residential fuel and electricity, clothing, and shoes.

name: vermont
sentence: A use tax is imposed on the buyer at the same rate as the sales tax.

name: vermont
sentence: The buyer pays the use tax when the seller fails to collect the sales tax or the items are purchased from a source where no tax is collected.

name: vermont
sentence: The use tax applies to items taxable under the sales tax.

name: vermont
sentence: Vermont does not collect inheritance taxes, but does impose a state estate tax; a Vermont estate tax return must be filed if the estate must file a federal estate tax return (the requirement for which depends on federal law).

name: vermont
sentence: Vermont does not collect a state gift tax.

name: vermont
sentence: Property taxes are levied by municipalities for the support of education and municipal services.

name: vermont
sentence: Vermont does not assess tax on personal property.

name: vermont
sentence: Property taxes are based on appraisal of the fair market value of real property.

name: vermont
sentence: Rates vary from 0.97% on homesteaded property in Ferdinand, Essex County, to 2.72% on nonresidents' property in Barre City.

name: vermont
sentence: Statewide, towns average 1.77% to 1.82% tax rate.

name: vermont
sentence: In 2007, Vermont counties were among the highest in the country for property taxes.

name: vermont
sentence: Chittenden ($3,809 median), Windham ($3,412), Addison ($3,352), and Windsor ($3,327) ranked in the top 100, out of 1,817 counties in the nation with populations greater than 20,000.

name: vermont
sentence: Twelve of the state's 14 counties stood in the top 20%.

name: vermont
sentence: Median annual property taxes as a percentage of median homeowners income, 5.4%, was rated as the third highest in the nation in 2011.

name: vermont
sentence: To equitably support education, some towns are required by Act 60 to send some of their collected taxes to be redistributed to school districts lacking adequate support.

name: vermont
sentence: Vermont is one of four states that were once independent nations (Texas, California, and Hawaii are the others).

name: vermont
sentence: Notably, Vermont is the only state to have voted for a presidential candidate from the Anti-Masonic Party, and Vermont was one of only two states to vote against Franklin D. Roosevelt in all four of his presidential campaigns (the other was Maine).

name: vermont
sentence: Vermont's history of independent political thought has led to movements for the establishment of the Second Vermont Republic and other plans advocating secession.

name: vermont
sentence: Vermont is the only state in the United States that requires voters to be sworn in, having established the voter's oath or affirmation in 1777.

name: vermont
sentence: Republicans dominated local Vermont politics from the party's founding in 1854 until the mid-1970s.

name: vermont
sentence: Before the 1960s, rural interests dominated the legislature.

name: vermont
sentence: As a result, cities, particularly the older sections of Burlington and Winooski, were neglected and fell into decay, and people began to move out to newer suburbs.

name: vermont
sentence: Vermont was for many years a stronghold of the Republican Party.

name: vermont
sentence: Ethno-political culture of the last century has seen a dramatic shift in voter turnout in the Green Mountain State.

name: vermont
sentence: Since 1992, Vermont has voted for the Democrat in every Presidential election.

name: vermont
sentence: Before 1992, Vermont voted for the Republican in every single Presidential election with the exception of 1964.

name: vermont
sentence: A series of one man, one vote decisions made by the United States Supreme Court in the 1960s required states to redraw their legislative districts to accurately reflect population.

name: vermont
sentence: As a result, urban areas in Vermont gained political power.

name: vermont
sentence: The legislature was redistricted under one-person, one-vote in the 1960s.

name: vermont
sentence: It passed the Land Use and Development Law (Act 250) in 1970 to discourage suburban sprawl and to limit major growth to already developed areas.

name: vermont
sentence: The law, the first of its kind in the nation, created nine District Environmental Commissions appointed by the Governor, who judged land development and subdivision plans that would have a significant impact on the state's environment and many small communities.

name: vermont
sentence: As a result of Act 250, Vermont was the last state to get a Wal-Mart (there are now six Wal-Marts in the state, as of November 2017, but only three—in Williston, St. Albans, and Derby—were newly built from the ground up).

name: vermont
sentence: Because of the successful attempts to dilute what is perceived as the original intent of Act 250, and other development pressures, Vermont has been designated one of America's most "endangered historic places" by the National Trust for Historic Preservation.

name: vermont
sentence: In 1995, the state banned the spreading of manure from December 15 to April 1, to prevent runoff and protect the water.

name: vermont
sentence: Therefore farms must have environmentally approved facilities to store manure during this time frame.

name: vermont
sentence: While the state voted largely Democratic, Republican Governor Douglas won all counties but Windham in the 2006 election.

name: vermont
sentence: A controversy dating from 1999 has been over the adoption of civil unions, an institution which grants same-sex couples nearly all the rights and privileges of marriage at the state, but not federal, level.

name: vermont
sentence: In Baker v. Vermont (1999), the Vermont Supreme Court ruled that, under the Constitution of Vermont, the state must either allow same-sex marriage or provide a separate but equal status for them.

name: vermont
sentence: The state legislature chose the second option by creating the institution of civil union

name: vermont
sentence: In April 2009, the state legislature overrode governor Jim Douglas's veto to allow same-sex marriage, becoming the first state in the nation to legalize same-sex marriage through legislation.

name: vermont
sentence: In September 2009, Vermont became the fourth state in which same-sex couples could marry.

name: vermont
sentence: The previous three were Massachusetts, Connecticut, Iowa.

name: vermont
sentence: In 2007, the state's House of Representatives rejected a measure which would have legalized assisted suicide for the terminally ill, by a vote of 82–63.

name: vermont
sentence: With the governor's signature on May 20, 2013, Vermont became the fourth state to pass a "death with dignity" law—the first to be passed through legislation rather than by ballot initiative.

name: vermont
sentence: Minor parties and independents flourish.

name: vermont
sentence: Rules which eliminate smaller parties from the ballot in most states do not exist in Vermont.

name: vermont
sentence: As a result, voters often have extensive choices for general elections.

name: vermont
sentence: Among others, this more open policy enabled independents like Bernie Sanders to win election as mayor of Burlington, as a US

name: vermont
sentence: Congressman, and as a US

name: vermont
sentence: Senatortor.

name: vermont
sentence: A political issue has been Act 60, which balances taxation for education funding.

name: vermont
sentence: This has resulted in the town of Killington trying to secede from Vermont and join New Hampshire due to what the locals say is an unfair tax burden.

name: vermont
sentence: The Vermont constitution and the courts supports the right of a person to walk (fish and hunt) on any unposted, unfenced land.

name: vermont
sentence: That is, trespass must be proven by the owner; it is not automatically assumed.

name: vermont
sentence: Vermont has some of the least restrictive gun control laws in the country.

name: vermont
sentence: A permit or license is not required for purchasing or carrying firearms.

name: vermont
sentence: Concealed carry and open carry of a firearm is legal over the age of 16, with those below 16 requiring parental permission.

name: vermont
sentence: Vermont has a pro-sanctuary city law.

name: vermont
sentence: The state is an alcoholic beverage control state.

name: vermont
sentence: In 2007, through the Vermont Department of Liquor Control, it took in over $14 million from the sale and distribution of liquor.

name: vermont
sentence: In 2013, Vermont became the 17th state to decriminalize marijuana.

name: vermont
sentence: The statute makes possession of less than an ounce of the drug punishable by a small fine rather than arrest and possible jail time.

name: vermont
sentence: In 2014, Vermont became the first state to call for a constitutional convention to overturn the Supreme Court's decision in Citizens United v. FEC.

name: vermont
sentence: In 2014, Vermont became the first state to mandate labeling of genetically modified organisms in the retail food supply.

name: vermont
sentence: In January 2018, Governor Phil Scott opted to sign H.511, the Vermont marijuana legalization bill, which allows adults 21 and older to possess up to one ounce of marijuana and grow up to two mature plants starting July 1, 2018.

name: vermont
sentence: Historically, Vermont was considered one of the most reliably Republican states in the country in terms of national elections.

name: vermont
sentence: From 1856 to 1988, Vermont voted Democratic only once, in Lyndon B. Johnson's landslide victory of 1964 against Barry M. Goldwater.

name: vermont
sentence: It was also one of only two states—Maine is the other—where Franklin D. Roosevelt was completely shut out in all four of his presidential bids.

name: vermont
sentence: In the late 19th and early 20th centuries, Republican presidential candidates frequently won the state with over 70% of the vote.

name: vermont
sentence: In the 1980s and 1990s, many people moved in from out of state.

name: vermont
sentence: Much of this immigration included the arrival of more liberal political influences of the urban areas of New York and the rest of New England in Vermont.

name: vermont
sentence: The brand of Republicanism in Vermont has historically been a moderate one, and combined with the newcomers from out of state, this made Vermont friendlier to Democrats as the national GOP moved to the right.

name: vermont
sentence: As evidence of this, in 1990 Bernie Sanders, a self-described democratic socialist, was elected to Vermont's lone seat in the House as an independent.

name: vermont
sentence: Sanders became the state's junior Senatortor in 2007.

name: vermont
sentence: However, for his entire career in the House and Senatorte, Sanders has caucused with the Democrats and is counted as a Democrat for the purposes of committee assignments and voting for party leadership.

name: vermont
sentence: After narrowly supporting George H W Bush in 1988, it gave Democrat Bill Clinton a 16-point margin in 1992—the first time the state had gone Democratic since 1964.

name: vermont
sentence: Vermont has voted Democratic in every presidential election since.

name: vermont
sentence: Since 2004, Vermont has been one of the Democrats' most loyal states.

name: vermont
sentence: It gave John Kerry his fourth-largest margin of victory in the presidential campaign against George W. Bush; he won the state's popular vote by 20 percentage points, taking almost 59% of the vote.

name: vermont
sentence: (Kerry, from neighboring Massachusetts, also became the first Northern Democrat ever to carry Vermont; Johnson was from Texas, Clinton from Arkansas and Al Gore, triumphant in the Green Mountain State in 2000, from Tennessee.)

name: vermont
sentence: Essex County in the state's northeastern section was the only county to vote for Bush.

name: vermont
sentence: Vermont is the only state that did not receive a visit from George W. Bush during his tenure as President of the United States.

name: vermont
sentence: Indeed, George W. Bush and Donald Trump are the only Republicans to win the White House without carrying Vermont.

name: vermont
sentence: In 2008, Vermont gave Barack Obama his third-largest margin of victory (37 percentage points) and third-largest vote share in the nation by his winning the state 68% to 31%.

name: vermont
sentence: Only Obama's birth state of Hawaii and Washington, D.C. were stronger Democratic victories.

name: vermont
sentence: The same held true in 2012, when Obama carried Vermont 67% of the vote to 31% for Romney, and in 2016, when Hillary Clinton won with 57% of the vote to 30% for Donald Trump.

name: vermont
sentence: Vermont's two Senatortors are Democrat Patrick Leahy, the longest-serving member of the Senatorte, and independent Bernie Sanders.

name: vermont
sentence: The state is represented by an at-large member of the House, Democrat Peter Welch, who succeeded Sanders in 2007.

name: vermont
sentence: In 2010, Vermont was the sixth highest ranked state for Well-Being in a study by Gallup and Healthways.

name: vermont
sentence: In 2010, the state stood third in physical well-being of children.

name: vermont
sentence: In 2010, Vermont was ranked the highest in the country for health outcomes.

name: vermont
sentence: In 2000, the state implemented the Vermont Child Health Improvement Program to improve preventive services and management of chronic conditions.

name: vermont
sentence: In 2011, the state ranked third in the nation in child health system performance.

name: vermont
sentence: In 2011, the March of Dimes gave Vermont an "A," ranking it number one in the country on its Prematurity Report Card.

name: vermont
sentence: In 2008, Vermont was ranked number one in the nation as the healthiest place to live for the seventh time in eight years.

name: vermont
sentence: Criteria included low teenage birth rate, strong health coverage, the lowest AIDS rate in the country, and 18 other factors.

name: vermont
sentence: The state scored well in cessation of smoking, obesity, fewer occupational fatalities, prevalence of health insurance, and low infant mortality.

name: vermont
sentence: A problem area was a high prevalence of binge drinking.

name: vermont
sentence: While ranking sixth from best for adults in obesity in 2009, the state still had 22% obese with a rate of 27% for children 10–17.

name: vermont
sentence: The ranking for children was ninth best in the nation.In 1993, the obesity rate for adults was 12%.

name: vermont
sentence: Vermonters spend $141 million annually in medical costs related to obesity.

name: vermont
sentence: The combined figures for overweight and obese adults rose from 40.7% in 1990 to 58.4% in 2010.

name: vermont
sentence: This is better than most other states.

name: vermont
sentence: In 2011, Vermont led the nation in the rate of young people who had consumed alcohol in the past month; one-third of people aged 11 through 20.

name: vermont
sentence: One-fifth of that group had binged during that time.

name: vermont
sentence: The state was second for the use of marijuana by young people

name: vermont
sentence: In 2009, Vermont was ranked second in the nation for safety.

name: vermont
sentence: Crime statistics on violence were used for the criteria.

name: vermont
sentence: In 2007, Vermont was ranked among the best five states in the country for preventing "premature death" in people under 75 years of age.

name: vermont
sentence: The rate of survival was twice that of the five lowest performing states.

name: vermont
sentence: Parts of the state have been declared federal disaster areas on 28 occasions from 1963 to 2008.

name: vermont
sentence: In 2007, the Environmental Protection Agency cited Chittenden and Bennington as counties with 70 parts per billion of smog which is undesirable.

name: vermont
sentence: In 2008, about 100,000 Vermonters got their health care through the federal government, Medicare, Tri-Care, and the Veteran's Administration.

name: vermont
sentence: An additional 10,000 Vermonters work for employers who provide insurance under federal law under ERISA.

name: vermont
sentence: About 20% of Vermonters receive health care outside of Vermont

name: vermont
sentence: In 2008, the state had an estimated 7.6% with no medical insurance, down from 9.8% in 2005.

name: vermont
sentence: In 2008, the Vermont Health Access Program for low-income, uninsured adults cost from $7 to $49 per month.

name: vermont
sentence: A "Catamount Health" premium assistance program was available for Vermonters who do not qualify for other programs.

name: vermont
sentence: Total monthly premiums ranged from $60 to $393 for an individual.

name: vermont
sentence: There was a $250 deductible.

name: vermont
sentence: Insured paid $10 toward each generic prescription.

name: vermont
sentence: 16.9% of residents 18 to 35 were uninsured, the highest group.

name: vermont
sentence: Health care spending increased from $2.3 billion in 2000 to $4.8 billion in 2009.In 2009, adult day care services cost more in Vermont than any other state—$150 daily.

name: vermont
sentence: The state started air drops of rabies bait for raccoons in 1997.

name: vermont
sentence: Known rabies cases in raccoons peaked in 2007 at 165.

name: vermont
sentence: The program is in cooperation with neighboring states and Canada.

name: vermont
sentence: Vermont was named the nation's smartest state in 2005 and 2006.

name: vermont
sentence: In 2006, there was a gap between state testing standards and national, which is biased in favor of the state standards by 30%, on average.

name: vermont
sentence: This puts Vermont 11th-best in the nation.

name: vermont
sentence: Most states have a higher bias.

name: vermont
sentence: However, when allowance for race is considered, a 2007 US Government list of test scores shows Vermont white fourth graders performed 25th in the nation for reading (229) and 26th for math (247).

name: vermont
sentence: White eighth graders scored 18th for math (292) and 12th for reading (273).

name: vermont
sentence: The first three scores were not considered statistically different from average.

name: vermont
sentence: White eighth graders scored significantly above average in reading.

name: vermont
sentence: Statistics for black students were not reliable because of their small representation in the testing.

name: vermont
sentence: In 2017, spending $1.6 billion on education for 76,000 public school children, represents more than $21,000 per student.

name: vermont
sentence: Education Week ranked the state second in high school graduation rates for 2007.

name: vermont
sentence: In 2011, 91% of the population had graduated from high school compared with 85% nationally.

name: vermont
sentence: Almost 34% have at least an undergraduate degree compared with 28% nationally.

name: vermont
sentence: In 2013, the ratio of pupils to teachers was the lowest in the country.

name: vermont
sentence: Experimentation at the University of Vermont by George Perkins Marsh, and later the influence of Vermont-born philosopher and educator John Dewey brought about the concepts of electives and learning by doing.

name: vermont
sentence: Vermont has five colleges within the Vermont State Colleges system, University of Vermont (UVM), and thirteen other private, degree-granting colleges, including Bennington College, Champlain College, Goddard College, Marlboro College, Middlebury College, Saint Michael's College, the Vermont Law School, and Norwich University.

name: vermont
sentence: In 2016, the University of Vermont charged the second highest tuition in the nation for four years, $61,000 for in-state students, to $147,000 for out-of-state students.

name: vermont
sentence: This compares with an average of 34,800 nationally for in-state students.

name: vermont
sentence: Vermont festivals include the Vermont Maple Festival, Festival on the Green, The Vermont Dairy Festival in Enosburg Falls, the Apple Festival (held each Columbus Day Weekend), the Marlboro Music Festival, and the Vermont Brewers Festival.

name: vermont
sentence: The Vermont Symphony Orchestra is supported by the state and performs throughout the area.

name: vermont
sentence: Since 1973 the Sage City Symphony, formed by composer Louis Calabro, has performed in the Bennington area.

name: vermont
sentence: In 1988 a number of Vermont-based composers including Gwyneth Walker formed the Vermont Composers Consortium, which was recognized by the governor proclaiming 2011 as The Year of the Composer.

name: vermont
sentence: Burlington, Vermont's largest city, hosts the annual Vermont International Film Festival, which presents ten days in October of independent films.

name: vermont
sentence: The Brattleboro-based Vermont Theatre Company presents an annual summer Shakespeare festival.

name: vermont
sentence: Brattleboro also hosts the summertime Strolling of the Heifers parade which celebrates Vermont's dairy culture.

name: vermont
sentence: The annual Green Mountain Film Festival is held in Montpelier.

name: vermont
sentence: In the Northeast Kingdom, the Bread and Puppet Theatre holds weekly shows in Glover in a natural outdoor amphitheater.

name: vermont
sentence: One of Vermont's best known musical acts is the rock band Phish, whose members met while attending school in Vermont and spent much of their early years playing at venues across the state.

name: vermont
sentence: The Vermont-based House of LeMay performs several shows a year, hosts the annual "Winter is a Drag Ball," and performs for fundraisers.

name: vermont
sentence: Examples of folk art found in Vermont include the Vermontasaurus in Post Mills, a community in Thetford.

name: vermont
sentence: The rate of volunteerism in Vermont was eighth in the nation with 37% in 2007.

name: vermont
sentence: The state stood first in New England.

name: vermont
sentence: In 2011 Vermont residents were ranked as the healthiest in the country.

name: vermont
sentence: Also in 2011, Vermont was ranked as the fourth most peaceful state in the United States.

name: vermont
sentence: In 2011 Vermont residents were ranked as the sixth most fit/leanest in the country.

name: vermont
sentence: Vermonters were the second most active citizens of state with 55.9% meeting the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention's physical activity requirements.

name: vermont
sentence: Vermont was ranked as the 12th happiest state in the country.

name: vermont
sentence: There are a number of museums in the state.

name: vermont
sentence: Winter sports are popular in New England, and Vermont's winter sports attractions are a big part of Vermont tourism.

name: vermont
sentence: Some well known attractions include Burke Mountain ski area, Jay Peak Resort, Killington Ski Resort, Stowe Mountain Resort, the Quechee Club Ski Area, and Smugglers' Notch Resort.

name: vermont
sentence: Vermont natives in the snowboarding profession include Kevin Pearce, Ross Powers, Hannah Teter, and Kelly Clark.

name: vermont
sentence: Others learned snowboarding in the state, such as Louie Vito and Ellery Hollingsworth.

name: vermont
sentence: Vermont Olympic gold medalists include Barbara Cochran,Hannah Kearney,Kelly Clark,Ross Powers,and Hannah Teter.

name: vermont
sentence: The largest professional franchise is the Vermont Lake Monsters, a single-A minor league baseball affiliate of the Oakland Athletics, based in Burlington.

name: vermont
sentence: They were named the Vermont Expos before 2006.

name: vermont
sentence: Up until the 2011 season, they were the affiliate of the Washington Nationals (formerly the Montreal Expos).

name: vermont
sentence: Currently the highest-ranked teams in basketball representing Vermont are the NCAA's Vermont Catamounts—male and female.

name: vermont
sentence: The Vermont Frost Heaves, the 2007 and 2008 American Basketball Association national champions, were a franchise of the Premier Basketball League, and were based in Barre and Burlington from the fall of 2006 through the winter of 2011.

name: vermont
sentence: The Vermont Bucks, an indoor football team, were based in Burlington and began play in 2017 as the founding team in the Can-Am Indoor Football League.

name: vermont
sentence: For 2018, the Bucks joined the American Arena League, but folded prior to playing in the new league.

name: vermont
sentence: Vermont is home to the University of Vermont Men's and Women's hockey teams.

name: vermont
sentence: Vermont's only professional hockey team was the Vermont Wild who played in the Federal Hockey League during the 2011–12 season, but the team folded before the season ended.

name: vermont
sentence: The Vermont Voltage were a USL Premier Development League soccer club that played in St. Albans.

name: vermont
sentence: Annually since 2002, high school statewide all stars compete against New Hampshire in ten sports during "Twin State" playoffs.

name: vermont
sentence: Vermont also has a few auto racing venues.

name: vermont
sentence: The most popular of them is Thunder Road International Speedbowl in Barre, Vermont.

name: vermont
sentence: It is well known for its tight racing and has become well known in short track stock car racing.

name: vermont
sentence: Other racing circuits include the USC sanctioned Bear Ridge Speedway, and the NASCAR sanctioned Devil's Bowl Speedway.

name: vermont
sentence: Some NASCAR Cup drivers have come to Vermont circuits to compete against local weekly drivers such as Tony Stewart, Clint Bowyer, Kyle Busch, Kenny Wallace, Ken Schrader, and Christopher Bell.

name: vermont
sentence: Kevin Lepage from Shelburne, Vermont is one of a few professional drivers from Vermont.

name: vermont
sentence: Racing series in Vermont include NASCAR Whelen All-American Series, American Canadian Tour, and Vermont's own Tiger Sportsman Series.

name: virginia
sentence: Virginia ( (listen)), officially the Commonwealth of Virginia, is a state in the Mid-Atlantic region of the Southern United States, between the Atlantic Coast and the Appalachian Mountains.

name: virginia
sentence: The geography and climate of the Commonwealth are shaped by the Blue Ridge Mountains and the Chesapeake Bay, which provide habitat for much of its flora and fauna.

name: virginia
sentence: The capital of the Commonwealth is Richmond; Virginia Beach is the most-populous city, and Fairfax County is the most-populous political subdivision.

name: virginia
sentence: The Commonwealth's estimated population as of 2019 is over 8.54 million, with 36% of them living in the Baltimore–Washington metropolitan area.

name: virginia
sentence: The area's history begins with several indigenous groups, including the Powhatan.

name: virginia
sentence: In 1607 the London Company established the Colony of Virginia as the first permanent English colony in the New World.

name: virginia
sentence: Virginia's state nickname, the Old Dominion, is a reference to this status.

name: virginia
sentence: Slave labor and the land acquired from displaced Native American tribes each played a significant role in the colony's early politics and plantation economy.

name: virginia
sentence: Virginia was one of the 13 Colonies in the American Revolution.

name: virginia
sentence: In the American Civil War, Virginia's Secession Convention resolved to join the Confederacy while the First Wheeling Convention resolved to remain in the Union, leading to a split that created West Virginia.

name: virginia
sentence: Although the Commonwealth was under one-party rule for nearly a century following Reconstruction, both major national parties are competitive in modern Virginia.

name: virginia
sentence: Virginia's state legislature is the Virginia General Assembly, which was established in 1619 and is the oldest continuous law-making body in North America.

name: virginia
sentence: It is made up of a 40-member Senatorte and a 100-member House of Delegates.

name: virginia
sentence: The state government is unique in how it treats cities and counties equally, manages local roads, and prohibits governors from serving consecutive terms.

name: virginia
sentence: Virginia's economy has many sectors: agriculture in the Shenandoah Valley; federal agencies in Northern Virginia, including the headquarters of the US Department of Defense and Central Intelligence Agency; and military facilities in Hampton Roads, the site of the region's main seaport.

name: virginia
sentence: Virginia has a total area of 42,774.2 square miles (110,784.7 km2), including 3,180.13 square miles (8,236.5 km2) of water, making it the 35th-largest state by area.

name: virginia
sentence: Virginia is bordered by Maryland and Washington, D.C. to the north and east; by the Atlantic Ocean to the east; by North Carolina to the south; by Tennessee to the southwest; by Kentucky to the west; and by West Virginia to the north and west.

name: virginia
sentence: Virginia's boundary with Maryland and Washington, D.C. extends to the low-water mark of the south shore of the Potomac River.

name: virginia
sentence: The state's southern border is defined as 36°30' north latitude, though surveyor error in the 1700s led to deviations of as much as three arcminutes.

name: virginia
sentence: From 1802 to 1803, a commission appointed by Virginia and Tennessee surveyed the area and set their border as a line from the summit of White Top Mountain to the top of the Cumberland Mountains.

name: virginia
sentence: Errors discovered in 1856 led Virginia to propose a new surveying commission in 1871, but in 1893 the US Supreme Court decided in favor of the 1803 line in the case Virginia v. Tennessee.

name: virginia
sentence: One result of this is the division of the city of Bristol between the two states.

name: virginia
sentence: The Chesapeake Bay separates the contiguous portion of the Commonwealth from the two-county peninsula of Virginia's Eastern Shore.

name: virginia
sentence: The bay was formed from the drowned river valleys of the Susquehanna River and the James River.

name: virginia
sentence: Many of Virginia's rivers flow into the Chesapeake Bay, including the Potomac, Rappahannock, York, and James, which create three peninsulas in the bay.

name: virginia
sentence: Sea level rise has eroded the land on Virginia's islands, which include Tangier Island in the bay and Chincoteague, one of 23 barrier islands on the Atlantic coast.

name: virginia
sentence: The Tidewater is a coastal plain between the Atlantic coast and the fall line.

name: virginia
sentence: It includes the Eastern Shore and major estuaries of Chesapeake Bay.

name: virginia
sentence: The Piedmont is a series of sedimentary and igneous rock-based foothills east of the mountains which were formed in the Mesozoic era.

name: virginia
sentence: The region, known for its heavy clay soil, includes the Southwest Mountains around Charlottesville.

name: virginia
sentence: The Blue Ridge Mountains are a physiographic province of the Appalachian Mountains with the highest points in the commonwealth, the tallest being Mount Rogers at 5,729 feet (1,746 m).

name: virginia
sentence: The Ridge and Valley region is west of the mountains and includes the Great Appalachian Valley.

name: virginia
sentence: The region is carbonate rock based and includes Massanutten Mountain.

name: virginia
sentence: The Cumberland Plateau and the Cumberland Mountains are in the southwest corner of Virginia, south of the Allegheny Plateau.

name: virginia
sentence: In this region, rivers flow northwest, with a dendritic drainage system, into the Ohio River basin.

name: virginia
sentence: The Virginia Seismic Zone has not had a history of regular earthquake activity.

name: virginia
sentence: Earthquakes are rarely above 4.5 in magnitude, because Virginia is located away from the edges of the North American Plate.

name: virginia
sentence: A 5.8 magnitude earthquake struck central Virginia on August 23, 2011, near Mineral, and was the state's largest in at least a century.

name: virginia
sentence: Due to the area's geologic properties, the earthquake was felt from Northern Florida to Southern Ontario.

name: virginia
sentence: 35 million years ago, a bolide impacted what is now eastern Virginia.

name: virginia
sentence: The resulting Chesapeake Bay impact crater may explain what earthquakes and subsidence the region does experience.

name: virginia
sentence: Coal mining takes place in the three mountainous regions at 45 distinct coal beds near Mesozoic basins.

name: virginia
sentence: More than 67 million tons of other non-fuel resources, such as slate, kyanite, sand, or gravel, were also mined in Virginia in 2019.

name: virginia
sentence: The commonwealth's carbonate rock is filled with more than 4,000 caves, ten of which are open for tourism, including the popular Luray Caverns and Skyline Caverns.

name: virginia
sentence: Virginia has a humid subtropical climate that transitions to humid continental west of the Blue Ridge Mountains.

name: virginia
sentence: Seasonal extremes vary from average lows of 25 °F (−4 °C) in January to average highs of 86 °F (30 °C) in July.

name: virginia
sentence: The Atlantic Ocean and Gulf Stream have a strong effect on eastern and southeastern coastal areas of the commonwealth, making the climate there warmer and more constant.

name: virginia
sentence: Most of Virginia's recorded extremes in temperature and precipitation have occurred in the Blue Ridge Mountains and areas west.

name: virginia
sentence: Virginia receives an average of 43.34 inches (110 cm) of precipitation annually, with the Shenandoah Valley being the state's driest region due to the mountains on either side.

name: virginia
sentence: Virginia has around 35–45 days with thunderstorms annually, and storms are common in the late afternoon and evenings between April and September.

name: virginia
sentence: These months are also the most common for tornadoes, 19 of which touched down in the state in 2019.

name: virginia
sentence: Hurricanes and tropical storms can occur from August to October, and though they typically impact coastal regions, the deadliest natural disaster in Virginia was Hurricane Camille, which killed over 150 people in 1969, mainly inland in Nelson County.

name: virginia
sentence: Between December and March, cold-air damming caused by the Appalachian Mountains can lead to significant snowfalls across the state, such as the January 2016 blizzard, which created the state's highest recorded snowfall of 36.6 inches (93 cm) near Bluemont.

name: virginia
sentence: Virginia only received 13.1 inches (33 cm) of snow during winter 2018–19, just above the state's average of 10 inches (25 cm).

name: virginia
sentence: Climate change in Virginia is leading to higher temperatures year-round as well as more heavy rain and flooding events.

name: virginia
sentence: Urban heat islands can be found in many Virginia cities and suburbs, particularly in neighborhoods linked to historic redlining.

name: virginia
sentence: Arlington had the most code orange days in 2019 for high ozone pollution in the air, with 12, followed by Fairfax County with 7.

name: virginia
sentence: Exposure of particulate matter in Virginia's air has decreased 49% from 13.5 micrograms per cubic meter in 2003 to 6.9 in 2019.

name: virginia
sentence: The closure and conversion of coal power plants in Virginia and the Ohio Valley region has reduced haze in the mountains, which peaked in 1998.

name: virginia
sentence: Virginia's 6 coal power plants must shut down by 2025, and current plans call for 30 percent of the state's electricity to be renewable by 2030 and for all of it to be carbon-free by 2050.

name: virginia
sentence: Forests cover 62 percent of Virginia as of 2019, of which 78 percent is considered hardwood forest, meaning that trees in Virginia are primarily deciduous and broad-leaved.

name: virginia
sentence: The other 22 percent is pine, with Loblolly and shortleaf pine dominating much of central and eastern Virginia.

name: virginia
sentence: In the western and mountainous parts of the commonwealth, oak and hickory are most common, while lower altitudes are more likely to have small but dense stands of moisture-loving hemlocks and mosses in abundance.

name: virginia
sentence: Gypsy moth infestations in oak trees and the blight in chestnut trees have decreased both of their numbers, leaving more room for hickory and invasive ailanthus trees.

name: virginia
sentence: In the lowland tidewater and Piedmont, yellow pines tend to dominate, with bald cypress wetland forests in the Great Dismal and Nottoway swamps.

name: virginia
sentence: Other common trees and plants include red bay, wax myrtle, dwarf palmetto, tulip poplar, mountain laurel, milkweed, daisies, and many species of ferns.

name: virginia
sentence: The largest areas of wilderness are along the Atlantic coast and in the western mountains, where the largest populations of trillium wildflowers in North America are found.

name: virginia
sentence: Virginia is home to more than one million white-tailed deer, whose population have rebounded from an estimated 25,000 to 50,000 during the Great Depression.

name: virginia
sentence: Native carnivorans include black bears, bobcats, coyotes, both gray and red foxes, raccoons, and skunks.

name: virginia
sentence: Rodents include groundhogs, weasels, nutria, beavers, both gray squirrels and fox squirrels, chipmunks, and Allegheny woodrats, while bats include brown bats and the Virginia big-eared bat, the state mammal.

name: virginia
sentence: The Virginia opossum is also the only marsupial native to the United States and Canada, and the native Appalachian cottontail was recognized as a distinct species of rabbit in 1992.

name: virginia
sentence: Virginia's bird fauna consists of 422 counted species, of which 359 are regularly occurring, 41 are accidental (vagrant), 20 are hypothetical, and two are extinct; of the regularly occurring species, 214 have bred in Virginia, while the rest are winter residents or transients in Virginia.

name: virginia
sentence: There are no species of bird endemic to the state.

name: virginia
sentence: Audubon recognizes 21 Important Bird Areas in the Virginia.

name: virginia
sentence: Peregrine falcons, whose numbers dramatically declined due to DDT pesticide poisoning in the middle of the 20th century, are the focus of conservation efforts in the state; as of 2017, Virginia had 31 breeding pairs of the bird, and a reintroduction program in Shenandoah National Park was underway.

name: virginia
sentence: Virginia has 226 species of freshwater fish, from 25 families; the state's diverse array of fish species is attributable to its varied and humid climate, physiography, river system interconnections, and lack of Pleistocene glaciers.

name: virginia
sentence: For example, the state is home to Eastern blacknose dace and sculpin (on the Appalachian Plateau); smallmouth bass and redhorse sucker (in the Ridge and Valley region); brook trout, rainbow trout, brown trout, and the Kanawha darter (in the Blue Ridge); stripeback darter and Roanoke Bass (in the Piedmont); and swampfish, bluespotted sunfish, and pirate perch (on the Coastal Plain).

name: virginia
sentence: The Chesapeake Bay is host to many species, including blue crabs, clams, oysters, rockfish, as well as the invasive blue catfish.

name: virginia
sentence: Running brooks with rocky bottoms are often inhabited by plentiful amounts of crayfish.

name: virginia
sentence: Amphibians found in Virginia include the Cumberland Plateau salamander and Eastern hellbender.

name: virginia
sentence: Virginia has 30 National Park Service units, such as Great Falls Park and the Appalachian Trail, and one national park, Shenandoah National Park.

name: virginia
sentence: Shenandoah was established in 1935 and encompasses the scenic Skyline Drive.

name: virginia
sentence: Almost forty percent (79,579 acres or 322.04 km2) of the park's total 199,173 acres (806.02 km2) area has been designated as wilderness under the National Wilderness Preservation System.

name: virginia
sentence: Virginia also has 38 Virginia state parks, 3 undeveloped parks, and 63 natural areas, totaling 127,000 acres (51,000 ha), of which approximately 70,000 acres (28,000 ha) are in state parks.

name: virginia
sentence: All are managed by the Virginia Department of Conservation and Recreation except for Breaks Interstate Park.

name: virginia
sentence: which lies on the Virginia-Kentucky border and is one of only two inter-state parks in the United States.

name: virginia
sentence: There are 22 state forests and other state lands managed by the Virginia Department of Forestry, totaling 67,920 acres (27,490 ha).

name: virginia
sentence: The Chesapeake Bay is not a national park, but is protected by both state and federal legislation and the inter-state Chesapeake Bay Program, which conducts restoration on the bay and its watershed.

name: virginia
sentence: The Great Dismal Swamp National Wildlife Refuge extends into North Carolina, as does the Back Bay National Wildlife Refuge, which marks the beginning of the Outer Banks.

name: virginia
sentence: Virginia celebrated its quadricentennial year in 2007, marking 400 years since the establishment of the Jamestown Colony.

name: virginia
sentence: The observances highlighted contributions from Native Americans, Africans, and Europeans, each of which had a significant part in shaping Virginia's history.

name: virginia
sentence: Warfare, including among these groups, has also had an important role.

name: virginia
sentence: Virginia was a focal point in conflicts from the French and Indian War, the American Revolution and the Civil War, to the Cold War and the War on Terrorism.

name: virginia
sentence: Fictionalized stories about the early colony, in particular the story of Pocahontas and John Smith, first became popular in the period after the Revolutionary War, and together with other myths surrounding George Washington's childhood and plantation elite in the antebellum period became touchstones of Virginian and American culture and helped shape the state's historic politics and beliefs.

name: virginia
sentence: The first people are estimated to have arrived in Virginia over 12,000 years ago.

name: virginia
sentence: By 5,000 years ago more permanent settlements emerged, and farming began by 900 AD.

name: virginia
sentence: By 1500, the Algonquian peoples had founded towns such as Werowocomoco in the Tidewater region, which they referred to as Tsenacommacah.

name: virginia
sentence: The other major language groups in the area were the Siouan to the west, and the Iroquoians, who included the Nottoway and Meherrin, to the north and south.

name: virginia

name: virginia
sentence: Virginia is divided into 95 counties and 38 independent cities, the latter acting in many ways as county-equivalents.

name: virginia
sentence: This general method of treating cities and counties on par with each other is unique to Virginia; only three other independent cities exist elsewhere in the United States, each in a different state.

name: virginia
sentence: Virginia limits the authority of cities and counties to countermand laws expressly allowed by the Virginia General Assembly under what is known as Dillon's Rule.

name: virginia
sentence: In addition to independent cities, there are also incorporated towns which operate under their own governments, but are part of a county.

name: virginia
sentence: Finally there are hundreds of unincorporated communities within the counties.

name: virginia
sentence: Virginia does not have any further political subdivisions, such as villages or townships.

sentence: As of 2017, agriculture occupied 28 percent of the land in Virginia with 7.8 million acres (12,188 sq mi; 31,565 km2) of farmland.

name: virginia
sentence: Virginia collects personal income tax from those with incomes above a filing threshold; there are five income brackets, with rates ranging from 2.0% to 5.75% of taxable income.

sentence: The state sales and use tax rate is 4.3%.

sentence: There is an additional 1% local tax, for a total of a 5.3% combined sales tax on most Virginia purchases.

name: virginia
sentence: Unlike the majority of states, Virginia collects sales tax on groceries, but at a lower rate than the general sales tax; the sales tax for food and certain essential personal hygiene goods is 2.5%.

name: virginia
sentence: Virginia's property tax is set and collected at the local government level and varies throughout the Commonwealth.

name: virginia
sentence: Real estate is also taxed at the local level based on one hundred percent of fair market value.

name: virginia
sentence: As of fiscal year 2018, the median real estate tax rate per $100 of assessed taxable value was $1.07 for cities, $0.67 for counties, and $0.17 for towns; town rates are lower because towns (unlike cities) have a narrow range of responsibilities and are subordinate to counties.

name: virginia
sentence: Of local government tax revenue, about 61% is generated from real property taxes; about 24% from tangible personal property, sales and use, and business license tax; and 15% from other taxes (such as restaurant meal taxes, public service corporation property tax, consumer utility tax, and hotel tax).

name: virginia
sentence: Virginia's culture was popularized and spread across America and the South by figures such as George Washington, Thomas Jefferson, and Robert E. Lee.

name: virginia
sentence: Their homes in Virginia represent the birthplace of America and the South.

name: virginia
sentence: Modern Virginia culture has many sources, and is part of the culture of the Southern United States.

name: virginia
sentence: The Smithsonian Institution divides Virginia into nine cultural regions.

name: virginia
sentence: Besides the general cuisine of the Southern United States, Virginia maintains its own particular traditions.

name: virginia
sentence: Virginia wine is made in many parts of the commonwealth.

name: virginia
sentence: Smithfield ham, sometimes called "Virginia ham", is a type of country ham which is protected by state law, and can be produced only in the town of Smithfield.

name: virginia
sentence: Virginia furniture and architecture are typical of American colonial architecture.

name: virginia
sentence: Thomas Jefferson and many of the commonwealth's early leaders favored the Neoclassical architecture style, leading to its use for important state buildings.

name: virginia
sentence: The Pennsylvania Dutch and their style can also be found in parts of the commonwealth.

name: virginia
sentence: Literature in Virginia often deals with the commonwealth's extensive and sometimes troubled past.

name: virginia
sentence: The works of Pulitzer Prize winner Ellen Glasgow often dealt with social inequalities and the role of women in her culture.

name: virginia
sentence: Glasgow's peer and close friend James Branch Cabell wrote extensively about the changing position of gentry in the Reconstruction era, and challenged its moral code with Jurgen, A Comedy of Justice.

name: virginia
sentence: William Styron approached history in works such as The Confessions of Nat Turner and Sophie's Choice.

name: virginia
sentence: Tom Wolfe has occasionally dealt with his southern heritage in bestsellers like I Am Charlotte Simmons.

name: virginia
sentence: Mount Vernon native Matt Bondurant received critical acclaim for his historic novel The Wettest County in the World about moonshiners in Franklin County during prohibition.

name: virginia
sentence: Virginia also names a state Poet Laureate.

name: virginia
sentence: Rich in cultural heritage, Virginia however ranks near the bottom of US states in terms of public spending on the arts, at nearly half of the national average.

name: virginia
sentence: The state government does fund some institutions, including the Virginia Museum of Fine Arts and the Science Museum of Virginia.

name: virginia
sentence: Other museums include the popular Steven F. Udvar-Hazy Center of the National Air and Space Museum and the Chrysler Museum of Art.

name: virginia
sentence: Besides these sites, many open-air museums are located in the Commonwealth, such as Colonial Williamsburg, the Frontier Culture Museum, and various historic battlefields.

name: virginia
sentence: The Virginia Foundation for the Humanities works to improve the Commonwealth's civic, cultural, and intellectual life.

name: virginia
sentence: Theaters and venues in the Commonwealth are found both in the cities and in suburbs.

name: virginia
sentence: The Harrison Opera House, in Norfolk, is home of the Virginia Opera.

name: virginia
sentence: The Virginia Symphony Orchestra operates in and around Hampton Roads.

name: virginia
sentence: Resident and touring theater troupes operate from the American Shakespeare Center in Staunton.

name: virginia
sentence: The Barter Theatre in Abingdon, designated the State Theatre of Virginia, won the first Regional Theatre Tony Award in 1948, while the Signature Theatre in Arlington won it in 2009.

name: virginia
sentence: There is also a Children's Theater of Virginia, Theatre IV, which is the second largest touring troupe nationwide.

name: virginia
sentence: Notable music performance venues include The Birchmere, the Landmark Theater, and Jiffy Lube Live.

name: virginia
sentence: Wolf Trap National Park for the Performing Arts is located in Vienna and is the only national park intended for use as a performing arts center.

name: virginia
sentence: Virginia has launched many award-winning traditional musical artists and internationally successful popular music acts, as well as Hollywood actors.

name: virginia
sentence: Virginia is known for its tradition in the music genres of old-time string and bluegrass, with groups such as the Carter Family and Stanley Brothers.

name: virginia
sentence: The state's African tradition is found through gospel, blues, and shout bands, with both Ella Fitzgerald and Pearl Bailey coming from Newport News.

name: virginia
sentence: Contemporary Virginia is also known for folk rock artists like Dave Matthews and Jason Mraz, hip hop stars like Pharrell Williams, Missy Elliott and Pusha T, as well as thrash metal groups like GWAR and Lamb of God.

name: virginia
sentence: Several members of country music band Old Dominion grew up in the Roanoke area, and took their band name from Virginia's state nickname.

name: virginia
sentence: Many counties and localities host county fairs and festivals.

name: virginia
sentence: The Virginia State Fair is held at the Meadow Event Park every September.

name: virginia
sentence: Also in September is the Neptune Festival in Virginia Beach, which celebrates the city, the waterfront, and regional artists.

name: virginia
sentence: Norfolk's Harborfest, in June, features boat racing and air shows.

name: virginia
sentence: Fairfax County also sponsors Celebrate Fairfax!

name: virginia
sentence: with popular and traditional music performances.

name: virginia
sentence: The Virginia Lake Festival is held during the third weekend in July in Clarksville.

name: virginia
sentence: Wolf Trap hosts the Wolf Trap Opera Company, which produces an opera festival every summer.

name: virginia
sentence: Each September, Bay Days celebrates the Chesapeake Bay as well as Hampton's 400-year history since 1610, and Isle of Wight County holds a County Fair on the second week of September as well.

name: virginia
sentence: Both feature live music performances, and other unique events.

name: virginia
sentence: On the Eastern Shore island of Chincoteague the annual Pony Penning of feral Chincoteague ponies at the end of July is a unique local tradition expanded into a week-long carnival.

name: virginia
sentence: The Shenandoah Apple Blossom Festival is a six-day festival held annually in Winchester which includes parades and bluegrass concerts.

name: virginia
sentence: The Old Time Fiddlers' Convention in Galax, begun in 1935, is one of the oldest and largest such events worldwide.

name: virginia
sentence: Two important film festivals, the Virginia Film Festival and the VCU French Film Festival, are held annually in Charlottesville and Richmond, respectively.

name: virginia
sentence: The Hampton Roads area is the 42nd-largest media market in the United States as ranked by Nielsen Media Research, while the Richmond-Petersburg area is 54th and Roanoke-Lynchburg is 69th as of 2020.

name: virginia
sentence: Northern Virginia is part of the much larger Washington, D.C. media market, which is the country's 7th-largest.

name: virginia
sentence: There are 36 television stations in Virginia, representing each major US network, part of 42 stations which serve Virginia viewers including those broadcasting from neighboring jurisdictions.

name: virginia
sentence: According the Federal Communications Commission, 595 FCC-licensed FM radio stations broadcast in Virginia, with 239 such AM stations as of 2020.

name: virginia
sentence: The nationally available Public Broadcasting Service (PBS) is headquartered in Arlington.

name: virginia
sentence: Independent PBS affiliates exist throughout Virginia, and the Arlington PBS member station WETA-TV produces programs such as the PBS NewsHour and Washington Week.

name: virginia
sentence: The most circulated native newspapers in the Commonwealth are Norfolk's The Virginian-Pilot with around 132,000 subscribers, the Richmond Times-Dispatch with 86,219, and The Roanoke Times as of 2018.

name: virginia
sentence: The paper with nation's most daily readers, USA Today, with 520,000 daily subscriptions, is headquartered in McLean.

name: virginia
sentence: USA Today is the flagship publication of Gannett, Inc., which merged with GateHouse Media in 2019, and operates over one hundred local newspapers nationwide.

name: virginia
sentence: In Northern Virginia, The Washington Post is the dominant newspaper and provides local coverage for the region.

name: virginia
sentence: Politico, which covers national politics, has its offices in Rosslyn.

name: virginia
sentence: Virginia's educational system consistently ranks in the top five states on the US Department of Education's National Assessment of Educational Progress, with Virginia students outperforming the average in all subject areas and grade levels tested.

name: virginia
sentence: The 2019 Quality Counts report ranked Virginia's K–12 education third in the country, with a letter grade of B.

name: virginia
sentence: All school divisions must adhere to educational standards set forth by the Virginia Department of Education, which maintains an assessment and accreditation regime known as the Standards of Learning to ensure accountability.

name: virginia
sentence: Public K–12 schools in Virginia are generally operated by the counties and cities, and not by the state.

name: virginia
sentence: As off the 2018–19 academic year, a total of 1,290,576 students were enrolled in 2,293 local and regional schools in the Commonwealth, including eight charter schools, and an additional 98 alternative and special education centers across 133 school divisions.

name: virginia
sentence: 2018 marked the first decline in overall enrollment in public schools, by just over 2,000 students, since 1984.

name: virginia
sentence: Besides the general public schools in Virginia, there are Governor's Schools and selective magnet schools.

name: virginia
sentence: The Governor's Schools are a collection of more than 40 regional high schools and summer programs intended for gifted students.

name: virginia
sentence: The Virginia Council for Private Education oversees the regulation of 483 state accredited private schools.

name: virginia
sentence: An additional 17,283 students receive homeschooling.

name: virginia
sentence: In 2019, 91.5 percent of high school students graduated on-time after four years, an increase of two percent from 2013, and 89.3 percent of adults over the age 25 had their high school diploma.

name: virginia
