sentence: Virginia has one of the smaller racial gaps in graduation rates among US states, with 89.7 percent of Black students graduating on time, compared to 94.7 percent of white students and 97.5 percent of Asian students.

name: virginia
sentence: Despite ending school segregation in the 1960s, seven percent of Virginia's public schools were rated as "intensely segregated" by The Civil Rights Project at UCLA in 2019, and the number has risen since 1989, when only three percent were.

name: virginia
sentence: Virginia has comparatively large public school districts, typically comprising entire counties or cites, and this helps mitigate funding gaps seen in other states such that non-white districts average slightly more funding, $255 per student as of 2019, than majority white districts.

name: virginia
sentence: Elementary schools, with the smallest districts, we found by VCU study in 2019 to be more segregated than middle or high schools in Virginia.

name: virginia
sentence: As of 2019, Virginia has the sixth highest percent of residents with bachelor's degrees or higher, with 38.2 percent.

name: virginia
sentence: As of that year, there are 169 colleges and universities in Virginia.

name: virginia
sentence: In the 2019 US News & World Report ranking of national public universities, the University of Virginia is ranked No.

name: virginia
sentence: 3, the College of William and Mary is No.

name: virginia
sentence: 10, Virginia Tech is No.

name: virginia
sentence: 30, George Mason University is No.

name: virginia
sentence: 67, and Virginia Commonwealth University is No.

name: virginia
sentence: James Madison University is ranked the No.

name: virginia
sentence: 6 regional university in The South.

name: virginia
sentence: There are 124 private institutions in the state, including nationally ranked liberal arts colleges Washington and Lee University at No.

name: virginia
sentence: 11, the University of Richmond at No.

name: virginia
sentence: 25, and the Virginia Military Institute at No.

name: virginia
sentence: Virginia Tech and Virginia State University are the state's land-grant universities.

name: virginia
sentence: The Virginia Military Institute is the oldest state military college.

name: virginia
sentence: Virginia also operates 23 community colleges on 40 campuses which enrolled more than 228,000 degree-seeking students during the 2018–2019 school year.

name: virginia
sentence: As of 2019, George Mason University had the largest on-campus enrollment at 37,677 students, though the private Liberty University had the largest total enrollment in the state, with 88,283 online and 15,105 on-campus students in Lynchburg.

name: virginia
sentence: Virginia has a mixed health record, and was ranked as the 15th overall healthiest state according to the 2019 United Health Foundation's Health Rankings.

name: virginia
sentence: Virginia was 19th lowest among US states in its number of premature deaths, with 6,914 per 100,000, and 24th with an infant mortality rate of 5.9 per 1,000 live births.

name: virginia
sentence: Falls Church and Loudoun County were both ranked in the top ten healthiest communities in 2020 by US News & World Report.

name: virginia
sentence: There are however racial and social health disparities.

name: virginia
sentence: With high rates of heart disease and diabetes, African Americans in Virginia had an average life expectancy 4 years lower than whites and 12 years lower than Asian Americans and Latinos in 2017, and were disproportionately affected by COVID-19 during the coronavirus pandemic.

name: virginia
sentence: African-American mothers are also three times more likely to die while giving birth in the state.

name: virginia
sentence: Mortality rates among white middle-class Virginians have also been rising, with drug overdose, suicide, and alcohol poisoning as leading causes.

name: virginia
sentence: Weight is an issue for many Virginians, and 30.3% of adults and 13.2% of 10- to 17-year-olds are obese as of 2019.

name: virginia
sentence: Additionally, 35% of adults are overweight and 23.3% do not exercise regularly.

name: virginia
sentence: Virginia banned smoking in bars and restaurants in January 2010, and the percent of tobacco smokers in the state has declined from 19% in that year to 14.9% in 2019.

name: virginia
sentence: Virginia does have among the highest rates of immunization nationwide, ranking 6th for childhood immunization and 14th for both TDaP and HPV vaccines per capita.

name: virginia
sentence: In 2008, Virginia became the first US state to mandate the HPV vaccine for girls for school attendance.

name: virginia
sentence: There are 90 hospitals in Virginia with a combined 17,706 hospital beds as of 2020. Notable examples include Inova Fairfax Hospital, the largest hospital in the Washington Metropolitan Area, and the VCU Medical Center, located on the medical campus of Virginia Commonwealth University.

name: virginia
sentence: The University of Virginia Medical Center, part of the University of Virginia Health System, is highly ranked in endocrinology according to US News & World Report.

name: virginia
sentence: Virginia has a ratio of 148.1 primary care physicians per 10,000 residents, which is the 24th highest nationally, but only 171.9 mental health providers per that number, the 10th lowest nationwide.

name: virginia
sentence: The rate of uninsured Virginians dropped to 8.8% after the state government passed Medicare expansion in 2019.

name: virginia
sentence: Because of the 1932 Byrd Road Act, the state government controls most of Virginia's roads, instead of a local county authority as is usual in other states.

name: virginia
sentence: As of 2018, the Virginia Department of Transportation owns and operates 57,867 miles (93,128 km) of the total 70,105 miles (112,823 km) of roads in the state, making it the third largest state highway system in the United States.

name: virginia
sentence: Although the Washington Metropolitan Area, which includes Northern Virginia, has the second highest rate of traffic congestion in the nation, Virginia as a whole has the 21st-lowest rate of congestion and the average commute time is 26.9 minutes.

name: virginia
sentence: Virginia hit peak car usage before the year 2000, making it one of the first such states.

name: virginia
sentence: Virginia has Amtrak passenger rail service along several corridors, and Virginia Railway Express (VRE) maintains two commuter lines into Washington, D.C. from Fredericksburg and Manassas.

name: virginia
sentence: VRE is one of the nation's fastest growing commuter rail services, handling nearly 20,000 passengers a day.

name: virginia
sentence: Arlington accounted for forty percent of Virginia's public transit trips as of 2013, with most of that being from the Washington Metro transit system, which also serves Alexandria and communities in Fairfax County along I-66.

name: virginia
sentence: The system is currently expanding west into additional areas of Loudoun County.

name: virginia
sentence: Major freight railroads in Virginia include Norfolk Southern and CSX Transportation.

name: virginia
sentence: Commuter buses include the Fairfax Connector, FRED buses in Fredericksburg, and OmniRide in Prince William County.

name: virginia
sentence: The Virginia Department of Transportation operates several free ferries throughout Virginia, the most notable being the Jamestown Ferry which connects Jamestown to Scotland Wharf across the James River.

name: virginia
sentence: Virginia has five major airports: Washington Dulles International and Reagan Washington National in Northern Virginia, both of which handle more than twenty million passengers a year; Richmond International; and Newport News/Williamsburg International Airport and Norfolk International serving the Hampton Roads area.

name: virginia
sentence: Several other airports offer limited commercial passenger service, and sixty-six public airports serve the state's aviation needs.

name: virginia
sentence: The Virginia Port Authority's main seaports are those in Hampton Roads, which carried 60,014,070 short tons (54,443,850 t) of total cargo in 2019, the seventh most of United States ports.

name: virginia
sentence: The Eastern Shore of Virginia is the site of Wallops Flight Facility, a rocket testing center owned by NASA, and the Mid-Atlantic Regional Spaceport, a commercial spaceport.

name: virginia
sentence: Space tourism is also offered through Vienna-based Space Adventures.

name: virginia
sentence: In 1619, the first Virginia General Assembly met at Jamestown Church, and included 22 locally elected representatives, making Virginia's legislature the oldest in the North America.

name: virginia
sentence: These representatives became a formal House of Burgesses in 1642 and governed with the crown-appointed Governor's Council until Virginia declared independence in 1776.

name: virginia
sentence: The current General Assembly is the 161st since that year.

name: virginia
sentence: The government today functions under the seventh Constitution of Virginia, which was approved by voters in 1971 and is similar to the federal structure in that it provides for three branches: a strong legislature, an executive, and a unified judicial system.

name: virginia
sentence: Virginia's legislature is bicameral with a 100-member House of Delegates and 40-member Senatorte, who together write the laws for the Commonwealth.

name: virginia
sentence: Delegates serve two-year terms, while senators serve four-year terms, with the most recent elections for both taking place in November 2019.

name: virginia
sentence: The executive department includes the governor, lieutenant governor, and attorney general, who are elected every four years in separate elections, with the next taking place in November 2021.

name: virginia
sentence: The governor must be at least 30 years old and incumbent governors cannot run for re-election, however the lieutenant governor and attorney general can, and governors can and have served non-consecutive terms.

name: virginia
sentence: The lieutenant governor is the official head of the Senatorte, and is responsible for breaking ties.

name: virginia
sentence: The House elects a Speaker of the House and the Senatorte elects a President pro tempore, who presides when the lieutenant governor isn't present, and both houses elect a clerk and majority and minority leaders.

name: virginia
sentence: The governor also nominates their eleven cabinet members and others who head various state departments.

name: virginia
sentence: State budgets are proposed in even years by the governor.

name: virginia
sentence: Based on data through 2018, the Pew Center on the States found Virginia's government to be above average in running surpluses, while US News and World Report ranked the state eighth in fiscal stability.

name: virginia
sentence: The legislature meets annually starting on the second Wednesday of the year, typically for 60 days in even years and 48 days in odd years due to the state's biannual budgeting, though special sessions can be called either by the governor or with agreement of two-thirds of both houses.

name: virginia
sentence: Special sessions were called in 2019 on gun control and in 2020 on police reform and the impact of the coronavirus on the state budget.

name: virginia
sentence: The judges and justices who make up Virginia's judicial system, also the oldest in America, are elected by a majority vote in both the House and Senatorte without input from the governor, one way Virginia's legislature is stronger than its executive.

name: virginia
sentence: The system consists of a hierarchy from the Supreme Court of Virginia and the Court of Appeals of Virginia to the Circuit Courts, the trial courts of general jurisdiction, and the lower General District Courts and Juvenile and Domestic Relations District Courts.

name: virginia
sentence: The Supreme Court has seven justices who serve twelve-year terms, with a mandatory retirement age of 73.

name: virginia
sentence: The Supreme Court selects its own Chief Justice from among their seven members, who is informally limited to two four-year terms.

name: virginia
sentence: The Code of Virginia is the statutory law, and consists of the codified legislation of the General Assembly.

name: virginia
sentence: The Virginia State Police is the largest law enforcement agency in Virginia with 3,022 sworn and civilian members as of 2018.

name: virginia
sentence: The Virginia Capitol Police protect the legislature and are the oldest police department in the United States.

name: virginia
sentence: The Virginia National Guard consists of approximately 7,200 soldiers in the Virginia Army National Guard, 1,200 airmen in the Virginia Air National Guard, 300 members of the Virginia Defense Force, and 400 civilians.

name: virginia
sentence: Since the resumption of capital punishment in Virginia in 1982, 113 people have been executed, the second highest number in the nation, and though no death sentences have been issued since 2011, two inmates remain on the state's death row as of 2021.

name: virginia
sentence: Virginia has the fourth lowest violent crime rate and 13th-lowest property crime rate as of 2018 according to FBI data.

name: virginia
sentence: Virginia ended prisoner parole in 1995.

name: virginia
sentence: As of 2019, Virginia's rate of recidivism of released felons who are re-convicted within three years and sentenced to a year or more is 23.1 percent, the lowest in the country.

name: virginia
sentence: Over the 20th century, Virginia shifted from a largely rural, politically Southern and conservative state to a more urbanized, pluralistic, and politically moderate environment.

name: virginia
sentence: Up until the 1970s, Virginia was a racially divided one-party state dominated by the Byrd Organization, which sought to stymie the political power of Northern Virginia, perpetuate segregation, and restrict voter registration.

name: virginia
sentence: The organization used malapportionment to control what areas of the state were over-represented in the General Assembly and the US Congress until ordered to end the practice by the 1964 US Supreme Court decision in Davis v. Mann and the 1965 the Virginia Supreme Court decision in Wilkins v. Davis respectively.

name: virginia
sentence: Passage of Federal civil rights legislation in the mid-1960s, including the Voting Rights Act of 1965, helped end the state's Jim Crow laws which effectively disfranchised African Americans.

name: virginia
sentence: Greater enfranchisement and demographic shifts further changed the electorate.

name: virginia
sentence: In 1980, 56 percent of eligible voters were born in the state; in 2019 that number was 45 percent, a result of strong international immigration and domestic migration into the state.

name: virginia
sentence: Regional differences also play a large part in Virginia politics.

name: virginia
sentence: While urban and growing suburban areas, including much of Northern Virginia, form the Democratic Party base, rural southern and western areas moved to support the Republican Party in response to its "southern strategy".

name: virginia
sentence: Rural Democratic support has nevertheless persisted in union-influenced Roanoke in Southwest Virginia, college towns such as Charlottesville and Blacksburg, and the southeastern Black Belt Region.

name: virginia
sentence: State election seasons traditionally start with the annual Shad Planking event in Wakefield.

name: virginia
sentence: State elections in Virginia occur in odd-numbered years, with executive department elections occurring in years following US presidential elections and Senatorte elections occurring in the years prior to presidential elections, as both have four-year terms.

name: virginia
sentence: House of Delegates elections take place concurrent with each of those elections as members have two-year terms.

name: virginia
sentence: National politics often play a role in state election outcomes, and Virginia has elected governors of the party opposite the US president in ten of the last eleven contests, with only Terry McAuliffe beating the trend.

name: virginia
sentence: McAuliffe, a Democrat, was elected Governor in the 2013 elections by two percentage points during Barack Obama's second presidential term.

name: virginia
sentence: Republicans, however, held a super-majority (68–32) of seats in the House of Delegates, which they had first gained in the 2011 state elections.

name: virginia
sentence: Republicans also held a one-vote majority the state senate, which they then maintained in the 2015 election.

name: virginia
sentence: Eleven house district lines used in these elections, drawn following the 2010 US Census, were later judged unconstitutional for discriminating against African Americans.

name: virginia
sentence: The 2017 statewide elections resulted in Democrats holding the three highest offices, with outgoing lieutenant governor Ralph Northam winning the governorship, Justin Fairfax elected lieutenant governor, and Mark Herring continuing as attorney general.

name: virginia
sentence: In concurrent House of Delegates elections, Democrats flipped fifteen of the Republicans' previous sixteen-seat majority.

name: virginia
sentence: Control of the House came down to the tied election in the 94th district, which was won by Republicans through drawing of lots, giving the party a slim 51–49 majority in the 2018–19 legislative sessions.

name: virginia
sentence: Despite a political crisis that February, Democrats took full control of the General Assembly in the November 2019 elections, the first after several districts were redrawn because of discrimination.

name: virginia
sentence: Voters in 2020 passed a referendum to give control of drawing both congressional and state legislative districts to a commission of eight citizens and four legislators from each of the two major parties, rather than the legislature.

name: virginia
sentence: Though Virginia was considered a "swing state" in the 2008 presidential election, Democratic candidates carried Virginia's 13 electoral votes in that election and the three since, suggesting the state has shifted to being reliably Democratic.

name: virginia
sentence: Virginia had previously voted for Republican presidential candidates in 13 out of 14 presidential elections from 1952 to 2004, including 10 in a row from 1968 to 2004, but hasn't voted for a Republican candidate statewide since 2009.

name: virginia
sentence: Virginia currently holds its presidential primary election on Super Tuesday, the same day as thirteen other states, with the most recent held on March 3, 2020.

name: virginia
sentence: In US congressional elections since 2006, both parties have seen successes.

name: virginia
sentence: Republican Senatortor George Allen lost close races in 2006, to Democratic newcomer Jim Webb, and again in 2012, to Webb's replacement, former Governor Tim Kaine.

name: virginia
sentence: In 2008, Democrats won both United States Senatorte seats; former Governor Mark Warner was elected to replace retiring Republican John Warner.

name: virginia
sentence: In the 2010 mid-term elections, the first under President Obama, Republicans flipped three United States House of Representatives seats from the Democrats, while in the 2018 mid-terms, the first under President Trump, Democrats flipped three seats from Republicans.

name: virginia
sentence: Of the state's eleven seats in the House of Representatives, Democrats currently hold seven and Republicans hold four.

name: virginia
sentence: Virginia is the most populous US state without a major professional sports league franchise.

name: virginia
sentence: The reasons for this include the lack of any dominant city or market within the state, the proximity of teams in Washington, D.C. and North Carolina, and a reluctance to publicly finance stadiums.

name: virginia
sentence: A proposed arena in Virginia Beach designed for an NBA franchise became the latest unsuccessful sports initiative when the city council there ended support in 2017.

name: virginia
sentence: Norfolk is however host to two minor league teams: The AAA Norfolk Tides and the ECHL's Norfolk Admirals.

name: virginia
sentence: The San Francisco Giants' AA team, the Richmond Flying Squirrels, began play at The Diamond in 2010, replacing the AAA Richmond Braves, who relocated after 2008.

name: virginia
sentence: Additionally, the Washington Nationals, Boston Red Sox, and Cleveland Indians also have Single-A farm teams in Virginia.

name: virginia
sentence: The Richmond Kickers, a United Soccer League club, have operated since 1993 and are the only team in their league to win both the league championship and the US Open Cup in the same year.

name: virginia
sentence: The Washington Football Team have their headquarters in Ashburn and their training facility is in Richmond, and the Washington Capitals train at MedStar Capitals Iceplex in Ballston.

name: virginia
sentence: Virginia has many professional caliber golf courses including the Greg Norman course at Lansdowne Resort and Kingsmill Resort, home of the Kingsmill Championship, an LPGA Tour tournament.

name: virginia
sentence: NASCAR currently schedules Monster Energy NASCAR Cup races on two tracks in Virginia: Martinsville Speedway and Richmond Raceway.

name: virginia
sentence: Virginia natives currently competing in the series include Denny Hamlin and Elliott Sadler.

name: virginia
sentence: Virginia does not allow state appropriated funds to be used for either operational or capital expenses for intercollegiate athletics.

name: virginia
sentence: Despite this, both the Virginia Cavaliers and Virginia Tech Hokies have been able to field competitive teams in the Atlantic Coast Conference and maintain modern facilities.

name: virginia
sentence: Their rivalry is followed statewide.

name: virginia
sentence: Twelve other universities compete in NCAA Division I, particularly in the Atlantic 10 Conference, Big South Conference, and Colonial Athletic Association.

name: virginia
sentence: Three historically Black schools compete in the Division II Central Intercollegiate Athletic Association, and two others (Hampton and Norfolk State) compete in Division I.

name: virginia
sentence: Several smaller schools compete in the Old Dominion Athletic Conference and the USA South Athletic Conference of NCAA Division III.

name: virginia
sentence: The NCAA currently holds its Division III championships in football, men's basketball, volleyball and softball in Salem.

name: virginia
sentence: The state nickname is its oldest symbol, though it has never been made official by law.

name: virginia
sentence: Virginia was given the title "Dominion" by King Charles II of England at the time of The Restoration, because it had remained loyal to the crown during the English Civil War, and the present moniker, "Old Dominion" is a reference to that title.

name: virginia
sentence: Charles' supporters were called Cavaliers, and "The Cavalier State" nickname was popularized after the American Civil War to romanticize the antebellum period.

name: virginia
sentence: Sports teams from the University of Virginia are called the Cavaliers.

name: virginia
sentence: The other nickname, "Mother of Presidents", is also historic, as eight Virginians have served as President of the United States, including four of the first five.

name: virginia
sentence: The state's motto, Sic Semper Tyrannis, translates from Latin as "Thus Always to Tyrants", and is used on the state seal, which is then used on the flag.

name: virginia
sentence: While the seal was designed in 1776, and the flag was first used in the 1830s, both were made official in 1930.

name: virginia
sentence: The majority of the other symbols were made official in the late 20th century.

name: virginia
sentence: The Virginia reel is among the square dances classified as the state dance.

name: virginia
sentence: In 1940, Virginia made "Carry Me Back to Old Virginny" the state song, but it was retired in 1997 due to its references to slavery.

name: virginia
sentence: In March 2015, Virginia named "Our Great Virginia", which uses the tune of "Oh Shenandoah", as the traditional state song and "Sweet Virginia Breeze" as the popular state song.

name: washington
sentence: Washington ( (listen)), officially the State of Washington, is a state in the Pacific Northwest region of the United States.

name: washington
sentence: Named for George Washington, the first US president, the state was made out of the western part of the Washington Territory, which was ceded by the British Empire in 1846, in accordance with the Oregon Treaty in the settlement of the Oregon boundary dispute.

name: washington
sentence: The state, which is bordered on the west by the Pacific Ocean, Oregon to the south, Idaho to the east, and the Canadian province of British Columbia to the north, was admitted to the Union as the 42nd state in 1889.

name: washington
sentence: Olympia is the state capital

name: washington
sentence: Washington is often referred to as Washington state to distinguish it from the nation's capital, Washington, D.C.

name: washington
sentence: Washington is the 18th largest state, with an area of 71,362 square miles (184,827 km2), and the 13th most populous state, with more than 7.6 million people.

name: washington
sentence: Approximately 60 percent of Washington's residents live in the Seattle metropolitan area, the center of transportation, business, and industry along Puget Sound, an inlet of the Pacific Ocean consisting of numerous islands, deep fjords, and bays carved out by glaciers.

name: washington
sentence: The remainder of the state consists of deep temperate rainforests in the west; mountain ranges in the west, central, northeast, and far southeast; and a semi-arid basin region in the east, central, and south, given over to intensive agriculture.

name: washington
sentence: Washington is the second most populous state on the West Coast and in the Western United States, after California.

name: washington
sentence: Mount Rainier, an active stratovolcano, is the state's highest elevation, at almost 14,411 feet (4,392 meters), and is the most topographically prominent mountain in the contiguous US

name: washington
sentence: Washington is a leading lumber producer; its rugged surface is rich in stands of Douglas fir, hemlock, ponderosa pine, white pine, spruce, larch, and cedar.

name: washington
sentence: Washington is the nation's largest producer of apples, hops, pears, red raspberries, spearmint oil, and sweet cherries, and ranks high in the production of apricots, asparagus, dry edible peas, grapes, lentils, peppermint oil, and potatoes.

name: washington
sentence: Livestock and livestock products make important contributions to total farm revenue, and the commercial fishing of salmon, halibut, and bottomfish makes a significant contribution to the state's economy.

name: washington
sentence: Washington ranks second only to California in wine production.

name: washington
sentence: Manufacturing industries in Washington include aircraft and missiles, shipbuilding, and other transportation equipment, food processing, metals and metal products, chemicals, and machinery.

name: washington
sentence: Washington has more than a thousand dams, including the Grand Coulee Dam, built for a variety of purposes including irrigation, power, flood control, and water storage.

name: washington
sentence: Washington is one of the wealthiest and most socially liberal states in the country.

name: washington
sentence: The state consistently ranks among the best for life expectancy and low unemployment.

name: washington
sentence: Along with Colorado, Washington was one of the first to legalize medicinal and recreational cannabis, was among the first thirty-six states to legalize same-sex marriage, doing so in 2012, and was one of only four US states to have been providing legal abortions on request before the 1973 Supreme Court decision in Roe v. Wade loosened abortion laws nationwide.

name: washington
sentence: Similarly, Washington voters approved a 2008 referendum on legalization of physician-assisted suicide, and is currently one of nine states, along with the District of Columbia to have legalized the practice.

name: washington
sentence: The state is also one of eight in the country to have criminalized the sale, possession and transfer of bump stocks, with California, Florida, New Jersey, New York, Vermont, Maryland, and Massachusetts also having banned these devices.

name: washington
sentence: Washington was named after President George Washington by an act of the United States Congress during the creation of Washington Territory in 1853.

name: washington
sentence: The territory was to be named "Columbia", for the Columbia River and the Columbia District, but Kentucky representative Richard H. Stanton found the name too similar to the District of Columbia (the national capital, itself containing the city of Washington), and proposed naming the new territory after President Washington.

name: washington
sentence: Washington is the only US state named after a president.

name: washington
sentence: Confusion over the state of Washington and the city of Washington, D.C., led to renaming proposals during the statehood process for Washington in 1889, including David Dudley Field II's suggestion to name the new state "Tacoma".

name: washington
sentence: These proposals failed to garner support.

name: washington
sentence: Washington, D.C.'s, own statehood movement in the 21st century includes a proposal to use the name "State of Washington, Douglass Commonwealth", which would conflict with the current state of Washington.

name: washington
sentence: Residents of Washington (known as "Washingtonians") and the Pacific Northwest simply refer to the state as "Washington", and the nation's capital "Washington, D.C.", "the other Washington", or simply "D.C."

name: washington
sentence: Washington is the northwesternmost state of the contiguous United States.

name: washington
sentence: It borders Idaho to the east, bounded mostly by the meridian running north from the confluence of the Snake River and Clearwater River (about 117°02'23" west), except for the southernmost section where the border follows the Snake River.

name: washington
sentence: Oregon is to the south, with the Columbia River forming the western part and the 46th parallel forming the eastern part of the Oregon-Washington border.

name: washington
sentence: During Washington's partition from Oregon, the original plan for the border followed the Columbia River east until the confluence with the Snake, and then would have followed the Snake River east; this was changed in order to keep Walla Walla's fertile farmland in Washington.

name: washington
sentence: To the west of Washington lies the Pacific Ocean.

name: washington
sentence: Its northern border lies mostly along the 49th parallel, and then via marine boundaries through the Strait of Georgia, Haro Strait, and Strait of Juan de Fuca, with the Canadian province of British Columbia to the north.

name: washington
sentence: Washington is part of a region known as the Pacific Northwest, a term which always refers to at least Washington and Oregon, and may or may not include some or all the following, depending on the user's intent: Idaho, western Montana, northern California, British Columbia, and Alaska.

name: washington
sentence: The high mountains of the Cascade Range run north–south, bisecting the state.

name: washington
sentence: In addition to Western Washington and Eastern Washington, residents call the two parts of the state the "West side" and the "East side", "Wet side" and "Dry side", or "Timberland" and "Wheatland", the latter pair more commonly in the names of region-specific businesses and institutions.

name: washington
sentence: These terms reflect the geography, climate and industry of the land on both sides of the Cascades.

name: washington
sentence: From the Cascade Mountains westward, Western Washington has a mostly Mediterranean Climate, with mild temperatures and wet winters, autumns and springs, and relatively dry summers.

name: washington
sentence: The Cascade Range has several volcanoes, which reach altitudes significantly higher than the rest of the mountains.

name: washington
sentence: From north to south, these major volcanoes are Mount Baker, Glacier Peak, Mount Rainier, Mount St. Helens, and Mount Adams.

name: washington
sentence: All are active volcanoes.

name: washington
sentence: Mount Rainier, the tallest mountain in the state, is 50 miles (80 km) south of the city of Seattle, from which it is prominently visible.

name: washington
sentence: The USGS considers 14,411-foot-tall (4,392 m) Mt.

name: washington
sentence: Rainier the most dangerous volcano in the Cascade Range, due to its proximity to the Seattle metropolitan area, and most dangerous in the continental US according to the Decade Volcanoes list.

name: washington
sentence: It is also covered with more glacial ice than any other peak in the contiguous 48 states.

name: washington
sentence: Western Washington also is home of the Olympic Mountains, far west on the Olympic Peninsula, which support dense forests of conifers and areas of temperate rainforest.

name: washington
sentence: These deep forests, such as the Hoh Rainforest, are among the only rainforests in the continental United States.

name: washington
sentence: Indeed, while Western Washington does not always suffer from a high amount of rainfall as measured in total inches of rain per year, it does consistently have more rainy days per year than most other places in the country.

name: washington
sentence: "Seattle's Rainy Reputation Is Well-Deserved".

name: washington
sentence: October 15, 2016.

name: washington
sentence: Retrieved January 17, 2021.

name: washington
sentence: Western Washington's frequent rain and cloud cover is a major plot point in the popular book Twilight, which is set in Western Washington precisely because of its relative lack of sunshine.

name: washington
sentence: Eastern Washington—the part of the state east of the Cascades—has a relatively dry climate, in distinct contrast to the west side.

name: washington
sentence: It includes large areas of semiarid steppe and a few truly arid deserts in the rain shadow of the Cascades

name: washington
sentence: Despite the limited amount of rainfall, agriculture is an extremely important business throughout much of Eastern Washington, as the soil is highly productive and irrigation, aided by dams along the Columbia River, is fairly widespread.

name: washington
sentence: The spread of population in Eastern Washington is dominated by access to water, especially rivers.

name: washington
sentence: The main cities are all located alongside rivers or lakes; indeed, most of them are named after the river or lake they adjoin.

name: washington
sentence: Farther east, the climate becomes less arid, with annual rainfall increasing as one goes east to 21.2 inches (540 mm) in Pullman, near the Washington-Idaho border.

name: washington
sentence: The Okanogan Highlands and the rugged Kettle River Range and Selkirk Mountains cover much of the state's northeastern quadrant.

name: washington
sentence: The Palouse southeast region of Washington was grassland that has been mostly converted into farmland, and extends to the Blue Mountains.

name: washington
sentence: As described above, Washington's climate varies greatly from west to east.

name: washington
sentence: A Mediterranean climate predominates in western Washington, and a much drier semi-arid climate prevails east of the Cascade Range.

name: washington
sentence: Major factors determining Washington's climate include the large semi-permanent high pressure and low pressure systems of the north Pacific Ocean, the continental air masses of North America, and the Olympic and Cascade mountains.

name: washington
sentence: In the spring and summer, a high pressure anticyclone system dominates the north Pacific Ocean, causing air to spiral out in a clockwise fashion.

name: washington
sentence: For Washington, this means prevailing winds from the northwest bring relatively cool air and a predictably dry season.

name: washington
sentence: In the autumn and winter, a low-pressure cyclone system takes over in the north Pacific Ocean.

name: washington
sentence: The air spiraling inward in a counter-clockwise fashion causes Washington's prevailing winds to come from the southwest, and bring relatively warm and moist air masses and a predictably wet season.

name: washington
sentence: The term "Pineapple Express" is used colloquially to describe atmospheric river events, where repeated storm systems are directed by this persistent cyclone from tropical and near-tropical Pacific regions into the Pacific Northwest.

name: washington
sentence: Despite western Washington's having a marine climate similar to many coastal cities of Europe, there are exceptions such as the "Big Snow" events of 1880, 1881, 1893, and 1916, and the "deep freeze" winters of 1883–1884, 1915–1916, 1949–1950, and 1955–1956, among others.

name: washington
sentence: During these events, western Washington experienced up to 6 feet (1.8 m) of snow, sub-zero (−18 °C) temperatures, three months with snow on the ground, and lakes and rivers frozen over for weeks.

name: washington
sentence: Seattle's lowest officially recorded temperature is 0 °F (−18 °C) set on January 31, 1950, but low-altitude areas approximately three hours away from Seattle have recorded lows as cold as −48 °F (−44 °C).

name: washington
sentence: The Southern Oscillation greatly influences weather during the cold season.

name: washington
sentence: During the El Niño phase, the jet stream enters the US farther south through California, therefore late fall and winter are drier than normal with less snowpack.

name: washington
sentence: The La Niña phase reinforces the jet stream through the Pacific Northwest, causing Washington to have more rain and snow than average.

name: washington
sentence: In 2006, the Climate Impacts Group at the University of Washington published The Impacts of Climate change in Washington's Economy, a preliminary assessment on the risks and opportunities presented given the possibility of a rise in global temperatures and their effects on Washington state.

name: washington
sentence: Rainfall in Washington varies dramatically going from east to west.

name: washington
sentence: The Olympic Peninsula's western side receives as much as 160 inches (4,100 mm) of precipitation annually, making it the wettest area of the 48 conterminous states and a temperate rainforest.

name: washington
sentence: Weeks may pass without a clear day.

name: washington
sentence: The western slopes of the Cascade Range receive some of the heaviest annual snowfall (in some places more than 200 inches or 5,100 millimeters water equivalent) in the country.

name: washington
sentence: In the rain shadow area east of the Cascades, the annual precipitation is only 6 inches (150 mm).

name: washington
sentence: Precipitation then increases again eastward toward the Rocky Mountains (about 120 miles east of the Idaho border).

name: washington
sentence: The Olympic mountains and Cascades compound this climatic pattern by causing orographic lift of the air masses blown inland from the Pacific Ocean, resulting in the windward side of the mountains receiving high levels of precipitation and the leeward side receiving low levels.

name: washington
sentence: This occurs most dramatically around the Olympic Mountains and the Cascade Range.

name: washington
sentence: In both cases the windward slopes facing southwest receive high precipitation and mild, cool temperatures.

name: washington
sentence: While the Puget Sound lowlands are known for clouds and rain in the winter, the western slopes of the Cascades receive larger amounts of precipitation, often falling as snow at higher elevations.

name: washington
sentence: Mount Baker, near the state's northern border, is one of the snowiest places in the world.

name: washington
sentence: In 1999, it set the world record for snowfall in a single season—1,140 inches (95 ft; 29 m).

name: washington
sentence: East of the Cascades, a large region experiences strong rain shadow effects.

name: washington
sentence: Semi-arid conditions occur in much of eastern Washington with the strongest rain shadow effects at the relatively low elevations of the central Columbia Plateau—especially the region just east of the Columbia River from about the Snake River to the Okanagan Highland.

name: washington
sentence: Thus, instead of rain forests, much of eastern Washington is covered with dry grassland, shrub-steppe, and sand dunes.

name: washington
sentence: The average annual temperature ranges from 51 °F (11 °C) on the Pacific coast to 40 °F (4 °C) in the northeast.

name: washington
sentence: The lowest temperature recorded in the state was −48 °F (−44 °C) in Winthrop and Mazama.

name: washington
sentence: The highest recorded temperature in the state was 118 °F (48 °C) at Ice Harbor Dam.

name: washington
sentence: Both records were set east of the Cascades.

name: washington
sentence: Western Washington is known for its mild climate, considerable fog, frequent cloud cover, long-lasting drizzles in the winter and warm, temperate summers.

name: washington
sentence: The Eastern region, which does not benefit from the general moderating effect of the Pacific Ocean, occasionally experiences extreme climate.

name: washington
sentence: Arctic cold fronts in the winter and heat waves in the summer are not uncommon.

name: washington
sentence: In the Western region, temperatures have only reached as high as 107 °F (42 °C) in Centralia, and as low as −6 °F (−21 °C) in Longview.

name: washington
sentence: Forests cover about half the state's land area, mostly west of the North Cascades.

name: washington
sentence: Approximately two-thirds of Washington's forested area is publicly owned, including 64 percent of federal land.

name: washington
sentence: Common trees and plants in the region are camassia, Douglas fir, hemlock, penstemon, ponderosa pine, western red cedar, and many species of ferns.

name: washington
sentence: The state's various areas of wilderness offer sanctuary, with substantially large populations of shorebirds and marine mammals.

name: washington
sentence: The Pacific shore surrounding the San Juan Islands are heavily inhabited with killer, gray, and humpback whales.

name: washington
sentence: In Eastern Washington, the flora is vastly different.

name: washington
sentence: Tumbleweeds and sagebrush dominate the landscape throughout large parts of the countryside.

name: washington
sentence: Russian olives and other trees are common alongside riverbanks; however, apart from the riversides, enormous swaths of Eastern Washington have no naturally existing trees at all (though many trees have been planted and are irrigated by people, of course).

name: washington
sentence: A wider variety of flora can be found in both the Blue Mountains and the eastern sides of the Cascades.

name: washington
sentence: Mammals native to the state include the bat, black bear, bobcat, cougar, coyote, deer, elk, gray wolf, hare, moose, mountain beaver, muskrat, opossum, pocket gopher, rabbit, raccoon, river otter, skunk, and tree squirrel.

name: washington
sentence: Because of the wide range of geography, the State of Washington is home to several different ecoregions, which allow for a varied range of bird species.

name: washington
sentence: This range includes raptors, shorebirds, woodland birds, grassland birds, ducks, and others.

name: washington
sentence: There have also been a large number of species introduced to Washington, dating back to the early 18th century, including horses and burros.

name: washington
sentence: The channel catfish, lamprey, and sturgeon are among the 400 known freshwater fishes.

name: washington
sentence: Along with the Cascades frog, there are several forms of snakes that define the most prominent reptiles and amphibians.

name: washington
sentence: Coastal bays and islands are often inhabited by plentiful amounts of shellfish and whales.

name: washington
sentence: There are five species of salmon that ascend the Western Washington area, from streams to spawn.

name: washington
sentence: Washington has a variety of National Park Service units.

name: washington
sentence: Among these are the Alta Lake State Park, Lake Roosevelt National Recreation Area, San Juan Islands National Wildlife Refuge, as well as three national parks—the Olympic National Park, North Cascades National Park, and Mount Rainier National Park.

name: washington
sentence: The three national parks were established between 1899 and 1968.

name: washington
sentence: Almost 95 percent (876,517 acres, 354,714 hectares, 3,547.14 square kilometers) of Olympic National Park's area has been designated as wilderness under the National Wilderness Preservation System.

name: washington
sentence: Additionally, there are 143 state parks and 9 national forests, run by the Washington State Park System and the United States Forest Service.

name: washington
sentence: The Okanogan National Forest is the largest national forest on the West Coast, encompassing 1,499,023 acres (606,633 ha).

name: washington
sentence: It is managed together as the Okanogan–Wenatchee National Forest, encompassing a considerably larger area of around 3,239,404 acres (1,310,940 ha).

name: washington
sentence: The skeletal remains of Kennewick Man, one of the oldest and most complete human remains found in North America, were discovered in Washington.

name: washington
sentence: The area has been known to host megathrust earthquakes in the past, the last being the Cascadia earthquake of 1700.

name: washington
sentence: Before the Europeans arrived, the region had many established tribes of aboriginal Americans, notable for their totem poles and their ornately carved canoes and masks.

name: washington
sentence: Prominent among their industries were salmon fishing and, notably among the Makah, whale hunting.

name: washington
sentence: The peoples of the Interior had a very different subsistence-based culture based on hunting, food-gathering and some forms of agriculture, as well as a dependency on salmon from the Columbia and its tributaries.

name: washington
sentence: The smallpox epidemic of the 1770s devastated the Native American population.

name: washington
sentence: The first recorded European landing on the Washington coast was by Spanish Captain Don Bruno de Heceta in 1775, on board the Santiago, part of a two-ship flotilla with the Sonora.

name: washington
sentence: He claimed the coastal lands up to Prince William Sound for Spain as part of their claimed rights under the Treaty of Tordesillas, which they maintained made the Pacific a "Spanish lake" and all its shores part of the Spanish Empire.

name: washington
sentence: In 1778, British explorer Captain James Cook sighted Cape Flattery, at the entrance to the Strait of Juan de Fuca, but Cook did not realize the strait existed.

name: washington
sentence: It was not discovered until Charles William Barkley, captain of the Imperial Eagle, sighted it in 1787.

name: washington
sentence: The straits were further explored by Spanish explorers Manuel Quimper in 1790 and Francisco de Eliza in 1791, and British explorer George Vancouver in 1792.

name: washington
sentence: The British-Spanish Nootka Convention of 1790 ended Spanish claims of exclusivity and opened the Northwest Coast to explorers and traders from other nations, most notably Britain and Russia as well as the fledgling United States.

name: washington
sentence: American captain Robert Gray (for whom Grays Harbor County is named) then discovered the mouth of the Columbia River.

name: washington
sentence: He named the river after his ship, the Columbia.

name: washington
sentence: Beginning in 1792, Gray established trade in sea otter pelts.

name: washington
sentence: The Lewis and Clark Expedition entered the state on October 10, 1805.

name: washington
sentence: Explorer David Thompson, on his voyage down the Columbia River, camped at the confluence with the Snake River on July 9, 1811, and erected a pole and a notice claiming the country for Great Britain and stating the intention of the North West Company to build a trading post at the site.

name: washington
sentence: Britain and the United States agreed to what has since been described as "joint occupancy" of lands west of the Continental Divide to the Pacific Ocean as part of the Anglo-American Convention of 1818, which established the 49th Parallel as the international boundary west from Lake of the Woods to the Rocky Mountains.

name: washington
sentence: Resolution of the territorial and treaty issues, west to the Pacific, was deferred until a later time.

name: washington
sentence: Spain, in 1819, ceded their rights north of the 42nd Parallel to the United States, although these rights did not include possession.

name: washington
sentence: Negotiations with Great Britain over the next few decades failed to settle upon a compromise boundary and the Oregon boundary dispute was highly contested between Britain and the United States.

name: washington
sentence: Disputed joint-occupancy by Britain and the US lasted for several decades.

name: washington
sentence: With American settlers pouring into Oregon Country, Hudson's Bay Company, which had previously discouraged settlement because it conflicted with the fur trade, reversed its position in an attempt to maintain British control of the Columbia District.

name: washington
sentence: Fur trapper James Sinclair, on orders from Sir George Simpson, Governor of the Hudson's Bay Company, led some 200 settlers from the Red River Colony west in 1841 to settle on Hudson Bay Company farms near Fort Vancouver.

name: washington
sentence: The party crossed the Rockies into the Columbia Valley, near present-day Radium Hot Springs, British Columbia, then traveled south-west down the Kootenai River and Columbia River.

name: washington
sentence: Despite such efforts, Britain eventually ceded all claims to land south of the 49th parallel to the United States in the Oregon Treaty on June 15, 1846.

name: washington
sentence: In 1836, a group of missionaries, including Marcus Whitman, established several missions and Whitman's own settlement Waiilatpu, in what is now southeastern Washington state, near present day Walla Walla County, in territory of both the Cayuse and the Nez Perce Indian tribes.

name: washington
sentence: Whitman's settlement would in 1843 help the Oregon Trail, the overland emigration route to the west, get established for thousands of emigrants in the following decades.

name: washington
sentence: Marcus provided medical care for the Native Americans, but when Indian patients—lacking immunity to new, "European" diseases—died in striking numbers, while at the same time many white patients recovered, they held "medicine man" Marcus Whitman personally responsible, and murdered Whitman and twelve other white settlers in the Whitman massacre in 1847.

name: washington
sentence: This event triggered the Cayuse War between settlers and Indians.

name: washington
sentence: Fort Nisqually, a farm and trading post of the Hudson's Bay Company and the first European settlement in the Puget Sound area, was founded in 1833.

name: washington
sentence: Black pioneer George Washington Bush and his Caucasian wife, Isabella James Bush, from Missouri and Tennessee, respectively, led four white families into the territory and founded New Market, now Tumwater, in 1846.

name: washington
sentence: They settled in Washington to avoid Oregon's Black Exclusion Law, which prohibited African Americans from entering the territory while simultaneously prohibiting slavery.

name: washington
sentence: After them, many more settlers, migrating overland along the Oregon Trail, wandered north to settle in the Puget Sound area.

name: washington
sentence: The growing populace of Oregon Territory north of the Columbia River formally requested a new territory.

name: washington
sentence: As a result of the Monticello Convention, held in present-day Cowlitz County, Congress passed legislation and President Millard Fillmore signed into law on March 2, 1853, the creation of a new Washington Territory.

name: washington
sentence: The boundary of Washington Territory initially extended farther east than the present state's, including what is now the Idaho Panhandle and parts of western Montana, and picked up more land to the southeast that was left behind when Oregon was admitted as a state.

name: washington
sentence: The creation of Idaho Territory in 1863 established the final eastern border.

name: washington
sentence: A Washington State constitution was drafted and ratified in 1878, but it was never officially adopted.

name: washington
sentence: Although never approved by Congress, the 1878 constitution is an important historical document which shows the political thinking of the time.

name: washington
sentence: It was used extensively during the drafting of Washington State's 1889 constitution, the one and only official Constitution of the State of Washington.

name: washington
sentence: Washington became the 42nd state in the United States on November 11, 1889.

name: washington
sentence: Early prominent industries in the state included agriculture and lumber.

name: washington
sentence: In eastern Washington, the Yakima River Valley became known for its apple orchards, while the growth of wheat using dry farming techniques became particularly productive.

name: washington
sentence: Heavy rainfall to the west of the Cascade Range produced dense forests, and the ports along Puget Sound prospered from the manufacturing and shipping of lumber products, particularly the Douglas fir.

name: washington
sentence: Other industries that developed in the state included fishing, salmon canning and mining.

name: washington
sentence: For a long period, Tacoma had large smelters where gold, silver, copper, and lead ores were treated.

name: washington
sentence: Seattle was the primary port for trade with Alaska and the rest of the country, and for a time, it possessed a large shipbuilding industry.

name: washington
sentence: The region around eastern Puget Sound developed heavy industry during the period including World War I and World War II, and the Boeing company became an established icon in the area.

name: washington
sentence: During the Great Depression, a series of hydroelectric dams were constructed along the Columbia river as part of a project to increase the production of electricity.

name: washington
sentence: This culminated in 1941 with the completion of the Grand Coulee Dam, the largest concrete structure in the United States.

name: washington
sentence: During World War II, the state became a focus for war industries.

name: washington
sentence: While the Boeing Company produced many of the nation's heavy bombers, ports in Seattle, Bremerton, Vancouver, and Tacoma were available for the manufacture of warships.

name: washington
sentence: Seattle was the point of departure for many soldiers in the Pacific, a number of whom were quartered at Golden Gardens Park.

name: washington
sentence: In eastern Washington, the Hanford Works atomic energy plant was opened in 1943, and played a major role in the construction of the nation's atomic bombs.

name: washington
sentence: On May 18, 1980, following a period of heavy tremors and small eruptions, the north face of Mount St. Helens side off in the largest landslide in recorded history before erupting violently, destroying a large part of the top of the volcano.

name: washington
sentence: The eruption flattened the forest up to 20 km north of the volcano, killed 57 people, flooded the Columbia River and its tributaries with ash and mud, and blanketed large parts of Washington eastward and other surrounding states in ash, making day look like night.

name: washington
sentence: The United States Census Bureau estimates Washington's population was 7,614,893 on July 1, 2019, a 13.24 percent increase since the 2010 Census.

name: washington
sentence: In 2018, the state ranked 13th overall in population, and was the third most populous, after California and Texas, west of the Mississippi River.

name: washington
sentence: Washington has the largest Pacific Northwest population, followed by Oregon, then Idaho.

name: washington
sentence: The Washington State Office of Financial Management pegged the state population at 7,656,200 as of April 1, 2020.

name: washington
sentence: As of the 2010 Census, the population of Washington was 6,724,540.

name: washington
sentence: The Seattle-Tacoma-Bellevue Metropolitan Area population was 3,439,809 in the 2010 Census, half the state total.

name: washington
sentence: The center of population of Washington in 2010 was at 47.33°N 121.62°W﻿ / 47.33; -121.62, in an unpopulated part of the Cascade Mountains in rural eastern King County, southeast of North Bend, northeast of Enumclaw, and west of Snoqualmie Pass.

name: washington
sentence: Washington's proportion of residents under age five was 6.7%, and 25.7% under 18, and 11.2% 65 or older.

name: washington
sentence: The racial composition of Washington's population as of 2016 was:

name: washington
sentence: According to the 2016 American Community Survey, 12.1% of Washington's population were of Hispanic or Latino origin (of any race): Mexican (9.7%), Puerto Rican (0.4%), Cuban (0.1%), and other Hispanic or Latino origin (1.8%).

name: washington
sentence: The five largest ancestry groups were: German (17.8%),Irish (10.8%), English (10.4%), Norwegian (5.4%), and American (4.6%).

name: washington
sentence: In 2011, 44.3 percent of Washington's population younger than age 1 were minorities.

name: washington
sentence: Note: Births in table don't add up, because Hispanics are counted both by their ethnicity and by their race, giving a higher overall number.

name: washington
sentence: While the population of African Americans in the Pacific Northwest is scarce overall, they are mostly concentrated in the South End and Central District areas of Seattle, and in inner Tacoma.

name: washington
sentence: The black community of Seattle consisted of one individual in 1858, Manuel Lopes, and grew to a population of 406 by 1900.

name: washington
sentence: It developed substantially during and after World War II when wartime industries and the US Armed Forces employed and recruited tens of thousands of African Americans from the Southeastern United States.

name: washington
sentence: They moved west in the second wave of the Great Migration left a high influence in West Coast rock music and R&B and soul in the 1960s, including Seattle native Jimi Hendrix, a pioneer in hard rock, who was of African American and Cherokee Indian descent.

name: washington
sentence: Native Americans lived on Indian reservations or jurisdictory lands such as the Colville Indian Reservation, Makah, Muckleshoot Indian Reservation, Quinault, Salish people, Spokane Indian Reservation, and Yakama Indian Reservation.

name: washington
sentence: The westernmost and Pacific coasts have primarily American Indian communities, such as the Chinook, Lummi, and Salish.

name: washington
sentence: Urban Indian communities formed by the US Bureau of Indian Affairs relocation programs in Seattle since the end of World War II brought a variety of Native American peoples to this diverse metropolis.

name: washington
sentence: The city was named for Chief Seattle in the very early 1850s when European Americans settled the sound.

name: washington
sentence: Asian Americans and Pacific Islanders are mostly concentrated in the Seattle−Tacoma metropolitan area of the state.

name: washington
sentence: Seattle, Bellevue, and Redmond, which are all within King County, have sizable Chinese communities (including Taiwanese), as well as significant Indian and Japanese communities.

name: washington
sentence: The Chinatown-International District in Seattle has a historical Chinese population dating back to the 1860s, who mainly emigrated from Guangdong Province in southern China, and is home to a diverse East and Southeast Asian community.

name: washington
sentence: Koreans are heavily concentrated in the suburban cities of Federal Way and Auburn to the south, and in Lynnwood to the north.

name: washington
sentence: Tacoma is home to thousands of Cambodians, and has one of the largest Cambodian-American communities in the United States, along with Long Beach, California, and Lowell, Massachusetts.

name: washington
sentence: The Vietnamese and Filipino populations of Washington are mostly concentrated within the Seattle metropolitan area.

name: washington
sentence: Washington state has the second highest percentage of Pacific Islander people in the mainland US (behind Utah); the Seattle-Tacoma area is home to more than 15,000 people of Samoan ancestry, who mainly reside in southeast Seattle, Tacoma, Federal Way, and in SeaTac.

name: washington
sentence: The most numerous (ethnic, not racial, group) are Latinos at 11%, as Mexican Americans formed a large ethnic group in the Chehalis Valley, farming areas of Yakima Valley, and Eastern Washington.

name: washington
sentence: They were reported to at least date as far back as the 1800s.

name: washington
sentence: But it was in the late 20th century, that large-scale Mexican immigration and other Latinos settled in the southern suburbs of Seattle, with limited concentrations in King, Pierce, and Snohomish Counties during the region's real estate construction booms in the 1980s and 1990s.

name: washington
sentence: Additionally, Washington has a large Ethiopian community, with many Eritrean residents as well.

name: washington
sentence: Both emerged in the late 1960s, and developed since 1980.

name: washington
sentence: An estimated 30,000 Somali immigrants reside in the Seattle area.

name: washington
sentence: In 2010, 82.51% (5,060,313) of Washington residents age 5 and older spoke English at home as a primary language, while 7.79% (477,566) spoke Spanish, 1.19% (72,552) Chinese (which includes Cantonese and Mandarin), 0.94% (57,895) Vietnamese, 0.84% (51,301) Tagalog, 0.83% (50,757) Korean, 0.80% (49,282) Russian, and German, 0.55% (33,744).

name: washington
sentence: In total, 17.49% (1,073,002) of Washington's population age 5 and older spoke a mother language other than English.

name: washington
sentence: Major religious affiliations of the people of Washington are:

name: washington
sentence: The largest denominations by number of adherents in 2010 were the Roman Catholic Church, with 784,332; The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints, with 282,356; and the Assemblies of God, with 125,005.

name: washington
sentence: Aquarian Tabernacle Church is the largest Wiccan church in the country.

name: washington
sentence: Like other West Coast states, the percentage of Washington's population identifying themselves as "non-religious" is higher than the national average.

name: washington
sentence: The percentage of non-religious people in Washington is one of the highest in the United States.

name: washington
sentence: Washington has a relatively strong economy, with a total gross state product of $569.449 billion in 2018, placing it 10th in the nation and growing by 5.7 percent per year—the fastest rate in the United States.

name: washington
sentence: The minimum wage as of January 1, 2020 was $13.50 an hour, the second highest of any state or district in the country behind Washington D.C at $14.00 an hour.

name: washington
sentence: Significant business within the state include the design and manufacture of aircraft (Boeing), automotive (Paccar), computer software development (Microsoft, Bungie, Amazon, Nintendo of America, Valve, ArenaNet), telecom (T-Mobile US), electronics, biotechnology, aluminum production, lumber and wood products (Weyerhaeuser), mining, beverages (Starbucks, Jones Soda), real estate (John L. Scott, Colliers International, Windermere Real Estate, Kidder Mathews), retail (Nordstrom, Eddie Bauer, Car Toys, Costco, R.E.I.

name: washington
sentence: ), and tourism (Alaska Airlines, Expedia, Inc.).

name: washington
sentence: A Fortune magazine survey of the top 20 Most Admired Companies in the US has four Washington-based companies: Amazon, Starbucks, Microsoft, and Costco.

name: washington
sentence: At over 80 percent the state has significant amounts of hydroelectric power generation.

name: washington
sentence: Also, significant amounts of trade with Asia pass through the ports of the Puget Sound, leading to a number six ranking of US ports (ranking combines twenty-foot equivalent units (TEUs) moved and infrastructure index).

name: washington
sentence: With the passage of Initiative 1183, the Washington State Liquor Control Board (WSLCB) ended its monopoly of all-state liquor store and liquor distribution operations on June 1, 2012.

name: washington
sentence: Among Washington's resident billionaires are, as of December 2017, both the first and the second wealthiest people in the world: Jeff Bezos of Amazon, with a net worth of $99.6 billion, and Bill Gates of Microsoft, at of $91.3 billion.

name: washington
sentence: As of April 2014, other Washington state billionaires included Microsoft's Paul Allen, Steve Ballmer, and Charles Simonyi, and Craig McCaw of McCaw Cellular Communications, James Jannard of Oakley, and Howard Schultz of Starbucks.

name: washington
sentence: As of December 2018, the state's unemployment rate is 4.3 percent.

name: washington
sentence: The state of Washington is one of seven states that do not levy a personal income tax.

name: washington
sentence: The state does not collect a corporate income tax or franchise tax either.

name: washington
sentence: Washington businesses are responsible for various other state levies, including the business and occupation tax (B & O), a gross receipts tax which charges varying rates for different types of businesses.

name: washington
sentence: Washington's state base sales tax is 6.5%, which is combined with a local sales tax that varies by locality.

name: washington
sentence: The combined state and local retail sales tax rates increase the taxes paid by consumers, depending on the variable local sales tax rates, generally between 7.5% and 10%.

name: washington
sentence: As of March 2017, the combined sales tax rate in Seattle and Tacoma was 10.1%.

name: washington
sentence: The cities of Lynnwood and Mill Creek have the highest sale tax rate in the state at 10.5%.

name: washington
sentence: These taxes apply to services as well as products.

name: washington
sentence: Most foods are exempt from sales tax.

name: washington
sentence: However, prepared foods, dietary supplements, and soft drinks remain taxable.

name: washington
sentence: An excise tax applies to certain products such as gasoline, cigarettes, and alcoholic beverages.

name: washington
sentence: Property tax was the first tax levied in the state of Washington, and its collection accounts for about 30% of Washington's total state and local revenue.

name: washington
sentence: It continues to be the most important revenue source for public schools, fire protection, libraries, parks and recreation, and other special purpose districts.

name: washington
sentence: All real property and personal property are subject to tax, unless specifically exempted by law.

name: washington
sentence: Most personal property owned by individuals is exempt from tax.

name: washington
sentence: Personal property tax applies to personal property used when conducting business, or to other personal property not exempt by law.

name: washington
sentence: All property taxes are paid to the county treasurer's office where the property is located.

name: washington
sentence: Washington does not impose a tax on intangible assets such as bank accounts, stocks, or bonds.

name: washington
sentence: Neither does the state assess any tax on retirement income earned and received from another state.

name: washington
sentence: Washington does not collect inheritance taxes.

name: washington
sentence: However, the estate tax is de-coupled from the federal estate tax laws, and therefore, the state imposes its own estate tax.

name: washington
sentence: Washington state has the 18th highest per capita effective tax rate in the United States, as of 2017.

name: washington
sentence: Their tax policy differs from neighboring Oregon's, which levies no sales tax, but does levy a personal income tax.

name: washington
sentence: This leads to border economic anomalies in the Portland-Vancouver metropolitan area.

name: washington
sentence: Additional border economies exist with neighboring British Columbia and Idaho.

name: washington
sentence: Washington is a leading agricultural state.

name: washington
sentence: The following figures are from the Washington State Department of Agriculture and the USDA, National Agricultural Statistics Service, Washington Field Office.

name: washington
sentence: For 2013, the total value of Washington's agricultural products was $10.2 billion.In 2013, Washington ranked first in the nation in production of red raspberries (92.7 percent of total US production), hops (79.2 percent), spearmint oil (72.9 percent), wrinkled seed peas (60 percent), apples (57 percent), sweet cherries (50.9 percent), pears (49.5 percent), Concord grapes (36.5 percent), carrots for processing (36.5 percent), green peas for processing (34.4 percent), and peppermint oil (31.4 percent).

name: washington
sentence: Washington also ranked second in the nation in production of fall potatoes (a quarter of the nation's production), nectarines, apricots, grapes (all varieties taken together), sweet corn for processing (a quarter of the nation's production), and summer onions (a fifth of the nation's production).

name: washington
sentence: The apple industry is of particular importance to Washington.

name: washington
sentence: Because of the favorable climate of dry, warm summers and cold winters of central Washington, the state has led the US in apple production since the 1920s.

name: washington
sentence: Two areas account for the vast majority of the state's apple crop: the Wenatchee–Okanogan region (comprising Chelan, Okanogan, Douglas, and Grant counties), and the Yakima region (comprising Yakima, Benton, and Kittitas counties).

name: washington
sentence: Washington produces seven principal varieties of apples which are exported to more than sixty countries.

name: washington
sentence: Washington ranks second in the United States in the production of wine, behind only California.

name: washington
sentence: By 2006, the state had over 31,000 acres (130 km2) of vineyards, a harvest of 120,000 short tons (109,000 t) of grapes, and exports going to more than forty countries around the world from the state's 600 wineries.

name: washington
sentence: While there are some viticultural activities in the cooler, wetter western half of the state, almost all (99%) of wine grape production takes place in the desert-like eastern half.

name: washington
sentence: The rain shadow of the Cascade Range leaves the Columbia River Basin with around 8 inches (200 mm) of annual rain fall, making irrigation and water rights of paramount interest to the Washington wine industry.

name: washington
sentence: Viticulture in the state is also influenced by long sunlight hours (on average, two more hours a day than in California during the growing season) and consistent temperatures.

name: washington
sentence: As of December 2014, there are 124 broadband providers offering service to Washington state; 93 percent of consumers have access to broadband speeds of 25/3Mbit/s or more.

name: washington
sentence: From 2009–2014, the Washington State Broadband Project was awarded $7.3 million in federal grants, but the program was discontinued in 2014.

name: washington
sentence: For infrastructure, another $166 million has been awarded since 2011 for broadband infrastructure projects in Washington state.

name: washington
sentence: US News & World Report ranked Washington 2nd nationally for household internet access, and 6th for online download speed, based on data from 2014 and 2015.

name: washington
sentence: Washington has a system of state highways, called State Routes, as well as an extensive ferry system which is the largest in the nation and the third largest in the world.

name: washington
sentence: There are 140 public airfields in Washington, including 16 state airports owned by the Washington State Department of Transportation.

name: washington
sentence: Seattle-Tacoma International Airport (Sea-Tac) is the major commercial airport of greater Seattle.

name: washington
sentence: Boeing Field in Seattle is one of the busiest primary non-hub airports in the US

name: washington
sentence: There are extensive waterways around Washington's largest cities, including Seattle, Bellevue, Tacoma and Olympia.

name: washington
sentence: The state highways incorporate an extensive network of bridges and the largest ferry system in the United States to serve transportation needs in the Puget Sound area.

name: washington
sentence: Washington's marine highway constitutes a fleet of twenty-eight ferries that navigate Puget Sound and its inland waterways to 20 different ports of call, completing close to 147,000 sailings each year.

name: washington
sentence: Washington is home to four of the five longest floating bridges in the world: the Evergreen Point Floating Bridge, Lacey V. Murrow Memorial Bridge and Homer M. Hadley Memorial Bridge over Lake Washington, and the Hood Canal Bridge which connects the Olympic Peninsula and Kitsap Peninsula.

name: washington
sentence: Among its most famous bridges is the Tacoma Narrows Bridge, which collapsed in 1940 and was rebuilt.

name: washington
sentence: Washington has a number of seaports on the Pacific Ocean, including Seattle, Tacoma, Kalama, Anacortes, Vancouver, Longview, Grays Harbor, Olympia, and Port Angeles.

name: washington
sentence: The Cascade Mountain Range also impedes transportation.

name: washington
sentence: Washington operates and maintains roads over seven major mountain passes and eight minor passes.

name: washington
sentence: During winter months some of these passes are plowed, sanded, and kept safe with avalanche control.

name: washington
sentence: Not all stay open through the winter.

name: washington
sentence: The North Cascades Highway, State Route 20, closes every year due to snowfall and avalanches in the area of Washington Pass.

name: washington
sentence: The Cayuse and Chinook passes east of Mount Rainier also close in winter.

name: washington
sentence: Washington is crossed by a number of freight railroads, and Amtrak's passenger Cascade route between Eugene, Oregon and Vancouver, BC is the eighth busiest Amtrak service in the US Seattle's King Street Station, the busiest station in Washington, and 15th busiest in the US, serves as the terminus for the two long distance Amtrak routes in Washington, the Empire Builder to Chicago and the Coast Starlight to Los Angeles.

name: washington
sentence: The Sounder commuter rail service operates in Seattle and its surrounding cities, between Everett and Lakewood.

name: washington
sentence: The intercity network includes the Cascade Tunnel, the longest railroad tunnel in the United States, which is part of the Stevens Pass route on the BNSF Northern Transcom.

name: washington
sentence: Sound Transit Link light rail currently operates in the Seattle area at a length of 20 miles (32 km), and in Tacoma at a length of 1.6 miles (2.6 km).

name: washington
sentence: The entire system has a funded expansion plan that will expand light rail to a total of 116 miles by 2041.

name: washington
sentence: Seattle also has a 3.8-mile (6.1 km) streetcar network with two lines and plans to expand further by 2025.

name: washington
sentence: Bus systems exist across the state, the busiest being King County Metro, located in Seattle and King County, with just above 122 million riders in 2017.

name: washington
sentence: Residents of Vancouver have resisted proposals to extend Portland's mass transit system into Washington.

name: washington
sentence: Hanford Nuclear Reservation is currently the most contaminated nuclear site in the United States and is the focus of the nation's largest environmental cleanup.

name: washington
sentence: The radioactive materials are known to be leaking from Hanford into the environment.

name: washington
sentence: In 2007, Washington became the first state in the nation to target all forms of highly toxic brominated flame retardants known as PBDEs for elimination from the many common household products in which they are used.

name: washington
sentence: A 2004 study of 40 mothers from Oregon, Washington, British Columbia, and Montana found PBDEs in the breast milk of every woman tested.

name: washington
sentence: Three recent studies by the Washington State Department of Ecology showed toxic chemicals banned decades ago linger in the environment and concentrate in the food chain.

name: washington
sentence: In one of the studies, state government scientists found unacceptable levels of toxic substances in 93 samples of freshwater fish from 45 sites.

name: washington
sentence: The toxic substances included PCBs, dioxins, two chlorinated pesticides, DDE, dieldrin and PBDEs.

name: washington
sentence: As a result of the study, the department will investigate the sources of PCBs in the Wenatchee River, where unhealthy levels of PCBs were found in mountain whitefish.

name: washington
sentence: Based on the 2007 information and a previous 2004 Ecology study, the Washington State Department of Health advises the public not to eat mountain whitefish from the Wenatchee River from Leavenworth downstream to where the river joins the Columbia, due to unhealthy levels of PCBs.

name: washington
sentence: Study results also showed high levels of contaminants in fish tissue that scientists collected from Lake Washington and the Spokane River, where fish consumption advisories are already in effect.

name: washington
sentence: On March 27, 2006, Governor Christine Gregoire signed into law the recently approved House Bill 2322.

name: washington
sentence: This bill would limit phosphorus content in dishwashing detergents statewide to 0.5 percent over the next six years.

name: washington
sentence: Though the ban would be effective statewide in 2010, it would take place in Whatcom County, Spokane County, and Clark County in 2008.

name: washington
sentence: A recent discovery had linked high contents of phosphorus in water to a boom in algae population.

name: washington
sentence: An invasive amount of algae in bodies of water would lead to a variety of excess ecological and technological issues.

name: washington
sentence: Washington's executive branch is headed by a governor elected for a four-year term.

name: washington
sentence: The current statewide elected officials are:

name: washington
sentence: The bicameral Washington State Legislature is the state's legislative branch.

name: washington
