sentence: The state legislature is composed of a lower House of Representatives and an upper State Senatorte.

name: washington
sentence: The state is divided into 49 legislative districts of equal population, each of which elects two representatives and one senator.

name: washington
sentence: Representatives serve two-year terms, while senators serve for four years.

name: washington
sentence: There are no term limits.

name: washington
sentence: The Democratic Party has a majority in the House and Senatorte.

name: washington
sentence: The Washington Supreme Court is the highest court in the state.

name: washington
sentence: Nine justices serve on the bench and are elected statewide.

name: washington
sentence: The two current United States Senatortors from Washington are Patty Murray and Maria Cantwell, both Democrats.

name: washington
sentence: Murray has represented the state since 1993, while Cantwell was first elected in 2001.

name: washington
sentence: The state is one of four with two female senators.

name: washington
sentence: Washington's ten representatives in the United States House of Representatives (see map of districts) as of the 2020 election are Suzan DelBene (D-1), Rick Larsen (D-2), Jaime Herrera Beutler (R-3), Dan Newhouse (R-4), Cathy McMorris Rodgers (R-5), Derek Kilmer (D-6), Pramila Jayapal (D-7), Kim Schrier (D-8), Adam Smith (D-9), and Marilyn Strickland (D-10).

name: washington
sentence: Due to Congressional redistricting as a result of the 2010 Census, Washington gained one seat in the United States House of Representatives.

name: washington
sentence: With the extra seat, Washington also gained one electoral vote, raising its total to 12.

name: washington
sentence: The state is typically thought of as politically divided by the Cascade Mountains, with Western Washington being liberal (particularly the I-5 Corridor) and Eastern Washington being conservative.

name: washington
sentence: Washington has voted for the Democratic presidential nominee in every election since 1988.

name: washington
sentence: Due to Western Washington's large population, Democrats usually fare better statewide.

name: washington
sentence: The Seattle metropolitan combined statistical area, home to almost two-thirds of Washington's population, generally delivers stronger Democratic margins than most other parts of Western Washington.

name: washington
sentence: This is especially true of King County, home to Seattle and almost a third of the state's population.

name: washington
sentence: Washington was considered a key swing state in 1968, and it was the only western state to give its electoral votes to Democratic nominee Hubert Humphrey over his Republican opponent Richard Nixon.

name: washington
sentence: Washington was considered a part of the 1994 Republican Revolution, and had the biggest pick-up in the house for Republicans, who picked up seven of Washington's nine House seats.

name: washington
sentence: However, this dominance did not last for long, as Democrats picked up one seat in the 1996 election, and two more in 1998, giving the Democrats a 5–4 majority.

name: washington
sentence: The governorship is held by Democrat Jay Inslee, who was elected to his first term in the 2012 gubernatorial election.

name: washington
sentence: In 2013 and 2014, both houses of the Washington State Legislature (the Washington Senatorte and the Washington House of Representatives) were controlled by Democrats.

name: washington
sentence: The state senate was under Republican control, due to two Democrats' joining Republicans to form the Majority Coalition Caucus.

name: washington
sentence: After the 2014 elections, the Democrats retained control of the House, while Republicans took a majority in the Senatorte without the need for a coalition.

name: washington
sentence: In November 2017, a special election gave Democrats a one seat majority in the Senatorte and complete control over state government.

name: washington
sentence: Since then, in the 2018 election, the Democrats have only expanded their majorities.

name: washington
sentence: No state has gone longer without a Republican governor than Washington.

name: washington
sentence: Democrats have controlled the Washington Governor's Mansion for 36 years; the last Republican Governor was John Spellman, who left office in 1985.

name: washington
sentence: Washington has not voted for a Republican senator, governor, or presidential candidate since 1994, tying Delaware for the longest streak in the country.

name: washington
sentence: Washington uses the non-partisan blanket primary system after the approval of Initiative 872 in 2004.

name: washington
sentence: All candidates run on the same ballot during primary elections and the top two candidates advance to the general election in November, regardless of party affiliation.

name: washington
sentence: This has resulted in several same-party general election match-ups.

name: washington
sentence: Washington is one of three states to have legalized assisted suicide.

name: washington
sentence: In 2008 the Washington Death with Dignity Act ballot initiative passed and became law.

name: washington
sentence: In November 2009, Washington voters approved full domestic partnerships via Referendum 71, marking the first time voters in any state expanded recognition of same-sex relationships at the ballot box.

name: washington
sentence: Three years later, in November 2012, same-sex marriage was affirmed via Referendum 74, making Washington one of only three states to have approved same-sex marriage by popular vote.

name: washington
sentence: Also in November 2012, Washington was one of the first two states approve the legal sale and possession of cannabis for both recreational use with Initiative 502.

name: washington
sentence: Although marijuana is still illegal under US Federal law, persons 21 and older in Washington state can possess up to one ounce of marijuana, 16 ounces of marijuana-infused product in solid form, 72 ounces of marijuana-infused product in liquid form, or any combination of all three, and to legally consume marijuana and marijuana-infused products.

name: washington
sentence: In November 2016, voters approved Initiative 1433, which among other things requires employers to guarantee paid sick leave to most workers.

name: washington
sentence: On January 1, 2018, the law went into effect, with Washington becoming the seventh state with paid sick leave requirements.

name: washington
sentence: With the passage of Initiative 1639 in the 2018 elections, Washington adopted stricter gun laws.

name: washington
sentence: Washington enacted a measure in May 2019 in favor of sanctuary cities, similar to California and Oregon laws which are among the strongest statewide mandates in the nation.

name: washington
sentence: In 2019 the legislature passed the Clean Energy Transformation Act, which requires all electricity sales to be from zero-carbon sources by 2045 and net-zero by 2030.

name: washington
sentence: As of the 2008–2009 school year, 1,040,750 students were enrolled in elementary and secondary schools in Washington, with 59,562 teachers employed to educate them.

name: washington
sentence: As of August 2009, there were 295 school districts in the state, serviced by nine Educational Service Districts.

name: washington
sentence: Washington School Information Processing Cooperative (a non-profit opt-in state agency) provides information management systems for fiscal & human resources and student data.

name: washington
sentence: Elementary and secondary schools are under the jurisdiction of the Washington State Office of Superintendent of Public Instruction (OSPI).

name: washington
sentence: High school juniors and seniors in Washington have the option of using the state's Running Start program.

name: washington
sentence: Begun by the state legislature in 1990, it allows students to attend institutions of higher education at public expense, simultaneously earning high school and college credit.

name: washington
sentence: The state also has several public arts focused high schools including Tacoma School of the Arts, the Vancouver School of Arts and Academics, and The Center School.

name: washington
sentence: There are also four Science and Math based high schools: one in the Tri-Cities known as Delta, one in Tacoma known as SAMI, another in Seattle known as Raisbeck Aviation High School, and one in Redmond known as Tesla STEM High School.

name: washington
sentence: There are more than 40 institutions of higher education in Washington.

name: washington
sentence: The state has major research universities, technical schools, religious schools, and private career colleges.

name: washington
sentence: Colleges and universities include the University of Washington, Seattle University, Washington State University, Western Washington University, Eastern Washington University, Central Washington University, Saint Martin's University, Pacific Lutheran University, Gonzaga University, University of Puget Sound, The Evergreen State College, and Whitman College.

name: washington
sentence: The top two health insurers as of 2017 were Premera Blue Cross, with 24 percent market share, followed by Kaiser Permanente at 21 percent.

name: washington
sentence: For the individual market, Molina Healthcare had the top share at 23%.

name: washington
sentence: The state adopted the Washington Healthplanfinder system in 2014 after the passage of the federal Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (also known as "ObamaCare").

name: washington
sentence: The state of Washington reformed its health care system in 1993 through the Washington Health Services Act.

name: washington
sentence: The legislation required individuals to obtain health insurance or face penalties, and required employers to provide insurance to employees.

name: washington
sentence: In addition, health insurance companies were required to sell policies to all individuals, regardless of pre-existing conditions, and cover basic benefits.

name: washington
sentence: The act was mostly repealed in 1995 before it could go into full effect.

name: washington
sentence: Hospitals exist across the state, but many of Washington's best-known medical facilities are located in and around Seattle.

name: washington
sentence: The Seattle–Tacoma area has five major hospitals: Harborview Medical Center, University of Washington Medical Center, Swedish Medical Center, MultiCare Tacoma General Hospital, and St. Joseph Medical Center.

name: washington
sentence: The Seattle-area hospitals are concentrated on First Hill, which is home to Virginia Mason Medical Center (the neighborhood has received the nickname "Pill Hill" owing to the high concentration of healthcare facilities).

name: washington
sentence: The Seattle Open Invitational golf tournament was part of the PGA Tour from the 1930s to the 1960s.

name: washington
sentence: The GTE Northwest Classic was part of the Senatoror PGA Tour from 1986 to 1995, and the Boeing Classic since 2005.

name: washington
sentence: In addition, the 2015 US Open was held at Chambers Bay, and several major tournaments were held at Sahalee Country Club.

name: washington
sentence: Pacific Raceways is a motorsports venue which has hosted the Northwest Nationals of the NHRA Mello Yello Drag Racing Series and a round of the Trans-Am Series.

name: washington
sentence: The WTA Seattle tennis tournament was part of the WTA Tour from 1977 to 1982.

name: washington
sentence: The Climate Pledge Arena has hosted several mixed martial arts events, such as UFC Fight Night: Nogueira vs. Davis, UFC on Fox: Henderson vs. Diaz, and UFC on Fox: Johnson vs. Moraga.

name: washington
sentence: Four ships of the United States Navy, including two battleships, have been named USWashington in honor of the state.

name: washington
sentence: Previous ships had held that name in honor of George Washington.

name: washington
sentence: The state's nickname, "The Evergreen State", was proposed in 1890 by Charles T. Conover of Seattle.

name: washington
sentence: The name proved popular as the forests were full of evergreen trees and the abundance of rain keeps the shrubbery and grasses green throughout the year.

name: washington
sentence: Although the nickname is widely used by the state, appearing on vehicle license plates for instance, it has not been officially adopted.

name: washington
sentence: The publicly funded Evergreen State College in Olympia also takes its name from this nickname.

name: washington
sentence: The state song is "Washington, My Home", the state bird is the American goldfinch, the state fruit is the apple, and the state vegetable is the Walla Walla sweet onion.

name: washington
sentence: The state dance, adopted in 1979, is the square dance.

name: washington
sentence: The state tree is the western hemlock.

name: washington
sentence: The state flower is the coast rhododendron.

name: washington
sentence: The state fish is the steelhead.

name: washington
sentence: The state folk song is "Roll On, Columbia, Roll On" by Woody Guthrie.

name: washington
sentence: The unofficial, but popularly accepted, state rock song is Louie Louie.

name: washington
sentence: The state grass is bluebunch wheatgrass.

name: washington
sentence: The state insect is the green darner dragonfly.

name: washington
sentence: The state gem is petrified wood.

name: washington
sentence: The state fossil is the Columbian mammoth.

name: washington
sentence: The state marine mammal is the orca.

name: washington
sentence: The state land mammal is the Olympic marmot.

name: washington
sentence: The state seal (featured in the state flag as well) was inspired by the unfinished portrait of President George Washington by Gilbert Stuart.

name: west_virginia
sentence: West Virginia ( (listen)) is a state in the Appalachian and Mid-Atlantic regions of the Southern United States.

name: west_virginia
sentence: It is bordered by Pennsylvania to the northeast, Maryland to the east and northeast, Virginia to the southeast, Kentucky to the southwest, and Ohio to the northwest.

name: west_virginia
sentence: West Virginia is the 41st-largest state by area and ranks 38th in population, with around 1.791 million residents.

name: west_virginia
sentence: The capital and largest city is Charleston.

name: west_virginia
sentence: West Virginia became a state following the Wheeling Conventions of 1861, at the start of the American Civil War.

name: west_virginia
sentence: Delegates from the Unionist counties of northwestern Virginia decided to break away from Virginia, which also included secessionist counties in the new state.

name: west_virginia
sentence: West Virginia was admitted to the Union on June 20, 1863, and was a key border state during the war.

name: west_virginia
sentence: It was the only state to form by separating from a Confederate state, the first to separate from any state since Maine separated from Massachusetts, and was one of two states (along with Nevada) admitted to the Union during the American Civil War.

name: west_virginia
sentence: While a portion of its residents held slaves, most were yeoman farmers, and the delegates provided for gradual abolition of slavery in the new state Constitution and the state's legislature passed the 13th Amendment that abolished slavery on February 3, 1865.

name: west_virginia
sentence: The Northern Panhandle extends adjacent to Pennsylvania and Ohio form a tri-state area, with the West Virginia cities of Wheeling and Weirton just across the border from the Pittsburgh metropolitan area, while Bluefield is less than 70 miles (110 km) from North Carolina.

name: west_virginia
sentence: Huntington in the southwest is close to the states of Ohio and Kentucky, while Martinsburg and Harpers Ferry in the Eastern Panhandle region are considered part of the Washington metropolitan area, in between the states of Maryland and Virginia.

name: west_virginia
sentence: The unique position of West Virginia means it is often included in several US geographical regions, including the Mid-Atlantic, the Upland South, and the Southeastern United States.

name: west_virginia
sentence: It is the only state that is entirely within the area served by the Appalachian Regional Commission; the area is commonly defined as "Appalachia".

name: west_virginia
sentence: The state is noted for its mountains and rolling hills, its historically significant logging and coal mining industries, and its political and labor history.

name: west_virginia
sentence: It is also known for a wide range of outdoor recreational opportunities, including skiing, whitewater rafting, fishing, hiking, backpacking, mountain biking, rock climbing, and hunting.

name: west_virginia
sentence: Other nominated names included Vandalia, Kanawha, Appalachia, and Western Virginia.

name: west_virginia
sentence: The Capital was originally Wheeling, before switching to Charleston.

name: west_virginia
sentence: It was then moved back to Wheeling, then back to its current spot in Charleston.

name: west_virginia
sentence: While it is now a solidly Republican state, it was once a Democratic state, between the Roosevelt era and 2000.

name: west_virginia
sentence: The first governor was Arthur Boreman.

name: west_virginia
sentence: Many ancient man-made earthen mounds from various prehistoric mound builder cultures survive, especially in the areas of present-day Moundsville, South Charleston, and Romney.

name: west_virginia
sentence: The artifacts uncovered in these give evidence of village societies.

name: west_virginia
sentence: They had a tribal trade system culture that crafted cold-worked copper pieces.

name: west_virginia
sentence: In the 1670s during the Beaver Wars, the powerful Iroquois, five allied nations based in present-day New York and Pennsylvania, drove out other American Indian tribes from the region in order to reserve the upper Ohio Valley as a hunting ground.

name: west_virginia
sentence: Siouan language tribes, such as the Moneton, had previously been recorded in the area.

name: west_virginia
sentence: A century later, the area now identified as West Virginia was contested territory among Anglo-Americans as well, with the colonies of Pennsylvania and Virginia claiming territorial rights under their colonial charters to this area before the American Revolutionary War.

name: west_virginia
sentence: Some speculative land companies, such as the Vandalia Company, and later the Ohio Company and Indiana Company, tried to legitimize their claims to land in parts of West Virginia and present day Kentucky, but failed.

name: west_virginia
sentence: This rivalry resulted in some settlers petitioning the Continental Congress to create a new territory called Westsylvania.

name: west_virginia
sentence: With the federal settlement of the Pennsylvania and Virginia border dispute, creating Kentucky County, Virginia, Kentuckians "were satisfied [...] and the inhabitants of a large part of West Virginia were grateful."

name: west_virginia
sentence: The Crown considered the area of West Virginia to be part of the British Virginia Colony from 1607 to 1776.

name: west_virginia
sentence: The United States considered this area to be the western part of the state of Virginia (which was commonly referred as Trans-Allegheny Virginia) from 1776 to 1863, before the formation of West Virginia.

name: west_virginia
sentence: Its residents were discontented for years with their position in Virginia, as the government was dominated by the planter elite of the Tidewater and Piedmont areas.

name: west_virginia
sentence: The legislature had electoral malapportionment, based on the counting of slaves toward regional populations, and the western white residents were underrepresented in the state legislature.

name: west_virginia
sentence: More subsistence and yeoman farmers lived in the west and they were generally less supportive of slavery, although many counties were divided on their support.

name: west_virginia
sentence: The residents of this area became more sharply divided after the planter elite of eastern Virginia voted to secede from the Union during the Civil War.

name: west_virginia
sentence: Residents of the western and northern counties set up a separate government under Francis Pierpont in 1861, which they called the Restored Government.

name: west_virginia
sentence: Most voted to separate from Virginia, and the new state was admitted to the Union in 1863.

name: west_virginia
sentence: In 1864 a state constitutional convention drafted a constitution, which was ratified by the legislature without putting it to popular vote.

name: west_virginia
sentence: West Virginia abolished slavery by a gradual process and temporarily disenfranchised men who had held Confederate office or fought for the Confederacy.

name: west_virginia
sentence: West Virginia's history has been profoundly affected by its mountainous terrain, numerous and vast river valleys, and rich natural resources.

name: west_virginia
sentence: These were all factors driving its economy and the lifestyles of its residents, who tended to live in many small, relatively isolated communities in the mountain valleys.

name: west_virginia
sentence: A 2010 analysis of a local stalagmite revealed that Native Americans were burning forests to clear land as early as 100 BCE.

name: west_virginia
sentence: Some regional late-prehistoric Eastern Woodland tribes were more involved in hunting and fishing, practicing the Eastern Agricultural Complex gardening method which used fire to clear out underbrush from certain areas.

name: west_virginia
sentence: Another group progressed to the more time-consuming, advanced companion crop fields method of gardening.

name: west_virginia
sentence: Also continuing from ancient indigenous people of the state, they cultivated tobacco through to early historic times.

name: west_virginia
sentence: It was used in numerous social and religious rituals.

name: west_virginia
sentence: "Maize (corn) did not make a substantial contribution to the diet until after 1150 BP", to quote Mills (OSU 2003).

name: west_virginia
sentence: Eventually, tribal villages began depending on corn to feed their turkey flocks, as Kanawha Fort Ancients practiced bird husbandry.

name: west_virginia
sentence: The local Indians made corn bread and a flat rye bread called "bannock" as they emerged from the protohistoric era.

name: west_virginia
sentence: A horizon extending from a little before the early 18th century is sometimes called the acculturating Fireside Cabin culture.

name: west_virginia
sentence: Trading posts were established by European traders along the Potomac and James rivers.

name: west_virginia
sentence: Tribes that inhabited West Virginia as of 1600 were the Siouan Monongahela Culture to the north, the Fort Ancient culture along the Ohio River from the Monongahela to Kentucky and extending an unknown distance inland, and the Eastern Siouan Tutelo and Moneton tribes in the southeast.

name: west_virginia
sentence: There was also the Iroquoian Susquehannock in the region approximately east of the Monongahela River and north of the Monongahela National Forest, a possible tribe called the Senatorndoa, or Shenandoah, in the Shenandoah Valley and the easternmost tip of the state may have been home to the Manahoac people.

name: west_virginia
sentence: The Monongahela may have been the same as a people known as the Calicua, or Cali.

name: west_virginia
sentence: The following may have also all been the same tribe—Moneton, Moheton, Senatorndoa, Tomahitan.

name: west_virginia
sentence: During the Beaver Wars, other tribes moved into the region.

name: west_virginia
sentence: There was the Iroquoian Tiontatecaga (also Little Mingo, Guyandotte), who seem to have split off from the Petun after they were defeated by the Iroquois.

name: west_virginia
sentence: They eventually settled somewhere between the Kanawha and Little Kanawha Rivers.

name: west_virginia
sentence: During the 1750s, when the Mingo Senatorca seceded from the Iroquois and returned to the Ohio River Valley, they contend that this tribe merged with them.

name: west_virginia
sentence: The Shawnee arrived as well, but were primarily stationed within former Monongahela territory approximately until 1750, however they did extend their influence throughout the Ohio River region.

name: west_virginia
sentence: They were the last Native tribe of West Virginia and were driven out by the United States during the Shawnee Wars (1811–1813).

name: west_virginia
sentence: The Erie, who were chased out of Ohio around 1655, are now believed to be the same as the Westo, who invaded as far as South Carolina before being destroyed in the 1680s.

name: west_virginia
sentence: If so, their path would have brought them through West Virginia.

name: west_virginia
sentence: The historical movement of the Tutelo, as well as Carbon dating for the Fort Ancients seem to correspond with the given period of 1655–1670 as the time of their removal.

name: west_virginia
sentence: The Susquehannocks were original participants of the Beaver Wars, but were cut off from the Ohio River by the Iroquois around 1630 and found themselves in dire straits.

name: west_virginia
sentence: From disease, constant warfare and an inability to provide for themselves financially, they began to collapse and moved further and further east, to the Susquehanna River of Eastern Pennsylvania.

name: west_virginia
sentence: The Manahoac were probably forced out in the 1680s, when the Iroquois began to invade Virginia.

name: west_virginia
sentence: The Siouan tribes there moved into North Carolina and later returned as one tribe, known as the Eastern Blackfoot, or Christannas.

name: west_virginia
sentence: The Westo did not secure the territory they conquered.

name: west_virginia
sentence: Before they were even gone, displaced natives from the south flooded into freshly conquered regions and took them over.

name: west_virginia
sentence: These became known as the Shattaras, or West Virginia Cherokees.

name: west_virginia
sentence: They took in and merged with the Monetons, who began to refer to themselves as the Mohetons.

name: west_virginia
sentence: The Calicua also began to refer to themselves as Cherokees soon after, showing an apparent further merger.

name: west_virginia
sentence: These Shattaras were closely related to the tribes which formed to the south in the aftermath of the Westo—the Yuchi and Cherokee.

name: west_virginia
sentence: From 1715 to 1717, the Yamasee War sprang up.

name: west_virginia
sentence: The Senatorndoa allegedly sided with the Yuchi and were destroyed by Yamasee allies.

name: west_virginia
sentence: Therefore, if the Senatorndoa were the same tribe as the Moneton, this would mean the collapse of Shattara-Moneton culture.

name: west_virginia
sentence: Another tribe who appeared in the region were the Canaragay, or Kanawha.

name: west_virginia
sentence: They later migrated to Maryland and merged into colonial culture.

name: west_virginia
sentence: In 1671, General Abraham Wood, at the direction of Royal Governor William Berkeley of the Virginia Colony, sent a party from Fort Henry led by Thomas Batts and Robert Fallam to survey this territory.

name: west_virginia
sentence: They were the first Europeans recorded as discovering Kanawha Falls.

name: west_virginia
sentence: Some sources state that Governor Alexander Spotswood's 1716 Knights of the Golden Horseshoe Expedition (for which the state's Golden Horseshoe Competition for 8th graders was named) had penetrated as far as Pendleton County; however, modern historians interpret the original accounts of the excursion as suggesting that none of the expedition's horsemen ventured much farther west of the Blue Ridge Mountains than Harrisonburg, Virginia.

name: west_virginia
sentence: John Van Metre, an Indian trader, penetrated into the northern portion in 1725.

name: west_virginia
sentence: The same year, German settlers from Pennsylvania founded New Mecklenburg, the present Shepherdstown, on the Potomac River, and others followed.

name: west_virginia
sentence: King Charles II of England, in 1661, granted to a company of gentlemen the land between the Potomac and Rappahannock rivers, known as the Northern Neck.

name: west_virginia
sentence: Thomas Fairfax, 6th Lord Fairfax of Cameron ultimately took possession of this grant, and in 1746, a stone was erected at the source of the North Branch Potomac River to mark the western limit of his grant.

name: west_virginia
sentence: A considerable part of this land was surveyed by the young George Washington between 1748 and 1751.

name: west_virginia
sentence: The diary kept by Washington recorded that there were already many squatters, largely of German origin, along the South Branch Potomac River.

name: west_virginia
sentence: Christopher Gist, a surveyor in the employ of the first Ohio Company, which was composed chiefly of Virginians, explored the country along the Ohio River north of the mouth of the Kanawha River between 1751 and 1752.

name: west_virginia
sentence: The company sought to have a fourteenth colony established with the name "Vandalia".

name: west_virginia
sentence: Many settlers crossed the mountains after 1750, though they were hindered by Native American resistance.

name: west_virginia
sentence: Few Native Americans lived permanently within the present limits of the state, but the region was a common hunting ground, crossed by many trails.

name: west_virginia
sentence: During the French and Indian War (the North American front of the Seven Years' War in Europe), Indian allies of the French nearly destroyed the scattered British settlements.

name: west_virginia
sentence: Shortly before the American Revolutionary War, in 1774 the Crown Governor of Virginia John Murray, 4th Earl of Dunmore, led a force over the mountains.

name: west_virginia
sentence: A body of militia under then-Colonel Andrew Lewis dealt the Shawnee Indians, under Hokoleskwa (or "Cornstalk"), a crushing blow during the Battle of Point Pleasant at the junction of the Kanawha and the Ohio rivers.

name: west_virginia
sentence: At the Treaty of Camp Charlotte concluding Dunmore's War, Cornstalk agreed to recognize the Ohio River as the new boundary with the "Long Knives".

name: west_virginia
sentence: By 1776, however, the Shawnee had returned to war, joining the Chickamauga, a band of Cherokee known for the area where they lived.

name: west_virginia
sentence: Native American attacks on settlers continued until after the American Revolutionary War.

name: west_virginia
sentence: During the war, the settlers in western Virginia were generally active Whigs and many served in the Continental Army.

name: west_virginia
sentence: However, Claypool's Rebellion of 1780–1781, in which a group of men refused to pay taxes imposed by the Continental Army, showed war-weariness in what became West Virginia.

name: west_virginia
sentence: Social conditions in western Virginia were entirely unlike those in the eastern portion of the state.

name: west_virginia
sentence: The population was not homogeneous, as a considerable part of the immigration came by way of Pennsylvania and included Germans, Protestant Scotch-Irish, and settlers from the states farther north.

name: west_virginia
sentence: Counties in the east and south were settled mostly by eastern Virginians.

name: west_virginia
sentence: During the American Revolution, the movement to create a state beyond the Alleghenies was revived and a petition for the establishment of "Westsylvania" was presented to Congress, on the grounds that the mountains presented an almost impassable barrier to the east.

name: west_virginia
sentence: The rugged nature of the country made slavery unprofitable, and time only increased the social, political, economic, and cultural differences (see Tuckahoe-Cohee) between the two sections of Virginia.

name: west_virginia
sentence: In 1829, a constitutional convention met in Richmond to consider reforms to Virginia's outdated constitution.

name: west_virginia
sentence: Philip Doddridge of Brooke County championed the cause of western Virginians who sought a more democratic frame of government.

name: west_virginia
sentence: However, western reforms were rejected by leaders from east of the Alleghenies who "clung to political power in an effort to preserve their plantation lifestyles dependent on enslaving blacks".

name: west_virginia
sentence: Virginia leaders maintained a property qualification for suffrage effectively disenfranchising poorer farmers in the west whose families did much of the farm-work themselves.

name: west_virginia
sentence: In addition, the 1829–1830 convention gave the slave-holding counties the benefit of three-fifths of their slave population in apportioning the state's representation in the US House of Representatives.

name: west_virginia
sentence: As a result, every county west of the Alleghenies except one voted to reject the constitution, which nevertheless passed because of eastern support.

name: west_virginia
sentence: Failure of the eastern planter elite to make constitutional reforms exacerbated existing east–west sectionalism in Virginia and contributed to Virginia's later division.

name: west_virginia
sentence: The Virginia Constitutional Convention of 1850–51, the Reform Convention, addressed a number of issues important to western Virginians.

name: west_virginia
sentence: It extended the vote to all white males 21 years or older.

name: west_virginia
sentence: The governor, lieutenant governor, the judiciary, sheriffs, and other county officers were to be elected by public vote.

name: west_virginia
sentence: The composition of the General Assembly was changed.

name: west_virginia
sentence: Representation in the house of delegates was apportioned on the basis of the census of 1850, counting whites only.

name: west_virginia
sentence: The Senatorte representation was arbitrarily fixed at 50 seats, with the west receiving twenty, and the east thirty senators.

name: west_virginia
sentence: This was made acceptable to the west by a provision that required the General Assembly to reapportion representation on the basis of white population in 1865, or else put the matter to a public referendum.

name: west_virginia
sentence: But the east also gave itself a tax advantage in requiring a property tax at true and actual value, except for slaves.

name: west_virginia
sentence: Slaves under the age of 12 years were not taxed and slaves over that age were taxed at only $300, a fraction of their true value.

name: west_virginia
sentence: Small farmers, however, had all their assets, animals, and land taxed at full value.

name: west_virginia
sentence: Despite this tax and the lack of internal improvements in the west, the vote was 75,748 for and 11,063 against the new Constitution.

name: west_virginia
sentence: Most of the opposition came from delegates from eastern counties, who did not like the compromises made for the west.

name: west_virginia
sentence: Given these differences, many in the west had long contemplated a separate state.

name: west_virginia
sentence: In particular, men such as lawyer Francis H. Pierpont from Fairmont, had long chafed under the political domination of the Tidewater and Piedmont slave-holders.

name: west_virginia
sentence: In addition to differences over the abolition of slavery, he and allies felt the Virginia government ignored and refused to spend funds on needed internal improvements in the west, such as turnpikes and railroads.

name: west_virginia
sentence: West Virginia was the only state in the Union to separate from a Confederate state (Virginia) during the American Civil War.

name: west_virginia
sentence: In Richmond on April 17, 1861, the Virginia Secession Convention of 1861 voted to secede from the Union, but of the 49 delegates from the northwestern corner (which ultimately became West Virginia) only 17 voted in favor of the Ordinance of Secession, while 30 voted against (with two abstentions).

name: west_virginia
sentence: Almost immediately after that vote, a mass meeting at Clarksburg recommended that each county in northwestern Virginia send delegates to a convention to meet in Wheeling on May 13, 1861.

name: west_virginia
sentence: When this First Wheeling Convention met, 425 delegates from 25 counties were present, though more than one-third of the delegates were from the northern panhandle area.

name: west_virginia
sentence: Soon, there was a division of sentiment.

name: west_virginia
sentence: Some delegates led by John S. Carlile favored the immediate formation of a new state, while others led by Waitman Willey argued that, as Virginia's secession had not yet been passed by the required referendum (as happened on May 23), such action would constitute revolution against the United States.

name: west_virginia
sentence: The convention decided that if Virginians adopted the secession ordinance (of which there was little doubt), another convention including the members-elect of the legislature would meet in Wheeling in June 1861.

name: west_virginia
sentence: On May 23, 1861, secession was ratified by a large majority in Virginia as a whole, but in the western counties 34,677 voted against and 19,121 voted for the Ordinance.

name: west_virginia
sentence: The Second Wheeling Convention met as agreed on June 11 and declared that, since the Secession Convention had been called without popular consent, all its acts were void and that all who adhered to it had vacated their offices.

name: west_virginia
sentence: The Wheeling Conventions, and the delegates themselves, were never actually elected by public ballot to act on behalf of western Virginia.

name: west_virginia
sentence: Of its 103 members, 33 had been elected to the Virginia General Assembly on May 23.

name: west_virginia
sentence: This included some hold-over state senators whose four-year terms had begun in 1859, and some who vacated their offices to convene in Wheeling.

name: west_virginia
sentence: Other members "were chosen even more irregularly—some in mass meetings, others by county committee, and still others were seemingly self-appointed".

name: west_virginia
sentence: An act for the reorganization of the government was passed on June 19.

name: west_virginia
sentence: The next day convention delegates chose Francis H. Pierpont as governor of Virginia, and elected other officers to a rival state government and two US senators (Willey and Carlile) to replace secessionists before adjourning.

name: west_virginia
sentence: The federal government in Washington, D.C. promptly recognized the new government and seated the two new senators.

name: west_virginia
sentence: Thus, there were two state governments in Virginia: one pledging allegiance to the United States and one to the Confederacy.

name: west_virginia
sentence: The second Wheeling Convention had recessed until August 6, then reassembled on August 20 and called for a popular vote on the formation of a new state and for a convention to frame a constitution if the vote should be favorable.

name: west_virginia
sentence: At the October 24, 1861 election, 18,408 votes were cast for the new state and only 781 against.

name: west_virginia
sentence: The election results were questioned, since the Union army then occupied the area and Union troops were stationed at many of the polls to prevent Confederate sympathizers from voting.

name: west_virginia
sentence: This was also election day for local offices, and elections were also held in camps of Confederate soldiers, who elected rival state officials, such as Robert E. Cowan.

name: west_virginia
sentence: Most pro-statehood votes came from 16 counties around the Northern panhandle.

name: west_virginia
sentence: Over 50,000 votes had been cast on the Ordinance of Secession, yet the vote on statehood garnered little more than 19,000.

name: west_virginia
sentence: In Ohio County, home to Wheeling, only about a fourth of the registered voters cast votes.

name: west_virginia
sentence: In most of what would become West Virginia, there was no vote at all, as two-thirds of the territory of West Virginia had voted for secession and county officers remained loyal to Richmond.

name: west_virginia
sentence: Votes recorded from pro-secession counties were mostly cast elsewhere by Unionist refugees from these counties.

name: west_virginia
sentence: Despite that controversy, delegates (including many Methodist ministers) met to write a new Constitution for the new state, beginning on November 26, 1861.

name: west_virginia
sentence: During that constitutional convention, a Mr. Lamb of Ohio County and a Mr. Carskadon claimed that in Hampshire County, out of 195 votes only 39 were cast by citizens of the state; the rest were cast illegally by Union soldiers.

name: west_virginia
sentence: One of the key figures was Rev.

name: west_virginia
sentence: Gordon Battelle, who also represented Ohio County, and who proposed resolutions to establish public schools, as well as to limit movement of slaves into the new state, and to gradually abolish slavery.

name: west_virginia
sentence: The education proposal succeeded, but the convention tabled the slavery proposals before finishing its work on February 18, 1862.

name: west_virginia
sentence: The new constitution was more closely modeled on that of Ohio than of Virginia, adopting a township model of government rather than the "courthouse cliques" of Virginia which Carlile criticized, and a compromise demanded by the Kanawha region (Charleston lawyers Benjamin Smith and Brown) allowed counties and municipalities to vote subsidies for railroads or other improvement organizations.

name: west_virginia
sentence: The resulting instrument was ratified (18,162 for and 514 against) on April 11, 1862.

name: west_virginia
sentence: On May 13, 1862 the state legislature of the reorganized government approved the formation of the new state.

name: west_virginia
sentence: An application for admission to the Union was made to Congress, introduced by Senatortor Waitman Willey of the Restored Government of Virginia.

name: west_virginia
sentence: However, Senator Carlile sought to sabotage the bill, first trying to expand the new state's boundaries to include the Shenandoah Valley, and then to defeat the Willey amendment at home.

name: west_virginia
sentence: On December 31, 1862, an enabling act was approved by President Abraham Lincoln admitting West Virginia, on the condition that a provision for the gradual abolition of slavery be inserted in its constitution (as Rev.

name: west_virginia
sentence: Battelle had urged in the Wheeling Intelligencer and also written to Lincoln).

name: west_virginia
sentence: While many felt West Virginia's admission as a state was both illegal and unconstitutional, Lincoln issued his Opinion on the Admission of West Virginia finding that "the body which consents to the admission of West Virginia is the Legislature of Virginia", and that its admission was therefore both constitutional and expedient.

name: west_virginia
sentence: The convention was reconvened on February 12, 1863, and the abolition demand of the federal enabling act was met.

name: west_virginia
sentence: The revised constitution was adopted on March 26, 1863 and on April 20, 1863, President Lincoln issued a proclamation admitting the state 60 days later on June 20, 1863.

name: west_virginia
sentence: Meanwhile, officers for the new state were chosen, while Gov.

name: west_virginia
sentence: Pierpont moved his pro-Union Virginia capital to Union-occupied Alexandria, where he asserted and exercised jurisdiction over all the remaining Virginia counties within the federal lines.

name: west_virginia
sentence: The question of the constitutionality of the formation of the new state was later brought before the Supreme Court of the United States in Virginia v. West Virginia.

name: west_virginia
sentence: Berkeley and Jefferson counties lying on the Potomac east of the mountains, in 1863, with the consent of the reorganized government of Virginia voted in favor of annexation to West Virginia.

name: west_virginia
sentence: Many voters of the strongly pro-secessionist counties were absent in the Confederate Army when the vote was taken and refused to acknowledge the transfer when they returned.

name: west_virginia
sentence: The Virginia General Assembly repealed the act of secession and, in 1866, brought suit against West Virginia asking the court to declare the counties a part of Virginia, which would have declared West Virginia's admission as a state unconstitutional.

name: west_virginia
sentence: Meanwhile, on March 10, 1866, Congress passed a joint resolution recognizing the transfer.

name: west_virginia
sentence: The Supreme Court decided in favor of West Virginia in 1870.

name: west_virginia
sentence: During the Civil War, Union General George B. McClellan's forces gained possession of the greater part of the territory in the summer of 1861, culminating at the Battle of Rich Mountain, and Union control was never again seriously threatened.

name: west_virginia
sentence: In 1863, General John D. Imboden, with 5,000 Confederates, raided a considerable portion of the state and burned Pierpont's library, although Senatortor Willey escaped their grasp.

name: west_virginia
sentence: Bands of guerrillas burned and plundered in some sections, and were not entirely suppressed until after the war ended.

name: west_virginia
sentence: The Eastern Panhandle counties were more affected by the war, with military control of the area repeatedly changing hands.

name: west_virginia
sentence: The area that became West Virginia actually furnished about an equal number of soldiers to the federal and Confederate armies, approximately 22,000–25,000 each.

name: west_virginia
sentence: In 1865, the Wheeling government found it necessary to strip voting rights from returning Confederates in order to retain control.

name: west_virginia
sentence: James Ferguson, who proposed the law, said if it was not enacted he would lose election by 500 votes.

name: west_virginia
sentence: The property of Confederates might also be confiscated, and in 1866 a constitutional amendment disfranchising all who had given aid and comfort to the Confederacy was adopted.

name: west_virginia
sentence: The addition of the Fourteenth and Fifteenth Amendments to the United States Constitution caused a reaction.

name: west_virginia
sentence: The Democratic party secured control in 1870, and in 1871, the constitutional amendment of 1866 was abrogated.

name: west_virginia
sentence: The first steps toward this change had been taken, however, by the Republicans in 1870.

name: west_virginia
sentence: On August 22, 1872, an entirely new constitution was adopted.

name: west_virginia
sentence: Beginning in Reconstruction, and for several decades thereafter, the two states disputed the new state's share of the pre-war Virginia government's debts, which had mostly been incurred to finance public infrastructure improvements, such as canals, roads, and railroads under the Virginia Board of Public Works.

name: west_virginia
sentence: Virginians—led by former Confederate general William Mahone—formed a political coalition based upon this: the Readjuster Party.

name: west_virginia
sentence: Although West Virginia's first constitution provided for the assumption of a part of the Virginia debt, negotiations opened by Virginia in 1870 were fruitless, and in 1871, Virginia funded two-thirds of the debt and arbitrarily assigned the remainder to West Virginia.

name: west_virginia
sentence: The issue was finally settled in 1915, when the Supreme Court of the United States ruled that West Virginia owed Virginia $12,393,929.50.

name: west_virginia
sentence: The final instalment of this sum was paid in 1939.

name: west_virginia
sentence: After Reconstruction, the new 35th state benefited from the development of its mineral resources more than any other single economic activity.

name: west_virginia
sentence: Saltpeter caves had been employed throughout Appalachia for munitions; the border between West Virginia and Virginia includes the "Saltpeter Trail", a string of limestone caverns containing rich deposits of calcium nitrate which were rendered and sold to the government.

name: west_virginia
sentence: The trail stretched from Pendleton County to the western terminus of the route in the town of Union, Monroe County.

name: west_virginia
sentence: Nearly half of these caves are on the West Virginia side, including Organ Cave and Haynes Cave.

name: west_virginia
sentence: In the late 18th-century, saltpeter miners in Haynes Cave found large animal bones in the deposits.

name: west_virginia
sentence: These were sent by a local historian and frontier soldier Colonel John Stuart to Thomas Jefferson.

name: west_virginia
sentence: The bones were named Megalonyx jeffersonii, or great-claw, and became known as Jefferson's three-toed sloth.

name: west_virginia
sentence: It was declared the official state fossil of West Virginia in 2008.

name: west_virginia
sentence: The West Virginia official state rock is bituminous coal, and the official state gemstone is silicified Mississippian fossil Lithostrotionella coral.

name: west_virginia
sentence: The limestone also produced a useful quarry industry, usually small, and softer, high-calcium seams were burned to produce industrial lime.

name: west_virginia
sentence: This lime was used for agricultural and construction purposes; for many years a specific portion of the C & O Railroad carried limestone rock to Clifton Forge, Virginia as an industrial flux.

name: west_virginia
sentence: Salt mining had been underway since the 18th century, though it had largely played out by the time of the American Civil War, when the red salt of Kanawha County was a valued commodity of first Confederate, and later Union, forces.

name: west_virginia
sentence: In years following, more sophisticated mining methods would restore West Virginia's role as a major producer of salt.

name: west_virginia
sentence: However, in the second half of the 19th century, there was an even greater treasure not yet developed: bituminous coal.

name: west_virginia
sentence: It would fuel much of the Industrial Revolution in the US and the steamships of many of the world's navies.

name: west_virginia
sentence: The residents (both Native Americans and early European settlers) had long known of the underlying coal, and that it could be used for heating and fuel.

name: west_virginia
sentence: However, for a long time, "personal" or artisanal mining was the only practical development.

name: west_virginia
sentence: After the War, with the new railroads came a practical method to transport large quantities of coal to expanding US and export markets.

name: west_virginia
sentence: As the anthracite mines of northwestern New Jersey and Pennsylvania began to play out during this same time period, investors and industrialists focused new interest in West Virginia.

name: west_virginia
sentence: Geologists such as Dr. David T. Ansted surveyed potential coal fields and invested in land and early mining projects.

name: west_virginia
sentence: The completion of the Chesapeake and Ohio Railway (C&O) across the state to the new city of Huntington on the Ohio River in 1872 opened access to the New River Coal Field.

name: west_virginia
sentence: Soon, the C&O was building its huge coal pier at Newport News, Virginia on the large harbor of Hampton Roads.

name: west_virginia
sentence: In 1881, the new Philadelphia-based owners of the former Atlantic, Mississippi and Ohio Railroad (AM&O), which stretched across Virginia's southern tier from Norfolk, had sights clearly set on the Mountain State, where the owners had large land holdings.

name: west_virginia
sentence: Their railroad was renamed Norfolk and Western (N&W), and a new railroad city was developed at Roanoke to handle planned expansion.

name: west_virginia
sentence: After its new president Frederick J. Kimball and a small party journeyed by horseback and saw firsthand the rich bituminous coal seam, which Kimball's wife named Pocahontas, the N&W redirected its planned westward expansion to reach it.

name: west_virginia
sentence: Soon, the N&W was also shipping from new coal piers at Hampton Roads.

name: west_virginia
sentence: In 1889, in the southern part of the state, along the Norfolk and Western rail lines, the important coal center of Bluefield, West Virginia was founded.

name: west_virginia
sentence: The "capital" of the Pocahontas coalfield, this city would remain the largest city in the southern portion of the state for several decades.

name: west_virginia
sentence: It shares a sister city with the same name, Bluefield, in Virginia.

name: west_virginia
sentence: In the northern portion of the state and elsewhere, the older Baltimore and Ohio Railroad (B&O) and other lines also expanded to take advantage of coal opportunities.

name: west_virginia
sentence: The B&O developed coal piers in Baltimore and at several points on the Great Lakes.

name: west_virginia
sentence: Other significant rail carriers of coal were the Western Maryland Railway (WM), Southern Railway (SOU), and the Louisville and Nashville Railroad (L&N).

name: west_virginia
sentence: Particularly notable was a latecomer, the Virginian Railway (VGN).

name: west_virginia
sentence: By 1900 only the most rugged terrain of southern West Virginia was any distance from the existing railroads and mining activity.

name: west_virginia
sentence: Within this area west of the New River Coalfield in Raleigh and Wyoming counties lay the Winding Gulf Coalfield, later promoted as the "Billion Dollar Coalfield".

name: west_virginia
sentence: A protégé of Dr. Ansted was William Nelson Page (1854–1932), a civil engineer and mining manager in Fayette County.

name: west_virginia
sentence: Former West Virginia governor William A. MacCorkle described him as a man who knew the land "as a farmer knows a field".

name: west_virginia
sentence: Beginning in 1898, Page teamed with northern and European-based investors to take advantage of the undeveloped area.

name: west_virginia
sentence: They acquired large tracts of land in the area, and Page began the Deepwater Railway, a short-line railroad chartered to stretch between the C&O at its line along the Kanawha River and the N&W at Matoaka—a distance of about 80 miles (130 km).

name: west_virginia
sentence: Although the Deepwater plan should have provided a competitive shipping market via either railroad, leaders of the two large railroads did not appreciate the scheme.

name: west_virginia
sentence: In secret collusion, each declined to negotiate favorable rates with Page, nor did they offer to purchase his railroad, as they had many other short-lines.

name: west_virginia
sentence: However, if the C&O and N&W presidents thought they could thus kill the Page project, they were to be proved mistaken.

name: west_virginia
sentence: One of the silent partner investors Page had enlisted was millionaire industrialist Henry Huttleston Rogers, a principal in John D. Rockefeller's Standard Oil Trust and an old hand at developing natural resources and transportation.

name: west_virginia
sentence: A master at competitive "warfare", Henry Rogers did not like to lose in his endeavors and also had "deep pockets".

name: west_virginia
sentence: Instead of giving up, Page (and Rogers) quietly planned and then built their tracks all the way east across Virginia, using Rogers' private fortune to finance the $40 million cost.

name: west_virginia
sentence: When the renamed Virginian Railway (VGN) was completed in 1909, no fewer than three railroads were shipping ever-increasing volumes of coal to export from Hampton Roads.

name: west_virginia
sentence: West Virginia coal was also under high demand at Great Lakes ports.

name: west_virginia
sentence: The VGN and the N&W ultimately became parts of the modern Norfolk Southern system, and the VGN's well-engineered 21st-century tracks continue to offer a favorable gradient to Hampton Roads.

name: west_virginia
sentence: As coal mining and related work became major employment activities in the state, there was considerable labor strife as working conditions, safety issues and economic concerns arose.

name: west_virginia
sentence: Even in the 21st century, mining safety and ecological concerns is still challenging to the state whose coal continues to power electrical generating plants in many other states.

name: west_virginia
sentence: Coal is not the only valuable mineral found in West Virginia, as the state was the site of the 1928 discovery of the 34.48 carat (6.896 g) Jones Diamond.

name: west_virginia
sentence: Located in the Appalachian Mountain range, West Virginia covers an area of 24,229.76 square miles (62,754.8 km2), with 24,077.73 square miles (62,361.0 km2) of land and 152.03 square miles (393.8 km2) of water, making it the 41st-largest state in the United States.

name: west_virginia
sentence: West Virginia borders Pennsylvania and Maryland in the northeast, Virginia in the southeast, Ohio in the northwest, and Kentucky in the southwest.

name: west_virginia
sentence: Its longest border is with Virginia at 381 miles (613 km), followed by Ohio at 243 miles (391 km), Maryland at 174 miles (280 km), Pennsylvania at 118 miles (190 km), and Kentucky at 79 miles (127 km).

name: west_virginia
sentence: West Virginia is located entirely within the Appalachian Region, and the state is almost entirely mountainous, giving reason to the nickname The Mountain State and the motto Montani Semper Liberi ("Mountaineers are always free").

name: west_virginia
sentence: The elevations and ruggedness drop near large rivers like the Ohio River or Shenandoah River.

name: west_virginia
sentence: About 75% of the state is within the Cumberland Plateau and Allegheny Plateau regions.

name: west_virginia
sentence: Though the relief is not high, the plateau region is extremely rugged in most areas.

name: west_virginia
sentence: The average elevation of West Virginia is approximately 1,500 feet (460 m) above sea level, which is the highest of any US state east of the Mississippi River.

name: west_virginia
sentence: On the eastern state line with Virginia, high peaks in the Monongahela National Forest region give rise to an island of colder climate and ecosystems similar to those of northern New England and eastern Canada.

name: west_virginia
sentence: The highest point in the state is atop Spruce Knob, at 4,863 feet (1,482 m), and is covered in a boreal forest of dense spruce trees at altitudes above 4,000 feet (1,200 m).

name: west_virginia
sentence: Spruce Knob lies within the Monongahela National Forest and is a part of the Spruce Knob-Senatorca Rocks National Recreation Area.

name: west_virginia
sentence: A total of six wilderness areas can also be found within the forest.

name: west_virginia
sentence: Outside the forest to the south, the New River Gorge is a canyon 1,000 feet (300 m) deep, carved by the New River.

name: west_virginia
sentence: The National Park Service manages a portion of the gorge and river that has been designated as the New River Gorge National Park and Preserve.

name: west_virginia
sentence: Other areas under protection and management include:

name: west_virginia
sentence: Most of West Virginia lies within the Appalachian mixed mesophytic forests ecoregion, while the higher elevations along the eastern border and in the panhandle lie within the Appalachian-Blue Ridge forests.

name: west_virginia
sentence: The native vegetation for most of the state was originally mixed hardwood forest of oak, chestnut, maple, beech, and white pine, with willow and American sycamore along the state's waterways.

name: west_virginia
sentence: Many of the areas are rich in biodiversity and scenic beauty, a fact appreciated by native West Virginians, who refer to their home as Almost Heaven (from the song, "Take Me Home, Country Roads" by John Denver).

name: west_virginia
sentence: Before the song, it was known as "The Cog State" (Coal, Oil, and Gas) or "The Mountain State".

name: west_virginia
sentence: The underlying rock strata are sandstone, shale, bituminous coal beds, and limestone laid down in a near-shore environment from sediments derived from mountains to the east, in a shallow inland sea on the west.

name: west_virginia
sentence: Some beds illustrate a coastal swamp environment, some river delta, some shallow water.

name: west_virginia
sentence: Sea level rose and fell many times during the Mississippian and Pennsylvanian eras, giving a variety of rock strata.

name: west_virginia
sentence: The Appalachian Mountains are some of the oldest on earth, having formed more than three hundred million years ago.

name: west_virginia
sentence: The climate of West Virginia is generally a humid subtropical climate (Köppen climate classification Cfa, except Dfb at the higher elevations) with warm to hot, humid summers and chilly winters, increasing in severity with elevation.

name: west_virginia
sentence: Some southern highland areas also have a mountain temperate climate (Köppen Cfb) where winter temperatures are more moderate and summer temperatures are somewhat cooler.

name: west_virginia
sentence: However, the weather is subject in all parts of the state to change.

name: west_virginia
sentence: The hardiness zones range from zone 5b in the central Appalachian mountains to zone 7a in the warmest parts of the lowest elevations.

name: west_virginia
sentence: In the Eastern Panhandle and the Ohio River Valley, temperatures are warm enough to see and grow subtropical plants such as southern magnolia (Magnolia grandiflora), crepe myrtle, Albizia julibrissin, American sweetgum and even the occasional needle palm and sabal minor.

name: west_virginia
sentence: These plants do not thrive as well in other parts of the state.

name: west_virginia
sentence: The eastern prickly pear grows well in many portions of the state.

name: west_virginia
sentence: Average January temperatures range from around 26 °F (−4 °C) near the Cheat River to 41 °F (5 °C) along sections of the border with Kentucky.

name: west_virginia
sentence: July averages range from 67 °F (19 °C) along the North Branch Potomac River to 76 °F (24 °C) in the western part of the state.

name: west_virginia
sentence: It is cooler in the mountains than in the lower sections of the state.

name: west_virginia
sentence: The highest recorded temperature in the state is 112 °F (44 °C) at Martinsburg on July 10, 1936 and the lowest recorded temperature in the state is −37 °F (−38 °C) at Lewisburg on December 30, 1917.

name: west_virginia
sentence: Annual precipitation ranges from less than 32 inches (810 mm) in the lower eastern section to more than 56 inches (1,400 mm) in higher parts of the Allegheny Front.

name: west_virginia
sentence: Valleys in the east have lower rainfall because the Allegheny mountain ridges to the west create a partial rain shadow.

name: west_virginia
sentence: Slightly more than half the rainfall occurs from April to September.

name: west_virginia
sentence: Dense fogs are common in many valleys of the Kanawha section, especially the Tygart Valley.

name: west_virginia
sentence: West Virginia is also one of the cloudiest states in the nation, with the cities of Elkins and Beckley ranking 9th and 10th in the US respectively for the number of cloudy days per year (over 210).

name: west_virginia
sentence: In addition to persistent cloudy skies caused by the damming of moisture by the Alleghenies, West Virginia also experiences some of the most frequent precipitation in the nation, with Snowshoe averaging nearly 200 days a year with either rain or snow.

name: west_virginia
sentence: Snow usually lasts only a few days in the lower sections but may persist for weeks in the higher mountain areas.

name: west_virginia
sentence: An average of 34 inches (860 mm) of snow falls annually in Charleston, although during the winter of 1995–1996 more than three times that amount fell as several cities in the state established new records for snowfall.

name: west_virginia
sentence: Average snowfall in the Allegheny Highlands can range up to 180 inches (4,600 mm) per year.

name: west_virginia
sentence: Severe weather is somewhat less prevalent in West Virginia than in most other eastern states, and it ranks among the least tornado-prone states east of the Rockies.

name: west_virginia
sentence: The United States Census Bureau estimates that the population of West Virginia was 1,792,147 on July 1, 2018, a 3.28% decrease since the 2010 United States Census.

name: west_virginia
sentence: The center of population of West Virginia is located in Braxton County, in the town of Gassaway.

name: west_virginia
sentence: At the 2010 Census, the racial composition of the state's population was:

name: west_virginia
sentence: In the same year, 1.2% of West Virginia's population was of Hispanic, Latino, or Spanish origin (they may be of any race).

name: west_virginia
sentence: As of 2019, West Virginia has an estimated population of 1,792,147, which is a decrease of 10,025 (0.55%) from the prior year and a decrease of 47,162 (2.55%) since the previous census.

name: west_virginia
sentence: This includes a natural decrease of 3,296 (108,292 births minus 111,588 deaths) and an increase from net migration of 14,209 into the state.

name: west_virginia
sentence: West Virginia is the least populous southeastern state.

name: west_virginia
sentence: Immigration from outside the United States resulted in a net increase of 3,691, and migration within the country produced a net increase of 10,518.

name: west_virginia
sentence: Only 1.6% of the state's residents were foreign-born, placing West Virginia last among the 50 states in that statistic.

name: west_virginia
sentence: It also has the lowest percentage of residents who speak a language other than English in the home (2.6%).

name: west_virginia
sentence: The five largest ancestry groups in West Virginia are: German (18.9%), Irish (15.1%) American (12.9%), English (11.8%) and Italian (4.7%) In the 2000 Census People who identified their ethnicity as simply American made up 18.7% of the population.

name: west_virginia
sentence: Large numbers of people of German ancestry are present in the northeastern counties of the state.

name: west_virginia
sentence: People of English ancestry are present throughout the entire state.

name: west_virginia
sentence: Many West Virginians who self-identify as Irish are actually Scots-Irish Protestants.

name: west_virginia
sentence: 2010 census data show that 16 percent of West Virginia's residents are 65 or older (exceeded only by Florida's 17 percent).

name: west_virginia
sentence: There were 20,928 births in 2006.

name: west_virginia
sentence: Of these, 19,757 (94.40% of the births, 95.19% of the population) were to non-Hispanic whites.

name: west_virginia
sentence: There were 22 births to American Indians (0.11% of the births and 0.54% of the population), 177 births to Asians (0.85% of the births and 0.68% of the population), 219 births to Hispanics (1.05% of the births and 0.88% of the population) and 753 births to blacks and others (3.60% of the births and 3.56% of the population).

name: west_virginia
sentence: The state's Northern Panhandle, and North-Central region feel an affinity for Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania.

name: west_virginia
sentence: Also, those in the Eastern Panhandle feel a connection with the Washington, D.C. suburbs in Maryland and Virginia, and southern West Virginians often consider themselves Southerners.

name: west_virginia
sentence: Finally, the towns and farms along the mid-Ohio River, which forms most of the state's western border, have an appearance and culture somewhat resembling the Midwest.

name: west_virginia
sentence: Note: Births in table do not add up, because Hispanics are counted both by their ethnicity and by their race, giving a higher overall number.

name: west_virginia
sentence: Several surveys have been made in recent years, in 2008 by the American Religion Identity Survey, in 2010 by the Pew Forum on Religion and Public Life.

name: west_virginia
sentence: The Pew survey results admit to a 6.5% margin of error plus or minus, while the ARIS survey says "estimates are subject to larger sampling errors in states with small populations."

name: west_virginia
sentence: A characteristic of religion in Appalachian communities is the abundance of independent, non-affiliated churches, which "remain unnoted and uncounted in any census of church life in the United States".

name: west_virginia
sentence: This sometimes leads to the belief that these communities are "unchurched".

name: west_virginia
sentence: The largest denomination as of 2010 was the United Methodist Church with 136,000 members in 1,200 congregations.

name: west_virginia
sentence: The second-largest Protestant church was the American Baptist Churches USA with 88,000 members and 381 congregations.

name: west_virginia
sentence: The Southern Baptist church had 44,000 members and 232 congregations.

name: west_virginia
sentence: The Churches of Christ had 22,000 members and 287 congregations.

name: west_virginia
sentence: The Presbyterian Church (USA) had 200 congregations and 20,000 members.

name: west_virginia
sentence: A survey conducted in 2015 by the Pew Research Center found that West Virginia was the seventh most "highly religious" state in the United States.

name: west_virginia
sentence: The economy of West Virginia nominally would be the 62nd largest economy globally behind Iraq and ahead of Croatia according to 2009 World Bank projections, and the 64th largest behind Iraq and ahead of Libya according to 2009 International Monetary Fund projections.

name: west_virginia
sentence: The state has a projected nominal GSP of $63.34 billion in 2009 according to the Bureau of Economic Analysis report of November 2010, and a real GSP of $55.04 billion.

name: west_virginia
sentence: The real GDP growth of the state in 2009 of .7% was the 7th best in the country.

name: west_virginia
sentence: West Virginia was one of only ten states in 2009 that grew economically.

name: west_virginia
sentence: While per capita income fell 2.6% nationally in 2009, West Virginia's grew at 1.8%.

name: west_virginia
sentence: Through the first half of 2010, exports from West Virginia topped $3 billion, growing 39.5% over the same period from the previous year and ahead of the national average by 15.7%.

name: west_virginia
sentence: Morgantown was ranked by Forbes as the #10 best small city in the nation to conduct business in 2010.

name: west_virginia
sentence: The city is also home to West Virginia University, the 95th best public university according to US News & World Report in 2011.

name: west_virginia
sentence: The proportion of West Virginia's adult population with a bachelor's degree is the lowest in the US at 17.3%.

name: west_virginia
sentence: The net corporate income tax rate is 6.5% while business costs are 13% below the national average.

name: west_virginia
sentence: The US Bureau of Economic Analysis reported that in 2014 West Virginia's economy grew twice as fast as the next fastest growing state east of the Mississippi River, ranking third alongside Wyoming and just behind North Dakota and Texas among the fastest growing states in the United States.

name: west_virginia
sentence: Tourism contributed $4.27 billion to the state's economy and employed 44,400 people in 2010, making it one of the state's largest industries.

name: west_virginia
sentence: Many tourists, especially in the eastern mountains, are drawn to the region's notable opportunities for outdoor recreation.

name: west_virginia
sentence: Canaan Valley is popular for winter sports, Senatorca Rocks is one of the premier rock climbing destinations in the eastern US, the New River Gorge/Fayetteville area draws rock climbers as well as whitewater rafting enthusiasts, and the Monongahela National Forest is popular with hikers, backpackers, hunters, and anglers.

name: west_virginia
sentence: In addition to such outdoor recreation opportunities, the state offers a number of historic and cultural attractions.

name: west_virginia
sentence: Harpers Ferry National Historical Park is a historic town situated at the confluence of the Shenandoah and Potomac rivers.

name: west_virginia
sentence: Harpers Ferry was the site of John Brown's 1859 raid on the US Armory and Arsenal.

name: west_virginia
sentence: Located at the approximate midpoint of the Appalachian Trail, Harpers Ferry is the base of the Appalachian Trail Conservancy.

name: west_virginia
sentence: The Greenbrier hotel and resort, originally built in 1778, has long been considered a premier hotel, frequented by numerous world leaders and US presidents over the years.

name: west_virginia
sentence: West Virginia is the site of the National Radio Astronomy Observatory, which features the Green Bank Telescope.

name: west_virginia
sentence: For the 1963 Centennial of the State, it hosted two high school graduate delegates from each of the 50 States at the National Youth Science Camp near Bartow, and has continued this tradition ever since.

name: west_virginia
sentence: The main building of Weston State Hospital is the largest hand-cut sandstone building in the western hemisphere, second worldwide only to the Kremlin in Moscow.

name: west_virginia
sentence: Tours of the building, which is a National Historic Landmark and part of the National Civil War Trail, are offered seasonally and by appointment year round.

name: west_virginia
sentence: West Virginia has numerous popular festivals throughout the year.

name: west_virginia
sentence: One of the major resources in West Virginia's economy is coal.

name: west_virginia
sentence: According to the Energy Information Administration, West Virginia is a top coal-producer in the United States, second only to Wyoming.

name: west_virginia
sentence: West Virginia is located in the heart of the Marcellus Shale Natural Gas Bed, which stretches from Tennessee north to New York in the middle of Appalachia.

name: west_virginia
sentence: As of 2017, the coal industry accounted for 2% of state employment.

name: west_virginia
sentence: Nearly all the electricity generated in West Virginia is from coal-fired power plants.

name: west_virginia
sentence: West Virginia produces a surplus of electricity and leads the Nation in net interstate electricity exports.

name: west_virginia
sentence: Farming is also practiced in West Virginia, but on a limited basis because of the mountainous terrain over much of the state.

name: west_virginia
sentence: West Virginia has the potential to generate 4,952 GWh/year from 1,883 MW of wind power, using 80 meter high wind turbines, or 8,627 GWh/year from 2,772 MW of 100 meter wind turbines, and 60,000 GWh from 40,000 MW of photovoltaics, including 3,810 MW of rooftop photovoltaics.

name: west_virginia
sentence: Source:

name: west_virginia
sentence: West Virginia personal income tax is based on federal adjusted gross income (not taxable income), as modified by specific items in West Virginia law.

name: west_virginia
sentence: Citizens are taxed within five income brackets, which range from 3.0% to 6.5%.

name: west_virginia
sentence: The state's consumer sales tax is levied at 6% on most products except for non-prepared foods.

name: west_virginia
sentence: West Virginia counties administer and collect property taxes, although property tax rates reflect levies for state government, county governments, county boards of education and municipalities.

name: west_virginia
sentence: Counties may also impose a hotel occupancy tax on lodging places not located within the city limits of any municipality that levies such a tax.

name: west_virginia
sentence: Municipalities may levy license and gross receipts taxes on businesses located within the city limits and a hotel occupancy tax on lodging places in the city.

name: west_virginia
sentence: Although the Department of Tax and Revenue plays a major role in the administration of this tax, less than half of one percent of the property tax collected goes to state government.

name: west_virginia
sentence: The primary beneficiaries of the property tax are county boards of education.

name: west_virginia
sentence: Property taxes are paid to the sheriff of each of the state's 55 counties.

name: west_virginia
sentence: Each county and municipality can impose its own rates of property taxation within the limits set by the West Virginia Constitution.

name: west_virginia
sentence: The West Virginia legislature sets the rate of tax of county boards of education.

name: west_virginia
sentence: This rate is used by all county boards of education statewide.

name: west_virginia
sentence: However, the total tax rate for county boards of education may differ from county to county because of excess levies.

name: west_virginia
sentence: The Department of Tax and Revenue supervises and otherwise assists counties and municipalities in their work of assessment and tax rate determination.

name: west_virginia
sentence: The total tax rate is a combination of the tax levies from four state taxing authorities: state, county, schools and municipal.

name: west_virginia
sentence: This total tax rate varies for each of the four classes of property, which consists of personal, real and intangible properties.

name: west_virginia
sentence: Property is assessed according to its use, location and value as of July 1.

name: west_virginia
sentence: WV Assessments has a free searchable database of West Virginia real estate tax assessments, covering current and past years.

name: west_virginia
sentence: All property is reappraised every three years

name: west_virginia
sentence: West Virginia does not impose an inheritance tax.

name: west_virginia
sentence: Because of the phase-out of the federal estate tax credit, West Virginia's estate tax is not imposed on estates of persons who died on or after January 1, 2005.

name: west_virginia
sentence: The largest private employers in West Virginia, as of March 2019, were:

name: west_virginia
sentence: West Virginia coal exports declined 40% in 2013—a loss of $2.9 billion and overall total exports declined 26%.

name: west_virginia
sentence: West Virginia ranked last in the Gallup Economic Index for the fourth year running.

name: west_virginia
sentence: West Virginia's score was −44, or a full 17 points lower than the average of −27 for the other states in the bottom ten.

name: west_virginia
sentence: West Virginia ranked 48th in the CNBC "Top States for Business 2013" based on measures of competitiveness such as economy, workforce and cost of living—ranking among the bottom five states for the last six years running.

name: west_virginia
sentence: West Virginia ranked 49th in the 2014 State New Economy Index, and has ranked in the bottom three states since 1999.

name: west_virginia
sentence: West Virginia ranked last or next-to-last in critical indicators such as Workforce Education, Entrepreneurial Activity, High-Tech Jobs, and Scientists and Engineers.

name: west_virginia
sentence: On January 9, 2014, a chemical spill contaminated the water supply of 300,000 people in nine West Virginia counties near Charleston.

name: west_virginia
